Revision 1.20 2004/10/18 18:17:47 packel added div0s; changed orth ʼa)da/mas,ʼ to a)da/mas
Revision 1.19 2004/10/07 14:18:11 packel removed *s in entry keys

Revision 1.17 2004/09/08 15:49:42 packel Changed doctype to TEI P4
Revision 1.16 2004/09/01 15:44:25 packel Fixed thirty-odd words that had multiple entries but no number afterward to differentiate the entries (e.g., si=gma, si=gma is now si=gma1, si=gma2).
Revision 1.15 2004/06/15 19:31:34 lcerrato changed nothwithstanding to notwithstanding
Revision 1.14 2003/02/04 21:21:51 lcerrato fixed typo kuma entry swoln to swollen

Revision 1.12 2001/04/20 21:58:57 dasmith Added funder.

Revision 1.7 1998/08/24 19:15:31 jrydberg finished trans tags and added new prep. defs.
Revision 1.6 1998/08/20 17:12:45 jrydberg Included greek words within trans tags where appropriate

Revision 1.4 1998/08/19 18:23:58 jrydberg Corrected trans tagging for short defs. through a)mfote/rwqen.
Revision 1.3 1998/08/17 20:24:43 jrydberg *** empty log message ***

Revision 1.1 1998/08/14 15:38:33 textgod Added to repository.

div1.head: ἀάατος
div1.sense: ἀάᾱτος: in Il. with penult. long, not to be injured, inviolable, νῦν μοι ὄμοσσον ἀάᾱτον Στυγὸς ὕδωρ, because the gods swore their most binding oaths thereby.
ἀάατος: in Od. with penult. short, hurtful, perilous, aweful; ἄεθλος ἀάατος.

div1.head: ἀαγής
div1.sense: unbroken, not to be broken, hard, strong, Od., Theocr.

div1.head: ἄαπτος
div1.sense: not to be touched, resistless, invincible, χεῖρες ἄαπτοι Hom., Hes.

div1.head: ἄατος
div1.sense: insatiate, c. gen., Ἄρης ἆτος πολέμοιο Il.

div1.head: ἀάω
div1.etym: The quantities vary: ᾱασεν, ᾱᾱσαν, part. ἀασας: ἀ_ασάμην, ἀ_ᾱσατο: ἀ_ασθην, ἀασθη.
div1.sense: properly to hurt, damage; then to mislead, infatuate, of the effects of wine, sleep, divine judgments, Od.; so in Mid., Ἄτη ἣ πάντας ἀᾶται Il.
aor1 mid. and pass., to act recklessly or foolishly, ἀασάμην I was infatuated Il.; μέγʼ ἀάσθη Il.

div1.head: ἀβακέω
div1.etym: Epic Verb only used in aor1.
div1.sense: to be speechless, Epic Verb only used in aor1, οἱ δʼ ἀβάκησαν πάντες Od.

div1.head: ἀβακής
div1.sense: speechless, infantine, Sapph..

div1.head: ἀβάκχευτος
div1.sense: uninitiated in the Bacchic orgies, generally, joyless, Eur.

div1.head: ἄβαλε
div1.sense: properly ἆ βάλε, expressing a wish, O that! Lat. utinam, c. inf., Anth.

div1.head: ἀβαρής
div1.sense: without weight: not burdensome, of persons, NTest.

div1.head: ἀβασάνιστος
div1.sense: not examined by torture, untortured; of things, unexamined, Plut.; adv. -τως, without examination, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀβασίλευτος
div1.sense: not ruled by a king, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: ἀβάσκαντος
div1.sense: not subject to enchantment; adv. -τως, Anth.

div1.head: ἀβάστακτος
div1.sense: not to be carried, Plut.

div1.head: ἄβατος
div1.sense: untrodden, impassable, inaccessible, of mountains, Hdt., Soph., etc.; of a river, not fordable, Xen.
of holy places, not to be trodden, like ἄθικτος, Soph.: metaph. pure, chaste, ψυχή Plat.
of horses, not ridden, Luc.
act., ἄβ. πόνος a plague that hinders walking, i.e. gout, Luc.

div1.head: ἀββα
div1.sense: Hebr. word, father, NTest.

div1.head: Ἀβδηρίτης
div1.sense: a man of Abdera in Thrace, proverb. of simpletons. Dem.

div1.head: Ἀβδηριτικός
div1.sense: like an Abderite, i.e. stupid, Luc.

div1.head: ἀβέβαιος
div1.sense: uncertain, unsteady; τὸ ἀβέβαιον ἀβεβαιότης, Luc.
of persons, unstable, Dem., etc.

div1.head: ἀβέβηλος
div1.sense: not profane, inviolable, Plut.

div1.head: ἀβελτερία
div1.sense: silliness, stupidity, fatuity, Plat.

div1.head: ἀβέλτερος
div1.sense: good for nothing, silly, stupid, fatuous, Ar., etc.;—Sup. -ώτατος, Ar.

div1.head: ἀβίαστος
div1.sense: unforced, without violence, Plat.

div1.head: ἄβιος
div1.sense: = ἀβίωτος, Anth.
without a living, starving, Luc.
of the Ἱππημολγοί, simple in life, Il.

div1.head: ἀβίωτος
div1.sense: not to be lived, insupportable, ἀβ. πεποίηκε τὸν βίον Ar.; ἀβίωτον χρόνον βιοτεῦσαι Eur.; ἀβίωτόν ἐστι life is intolerable, Eur., Plat.; adv., ἀβιώτως ἔχειν to find life intolerable, Plut.

div1.head: ἀβλάβεια
div1.sense: freedom from harm, Plut.
act. harmlessness, Lat. innocentia, Cic.

div1.head: ἀβλαβής
div1.sense: without harm, i.e.,
pass. unharmed, unhurt, secure, Aesch., etc.
act. not harming, harmless, innocent, Aesch., Plat.
averting or preventing harm, Theocr.
adv. in Attic formularies, ἀβλαβῶς σπονδαῖς ἐμμένειν without doing harm, Thuc.; so the σπονδαί themselves are entitled ἄδολοι καὶ ἀβλαβεῖς, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀβλέφαρος
div1.sense: without eye-lids, Anth.

div1.head: ἀβλής
div1.sense: not thrown or shot, ἰὸν ἀβλῆτα an arrow not yet used, Il.

div1.head: ἄβλητος
div1.sense: not hit by darts, Il.

div1.head: ἀβληχής
div1.sense: without bleatings, Anth.

div1.head: ἀβληχρός
div1.sense: weak, feeble, Il.; ἀβλ. θάνατος an easy death in ripe old age, opp. to a violent one, Od.

div1.head: ἀβληχρώδης
div1.sense: of sheep, Babr.

div1.head: ἀβοήθητος
div1.sense: helpless, Plut.

div1.head: ἀβοητί
div1.sense: without summons, Pind.

div1.head: ἀβόητος
div1.sense: not loudly lamented, Anth.

div1.head: ἀβόσκητος
div1.sense: ungrazed, ὄρη Babr.

div1.head: ἀβουκόλητος
div1.sense: untended by herdsmen: metaph. unheeded, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀβουλέω
div1.etym: ἀβουλέω is an exception to the rule that a_privat cannot be comp. directly with Verbs.
div1.sense: to be unwilling, Plat.

div1.head: ἀβουλία
div1.sense: want of counsel, thoughtlessness, Hdt., Soph., etc.

div1.head: ἄβουλος
div1.sense: inconsiderate, ill-advised, Soph., etc.; τέκνοισι ἄβουλος taking no thought for them, Soph.: comp. -ότερος, Thuc.; adv. -ως, inconsiderately, Hdt.; Sup. ἀβουλότατα, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀβούτης
div1.sense: without oxen, i.e. poor, Hes.

div1.head: ἀβριθής
div1.sense: of no weight, Eur.

div1.head: ἁβροβάτης
div1.sense: softly or delicately stepping, Aesch.

div1.head: ἁβρόβιος
div1.sense: living delicately, effeminate, Plut.

div1.head: ἁβρόγοος
div1.sense: wailing womanishly, Aesch.

div1.head: ἁβροδίαιτος
div1.sense: living delicately, Aesch.; τὸ ἁβροδίαιτον effeminacy, Thuc.

div1.head: ἁβροκόμης
div1.sense: with delicate or luxuriant leaves, φοῖνιξ Eur., Anacreont.

div1.head: ἀβρόμιος
div1.sense: without Bacchus, Anth.

div1.head: ἄβρομος
div1.sense: noiseless; epith. of the Trojans in Il., v. αὐΐαχος.

div1.head: ἁβροπέδιλος
div1.sense: with soft sandals, Anth.

div1.head: ἁβρόπηνος
div1.sense: of delicate texture, Aesch.

div1.head: ἁβρόπλουτος
div1.sense: richly luxuriant, Eur.

div1.head: ἁβρός
div1.etym: perhaps the same root as ἥβη
div1.sense: delicate, graceful, beauteous, pretty, Anacr., etc.: of things, splendid, Pind.—Very early the word took the notion of over-delicate, dainty, luxurious; hence neut. as adv. ἁβρὰ παθεῖν to live delicately, Solon; ἁβρὰ παρηΐδος ἁβρὰν παρηΐδα, Eur.; ἁβρῶς and ἁβρὸν βαίνειν to step delicately, Eur.

div1.head: ἀβροτάζω
div1.etym: From same Root with ἀμβροτεῖν, ἁμαρτεῖν, μ being rejected.
div1.sense: to miss, c. gen., only in aor1 subj., μήπως ἀβροτάξομεν (Epic for -ωμεν) ἀλλήλοιϊν that we may not miss one another, Il.

div1.head: ἁβρότης
div1.sense: delicacy, luxury, Pind.; οὐκ ἐν ἁβρότητι κεῖσαι thou art not in a position to be fastidious, Eur.

div1.head: ἁβρότιμος
div1.sense: delicate and costly, Aesch.

div1.head: ἄβροτος
div1.sense: immortal, divine, holy, νὺξ ἀβρότη, either holy Night, as a divinity, (like ἱερὸν κνέφας, ἱερὸν ἦμαρ), or never failing (like ἄφθιτος ἠώς), Il.; ἔπη ἄβροτα holy hymns, Soph.
without men, solitary, Aesch.

div1.head: ἁβροχίτων
div1.sense: in soft tunic, softly clad, Anth.; εὐνὰς ἁβροχίτωνας beds with soft coverings, Aesch.

div1.head: ἄβροχος
div1.sense: unwetted, unmoistened, Aeschin.: wanting rain, waterless, Eur.

div1.head: ἁβρύνω
div1.sense: to make delicate, treat delicately, Aesch.: to deck or trick out, εἰς γάμον ἁβρῦναί τινα Anth.; Mid. or Pass. to live delicately; then to wax wanton, give oneself airs, Aesch.; c. gen. rei, to pride or plume oneself on a thing, Eur.

div1.head: Ἀβυδόθεν
div1.sense: from Abydos, Il.

div1.head: Ἀβυδόθι
div1.sense: at Abydos, Il.

div1.head: Ἄβυδος
div1.sense: Abydos, the town on the Asiatic side of the Hellespont.

div1.head: ἄβυσσος
div1.sense: with no bottom, bottomless, unfathomed, Hdt.; generally, unfathomable, enormous, Aesch.
ἡ ἄβυσσος, the great deep, the abyss, bottomless pit, NTest.

div1.head: ἀγαθοειδής
div1.sense: seeming good, Plat.

div1.head: ἀγαθοεργέω
div1.sense: to do good, NTest.

div1.head: ἀγαθοεργία
div1.sense: a good deed, service rendered, Lat. beneficium, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀγαθοεργός
div1.sense: doing good: — οἱ Ἀγαθοεργοί, at Sparta, the five oldest and most approved knights, who went on foreign missions for the state, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀγαθοποιέω
div1.sense: to do good, NTest.; ἀγ. τινά to do good to, NTest.
to do well, act rightly, NTest.

div1.head: ἀγαθοποιία
div1.sense: well doing, NTest.

div1.head: ἀγαθοποιός
div1.sense: doing good, beneficent.

div1.head: ἀγαθός
div1.sense: good, Lat. bonus:
of persons,

in early times, good, gentle, noble, in reference to birth, opp. to κακοί, πατρὸς δʼ εἴμʼ ἀγαθοῖο, θεὰ δέ με γείνατο μήτηρ Il.; ἀγαθοὶ καὶ ἐξ ἀγαθῶν, Lat. boni bonis prognati, Plat.; with this early sense was associated that of wealth and power, like Lat. optimus quisque in Sallust and Cicero; esp. in the phrase καλοὶ κἀγαθοί (v. καλοκἀγαθός).

good, brave, since these qualities were attributed to the Chiefs, Il.; ἀγαθὸς ἐν ὑσμίνῃ, βοὴν ἀγαθός, πὺξ ἀγαθός, etc., Hom.; ἀγ. τὰ πολέμια, τὰ πολιτικά Hdt., etc.;—also c. dat., ἀγ. πολέμῳ Xen.;—and, ἀγ. εἴς τι, περί τι, πρός τι Plat., etc.; lastly, c. inf., ἀγ. μάχεσθαι, ἱππεύεσθαι, good at fighting, etc., Hdt.
good, in moral sense, Plat., etc.
ἀγαθοῦ δαίμονος, as a toast, "to the good Genius," Ar.
of things,
good, serviceable, Ἰθάκη ἀγαθὴ κουροτρόφος Od.; ἀγ. τοῖς τοκεῦσι, τῇ πόλει Xen.; c. gen., εἴ τι οἶδα πυρετοῦ ἀγ. good for fever, Xen.; ἀγαθόν ἐστι, c. inf., it is good to do so and so, Hom., etc.

ἀγαθόν, τό, a good, of persons, φίλον, ὃ μέγιστον ἀγ. εἶναι φασι Xen.; ἐπʼ ἀγαθῷ τοῖς πολίταις Ar.; τὸ ἀγαθόν or τἀγαθόν, the good, summum bonum, Plat., etc.; in pl., ἀγαθά, τά, the goods of fortune, wealth, Hdt., etc.; also good qualities, of a horse, Xen.

instead of the regular degrees of comparison, many forms are used,—comp. ἀμείνων, ἀρείων, βελτίων, κρείσσων, λωΐων , Epic βέλτερος, λωΐτερος, φέρτερος;— Sup. ἄριστος, βέλτιστος, κράτιστος, λώϊστος, Epic βέλτατος, κάρτιστος, φέρτατος, φέριστος.
the adv. is usually εὖ: ἀγαθῶς in late writers.

div1.head: ἀγαθωσύνη
div1.sense: goodness, kindness, NTest.

div1.head: ἀγαίομαι
div1.etym: Epic and Ionic for ἄγαμαι, only in pres. and in bad sense (cf. ἄγη II).
div1.sense: c. gen. rei, to be indignant at, Od.
c. dat. pers. to be indignant with, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀγακλεής
div1.sense: very glorious, famous, Lat. inclytus, Il., Pind.

div1.head: ἀγακλειτός
div1.sense: = ἀγακλεής, Hom., etc.
of things, ἀγακλειτὴ ἑκατόμβη Od.

div1.head: ἀγακλυτός
div1.sense: Lat. inclytus, of men, Hom., Hes.
of things, Od.

div1.head: ἀγα-κτιμένη
div1.sense: well-built or placed, πόλις Pind.

div1.head: ἀγάλακτος
div1.sense: without milk, getting no milk, i.e. taken from the motherʼs breast, Horaceʼs jam lacte depulsus, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀγαλλίασις
div1.sense: great joy, exultation, NTest.

div1.head: ἀγαλλιάω
div1.sense: to rejoice exceedingly, NTest.

div1.head: ἀγαλλίς
div1.sense: the iris or flag, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἀγάλλω
div1.etym: Pass., mostly in pres. and imperf.
div1.sense: to make glorious, glorify, exalt, c. acc. : esp. to pay honour to a god, ἀγ. τινὰ θυσίαισι Ar.; to adorn, deck, γαμηλίους εὐνάς Eur.; Pass. to glory, take delight, exult in a thing, c. dat., Hom., Attic; absol., Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἄγαλμα
div1.sense: a glory, delight, honour, Il., Attic; ἀγάλματʼ ἀγορᾶς mere ornaments of the agora, Eur.
a pleasing gift, esp. for the gods, Od.
a statue in honour of a god, Hdt., Attic; an image, as an object of worship, etc., Aesch.; then generally,= ἀνδριάς, any statue, Plat.: also a portrait, picture, ἐξαλειφθεῖσʼ ὡς ἄγαλμα Eur.

div1.head: ἀγαλματοποιός
div1.sense: a maker of statues, a sculptor, statuary, Hdt., Plat., etc.

div1.head: ἄγαμαι
div1.sense: absol. to wonder, be astonished, Hom.
c. acc. to admire a person or thing, Hom., Hdt.; so in Attic, ταῦτα ἀγασθείς Xen.; c. acc. pers. et rei, to admire one for a thing, Plat., Xen.
c. gen. rei only, often in Com., to wonder at, λόγων Ar.
c. acc. rei et gen. pers., οὐκ ἄγαμαι ταῦτʼ ἀνδρός I admire not this in a man, Eur.
c. gen. pers., foll. by a part., to wonder at oneʼs doing, ἀγ. αὐτοῦ εἰπόντος Plat.
c. dat. to be delighted with a person or thing, Hdt., Eur., etc.
in bad sense, to feel envy, bear a grudge against a person, c. dat., Hom.
c. acc. to be jealous or angry at a thing, Od. Cf. ἀγαίομαι.

div1.head: Ἀγαμεμνόνεος
div1.sense: of or having to do with Agamemnon, Hom., Pind., Aesch.

div1.head: Ἀγαμεμνονίδης
div1.sense: Agamemnonʼs son, Orestes, Od.

div1.head: Ἀγαμέμνων
div1.sense: the very steadfast, name of the leader of the Greeks against Troy, Hom.

div1.head: ἀγαμένως
div1.sense: part. pres. of ἄγαμαι, with admiration, respect or deference, Plat.

div1.head: ἀγαμία
div1.sense: celibacy, Plut.; ἀγαμίου δίκη, ἡ, an action against one for not marrying, Plut.

div1.head: ἄγαμος
div1.sense: unmarried, unwedded, single, Lat. caelebs, Il., Trag.
γάμος ἄγαμος, a marriage that is no marriage, a fatal marriage, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: ἀγανακτέω
div1.sense: to feel irritation: metaph. to be vexed, annoyed, angry, discontented, Ar., Plat.; c. dat. rei, to be vexed at a thing, Plat.; ἐπί τινι Isocr., ὑπέρ τινος, διά τι Plat.
to be vexed at or with a person, τινί Xen.; πρός τινα Plut.; κατά τινος Luc.: c. acc. pers., ἀγ. τινὰς ἀποθνήσκοντας to be angry at their dying, Plat.

div1.head: ἀγανάκτησις
div1.sense: irritation, of the irritation caused by teething, Plat.: metaph., ἀγανάκτησιν ἔχει the thing gives ground for annoyance or displeasure, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀγανακτητικός
div1.sense: irritable, Plat.

div1.head: ἀγανακτητός
div1.sense: irritating, Plat.

div1.head: ἀγάννιφος
div1.sense: much snowed on, snow-capt, Il.

div1.head: ἀγανοβλέφαρος
div1.sense: mild-eyed, Anth.

div1.head: ἀγανός
div1.sense: mild, gentle, kindly, of words, Hom., Pind.; in Hom. of the shafts of Apollo and Artemis, as bringing an easy death; Sup. ἀγανώτατος, Hes.: adv. -νῶς, Eur.

div1.head: ἀγανοφροσύνη
div1.sense: gentleness, kindliness, Hom.

div1.head: ἀγανόφρων
div1.sense: poet. adj. gentle of mood, Hom.

div1.head: ἄγαν
div1.etym: ἄγᾱν properly, but ἄγαν in Anth.
div1.sense: very, much, very much, Theogn., Attic, the word λίην being its equiv. in Epic and Ionic: in bad sense, too, too much, Lat. nimis, as in the famous μηδὲν ἄγαν, ne quid nimis, not too much of any thing, Theogn., etc.

div1.head: ἀγάομαι
div1.sense: admiring, Hes.

div1.head: ἀγαπάζω
div1.sense: to treat with affection, shew affection to a person, caress, c. acc., Hom.; so in Mid., Od.

div1.head: ἀγαπάω
div1.sense: of persons, to treat with affection, to caress, love, be fond of, c. acc., Attic for ἀγαπάζω, Plat., etc.; Pass. to be beloved, Plat., Dem.
in NTest. to regard with brotherly love, v. ἀγαπή.

of things, to be well pleased or contented at or with a thing, c. dat., Dem., etc.; also c. acc. rei, Dem.; absol. to be content, Luc.: —ἀγ. ὅτι.., εἰ.., ἐὰν.., to be well pleased that . . ., Thuc., etc.

div1.head: ἀγάπημα
div1.sense: a delight, darling, Anth.

div1.head: ἀγαπήνωρ
div1.sense: = ἠνορέην ἀγαπῶν, loving manliness, manly, Il.

div1.head: ἀγάπη
div1.sense: love: esp. brotherly love, charity; the love of God for man and of man for God, NTest.
in pl. a love-feast, NTest.

div1.head: ἀγαπητέος
div1.sense: to be loved, desired, Plat.

div1.head: ἀγαπητικός
div1.sense: affectionate, Plut.

div1.head: ἀγαπητός
div1.sense: beloved, of an only son, Hom., Dem.
of things, worthy of love, loveable, dear, Plat., etc.
to be acquiesced in (as the least in a choice of evils), ἀγαπητόν ἐστι one must be content, εἰ.., ἐάν.., Plat., Xen., etc.
adv. -τῶς, cheerfully, contentedly, Plat., Dem., etc.
just enough to content one, only just, barely, scarcely, Plat.

div1.head: ἀγάρροος
div1.sense: strong-flowing, swift-flowing, Il.

div1.head: ἀγάστονος
div1.sense: much groaning, howling, of waves, Od.: loud-wailing, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀγαστός
div1.etym: ἀγατός poet. for ἀγαστός, as θαυματός for θαυμαστός, Hhymn.; verb. adj. of ἄγαμαι
div1.sense: deserving admiration, later form of the Hom. ἀγητός, admirable, Eur., Xen.; adv. -τῶς, Xen. poet. for ἀγαστός, as θαυματός for θαυμαστός, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἀγαυός
div1.sense: illustrious, noble, Hom.; Sup. -ότατος, Od.

div1.head: ἀγαυρός
div1.sense: stately, proud, Hes.: superl. adv. ἀγαυρότατα, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀγγαρεύω
div1.sense: to press one to serve as a courier, to press into service, NTest.

div1.head: ἀγγαρήϊος
div1.sense: ἀγγαρήϊος, Ionic form of ἄγγαρος, Hdt.
neut. ἀγγαρήϊον, post-riding, the Persian system of mounted couriers, Hdt.

div1.head: ἄγγαρος
div1.sense: Persian word, a mounted courier, such as were kept ready at regular stages throughout Persia for carrying the royal despatches; cf. ἀγγαρήϊος, and v. Xen. Cyr. 8. 6, 17.
as adj., ἄγγαρον πῦρ the courier flame, said of beacon fires used for telegraphing, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀγγελία
div1.sense: a message, tidings, news, Hom., Hdt., etc.; ἀγγελίη ἐμή a report of me, concerning me, Il.; ἀγγελίην πατρὸς φέρει ἐρχομένοιο he brings news of or about thy fatherʼs coming, Od.: — ἀγγελίην ἐλθεῖν, to go a message, i. e. on a message, like Lat. legationem obire, Il.;—so also Epic in gen., ἀγγελίης οἴχνεσκε went on account of a message, Od.; ἤλυθε σεῦ ἕνεκʼ ἀγγελίης ( i. e. ἀγγελίης σοῦ ἕνεκα) Od., Hes.
a proclamation, command, Hhymn., etc.

div1.head: ἀγγελιαφόρος
div1.sense: a messenger, Hdt.: title of the Persian minister who introduced people to the king, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀγγέλλω
div1.sense: to bear a message, τινί to a person, Hom.; c. acc. et inf. to make proclamation that, Il.
c. acc. rei, to announce, proclaim, report, Hom., Attic
c. acc. pers. to bring news of, Od.; περί τινος Soph.
Mid. to announce oneself, Soph.
Pass. to be reported of, Soph., etc.; τὰ ἠγγελμένα the reports, Thuc.

div1.head: ἄγγελμα
div1.sense: a message, tidings, news, Eur., Thuc., etc.

div1.head: ἄγγελος
div1.sense: a messenger, envoy, Hom., Hdt., Attic
generally, one that announces, of birds of augury, Il.; Μουσῶν ἄγγελος, of a poet, Theogn.; Διὸς ἄγγ., of the nightingale, Soph.; c. gen. rei, ἄγγ. κακῶν ἐμῶν Soph.
a divine messenger, an angel, NTest.

div1.head: ἄγγος
div1.sense: a vessel of various kinds, a jar to hold milk, etc., Hom.: a vat for the vintage, Hes.; a vase, pitcher, pail, Hdt., Attic
a coffer or ark, in which children were laid, Hdt., Eur.: a chest for clothes, Soph.: a cinerary urn, Soph.
the cell of a honeycomb, Anth.

div1.head: ἀγείρω
div1.sense: to bring together, gather together, c. acc., Hom., Attic; Pass. to come together, gather, assemble, Hom.; ἀγρόμενοι σύες herded swine, Od.; θυμὸς ἐνὶ στήθεσσιν ἀγέρθη, ἐς φρένα θυμὸς ἀγέρθη Il.
of things, to get together, collect, gather, Od.; so in Mid., Od.
to collect by begging, Od.
ὀφρύας εἰς ἓν ἀγείρειν to frown, Anth.

div1.head: ἀγείτων
div1.sense: without neighbour, neighbourless, Aesch.; φίλων ἀγ. with no friends as neighbours, Eur.

div1.head: ἀγελαῖος
div1.sense: belonging to a herd, feeding at large, Hom., Attic.
in herds or shoals, gregarious, ἰχθύες Hdt.; ἀγελαῖα, τά, gregarious animals, Plat.
of the herd or multitude, i.e. common, Plat., etc.

div1.head: ἀγελαρχέω
div1.sense: to lead a company, c. gen., Plut.

div1.head: ἀγελάρχης
div1.sense: the leader of a company, captain, Plut., Luc.

div1.head: ἀγελαστί
div1.sense: without laughter, Plut.

div1.head: ἀγέλαστος
div1.sense: not laughing, grave, gloomy, sullen, Hhymn., Aesch.
pass. not to be laughed at, not trifling, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀγελείη
div1.sense: Epic epith. of Athena, driver of spoil, forager, Il.

div1.head: ἀγεληδόν
div1.sense: in herds or companies, Il., Hdt.:— Doric ἀγελᾱδόν, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀγέλη
div1.sense: a herd, of horses, of oxen and kine, cf. βούνομος; of swine, Hes.
any herd or company, Soph., Eur.; metaph., πόνων ἀγέλαι Eur.

div1.head: ἀγενεαλόγητος
div1.sense: of unrecorded descent, NTest.

div1.head: ἀγένειος
div1.sense: beardless; ἀγένειόν τι εἰρηκέναι to speak like a boy, Luc.

div1.head: ἀγένητος
div1.sense: unborn, uncreated, unoriginated, Plat.
of things, not done, not having happened, ἀγένητον ποιεῖν, Lat. infectum reddere, Soph.

div1.head: ἀγεννής
div1.sense: of no family, low-born, Hdt., Plat., etc.
low-minded, Hdt., Ar., etc.
of things, much like βάναυσος, illiberal, sordid, Plat.; adv. -νῶς, Eur.

div1.head: ἀγέννητος
div1.sense: unbegotten, unborn, ἀγ. τότʼ ἦ Soph.
like ἀγεννής, low-born, Soph.

div1.head: ἄγε
div1.etym: properly imperat. of ἄγω, used as adv.
div1.sense: come! come on! well! Lat. age! Hom., Attic.

div1.head: ἀγέραστος
div1.sense: without a gift of honour, unrecompensed, unrewarded, Il., Eur.

div1.head: ἄγερσις
div1.sense: a gathering, mustering, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀγέρωχος
div1.sense: poet. adj. high-minded, lordly, Hom., etc.; in Pind. of noble actions.
in bad sense, haughty, arrogant, insolent, Archil., Luc.: so adv. -χως, Anth.

div1.head: ἀγέστρατος
div1.sense: host-leading, Hes.

div1.head: ἄγευστος
div1.sense: without taste of, fasting from, c. gen.; metaph., κακῶν ἄγευστος αἰών Soph.; τῶν τερπνῶν ἄγευστος Xen.

div1.head: ἀγηλατέω
div1.sense: to drive out a curse, i.e. an accursed or polluted person, Lat. piaculum exigere, Hdt., Soph.

div1.head: ἄγημα
div1.sense: anything led, a division of an army, corps, Xen.

div1.head: ἀγηνορία
div1.sense: manliness, manhood, courage, Il.

div1.head: ἀγήνωρ
div1.sense: poet. adj., manly, courageous, heroic, Il.; in bad sense, headstrong, arrogant, Hom., Hes.

div1.head: ἄγη
div1.sense: wonder, awe, amazement, Hom.
envy, malice, Hdt.; and of the gods, jealousy, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀγή
div1.sense: a fragment, piece, splinter, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: ἀγήραος
div1.sense: not waxing old, undecaying,
of persons, Hom., Hes.; so, ἀγήρως χρόνῳ Soph.
of things, Il., Attic

div1.head: ἀγησίλαος
div1.sense: leader of people, conductor of men, Aesch.; so, ἡγησίλεως and ἀγησίλας, ἀγησίλα, Anth.

div1.head: ἀγησίχορος
div1.sense: leading the chorus, Pind.

div1.head: ἀγητός
div1.sense: admirable, wondrous, c. acc. rei, εἶδος ἀγητός admirable in form, Il.; εἶδος ἀγητοί wonderful in form only, as a reproach, Il.; c. dat. rei, ἀγ. χρήμασι Solon.

div1.head: ἁγιασμός
div1.sense: consecration, sanctification, NTest.

div1.head: ἁγίζω
div1.sense: to hallow, dedicate, Soph.

div1.head: ἀγινέω
div1.sense: to lead, bring, carry, Il., Hdt.; Mid. to cause to be brought, Hdt.

div1.head: ἅγιος
div1.sense: devoted to the gods, sacred, holy, Lat. sacer:
of things, esp. temples, Hdt., Xen., etc.: τὸ ἅγιον the Temple, τὰ ἅγια τῶν ἁγίων theHoly of Holies, NTest.
of persons, holy, pure, Ar.; adv. ἁγίως, Isocr., NTest.—The word never occurs in Hom. or Trag., ἁγνός being used instead.

div1.head: ἁγιστεία
div1.sense: mostly in pl. holy rites, temple-worship, Isocr.

div1.head: ἁγιστεύω
div1.sense: to perform sacred rites, Plat.
to live piously or chastely, Eur.

div1.head: ἁγιωσύνη
div1.sense: holiness, sanctity, NTest.

div1.head: ἀγκάζομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to lift up in the arms, Il.

div1.head: ἄγκαθεν
div1.sense: like ἀγκάς, in the arms, Aesch.
with bent arm, resting on the arm, Aesch.
div1.etym: not for ἀνέκαθεν, since ἀγκ- stands for ἀνακ-, never for ἀνεκ-.

div1.head: ἀγκάλη
div1.sense: the bent arm, Hdt., etc.; mostly in pl., ἐν ἀγκάλαις in the arms, Aesch., Eur.; ἐν ταῖς ἀγκ. Xen.;—in sg., φέρειν ἐν τῇ ἀγκάλῃ Hdt.
metaph. anything closely enfolding, πετραία ἀγκάλη Aesch.; πόντιαι ἀγκάλαι bights or arms of the sea, Aesch.; κυμάτων ἐν ἀγκάλαις Ar.

div1.head: ἀγκαλίζομαι
div1.sense: to embrace, Anth.
ἀγκαλιζόμενος in pass. sense, Aesop.

div1.head: ἀγκάλισμα
div1.sense: that which is embraced or carried in the arms, Luc.

div1.head: ἄγκαλος
div1.sense: an armful, bundle, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἀγκάς
div1.sense: in or into the arms, Hom., Theocr.

div1.head: ἀγκίστριον
div1.sense: a fish-hook, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀγκιστρόδετος
div1.sense: with a hook, Anth.

div1.head: ἄγκιστρον
div1.sense: a fish-hook, Od., Hdt., etc.
the hook of a spindle, Plat.

div1.head: ἀγκιστρόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be furnished with barbs, Plut.

div1.head: ἀγκοίνη
div1.sense: poet. for ἀγκάλη or ἀγκών, the bent arm, only in pl., Hom.

div1.head: ἄγκος
div1.sense: a bend: hence a mountain glen, dell, valley, Hom., Hdt., Eur.

div1.head: ἀγκύλη
div1.sense: a loop or noose in a cord,Eur., Xen.
the thong of a javelin, by which it was hurled: the javelin itself, Eur.
a bow-string, Soph.

div1.head: ἀγκύλιον
div1.sense: Dim. of ἀγκύλη; τὰ ἀγκύλια, the Roman ancilia, Plut.

div1.head: ἀγκυλογλώχιν
div1.sense: of a cock, with hooked spurs, Babr.

div1.head: ἀγκυλόδους
div1.sense: crook-toothed: barbed, Anth.

div1.head: ἀγκυλομήτης
div1.sense: crooked of counsel, wily, epith. of Κρόνος, Hom.; of Prometheus, Hes.

div1.head: ἀγκυλόπους
div1.sense: with bent legs, ἀγκ. δίφρος, Rom. sella curulis, Plut.

div1.head: ἀγκύλος
div1.sense: crooked, curved, of a bow, Il.: beaked, of the eagle, Pind.: of greedy fingers, hooked, Ar.
metaph., of style, crooked, intricate, Luc.

div1.head: ἀγκυλότοξος
div1.sense: with curved bow, Il., etc.

div1.head: ἀγκυλοχείλης
div1.sense: with hooked beak, αἰετός Od.; αἰγυπιοί Il.

div1.head: ἀγκυλοχήλης
div1.sense: with crooked claws, Batr.

div1.head: ἀγκυλόω
div1.sense: to crook, bend, τὴν χεῖρα: Pass., ὄνυχας ἠγκυλωμένος with crooked claws, Ar.

div1.head: ἀγκυλωτός
div1.sense: of javelins, furnished with a thong (ἀγκύλη) for throwing, Eur.

div1.head: ἄγκυρα
div1.sense: Lat. ancora, an anchor, first in Alcae. and Theogn., for in Hom. we hear only of εὐναί, i. e. stones used as anchors; ἄγκυραν βάλλεσθαι, καθιέναι, μεθιέναι, ἀφιέναι to cast anchor, Pind., Hdt., etc.; so, ἐπὶ δυοῖν ἀγκύραιν ὁρμεῖν, i. e. "to have two strings to oneʼs bow," Dem.; cf. ὀχέω; ἐπὶ τῆς αὐτῆς (sc. ἀγκύρας) ὁρμεῖν τοῖς πολλοῖς, i. e. "to be in the same boat" with the many, Dem.

div1.head: ἀγκυρίζω
div1.sense: to throw by the hook-trick, i. e. by hooking your leg behind the otherʼs knee, in wrestling, Ar.

div1.head: ἀγκύριον
div1.sense: a small anchor, Luc.

div1.head: ἀγκών
div1.sense: the bend of the arm, the elbow, Hom.
generally the arm, like ἀγκάλη, Pind., Soph.
any bend, as the jutting angle of a wall, Il.: the bend or reach of a river, Hdt.; ἕσπεροι ἄγκωνες, in Soph., seem to be the angle of the bay of Rhoeteium.

div1.head: ἀγλαέθειρος
div1.sense: bright-haired, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἀγλαΐα
div1.sense: splendour, beauty, adornment; ἀγλαΐηφι πεποιθώς (Epic dat.) Il.: in bad sense, pomp, show, vanity, and in pl. vanities, Od., Eur.
triumph, glory, Pind., Soph.: in pl., festivities, merriment, Hes.

div1.head: ἀγλαΐζω
div1.sense: to make bright or splendid, Plut.
Mid. and Pass. to adorn oneself or be adorned with a thing, take delight in, σέ φημι ἀγλαϊεῖσθαι I say that thou will take delight in them (sc. τοῖς ἵπποις), Il.

div1.head: ἀγλάϊσμα
div1.sense: an ornament, honour, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: ἀγλαόγυιος
div1.sense: with beauteous limbs, Pind.

div1.head: ἀγλαόδενδρος
div1.sense: with beautiful trees, Pind.

div1.head: ἀγλαόδωρος
div1.sense: giving splendid gifts, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἀγλαόθυμος
div1.sense: noble-hearted, Anth.

div1.head: ἀγλαόκαρπος
div1.sense: bearing beautiful or goodly fruit Od.: in Hhymn. of Demeter, giver of the fruits of the earth.

div1.head: ἀγλαόμορφος
div1.sense: of beauteous form, Anth.

div1.head: ἀγλαός
div1.sense: splendid, shining, bright, beautiful, Hom., Hes.
of men, either beautiful or famous, Il.; c. dat. rei, famous for a thing, Il.

div1.head: ἀγλαοτρίαινα
div1.sense: god of the bright trident, Pind.

div1.head: ἀγλαώψ
div1.sense: bright-eyed, beaming, Soph.

div1.head: ἄγλις
div1.sense: a head of garlic, made up of several cloves, Ar.

div1.head: ἄγλωσσος
div1.sense: without tongue, of the crocodile, Arist.
tongueless, ineloquent, Lat. elinguis, Pind., Ar.: then = βάρβαρος, Soph.

div1.head: ἆγμα
div1.sense: a fragment, Plut.

div1.head: ἀγμός
div1.sense: a broken cliff, crag, Eur.

div1.head: ἄγναμπτος
div1.sense: unbending, inflexible, Plut.

div1.head: ἄγναφος
div1.sense: uncarded, NTest.

div1.head: ἁγνεία
div1.sense: purity, chastity, Soph., NTest.: in pl. purifications, Isocr.

div1.head: ἅγνευμα
div1.sense: chastity, Eur.

div1.head: ἁγνεύω
div1.sense: to consider as part of purity, make it a point of religion, c. inf., ἁγνεύουσι ἔμψυχον μηδὲν κτείνειν Hdt.: absol. to be pure, Aesch.; χεῖρας ἁγνεύει is clean in hands, Eur.: to keep oneself pure from a thing, c. gen., Dem.

div1.head: ἁγνίζω
div1.sense: to cleanse away, esp. by water, Soph.
to cleanse, purify, from a thing, c. gen. Eur.
ἁγν. τὸν θανόντα to hallow the dead by fire, so that he may be received by the gods below, Soph.; Pass., σώμαθʼ ἡγνίσθη πυρί Eur.

div1.head: ἅγνισμα
div1.sense: a purification, expiation, Aesch.

div1.head: ἁγνιστέος
div1.sense: to be purified, Eur.

div1.head: ἀγνοέω
div1.sense: Passive not to perceive or know, ἄνδρʼ ἀγνοιήσασʼ from not recognising him, Od.: mostly with negat., οὐκ ἠγνοίησεν, i. e. he perceived or knew well, Il.; μηδὲν ἀγνόει learn all, Eur.: —c. acc. to be ignorant of, Hdt., Attic; ἀγν. περί τινος Plat.; dependent clauses are added in part., τίς ἀγνοεῖ τὸν πόλεμον ἥξοντα; Dem.; or with a Conjunct., οὐδεὶς ἀγνοεῖ ὅτι.., Dem.; Pass. not to be known, Plat., etc.
absol. to go wrong, make a false step, etc.; ἀγνοῶν ignorantly, by mistake, Xen.

div1.head: ἀγνόημα
div1.sense: a fault of ignorance, error, NTest.

div1.head: ἄγνοια
div1.sense: want of perception, ignorance, Aesch., Thuc., etc.; ἣν ὑπʼ ἀγνοίας δρᾷς, i. e. whom seeing you pretend not to know, Soph.
= ἀγνόημα, a mistake, Dem.

div1.head: ἁγνόρυτος
div1.sense: pure-flowing, ποταμός Aesch.

div1.head: ἄγνος
div1.sense: a willow-like tree, vitex agnus castus, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἁγνός
div1.sense: full of religious awe:
of places and things dedicated to gods, hallowed, holy, sacred, Od., Att.
of divine persons, chaste, pure, Od.
of persons, undefiled, chaste, pure, Aesch., Eur.: c. gen. pure from a thing, Eur.
pure from blood, guiltless, Soph.; ἁγνὸς χεῖρας Eur.
in moral sense, pure, upright, Xen.; adv., ἁγνῶς ἔχειν to be pure, Xen.

div1.head: ἁγνότης
div1.sense: purity, chastity, NTest.

div1.head: ἄγνυμι
div1.sense: to break, shiver, Hom.; Pass. to be broken or shivered, ἄγη ξίφος Il.; ἐάγη δόρυ Il.; πάλιν ἄγεν ὄγκοι (for ἐάγησαν) the barbs were broken backwards, Il.; καμπὰς πολλὰς ἀγνύμενος, of a river, with a broken, i. e. winding, course, Hdt.; ἄγνυτο ἠχώ the sound spread around, Hes.

div1.head: ἀγνωμονέω
div1.sense: to act without right feeling, act unfairly, Xen., Dem.; Pass. to be unfairly treated, ἀγνωμονηθείς Plut.

div1.head: ἀγνωμοσύνη
div1.sense: want of sense, folly, Theogn.: senseless pride, arrogance, Hdt., Eur.
want of feeling, unkindness, unfairness, Dem.
in pl. misunderstandings, Xen.

div1.head: ἀγνώμων
div1.sense: ill-judging, senseless, Pind., Plat., etc.; adv. -όνως, senselessly, Xen.
headstrong, reckless, arrogant, (in comp. -ονέστερος) Hdt.; in Sup., Xen.
unfeeling, unkind, hardhearted, Soph., Xen.
of things, senseless, brute, Soph., Aeschin.

div1.head: ἀγνωσία
div1.sense: ignorance, Eur.; διὰ τὴν ἀλλήλων ἀγν. from not knowing one another, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀγνώς
div1.sense: pass. unknown, of persons, Aesch.; ἀγνὼς πατρί clam patre, Eur.: of things, unknown, obscure, unintelligible, Aesch., Soph.; ἀγν. δόκησις a dark suspicion, Soph.
not known, obscure, ignoble, Eur.
act. not knowing, ignorant, Soph.
c. gen., where the sense fluctuates between pass. and act., ἀγνῶτες ἀλλήλων Thuc.

div1.head: ἄγνωστος
div1.sense: unknown, τινί; ἄγνωτον ἐς γῆν Eur.; γνωτὰ κοὐκ ἄγνωτά μοι Soph.
not to be known, ἄγνωστόν τινα τεύχειν Od.; ἀγνωστότατοι γλῶσσαν most unintelligible in tongue, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀγονία
div1.sense: unfruitfulness, Plut.

div1.head: ἄγονος
div1.sense: pass. unborn, Il.: not yet born, Eur.
act. not producing, unfruitful, barren; τόκοισιν ἀγόνοις travail without issue, bringing no children to the birth, Soph., etc.
c. gen. not productive of, barren in a thing, Plat.
childless, Eur.

div1.head: ἄγοος
div1.sense: unmourned, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀγοράζω
div1.sense: (also in mid. sense); to be in the ἀγορά, frequent it, Hdt.: to occupy the market-place, Thuc.
to buy in the market, buy, purchase, Ar., Xen.; Mid. to buy for oneself, Xen., etc.
as a mark of idle fellows, to lounge in the ἀγορά, Thuc.; cf. ἀγοραῖος.

div1.head: ἀγοραῖος
div1.sense: in, of, or belonging to the ἀγορά, Hdt., Attic; Ἑρμῆς Ἀγ. as patron of traffick, Ar.
frequenting the market, etc.; ἀγοραῖοι, οἱ, loungers in the market, Lat. circumforanei, subrostrani, Hdt.; hence generally, the common sort, low fellows, Ar., Plat., etc.
of things, low, mean, vulgar, Ar.
generally, proper to the ἀγορά, skilled in, suited to forensic speaking, Plut.
ἀγοραῖος (sc. ἡμέρα), a court-day, Strab., NTest.
adv. -ως, in forensic style, Plut.

div1.head: ἀγορανομικός
div1.sense: of or for the ἀγορανόμος or his office, Plat.; used to translate Lat. aedilicius, Plut.

div1.head: ἀγορανόμος
div1.sense: a clerk of the market, who regulated buying and selling there, Ar.; used to translate Lat. Aedilis, Plut.

div1.head: ἀγοράομαι
div1.etym: almost wholly used in Epic forms.
div1.sense: to meet in assembly, sit in debate: then, like ἀγορεύω, to speak in the assembly, harangue, Hom.
to speak, utter, Il.
to talk with, τινι Soph.

div1.head: ἀγορά
div1.sense: an assembly of the people, opp. to the Council of Chiefs, Hom.: —καθίζειν ἀγορήν to hold an assembly, opp. to λύειν ἀγ. to dissolve it; ἀγορήνδε καλέειν, κηρύσσειν, Hom.; so, ἀγορὰν συνάγειν, συλλέγειν Xen.

the place of Assembly, Hom.; used not only for debating, trials, and other public purposes, but also as a market-place, like the Roman Forum, Attic; but to lounge in the market was held to be disreputable, cf. ἀγοραῖος.
the business of the ἀγορά, public speaking, gift of speaking, mostly in pl., Hom.
things sold in the ἀγορά, the market, Lat. annona; ἀγορὰν παρασκευάζειν to hold a market, Thuc.
as a mark of time, ἀγορὰ πλήθουσα or ἀγορᾶς πληθώρη the forenoon, when the market-place was full, Hdt.; opp. to ἀγορῆς διάλυσις, the time just after mid-day, when they went home, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀγορασἀγένειος
div1.sense: will lounge in the ἀγορά, without a beard, Ar.

div1.head: ἀγόρασμα
div1.sense: that which is bought: in pl.goods, wares, merchandise, Dem., etc.

div1.head: ἀγοραστής
div1.sense: the slave who bought provisions for the house, the purveyor, Xen.

div1.head: ἀγορεύω
div1.etym: in correct Attic writers, this Verb (and its compds.) is for the most part confined to pres. and imperf.; the other tenses being borrowed.
div1.sense: to speak in the assembly, harangue, speak, Hom.; κακόν τι ἀγορεύειν τινά to speak ill of one, Od.; of the κῆρυξ in the Ecclesia, τίς ἀγορεύειν βούλεται; who wishes to address the people? Ar., Dem., etc.
μή τι φόβονδʼ ἀγόρευε counsel me not to flight, Il.
to proclaim, declare, mention, Hom.; in aor1 mid., ἀγορεύσασθαι ὡς . . . to have it proclaimed that . . ., Hdt., etc.: metaph., δέρμα θηρὸς ἀγ. χειρῶν ἔργον tells a tale of. . ., Theocr.
Pass., of a speech, to be spoken, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀγορῆθεν
div1.sense: from the Assembly or market, Il., etc.

div1.head: ἀγορήνδε
div1.sense: to the Assembly or market, Il.

div1.head: ἀγορητής
div1.sense: a speaker, orator, Il.

div1.head: ἀγορητύς
div1.sense: the gift of speaking, eloquence, Od.

div1.head: ἀγορῆφι
div1.sense: in the Assembly, Hes.

div1.head: ἀγός
div1.sense: a leader, chief, Il., etc.

div1.head: ἄγος
div1.sense: any matter of religious awe:
like Lat. piaculum, that which requires expiation, a curse, pollution, guilt, Hdt., Aesch., etc.
the person or thing accursed, an abomination, Soph., Thuc.
an expiation, Soph.
in good sense, = σέβας, awe, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἀγοστός
div1.sense: the flat of the hand, Il.
the arm, = ἀγκάλη, Theocr., Anth.

div1.head: ἀγράμματος
div1.sense: without learning (γράμματα), unlettered, Xen., Anth.

div1.head: ἄγραπτος
div1.sense: unwritten, Soph.

div1.head: ἄγρα
div1.sense: a catching, hunting, ἄγραν ἐφέπειν to follow the chase, Od.; ἐς ἄγρας ἰέναι Eur.: also of fishing, Soph.
a way of catching, Hes., Hdt.
that which is taken in hunting, the booty, prey, Hes., Trag.: game, Hdt.: of fish, a draught, haul, NTest.

div1.head: ἀγραυλέω
div1.sense: to dwell in the field, NTest.

div1.head: ἄγραυλος
div1.sense: dwelling in the field, of shepherds, Il., Hes.; ἄγρ. ἀνήρ a boor, Anth.
of oxen, Hom., etc.
of things, rural, rustic, Eur.

div1.head: ἄγραφος
div1.sense: unwritten, Thuc.; ἄγραφοι νόμοι unwritten laws, i. e.
the laws of nature, moral law, Dem.
laws of custom, common law, Thuc.
not registered, Thuc. ἄγρει, ἀγρεῖτε, v. ἀγρέω.

div1.head: ἀγρεῖος
div1.sense: of or in the country, Anth.
clownish, boorish, Ar.

div1.head: ἀγρειοσύνη
div1.sense: clownishness, a rude, vagrant life, Anth.

div1.head: ἀγρεῖφνα
div1.sense: a harrow, rake, Anth.

div1.head: ἄγρευμα
div1.sense: that which is taken in hunting, booty, prey, spoil, Eur.
a means of catching, Aesch.; of the net thrown over Agamemnon, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀγρεύς
div1.sense: a hunter, Pind., Eur.
of an arrow, Anth.

div1.head: ἀγρευτής
div1.sense: a hunter, like ἀγρεύς, Soph.
as adj., ἀγρ. κύνες hounds, Solon; ἀγρ. κάλαμοι a trap of reeds, Anth.

div1.head: ἀγρεύω
div1.sense: to take by hunting or fishing, to catch, take, Hdt., Eur.; also in Mid., θύματʼ ἠγρεύσασθʼ ye caught or chose your victim, Eur.; Pass. to be taken in the chase, Xen.
metaph. to hunt after, thirst for, Eur.; but ἀγρεύειν τινὰ λόγῳ to catch him in or by his words, NTest.

div1.head: ἀγρέω
div1.sense: to capture, seize, Sapph., Aesch.
imperat. ἄγρει, ἄγε, come, come on Il.; ἀγρεῖτε Od.

div1.head: ἀγριαίνω
div1.sense: intr. to be angered, provoked, chafed, Plat.; τινί with one, Plat.; metaph. of rivers, Plut.
Causal, to make angry: Pass. to be angered, Plut.

div1.head: ἀγριάς
div1.sense: wild, ἄμπελον ἀγριάδα Anth.

div1.head: ἀγριέλαιος
div1.sense: of a wild olive, Anth.
as Subst. a wild olive, Lat. oleaster, Theocr., NTest.

div1.head: ἀγριοποιός
div1.sense: writing wild poetry, Ar.

div1.head: ἄγριος
div1.sense: living in the fields, Lat. agrestis:
of animals, wild, savage, αἴξ, σῦς Il.; ἵπποι, ὄνοι Hdt., etc.; of men, Hdt.; of a countryman, as opp. to a citizen, Mosch.
of trees, wild, Hdt., etc.; μητρὸς ἀγρίας ἄπο made from the wild vine, Aesch.; ἄγρ. ἔλαιον, Soph.
of countries, wild, uncultivated, Plat.
of men and animals, having qualities incident to a wild state:
in moral sense, savage, fierce, Lat. ferus, ferox, Hom., etc.
wild, brutal, coarse, boorish, rude, Hom., etc.; ἀγριώτατα ἤθεα Hdt.; ἐς τὸ ἀγριώτερον to harsher measures, Thuc.
of things and circumstances, cruel, harsh, Aesch., etc.; νὺξ ἀγριωτέρη more wild, stormy, Hdt.; ἀγρ. νόσος a malignant disease, Soph.
adv. -ίως, savagely, Aesch., etc.: also ἄγρια as neut. pl., Hes., Mosch.

div1.head: ἀγριότης
div1.sense: wildness, savageness, Xen., etc.
in moral sense, savageness, fierceness, cruelty, Plat., etc.

div1.head: ἀγριόφωνος
div1.sense: with wild rough voice, Od.

div1.head: ἀγριόω
div1.sense: to make wild or savage; τινί against one, Eur.
Pass., imperf. ἠγριούμην, aor1 ἠγριώθην: perf. ἠγρίωμαι; to grow wild or savage, and in perf. to be so, Eur.
in moral sense, to be savage, fierce, Soph., etc.

div1.head: ἀγριωπός
div1.sense: wild-looking, Eur.

div1.head: ἀγροβότης
div1.sense: feeding in the field, dwelling in the country, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: ἀγρογείτων
div1.sense: a country neighbour, Plut.

div1.head: ἀγροδότης
div1.sense: a giver of booty or prey, Anth.

div1.head: ἀγρόθεν
div1.sense: from the country, Od., Eur., etc.

div1.head: ἀγροικία
div1.sense: rusticity, boorishness, coarseness, Plat.

div1.head: ἀγροικίζομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to be rude and boorish, Plat.

div1.head: ἄγροικος
div1.sense: of or in the country, Ar., etc.
of men, dwelling in the country, a countryman, rustic, Ar.; then, opp. to ἀστεῖος, clownish, boorish, rude, Ar.; the character of the ἄγροικος is described by Theophr.
adv. -κως, Ar.; comp. -οτέρως, Plat., Xen.; but -ότερον, Plat.
of land, rough, uncultivated, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀγροιώτης
div1.sense: a countryman, Hom., Hes., etc.
as adj. rustic, Anth. ἀγρόμενος, Epic aor2 part. pass. of ἀγείρω.

div1.head: ἀγρόνδε
div1.sense: to the country, Od.

div1.head: ἀγρονόμος
div1.sense: haunting the country, rural, wild, Od., Aesch.; of places, Soph.
as Subst., overseer of public lands, a magistrate at Athens, Plat.

div1.head: ἀγρός
div1.sense: Lat. ager, a field, in pl. fields, lands, Hom., etc.: in sg. a farm, Od.
the country, opp. to the town, Od.: ἀγρῷ or ἐπʼ ἀγροῦ in the country, Od.; κατʼ ἀγρούς Od.; ἐπʼ ἀγρῶν Soph.

div1.head: ἀγρότερος
div1.sense: poet. for ἄγριος, wild, of animals,Hom., etc.
of countrymen, Anth.
of plants, wild, Anth.
fond of the chase; Ἀγροτέρα, the Huntress, i. e. Artemis, Il., Xen.

div1.head: ἀγροτήρ
div1.sense: = ἀγρότης, Eur.; fem. ἀγρότειρα, as adj. rustic, Eur.

div1.head: ἀγρότης
div1.sense: a country-man, rustic, Eur.
= ἀγρευτής a hunter, Od.; fem. ἀγρότις, i. e. Artemis, Anth.

div1.head: ἀγροφύλαξ
div1.sense: a watcher of the country, Anth.

div1.head: ἀγρυπνέω
div1.sense: to lie awake, be wakeful, Theogn.; ἀγρυπνεῖν τὴν νύκτα to pass a sleepless night, Xen.
metaph. to be watchful, NTest.

div1.head: ἀγρυπνητικός
div1.sense: wakeful, Plut.

div1.head: ἀγρυπνία
div1.sense: sleeplessness, waking, watching, Plat.; ἀγρυπνίῃσιν εἴχετο Hdt.

div1.head: ἄγρυπνος
div1.sense: hunting after sleep, i. e. sleepless, wakeful, Plat., etc.: metaph., Ζηνὸς ἄγρ. βέλος Aesch.; τὸ ἄγρυπνον ἀγρυπνία, Plat.
act. keeping awake, μέριμναι Anth.

div1.head: ἀγρώσσω
div1.sense: to catch fish, Od.

div1.head: ἄγρωστις
div1.sense: Subst. and adj., Soph., Eur., a grass that mules fed on.

div1.head: ἀγρώτης
div1.sense: adj., wild, Eur.: rustic, Anth.

div1.head: ἄγυια
div1.etym: a quasiparticipial form from ἄγω cf. ὄργυια
div1.sense: a street, highway, Hom., etc.

div1.head: ἀγυιᾶτις
div1.sense: adj., ἀγυιάτιδες θεραπεῖαι the worship of Apollo Agyieus, Eur.

div1.head: Ἀγυιεύς
div1.sense: name of Apollo, guardian of the streets, Eur.
a pillar set up at the street door, Ar.

div1.head: ἀγυμνασία
div1.sense: want of training, Ar.

div1.head: ἀγύμναστος
div1.sense: unexercised, untrained, Xen.
unpractised, τινός in a thing, Eur., Xen., etc.; also εἴς, πρός or περί τι Plat., etc.
unharassed, Soph.
adv., ἀγυμνάστως ἔχειν πρός τι to be unpractised in a thing, Xen.

div1.head: ἄγυρις
div1.sense: a gathering, crowd, Hom.

div1.head: ἀγυρτάζω
div1.sense: to collect by begging, Od.

div1.head: ἀγύρτης
div1.sense: a collector: esp. a begging priest of Cybele, Anth.: then,
a beggar, mountebank, vagabond, juggler, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: ἀγυρτικός
div1.sense: fit for an ἀγύρτης, vagabond, Plut.

div1.head: ἀγχέμαχος
div1.sense: fighting hand to hand, Il., Hes.; τὰ ἀγχ. ὅπλα arms for close fight, Xen.

div1.head: ἀγχίαλος
div1.sense: near the sea, of cities, Il.; of islands, sea-girt, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: ἀγχιβαθής
div1.sense: deep near shore, of the sea, Od.

div1.head: ἀγχιγείτων
div1.sense: neighbouring, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀγχίθεος
div1.sense: near the gods, i. e. like the gods or dwelling with them, Od.; later, a demigod, Luc.

div1.head: ἀγχίθυρος
div1.sense: next door, Theogn., Theocr.

div1.head: ἀγχίμολος
div1.sense: coming near, c. gen., Theocr.: —in Hom. only in as adv. near, close at hand; so ἐξ ἀγχιμόλοιο Il.

div1.head: ἀγχινεφής
div1.sense: near the clouds, Anth.

div1.head: ἀγχίνοια
div1.sense: readiness of mind, ready wit, sagacity, Plat., etc. From

div1.head: ἀγχίνοος
div1.sense: ready of wit, sagacious, shrewd, Od., Plat., etc.

div1.head: ἄγχι
div1.sense: of Place, near, nigh, close by, absol. or c. gen., Hom.; comp. ἄγχιον, ἆσσον: Sup. ἄγχιστα (v. ἆσσον, ἄγχιστος).

div1.head: ἀγχίπλοος
div1.sense: near by sea, ἀγχ. πόρος a short voyage, Eur.

div1.head: ἀγχίπορος
div1.sense: passing near, always near, Anth.

div1.head: ἀγχίπτολις
div1.sense: poet. for ἀγχίπολις, near the city, dwelling hard by, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: ἀγχιστεία
div1.sense: nearness of kin, Plat.
rights of kin, right of inheritance, Ar.

div1.head: ἀγχιστεύς
div1.sense: mostly in pl. ἀγχιστεῖς, closely akin, of nations, Hdt.: next of kin, Luc.

div1.head: ἀγχιστεύω
div1.sense: to be next or near, c. dat., Eur.
to be next of kin, Isae.

div1.head: ἀγχιστήρ
div1.sense: one who brings near, the immediate author, Soph..

div1.head: ἀγχιστῖνος
div1.sense: close together, crowded, in heaps, Hom.

div1.head: ἄγχιστος
div1.sense: Sup. adj., nearest, Pind., Trag.; γένει ἄγχιστος πατρός nearest of kin to him, Eur.
in Hom. only neut. as adv., ἄγχιστον or ἄγχιστα most nearly like, c. gen., Διὸς ἄγχ. next to Zeus, Aesch.; ἄγχ. τοῦ βωμοῦ Hdt.
of Time, most lately, but now, most recently, Il., Hdt.

div1.head: ἀγχίστροφος
div1.sense: turning closely, quick-wheeling, of a hawk, Theogn.
quick-changing, sudden, Thuc.; neut. pl. as adv. suddenly, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀγχιτέρμων
div1.sense: near the borders, neighbouring, Soph.

div1.head: ἀγχίτοκος
div1.sense: in the pangs of child-birth, Anth.

div1.head: ἀγχόθεν
div1.sense: from nigh at hand, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀγχόθι
div1.sense: near, c. gen., Hom.; absol., Theocr.

div1.head: ἀγχόνη
div1.sense: a throttling, strangling, hanging, Trag., etc.; ἔργα κρείσσονʼ ἀγχόνης deeds beyond (i.e. too bad for) hanging, Soph.; τάδʼ ἀγχόνης πέλας ʼtis nigh as bad as hanging, Eur.; in pl., ἐν ἀγχόναις θάνατον λαβεῖν to die by hanging, Eur.

div1.head: ἀγχόνιος
div1.sense: fit for strangling, βρόχος Eur.

div1.head: ἀγχοτάτω
div1.sense: Sup. of ἀγχοῦ, like ἄγχιστα, nearest, next, c. gen., Hdt.; ἀγχ. τινός very near, i. e. very like, some one, Hdt.; also τινί Hdt.:— οἱ ἀγχοτάτω προσήκοντες the nearest of kin, Hdt.:— so, ἀγχότατα ἔχειν τινός to be most like one, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀγχότερος
div1.sense: comp. of ἀγχοῦ, nearer, c. gen., Hdt.

div1.head: ἀγχοῦ
div1.sense: = ἄγχι, near, nigh, ἀγχοῦ δʼ ἱσταμένη Hom.;c. gen. Hom., Hdt.

div1.head: ἄγχουρος
div1.sense: neighbouring, Anth.

div1.head: ἀγχώμαλος
div1.sense: nearly equal, ἀγχώμαλοι ἐν χειροτονίᾳ Thuc.; ἀγχ. μάχη a doubtful battle, Thuc.: — as adv., ἀγχώμαλα ναυμαχεῖν, Lat. aequo Marte pugnare, Thuc. adv. -λως, Luc.

div1.head: ἄγχω
div1.sense: to compress, press tight, esp. the throat, to strangle, throttle, choke, ἄγχε μιν ἱμὰς ὑπὸ δειρήν Il.; τὸν Κέρβερον ἀπῇξας ἄγχων Ar.: metaph. of creditors, Ar., NTest.; of a guilty conscience, τοῦτο ἄγχει Dem.

div1.head: ἀγωγαῖος
div1.sense: fit for leading by, of a dogʼs leash, Anth.

div1.head: ἀγωγεύς
div1.sense: one that draws or drags, Hdt.
a leading-rein, leash, Soph., Xen.

div1.head: ἀγωγή
div1.sense: a carrying away, carriage, Hdt., etc.; πρὸς τὰς ἀγωγὰς χρῆσθαι ὑποζυγίοις Plat.
intr., τὴν ἀγωγὴν ἐποιεῖτο pursued his voyage, Thuc.: movement, τοῦ ποδός Plat.
a bringing to or in, ὑμῶν ἡ ἐς τοὺς ὀλίγους ἀγ. your bringing us before the council, Thuc.
a carrying off, abduction, Aesch., Soph.
a leading towards a point, guiding, ἵππου Xen.
the leading of an army, Plat.; ἐν ταῖς ἀγ. on marches, Xen.
a training, education, Plat., etc.; of plants, culture, Theophr.

div1.head: ἀγώγιμος
div1.sense: easy to be led or carried, τρισσῶν ἁμαξῶν ἀγώγιμον βάρος weight enough to load three wains, Eur.; τὰ ἀγώγιμα things portable, wares, Xen., etc.
of persons, to be carried off, delivered into bondage, Dem.
easily led, complaisant, Plut.

div1.head: ἀγώγιον
div1.sense: the load of a wagon, Xen.

div1.head: ἀγωγός
div1.sense: leading, and as Subst. a guide, Hdt., etc.: c. gen., δύναμις ἀνθρώπων ἀγωγός power of leading men, Plut.
leading towards a point, εἴς, πρός or ἐπί τι Plat., etc.
drawing forth, eliciting, χοαὶ νεκρῶν ἀγωγοί Eur.; δακρύων ἀγ. Eur.
absol. attractive, Plut.

div1.head: ἀγωνάρχης
div1.sense: judge of a contest, Soph.

div1.head: ἀγωνία
div1.sense: a contest, struggle for victory, διὰ πάσης ἀγωνίης ἔχειν to embrace every kind of contest, Hdt.; πολεμίων ἀγωνία Eur.; ἐν δημοτικῇ ἀγ. Xen.
gymnastic exercise, wrestling, Plat., etc.: generally, exercise, Plat.
of the mind, agony, anguish, ἐν φόβῳ καὶ πολλῇ ἀγωνίᾳ Dem.

div1.head: ἀγωνιάω
div1.sense: like ἀγωνίζομαι, to contend eagerly, struggle, Dem., etc.
to be distressed, be in an agony, Plat.; περί τινος Arist.; ἐπί τινι Plut.

div1.head: ἀγωνίζομαι
div1.sense: as Dep. to contend for a prize, esp. in the public games, Hdt.; πρός τινα Plat.; τινί Plat., etc.; περί τινος about a thing, Hdt., etc.: c. acc. cogn., ἀγ. στάδιον Hdt.; ἀγῶνα περὶ τῆς ψυχῆς ἀγ. Dem.
to fight, Hdt., Thuc.; περὶ τῶν ἁπάντων ἀγ. Thuc.; πρός τινα Thuc.: c. acc cogn., ἣν μάχην ἀγωνίζεσθε Eur.
to contend for the prize on the stage, both of the poet, Hdt., etc., and of the actor, Dem.: generally to contend for victory, καλῶς ἠγώνισαι Plat.
of public speaking, Xen.

to contend against, as law-term, Antipho; c. acc. cogn., ἀγ. δίκην, γραφήν to fight a cause to the last, Dem.; ἀγ. ψευδομαρτυριῶν (sc. γραφήν) Dem.; ἀγ. ἀγῶνα Andoc., etc.; but ἀγ. φόνον to fight against a charge of murder, Eur.
generally, to struggle, to exert oneself, c. inf., Thuc.; c. acc. cogn., ἃ μὲν ἠγωνίσω Dem.

as Pass. to be won by a contest, to be brought to issue, mostly in perf., πολλοὶ ἀγῶνες ἀγωνίδαται (Ionic for ἠγωνισμένοι εἰσι) Hdt.; τὰ ἠγωνισμένα the contested points, Eur., etc.; ὁ ἀγωνιζόμενος νόμος the law under debate, Dem.; fut. mid. in pass. sense, ἀγωνιεῖται τὸ πρᾶγμα it shall be brought to issue, Dem.

div1.head: ἀγώνιος
div1.sense: of or belonging to the contest, ἄεθλος ἀγ. its prize, Pind.; of Hermes, as president of games, Pind.; of Zeus as decider of the contest, Soph.;—the ἀγώνιοι θεοί, in Aesch., etc., are prob. the gods who presided over the great games (Zeus, Poseidon, Apollo, Hermes).
ἀγωνίῳ σχολᾷ in Soph. Aj. 195 is prob. an oxymoron, rest full of conflict, uneasy rest.

div1.head: ἀγώνισις
div1.sense: contest for a prize, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀγώνισμα
div1.sense: a contest, in pl. deeds done in battle, brave deeds, feats, Hdt.
in sg., ἀγ. τινός a feat for him to be proud of, Thuc.; ξυνέσεως ἀγ. a fine stroke of wit, Thuc.; ἀρᾶς ἀγ. the issue of the curse, Eur.
ἀγ. ποιεῖσθαί τι to make it an object to strive for, Hdt.; οὐ μικρὸν τὸ ἀγ. προστάττεις Luc.
that with which one contends, a prize-essay, declamation, ἀγ. ἐς τὸ παραχρῆμα Thuc.

div1.head: ἀγωνισμός
div1.sense: rivalry, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀγωνιστέον
div1.sense: one must contend, Xen., etc.

div1.head: ἀγωνιστής
div1.sense: a rival at the games, competitor, Hdt., etc.:—as adj., ἀγ. ἵπποι race- horses, Plut.
a debater, opponent, Plat.
c. gen. one who struggles for a thing, τῆς ἀρετῆς Aeschin.

div1.head: ἀγωνιστικός
div1.sense: fit for contest or debate, Arist.
of persons, contentious, eager for applause, Plat.:—adv. -κῶς, contentiously, ἀγ. ἔχειν to be disposed to fight, Plut.

div1.head: ἀγωνοθεσία
div1.sense: the office of ἀγωνοθέτης, direction of games, Plut.

div1.head: ἀγωνοθετέω
div1.sense: to direct the games, exhibit them, Thuc.; ἀγ. Ὀλύμπια Anth.
c. acc., ἀγ. στάσιν to stir up sedition, Plut.
generally, to act as judge, decide, Dem. From

div1.head: ἀγωνοθέτης
div1.sense: judge of the contests, director of the games, or (later) an exhibitor of games, Hdt., Attic
generally, a judge, Xen., etc

div1.head: ἀγών
div1.sense: a number of people brought together, a gathering, assembly, like ἀγορά, ἵζανεν εὐρὺν ἀγῶνα, λῦτο δʼ ἀγών, ἐν ἀγῶνι νεῶν Hom.: esp. an assembly met to see games, Hom., etc.
a place of contest, the arena, Hom., etc.; βήτην ἐς μέσσον ἀγῶνα Il.
an assembly of the Greeks at their great national games, ὁ ἐν Ὀλυμπίῃ ἀγών Hdt.; ὁ Ὀλυμπικὸς ἀγών Ar.

the contest for a prize at the games, ἀγὼν ἱππικός, γυμνικός Hdt., etc.; ἀγὼν τῶν ἀνδρῶν, in which the chorus was composed of men, opp. to τῶν παίδων, Dem., etc.:— hence, ἀγῶνα ἄγειν, καθιστάναι, τιθέναι, προτιθέναι, ποιεῖν, to hold or propose a contest; ἀγῶν or ἐν ἀγῶνι νικᾶν, to win one or at one.

generally, any struggle, trial, or danger, πολλοὺς ἀγῶνας ἐξιών, of Hercules, Soph.; ἀγὼν προκέαται, c. inf., it is hard or dangerous to do a thing, Hdt.:— also, ἀγὼν περὶ τῆς ψυχῆς, περὶ μεγίστων a struggle for life and death, for oneʼs highest interests, Eur.
a battle, action, Thuc.
an action at law, trial, Plat., etc.
metaph., οὐ λόγων ἔθʼ ἁγών now is not the time for speaking, etc., Eur.; οὐχ ἕδρας ἀγ. ʼtis no time for sitting still, Eur.

div1.head: ἄγω
div1.etym: on the augment in the Doric form ἆγον, see Chantraine, MHG, 311.
div1.sense: to lead or carry, to convey, bring, with living creatures as the object, φέρω being used of things, δῶκε δʼ ἄγειν ἑτάροισι γυναῖκα, καὶ τρίποδα φέρειν Il. (v. infr. 3); ἄγ. εἰς or πρὸς τόπον; poet. also c. acc. loci, ἄγει Ἀχέροντος ἀκτάν Soph.
intr. of soldiers, to march, Xen., etc.; so, ἄγωμεν let us go, NTest.
part. ἄγων is used in sense, taking, στῆσε δʼ ἄγων, where we should use two Verbs, took and placed, Hom.
to take with one, ἑταίρους Hom.

to carry off as captives or booty, Hom., etc.; mostly in phrase ἄγειν καὶ φέρειν to sweep a country of all its plunder (where φέρειν refers to things, ἄγειν to men and cattle); then c. acc. loci, φέρων καὶ ἄγων τὴν Βιθυνίδα plundering all Bithynia, Xen.; in Pass., ἀγόμεθα, φερόμεθα Eur.
ἄγειν εἰς δίκην or δικαστήριον, ἄγ. ἐπὶ τοὺς δικαστάς to carry one before a court of justice, Lat. rapere in jus, Attic; so, simply ἄγειν, Plat.
to fetch, ἄξεθʼ ὑῶν τὸν ἄριστον Od.: of things, to bring in, import, οἶνον νῆες ἄγουσι Il.
to draw on, bring on, πῆμα τόδʼ ἤγαγον Οὐρανίωνες Il.; Ἰλίῳ φθοράν Aesch.
to bear up, φελλοὶ δʼ ὥς, ἄγουσι δίκτυον Aesch.
to lead towards a point, lead on, τὸν δʼ ἄγε μοῖρα κακὴ θανάτοιο τέλοσδε Il.; also, c. inf., ἄγει θανεῖν leads to death, Eur.: —ὁδὸς ἄγει the road leads, εἰς or ἐπὶ τόπον Soph., Plat.
metaph. to lead, as a general, Il.; ἄγ. στρατιάν, ναῦς, etc., Thuc.; ἄγ. τὴν πολιτείαν to conduct the government, Thuc.
to bring up, train, educate, Plat.
to draw out in length, τεῖχος ἄγειν to draw a line of wall, Lat. ducere, Thuc.:— Pass., ἦκται ἡ διῶρυξ Hdt.; κόλπου ἀγομένου a bay being formed, Hdt.
to keep in memory, καί μευ κλέος ἦγον Ἀχαιοί Od.
like agere, to hold, celebrate, ἑορτήν, τὰ Ὀλύμπια Hdt., etc.
also to hold, keep, observe, σπονδὰς ἄγ. πρός τινας Thuc.; εἰρήνην Plat.: often c. acc., as periphrasis for a Verb, σχολὴν ἄγειν σχολάζειν, Eur.; ἡσυχίαν ἄγ. ἡσυχάζειν, Xen.
to keep, maintain, ἐλευθέραν ἦγε τὴν Ἑλλάδα Dem.
of Time, to pass, ποίας ἡμέρας δοκεῖς μʼ ἄγειν; Soph.

like ἡγέομαι, Lat. ducere, to hold, account, reckon, ἐν τιμῇ ἄγειν, ἐν οὐδεμιῇ μοίρῃ, περὶ πλείστου ἄγειν Hdt.; θεοὺς ἄγειν to believe in gods, Aesch.; τιμιώτερον ἀγ. τινά Thuc.: —so with Adverbs, δυσφόρως ἄγ. to think insufferable, Soph.; ἐντίμως ἄγειν Plat.
to weigh so much, ἄγειν μνᾶν, τριακοσίους δαρεικούς to weigh a mina, 300 darics, Dem., where the acc. is the weight which the thing weighs or draws down: cf. ἕλκω.
on ἄγε, ἄγετε, v. sub vocc.
Mid. ἄγομαι, to carry away for oneself, take with one, χρυσόν τε καὶ ἄργυρον οἴκαδʼ ἄγεσθαι Od.

ἄγεσθαι γυναῖκα, Lat. uxorem ducere, to take to oneself a wife, Od.; in full, ἄγ. γυναῖκα ἐς τὰ οἰκία Hdt.; and simply ἄγεσθαι, to marry, Il., etc.;—also of the father, to bring home a wife for his son, Od.
διὰ στόμα ἄγεσθαι μῦθον to let pass through the mouth, i. e. to utter, Il.
ἄγεσθαί τι ἐς χεῖρας to take a thing into oneʼs hands, and so to undertake, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀδαημονία
div1.sense: ignorance or unskilfulness in doing, c. inf., Od.

div1.head: ἀδαήμων
div1.sense: unknowing, ignorant of a thing, c. gen., Il.; κακῶν ἀδαήμονες Od.

div1.head: ἀδαής
div1.sense: = ἀδαήμων, c. gen. pers., Hdt.; c.gen. rei, Hdt.; c. inf. unknowing how to do, Soph.: absol., Xen.

div1.head: ἀδάητος
div1.sense: unknown, Hes.

div1.head: ἄδαιτος
div1.sense: of which none might eat, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀδακρυτί
div1.sense: without tears, Isocr., Plut.

div1.head: ἀδάκρυτος
div1.sense: without tears, i. e.
act. tearless, ἀδ. καὶ ἀπήμων Il.; ἀδακρύτω ἔχεν ὄσσε Od.: —εὐνάζειν ἀδακρύτων βλεφάρων πόθον to lull the desire of her eyes so that they weep no more, Soph.; cf. ἄδερκτος,
pass. unwept, unmourned, Soph.
costing no tears, τρόπαια Plut.

div1.head: ἀδαμάντινος
div1.sense: adamantine, Aesch., etc.: —metaph. hard as adamant, σιδηροῖς καὶ ἀδαμαντίνοις λόγοις Plat.; οὐκ ἀδ. ἐντί, of a girl, Theocr.:—adv. -νως, Plat.

div1.head: ἀδαμαντόδετος
div1.sense: iron-bound, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀδάμας
div1.sense: properly the untamed, unconquerable:
as Subst. adamant, i. e. the hardest metal, prob. steel: metaph. of any thing unalterable, ἔπος ἐρέω ἀδάμαντι πελάσσας having fixed it firm as adamant, Orac. ap. Hdt.
the diamond, Theophr.
as adj., metaph., the inflexible, of Hades, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀδάμαστος
div1.sense: epith. of Hades, inflexible, Il.:—later in the proper sense, untamed, unbroken, ἵππος Xen.

div1.head: ἀδάματος
div1.sense: unconquered, Aesch., etc.; of females, unwedded, Soph.: of beasts, untamed, v. sub πέσημα. [ᾱδαματω in Theocr.]

div1.head: ἀδάπανος
div1.sense: without expense, costing nothing, γλυκέα κἀδάπανα (crasis for καὶ ἀδάπανα) Ar.:— adv., ἀδαπάνως τέρψαι φρένα Eur.

div1.head: ἄδαστος
div1.sense: undivided, Soph.

div1.head: ἀδεής
div1.sense: without fear, fearless, εἴ περ ἀδειής τʼ ἐστί, of Hector, Il.; κύον ἀδδεές Il.
fearless, secure (v. ἀλεής), τὸ ἀδεές, security, Thuc.; ἀδεὴς θανάτου without fear of death, Plat.; ἀδεὲς δέος δεδιέναι to fear where no fear is, Plat.
causing no fear, not formidable, πρὸς ἐχθρούς Thuc.
adv. ἀδεῶς, without fear, confidently, Hdt., etc.
without stint, freely, Thuc.

div1.head: ἄδεια
div1.sense: freedom from fear, ἀδείην διδόναι to grant an amnesty, indemnity, Hdt.; ἐν ἀδείῃ εἶναι Hdt.; τῶν σωμάτων ἄδειαν ποιεῖν Thuc.; ἄδειάν τινι παρασκευάζειν, παρέχειν Dem.; opp. to ἄδειαν λαμβάνειν to receive indemnity, Dem.; ἀδείας τυγχάνειν Dem.

div1.head: ἀδείμαντος
div1.sense: fearless, dauntless, Pind., etc.:—adv. -τως, Aesch.
where no fear is, οἰκία Luc.

div1.head: ἄδειπνος
div1.sense: supperless, Xen., etc.

div1.head: ἀδέκαστος
div1.sense: unbribed, Arist.:—comp. adv. -ότερον Luc.

div1.head: ἀδεκάτευτος
div1.sense: not tithed, tithe-free, Ar.

div1.head: ἀδελφή
div1.sense: fem. of ἀδελφός, a sister, Trag., etc.
a sister (as a fellow Christian), NTest.

div1.head: ἀδελφιδέος
div1.sense: a brotherʼs or sisterʼs son, a nephew, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀδελφιδῆ
div1.sense: a brotherʼs or sisterʼs daughter, a niece, Ar., etc.

div1.head: ἀδελφοκτόνος
div1.sense: murdering a brother or sister, Hdt. (in Ionic form ἀδελφεοκτ-) , Plut.

div1.head: ἀδελφός
div1.sense: ἀδελφοί are properly sons of the same mother:

as Subst., ἀδελφός, ὁ, voc. ἄδελφε (not -φέ), Ionic ἀδελφεός, Epic -ειός:—a brother, or generally, a near kinsman, ἀδελφοί brother and sister, like Lat. fratres, Eur.; ἀδελφεοὶ ἀπʼ ἀμφοτέρων brothers by both parents, i. e. not half-brothers, Hdt.
a brother (as a fellow Christian), NTest.
adj., ἀδελφός, ή, όν, brotherly or sisterly, Trag., Plat.
like Lat. geminus, gemellus, of anything in pairs, twin, Xen.:—then, just like, c. gen. or dat., ἀδελφὰ τῶνδε, ἀδελφὰ τούτοισι Soph.

div1.head: ἀδελφότης
div1.sense: the brotherhood, NTest.

div1.head: ἀδέξιος
div1.sense: left-handed, awkward, Luc.

div1.head: ἀδερκής
div1.sense: unseen, invisible, Anth.

div1.head: ἄδερκτος
div1.sense: not seeing, ἀδέρκτων ὀμμάτων τητώμενος reft of thine eyes so that they see not, Soph.; adv. -τως, without looking, Soph.

div1.head: ἄδεσμος
div1.sense: unfettered, unbound, ἄδ. φυλακή, Lat. libera custodia, our "parole," Thuc., etc.; δεσμὸς ἄδεσμος bond that is no bond, of a wreath, Eur.

div1.head: ἀδέσποτος
div1.sense: without master, Plat., etc.

div1.head: ἄδετος
div1.sense: unbound, free, Dem.

div1.head: ἀδευκής
div1.sense: a word used by Hom. only in Od. as epith. of ὄλεθρος, πότμος, φῆμις, commonly expl. not sweet, bitter, cruel (from an old word δευκής sweet); but more prob. it means unexpected, sudden (from δοκ-έω).

div1.head: ἀδέψητος
div1.sense: untanned, of a raw hide, Od.

div1.head: ἀδέω
div1.etym: only found in two Homeric forms, aor1 opt. and perf. part.
div1.sense: to be sated, μὴ ξεῖνος δείπνῳ ἀδήσειε lest he should be sated with the repast, feel loathing at it; καμάτῳ ἀδηκότες ἠδὲ καὶ ὕπνῳ sated with toil and sleep.

div1.head: ἀδήϊος
div1.sense: unassailed, unravaged, Soph.

div1.head: ἄδηκτος
div1.sense: unbitten, not gnawed or worm eaten , Hes.; adv. ἀδήκτως, Plut.

div1.head: ἀδηλέω
div1.sense: to be in the dark about a thing, Soph.

div1.head: ἀδηλία
div1.sense: uncertainty, Anth.

div1.head: ἄδηλος
div1.sense: not seen or known, unknown, obscure, Hes., Soph., Plat.
of things, ἄδ. θάνατοι death by an unknown hand, Soph.; ἄδ. ἔχθρα secret enmity, Thuc.; ῥεῖ πᾶν ἄδηλον melts all to nothing, Soph.; ἄδ. τινι unseen, unobserved by him, Xen.
neut. ἄδηλόν ἐστι εἰ . . , ὅτι . . , it is uncertain whether . . , unknown that . . , Plat., etc.; so, ἄδηλον μή . . , Plat.:— absol., ἄδηλον ὄν it being uncertain, Thuc.; so, ἐν ἀδηλοτέρῳ εἶναι Xen.
ἄδηλος often agrees with the subject (like δίκαιός εἰμι), παῖδες ἄδηλοι ὁποτέρων ἄδηλόν ἐστιν ὁποτέρων παῖδες εἰσίν Lys., etc.
adv. -λως, secretly, Thuc., etc.; Sup. -ότατα, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀδημονέω
div1.sense: to be sorely troubled, Plat.; ἀδημονῆσαι τὰς ψυχάς Xen.

div1.head: ἀδημονία
div1.sense: trouble, distress, Anth., Plut.

div1.head: ἅδην
div1.etym: α short, except in first place cited from Il., where it is commonly written ἄδδην.
div1.sense: adv., Lat. satis, to oneʼs fill, ἔδμεναι ἄδην to eat their fill, Il.

c. gen., οἵ μιν ἄδην ἐλόωσι πολέμοιο who may drive him to satiety of war, Il.; ἅδην ἔλειξεν αἵματος licked his fill of blood, Aesch.; καὶ τούτων μὲν ἅδην enough of this, Plat.; c. part., ἄδην εἶχον κτείνοντες Hdt.

div1.head: ἄδηρις
div1.sense: without strife, Anth.

div1.head: ἀδήριτος
div1.sense: without strife or battle, Il.
unconquerable, ἀνάγκης σθένος Aesch.

div1.head: ᾍδης
div1.etym: αιδης in Hom., Attic ᾱδης; but in Trag. also ᾱιδας:— gen. αιδεω as an anapaest in Hom.; gen. αιδᾱο Hom.; gen. ᾱιδος before a vowel, Il.
div1.sense: Hades or Pluto (cf. Πλούτων), the god of the nether world, son of Kronus and Rhea, brother to Zeus, Ζεὺς καὶ ἐγώ, τρίτατος δʼ Ἄιδης Il.; called Ζεὺς καταχθόνιος Il.; εἰν or εἰς Ἀΐδαο (sc. δόμοις, δόμους) in, into the nether world, Hom.; εἰν Ἄϊδος Il.; ἐν Ἅιδου, ἐς Ἅιδου (sc. οἴκῳ, οἶκον) Attic:— also Ἄϊδόσδε adv., Il.
as appellative,Hades, the world below, εἰσόκεν ἄϊδι κεύθωμαι Il.; ἐπὶ τὸν ᾅδην Luc.; εἰς ἀΐδην Anth.; ἐν τῷ ᾅδῃ NTest.
the grave, death, ᾅδης πόντιος death by sea, Aesch., etc.

div1.head: ἀδηφάγος
div1.sense: eating oneʼs fill, gluttonous, ἀδ. ἀνήρ, of an athlete, Theocr.; τὴν ἀδ. νόσον this devouring sore, Soph.

div1.head: ἀδῄωτος
div1.sense: not ravaged, Xen.

div1.head: ἀδιάβατος
div1.sense: not to be passed, ποταμός, νάπος Xen.

div1.head: ἀδιάβλητος
div1.sense: not listening to slander, Plut.

div1.head: ἀδιάθετος
div1.sense: intestate, Plut.

div1.head: ἀδιάκριτος
div1.sense: undecided, Luc.

div1.head: ἀδιάλειπτος
div1.sense: unintermitting, incessant, NTest.; adv. -τως, Polyb., NTest.

div1.head: ἀδιάλυτος
div1.sense: undissolved, indissoluble, Plat.

div1.head: ἀδίαντος
div1.sense: unwetted, Simon.
ἀδίαντον, τό, a plant, maiden-hair, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀδίαυλος
div1.sense: with no way back, of Hades, Eur.

div1.head: ἀδιαφθορία
div1.sense: incorruption, uprightness, NTest.

div1.head: ἀδιάφθορος
div1.sense: uncorrupted, Plat., etc.:— adv. -ρως, Aeschin.
of judges and witnesses, incorruptible, Plat., etc.: Sup. adv. -ώτατα, Plat.
imperishable, Plat.

div1.head: ἀδίδακτος
div1.sense: untaught, ignorant, c. gen., ἀδ. ἐρώτων Anth.
untrained, of a chorus, Dem.
of things, untaught, Plut., Luc.

div1.head: ἀδιέξοδος
div1.sense: act., unable to get out, Anth.

div1.head: ἀδιερεύνητος
div1.sense: unquestioned, Plut.

div1.head: ἀδιήγητος
div1.sense: indescribable, Xen., Dem.

div1.head: ἀδίκαστος
div1.sense: undecided, Luc.

div1.head: ἀδικέω
div1.sense: to do wrong, Hdt., etc.; τἀδικεῖν wrong-doing, Soph.; τὸ μἀδικεῖν righteous dealing, Aesch.; but, σχήσει τὸ μἀδικεῖν will restrain wrong-doing, Aesch.:—in legal phrase the particular case of wrong is added in part., Σωκράτης ἀδικεῖ διδάσκων Plat., Xen.:—c. acc. cogn., ἀδικίαν, ἀδίκημα, Plat., or a neut. adj., ἀδικεῖν πολλά, μέγαλα, Plat.; οὐδέν, μηδὲν ἀδ., Plat.:—also, ἀδ. περὶ τὰ μυστήρια Dem.

trans. c. acc. pers. to do one wrong, to wrong, injure, Hdt., etc.:—c. dupl. acc. to wrong one in a thing, Ar., etc.; τὰ μέγιστα ἀδ. τινά Dem.; ἀδ. τινὰ περί τινος Plat.:—Pass. to be wronged, μὴ δῆτʼ ἀδικηθῶ Soph.; ἀδικεῖσθαι εἴς τι Eur.
to spoil, damage, ἀδ. γῆν Thuc.

div1.head: ἀδίκημα
div1.sense: a wrong done, a wrong, Lat. injuria, Hdt., etc.:—c. gen. a wrong done to one, Dem.
that which is got by wrong, ill-gotten goods, Plat.

div1.head: ἀδικητέον
div1.sense: one must do wrong, Plat.

div1.head: ἀδικία
div1.sense: wrong-doing, injustice, Hdt., etc.
like ἀδίκημα, a wrong, injury, Hdt., Plat.

div1.head: ἀδίκιον
div1.sense: a wrong, wrong-dealing, Hdt.
ἀδικίου γραφή, an action against public wrong-doers, Plut.

div1.head: ἄδικος
div1.sense: of persons, wrong-doing, unrighteous, unjust, Hes., Hdt., etc.; ἀδικώτατος Soph.:— ἄδ. εἴς τι unjust in a thing, ἔς τινα towards a person, Hdt.; περί τινα Xen.; c. inf. so unjust as to . . NTest.
ἄδ. ἵπποι obstinate, unmanageable, Xen.
of things, wrongly done, wrong, unjust, ἔργματα Theogn., Hdt., etc.; τὸ δίκαιον καὶ τὸ ἄδ., τὰ δίκαια καὶ ἄδικα right and wrong, Plat.
adv. -κως, Solon, etc.; τοὺς ἀδ. θνήσκοντας Soph.; εἴτε δικαίως εἴτε ἀδ. jure an injuria, Hdt.; οὐκ ἀδ. not without reason, Plat.

div1.head: ἀδινός
div1.sense: close-packed: (v. ἁδρός):— hence,
crowded, thronging, of bees, flies, sheep, Hom.; ἀδινὰ δάκρυα thick-falling tears, Soph.

vehement, loud, of sounds, Il.; Σειρῆνες ἀδιναί the loud-voiced Sirens, Od.:—adv. -νῶς, frequently, or loudly, vehemently, Il.; so ἀδινόν and ἀδινά as adv., ἀδινὸν κλαίειν, μυκᾶσθαι, στοναχῆσαι Hom.: comp. ἀδινώτερον Od.

div1.head: ἀδιόρθωτος
div1.sense: not corrected, not set right, Dem.:—of books, unrevised, Cic.

div1.head: ἀδίστακτος
div1.sense: not doubted; adv. -τως, Anth.

div1.head: ἄδιψος
div1.sense: not suffering from thirst, Eur., etc.

div1.head: ἀδμής
div1.sense: untamed, of cattle, Od.
of maidens, unwedded, Od.

div1.head: ἄδμητος
div1.sense: in Hom. only in fem. and of cattle, unbroken, βοῦν ἀδμήτην, ἢν οὔ πω ὑπὸ ζυγὸν ἤγαγεν ἀνήρ Il.; ἵππον ἑξέτεʼ ἀδμήτην Il.
like ἀδμής, unwedded, of maidens, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἀδόκητος
div1.sense: unexpected, Hes., Soph., etc.; τὸ ἀδ. the unexpectedness, Thuc.
adv. -τως, Thuc.; so ἀδόκητα as adv., Eur.; ἀπὸ τοῦ ἀδοκήτου Thuc.

div1.head: ἀδοκίμαστος
div1.sense: untried, unproved, in regard to civic rights, Lys., etc.

div1.head: ἀδόκιμος
div1.sense: not standing the test, spurious, properly of coin, Plat.
metaph. of persons, rejected as false, disreputable, reprobate, Eur., Xen., etc.

div1.head: ἀδολεσχέω
div1.sense: to talk idly, prate, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: ἀδολέσχης
div1.etym: Prob. from ἄδην, λέσχη, talking to satiety.
div1.sense: a garrulous fellow, idle talker, Ar., Plat.

div1.head: ἀδολεσχία
div1.sense: garrulity, idle talk, Ar., Plat., etc.; Theophr. wrote περὶ ἀδολεσχίας.

div1.head: ἄδολος
div1.sense: without fraud, guileless, of treaties, σπονδαὶ ἄδ. καὶ ἀβλαβεῖς Thuc.:—adv., often in the phrase ἀδόλως καὶ δικαίως, Lat. sine dolo malo, Thuc.
of liquids, unadulterated, genuine, Aesch.; metaph. guileless, pure, Eur.

div1.head: ἀδόνητος
div1.sense: unshaken, Anth.

div1.head: ἀδόξαστος
div1.sense: not matter of opinion, i. e. certain, Plat.

div1.head: ἀδοξέω
div1.sense: to be held in no esteem, to stand in ill repute, Eur., Dem.
trans. to hold in no esteem, τινα Plut.

div1.head: ἀδοξία
div1.sense: ill-repute, disgrace, Thuc., Plat.; obscurity, Plut.

div1.head: ἄδοξος
div1.sense: inglorious, disreputable, Xen., Dem.: —of persons, obscure, ignoble, Xen., etc.:—adv. -ξως, Plut.

div1.head: ἅδος
div1.sense: satiety, loathing, Il.

div1.head: ἄδοτος
div1.sense: without gifts, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἄδουλος
div1.sense: unattended by slaves, Eur.

div1.head: ἀδούπητος
div1.sense: noiseless, Anth.

div1.head: ἀδρανής
div1.sense: inactive, powerless, Babr., Anth.
intractable, of iron, Plut.

div1.head: Ἀδράστεια
div1.etym: Perhaps from a_privat, διδράσκω a name of Nemesis.
div1.sense: Aesch., the Inevitable.

div1.head: ἄδραστος
div1.sense: not running away, not inclined to do so, of slaves, Hdt.

div1.head: Ἀδριακός
div1.sense: from the Adriatic; Ἀδριᾱκός ἀμφιφορεύς, i. e. a cask of Italian wine, Anth.

div1.head: Ἀδριανός
div1.sense: Adriatic, Eur.

div1.head: Ἀδρίας
div1.sense: the Adriatic, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἁδρόομαι
div1.sense: to come to oneʼs strength, Plat.

div1.head: ἁδρός
div1.sense: in the primary sense it seems to mean thick: (akin to ἀδ-ινός, as κυδρός to κυδνός):
of things, χιόνα ἁδρὴν πίπτουσαν falling thick, Hdt.:— strong, great in any way, ἁδρὸς πόλεμος Ar.
of persons, large, fine, well-grown, Hdt., Plat.; of animals, Xen., Babr.; of fruit or corn, full-grown, ripe, Hdt.

div1.head: ἁδροσύνη
div1.sense: = ἁδροτής, of ears of corn, Hes.

div1.head: ἁδροτής
div1.sense: strength, Il.
abundance, NTest.

div1.head: ἀδρυάς
div1.etym: = Ἁμαδρυάς, a kind of nymph, Hamadryad, Anth.

div1.head: ἁδρύνω
div1.sense: to make ripe, ripen, Xen.
Pass. to grow ripe, ripen, of fruit or corn, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἀδυναμία
div1.sense: want of strength or power, inability, incapacity, Hdt., etc.; c. gen., ἀδ. τοῦ ἀδικεῖν for wrong-doing, Plat.
poverty, Xen., Dem., etc.

div1.head: ἀδυνασία
div1.sense: Hdt., etc.; c. gen., ἀδ. τοῦ λέγειν Thuc.

div1.head: ἀδυνατέω
div1.sense: of persons, to want strength, Plat., etc.; c. inf. to be unable to do, Xen.
of things, to be impossible, NTest.

div1.head: ἀδύνατος
div1.sense: of persons, unable to do a thing, c. inf., Hdt., Eur., etc.

absol. without strength, powerless, Hdt., Eur., etc.; οἱ ἀδύνατοι men disabled for service, incapable, Aeschin., etc.; ἀδύνατος χρήμασι poor, Thuc.; εἴς τι Plat.:—of ships, disabled, Hdt.:— τὸ ἀδ. want of strength, Plat.; τὰ ἀδ. disabilities, Dem.
of things, that cannot be done, impossible, Eur., Plat., etc.; ἀδύνατόν or ἀδύνατά ἐστι, it is impossible, Hdt., etc.: τὸ ἀδ. impossibility, Hdt.; τολμᾶν ἀδύνατα, ἀδυνάτων ἐρᾶν Eur.

div1.head: ἄδυτον
div1.sense: the innermost sanctuary, Il., etc.

div1.head: ἄδυτος
div1.sense: not to be entered, Il., etc.

div1.head: ἀδωνιάζω
div1.sense: Ἀδωνιάζουσαι, αἱ, those who keep the Adonia, the title of the 15th Id. of Theocr.

div1.head: Ἀδώνια
div1.sense: the mourning for Adonis, celebrated yearly by Greek matrons:

div1.head: Ἄδωνις
div1.sense: Adonis, favourite of Aphrodite, Sapph.; ὥδωνις, crasis for ὁ Ἄδ., Theocr.:—generally, an Adonis, a darling, Luc.
Ἀδώνιδος κῆποι, quick-growing herbs grown in pots for the Adonia, Plat.

div1.head: ἀδωροδόκητος
div1.sense: Aeschin.: adv. -τως, Dem.

div1.head: ἀδωροδόκος
div1.sense: incorruptible, Anth.

div1.head: ἄδωρος
div1.sense: without gifts, taking none, incorruptible, c. gen., ἀδωρότατος χρημάτων Thuc.
giving no gifts, ἀδώροις ἐλαφηβολίαις by hunting from which no gifts were offered, Soph.
ἄδωρα δῶρα gifts that are no gifts, like βίος ἀβίωτος, Soph.

div1.head: ἀδώτης
div1.sense: one who gives nothing, Hes.

div1.head: ἀείβολος
div1.sense: continually thrown, Anth.

div1.head: ἀειγενέτης
div1.sense: epith. of the gods, like αἰὲν ἐόντες, everlasting, immortal, θεῶν αἰειγενετάων, θεοῖς αἰειγενέτῃσιν Il.

div1.head: ἀειγενής
div1.sense: everlasting, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: ἀειδής
div1.sense: without form, incorporeal, Plat.

div1.head: ἀειδίνητος
div1.sense: ever-revolving, Anth.

div1.head: ἀείδω
div1.etym: compare the morphological problems with ἀείρω
div1.sense: to sing, Il., etc.:—then of any sound, to twang, of the bowstring, Od.; to whistle, of the wind, Mosch.; to ring, of a stone struck, Theocr.
trans.,
c. acc. rei, to sing, chant, μῆνιν, παιήονα, κλέα ἀνδρῶν Hom.:—absol., ἀείδειν ἀμφί τινος to sing in oneʼs praise, Od.:—Pass., of songs, to be sung, Hdt.; ᾆσμα καλῶς ᾀσθέν Xen.
c. acc. pers. to sing, praise, Attic

div1.head: ἀειζώων
div1.sense: ever-living, φύτλη Anth.

div1.head: ἀειθαλής
div1.sense: ever-green, Anth.

div1.head: ἀεικής
div1.sense: unseemly, shameful, ἀεικέα λοιγὸν ἀμύνειν Il.; ἀεικέα εἵματα Od.; δεσμὸς ἀεικής Aesch.; στολή Soph.; ἀεικέστερα ἔπεα Hdt.; οὐδὲν ἀεικὲς παρέχεσθαι to cause no inconvenience, Hdt.:—adv. ἀεικῶς; Ionic -έως, Simon.; ἀεικές as adv., Od.
unseemly, shabby, μισθός, ἄποινα Il.
οὐδὲν ἀεικές ἐστι, c. inf., it is nothing strange that . . , Hdt., Aesch. Cf. Attic αἰκής.

div1.head: ἀεικία
div1.sense: unseemly treatment, outrage, Hom., Hdt.:—Cf. Attic αἰκία.

div1.head: ἀεικίζω
div1.sense: to treat unseemly, injure, abuse, Hom.; οὐ γὰρ ἐγώ σʼ ἔκπαγλον ἀεικιῶ I will do thee no great dishonour, Il.:—Mid. in act. sense, Hom.

div1.head: ἀειλογία
div1.sense: a continual talking:— as Attic law-term, τὴν ἀ. προτείνεσθαι or παρέχειν to court continual inquiry into oneʼs conduct, Dem.

div1.head: ἀείμνηστος
div1.sense: ever to be remembered, Trag., Thuc. adv. -τως, Aeschin.

div1.head: ἀείνηστις
div1.sense: ever-fasting, Anth.

div1.head: ἀειπάρθενος
div1.sense: ever a virgin, Sapph.

div1.head: ἀεί
div1.etym: The Root is !αεϝ ; cf. Lat. aevum, aetas, i. e. aeuitas.
div1.sense: always, for ever, Hom., etc.; often with other words of time, διαμπερὲς αἰεί, συνεχὲς αἰεί, ἐμμενὲς αἰεί, Hom.; ἀεὶ καθʼ ἡμέραν, καθʼ ἡμέραν ἀεί, ἀεὶ καὶ καθʼ ἡμέραν, ἀεὶ κατʼ ἐνιαυτόν, ἀεὶ διὰ βίου, etc., Plat., etc.; v. εἰσαεί:—ὁ ἀεὶ χρόνος eternity, Hdt., Plat.; οἱ ἀεὶ ὄντες the immortals, Xen., etc.:—but, ὁ αἰεὶ βασιλεύων the king for the time being, Hdt.; τοῖσι τούτων αἰεὶ ἐκγόνοισι to their descendants for ever, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀείρυτος
div1.sense: ever-flowing, κρήνη Soph.

div1.head: ἀείρω
div1.etym: ἀ_ρῶ contr. as if from ἀερῶ, which is not in use. Compare the morphological problems of ἀείδω.
div1.sense: to lift, heave, raise up, Hom., etc.; ἱστία στεῖλαν ἀείραντες furled the sails by brailing them up, Od.:—esp. to lift for the purpose of carrying, to bear away, carry, Il.; ἄχθος ἀείρειν, of ships of burden, Od.; μή μοι οἶνον ἄειρε offer me not wine, Il.
to raise, levy, λεκτὸν ἀροῦμεν στόλον Aesch.
Mid. to lift up for oneself, i. e. bear off, c. acc. rei, Il.
to raise or stir up, ἀείρασθαι πόλεμον to undertake a long war, Hdt.; βαρὺς ἀείρεσθαι slow to undertake, Hdt.
ἀείρασθαι τὰ ἱστία to hoist sail, with or without ἱστία, Hdt.
Pass. to be lifted or carried up, Od.; ἀείρεσθαι εἰς . . to rise up and go to a place, Hdt.;—mostly of seamen, but also of land-journeys, Od.
to be suspended, πὰρ κουλεὸν αἰὲν ἄωρτο the dagger] hung always by the sword-sheath, Il.
metaph. to be lifted up, excited, Soph.

div1.head: ἄεισμα
div1.sense: poet. and Ionic for ᾆσμα, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἀειφλεγής
div1.sense: ever-burning, Anth.

div1.head: ἀείφρουρος
div1.sense: ever-watching, i. e. ever-lasting, οἴκησις ἀείφρ., of the grave, Soph.

div1.head: ἀειφυγία
div1.sense: perpetual exile, Plat.

div1.head: ἀειχρόνιος
div1.sense: everlasting, Anth.

div1.head: ἀεκαζόμενος
div1.sense: particip. form = ἀέκων,against oneʼs will, unwilling Od.; πόλλʼ ἀεκαζόμενος, Virgilʼs multa reluctans, Od.

div1.head: ἀέκητι
div1.sense: against oneʼs will, Hom.; c. gen., σεῦ ἀέκητι, ἀέκητι σέθεν, Lat. te invito, and θεῶν ἀέκητι, ἀέκητι θεῶν, Hom.

div1.head: ἀεκούσιος
div1.sense: against oneʼs will, involuntary, of acts, Hdt., etc.
of persons, only in adv. ἀκουσίως, involuntarily, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀέκων
div1.sense: against oneʼs will, unwilling, of persons, ἀέκοντος ἐμεῖο Il.; πόλλʼ ἀέκων, Virgilʼs multa reluctans, Il.; ἄκοντος Διός, invito Jove, Aesch., Xen.:—adv. ἀκόντως, unwillingly, Plat.
like ἀκούσιος, of acts, involuntary, ἔργα Soph.

div1.head: ἀελλαῖος
div1.sense: storm-swift, πελειάς Soph.

div1.head: ἄελλα
div1.sense: a stormy wind, whirlwind, eddy, Hom.; ἄελλαι ἀνέμων Hom.
metaph. of any whirling motion, ὠκυδρόμοις ἀέλλαις, of an animal, Eur.; ἄστρων ὑπʼ ἀέλλαισι Eur.

div1.head: ἀελλής
div1.sense: eddying, Il.

div1.head: ἀελλομάχος
div1.sense: struggling with the storm, Anth.

div1.head: ἀελλόπος
div1.etym: poetic for ἀελλόπους, compare ἀρτίπος, Οἰδίπος
div1.sense: storm-footed, storm-swift, Il., etc.

div1.head: Ἀελλώ
div1.sense: storm, a Harpy, Hes.

div1.head: ἀελπτέω
div1.sense: to have no hope, only in part., ἀελπτέοντες σόον εἶναι Il.; ἀ. ὑπερβαλέεσθαι Hdt.

div1.head: ἀελπής
div1.sense: unhoped for, unexpected, Od.

div1.head: ἀελπτία
div1.sense: an unlooked for event, ἐξ ἀελπτίης unexpectedly, Archil.

div1.head: ἄελπτος
div1.sense: = ἀελπτής, Hhymn.; ἐξ ἀέλπτου unexpectedly, Hdt.; so, ἐξ ἀέλπτων Soph.
beyond hope, despaired of, Solon.
act. hopeless, desperate, Hhymn., Aesch.
adv. -τως, beyond all hope, Lat. insperato, Aesch.:—neut. pl. as adv., Eur.

div1.head: ἀέναος
div1.sense: ever-flowing, Hes., Hdt., Trag.
generally, everlasting, ἀρετᾶς ἀέναον κλέος Simon.;—rare in Attic Prose, Xen., Plat.

div1.head: ἀεξίφυλλος
div1.sense: nourishing leaves, leafy, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀεξίφυτος
div1.sense: nourishing plants, Ἠώς Anth.

div1.head: ἀέξω
div1.etym: poetic form of αὔξω, compare αὐξάνω
div1.sense: to increase, enlarge, foster, strengthen, μένος μέγα θυμὸς ἀέξει Il.; θυμὸν ἀέξειν Il.; πένθος ἀ. to cherish woe, Od.; υἱὸν ἀ. to rear him to manʼs estate, Od.; ἔργον ἀέξουσι θεοί they bless the work, Od.
to exalt by oneʼs deeds, to magnify, τὸ πλῆθος ἀέξειν Hdt.; to magnify, exaggerate, [ἀγγελίαν μῦθος ἀέξει Soph.

Pass. to increase, grow, ἀέξετο he was waxing tall, Od.; οὐ ποτʼ ἀέξετο κῦμα no wave rose high, Od.; χόλος ἐν στήθεσσιν ἀέξεται rises high, Il.; τόδε ἔργον ἀ. it prospers, Od.; ἀέξετο ἱερὸν ἦμαρ was getting on to noon, Il.; so, κέρδος ἀέξεται Aesch.

div1.head: ἀεργία
div1.sense: a not working, idleness, Od., Hes.:—Cf. Attic ἀργία.

div1.head: ἀεργός
div1.sense: not-working, idle, Hom., Hes., etc.;— ἀεργοὶ δόμοι idle houses, i. e. where people are idle, Theocr.—Cf. Attic ἀργός.

div1.head: ἀέρδην
div1.sense: lifting up, Aesch.—Cf. Attic ἄρδην.

div1.head: ἀέριος
div1.sense: in the mist or thick air of morning, Eur.
in the air, high in air, Eur.

div1.head: ἀεροβατέω
div1.sense: to walk the air, Ar., Plat.

div1.head: ἀεροβάτης
div1.sense: one who walks the air, Plut.

div1.head: ἀεροδινής
div1.sense: wheeling in air, Anth.

div1.head: ἀεροδόνητος
div1.sense: air-tossed, soaring, Ar.

div1.head: ἀεροδρομέω
div1.sense: to traverse the air, Luc.

div1.head: ἀεροκόραξ
div1.sense: an air-raven, Luc.

div1.head: ἀεροκώνωψ
div1.sense: an air-gnat, Luc.

div1.head: ἀερομαχία
div1.sense: an air-battle, Luc.

div1.head: ἀερομετρέω
div1.sense: to measure the air: to lose oneself in vague speculation, Xen.

div1.head: ἀερονηχής
div1.sense: floating in air, of clouds, Ar.

div1.head: ἀερόφοιτος
div1.sense: roaming in air, Aesch. ap. Ar.

div1.head: ἀερσιπότης
div1.sense: high-soaring, Hes., Anth.

div1.head: ἀερσίπους
div1.sense: lifting the feet, brisk-trotting, ἵπποι Il.

div1.head: ἀερτάζω
div1.etym: ἀερτάζω is a lengthd. Epic form of ἀείρω.
div1.sense: to lift up:— imperf. ἠέρταζον, Anth.

div1.head: ἄεσα
div1.etym: from a form ἀέω, not in use. Akin to ἄημι, ἄω, ἰαύω.
div1.sense: to sleep, Od.

div1.head: ἀεσιφροσύνη
div1.sense: silliness, folly, Od., Hes.

div1.head: ἀεσίφρων
div1.sense: damaged in mind, witless, silly, Hom., Hes.

div1.head: ἀετός
div1.sense: an eagle, Hom., etc.:—proverb., ἀετὸς ἐν νεφέλαισι, of a thing quite out of reach, Ar.
an eagle as a standard, of the Persians, Xen.; of the Romans, Plut.
in architecture, the pediment of a temple, Ar.

div1.head: ἀετοφόρος
div1.sense: a standard-bearer, Plut.
