div1.head: ἀετώδης
div1.sense: eagle-like, Luc.

div1.head: ἀζαλέος
div1.sense: dry, parched, Hom.; βῶν ἀζαλέην the dry bullʼs-hide, Il.
metaph. dry, harsh, Anth.
act. parching, scorching, Σείριος Hes.

div1.head: ἀζάνω
div1.sense: to dry, parch up, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἄζα
div1.sense: drought: in Od. an old shield is said to be πεπαλαγμένον ἄζῃ coated with dry dirt or mould.

div1.head: ἀζηλία
div1.sense: freedom from jealousy, Plut.

div1.head: ἄζηλος
div1.sense: not subject to envy, unenviable, dreary, Simon., Aesch., etc.
generally, sorry, inconsiderable, Plut.

div1.head: ἀζηλότυπος
div1.sense: free from jealousy, envy, Plut.

div1.head: ἀζήλωτος
div1.sense: not to be envied, Plat.

div1.head: ἀζήμιος
div1.sense: free from further payment: without loss, scot-free, Lat. immunis, Hdt., etc.:—unpunished, not deserving punishment, Soph., Eur.
act. harmless, of sour looks, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀζηχής
div1.etym: Epic word, perhaps an old dialectic form for ἀδιεχής, a_copulat, διέχω, v. sub ζα-.
div1.sense: unceasing, excessive, Il.; neut. as adv., ἀζηχὲς φαγέμεν καὶ πιέμεν Od.; ὄϊες ἀζ. μεμακυῖαι Il.

div1.head: ἅζομαι
div1.sense: to stand in awe of, dread, esp. the gods and oneʼs parents, Hom.; followed by inf., to shrink from doing, Hom.; also ἅζομαι μὴ . . , Il.
absol. in part. awe-struck, Od., Soph.

div1.head: ἄζυγος
div1.sense: unwedded, κοίτη Luc.

div1.head: ἄζυμος
div1.sense: of bread, unleavened, ἡ ἑορτὴ τῶν ἀζύμων or τὰ ἄζυμα the feast of unleavened bread, NTest.

div1.head: ἄζυξ
div1.sense: unyoked, unpaired, unmarried, Eur.; of Pallas the virgin goddess, Eur.: with a gen. added, ἄζυξ λέκτρων, γάμων, εὐνῆς, Lat. nuptiarum expers, Eur.

div1.head: ἄζω
div1.sense: to dry up, parch, Hes.:—Pass., αἴγειρος ἀζομένη κεῖται the poplar lies drying, Il.

div1.head: ἄζωστος
div1.sense: ungirt, from hurry, Hes.

div1.head: ἀηδής
div1.sense: unpleasant to the taste, distasteful, of food, Plat.
generally, unpleasant, οὐδὲν οἱ ἀηδέστερον ἔσεσθαι Hdt.: in Plat. of talk, ἀηδές or οὐκ ἀηδές ἐστι.
of persons, disagreeable, odious, Plat.
adv. -δῶς, unpleasantly, Plat.; ἀηδῶς ἔχειν τινί to be on bad terms with one, Dem.
without pleasure to oneself, unwillingly, Plat.

div1.head: ἀηδία
div1.sense: unpleasantness, nauseousness, of drugs, Hipp.
of persons, odiousness, Dem., etc.
a being ill-pleased, disgust, dislike, Plat.

div1.head: ἀηδονιδεύς
div1.sense: a young nightingale, Theocr., in Epic pl. ἀηδονιδῆες.

div1.head: ἀηδόνιος
div1.sense: of a nightingale, γόος, νόμος ἀ. the nightingaleʼs dirge, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀηδονίς
div1.sense: a nightingale, Eur., Theocr.; Μουσάων ἀηδονίς, of a poet, Anth.

div1.head: ἀηδών
div1.sense: the songstress, i. e. the nightingale, Hes., etc.; of the daughter of Pandareus, who was changed into a nightingale, Hom.

div1.head: ἀήθεια
div1.sense: unaccustomedness, Batr.; ἀήθ. τινος inexperience of a thing, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀηθέσσω
div1.sense: to be unaccustomed to a thing, c. gen., Il.

div1.head: ἀήθης
div1.sense: unwonted, unusual, Aesch.:—adv. -θως, unexpectedly, Thuc.
of persons, unused to a thing, c. gen., Thuc., Dem.

div1.head: ἄημα
div1.sense: a blast, gale, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: ἄημι
div1.sense: to breathe hard, blow, of winds, Hom.:—Pass. to be beaten by the wind, ὑόμενος καὶ ἀήμενος Od.: metaph., to toss or wave about, as if by the wind, δίχα θυμὸς ἄητο, i. e. was in doubt or fear, Il.

div1.head: ἀήρ
div1.sense: the lower air, the air that surrounds the earth, opp. to αἰθήρ the upper air (v. Il. 14. 288, where a tall pine μακροτάτη πεφυυῖα διʼ ἠέρος αἰθέρʼ ἵκανεν); hence mist, gloom, περὶ δʼ ἠέρα πουλὺν ἔχευεν Il.; ἠέρα μὲν σκέδασε Il.; cf. ἠέριος, ἠεροειδής.
generally, air, Soph., etc.; ἀέρα δέρειν (cf. Virg. verberat auras), NTest.

div1.head: ἄησις
div1.sense: a blowing, Eur.

div1.head: ἀήσσητος
div1.sense: unconquered, Thuc., Dem.
unconquerable, Plat.

div1.head: ἀήσυλος
div1.sense: wicked, Il.

div1.head: ἀήσυρος
div1.sense: light as air, small, little, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀήτης
div1.sense: a blast, gale, Hom., etc.

div1.head: ἄητος
div1.sense: stormy, furious, θάρσος ἄητον Il.

div1.head: ἀθαλάσσωτος
div1.sense: unused to the sea, a land-lubber, Ar.

div1.head: ἀθαλής
div1.sense: not verdant, withered, Plut.

div1.head: ἀθαλπής
div1.sense: without warmth, Anth.

div1.head: ἀθαμβής
div1.sense: fearless, Ibyc., Plut.

div1.head: ἀθανασία
div1.sense: immortality, Plat., etc.

div1.head: ἀθανατίζω
div1.sense: to make immortal, to hold oneself immortal, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀθάνατος
div1.sense: undying, immortal, Hom., etc.:— ἀθάνατοι, οἱ, the Immortals, Hom., etc.; ἀθάναται ἅλιαι, i. e. the sea goddesses, Od.: comp. -ώτερος, Plat.
of immortal fame, Tyrtae.
of things, everlasting, Od., Hdt., etc.
ἀθ. θρίξ the hair on which life depended, Aesch.
οἱ ἀθάνατοι the immortals, a body of Persian troops in which every vacancy was at once filled up, Hdt.
adv., ἀθανάτως εὕδειν Anth.
div1.etym: ᾱθ- always in the adj. and all derivs., v. A α, fin.

div1.head: ἄθαπτος
div1.sense: unburied, Il., etc.
unworthy of burial, Anth.

div1.head: ἀθάρη
div1.sense: groats or meal, porridge, Ar., etc.

div1.head: ἀθαρσής
div1.sense: discouraged, downhearted, Plut.: τὸ ἀθαρσές want of courage, Plut. adv. -σῶς, Plut.

div1.head: ἀθέατος
div1.sense: unseen, invisible, Plut., Luc.
that may not be seen, secret, Plut.
act. not seeing, blind to a thing, c. gen., Xen.

div1.head: ἀθεεί
div1.sense: without the aid of God, οὐκ ἀθεεί, Hor.ʼs non sine Dis, Od.

div1.head: ἀθείαστος
div1.sense: uninspired, Plut.

div1.head: ἄθελκτος
div1.sense: implacable, Aesch.

div1.head: ἄθεμις
div1.sense: lawless, Pind., Eur.

div1.head: ἀθεμίστιος
div1.sense: lawless, godless, ἀθεμίστια εἰδώς versed in wickedness, Od.

div1.head: ἀθέμιστος
div1.sense: lawless, without law or government, of the Cyclopes, Od.; ἀθεμιστότεροι Xen.
of things, lawless, unlawful, ἀθέμιτα ἔργα, ἀθέμιτα ἔρδειν Hdt.; ἀθ. ποιεῖν, εὔχεσθαι Xen.

div1.head: ἄθεος
div1.sense: without God, denying the gods, Plat.
godless, ungodly, Trag.:—comp. -ώτερος Lys.; Sup. -ώτατος Xen.
abandoned of the gods, Soph.
adv. -ως, impiously, Soph.; Sup. -ώτατα, in most unholy wise, Soph.

div1.head: ἀθεότης
div1.sense: ungodliness, Plat.

div1.head: ἀθεράπευτος
div1.sense: uncared for, of animals, Xen.: τὸ ἀθ. neglect of oneʼs appearance, Luc.
unhealed, incurable, Luc.

div1.head: ἀθερίζω
div1.sense: to slight, make light of, Lat. nihil curare, c. acc. pers., Hom.

div1.head: ἀθέρμαντος
div1.sense: not heated by strife or passion, Aesch.

div1.head: ἄθερμος
div1.sense: without heat: τὸ ἄθερμον want of heat, Plat.

div1.head: ἀθέσφατος
div1.sense: beyond even a godʼs power to express: ineffable, aweful, ὄμβρος, θάλασσα, νύξ Hom.; also marvellous in quantity, ἀθ. οἶνος, σῖτος, βόες Od.

div1.head: ἀθετέω
div1.sense: to set aside: ἀθ. τινα to deny one, refuse his request, NTest.

div1.head: ἄθετος
div1.sense: set aside:— adv. -τως, ἀθέσμως, lawlessly, despotically, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀθεώρητος
div1.sense: without observation:— adv. -τως, Plut.

div1.head: ἄθηλυς
div1.sense: unfeminine, Plut.

div1.head: Ἀθήναζε
div1.sense: to Athens, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: Ἀθήναιον
div1.sense: the temple of Athena, Hdt.

div1.head: Ἀθηναῖος
div1.sense: Athenian, of or from Athens, Il., etc

div1.head: Ἀθῆναι
div1.sense: the city of Athens, used in pl., because it consisted of several parts (cf. Θῆβαι, Μυκῆναι, Hom., etc.; the sg. (like Θήβη) Od.

div1.head: Ἀθήνηθεν
div1.sense: from Athens, Lys., etc.; poet. Ἀθήνοθεν Anth.

div1.head: Ἀθήνη
div1.sense: Athena, goddess of wisdom, warlike prowess, and skill in the arts, often called Παλλὰς Ἀθήνη.

div1.head: Ἀθήνησιν
div1.sense: at Athens, Dem.

div1.head: Ἀθηνιάω
div1.sense: to long to be at Athens, Luc.

div1.head: ἀθήρευτος
div1.sense: not hunted, Xen.

div1.head: ἀθηρηλοιγός
div1.sense: consumer of ears of corn, of a winnowing fan, Od.

div1.head: ἄθηρος
div1.sense: without wild beasts or game, Hdt.: τὸ ἄθηρον absence of game, Plut.

div1.head: ἀθήρ
div1.sense: an ear of corn, Hes.
husks, chaff, Luc.
the point of a weapon, Aesch., etc.

div1.head: ἀθιγής
div1.sense: untouched, of a virgin, Anth.

div1.head: ἄθικτος
div1.sense: untouched: c. gen. untouched by a thing, Soph.; κερδῶν ἄθικτον βουλευτήριον untouched by gain, i. e. incorruptible, Aesch.; also c. dat., νόσοις ἄθ. Aesch.
not to be touched, holy, sacred, of Delphi, Soph.; ἄθικτα holy things, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀθλεύω
div1.sense: to contend for a prize, combat, wrestle, Il.; ἀθλεύων πρὸ ἄνακτος struggling or suffering for him, Il.

div1.head: ἀθλέω
div1.sense: Λαομέδοντι ἀθλήσαντες having contended with him, Il.; πολλά περ ἀθλήσαντα having gone through many struggles, Il.: to contend in battle, πρός τινα Hdt.

div1.head: ἄθλημα
div1.sense: a contest, Plat., etc.
an implement of labour, Theocr.

div1.head: ἄθλησις
div1.sense: a contest, struggle, NTest.

div1.head: ἀθλητής
div1.sense: a prizefighter, Lat. athleta: as adj., ἀθλ. ἵππος a race-horse, Lys.
c. gen. rei, practised in a thing, Plat.

div1.head: ἄθλιος
div1.etym: Attic contr. of Epic ἀέθλιος, see also ἄεθλον, ἆθλον
div1.sense: gaining the prize, or running for it (this sense only in Epic form) ἵππος ἀεθλίη a race-horse, Theogn.; μῆλον ἀέθλ. the apple of discord, Anth.

metaph. struggling, wretched, miserable (this sense only in Attic form), of persons Aesch., etc.: comp. -ιώτερος Soph.: Sup. -ιώτατος Eur.:—also of states of life, γάμοι, βίος, τύχη Trag.: —adv. -ίως, miserably, Soph.
in moral sense, pitiful, wretched, Dem.
without any moral sense, wretched, sorry, θηρσὶν ἀθλία βορά Eur.:—adv., ἀθλίως καὶ κακῶς with wretched success, Dem.

div1.head: ἀθλιότης
div1.sense: suffering, wretchedness, Plat., etc.

div1.head: ἀθλοθέτης
div1.sense: one who awards the prize, the judge in the games, Plat., etc.

div1.head: ἆθλον
div1.etym: contr. from Epic and Ionic ἄεθλον
div1.sense: the prize of contest, Hom., etc.; ἄεθλα κεῖται or πρόκειται prizes are proposed, Hdt.; ἆθλα προφαίνειν, προτιθέναι, τιθέναι to propose prizes, Xen.; ἆθλα λαμβάνειν or φέρεσθαι to win prizes, Plat.; ἆθλα πολέμου, τῆς ἀρετῆς Dem.
= ἆθλος, a contest, Od.:—metaph. a conflict, struggle, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: ἆθλος
div1.etym: contr. from Epic and Ionic ἄεθλος
div1.sense: a contest for a prize, Hom., etc.; ἄεθλος πρόκειται a task is set one, Hdt.; ἄεθλον προτιθέναι to set it, Hdt.;—metaph. a conflict, struggle, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀθλοφόρος
div1.sense: bearing away the prize, victorious, ἵππος Il.; in Ionic form ἀεθλ-, Il., Hdt.

div1.head: ἄθολος
div1.sense: not turbid, clear, Luc.

div1.head: ἀθόλωτος
div1.sense: untroubled, of water, Hes.

div1.head: ἀθορύβητος
div1.sense: undisturbed: τὸ ἀθ. tranquillity, Xen.

div1.head: ἀθόρυβος
div1.sense: without uproar, Plat.:—adv. -βως, Eur.

div1.head: ἄθραυστος
div1.sense: unbroken, unhurt, Eur., etc.

div1.head: ἀθρέω
div1.sense: to look at, gaze at, observe, perceive, Hom., etc.
absol., or with a prep., to look, gaze, Il.; δεῦρʼ ἄθρησον Eur.; οὐ γὰρ ἴδοις ἂν ἀθρῶν by observing, Soph.
of the mind, to look into a thing, consider, Soph., Eur., etc.:—foll. by an interrog. or rel. clause, ταῦτʼ ἄθρησον, εἰ . . consider this also, whether . . , Soph.; ἄθρει Plat.

div1.head: ἀθρητέον
div1.sense: one must consider, Eur., Xen.

div1.head: ἀθροίζω
div1.sense: to gather together, to muster forces, Soph., Xen.; Τροίαν ἀθρ. to gather the Trojans together, Eur.; πνεῦμα ἄθροισον collect breath, Eur.:—Mid. to gather for oneself, collect round one, Eur., Xen.:—Pass. to be gathered together, ἐς τὴν ἀγορήν Hdt.; ἀθροισθέντες having rallied, Thuc.; τὸ ξύμπαν ἠθροίσθη δισχίλιοι the whole amounted collectively to 2000, Thuc.
in Pass. also of the mind, ἀθροίζεσθαι εἰς ἑαυτόν to collect oneself, Plat.; φόβος ἤθροισται fear has gathered strength, arisen, Xen.

div1.head: ἄθροισις
div1.sense: a gathering, mustering, στρατοῦ Eur.; χρημάτων Thuc.

div1.head: ἄθροισμα
div1.sense: a gathering, λαοῦ Eur.

div1.head: ἁθροιστέον
div1.sense: one must collect, Xen.

div1.head: ἀθρόος
div1.sense: in crowds or masses, crowded together, mostly in pl.; πάντες ἁθρόοι Od., etc.; ἀθρόοι, of soldiers, in close order, Lat. conferto agmine, Hdt., Xen., etc.; also, πολλαὶ κῶμαι ἀθρόαι close together, Xen.

taken together, ἁθρόα πάντʼ ἀπέτισεν he paid for all at once, Od.; ἁθρόα πόλις the citizens as a whole, Thuc.; τὸ ἀθρόον their assembled force, Xen.; ἀθρόωι στόματι with one voice, Eur.; ἁθρόους κρίνειν to condemn all by a single vote, Plat.; κατήριπεν ἀθρόος he fell all at once, Theocr.
multitudinous, δάκρυ Eur., Plat.
comp. ἁθροώτερος Thuc., etc.; later ἀθρούστερος Plut.

div1.head: ἄθρυπτος
div1.sense: not broken, not enervated, Plut.; ἄθρυπτος εἰς γέλωτα never breaking into laughter, Plut. adv. -τως, Plut.

div1.head: ἀθυμέω
div1.sense: to be disheartened, lose heart, Aesch., etc.; τινι at or for a thing, Soph.; ἐπί τινι, εἴς τι, πρός τι, Attic Prose:—foll. by a relat. word, to be sore afraid, ἀθυμῶ δʼ εἰ φανήσομαι Soph.; δεινῶς ἀθυμῶ μὴ βλέπων ὁ μάντις ἦι Soph.

div1.head: ἀθυμητέον
div1.sense: one must lose heart, Xen.

div1.head: ἀθυμία
div1.sense: want of heart, faintheartedness, Hdt., Soph., etc.; εἰς ἀθυμίαν καθιστάναι τινά Plat.; ἀθυμίαν παρέχειν τινί Xen.; ἐν ἀθυμίαι εἶναι Xen.; ἀθυμία ἐμπίπτει τινί Xen.

div1.head: ἄθυμος
div1.sense: without heart, fainthearted, Od., Hdt., etc.; ἄθ. εἶναι πρός τι to have no heart for a thing, Xen.; so adv., ἀθύμως ἔχειν πρός τι Xen.
without passion, Plat.

div1.head: ἄθυρμα
div1.sense: a plaything, toy: a delight, joy, Hom., etc.

div1.head: ἀθυρόγλωττος
div1.sense: one that cannot keep his mouth shut, a ceaseless babbler, Eur.

div1.head: ἄθυρος
div1.sense: without door, Plut.

div1.head: ἀθυρόστομος
div1.sense: ever-babbling, Soph.

div1.head: ἄθυρσος
div1.sense: without thyrsus, Eur.

div1.head: ἀθύρω
div1.sense: to play, sport, of children, Il., Eur.; c. acc. cogn., μοῦσαν ἀθύρων singing sportive songs, Hhymn.:—Mid., simply, to sing, Hhymn.
c. acc., ἔργα φωτῶν ἀθ. to play the deeds of men, of an actor, Anth.

div1.head: ἀθύρωτος
div1.sense: never closed, Ar.

div1.head: ἄθυτος
div1.sense: not offered, i. e. neglected, ἱερὰ ἄθ., Lat. sacra inauspicata, Aeschin.
act. without sacrificing, ἄθυτος ἀπελθεῖν Xen.

div1.head: Ἄθῳος
div1.sense: of mount Athos, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀθῷος
div1.sense: unpunished, scot-free, Eur., etc.; ἀθώιους καθιστάναι τινάς to secure their immunity, Dem.; ἀθῶιον ἀφιέναι Dem.; ἀθῶιος ἀπαλλάττειν to get off scot-free, Plat.
free from a thing, c. gen., Ar.
unharmed by a thing, c. gen., Dem.
not deserving punishment, without fault, Dem.

div1.head: ἀθώπευτος
div1.sense: not flattered, without flattery, τῆς ἐμῆς γλώσσης from my tongue, Eur.
act. not flattering, discourteous, Anth.

div1.head: ἀθωράκιστος
div1.sense: without breastplate, Xen.

div1.head: Ἄθως
div1.sense: mount Athos, Il., etc.

div1.head: αἴαγμα
div1.sense: a wail, Eur.

div1.head: αἰάζω
div1.sense: to cry αἰαῖ, to wail, Trag.; c. acc. to bewail, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: αἰαῖ
div1.sense: exclam. of grief, ah! Lat. vae! c. gen., αἰαῖ τόλμας Eur.; and repeated, αἰαῖ αἰαῖ μελέων ἔργων Aesch.:—later c. acc., αἰαῖ τὰν Κυθέρειαν Bion.

div1.head: Αἰακίδης
div1.sense: son of Aeacus, Il.

div1.head: αἰακτός
div1.sense: bewailed, lamentable, Aesch., Ar.
wailing, miserable, Aesch.

div1.head: αἰανής
div1.sense: dreary, dismal, direful, horrid, νυκτὸς αἰανῆ τέκνα, νυκτὸς αἰανὴς κύκλος, αἰανὴς νόσος Aesch., Soph., etc.
of Time, εἰς τὸν αἰανῆ χρόνον Aesch.; and so in adv. αἰανῶς for ever, Aesch.
div1.etym: The prob. deriv. is from αἰεί, everlasting, whence may come the notion of neverending, wearisome, dreary.

div1.head: αἶα
div1.sense: Epic form used for γαῖα metri grat., Hom., Trag.; never in pl.

div1.head: Αἴας
div1.sense: Ajax, pr. n., borne by two heroes, the Greater son of Telamon, the Less son of Oileus, Hom.

div1.head: αἰβοῖ
div1.sense: bah! exclam. of disgust or astonishment; but αἰβοῖ, βοῖ, of laughter, Ar.

div1.head: αἴγαγρος
div1.sense: the wild goat, Babr.

div1.head: Αἰγαῖος
div1.sense: Aegaean, πέλαγος Aesch.; ὄρος Αἰγ. mount Ida, Hes.
Αἰγαῖος (sc. πόντος), the Aegaean, Plat., etc.

div1.head: Αἰγαίων
div1.sense: Aegaeon, the name given by men to the hundred-armed son of Uranus and Gaia, called by gods Βριάρεως, Il.
the Aegaean sea, Eur.

div1.head: αἰγανέη
div1.sense: a hunting-spear, javelin, Hom., Anth.

div1.head: Αἴγειος
div1.sense: of Aegeus, Aesch.

div1.head: αἴγειος
div1.sense: of a goat or goats, Lat. caprinus, αἴγειος τυρός goats-milk cheese, Il.; ἀσκῶι ἐν αἰγείωι in a goatʼs skin, Il.; αἰγείη κυνέη a helmet of goatskin.

div1.head: αἴγειρος
div1.sense: the poplar (cf. λεύκη), Od.

div1.head: αἰγελάτης
div1.sense: a goatherd, Plut., Anth.

div1.head: αἴγεος
div1.sense: = αἴγειος, Od.
as Subst. αἰγέη (sc. δορά), a goatʼs skin, Hdt.

div1.head: αἰγιαλίτης
div1.sense: one who haunts the shore, Anth.

div1.head: αἰγιαλός
div1.sense: the sea-shore, beach, strand, Hom., Hdt.; αἰγιαλὸν ἔνδον τρέφει, i. e. he has a whole sea-beach (i. e. quantities of voting-pebbles, ψῆφοι) in his house, Ar.

div1.head: αἰγίβοσις
div1.sense: a goat-pasture, Anth.

div1.head: αἰγιβότης
div1.sense: feeding goats, Anth.

div1.head: αἰγίβοτος
div1.sense: browsed by goats, Od.

div1.head: αἰγίθαλλος
div1.sense: the titmouse, Lat. parus, Ar.

div1.head: αἰγίκνημος
div1.sense: goat-shanked, Anth.

div1.head: αἰγικορεῖς
div1.sense: goatherds; name of one of the four old Attic Tribes, Hdt., Eur.
div1.etym: If from αἴξ, κορέννυμι, the literal sense would be goatfeeders.

div1.head: αἰγίλιψ
div1.sense: destitute even of goats, hence steep, sheer, πέτρη Il.

div1.head: αἴγιλος
div1.sense: a herb of which goats are fond, Theocr.

div1.head: Αἰγιναίη
div1.sense: (sc. νῆσος) Aegina, Hdt.

div1.head: Αἰγιναῖος
div1.sense: of Aegina, Thuc., etc.

div1.head: Αἴγινα
div1.sense: Aegina, Il., etc.

div1.head: Αἰγινήτης
div1.sense: an Aeginetan, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: αἰγινομεύς
div1.sense: a goatherd, Anth.

div1.head: αἰγίνομος
div1.sense: pass. browsed by goats, βοτάνη Anth.

div1.head: αἰγινόμος
div1.sense: feeding goats: as Subst. a goatherd, Anth.

div1.head: αἰγίοχος
div1.sense: Aegis-bearing, of Zeus, Hom.

div1.head: αἰγιπόδης
div1.sense: goat-footed, Hhymn.

div1.head: αἰγίπυρος
div1.sense: a plant of which goats were fond, perh. buckwheat, Theocr.

div1.head: αἰγίς
div1.sense: the aegis or shield of Zeus, described in Il. 5. 738 sqq. the aegis on statues of Athena is a short cloak of goat-skin, covered with scales, set with the Gorgonʼs head, and fringed with snakes, v. Hdt. 4. 189.
a goatskin coat, Eur.
(αἴξ II) a rushing storm, hurricane, Aesch.

div1.head: αἰγλήεις
div1.sense: dazzling, radiant, lustrous, Hom.

div1.head: αἴγλη
div1.sense: the light of the sun, radiance, Od.:—then simply daylight, λευκὴ αἴγλη Od.; εἰς αἴγλαν μολεῖν, i. e. to be born, Pind
any dazzling light, lustre, gleam, χαλκοῦ Il.

div1.head: αἰγλοφανής
div1.sense: radiant, Anth.

div1.head: αἰγόκερως
div1.sense: goat-horned, Anth., Plut.
as Subst. Capricorn in the Zodiac, Luc.

div1.head: αἰγοπρόσωπος
div1.sense: goat-faced, Hdt.

div1.head: αἰγυπιός
div1.sense: a vulture, Hom., etc.:— αἰγυπιός is the vulture which preys on live animals, γύψ the carrion vulture.

div1.head: Αἰγυπτιάζω
div1.sense: to speak Egyptian, Luc.

div1.head: Αἰγυπτιακός
div1.sense: of or for the Egyptians, Plut., etc.

div1.head: Αἰγύπτιος
div1.sense: Egyptian, Hom., etc.
div1.etym: Αἰγυπτίη, Αἰγυπτίων, etc., are trisyll. in Hom.

div1.head: Αἰγυπτιστί
div1.sense: in the Egyptian tongue, Hdt.
in Egyptian fashion, craftily, Theocr.

div1.head: Αἰγυπτογενής
div1.sense: of Egyptian race, Aesch.

div1.head: Αἰγυπτόνδε
div1.sense: to Egypt, Od.

div1.head: Αἴγυπτος
div1.sense: the river Nile, Od.; called Νεῖλος first in Hes.
Egypt, Od.

div1.head: αἰγῶνυξ
div1.sense: goat-hoofed, Anth.

div1.head: αἰδέομαι
div1.sense: to be ashamed to do a thing, c. inf., Hom., etc.; rarely c. part., αἴδεσαι μὲν πατέρα προλείπων feel ashamed of deserting him, Soph.:—absol., αἰδεσθείς from a sense of shame, Il.
c. acc. pers. to stand in awe of, fear, respect, αἰδεῖο θεούς Il., Hom., etc.; and of things, αἴδεσσαι μέλαθρον respect the house, Il.; ὅρκον αἰδεσθείς Soph.
to feel regard for a person, μήδε τί μʼ αἰδόμενος μήδʼ ἐλεαίρων Od.

div1.head: αἰδέσιμος
div1.sense: exciting shame, venerable, Luc.

div1.head: αἴδεσις
div1.sense: respect, Dem.

div1.head: ἀΐδηλος
div1.sense: making unseen, annihilating, destroying, Il.:—adv. -λως, ὀλεθρίως, Il.
pass. unseen, obscure, Hes.

div1.head: αἰδήμων
div1.sense: bashful, modest, Xen.: Sup. αἰδημονέστατος, Xen.: adv. -μόνως, Xen.

div1.head: ἀϊδής
div1.sense: unseen, annihilated, Hes.

div1.head: ἀΐδιος
div1.sense: everlasting, eternal, Hes. and Attic:— ἐς ἀΐδιον for ever, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀϊδνός
div1.sense: unseen, dark, Hes.

div1.head: αἰδοῖον
div1.sense: mostly in pl. αἰδοῖα, τά, the genitals, pudenda, Il., etc.

div1.head: αἰδοῖος
div1.sense: of persons, regarded with reverence, august, venerable, and of women, deserving respect, tender, Hom.
act. shamefaced, reverent, Od.:—adv. -ως, reverently, Od.
comp. αἰδοιότερος, Od.; Sup. αἰδοιέστατος, Pind.

div1.head: αἰδόφρων
div1.sense: respectful in mind, compassionate, Soph.; πρός τινα Eur.

div1.head: ἀϊδρείη
div1.sense: want of knowledge, ignorance, Od., Hdt.

div1.head: ἄϊδρις
div1.sense: poet. adj. unknowing, ignorant, Il.; c. gen., Od., etc.

div1.head: ἀΐδρυτος
div1.sense: unsettled, vagabond, Ar.; δρόμοις ἀν. in vagabond courses, Eur.

div1.head: Ἀϊδωνεύς
div1.etym: poets used the obl. cases Ἀϊδονῆος, ῆϊ, ῆα, with ᾱ, metri grat.

div1.head: αἰδώς
div1.sense: a sense of shame, shame, modesty, self-respect, Hom., etc.:—personif., Ζηνὶ σύνθακος θρόνων Αἰδώς Shame that shares his throne with Zeus, Soph.
regard for others, respect, reverence, Theogn.; τὴν ἐμὴν αἰδῶ respect for me, Aesch.
that which causes shame, and so,
a shame, Il.; as an exclam., shame! αἰδώς, Ἀργεῖοι, κακʼ ἐλέγχεα! Il.; αἰδώς, ὦ Λύκιοι· ποῖ φεύγετε; Il.
= τὰ αἰδοῖα, Il.

div1.head: αἰένυπνος
div1.sense: lulling in eternal sleep, of Death, Soph.

div1.head: αἰζήϊος
div1.sense: strong, lusty, vigorous, Hom.

div1.head: αἰζηός
div1.sense: strong, lusty, vigorous, Hom.

div1.head: αἴητος
div1.sense: in Il. Vulcan is πέλωρ αἴητον, ἄητον, terrible, mighty monster.

div1.head: αἰθάλη
div1.sense: soot, Luc.

div1.head: αἰθαλίων
div1.sense: epith. of the τέττιξ, swarthy, dusky, Theocr.

div1.head: αἰθαλόεις
div1.sense: smoky, sooty, Il., Theocr.; κόνις αἰθ. black ashes that are burnt out, Hom.
burning, Hes., Aesch.

div1.head: αἴθαλος
div1.sense: soot, Eur.

div1.head: αἰθαλόω
div1.sense: to soil with soot or smoke, Eur.

div1.head: αἴθε
div1.sense: Epic for εἴθε, αἴθʼ ὄφελες would that Hom.; cf. αἰ.

div1.head: αἰθερεμβατέω
div1.sense: to walk in ether, Anth.

div1.head: αἰθέριος
div1.sense: of or in the upper air, high in air, on high, Aesch., Soph., etc.; αἰθερία ἀνέπτα flew up into the air, Eur.

div1.head: αἰθεροδρόμος
div1.sense: ether-skimming, Anth.

div1.head: αἰθήρ
div1.etym: in Hom. fem; in Hes., Aesch., and Attic Prose masc; in Soph. and Eur. masc or fem.
div1.sense: ether, the brighter purer air, the sky, above the ἀήρ (q. v.); Ζεὺς αἰθέρι ναίων Il.
a clime, region, Eur.

div1.head: Αἰθιοπία
div1.sense: Ethiopia, Hdt.

div1.head: Αἰθιοπικός
div1.sense: Ethiopian, Hdt., etc.
in literal sense, sun-burnt, Anth.

div1.head: Αἰθίοψ
div1.sense: properly burnt-face, i. e. an Ethiop, African, Hom., etc.
adj. Ethiopian, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: αἶθος
div1.sense: a burning heat, fire, Eur.

div1.head: αἴθουσα
div1.etym: sc. στοά, αἴθουσα being partic. of αἴθω
div1.sense: in the Homeric house, the corridor, open in front like a verandah, looking E. or S. to catch the sun, whence the name; the sleeping place of travellers, Od.

div1.head: αἶθοψ
div1.sense: fiery-looking, of metal, flashing, Il., etc.; of wine, sparkling, Il.; of smoke, mixed with flame, Od.
swart, dark, Anth.
metaph. fiery, keen, eager, Lat. ardens, Hes., Soph.

div1.head: αἰθρηγενής
div1.sense: epith. of Boreas, born in ether, sprung from ether, Il.

div1.head: αἴθρη
div1.sense: not αἴθρα even in Attic; clear sky, fair weather, Lat. sudum, Hom.

div1.head: αἰθρία
div1.etym: later form of αἴθρη, Solon, etc.
div1.sense: αἰθρίης, Attic -ίας, in clear weather, Hdt., Ar.; ὑπὸ τῆς αἰθρίας in the open air, Lat. sub dio, Xen.
the clear cold air of night, Hdt.

div1.head: αἰθριάω
div1.sense: to be clear, of the sky, ὡς δʼ ᾐθρίᾱσε Babr.

div1.head: αἰθριοκοιτέω
div1.sense: to sleep in open air, Theocr.

div1.head: αἴθριος
div1.sense: clear, bright, fair, of weather, Hhymn., Hdt.; epith. of Ζεύς, Theocr.

div1.head: αἶθρος
div1.sense: the clear chill air of morn, Od.; cf. αἰθρία.

div1.head: αἴθυια
div1.sense: a sea-bird, a gull or diver, Od.

div1.head: αἰθυκτήρ
div1.sense: one that darts swiftly, Anth.

div1.head: αἰθύσσω
div1.sense: to put in rapid motion, stir up, kindle, Soph.:—Pass. to quiver, of leaves, Sapph.

div1.head: αἴθων
div1.sense: fiery, burning, blazing: of metal, flashing, glittering, Hom., etc.
in Hom. of the horse, lion, bull, eagle, —where it is either fiery, fierce, or tawny.
metaph. ablaze, fiery, Aesch., Soph.
div1.etym: The penult. of the obl. cases may be shortd. in Poets, metri grat., αἴθονος Soph.; αἴθονα Hes.

div1.head: αἴθω
div1.sense: to light up, kindle, Hdt., Trag.
intr. to burn or blaze, Soph.:—in this sense the Pass. αἴθομαι is used by Hom. in part., πυρὸς μένος αἰθομένοιο Il., Od., etc.; so metaph., ἔρωτι αἴθεσθαι Xen.

div1.head: αἰκάλλω
div1.sense: to flatter, wheedle, fondle, c. acc., Soph., Eur.
absol., of a dog, to wag the tail fawningly, Babr.: (this is prob. the orig. sense).

div1.head: ἀϊκή
div1.sense: rapid flight, rush, impetus, Il.

div1.head: ἀϊκής
div1.sense: adv. ἀϊκῶς, Il.:—in Trag., αἰκής, αἰκῶς.

div1.head: αἰκία
div1.sense: injurious treatment, an affront, outrage, Aesch., etc.
in Prose mostly as law-phrase, αἰκίας δίκη an action for assault, less serious than that for ὕβρις, Plat., etc.

div1.head: αἰκίζω
div1.sense: Act. only in pres., to treat injuriously, to plague, torment, τινά Soph.; of a storm, αἰκίζων φόβην ὕλης Soph.:—Pass. to be tormented, Aesch.
Dep. in same sense as Act., c. acc., Soph., etc.; c. dupl. acc. pers. et rei, αἰκίζεσθαί τινα τὰ ἔσχατα Xen.

div1.head: αἴκισμα
div1.sense: an outrage, torture, Aesch.:—in pl. mutilated corpses, Eur.

div1.head: ἀικῶς
div1.sense: adverb of ἀϊκής.

div1.head: αἴλινος
div1.sense: a plaintive dirge, Trag.; (said to be from αἶ Λίνον, ah me for Linus! v. Λίνος II.)
adj. αἴλινος, ον, mournful, plaintive, Eur.:— neut. pl. αἴλινα as adv., Mosch.

div1.head: αἴλουρος
div1.sense: a cat, Hdt., Attic

div1.head: αἱμακτός
div1.sense: mingled with blood, of blood, Eur.

div1.head: αἱμαλέος
div1.sense: bloody, blood-red, Anth.

div1.head: αἷμα
div1.sense: blood, Hom., etc.; in pl. streams of blood, Trag.
bloodshed, murder, Aesch., etc.: —ἐφʼ αἵματι φεύγειν to avoid trial for murder by going into exile, Dem.; so, αἷμα φεύγειν Eur.
like Lat. sanguis, blood-relationship, kin, Soph., Hom., etc.; ὁ πρὸς αἵματος one of the blood or race, Soph.; μητρὸς τῆς ἐμῆς ἐν αἵματι akin to her by blood, Aesch.

div1.head: αἱμασιά
div1.sense: a wall of dry stones, Lat. maceria, Od., etc.

div1.head: αἱμάς
div1.sense: a gush or stream of blood, Soph.

div1.head: αἱμάσσω
div1.sense: to make bloody stain with blood, Aesch.:—hence to smite so as to make bloody, Soph., Eur.; so in Mid., Anth.:—Pass. to welter in blood, be slain, Soph.

div1.head: αἱματεκχυσία
div1.sense: shedding of blood, NTest.

div1.head: αἱματηρός
div1.sense: bloody, bloodstained, murderous, Trag.
of blood, consisting thereof, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: αἱματηφόρος
div1.sense: bringing blood, bloody, Aesch.

div1.head: αἱματόεις
div1.sense: contr. αἱματοῦς, οῦσσα, οῦν, αἱματηρός Il.
blood-red or of blood, Il.
bloody, murderous, Il.

div1.head: αἱματολοιχός
div1.sense: licking blood, ἔρως αἱμ. thirst for blood, Aesch.

div1.head: αἱματοπώτης
div1.sense: a blood-drinker, Ar.

div1.head: αἱματορρόφος
div1.sense: blood-drinking, Aesch.

div1.head: αἱματόρρυτος
div1.sense: blood-streaming, αἱμ. ῥανίδες a shower of blood, Eur.

div1.head: αἱματοσταγής
div1.sense: blood-dripping, Aesch.

div1.head: αἱματόφυρτος
div1.sense: blood-stained, Anth.

div1.head: αἱματοχάρμης
div1.sense: delighting in blood, Anth.

div1.head: αἱματόω
div1.sense: to make bloody, stain with blood, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: αἱματώδης
div1.sense: blood-red, Thuc.

div1.head: αἱματωπός
div1.sense: bloody to behold, Eur.

div1.head: αἱμοβαφής
div1.sense: bathed in blood, Soph.

div1.head: αἱμοβόρος
div1.sense: blood-sucking, greedy of blood, Theocr.

div1.head: αἱμόδιψος
div1.sense: bloodthirsty, Luc.

div1.head: αἱμορραγής
div1.sense: bleeding violently, Soph.

div1.head: αἱμόρραντος
div1.sense: blood-sprinkled, Eur.

div1.head: αἱμορροέω
div1.sense: to have a αἱμόρροια, discharge of blood.

div1.head: αἱμόρροια
div1.sense: a discharge of blood.

div1.head: αἱμόρρυτος
div1.sense: blood-streaming, Aesch., Anth.

div1.head: αἱμοφόρυκτος
div1.sense: defiled with blood, κρέα Od.

div1.head: αἱμυλία
div1.sense: winning, wily ways, Plut.

div1.head: αἱμυλομήτης
div1.sense: of winning wiles, Hhymn.

div1.head: αἱμύλος
div1.sense: flattering, wheedling, wily, Hes., Aesch.; τὸν αἱμυλώτατον Soph.

div1.head: αἱμώδης
div1.sense: bloody, blood-red, Luc.

div1.head: αἵμων
div1.sense: skilful in a thing, c. gen., αἵμονα θήρης Il.
(αἷμα) bloody, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: αἰναρέτης
div1.sense: terribly brave, Il.

div1.head: αἴνεσις
div1.sense: praise, NTest.

div1.head: αἰνετός
div1.sense: praiseworthy, Arist., Anth.

div1.head: αἰνέω
div1.sense: This is a Poet. and Ionic Verb, while ἐπαινέω is used in Attic Prose
properly, to tell or speak of (cf. αἶνος), Aesch.
commonly, to speak in praise of, praise, Lat. laudo, c. acc., Hom., Hdt.
to allow, recommend, Od.: c. inf. to recommend to do a thing, Aesch.; also c. part., αἰνεῖν ἰόντα to commend oneʼs going, Aesch.
like ἀγαπάω, to be content, acquiesce, Eur.:—c. acc. rei, to be content with, acquiesce in, γάμον Pind., etc.; θῆσσαν τράπεζαν Eur.
to decline courteously, Hes.
to promise or vow, τί τινι or τινὶ ποιεῖν τι Soph., Eur.

div1.head: αἴνη
div1.sense: praise, fame, ἐν αἴνηι ἐών Hdt.

div1.head: αἴνιγμα
div1.sense: a dark saying, riddle, Aesch., etc.; ἐξ αἰνιγμάτων in riddles, Aesch.; διʼ αἰνιγμάτων Aeschin.; αἴνιγμα προβάλλειν, ξυντιθέναι to propose a riddle, Plat.; opp. to αἴνιγμα λύειν, εὑρίσκειν to solve it, Soph., etc.

div1.head: αἰνιγματώδης
div1.sense: riddling, dark, Aesch.

div1.head: αἰνιγμός
div1.sense: a riddle, διʼ αἰνιγμῶν ἐρεῖν Ar.; ἐν αἰνιγμοῖσι σημαίνειν Eur.

div1.head: αἰνίζομαι
div1.etym: usually dep., = αἰνέω, Hom.:—act. αἰνίζω, Anth.

div1.head: αἰνικτήριος
div1.sense: known from the adv. -ίως, in riddles, Aesch.

div1.head: αἰνικτός
div1.sense: expressed in riddles, riddling, Soph.

div1.head: αἰνίσσομαι
div1.sense: to speak in riddles, Soph., Eur.; γνωρίμως αἰνίξομαι I will speak in riddles but so as to be understood, Soph.; αἰνίσσεσθαι ἔπεα to speak riddling verses, Hdt.:—c. acc. rei, to hint a thing, intimate, shadow forth, Plat.
as Pass. to be wrapt up in riddles, only in aor1 ἠινίχθην, perf. ᾔνιγμαι, Theogn., Plat., etc.

div1.head: αἰνοβίας
div1.sense: awefully strong, Anth.

div1.head: αἰνόγαμος
div1.sense: fatally wedded, Eur.

div1.head: αἰνόθεν
div1.sense: adv. only in phrase αἰνόθεν αἰνῶς, from horror to horror, right horribly, Il.

div1.head: αἰνόθρυπτος
div1.sense: sadly enervated, Theocr.

div1.head: αἰνολαμπής
div1.sense: horrid-gleaming, Aesch.

div1.head: αἰνόλεκτρος
div1.sense: fatally wedded, Aesch.

div1.head: αἰνολέων
div1.sense: a dreadful lion, Theocr.

div1.head: αἰνόλινος
div1.sense: unfortunate in lifeʼs thread, in allusion to the Parcae, Anth.

div1.head: αἰνόλυκος
div1.sense: a horrible wolf, Anth.

div1.head: αἰνόμορος
div1.sense: doomed to a sad end, Hom.

div1.head: αἰνοπαθής
div1.sense: suffering dire ills, Od., Anth.

div1.head: Αἰνόπαρις
div1.sense: like Δύσπαρις, unlucky Paris, Eur.

div1.head: αἰνοπάτηρ
div1.sense: unhappy father, Aesch.

div1.head: αἰνός
div1.sense: dread, dire, grim, terrible, Hom.; αἰνότατε Κρονίδη most dread son of Cronus, Il.
adv. -νῶς, terribly, i. e. strangely, exceedingly, Hom., Hdt.; also αἰνά as adv., Il.; Sup. -ότατον, Il.

div1.head: αἶνος
div1.sense: = μῦθος, a tale, story, Od.; αἰνεῖν αἶνον to tell a tale, Aesch., Soph.: generally, a saying, proverb, Theocr.
= Attic ἔπαινος, praise, Hom., Trag.

div1.head: αἰνοτόκεια
div1.sense: unhappy in being a mother, Mosch.

div1.head: αἰνοτύραννος
div1.sense: a dreadful tyrant, Anth.

div1.head: αἴνυμαι
div1.sense: to take, take off, take hold of, Hom.; c. gen. partit., τυρῶν αἰνυμένους taking of the cheeses, Od.

div1.head: αἴξ
div1.sense: a goat, Lat. caper, capra, Hom.
αἲξ ἄγριος the wild goat, the ibex, Hom.
αἶγες, old name for waves.
div1.etym: Prob. not from ἀΐσσω, of which the root is αικ.

div1.head: Αἰολεύς
div1.sense: an Aeolian; pl. Αἰολέες, Attic Αἰολεῖς or -ῆς Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: αἰολίζω
div1.sense: to speak Aeolian, Plut.

div1.head: Αἰολικός
div1.sense: of or like the Aeolians, Theocr.

div1.head: αἰόλλω
div1.sense: to shift rapidly to and fro, Od.:—Pass. to shift colour, of grapes, Hes.

div1.head: αἰολοβρόντης
div1.sense: wielder of lightning, Ζεύς Pind.

div1.head: αἰολοθώρηξ
div1.sense: with glancing breastplate, Il.

div1.head: αἰολόμητις
div1.sense: full of various wiles, Hes., Aesch.

div1.head: αἰολομίτρης
div1.sense: with glancing or glittering girdle (for it was plated with metal), Il.
with variegated turban, Theocr.

div1.head: αἰολόπωλος
div1.sense: with quick-moving steeds, Il., Theocr.

div1.head: αἰόλος
div1.etym: The penult. is lengthd. in the gen. Αἰόλου μεγαλήτορος, metri grat., Od.
div1.sense: quick-moving, Il.; αἰόλαι εὐλαί wriggling worms, Il.; so of wasps and serpents, Il.

changeful of hue, gleaming, glancing, of arms and armour, Il.; (but here also it may be explained moving with the body, manageable, Lat. habilis);— also, αἰόλα νύξ star-spangled night, Soph.; Aesch. calls smoke flushed by fire-light αἰόλη πυρὸς κάσις; αἰόλα σάρξ discoloured from disease, Soph.
metaph.,
changeful, shifting, varied, κάκα Aesch.; of sounds, ἰαχή Eur.
shifty, wily, slippery, ψεῦδος Pind.
as prop. n., proparox. Αἴολος, ου, ὁ, lord of the winds, properly the rapid or the changeable, Od.

div1.head: αἰολόστομος
div1.sense: shifting in speech, of an oracle, Aesch.

div1.head: αἴ
div1.sense: Exclam. of astonishment, ha! αἲ τάλας Ar.

div1.head: αἰ
div1.sense: if:— αἴ κε or κεν if only, so that, Lat. dummodo, with subj., Hom.; so Doric αἴκᾱ, Theocr.
αἲ γάρ (with accent), Epic for εἰ γάρ, to express a wish, O that! would that! Lat. utinam! with opt., Hom.; cf. αἴθε.

div1.head: αἰπεινός
div1.sense: high, lofty, Hom.
metaph.,
precipitate, hasty, Pind.
hard to win, difficult, Pind., Eur.

div1.head: αἰπολέω
div1.sense: to tend goats, Theocr.: —Pass., of the flock, Aesch.

div1.head: αἰπολικός
div1.sense: of or for goatherds, Anth.

div1.head: αἰπόλιον
div1.sense: a herd of goats, Il., etc.
a goat-pasture, Anth.

div1.head: αἰπόλος
div1.etym: αἰπόλος is for αἰγοπόλος from αἴξ, πολέω.
div1.sense: a goatherd, Od., etc.

div1.head: αἶπος
div1.sense: a height, a steep, Aesch.:— πρὸς αἶπος ἔρχεσθαι, metaph. of a difficult task, Eur.

div1.head: αἰπός
div1.sense: high, lofty, of cities, Il.; αἰπὰ ῥέεθρα streams falling sheer down, Il.

div1.head: αἰπυμήτης
div1.sense: with high thoughts, Θέμιδος αἰπυμῆτα παῖ Aesch.

div1.head: αἰπύνωτος
div1.sense: high-backed, on a high mountain-ridge, of Dodona, Aesch.

div1.head: αἰπύς
div1.sense: high and steep, lofty, of cities on heights, as Troy, Od.; of hills, Il.; βρόχος αἰπ. a noose hanging straight down, Od.
metaph. sheer, utter, αἰπὺς ὄλεθρος Hom. (death being regarded as the plunge over a precipice); so, φόνος αἰπύς Od.; also αἰπὺς χόλος towering wrath, Il.
arduous, difficult, Il.

div1.head: αἱρέσιμος
div1.sense: that can be taken, Xen.

div1.head: αἵρεσις
div1.sense: a taking especially, esp. of a town, Hdt., etc.; ἡ βασιλῆος αἵρ. the taking by the king, Hdt.
means for taking a place, Thuc.

(αἱρέομαι) a taking for oneself, a choosing, choice, νέμειν, προτιθέναι, προβάλλειν to give or offer choice, Hdt., Attic; αἵρ. γίγνεταί τινι a choice is allowed one, Thuc.; αἵρεσιν λαμβάνειν to have choice given, Dem.
choice or election of magistrates, Thuc., etc.
a choice, deliberate plan, purpose, Plat., etc.
a sect, school, etc.: esp. a religious sect, such as the Sadducees and Pharisees, NTest.
a heresy, Eccl.

div1.head: αἱρετέος
div1.sense: to be taken, desirable, Xen.
αἱρετέον, one must choose, Plat.

div1.head: αἱρετίζω
div1.sense: to choose, select, Babr., NTest.

div1.head: αἱρετικός
div1.sense: able to choose, Plat.
heretical, NTest.

div1.head: αἱρετός
div1.sense: that may be taken or conquered, Hdt.; that may be understood, Plat.
(αἱρέομαι) to be chosen, eligible, Plat., Hdt., etc.; ζοῆς πονηρᾶς θάνατος αἱρετώτερος Menand.
chosen, elected, Plat., etc.

div1.head: αἱρέω
div1.etym: The forms εἷλον etc. come from the stem ἑλ-.
div1.sense: Act. to take with the hand, grasp, αἱρ. τι ἐν χερσίν, μετὰ χερσίν to take a thing in hand, Od.; αἱρ. χερσὶ δόρυ Il.; αἱρ, τινὰ χειρός to take one by the hand, Il.:—part. ἑλών is sometimes used as adv., by force, Soph.
to take away, Hom.
to take by force, to take a city, Il., etc.; to overpower, kill, Hom., etc.:—often of passions, etc., to seize, Hom., etc.:—to conquer (in a race), Il.
to take, catch, as in hunting, in good sense, to win over, Xen., etc.:—c. part. to catch or detect one doing a thing, Soph.
to win, gain, κῦδος Il.; of the public games, Simon., etc.

as Attic law-term, to convict a person of a thing, τινά τινος Ar., etc.: also c. part., αἱρεῖν τινὰ κλέπτοντα to convict of theft, Ar.; ἡιρῆσθαι κλοπεύς (sc. ὤν) Soph.; τοῦτʼ ἔστιν ὃ ἐμὲ αἱρήσει Plat.
ὁ λόγος αἱρέει, Lat. ratio evincit, reason proves, Hdt.
Mid. to take for oneself, Hom., etc.; αἱρ. δόρπον, δεῖπνον to take oneʼs supper, Hom.:—so in most senses of Act.

to choose, Hom.: to take in preference, prefer one thing to another, τι πρό τινος Hdt.; τι ἀντί τινος Xen.; also, τί τινος Soph.; τι μᾶλλον ἢ . . , or μᾶλλόν τινος Attic:—c. inf. to prefer to do, Hdt., etc.
αἱρεῖσθαι τά τινος or τινά to take anotherʼs part, join his party, Hdt., etc.
to choose by vote, elect to an office, Plat., etc.
Pass. to be taken, Hdt.; but ἁλίσκομαι is used in Attic for Pass.
as Pass. to the mid. sense, to be chosen, in perf. ᾕρημαι (which is also mid.), Hdt., Attic

div1.head: ἄϊρος
div1.sense: Od. 18. 73 Ἶρος ἄϊρος, Irus unhappy Irus, — a play upon his name, like δῶρα ἄδωρα.

div1.head: αἴρω
div1.etym: distinguish ἀρῶ from ἀ_ρῶ, contr. of ἀερῶ.
div1.sense: Act.
to take up, raise, lift up, Il., etc.; αἴρειν βῆμα to step, walk, Eur.; αἴρ. σημεῖον to hoist a signal, Xen.:—Pass. to mount up, ascend, Xen.
often of armies and ships, αἴρ. τὰς ναῦς to get the fleet under sail, Thuc.:—also intr. to get under way, start, set out, ἆραι τῶι στρατῶι Thuc.;—so in Mid. and Pass., Hdt., etc.
to bear, sustain, μόρον Aesch.; ἆθλον Soph.
to raise up, exalt, Aesch.:—of passion, to exalt, excite, ὑψοῦ αἴρειν θυμόν to grow excited, Soph.; αἴρειν θάρσος to pluck up courage, Eur., etc.: Pass., οὐκ ἤρθη νοῦν ἐς ἀτασθαλίην Simon.
to raise by words, to extol, exaggerate, Eur., Dem.
to lift and take away, to remove, Aesch., etc.:—to take off, kill, NTest.

Mid., with perf. pass. ἦρμαι, to take up for oneself: to carry off, win, gain, κλέος Il.; ἀέθλια (of horses) Il.; κῦδος Hom.:—hence simply to receive, get, ἕλκος ἀρέσθαι Il.; also, δειλίαν ἀρεῖ wilt incur a charge of cowardice, Soph.
to take upon oneself, undergo, carry, bear, Il., etc.
to undertake, begin, πόλεμον Thuc., etc.; φυγὴν ἀρέσθαι, Lat. fugam capere, Aesch.
to raise up, σωτῆρά τινι Soph.: of sound, αἴρεσθαι φωνήν to raise, lift up oneʼs voice, Ar.

div1.head: Αἶσα
div1.sense: like Μοῖρα, the goddess of destiny, Lat. Parca, Il.
as appellat.
the decree, dispensation of a god, Διὸς αἴσηι, ὑπὲρ Διὸς αἶσαν Il.; θεοῦ αἶσα Eur.:— κατʼ αἶσαν fitly, duly, Il., etc.; κατʼ αἶσαν, οὐδʼ ὑπὲρ αἶσαν Il.
oneʼs appointed lot, destiny, Hom., etc.
oneʼs share in a thing, Od.; ληΐδος αἶσα Od., etc.

div1.head: αἰσθάνομαι
div1.sense: to perceive, apprehend by the senses, to see, hear, feel, Hdt., Attic

to perceive by the mind, understand, hear, learn, often in Attic: absol., αἰσθάνει, Lat. tenes, you are right, Eur.:—Construct., c. gen. to have perception of, τῶν κακῶν Eur., etc.; also c. acc., Soph., etc.:—dependent clauses are mostly added in part. agreeing with subject, αἰσθάνομαι κάμνων Thuc.; or agreeing with object, τυράννους ἐκπεσόντας ἠισθόμην Aesch.

div1.head: αἴσθημα
div1.sense: perception of a thing, κακῶν Eur.

div1.head: αἴσθησις
div1.sense: perception by the senses, αἴσθ. πημάτων perception, sense of calamities, Eur.— The phrase αἴσθησιν ἔχειν is used
of persons, αἴσθ. ἔχειν τινός, αἰσθάνεσθαί τινος or τι, to have a perception of a thing, perceive it, Plat.
of things, to give a perception, i. e. to become perceptible, serving as a Pass. to αἰσθάνομαι, Thuc.; more freq. αἴσθησιν παρέχειν Thuc., Xen.
one of the senses, Plat.: and in pl. the senses, Plat.
a perception, αἰσθήσεις θεῶν visions of the gods, Plat.
in hunting, the scent, Xen.

div1.head: αἰσθητήριον
div1.sense: an organ of sense, Arist., etc.; τὰ αἰσθ. the senses, faculties, NTest.

div1.head: αἰσθητικός
div1.sense: of or for perception by the senses, perceptive, Plat., etc.:—adv. αἰσθητικῶς ἔχειν to be quick of perception, Arist.
of things, perceptible, Plut.

div1.head: αἰσθητός
div1.sense: perceptible by the senses, Plat.

div1.head: ἀΐσθω
div1.sense: to breathe out, like ἀποπνέω, θυμὸν ἄϊσθε he was giving up the ghost, Il.

div1.head: αἰσιμία
div1.sense: happiness, αἰσιμίαις πλούτου Aesch.

div1.head: αἴσιμος
div1.sense: Lat. fatalis, appointed by the will of the gods, destined, αἴσιμον ἦμαρ the fatal day, day of death, Il., etc.; αἴσιμόν ἐστι it is fated, Il.
agreeable to fate, meet, right, αἴσιμα εἰπεῖν, αἴσιμα εἰδώς Od.

div1.head: αἴσιος
div1.sense: boding well, auspicious, Il., etc.:—adv. -ίως, Eur.

div1.head: ἄϊσος
div1.sense: unlike, unequal, Pind.

div1.head: ἀΐσσω
div1.sense: to move with a quick shooting motion, to shoot, dart, glance, Lat. impetu ferri, Il., etc.; so in aor. mid., ἀΐξασθαι, and aor. pass. ἀϊχθῆναι Il.; κόμη διʼ αὔρας ἀίσσεται floats on the breeze, Soph.
to turn eagerly, be eager, εἴς τι Eur.
trans. to put in motion, Eur.

div1.head: ἄϊστος
div1.sense: not to be seen, unseen.
act. unconscious of, c. gen., Eur.

div1.head: ἀϊστόω
div1.sense: to make unseen, to annihilate, Hom., etc.

div1.head: ἀΐστωρ
div1.sense: unknowing, unconscious, Plat.; τινός of a thing, Eur.

div1.head: αἴσυλος
div1.sense: unseemly, evil, Il.

div1.head: αἰσυμνάω
div1.sense: to rule over, c. gen., Eur.

div1.head: αἰσυμνητεία
div1.sense: an elective monarchy, Arist.

div1.head: αἰσυμνητήρ
div1.sense: a prince, Il.

div1.head: αἰσυμνήτης
div1.sense: a regulator of games, a judge or umpire, Od.: a president, manager, Theocr.
an elective prince, Arist.

div1.head: αἶσχος
div1.sense: shame, disgrace, Hom., etc.:—in pl. shameful deeds, Od.
ugliness or deformity, of mind or body, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: αἰσχρήμων
div1.sense: shameful, Anth.

div1.head: αἰσχροκέρδεια
div1.sense: base covetousness, Soph.

div1.head: αἰσχροκερδής
div1.sense: sordidly greedy of gain, Hdt., Eur.—adv. -δῶς, NTest.

div1.head: αἰσχρολογία
div1.sense: foul language, abuse, Xen.

div1.head: αἰσχρόμητις
div1.sense: forming base designs, Aesch.

div1.head: αἰσχροποιός
div1.sense: doing foully, Eur.

div1.head: αἰσχρός
div1.sense: causing shame, abusive, ἔπεα Il.; so in adv., αἰσχρῶς ἐνένισπε Il.
opp. to καλός:
of outward appearance, ugly, ill-favoured, of Thersites, Il.

in moral sense, shameful, disgraceful, base, infamous, Hdt., etc.; αἰσχρόν ἐστι, c. inf., Il.: —τὸ αἰσχρόν, as Subst., dishonour, disgrace, Soph., etc.; τὸ καλὸν καὶ τὸ αἰσχρόν, Lat. honestum et turpe, virtue and vice, Arist.:—adv. shamefully, Sup. αἴσχιστα, Trag.
awkward, Xen.
instead of the regul. comp. and Sup. αἰσχρότερος, -ότατος, the forms αἰσχίων [ῑ], αἴσχιστος (formed from αἶσχος) are used.

div1.head: αἰσχρότης
div1.sense: ugliness, deformity, Plat.

div1.head: αἰσχρουργία
div1.sense: shameless conduct, Eur.

div1.head: αἰσχύνη
div1.sense: shame done one, disgrace, dishonour, Hdt., Attic
a disgrace, of a person, Aesch.
shame for an ill deed, personified in Aesch.
generally, like αἰδώς, shame, the sense of shame, Soph., etc.

div1.head: αἰσχυντέον
div1.sense: one must be ashamed, Xen.

div1.head: αἰσχυντηλός
div1.sense: bashful, modest, Plat.

div1.head: αἰσχυντήρ
div1.sense: a dishonourer, Aesch.

div1.head: αἰσχυντικός
div1.sense: shameful, Arist.

div1.head: αἰσχύνω
div1.sense: to make ugly, disfigure, mar, πρόσωπον, κόμην Il.
in moral sense, to dishonour, tarnish, γένος πατέρων Il., etc.
to dishonour a woman, Aesch., etc.
Pass. to be dishonoured, νέκυς ᾐσχυμμένος, of Patroclus, Il.
to be ashamed, feel shame, absol., Od., Hdt., etc.

to be ashamed at a thing, c. acc. rei, Od., etc.; also c. dat. rei, Ar., etc.; and with Preps., αἰσχ. ἐπί τινι Xen.; ἔν τινι Thuc.; ὑπέρ τινος Dem.:—c. part to be ashamed at doing a thing, Aesch., Soph., etc.:—but c. inf. to be ashamed to do a thing, Hdt., etc.
c. acc. pers. to feel shame before one, Eur., etc.

div1.head: ἀΐτας
div1.sense: Doric word for a beloved youth, favourite, Theocr.: generally a lover, Anth.

div1.head: αἰτέω
div1.sense: to ask, beg, Od., etc.

c. acc. rei, to ask for, crave, demand, Hom., etc.; ὁδὸν αἰτ. to beg oneʼs departure, i. e. ask leave to depart, Od.:—c. acc. pers. et rei, to ask a person for a thing, Hom., etc.; δίκας αἰτ. τινὰ φόνου to demand satisfaction from one for murder, Hdt.
c. acc. pers. et inf. to ask one to do, Od., etc.
Mid. to ask for oneself, to claim, Aesch., etc.:—but often used just like Act.
Pass.:
of persons, to have a thing begged of one, Hdt., Thuc.
of things, to be asked, τὸ αἰτεόμενον Hdt., etc.

div1.head: αἴτημα
div1.sense: a request, demand, Plat., NTest.

div1.head: αἴτησις
div1.sense: a request, demand, Hdt.

div1.head: αἰτητέον
div1.sense: one must ask, Xen.

div1.head: αἰτητικός
div1.sense: fond of asking, c. gen., Arist.

div1.head: αἰτητός
div1.sense: asked for, Soph.

div1.head: αἰτιάζομαι
div1.sense: to be accused, Xen.

div1.head: αἰτίαμα
div1.sense: a charge, guilt imputed, λαβεῖν ἐπʼ αἰτιάματί τινα Aesch.; τοιοῖσδε ἐπʼ αἰτιάμασιν on such charges, Aesch.

div1.head: αἰτιάομαι
div1.sense: to charge, accuse, censure, blame, c. acc. pers., τάχα κεν καὶ ἀναίτιον αἰτιόωιτο Il.; αἰτ. τινά τινος to accuse of a thing, Hdt., etc.;—c. inf., αἰτ. τινα ποιεῖν τι to accuse one of doing, Hdt.:—in this signf., certain tenses are used in pass. sense, to be accused, aor1 ἠιτιάθην Thuc., Xen.; perf. ἠιτίαμαι Thuc.
c. acc. rei, to lay to oneʼs charge, impute, τοῦτο αἰτ. Xen.; ταῦτα Dem.; c. dupl. acc., τί ταῦτα τοὺς Λάκωνας αἰτιώμεθα; Ar.
to allege as the cause, αἰτ. τινα αἴτιον Plat.; φωνάς τε καὶ ἄλλα μυρία αἰτ. Plat.; τῆς ἱερᾶς χώρας ἠιτιᾶτο εἶναι he alleged that it was part of the sacred territory, Dem.

div1.head: αἰτία
div1.sense: a charge, accusation, Lat. crimen, and then the guilt or fault implied in such accusation, Pind., Hdt.:—Phrases: αἰτίαν ἔχειν to be accused, τινός of a thing, Pind., etc.;—reversely, αἰτία ἔχει με Pind.; ἐν αἰτίαι εἶναι or γίγνεσθαι Xen., etc.; αἰτίαν ὑπέχειν to lie under a charge, Plat.; αἰτίαν φέρεσθαι Thuc.; αἰτίαις ἐνέχεσθαι Plat.:—opp. to these are ἐν αἰτίαι ἔχειν or διʼ αἰτίας to hold one guilty, accuse, Hdt., Thuc., etc.; ἐν αἰτίαι βάλλειν Soph.; αἰτίαν νέμειν τινί Soph., etc.
in good sense, εἰ εὖ πράξαιμεν, αἰτία θεοῦ the credit is his, Aesch.; οἳ ἔχουσι ταύτην τὴν αἰτίαν who have this as their characteristic, Plat.
expostulation, μὴ ἐπʼ ἔχθραι τὸ πλέον ἢ αἰτίαι Thuc.
a cause, Lat. causa, Plat., etc.; dat. αἰτίαι, like Lat. causa, for the sake of, κοινοῦ ἀγαθοῦ Thuc.
an occasion, opportunity, αἰτίαν παρέχειν Luc.
the head under which a thing comes, Dem.

div1.head: αἰτιατέον
div1.sense: one must accuse, Xen.
one must allege as the cause, Plat.

div1.head: αἰτίζω
div1.sense: to ask, beg, c. acc. rei, σῖτον Od.
c. acc. pers. to beg of, μνηστῆρας Od.
absol., αἰτίζων βόσκειν ἣν γαστέρα to fill oneʼs belly by begging, Od.

div1.head: αἰτιολογικός
div1.sense: inquiring into causes: τὸ αἰτιολογικόν, investigation of causes, Strab.

div1.head: αἴτιος
div1.sense: to blame, blameworthy, culpable, Il., etc.: comp., αἰτιώτερος more culpable, Thuc.; Sup., τοὺς αἰτιωτάτους the most guilty, Hdt.; τινος for a thing, Hdt.
as Subst., αἴτιος, ὁ, the accused, culprit, Lat. reus, Aesch., etc.; οἱ αἴτιοι τοῦ πατρός they who have sinned against my father, Aesch.:—c. gen. rei, οἱ αἴτ. τοῦ φόνου those guilty of murder, Aesch.
being the cause, responsible for, c. gen. rei, Hdt., etc.; c. inf., Soph.: Sup., αἰτιώτατος ναυμαχῆσαι mainly instrumental in causing the seafight, Thuc.
αἴτιον, τό, a cause, Plat., etc.

div1.head: Αἰτναῖος
div1.sense: of or belonging to Etna (Αἴτνη), Pind., Aesch., etc.
metaph. like Etna, enormous, Eur.; some explain it so when used of horses, but better Etnean, i. e. Sicilian (for the Sicilian horses were famous), Soph.

div1.head: αἰφνίδιος
div1.sense: unforeseen, sudden, Aesch., Thuc.:—adv. -ίως, Thuc.; also -ιον Plut.

div1.head: αἰχμάζω
div1.sense: to throw the spear, Il.; ἔνδον αἰχμάζειν to play the warrior at home, Aesch.
to arm with the spear, ἤιχμασας χέρα Soph.

div1.head: αἰχμαλωσία
div1.sense: captivity: a body of captives, Diod., NTest.

div1.head: αἰχμαλωτεύω
div1.sense: to take prisoner, NTest.

div1.head: αἰχμαλωτικός
div1.sense: of or for a prisoner, Eur.

div1.head: αἰχμάλωτος
div1.sense: taken by the spear, captive to oneʼs spear, taken prisoner, Hdt., etc.; αἰχμάλωτον λαμβάνειν, ἄγειν to take prisoner, Xen.; αἰχμ. γίγνεσθαι to be taken, Xen.; τὰ αἰχμάλωτα booty, Xen.
= αἰχμαλωτικός, δουλοσύνη αἰχμ. such as awaits a captive, Hdt., Aesch.

div1.head: αἰχμήεις
div1.sense: armed with the spear, Aesch.

div1.head: αἰχμή
div1.sense: the point of a spear, Lat. cuspis, Il., etc.
a spear, Il., etc.; τοξουλκὸς αἰχμή, of an arrow, Aesch.
a body of spearmen, Pind., Eur.; cf. ἀσπίς.
war, battle, κακῶς ἡ αἰχμὴ ἐστήκεε the war went ill, Hdt.
warlike spirit, mettle, Pind.; so, in Aesch., γυναικὸς or γυναικεία αἰχμά seems to be a womanʼs spirit.
a sceptre, Aesch.

div1.head: αἰχμητής
div1.sense: a spearman, Hom.
In Pind. as adj.,
pointed, κεραυνός.
warlike, θυμός.

div1.head: αἰχμοφόρος
div1.sense: one who trails a pike, a spearman, Hdt.:—esp. like δορυφόρος, of body-guards, Hdt.

div1.head: αἶψα
div1.sense: quick, with speed, on a sudden, Hom.

div1.head: αἰψηροκέλευθος
div1.sense: swift-speeding, of Boreas, Hes.

div1.head: αἰψηρός
div1.sense: quick, speedy, in haste, Hom.

div1.head: ἀΐω
div1.sense: to perceive by the ear, to hear, c. acc. rei, Il.; c. gen., Trag.:—also to perceive by the eye, to see, Od.
to listen to, give ear to, δίκης Hes.: to obey, Aesch.; cf. ἐπαΐω.
div1.etym: Hom. has αιω; but ᾱιεις, ᾱιων Soph.

div1.head: ἀΐω
div1.sense: to breathe, only in imperf., ἐπεὶ φίλον ἄϊον ἦτορ when I was breathing out my life, Il.

div1.head: αἰώνιος
div1.sense: lasting for an age (αἰών 3), Plat.: ever-lasting, eternal, Plat.

div1.head: αἰών
div1.sense: a period of existence:
oneʼs life-time, life, Hom. and Attic Poets.
an age, generation, Aesch.; ὁ μέλλων αἰών posterity, Dem.
a long space of time, an age, ἀπʼ αἰῶνος of old, for ages, Hes., NTest.; τὸν διʼ αἰῶνος χρόνον for ever, Aesch.; ἅπαντα τὸν αἰ. Lycurg.
a definite space of time, an era, epoch, age, period, ὁ αἰὼν οὗτος this present world, opp. to ὁ μέλλων, NTest.:—hence its usage in pl., εἰς τοὺς αἰῶνας for ever, NTest.

div1.head: αἰώρα
div1.sense: a machine for suspending bodies: a noose for hanging, a halter, Soph. in the form ἐώρα).
suspension in the air, oscillation, plat.

div1.head: αἰωρέω
div1.sense: to lift up, raise, ὑγρὸν νῶτον αἰωρεῖ, of the eagle raising his feathers, Pind.; τοὺς ὄφεις ὑπὲρ τῆς κεφαλῆς αἰωρῶν Dem.:—cf. ἐωρέω.
to hang, Plut., Luc.
Pass. to be hung, hang, Hdt.; αἰωρουμένων τῶν ὀστῶν being raised, lifted, Plat.; αἷμα ἠιωρεῖτο spouted up, Bion.
to hang suspended, float in air, hover, oscillate, Soph., Plat.
metaph. to be in suspense, Thuc.; αἰωρεῖσθαι ἐν ἄλλοις to depend upon others, Plat.; αἰωρηθεὶς ὑπὲρ μεγάλων playing for a high stake, Hdt.

div1.head: αἰώρημα
div1.sense: that which is hung up: a hanging cord, a halter, Eur.

div1.head: αἰωρητός
div1.sense: a hovering, Anth.

div1.head: Ἀκαδήμεια
div1.sense: the Academy, a gymnasium near Athens, where Plato taught: hence Platonic philosophers were called Ἀκαδημικοί, Academics.

div1.head: ἀκαθαρσία
div1.sense: uncleanness, impurity, Dem.

div1.head: ἀκάθαρτος
div1.sense: uncleansed, unclean, impure, Plat.:—adv., ἀκαθάρτως ἔχειν Plat.
of things, not purged away, Soph.

div1.head: ἄκαινα
div1.sense: a thorn, goad, Anth.

div1.head: ἀκαιρία
div1.sense: unfitness of times: unseasonableness, Plat.
want of opportunity, τὴν ἀκαιρίαν τὴν ἐκείνου καιρὸν ὑμέτερον νομίσαντες Dem.

div1.head: ἄκαιρος
div1.sense: ill-timed, unseasonable, inopportune, ἐς ἄκαιρα πονεῖν, Lat. operam perdere, Theogn.; οὐκ ἄκαιρα λέγειν Aesch.; ἄκ. προθυμία Thuc.:—adv. -ρως, Aesch., etc.; neut. pl. as adv., Eur.
of persons, importunate, Lat. molestus, Theophr.

div1.head: ἀκάκης
div1.sense: poet. for ἄκακος, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀκάκητα
div1.sense: guileless, gracious, epith. of Hermes, Hom., Hes.

div1.head: ἀκακία
div1.sense: guilelessness, Dem., etc.

div1.head: ἄκακος
div1.sense: unknowing of ill, guileless, Aesch., Plat.
innocent, simple, Dem.:—adv. -κως, Plat.

div1.head: ἀκαλαρρείτης
div1.sense: soft-flowing, of Ocean, Hom.

div1.head: ἀκαλήφη
div1.sense: a nettle, Lat. urtica, Ar.

div1.head: ἀκαλλής
div1.sense: without charms, Luc.

div1.head: ἀκαλλιέρητος
div1.sense: ill-omened, ἱερά Aeschin.

div1.head: ἀκαλλώπιστος
div1.sense: unadorned, Luc.

div1.head: ἀκάλυπτος
div1.sense: uncovered, unveiled, Soph.

div1.head: ἀκαμαντολόγχας
div1.sense: unwearied at the spear, Pind.

div1.head: ἀκαμαντομάχας
div1.sense: unwearied in fight, Pind.

div1.head: ἀκαμαντόπους
div1.sense: untiring of foot, unwearied, Pind.

div1.head: ἀκάμας
div1.sense: untiring, unresting, Il., etc.

div1.head: ἀκάματος
div1.sense: without sense of toil: hence — untiring, unresting, Hom.; ἀκ. γῆ earth that never rests from tillage, Soph.:—neut. ἀκάματα, as adv., Soph.
div1.etym: ἀκάματος, Soph.; but ἀ_κάματος in dactylics.

div1.head: ἄκαμπτος
div1.sense: unbent, that will not bend, rigid, Plat.:—metaph. unbending, unflinching, inexorable, Pind.; ψυχὰν ἄκαμπτος Pind.; ἀκάμπτωι μένει Aesch.; ἄκαμπτον Plut.

div1.head: ἄκανθα
div1.sense: a thorn, prickle, Theocr., etc.
a prickly plant, thistle; in pl. thistledown, Od.:—also a kind of acacia, Hdt.
the backbone or spine of animals, Hdt., etc.
metaph., ἄκανθαι, thorny questions, Luc.

div1.head: ἀκάνθινος
div1.sense: of thorns, NTest.
of acacia wood, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀκανθίς
div1.sense: a bird, the goldfinch, or the linnet, Arist., Theocr.
as fem. adj. prickly, Anth.

div1.head: ἀκανθοβάτης
div1.sense: walking among thorns, nickname of grammarians, Anth.:—fem. ἀκανθοβάτις, ιδος, Anth.

div1.head: ἀκανθολόγος
div1.sense: gathering thorns, nickname of quibblers, Anth.

div1.head: ἄκανθος
div1.sense: Lat. acanthus, brank-ursine, a plant imitated in Corinthian capitals, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀκανθώδης
div1.sense: full of thorns, thorny, Hdt.
metaph., λόγοι ἀκ. thorny arguments, Luc.

div1.head: ἄκαπνος
div1.sense: without smoke, θυσία ἄκαπνος an offering but no burnt offering, Luc.; a poem is called Καλλιόπης ἄκαπνον θύος Anth.

div1.head: ἀκᾶ
div1.sense: softly, gently, Pind.

div1.head: ἀκάρδιος
div1.sense: wanting the heart, Plut.

div1.head: ἀκάρηνος
div1.sense: headless, Anth.

div1.head: ἀκαρής
div1.sense: of hair, too short to be cut, very short: mostly in neut. ἀκαρές,
of Time, a moment, ἐν ἀκαρεῖ χρόνου Ar.; ἀκαρῆ διαλιπὼν (sc. χρόνον) having waited a moment, Ar.; ἀκαρὲς ὥρας a moment, Plut.
the acc. ἀκαρῆ is used adverbially without reference to Time, οὐκ ἀκαρῆ or οὐδʼ ἀκαρῆ not a bit, Ar.

div1.head: ἀκαριαῖος
div1.sense: momentary, brief, Dem., etc.

div1.head: ἀκαρπία
div1.sense: unfruitfulness, barrenness, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀκάρπιστος
div1.sense: where nothing is to be reaped, unfruitful, of the sea, like ἀτρύγετος, Eur.

div1.head: ἄκαρπος
div1.sense: without fruit, barren, Eur.
metaph. fruitless, unprofitable, Eur.:—adv. -πως, Soph.
act. making barren, blasting, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀκάρπωτος
div1.sense: not made fruitful, without fruit: of an oracle, fruitless, unfulfilled, Aesch.; νίκας ἀκάρπωτον χάριν because of victory which yielded no fruit, Soph.

div1.head: ἀκασκαῖος
div1.sense: gentle, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀκατάβλητος
div1.sense: not to be overthrown, irrefragable, Ar.

div1.head: ἀκατάγνωστος
div1.sense: not to be condemned, NTest.

div1.head: ἀκατακάλυπτος
div1.sense: uncovered, NTest.

div1.head: ἀκατάκριτος
div1.sense: uncondemned, NTest.

div1.head: ἀκατάλλακτος
div1.sense: irreconcileable:— adv. -τως, ἀκαταλλάκτως πολεμεῖν Dem.

div1.head: ἀκατάλυτος
div1.sense: indissoluble, NTest.

div1.head: ἀκατάστατος
div1.sense: unstable, unsettled, Dem.

div1.head: ἀκατάσχετος
div1.sense: not to be checked:— adv. -τως, Plut.

div1.head: ἀκαταφρόνητος
div1.sense: not to be despised, important, Lat. haud spernendus, Xen., Plut., etc.

div1.head: ἀκατάψευστος
div1.sense: not fabulous, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀκάτιον
div1.sense: a light boat, Thuc., etc.
a small sail, perh. a top-sail, Xen., Luc.

div1.head: ἄκατος
div1.sense: a light vessel, Lat. actuaria, Hdt., etc.; cf. ἀκάτιον.
generally, a ship, Eur.

div1.head: ἄκαυστος
div1.sense: unburnt, Xen.

div1.head: ἀκαχίζω
div1.sense: to trouble, grieve, τινά Od.:—Pass., μὴ λίην ἀκαχίζεο θυμῶι be not troubled in mind, Il.; μήτι θανὼν ἀκαχίζευ be not grieved at death, Od.

div1.head: ἀκαχμένος
div1.sense: a part. (as if from a Verb *ἄκω, v. ἀκή Ι), sharpened, of axes and swords, Hom.

div1.head: ἀκέλευστος
div1.sense: unbidden, Trag., Plat.

div1.head: ἀκέντητος
div1.sense: needing no goad or spur, Pind.

div1.head: ἄκεντρος
div1.sense: without sting, stingless, Plat.

div1.head: ἀκέομαι
div1.etym: The form ἀκέο is for ἀκέεο.
div1.sense: trans. to heal, cure, ἕλκος ἄκεσσαι heal the sore, Il.; or of part healed, βλέφαρον ἀκέσαιο Eur.; also to heal a person, Il.
to stanch, quench, δίψαν Il.
generally, to mend, repair, νῆας Od.; applied to a tailor or cobbler, like Lat. resarcire, Luc.
metaph. to repair, make amends for, ἁμαρτάδα Hdt.; κακόν Soph.:—absol. to make amends, ἀλλʼ ἀκεώμεθα, ἀλλʼ ἀκέσασθε Hom.

div1.head: ἀκέραιος
div1.sense: unmixed, pure in blood, Eur.

entire, unharmed, unravaged, of cities or countries, Hdt., Thuc.; ἀκ. δύναμις an army in full force, Thuc.; ἀκ. λέχος inviolate, Eur.; of persons, uncontaminated, guileless, Eur.: c. gen., ἀκέραιος κακῶν ἠθῶν uncontaminated by bad habits, Plat.

div1.head: ἀκεραύνωτος
div1.sense: not lightning-struck, Luc.

div1.head: ἀκέρδεια
div1.sense: want of gain, loss, Pind.

div1.head: ἀκερδής
div1.sense: without gain, bringing loss, Soph., Plat.
not greedy of gain, Plut.

div1.head: ἀκέρκιστος
div1.sense: unwoven, Anth.

div1.head: ἄκερκος
div1.sense: without a tail, Arist.

div1.head: ἀκερματία
div1.sense: want of money, Ar.

div1.head: ἀκερσεκόμης
div1.sense: with unshorn hair (the Greek youths wore their hair long till they reached manhood), epith. of Phoebus, Il., etc.

div1.head: ἀκέρωτος
div1.sense: not horned, Anth.

div1.head: ἄκεσις
div1.sense: a healing, cure, Hdt.

div1.head: ἄκεσμα
div1.sense: a remedy, cure, Pind., Aesch.

div1.head: ἀκεστήρ
div1.sense: a healer: metaph. as adj., ἀκ. χαλινός the rein that tames the steed, Soph.

div1.head: ἀκεστής
div1.sense: ἀκεσταὶ ἱματίων ῥαγέντων menders of torn clothes, Xen.

div1.head: ἀκεστορία
div1.sense: the healing art, Anth.

div1.head: ἀκεστός
div1.sense: curable:— metaph., easily revived, Il.

div1.head: ἀκέστρα
div1.sense: a darning-needle, Luc.

div1.head: ἀκέστρια
div1.sense: a sempstress, Luc.

div1.head: ἀκέστωρ
div1.sense: a healer, saviour, Eur.

div1.head: ἀκεσφόρος
div1.sense: bringing a cure, healing, Eur.

div1.head: ἀκεσώδυνος
div1.sense: allaying pain, Anth.

div1.head: ἀκέφαλος
div1.sense: without head, Hdt.
without beginning, λόγος Plat.

div1.head: ἀκέων
div1.sense: a participial form, used as adv. like ἀκήν, softly, silently, Hom.; also dual ἀκέοντε Od. —Though ἀκέουσα occurs in Hom., yet ἀκέων stands with fem., Ἀθηναίη ἀκέων ἦν Il.; and though he has dual ἀκέοντε, yet ἀκέων occurs with pl. Verbs.

div1.head: ἀκήδεστος
div1.sense: uncared for, unburied, Il.: adv., -τως, without due rites of burial, or (perh.) without care for others, recklessly, remorselessly, Il.

div1.head: ἀκήδευτος
div1.sense: unburied, Plut.

div1.head: ἀκηδέω
div1.sense: to take no care for, no heed of, c. gen., Il., Aesch.

div1.head: ἀκηδής
div1.sense: pass. uncared for, unburied, Hom.
act. without care or sorrow, careless, heedless, Hom.

div1.head: ἀκήλητος
div1.sense: to be won by no charms, proof against enchantment, inexorable, Od., Soph.

div1.head: ἄκημα
div1.sense: a cure, relief, ὀδυνάων for pains, Il.

div1.head: ἀκήν
div1.sense: softly, silently, Il.

div1.head: ἀκή
div1.sense: a Subst. cited in two senses,
a point, (whence ἀκίς, ἄκων, ἀκόνη, ἀκαχμένος, ἀκωκή, αἰχμή; cf. Lat. acus, acuo, acies).
silence, calm, (whence ἀκήν, ἀκέων, ἀκασκαῖος, ἦκα): a lulling, healing (whence ἀκέομαι).

div1.head: ἀκηράσιος
div1.sense: unmixed, οἶνος Od.
untouched, Lat. integer, ἀκ. λειμῶνες meadows not yet grazed or mown, Hhymn.; ἄνθος ἀκ. fresh, Anth.

div1.head: ἀκήρατος
div1.sense: unmixed, uncontaminated, undefiled, ὕδωρ Il.; ποτόν Aesch.; ὄμβρος Soph.; ἀκ. χρυσός pure gold, Hdt.
metaph.,
of things, untouched, unhurt, undamaged, Lat. integer, Hom.; ἀκ. κόμη unshorn hair, Eur.; ἀκ. λειμών an unmown meadow, Eur., etc.
of persons, undefiled, Eur.; c. dat., ἀκήρατος ἄλγεσι untouched by woes, Eur.; c. gen., ἀκ. κακῶν without taint of ill, Eur.

div1.head: ἀκήριος
div1.sense: unharmed by the Κῆρες, unharmed, Od.
act. unharming, harmless, Hhymn., Hes.
(κῆρ) without heart, i. e.,
lifeless, Il.
heartless, spiritless, Il.

div1.head: ἀκηρυκτεί
div1.sense: without needing a flag of truce, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀκήρυκτος
div1.sense: unannounced, unproclaimed, ἀκ. πόλεμος a sudden war, Hdt.; but also a war in which no herald was admitted, implacable, Xen., Dem.:—adv. -τως, without needing a flag of truce, Thuc.
not proclaimed by heralds, inglorious, Eur.
with no tidings, not heard of, Soph.

div1.head: ἀκήρωτος
div1.sense: unwaxed, Luc.

div1.head: ἀκίβδηλος
div1.sense: unadulterated, genuine, Plat., Luc.
metaph. of men, guileless, honest, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀκιδνός
div1.sense: weak, feeble, faint, Hom. always in the comp., ἀκιδνότερος Od.

div1.head: ἄκικυς
div1.sense: powerless, feeble, Od.

div1.head: ἀκινάκης
div1.sense: Persian word, a short straight sword, Hdt., who declines it -εος, -εϊ, -εα; but Xen. has ἀκινάκην, ἀκινάκας as acc. sg. and pl.

div1.head: ἀκίνδυνος
div1.sense: without danger, free from danger, Eur., Thuc., etc.
adv. -νως, Eur., etc.: comp., ἀκινδυνότερον with less danger, Plat.; Sup., ἀκινδυνότατα most free from danger, Xen.

div1.head: ἀκίνητος
div1.sense: unmoved, motionless, of Delos, Orac. ap. Hdt.; ἐξ ἀκινήτου ποδός without stirring a step, Soph.
idle, sluggish, Ar.
unmoved, unaltered, of laws, Thuc., etc.
immovable, hard to move, Plat., Luc.:—adv., ἀκινήτως ἔχειν to be immovable, Plat., etc.
not to be stirred or touched, inviolate, Lat. non movendus, τάφος Hdt.: proverb. of sacred things, κινεῖν τὰ ἀκίνητα Hdt.; also τἀκίνητα φράσαι Soph.
of persons, not to be shaken, steadfast, stubborn, Soph.

div1.head: ἄκιος
div1.sense: not worm-eaten: Sup. ἀκιώτατος Hes.

div1.head: ἀκίς
div1.sense: a point, the barb of an arrow or hook, Plut., Anth.:—an arrow, dart, Ar.
metaph., πόθων ἀκίδες the stings of desire, Anth.

div1.head: ἀκίχητος
div1.sense: not to be reached, unattainable, Il.
of persons, not to be reached by prayer, inexorable, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀκκίζομαι
div1.sense: to affect indifference or coyness, dissemble, Plat.

div1.head: ἀκκώ
div1.sense: a bugbear or a silly woman.

div1.head: ἄκλαστος
div1.sense: unbroken, Anth.

div1.head: ἄκλαυτος
div1.sense: unlamented, Hom.: (κλαίω):
pass. unwept, φίλων by friends, Soph.; ἄκλαυτα τέκνα, i. e. children not liable to death, Eur.
act. not weeping, tearless, Od.
Soph. = χαίρων, with impunity.

div1.head: ἀκλεής
div1.sense: without fame, inglorious, unsung, Hom., etc. adv. ἀκλεῶς, Hdt., Epic ἀκλειῶς, Il., etc.: also neut. ἀκλεές as adv., Il.

div1.head: ἀκλεΐα
div1.sense: ingloriousness, Anth.

div1.head: ἄκλειστος
div1.sense: not closed or fastened, Eur., Thuc.

div1.head: ἄκληρος
div1.sense: without lot or portion, poor, needy, Od., Xen., etc.: c. gen. without lot or share in a thing, Aesch., etc.
unallotted, without an owner, Eur.

div1.head: ἀκλήρωτος
div1.sense: without lot or portion in a thing, c. gen., Pind.

div1.head: ἄκλητος
div1.sense: uncalled, unbidden, Aesch., etc.

div1.head: ἀκλινής
div1.sense: bending to neither side, unswerving, Plat.: steadfast, regular, Anth., etc.:— adv. -νῶς, Ionic -νέως, Anth.

div1.head: ἄκλυστος
div1.sense: unwashed by waves, Plut., etc.; as fem., Αὖλιν ἀκλύσταν Eur.

div1.head: ἀκμάζω
div1.sense: to be in full bloom, be at oneʼs prime or perfection,
of persons, cities and states, Hdt., etc.
c. dat. to flourish or abound in a thing, πλούτωι Hdt.; παρασκευῆι Thuc.
c. inf. to be strong enough to do, Xen.
of things, ἀκμάζει ὁ πόλεμος, ἡ νόσος the war, the plague is at its height, Thuc.; ἀκμάζον θέρος mid-summer, Thuc.; of corn, to be just ripe, Thuc.
impers. ἀκμάζει, c. inf., it is high time to do, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀκμαῖος
div1.sense: in full bloom, at the prime, blooming, vigorous, Aesch.; ἀκμαῖος φύσιν in the prime of strength, Aesch.
in time, in season, Lat. opportunus, Soph.

div1.head: ἀκμηνός
div1.sense: full-grown, Od.

div1.head: ἄκμηνος
div1.sense: fasting, Il.; c. gen., ἄκμηνος σίτοιο fasting from food, Il.

div1.head: ἀκμή
div1.sense: a point, edge: proverb., ἐπὶ ξυροῦ ἀκμῆς on the rasorʼs edge (v. ξυρόν) ; ἀμφιδέξιοι ἀκμαί the fingers of both hands, Soph.; ποδοῖν ἀκμαί the toes, Soph.

the highest point of anything, the bloom, flower, prime, of manʼs age, Lat. flos aetatis, ἀκμὴ ἥβης Soph.; ἀκμὴ βίου Xen.; ἐν ἀκμῆι εἶναι ἀκμάζειν, Plat.; ἀκμὴν ἔχειν, of corn, to be ripe, Thuc.; also of time, ἀ. ἦρος the spring-prime, Pind.; ἀ. θέρους mid-summer, Xen.; ἀ. τῆς δόξης Thuc.; periphr. like βία, ἀκμὴ Θησειδᾶν Soph.

like καιρός, the best, most fitting time, Trag.; ἔργων, λόγων ἀκμή the time for doing, speaking, Soph.; ἀκμή ἐστι, c. inf., ʼtis high time to do, Aesch.; ἐπʼ ἀκμῆς εἶναι, c. inf., to be on the point of doing, Eur.; ἐπʼ αὐτὴν ἥκει τὴν ἀκμήν ʼtis come to the critical time, Dem.
ἀκμήν, acc. of ἀκμή, used as adv., just, Xen.
yet, still, Theocr., NTest.

div1.head: ἀκμής
div1.sense: untiring, unwearied, Il., Soph.

div1.head: ἄκμων
div1.sense: orig. prob. a thunderbolt, ἄκμων οὐρανόθεν κατιών Hes.
an anvil, Hom., etc.: metaph., λόγχης ἄκμονες very anvils to bear blows, Aesch.

div1.head: ἄκνηστις
div1.sense: the spine or backbone, Od.

div1.head: ἄκνισος
div1.sense: without the fat of sacrifices, Anth.

div1.head: ἀκοή
div1.sense: a hearing, the sound heard, Il.
the thing heard, hearsay, report, news, tidings, μετὰ πατρὸς ἀκουήν in quest of tidings of his father, Od.; ἀκοῆι ἱστορεῖν, παραλαβεῖν τι to know by hearsay, Hdt.; so, ἐξ ἀκοῆς λέγειν Plat.
the sense of hearing, Hdt., etc.
the act of hearing, hearing, ἀκοῆι κλύειν, ἀκοαῖς δέχεσθαι, εἰς ἀκοὰς ἔρχεταί τι Soph., Eur.; διʼ ἀκοῆς αἰσθάνεσθαι Plat.
the ear, Sapph., Aesch.

div1.head: ἀκοίμητος
div1.sense: sleepless, of the sea, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀκοινώνητος
div1.sense: not shared with another, c. dat., Eur.
act. having no share of or in, c. gen., Plat.: absol. unsocial, inhuman, Plat.

div1.head: ἄκοιτις
div1.sense: a spouse, wife, Hom., etc.

div1.head: ἀκολασία
div1.sense: licentiousness, intemperance, Thuc., etc.

div1.head: ἀκολασταίνω
div1.sense: to be licentious, intemperate, Ar., Plat., etc.

div1.head: ἀκολάστημα
div1.sense: an act of ἀκολασία, Plut.

div1.head: ἀκόλαστος
div1.sense: Lat. non castigatus, unchastised, undisciplined, unbridled, Hdt., Attic, etc.
licentious, intemperate, opp. to σώφρων, Soph., etc.:— so in adv., ἀκολάστως ἔχειν Plat.; comp., ἀκολαστοτέρως ἔχειν πρός τι to be too intemperate in a thing, Xen.

div1.head: ἄκολος
div1.sense: a bit, morsel, Od.

div1.head: ἀκολουθέω
div1.sense: to follow one, go after or with him, c. dat. pers., Ar., etc.; also, ἀκ. μετά τινος Plat.; σύν τινι Xen.; κατόπιν τινός Ar.:— absol., Plat., etc.
metaph. to follow, obey, τινι Thuc., etc.; ἀκ. τοῖς πράγμασιν to follow circumstances, Dem.
to follow the thread of a discourse, Plat.
of things, to follow upon, be consequent upon, τοῖς εἰρημένοις Plat.

div1.head: ἀκολουθητέον
div1.sense: one must follow, Xen., etc.

div1.head: ἀκολουθία
div1.sense: a following, train, Soph., Plat.
a following upon, conformity with, τοῖς πράγμασι Plat.

div1.head: ἀκόλουθος
div1.sense: following, attending on; as Subst. a follower, attendant, Lat. pedisequus, Ar., Thuc., etc.; οἱ ἀκόλουθοι the camp-followers, Xen.
following after, c. gen., Νηρήιδων ἀκ. Soph.
following or consequent upon, in conformity with, c. gen., Ar.; also c. dat., Plat.:—absol. agreeing with one another, Xen., etc.:— adv. -θως, in accordance with, τοῖς νόμοις Dem.

div1.head: ἀκόλυμβος
div1.sense: unable to swim, Batr., Plut.

div1.head: ἀκομιστία
div1.sense: want of tending or care, Od.

div1.head: ἀκόμιστος
div1.sense: untended.

div1.head: ἄκομος
div1.sense: without hair, bald, Luc.

div1.head: ἀκόμπαστος
div1.sense: not boastful, Aesch.

div1.head: ἄκομπος
div1.sense: not boasting, Aesch.

div1.head: ἄκομψος
div1.sense: unadorned, boorish, ἐγὼ δʼ ἄκομψος rude I am in speech," Eur.

div1.head: ἀκονάω
div1.sense: to sharpen, whet, μαχαίρας Ar.; λόγχην Xen.:—Mid., ἀκονᾶσθαι μαχαίρας to sharpen their swords, Ar.

div1.head: ἀκόνδυλος
div1.sense: without knuckles:—without blows, Luc.

div1.head: ἀκόνη
div1.sense: a whetstone, hone, Pind., etc.

div1.head: ἀκονιτικός
div1.sense: made of aconite, Xen.

div1.head: ἀκονιτί
div1.sense: without the dust of the arena, i. e. without a struggle, without effort, Lat. sine pulvere, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: ἀκόνιτον
div1.sense: aconite, a poisonous plant, Theophr.

div1.head: ἀκοντίζω
div1.sense: to hurl a javelin, τινός at one, Il.; ἐπί τινι Il.:—the weapon is put in dat., ἀκόντισε δουρί darted with his spear, Il.; also in acc., ἀκόντισαν ὀξέα δοῦρα darted their spears, Od.
c. acc. pers. to hit with a javelin, Hdt., etc.; Pass. to be so hit or wounded, Eur., Xen.
to shoot forth rays, of the moon, Eur.
intr. to pierce, εἴσω γῆς Eur.

div1.head: ἀκόντιον
div1.etym: Dim. of ἄκων, Hhymn., Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἀκοντί
div1.etym: adverb of ἄκων, contr. for ἀεκοντί, Plut.

div1.head: ἀκόντισις
div1.sense: javelin-throwing, Xen.

div1.head: ἀκόντισμα
div1.sense: a javelinʼs throw, Xen.
the thing thrown, a dart, javelin, Plut.
in pl. = ἀκοντισταί, Plut.

div1.head: ἀκοντιστής
div1.sense: a darter, javelin-man, Hom., Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἀκοντιστικός
div1.sense: skilled in throwing the javelin, Xen.

div1.head: ἀκοντιστύς
div1.sense: the game of throwing the javelin, Il.

div1.head: ἄκοπος
div1.sense: without weariness, and so,
pass. untired, Plat.
act. not wearying, of a horse, easy, Xen.
removing weariness, refreshing, Plat.

div1.head: ἀκόρεστος
div1.sense: insatiate, Trag.; c. gen. insatiate in a thing, Aesch.:—in Soph. (πάντων ἀκορέστατος, most insatiate, most shameless), the word is either sync. for ἀκορεστότατος, or Sup. of ἀκορής, ἀκόρεστος.
of things,
insatiate, unceasing, Lat. improbus, Trag.
act. not satiating, Aesch.
not liable to surfeit, φιλία Xen.

div1.head: ἀκόρητος
div1.sense: insatiate, unsated in or with a thing, c. gen., Il.
(κορέω) unswept, ungrimmed, ungarnished, Ar.

div1.head: ἄκορος
div1.sense: untiring, ceaseless, Lat. improbus, εἰρεσία Pind.

div1.head: ἀκοσμέω
div1.sense: to be disorderly, to offend, Soph., Dem., etc.

div1.head: ἀκόσμητος
div1.sense: unarranged, unorganised, Plat.:—adv. -τως, Plat.
unfurnished with, c. dat., Xen.

div1.head: ἀκοσμία
div1.sense: disorder, Plat.: extravagance, Eur.:—in moral sense, disorderliness, disorderly conduct, Soph.

div1.head: ἄκοσμος
div1.sense: without order, disorderly, Aesch.:—in Hom. of Thersitesʼ words, disorderly:— adv. -μως, Hdt., etc.
κόσμος ἄκοσμος, a world that is no world, Anth.; also of an inappropriate ornament, Anth.

div1.head: ἄκος
div1.sense: a cure, relief, remedy for a thing, c. gen., Od., etc.:—absol., ἄκος εὑρεῖν Il., Soph.; ἐξευρεῖν, λαβεῖν, ποιεῖσθαι, Hdt., etc.:—by a medical metaph., ἄκος ἐντέμνειν, τέμνειν, cf. ἐντέμνω II.
a means of obtaining a thing, c. gen., Eur.

div1.head: ἀκοστάω
div1.sense: only in aor1 part. ἵππος ἀκοστήσας ἐπὶ φάτνηι a horse corn-fed at manger, a stalled horse, Il.

div1.head: ἀκοστή
div1.sense: barley.

div1.head: ἀκουάζομαι
div1.sense: to hearken or listen to, c. gen., Od.; δαιτὸς ἀκουάζεσθον ye are bidden to the feast, Il.

div1.head: ἄκουρος
div1.sense: without male heir, Od.
(κουρά) unshaven, unshorn, Ar.

div1.head: ἀκουσίθεος
div1.sense: heard of God, Anth.

div1.head: ἄκουσμα
div1.sense: a thing heard, such as music, Xen.
a rumour, tale, Soph.

div1.head: ἀκουστέον
div1.sense: one must hear or hearken to, c. gen. pers., Hdt., etc.; c. acc. rei, Plat.
ἀκουστέος, α, ον, to be hearkened to, Soph.

div1.head: ἀκουστός
div1.sense: heard, audible, Hhymn., Plat., etc.
that should be heard, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: ἀκούω
div1.sense: to hear, Hom., etc. —Construct., properly, c. acc. of thing heard, gen. of pers. from whom it is heard, ταῦτα Καλυψοῦς ἤκουσα Od.; the gen. pers. may be omitted, ἀκήκοας λόγον Soph., or the acc. rei, ἄκουε τοῦ θανόντος Soph.:—often however c. gen. rei, to have hearing of a thing.
c. gen. objecti, to hear of, hear tell of, ἀκ. πατρός Od.; so c. acc., Od.:—so, ἀκ. περί τινος.
the pers. from whom the thing is heard takes a prep., ἀκούειν τι ἀπό, ἔκ, παρά, πρός τινος, Il., Attic
to know by hearsay, εἴ που ἀκούεις Od.; so Plat., etc.
absol. to hearken, give ear, to begin a proclamation, ἀκούετε λεώι hear, O people.
to listen to, give ear to, Il.
to obey, c. gen., or more rarely c. dat., Il.
to hear and understand, κλύοντες οὐκ ἤκουον Aesch.

in pass. sense, with an adv., to hear oneself called, be called so and so, like Lat. audire, κακῶς ἀκ. πρός τινος to be ill spoken of by one, Hdt.; εὖ, κακῶς, ἄριστα ἀκ., Lat. bene, male audire, Hdt., Attic
with a Noun, ἀκούειν κακός, καλός Soph., Plat.; κόλακες ἀκούουσι Dem.
c. acc. rei, ἀκ. κακά to have evil spoken of one, Ar.; φήμας κακὰς ἤκουσεν Eur.

div1.head: ἀκράαντος
div1.sense: unfulfilled, fruitless, Lat. irritus, Hom.

div1.head: ἀκραγής
div1.sense: not barking, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀκραής
div1.sense: blowing strongly, fresh-blowing, of the north and west wind, Od.; si ἀκραὲς erit, if it shall be clear weather, Cic.

div1.head: ἀκραῖος
div1.sense: dwelling on the heights, Eur.

div1.head: ἀκραιφνής
div1.sense: unmixed, pure, Eur., Ar.: metaph., πενία ἀκρ. utter poverty, Anth.
unharmed, entire, Lat. integer, Eur., Thuc.
c. gen. untouched by a thing, Soph.

div1.head: ἄκραντος
div1.sense: unfulfilled, fruitless, Pind., Aesch.:—neut. pl. as adv., in vain, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: ἄκρα
div1.sense: a headland, foreland, cape, Hom., etc.
a mountain-top, summit: used by Hom. only in the phrase κατʼ ἄκρης from top to bottom, i. e. utterly, πόλιν αἱρέειν κατʼ ἄκρης Hdt.; so in Attic, κατʼ ἄκρας utterly, Trag., Plat.
the citadel of a city, Lat. arx, Xen.

div1.head: ἀκρασία
div1.sense: bad mixture, ill temperature, Theophr.

div1.head: ἀκράτεια
div1.sense: incontinence, want of self-control, Plat.:—the later form is ἀκρασία.

div1.head: ἀκρατής
div1.sense: powerless, impotent, Soph.
c. gen. rei, not having power or command over a thing, Lat. impotens, γλώσσης Aesch.; ὀργῆς Thuc.:—also, intemperate in the use of a thing, οἴνου Xen., Arist.; περὶ τὰ πόματα Arist.
absol. without command over oneself, incontinent, Lat. impotens sui, Arist.
of things, immoderate, δαπάνη Anth.

div1.head: ἀκρατίζομαι
div1.sense: to drink wine unmixed with water: hence, to breakfast, because this meal consisted of bread dipped in wine, Ar.

div1.head: ἀκράτισμα
div1.sense: a breakfast, Arist.

div1.head: ἀκράτιστος
div1.sense: having breakfasted, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀκρατοποσία
div1.sense: a drinking of sheer wine, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀκρατοπότης
div1.sense: a drinker of sheer wine, Hdt.

div1.head: ἄκρατος
div1.sense: of liquids, unmixed, sheer, of wine, Od.:—esp., οἶνος ἄκρητος wine without water, Lat. merum, Hdt.; and ἄκρατος without (οἶνος), Ar., etc.
metaph., ἄκρ. μέλαν pure black, Theophr.; ἄκρατος νύξ sheer night, Aesch.; ἄκρ. νοῦς pure intellect, Xen.
of conditions or states, pure, untempered, absolute, ἐλευθερία, ἡδονή Plat.; ἄκρ. ψεῦδος a sheer lie, Plat.:—adv. -τως absolutely, Luc.
of persons, intemperate, excessive, violent, ἄκρατος ὀργήν Aesch.: so of things we feel, ἄκρ. ὀργή, ἄκρ. καῦμα, etc.
comp. ἀκρατέστερος, Sup. -έστατος (as if from ἀκρατής).

div1.head: ἀκράτωρ
div1.sense: = ἀκρατής I, Soph.
= ἀκρατής II, Plat.

div1.head: ἀκραχολέω
div1.sense: to be passionate, Plat.

div1.head: ἀκράχολος
div1.sense: quick to anger, passionate, Ar.
in passionate distress, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀκρεμών
div1.sense: a branch, twig, spray, Eur., Theocr.

div1.head: ἀκρέσπερος
div1.sense: at eventide, Anth.: neut. ἀκρέσπερον as adv., Theocr.

div1.head: ἀκρήβης
div1.sense: a youth in his prime, Anth.

div1.head: ἄκρηβος
div1.sense: in earliest youth, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀκρίβεια
div1.sense: exactness, minute accuracy, precision, Thuc., etc.; with Preps. in adv. sense, διʼ ἀκριβείας, ἀκριβῶς, with minuteness or precision, Plat.; so, εἰς τὴν ἀκρ., πρὸς τὴν ἀκρ. Plat.:— ἡ ἀκρ. τοῦ ναυτικοῦ its perfect condition, Thuc.
parsimony, frugality, Plut.

div1.head: ἀκριβής
div1.sense: exact, accurate, precise, made or done to a nicety, Eur., etc.
of persons, exact, precise, strict, consummate, Thuc., etc.:—esp. painfully exact, over-nice, precise, curious, Plat.:— τὸ ἀκριβές ἀκρίβεια, Thuc.:—adv. -βῶς, to a nicety, precisely, Hdt., etc.
parsimonious, frugal, Menand.

div1.head: ἀκριβολογέομαι
div1.sense: to be exact or precise in language or thought, Plat.; c. acc. rei, to weigh accurately, Plat.

div1.head: ἀκριβολόγος
div1.sense: precise in argument.

div1.head: ἀκριβόω
div1.sense: to make exact or accurate, Eur.; ἀκρ. τάδε to be perfect in bearing these hardships, Xen.:—Pass. to be or become perfect, Ar.
to investigate accurately, to understand thoroughly, οἱ τάδʼ ἠκριβωκότες Eur.; τοὔνομά μου σὺ ἀκριβοῖς; are you sure of my name? Plat.

div1.head: ἀκριδοθήκη
div1.sense: a locust-cage, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀκρισία
div1.sense: want of distinctness, Xen.

div1.head: ἀκρίς
div1.sense: a locust, Il.

div1.head: ἄκρις
div1.sense: a hill-top, Od.

div1.head: ἀκριτόδακρυς
div1.sense: shedding floods of tears, Anth.

div1.head: ἀκριτόμυθος
div1.sense: recklessly or confusedly babbling, Il.
hard of interpretation, Od.

div1.head: ἄκριτος
div1.sense: undistinguishable, unarranged, disorderly, Hom.; τύμβος ἄκριτος one common undistinguished grave, Il.
continual, unceasing, ἄχεα Il.; neut. as adv., πενθήμεναι ἄκριτον αἰεί Od.:— ὄρος ἄκρ. a continuous mountain-range, Anth., Babr.
undecided, doubtful, νείκεα, ἄεθλος Il.; ἀκρίτων ὄντων while the issue was doubtful, Thuc.:—adv. ἀκρίτως, without decisive issue, Il.
unjudged, untried, of persons and things, ἄκριτόν τινα κτείνειν to put to death without trial, Lat. indicta causa, Hdt., etc.
act. not giving a judgment, Hdt.: without judgment, ill-judged, rash, Eur.

div1.head: ἀκριτόφυλλος
div1.sense: of undistinguishable, i. e. closely blending, leafage, Il.

div1.head: ἀκριτόφυρτος
