div1.sense: undistinguishably mixed, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀκρόαμα
div1.sense: anything heard with pleasure, as a play or musical piece, Xen.

div1.head: ἀκροαματικός
div1.sense: designed for hearing only, Plut.

div1.head: ἀκροάομαι
div1.sense: to hearken to, listen to, c. gen. pers., acc. rei, Thuc., etc.; c. gen. rei, Thuc.
absol. to listen, ὁ ἀκροώμενος a hearer, disciple, Plat., Xen.
to attend to, obey, τινός Thuc., etc.

div1.head: ἀκρόασις
div1.sense: a hearing or listening, Thuc., etc.
obedience to another, c. gen., Thuc.

div1.head: ἀκροατέον
div1.sense: one must listen to, τινός Ar.

div1.head: ἀκροατήριον
div1.sense: a place of audience, NTest.
an audience, Plut.

div1.head: ἀκροατής
div1.sense: a hearer, Lat. auditor, Thuc., etc.: a disciple, Arist.
a lecturer, Plut.

div1.head: ἀκροατικός
div1.sense: of or for hearing, μισθὸς ἀκρ. a lecturerʼs fee, Luc.

div1.head: ἀκροβαφής
div1.sense: tinged at the point, Anth.

div1.head: ἀκροβελής
div1.sense: with a point at the end, Anth.

div1.head: ἀκροβολέω
div1.sense: to sling, Anth.

div1.head: ἀκροβολία
div1.sense: a slinging, skirmishing, Appian.

div1.head: ἀκροβολίζομαι
div1.sense: to throw from afar, to fight with missiles, to skirmish, πρός τινα or absol., Thuc., Xen.:—metaph., ἀκρ. ἔπεσι Hdt.—The Act. in Anth.

div1.head: ἀκροβόλισις
div1.sense: a skirmishing, Xen., etc.

div1.head: ἀκρόβολος
div1.sense: pass., struck from afar, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀκροβόλος
div1.sense: act. a slinger, skirmisher.

div1.head: ἀκροβυστία
div1.sense: the foreskin, NTest.
circumcision, NTest.;—and as collect. the uncircumcision, i. e. the uncircumcised, NTest.

div1.head: ἀκρογωνιαῖος
div1.sense: at the extreme angle, ἀκρ. λίθος the corner foundation-stone, NTest.

div1.head: ἀκρόδετος
div1.sense: bound at the end or top, Anth.

div1.head: ἀκρόδρυα
div1.sense: fruit-trees, Xen.
fruits, Arist.

div1.head: ἀκροθιγής
div1.sense: touching on the surface, touching the lips, Anth.

div1.head: ἀκροθινιάζομαι
div1.sense: to take of the best, pick out for oneself, Eur.

div1.head: ἀκροθίνιον
div1.sense: the topmost part of a heap, the choice part, first-fruits, taken as an offering to the gods, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἀκροκελαινιάω
div1.sense: only in Epic part.; growing black on the surface, of a swollen stream, Il.

div1.head: ἀκροκνέφαιος
div1.sense: at the beginning of night, in twilight, Hes.

div1.head: ἀκρόκομος
div1.sense: with hair on the crown, of the Thracians, who seem to have shaved all the head except the crown, Il.
with leaves at the top, Eur., Theocr.

div1.head: Ἀκροκόρινθος
div1.sense: the citadel of Corinth, Eur., Xen.

div1.head: ἀκρόλιθος
div1.sense: with the ends made of stone; ξόανον ἀκρ. a statue with the head, arms, and legs marble, the rest wood, Anth.

div1.head: ἀκρολογέω
div1.sense: to gather at top, στάχυας Anth.

div1.head: ἀκρολοφίτης
div1.sense: a mountaineer, Anth.

div1.head: ἀκρόλοφος
div1.sense: high-crested, peaked, Anth.
as Subst. a mountain crest, Plut.

div1.head: ἀκρολυτέω
div1.sense: to untie at the ends, Anth.

div1.head: ἀκρομανής
div1.sense: on the verge of madness, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀκρομόλυβδος
div1.sense: leaded at the edge, of a net, Anth.

div1.head: ἄκρον
div1.sense: the highest or furthest point:
a mountain-top, peak, Hom., etc.
a headland, foreland, cape, Od.
an end, extremity, Plat.; ἄκρα χειρῶν the hands, Luc.
metaph. the highest pitch, height, Pind.; εἰς ἄκρον exceedingly, Theocr.; τὰ ἄκρα τοῖς ἄκροις ἀποδιδόναι the highest place to the highest men, Plat.; ἄκρα φέρεσθαι to win the prize, Theocr.
of persons, Ἄργεος ἄκρα the oldest rulers of Argos, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀκρονυχί
div1.sense: with the tip of the nail, Anth.

div1.head: ἀκρόνυχος
div1.sense: at night-fall, at even, Theocr., etc.

div1.head: ἀκροπενθής
div1.sense: exceeding sad, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀκροποδητί
div1.sense: on tiptoe, Luc.

div1.head: ἀκρόπολις
div1.sense: the upper city, i. e. the citadel, Lat. arx, Od., Hdt.:—esp. the Acropolis of Athens, which served as the treasury, Thuc.
metaph. of men, a tower of defence, Theogn.

div1.head: ἀκροπόλος
div1.sense: high-ranging, lofty, Hom.

div1.head: ἀκροπόρος
div1.sense: piercing with the point, Od.

div1.head: ἀκρόπρῳρον
div1.sense: the end of a shipʼs prow, Strab.

div1.head: ἀκρόπτερον
div1.sense: the tip of the wing, Anth.

div1.head: ἀκροσίδηρος
div1.sense: pointed or shod with iron, Anth.

div1.head: ἀκρόσοφος
div1.sense: high in wisdom, Pind.

div1.head: ἄκρος
div1.sense: at the furthest point, and so either topmost = Lat. summus, or outermost = Lat. extremus:
highest, topmost, ἐν ἄκρηι πόλει ἐν ἀκροπόλει, Il.; μέλαν ὕδωρ ἄκρον at its surface, Il., etc.

outermost, ἄκρη χείρ, ἄκροι πόδες, ἄκρος ὦμος the end of the hand, ends of the feet, tip of the shoulder, Il., Thuc.; ἐπʼ ἄκρων δακτύλων on tiptoe, Soph.; ἄκροισι λαίφους κρασπέδοις with the outermost edges of the sail, i. e. under close-reefed sails, Eur.
of Time, it denotes completeness, ἄκραι σὺν ἑσπέραι when eve was fully come, Pind.; ἄκρας νυκτός at dead of night, Soph.

of Degree, the highest in its kind, exceeding good, consummate, excellent: of persons, Hdt., etc.; ἄκρος μάντις Soph.:—often with an acc. modi added, ψυχὴν οὐκ ἄκρος not strong in mind, Hdt.; ἄκροι τὰ πολέμια, skilful in war, Hdt., etc.; also c. gen. modi, οἱ ἄκροι τῆς ποιήσεως Plat.; also, ἄκρος εἰς or περί τι Plat.
as Subst., v. ἄκρα, ἄκρον.
neut. as adv. on the top or surface, just, ἄκρον ἐπὶ ῥηγμῖνος on the very edge of the surf, il.
exceedingly, Theocr.
utterly, completely, Plat.

div1.head: ἀκροστόλιον
div1.sense: the gunwale of a ship, Plut.

div1.head: ἀκροσφαλής
div1.sense: apt to trip, unsteady, precarious, Plat.

div1.head: ἀκροτελεύτιον
div1.sense: the fag-end of a verse, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀκροτομέω
div1.sense: to lop off, shave the surface, Xen.

div1.head: ἀκρότομος
div1.sense: cut off sharp, abrupt, Polyb.

div1.head: ἀκροφύσιον
div1.sense: the snout or pipe of a pair of bellows, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀκροχανής
div1.sense: yawning at top, Anth.

div1.head: ἀκροχειρίζω
div1.sense: in mid., to struggle at armʼs length, of a kind of wrestling, in which they grasped one anotherʼs hands, without clasping the body, Plat., etc.

div1.head: ἀκροχορδών
div1.sense: a wart with a thin neck, Plut.

div1.head: ἄκρυπτος
div1.sense: unhidden, Eur.

div1.head: ἀκρύσταλλος
div1.sense: free from ice, ἡ χώρη Hdt.

div1.head: ἀκρωμία
div1.sense: the point of the shoulder; in a horse, the withers, Xen.

div1.head: ἀκρωνία
div1.sense: a dub. word in Aesch., perh. = ἀκρωτηριασμός, mutilation.

div1.head: ἀκρωνυχία
div1.sense: the tip of the nail: metaph. the ridge of a mountain, Xen.

div1.head: ἀκρώνυχος
div1.sense: with nails at the extremities, χερὸς ἀκρώνυχα the tips of the fingers, Anth.

div1.head: ἀκρώρεια
div1.sense: a mountain-ridge, Xen., Theocr.

div1.head: ἀκρωτηριάζω
div1.sense: to cut off the extremities, mutilate, τὰς πρῴρας ἠκρωτηρίασαν cut the beaks off the prows, Hdt.:—so in Mid., τὰς τριήρεις ἀκρωτηριασάμενοι Xen.; perf. pass. in mid. sense, ἠκρωτηριασμένοι τὰς πατρίδας having mutilated their countries, Dem.

div1.head: ἀκρωτήριον
div1.sense: any prominent part, ἀκρ. τοῦ οὔρεος a mountain-peak, Hdt.
a cape, promontory, Hdt., Thuc.
the extremity of anything, ἀκρ. νηός a shipʼs beak, Hdt.
in pl. the extremities of the body, hands and feet, fingers and toes, Thuc., etc.; τὰ ἀκρ. τῆς Νίκης her wings, Dem.

div1.head: ἀκταίνω
div1.sense: to lift up, raise, ἀκταίνειν στάσιν to raise oneself so as to stand, to stand upright, Aesch.; so in the form ἀκταινόω, Plat.

div1.head: ἀκταῖος
div1.sense: on the coast, of Ionian cities, Thuc.: so, Ἀκταία (sc. γῆ), coast-land, an old name of Attica, Thuc.
haunting the coast, βάτραχοι Babr.

div1.head: ἀκτέανος
div1.sense: without property, poor, τίνος in a thing, Anth.

div1.head: ἀκτέα
div1.sense: the elder-tree, Luc.

div1.head: ἀκτένιστος
div1.sense: uncombed, unkempt, Soph.

div1.head: ἀκτέος
div1.sense: one must lead, Plat., etc.; εἰρήνην ἀκτέον one must keep peace, Dem.
one must go or march, Xen.

div1.head: ἀκτέριστος
div1.sense: unhallowed by funeral rites, Soph.

div1.head: ἀκτήμων
div1.sense: without property, poor, χρυσοῖο in gold, Il.: absol., ἀκτ. πενία Theocr.

div1.head: ἀκτή
div1.sense: a headland, foreland, promontory, shore, Od., etc.: of the banks of rivers, ἀκταὶ Σιμόεντος Aesch.; Ἀχέροντος Soph.
generally, coast-land, ἀκταὶ διφάσιαι of the N. and S. coasts of Asia Minor, Hdt.; of Attica (cf. ἀκταῖος), Soph.
generally, any edge or strand, like the sea-coast, Lat. ora, χώματος ἀκτή of a sepulchral mound, Aesch.; βώμιος ἀ. of an altar, Soph. (Perh. from ἄγνυμι, cf. ῥηγμίν.)
corn or meal, Δημήτερος ἀκτή Il.; ἀλφίτου ἀκτή Od.

div1.head: ἄκτητος
div1.sense: not worth getting, Plat.

div1.head: ἀκτινηδόν
div1.sense: like a ray, Luc.

div1.head: ἄκτιος
div1.sense: haunting the shore, of Pan, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀκτίς
div1.sense: a ray, beam, of the sun, Hom.; ἀνὰ μέσσαν ἀκτῖνα, i. e. from the south, Soph.; ἀκτῖνες τελευτῶσαι sunset, Eur.
metaph. brightness, splendour, glory, Pind.
like Lat. radius, the spoke of a wheel, Anth.

div1.head: ἀκτίτης
div1.sense: a dweller on the coast, Anth.

div1.head: ἄκτιτος
div1.sense: untilled, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἄκτωρ
div1.sense: a leader, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀκυβέρνητος
div1.sense: without steersman, Plut.

div1.head: ἄκυλος
div1.sense: an acorn, the fruit of the ilex, Od.

div1.head: ἀκύμαντος
div1.sense: not washed by the waves, ψαμάθοις ἐπʼ ἀκυμάντοις on sands washed by no waves, i. e. on the sands of the stadium, Eur.
waveless, calm, πέλαγος Luc.

div1.head: ἄκυμος
div1.sense: tranquil, ἀκ. βίοτος Eur.

div1.head: ἀκύμων
div1.sense: without fruit, barren, of women, Eur.

div1.head: ἄκυρος
div1.sense: without authority:

of laws and contracts, invalid, ἄκυρον ποιεῖν, Lat. irritum facere, to set aside, and ἄκυρον γίγνεσθαι, to become of no force, to be set aside, Plat.; νόμοις ἀκύροις χρωμένη, i. e. having laws, but not enforcing them, Thuc.
of persons, having no right or power, ἄκ. ποιεῖν τινά Xen.; c. gen., ἄκυροι πάντων γενήσεσθε Dem.

div1.head: ἀκύρωτος
div1.sense: unconfirmed, Eur.

div1.head: ἀκωκή
div1.sense: a point, Hom., etc.

div1.head: ἀκώλυτος
div1.sense: unhindered, Luc.: adv. -τως, Plat.

div1.head: ἀκωμῴδητος
div1.sense: not ridiculed: adv. -τως, Luc.

div1.head: ἄκων
div1.sense: a javelin, dart, Hom., etc.

div1.head: ἄκωπος
div1.sense: without oars, Anth.

div1.head: ἀλαβαρχία
div1.sense: the office of Ἀλαβάρχης, in Egypt, ἐξ Ἀλαβαρχίης , Anth.

div1.head: ἀλαβαστοθήκη
div1.sense: a case for alabaster ornaments, Dem.

div1.head: ἀλάβαστος
div1.sense: a box or casket of alabaster, Hdt., Ar., etc.: ἀλάβαστρος is a later form in Lxx., NTest., Plut.

div1.head: ἀλάβαστρον
div1.sense: a box or casket of alabaster, in NTest., pl. ἀλάβαστρα or -τα in Theocr. and Anth.

div1.head: ἅλαδε
div1.sense: adverb of ἅλς, to or into the sea, Il., etc.; also, εἰς ἅλαδε Od.

div1.head: ἁλάδρομος
div1.sense: either from ἅλλομαι, the bounding race; or from ἅλς, a race over the sea.

div1.head: ἀλαζονεία
div1.sense: false pretension, imposture, quackery, Ar., Plat., etc.

div1.head: ἀλαζόνευμα
div1.sense: an imposture, piece of quackery, Ar., etc.

div1.head: ἀλαζονεύομαι
div1.sense: to make false pretensions, of the Sophists, Xen.

div1.head: ἀλαζονικός
div1.sense: boastful, braggart, Xen. adv. -κῶς, Plut.

div1.head: ἀλαζών
div1.sense: properly a vagabond: then, a false pretender, impostor, quack, of Sophists, Ar., Plat., etc.
as adj. swaggering, boastful, braggart, Lat. gloriosus, Hdt., Plat.

div1.head: ἀλαίνω
div1.sense: to wander about, Aesch., Eur.; ἀλ. πόδα to wander on foot, Eur.

div1.head: ἀλαλαγή
div1.sense: a shouting, Soph., Hdt.

div1.head: ἀλάλαγμα
div1.sense: = ἀλαλαγή, a shouting.
a loud noise, τυμπάνων, αὐλοῦ Eur.

div1.head: ἀλαλάζω
div1.etym: (formed from the cry ἀλαλαί as ἐλελίζω, ὀλολύζω from similar sounds)
div1.sense: to raise the war-cry, Xen.; c. acc. cogn., νίκην ἀλαλάζειν to shout the shout of victory, Soph.
generally, to cry or shout aloud, of Bacchus and the Bacchae, Eur.
rarely of a cry of pain, ἠλάλαζε δυσθνῆσκον Eur.
rarely also of other sounds than the voice, to sound loudly, clang, NTest.

div1.head: ἀλαλαί
div1.sense: exclam. of joy, Ar.

div1.head: ἀλάλημαι
div1.etym: perf. of ἀλάομαι, only used in pres. sense
the part. ἀλαλήμενος takes the accent of pres.
div1.sense: to wander or roam about, like a beggar, Od.; of seamen, Od.

div1.head: ἀλαλή
div1.sense: a loud cry, Eur.:— esp. the cry with which battle was begun, hence the battle-cry, Pind.

div1.head: ἀλαλητός
div1.sense: the shout of victory, Il.: war-cry, Il., Hes.
rarely, a cry of woe or wailing, Il.
a loud noise, αὐλῶν Anth.

div1.head: ἀλάλητος
div1.sense: unutterable, Anth., NTest.

div1.head: ἄλαλκε
div1.etym: From !αλκ, come ἄλαλκε, ἀλκή, ἄλκαρ, ἄλκιμος, ἀλέξω: identical with !αρκ, whence ἀρκέω, Lat. arceo, arx, arca.
div1.sense: to ward or keep off, τί τινι something from a person, Il., etc.; more rarely τί τινος Il.

div1.head: Ἀλαλκομενηΐς
div1.sense: name of Athena, prob. from ἀλαλκεῖν, the Protectress, Il.

div1.head: Ἀλαλκομένιος
div1.sense: a Boeot. month, answering to Attic Μαιμακτηριών, Plut.

div1.head: ἄλαλος
div1.sense: speechless, NTest.

div1.head: ἀλαλύκτημαι
div1.etym: a perf. formed by redupl. from *ἀλυκτέω.
div1.sense: to be sore distressed, Il.

div1.head: ἀλάμπετος
div1.sense: without light, darksome, Hhymn.; of the nether world, Soph.

div1.head: ἀλαμπής
div1.sense: ἀλ. ἡλίου out of the sunʼs light, Soph.
metaph. obscure, Plut.

div1.head: ἀλάομαι
div1.sense: to wander, stray or roam about, Hom., etc.: to wander from home, be banished, Soph.; c. acc. loci, ἀλ. γῆν to wander over the land, Soph.
c. gen. to wander away from, cease to enjoy, εὐφροσύνας Pind.; τῆς πάροιθʼ εὐπραξίας Eur.
metaph. to wander in mind, be distraught, Soph.

div1.head: ἀλαοσκοπιά
div1.sense: a blind, i. e. useless, careless, watch, Hom., Hes.

div1.head: ἀλαός
div1.etym: Commonly regarded as a compd. of a_privat and λάω video.
div1.sense: not seeing, blind, Od., Trag., etc.; ἕλκος ἀλαόν a blinding wound, i. e. blindness, Trag.

div1.head: ἀλαόω
div1.sense: to blind, ὀφθαλμοῦ of an eye, Od.

div1.head: ἀλαπαδνός
div1.sense: exhausted, powerless, feeble, Hom., Hes.; Comp. ἀλαπαδνότεροι Il.

div1.head: ἀλαπάζω
div1.etym: From Root !λαπ, with α prefixed, cf. λαπάσσω.
div1.sense: to empty, drain, exhaust, Od.; ἀλ. πόλιν to plunder it, Il.; and of men, to destroy, Il.

div1.head: ἅλας
div1.sense: salt, NTest., Plut.

div1.head: ἀλαστέω
div1.sense: to be full of wrath, Il.

div1.head: ἀλάστορος
div1.sense: under the influence of an ἀλάστωρ: suffering cruelly, Soph.

div1.head: ἄλαστος
div1.sense: not to be forgotten, insufferable, unceasing, πένθος, ἄχος Hom.: neut. as adv., incessantly, Od.
of persons, ἄλαστε accursed wretch! Il., Soph.

div1.head: ἀλάστωρ
div1.sense: the avenging deity, destroying angel, Trag.; ἀλ. οὑμός Soph.; βουκόλων ἀλάστωρ the herdsmenʼs plague, of the Nemean lion, Soph.
pass. he who suffers from such vengeance, an accursed wretch, Aesch., Dem.
div1.etym: Either from ἄλαστος, or from ἀλάομαι, he that makes to wander.

div1.head: ἀλαωτύς
div1.sense: a blinding, Od.

div1.head: ἀλγεινός
div1.sense: Attic for Epic ἀλεγεινός, giving pain, painful, grievous, Trag., Thuc.:—adv. -νῶς, Soph., Plat.
rare in pass. sense, feeling pain, grievously suffering, suffering, Soph. —Cf. ἀλγίων, -ιστος.

div1.head: ἀλγέω
div1.sense: to feel bodily pain, suffer, Il., Hdt., etc.; the suffering part in acc., ἀλγ. ἧπαρ Aesch.; τὸν δάκτυλον, τὰ ὄμματα Plat.
to suffer hardship, Od.

to feel pain of mind, to grieve, be troubled or distressed, ἀλγεῖν ψυχήν, φρένα Hdt., Eur., etc.; ἀλγ. τινί to be pained at a thing, Hdt., Soph.; ἐπί τινι Soph.; διά τι Hdt.; περί τι or τινος Thuc.; c. gen., Aesch.; c. acc., ἀλγῶ μὲν ἔργα Aesch.; c. part., ἤλγησʼ ἀκούσας Hdt.

div1.head: ἀλγηδών
div1.sense: a sense of pain, pain, suffering, Hdt., Eur., etc.
of mind, pain, grief, Soph., Eur., etc.

div1.head: ἄλγημα
div1.sense: pain, suffering, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: ἄλγησις
div1.sense: sense of pain, Soph.

div1.head: ἀλγινόεις
div1.sense: painful, grievous, Hes.

div1.head: ἀλγίων
div1.etym: irreg. comp. and Sup. of ἀλγεινός, formed from ἄλγος (as καλλίων, -ιστος from κάλλος, αἰσχίων, -ιστος from αἶσχος)
In Hom. ἄλγιον, ι short, but ῑ always in Attic.
div1.sense: more or most painful, grievous or distressing:— of the comp., Hom. has only neut. ἄλγιον, so much the worse, all the harder; ἀλγίστη δαμάσασθαι (of a mule), Il.

div1.head: ἄλγος
div1.sense: pain of body, Il., Soph.
pain of mind, grief, distress, Hom.
anything that causes pain, Bion., Anth.

div1.head: ἀλγύνω
div1.etym: The future middle ἀλγυνοῦμαι is used in a passive sense.
div1.sense: to pain, grieve, distress, τινά Aesch., etc.:—Pass. to be grieved at a thing, τινι Soph.; ἐπί τινι Eur.; τι Soph.: c. part., εἰσιδοῦσα ἠλγύνθην Aesch.

div1.head: ἀλδαίνω
div1.etym: Only in pres. and imperf., except Epic 3rd sg. aor2 ἤλδανε.
div1.sense: to make to grow, μέλεʼ ἤλδανε she filled out his limbs, Od.: to increase, multiply, ἀλδαίνειν κακά Aesch.

div1.head: ἀλδήσκω
div1.sense: to grow, wax, Il.
trans. = ἀλδαίνω, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀλεαίνω
div1.sense: to warm, make warm, Arist.
intr. to grow warm, be warm, Ar.

div1.head: ἀλέα
div1.sense: an escape, Il.; c. gen. shelter from ὑετοῦ Hes.
warmth, heat, Od., Ar. (Deriv. uncertain.)

div1.head: ἀλεγεινός
div1.sense: c. inf., ἵπποι ἀλεγεινοὶ δαμήμεναι hard to break, Il.

div1.head: ἀλεγίζω
div1.etym: Epic Verb, only in pres. and imperf.
div1.sense: to trouble oneself about a thing, to care for, in Hom. always with negat., c. gen. rei, τῶν μὲν ἄρʼ οὐκ ἀλέγιζε πατήρ Il.: absol. to take heed, Il.

div1.head: ἀλεγύνω
div1.sense: to care for, furnish, c. acc., ἄλλας δʼ ἀλεγύνετε δαῖτας find your meals elsewhere; δαῖτʼ ἀλέγυνον, of invited guests; but, δαῖτας ἐΐσας ἀλ. to prepare a meal for guests, all in Od.

div1.head: ἀλέγω
div1.etym: Prob. from Root !λεγ, LIG in Lat. religio, α being euphonic.
div1.sense: to trouble oneself, have a care, mostly with negat.:
absol., οὐκ ἀλ. to have no care, heed not, Lat. negligo, Hom.; κύνες οὐκ ἀλέγουσαι careless, reckless dogs, Od.; without negat., ἀλέγουσι κιοῦσαι are heedful in their course.
with a case,
c. gen. to care for, Od., Aesch.
c. acc. to heed, regard, respect, Il.:—without a negat., ὅπλα ἀλέγουσιν take care of, Od.

div1.head: ἀλεεινός
div1.sense: open to the sun, warm, hot, χώρη Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: ἀλεείνω
div1.etym: Epic Verb, only in pres. and imperf.
div1.sense: to avoid, shun, c. acc., Od.; c. inf., κτεῖναι ἀλέεινε he avoided killing him, Il.

div1.head: ἀλεής
div1.sense: in the sun, ὕπνος Soph.

div1.head: ἀλείατα
div1.sense: wheaten flour, Od.; cf. ἄλευρον.

div1.head: ἄλειμμα
div1.sense: anything used for anointing, unguent, fat, oil, Plat.

div1.head: ἀλείπτης
div1.sense: an anointer, a teacher of gymnastics, Arist.:—metaph. a teacher, Plut.

div1.head: ἄλεισον
div1.sense: a cup, goblet, χρύσειον Hom.

div1.head: ἀλείτης
div1.sense: one who flees from punishment, a culprit, a sinner, Hom.

div1.head: ἄλειφαρ
div1.sense: anointing-oil, unguent, oil, Hom.
generally, anything used for smearing, pitch or resin, to seal wine-jars, Hes., Aesch., Theocr., etc.

div1.head: ἀλείφω
div1.etym: From Root !lip, with α prefixed, v. λίπος
div1.sense: to anoint with oil, oil the skin, as was done after bathing, or before gymnastic exercises, the Act. referring to the act of another, Mid. to oneself, Il.; often with λίπα added (v. λίπα):— metaph. to prepare as if for gymnastics, to stimulate, Plat., etc.
like ἐπαλείφω, to plaster, οὔατα ἀλεῖψαι to stop up the ears, Od.

div1.head: ἄλειψις
div1.sense: an anointing:—a method or custom of anointing, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀλεκτορίσκος
div1.sense: a cockerel, Babr.

div1.head: ἀλεκτοροφωνία
div1.sense: cock-crow, i.e. the third watch of the night, Aesop., NTest.

div1.head: ἄλεκτρος
div1.sense: unbedded, unwedded, Soph., etc.; ἄλεκτρʼ, ἄνυμφα γάμων ἁμιλλήματα, much like γάμος ἄγαμος, i. e. a lawless, unhallowed marriage, Soph.; ἄλεκτρα, as adv., Soph.

div1.head: ἀλεκτρύαινα
div1.sense: a hen, Ar.

div1.head: ἀλεκτρυών
div1.sense: masc., a cock, Theogn., etc.
fem. = ἀλεκτρύαινα, a hen, Ar.

div1.head: ἀλέκτωρ
div1.sense: a cock, Aesch., etc.

div1.head: ἀλέκω
div1.sense: to ward off, Anth.

div1.head: Ἀλεξανδριστής
div1.sense: a partisan of Alexander, Plut.

div1.head: ἀλέξανδρος
div1.sense: defending men, πόλεμος Inscr. ap. Diod.
the usual name of Paris in Il., cf. Aesch. Ag. 61, 363.

div1.head: Ἀλεξανδρώδης
div1.sense: Alexander-like, Menand.

div1.head: ἀλεξάνεμος
div1.sense: keeping off the wind, Od.

div1.head: ἀλέξημα
div1.sense: a defence, remedy, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀλέξησις
div1.sense: a keeping off, defence, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀλεξητήριος
div1.sense: able to keep off, of the gods, Lat. Averrunci, Aesch.; ξύλον ἀλ. a club for defence, Eur.
ἀλεξητήριον (sc. φάρμακον), a remedy: protection, Xen.

div1.head: ἀλεξητήρ
div1.sense: one who keeps off, ἀλ. μάχης a stemmer of battle, a champion, Il.

div1.head: ἀλεξιάρη
div1.etym: from ἀλέξω and ἀπά or Ἄρης
div1.sense: (from ἀρά) she that keeps off a curse, or (from Ἄρης) she that guards from death and ruin, Hes.

div1.head: ἀλεξιβέλεμνος
div1.sense: keeping off darts, Anth.

div1.head: ἀλεξίκακος
div1.sense: keeping off evil or mischief, Il.: c. gen., δίψης ἀλ. Anth.

div1.head: ἀλεξίμβροτος
div1.sense: protecting mortals, Pind.

div1.head: ἀλεξίμορος
div1.sense: warding off death, Soph.

div1.head: ἀλεξιφάρμακον
div1.sense: an antidote, remedy, Plat.:— τινός against a thing, Plat.

div1.head: ἀλέξω
div1.etym: Note that some stems are formed from ἀλεξέω and others from ἀλέκω.
div1.sense: to ward or keep off, turn away or aside; c. acc. rei, Ζεὺς τό γʼ ἀλεξήσειε Od.; c. acc. rei et dat. pers., Δαναοῖσιν ἀλεξήσειν κακὸν ἦμαρ will ward it off from them, Il., etc.: —then c. dat. pers. only, to assist, defend, Il., Xen.; absol. to lend aid, Il.: —Mid. to keep off from oneself, defend oneself against, c. acc., Il.: absol. to defend oneself, Il., Soph.
Mid., also, to recompense, requite, τοὺς εὖ καὶ κακῶς ποιοῦντας ἀλεξόμενος Xen.

div1.head: ἀλέομαι
div1.etym: Prob. from same root as ἀλάομαι.
div1.sense: to avoid, shun, c. acc. rei, ἔγχεα ἀλεώμεθα, ἠλεύατο ἔγχος, ἀλεύατο κῆρα, ἀλεώμεθα μῆνιν, τὸ κῆτος ἀλέαιτο, — all in Il.; rarely c. acc. pers., θεοὺς ἀλέασθαι, Il.:—c. inf. to avoid doing; ἀλεύεται (Epic 3rd sg. subj. for -ηται) ἠπεροπεύειν Od.
absol. to flee for oneʼs life, flee, τὸν μὲν ἀλευάμενον τὸν δὲ κτάμενον Il.; οὔτε φυγέειν δύνατʼ οὔτʼ ἀλέασθαι Il.

div1.head: ἀλέτης
div1.sense: a grinder, v. ὄνος II. 2.

div1.head: ἀλετός
div1.sense: a grinding, Plut.

div1.head: ἀλετρεύω
div1.sense: to grind, Od.

div1.head: ἀλετρίβανος
div1.sense: that which grinds or pounds, a pestle, Ar.

div1.head: ἀλετρίς
div1.sense: a female slave who grinds corn, γυνὴ ἀλετρίς Od.

div1.head: ἄλευρον
div1.sense: wheaten flour, distinguished from ἄλφιτα (barley-meal), Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἀλεύω
div1.sense: to remove, keep away; aor1 imperat., ἄλευσον ὕβριν Aesch.; κακὸν ἀλεύσατε Aesch.: absol. in pres. ἄλευ, for ἄλευε, avert the evil, Aesch.:—Mid., ἀλεύομαι, v. ἀλέομαι.

div1.head: ἀλέω
div1.etym: From Root !αλ, came also ἀλήθω, ἀλείατα, ἄλευρον, ἄλως, ἀλωή.
div1.sense: to grind, bruise, pound, Od.

div1.head: ἀλεωρή
div1.sense: avoidance, escape, Il., Hdt.
c. gen. a means of avoiding, a defence or shelter from δηΐων ἀνδρῶν Il.: absol. a defence, Il., Hdt.

div1.head: ἀλήθεια
div1.sense: truth, as opp. to a lie, παιδὸς πᾶσαν ἀλ. μυθεῖσθαι to tell the whole truth about the lad, Od.; so, χρᾶσθαι τῇ ἀλ. Hdt.; ἡ ἀλ. περί τινος Thuc.
truth, reality, opp. to appearance, τῶν ἔργων ἡ ἀλ. Thuc.
adverb. usages, τῇ ἀληθείᾳ in very truth, Thuc.; rarely ἀληθείᾳ Plat.; ἐπʼ ἀληθείας in truth and reality, Dem.; μετʼ ἀληθείας Xen.; κατʼ ἀλήθειαν Arist.
the character of the ἀληθής, truthfulness, sincerity, frankness, candour, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἀληθεύω
div1.sense: to speak truth, Aesch., etc.; τὰς δέκα ἡμέρας ἠλήθευσε he was right about the 10 days, Xen.; ἀλ. τοὺς ἐπαίνους to prove their praises true, Luc.
Pass. to come true, of predictions, Xen.

div1.head: ἀληθής
div1.sense: unconcealed, true:
true, opp. to ψευδής, Hom.; τὸ ἀληθές, by crasis τἀληθές, Ionic τὠληθές, and τὰ ἀληθῆ, by crasis τἀληθῆ the truth, Hdt., Attic
of persons, truthful, Il., Attic
of oracles and the like, true, coming true, Aesch., etc.
adv. ἀληθῶς, Ionic -θέως, truly, Hdt., etc.
really, actually, in reality, Aesch., Thuc., etc.; so, ὡς ἀληθῶς Eur., Plat., etc.
neut. as adv., proparox. ἄληθες; itane? indeed? really? in sooth? ironically, Soph., Eur., etc.
τὸ ἀληθές really and truly, Lat. revera, Plat., etc.; so, τὸ ἀληθέστατον in very truth, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀληθινός
div1.sense: agreeable to truth:
of persons, truthful, trusty, Xen., Dem.
of things, true, real, Plat.; ἐς ἀλ. ἄνδρʼ ἀποβῆναι to turn out a true man, Theocr.:—adv. -νῶς, truly, really, Plat., etc.

div1.head: ἀληθόμαντις
div1.sense: prophet of truth, Aesch.

div1.head: Ἀλήϊον πεδίον
div1.sense: , the plain of wandering (over which Bellerophon wandered), in Lycia or Cilicia, Il.

div1.head: ἀλήϊος
div1.sense: poor in lands, Il.

div1.head: ἄλημα
div1.sense: fine meal: metaph. of a wily knave, such as Ulysses, Soph.

div1.head: ἀλήμων
div1.sense: a wanderer, rover, Od., Anth.

div1.head: ἄλη
div1.sense: ceaseless wandering, Od., etc.
wandering of mind, distraction, Eur.
act., ἄλαι βροτῶν δύσορμοι, of storms such as keep men wandering without haven and rest, Aesch.; cf. ἀλύω.

div1.head: ἄληπτος
div1.sense: not to be laid hold of, hard to catch, Plut.; comp. ἀληπτότερος less amenable, Thuc.
incomprehensible, Plut.

div1.head: ἁλής
div1.etym: εἴλω, cf. ἀολλής; Ionic word equiv. to Attic ἀθρόος,
div1.sense: assembled, thronged, in a mass, all at once, Lat. confertus, Hes., Hdt.; either in pl., ὡς ἁλέες εἴησαν οἱ Ἕλληνες, or with collective nouns, ἁλὴς γενομένη πᾶσα ἡ Ἑλλάς Hdt.

div1.head: ἀλητεία
div1.sense: a wandering, roaming, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: ἀλητεύω
div1.sense: to wander, roam about, of beggars, Od.; of exiles, Eur.

div1.head: ἀλήτης
div1.sense: a wanderer, stroller, rover, vagabond, of beggars, Hom.; of exiles, Trag.; τὸν μακρῶν ἀλάταν πόνων one who has wandered in long labours, Soph.
as adj. vagrant, roving, βίος Hdt.

div1.head: ἄλθομαι
div1.sense: Pass., to become whole and sound, ἄλθετο χείρ (Epic 3rd sg. imperf.) Il.

div1.head: ἁλιάδης
div1.sense: a seaman, Soph.

div1.head: ἁλιάετος
div1.sense: the sea-eagle, osprey, Ar.

div1.head: ἁλιαής
div1.sense: blowing seaward, Od.

div1.head: ἁλιανθής
div1.sense: properly sea-blooming: then = ἁλιπόρφυρος, purple, Anth.

div1.head: ἁλία
div1.sense: an assembly of the people, in Doric states, answering to Attic ἐκκλησία, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἀλίαστος
div1.sense: unshrinking, unabating, Il.; neut. as adv., μηδʼ ἀλίαστον ὀδύρεο nor mourn incessant, Il.; so, φρὴν ἀλίαστος φρίσσει Eur.
of persons, undaunted, Eur.

div1.head: ἀλίβας
div1.sense: a dead body, corpse, Plat.

div1.head: ἁλίβρεκτος
div1.sense: washed by the sea, Anth.

div1.head: ἀλίγκιος
div1.sense: resembling, like, Hom.:—cf. the compd. ἐναλίγκιος.

div1.head: ἁλίδονος
div1.sense: sea-tossed, Aesch.

div1.head: ἁλιεία
div1.sense: fishing, Arist.

div1.head: ἁλιερκής
div1.sense: sea-fenced, sea-girt, Pind.

div1.head: ἁλιεύς
div1.sense: one who has to do with the sea, and so,
a fisher, Hom., etc.
a seaman, sailor, Od.; with another Subst., ἐρέτας ἁλιῆας sea-faring rowers, Od.

div1.head: ἁλιευτικός
div1.sense: of or for fishing, Xen., Arist.; —ἡ ἁλιευτική (with or without τέχνη) the art of fishing, Plat.

div1.head: ἁλιεύω
div1.sense: to be a fisher, Plut., Luc., etc.
to fish, go fishing, NTest.

div1.head: ἁλίζω
div1.sense: to gather together, to muster, military forces, Hdt.:—Pass. to meet together, assemble, Hdt.

div1.head: ἁλίζω
div1.sense: to salt, and Pass. to be salted, Arist., NTest.

div1.head: ἁλίζωνος
div1.sense: sea-girt, Anth.

div1.head: ἁλίζωος
div1.sense: living on or in the sea, Anth.

div1.head: ἁλιήρης
div1.sense: sweeping the sea, κώπη Eur.

div1.head: ἄλιθος
div1.sense: without stones, not stony, of land, Xen.

div1.head: Ἁλικαρνασσεύς
div1.sense: a Halicarnassian, Hdt.

div1.head: Ἁλικαρνασσόθεν
div1.sense: from Halicarnassus, Luc.

div1.head: Ἁλικαρνασσός
div1.sense: a Doric city of Caria, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἁλίκλυστος
div1.sense: sea-washed, Soph.

div1.head: ἁλίκτυπος
div1.sense: groaning at sea, of ships in bad weather, Soph.
of waves, roaring on the sea, Eur.

div1.head: ἁλικύμων
div1.sense: surrounded by waves, Anth.

div1.head: ἀλίμενος
div1.sense: without harbour, harbourless, Aesch., Thuc., etc.
metaph. without shelter, inhospitable, Eur.

div1.head: ἀλιμενότης
div1.sense: want of harbours, Xen.

div1.head: ἁλιμυρήεις
div1.sense: flowing into the sea, of rivers, Hom.

div1.head: ἁλιμυρής
div1.sense: sea-flowing, of the sea, Anth.

div1.head: ἀλινδέω
div1.sense: to make to roll (but Act. only occurs in compos. with ἐξ):— Pass. to roll in the dust (cf. ἀλινδήθρα):— metaph. to roam about, Anth.

div1.head: ἀλινδήθρα
div1.sense: a sandy place for horses to roll in, Lat. volutabrum: metaph., ἀλινδήθραι ἐπῶν, i. e. words big enough for rolling places, Ar.

div1.head: ἁλινήκτειρα
div1.etym: ἅλς, νήχω, fem. as if from *ἁλινηκτήρ
div1.sense: swimming in the sea, Anth.

div1.head: ἁλινηχής
div1.sense: swimming in the sea, Anth.

div1.head: ἅλινος
div1.sense: of salt, Hdt.

div1.head: ἄλινος
div1.sense: without a net, ἄλ. θήρα a chase in which no net is used, Anth.

div1.head: ἁλίξαντος
div1.sense: worn by the sea, Anth.

div1.head: ἅλιος
div1.sense: of the sea, Lat. marinus, of sea-gods and nymphs, Hom., etc.; ἅλ. ψάμαθοι the sea sand, Od.

div1.head: ἅλιος2
div1.sense: fruitless, unprofitable, vain, idle, Hom.: neut. ἅλιον as adv., in vain, Il.; regul. adv. ἁλίως, Soph.

div1.head: ἁλιοτρεφής
div1.sense: sea-bred, φῶκαι Od.

div1.head: ἁλιόω
div1.sense: to make fruitless, frustrate, disappoint, Διὸς νόον Od.; οὐδʼ ἁλίωσε βέλος nor did he hurl the spear in vain, Il.

div1.head: ἀλιπαρής
div1.sense: not fit for a suppliant, Soph.

div1.head: ἁλίπεδον
div1.sense: a plain by the sea:— as the plain near Piraeeus was called, Xen.

div1.head: ἁλίπλαγκτος
div1.sense: roaming the sea, Soph., Anth.

div1.head: ἁλιπλανής
div1.sense: sea-wandering, Anth.

div1.head: ἁλιπλανία
div1.sense: a wandering voyage, Anth.

div1.head: ἁλίπληκτος
div1.sense: sea-beaten, Pind.

div1.head: ἁλίπλοος
div1.sense: covered with water, Il.
sailing on the sea, ναῦς Arion.

div1.head: ἁλιπόρος
div1.sense: through which the sea flows, Luc.

div1.head: ἁλιπόρφυρος
div1.sense: of sea-purple, of true purple dye, Od.

div1.head: ἁλιρραγής
div1.sense: against which the sea breaks, Anth.

div1.head: ἁλίρραντος
div1.sense: sea-surging, Anth.

div1.head: ἁλιρρόθιος
div1.sense: dashed over by the sea, Anth.

div1.head: ἁλίρροθος
div1.sense: ἁλ. πόροι the pathways of the raging sea, Aesch.

div1.head: ἁλίρρυτος
div1.sense: washed by the sea, Anth.

div1.head: ἀλισγέω
div1.sense: to pollute.

div1.head: ἀλίσγημα
div1.sense: a pollution, NTest.

div1.head: ἁλίσκομαι
div1.etym: a defect. Pass., the Act. being supplied by αἱρέω
div1.sense: to be taken, conquered, of persons and places, Hom., etc.; ἁλίσκεσθαι εἰς πολεμίους to fall into the hands of the enemy, Plat.
to be caught, seized, θανάτῳ ἁλῶναι or without θανάτῳ, to die, Hom.; ἑάλωσαν εἰς Ἀθήνας γράμματα letters were seized and taken to Athens, Xen.
in good sense, to be won, achieved, attained, Soph., etc.
with part. to be caught or detected doing a thing, Hdt.; ἐὰν ἁλῷς τοῦτο πράττων Plat.; also with a Subst. or adj., the part. ὤν being omitted, οὐ γὰρ δὴ φονεὺς ἁλώσομαι Soph., Ar.
as Attic law-term, to be convicted and condemned, Plat., Dem.:—c. gen. criminis, to be convicted of, ἁλῶναι ψευδομαρτυριῶν, etc.

div1.head: ἅλις
div1.sense: in heaps, crowds, swarms, in abundance, in plenty; and then, sufficiently, enough, Lat. satis:
with Verbs, ἅλις πεποτήαται μέλισσαι Il.; περὶ δὲ Τρωαὶ ἅλις ἦσαν fly in swarms, Il.:—also just enough, in moderation, like μετρίως, Eur.
attached to a Noun, χαλκόν τε χρυσόν τε ἅλις gold and silver enough, Od.
ἅλις (sc. ἐστι) ʼtis enough, Il.; ἢ οὐχ ἅλις, ὡς . . ; is it not enough that . . ? Hom.
like an adj., ἅλις ἡ συμφορά (sc. ἐστι) Eur.:—also, ἅλις (sc. εἰμί) with a part. added, ἅλις νοσοῦσʼ ἐγώ enough that I suffer, Soph.
c. gen. rei, enough of a thing, ἅλις ἔχειν τινός Hdt., Attic

div1.head: ἁλίστονος
div1.sense: sea-resounding, Aesch.

div1.head: ἁλιστός
div1.sense: salted, pickled, Anth.

div1.head: ἁλίστρεπτος
div1.sense: sea-tossed, Anth.

div1.head: ἀλιταίνω
div1.etym: ἀλιτήμενος is formed as if from ἀλίτημι
div1.sense: c. acc. pers. to sin or offend against a god, Hom., Aesch.
c. acc. rei, to transgress, Διὸς ἐφετμάς Il.
the part. ἀλιτήμενος is used as an adj., sinful, Od.

div1.head: ἁλιτενής
div1.sense: stretching along the sea, level, flat, Plut.

div1.head: ἁλιτέρμων
div1.sense: bounded by the sea, Anth.

div1.head: ἀλίτημα
div1.sense: a sin, offence, Anth.

div1.head: ἀλιτήριος
div1.sense: sinning or offending against, a god, c. gen., Ar., Thuc.
absol. sinful, guilty, Lys., etc.

div1.head: ἀλιτηριώδης
div1.sense: abominable, accursed, Plat.

div1.head: ἀλιτόξενος
div1.sense: sinning against oneʼs friend, Pind.

div1.head: ἀλιτοφροσύνη
div1.sense: a wicked mind, Anth.

div1.head: ἀλιτραίνω
div1.sense: to sin, offend, Hes., Anth.

div1.head: ἀλιτρία
div1.sense: sinfulness, mischief, Soph.

div1.head: ἀλιτρός
div1.sense: sinful, sinning; and as Subst., δαίμοσιν ἀλιτρός a sinner against the gods, Hom.: in milder sense, a knave, rogue, Od.

div1.head: ἁλίτρυτος
div1.sense: sea-beaten, sea-worn, γέρων Theocr.; κύμβη Anth.

div1.head: ἁλίτυπος
div1.sense: sea-beaten, ἁλ. βάρη griefs for sea-tossed corpses, Aesch.
as Subst. a seaman, fisherman, Eur.

div1.head: ἁλίτυρος
div1.sense: a sort of salt-cheese, Anth.

div1.head: ἁλιφθορία
div1.sense: a disaster at sea, shipwreck, Anth.

div1.head: ἁλιφθόρος
div1.sense: destroying on the sea: as Subst. a pirate, Anth.

div1.head: ἀλκαῖος
div1.sense: strong, mighty, Eur.

div1.head: ἄλκαρ
div1.sense: only in nom. and acc., a safeguard, defence, c. dat., Τρώεσσιν ἄλκαρ ἔσεσθαι Il.; c. gen. ἄλκαρ Ἀχαιῶν defence of the Achaeans, Il.; but, γήραος ἄλκαρ a defence against old age, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἀλκήεις
div1.sense: valiant, warlike, Hhymn., Anth.

div1.head: ἀλκή
div1.sense: strength displayed in action, prowess, courage, boldness, ἐπιειμένος ἀλκήν clad in prowess, Il.; δύεσθαι ἀλκήν Il.: in pl. feats of strength, Pind.

strength to avert danger, a defence, succour, Hom.; ἀλκή τινος defence or aid against a thing, Hes., Pind., etc.; ἐς or πρὸς ἀλκὴν τρέπεσθαι to turn and resist, stand on oneʼs guard, Hdt., etc.; so, ἀλκῆς μεμνῆσθαι Hdt.
battle, fight, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: ἀλκίμαχος
div1.sense: bravely fighting, Anth.

div1.head: ἄλκιμος
div1.sense: strong, stout, of men and weapons, Hom.; ἄλκιμος τὰ πολεμικά Hdt.

div1.head: ἀλκί
div1.etym: heteroclit. of ἀλκή as if from ἄλξ
div1.sense: might, strength, ἀλκὶ πεποιθώς, of wild beasts, Hom.

div1.head: ἀλκίφρων
div1.sense: stout-hearted, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀλκτήρ
div1.sense: a protector from a thing, c. gen., Hom.

div1.head: ἀλκυονίς
div1.etym: pl. ἀλκυονίδες, with or without ἡμέραι,
div1.sense: the 14 winter days during which the halcyon builds its nest, and the sea is calm, the halcyon days, proverb. of undisturbed tranquillity, Ar.

div1.head: ἀλκυών
div1.sense: the kingfisher, Lat. alcedo, Hom., etc. (halcyon with h is a wrong form.)

div1.head: ἀλλαγή
div1.sense: a change, Aesch., etc.
exchange, barter, whether in buying or selling, Plat.

div1.head: ἄλλαγμα
div1.sense: that which is given or taken in exchange: the price of a thing, Anth.

div1.head: ἀλλαντοπωλέω
div1.sense: to deal in sausages, Ar.

div1.head: ἀλλαντοπώλης
div1.sense: a sausage-dealer, Ar.

div1.head: ἀλλά
div1.etym: Conjunct., properly neut. pl. of ἄλλος (with changed accent)
div1.sense: otherwise, but, stronger than δέ:

to oppose single clauses, but, Lat. autem, the preceding clause being negat., οὐ μόνον ἅπαξ, ἀλλὰ πολλάκις Plat.; so, οὐχ (or μὴ) ὅτι, οὐχ (or μὴ) ὅπως, are followed by ἀλλά or ἀλλά καὶ . . . , not only . . . , but . . .
after a negative ἀλλά sometimes = ἀλλʼ ἤ, except, but, ἔπαισεν οὔτις ἀλλʼ ἐγώ Soph.
to oppose whole sentences, but, yet, Lat. at:— used by Hom., with imperat. or subj., to remonstrate, encourage, persuade, like Lat. tandem, ἀλλʼ ἴθι, ἀλλʼ ἄγε, ἀλλὰ ἴωμεν, Hom.
joined with other Particles, ἀλλʼ ἄρα, or, ἀλλʼ οὖν, but then, however, Hdt., etc.
ἀλλὰ γάρ, Lat. enimvero, but really, certainly, Attic
ἀλλʼ ἦ in questions, Lat. an vero? ergo? Plat.: cf. ἀλλʼ ἤ (suo loco).

div1.head: ἀλλᾶς
div1.sense: a sausage, Ar.

div1.head: ἀλλάσσω
div1.sense: to make other than it is, to change, alter, Eur., Plat., etc.
ἀλλ. τί τινος to give in exchange for, barter one thing for another, Aesch.; τι ἀντί τινος Eur.: so in Mid., Thuc.
to repay, requite, φόνον φονεῦσιν Eur.
to give up, leave, quit, οὐράνιον φῶς Soph.

to take one thing for another, κάκιον τοὐσθλοῦ Theogn.; ἀλλ. θνητὸν εἶδος to assume mortal form, Eur.:—Mid., ἀλλάσσεσθαι τί τινος one thing for another, εὐδαιμονίας Hdt., etc.:—hence, to buy, τι ἀντʼ ἀργυρίου Plat.
to interchange, alternate, σκῆπτρʼ ἀλλάσσων ἔχειν to enjoy power in turn, Eur.:—Pass., ἀρεταὶ ἀλλασσόμεναι in turns, Pind.

div1.head: ἀλλαχῆ
div1.sense: elsewhere, in another place, ἄλλος ἀλλαχῆ one here, another there, Xen.; ἄλλοτε ἀλλαχῆ now here, now there, Xen.

div1.head: ἀλλαχόθεν
div1.sense: from another place, Antipho.

div1.head: ἀλλαχόθι
div1.sense: elsewhere, Xen.

div1.head: ἀλλαχόσε
div1.sense: elsewhither, to another place, Xen.

div1.head: ἀλλαχοῦ
div1.sense: elsewhere, Soph., Xen.

div1.head: ἀλληγορέω
div1.sense: to speak so as to imply something other than what is said, to interpret allegorically, Plut.:—Pass. to be spoken allegorically, NTest.

div1.head: ἀλληγορία
div1.sense: an allegory, i. e. description of one thing under the image of another, Cic.

div1.head: ἄλληκτος
div1.sense: unceasing, ceaseless, Od., Soph.
implacable, Il.

div1.head: ἀλληλοφαγία
div1.sense: an eating one another, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀλληλοφάγος
div1.sense: eating each other, Arist.

div1.head: ἀλληλοφονία
div1.sense: mutual slaughter, Pind.

div1.head: ἀλληλοφόνοι
div1.sense: murdering one another, Aesch., Xen.

div1.head: ἀλλήλων
div1.sense: of one another, to one another, one another, Hom., etc.

div1.head: ἄλλῃ
div1.sense: of Place,
in another place, elsewhere, Hom., etc.: —c. gen. loci, ἄλλος ἄλλῃ τῆς πόλεως one in one part of the city, one in another, Thuc.
to another place, elsewhither, Hom., etc.
of Manner, in another way, somehow else, otherwise, Hom., etc.; ἄλλῃ γέ πῃ Plat.; ἄλλῃ πως Xen.

div1.head: ἄλλιστος
div1.sense: inexorable, Anth.

div1.head: ἀλλιτάνευτος
div1.sense: inexorable, Anth.

div1.head: ἀλλογενής
div1.sense: of another race, a stranger, NTest.

div1.head: ἀλλόγλωσσος
div1.sense: using a strange tongue, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀλλογνοέω
div1.sense: to take one for another, not know, ἀλλογνώσας (Ionic for ἀλλογνοήσας) Hdt.

div1.head: ἀλλόγνωτος
div1.sense: mis-known, unknown, Od.

div1.head: ἀλλοδαπός
div1.sense: belonging to another people or land, foreign, strange, Hom., etc.

div1.head: ἀλλοειδής
div1.sense: of strange appearance, neut. pl. ἀλλοειδέα (which must be long-long-long), or ἀλλοϊδέα (which must be long-short-short-long), Od.

div1.head: ἄλλοθεν
div1.sense: from another place, ἄλλοθεν ἄλλος one from one place, another from another, Il., etc.; ἄλλοθεν from abroad, Od.; οὐδαμόθεν ἄλλοθεν Od.

div1.head: ἄλλοθι
div1.sense: elsewhere, in another place, in a strange or foreign land, Od.: c. gen., ἄλλοθι γαίης in another or strange land, Od.; but, ἄλλοθι πάτρης elsewhere than in oneʼs native land, i. e. away from home, Od.
in other ways, from other causes, Thuc., Plat.

div1.head: ἀλλόθροος
div1.sense: speaking a strange tongue, Od.; generally, foreign, strange, alien, Hdt., Trag.

div1.head: ἀλλοῖος
div1.sense: of another sort or kind, different, Hom.; ἀλλοῖόν τι, euphem. for κακόν τι, other than good, Hdt.:—from its comparative force, it may be foll. by ἤ . . , Hom., Plat., etc.:—but an actual comp. ἀλλοιότερος occurs in Hdt., Thuc., etc.
adv. -ως, otherwise, Plat.: comp. -ότερον Xen.

div1.head: ἀλλοιόω
div1.sense: to make different, to change, alter, Plat., etc.
Pass. with fut. mid. ἀλλοιώσομαι and pass. ἀλλοιωθήσομαι:—to become different, be changed, Thuc., Xen.
to be changed for the worse, Xen. Hence

div1.head: ἀλλοίωσις
div1.sense: a change, alteration, Plat., etc.

div1.head: ἀλλόκοτος
div1.sense: of unusual nature or form, strange, monstrous, Ar., Plat., etc.; ἀλλ. πρᾶγμα an unwelcome business, Thuc.: c. gen., ἀλλοκότῳ γνώμαι τῶν πάρος with purpose utterly different from . . , Soph. adv. -τως, Plat.
div1.etym: From ἄλλος, the termin. -κοτος being uncertain.

div1.head: ἅλλομαι
div1.sense: to spring, leap, bound, of living beings, Hom., etc.:—metaph. of things, ἆλτο ὀϊστός Il.; the eye, to throb, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀλλοπρόσαλλος
div1.sense: i. e. ἄλλοτε πρὸς ἄλλον, leaning first to one side, then to the other, of Ares, Il.; πλοῦτος Anth.

div1.head: ἄλλοσε
div1.sense: to another place, elsewhither, Od.; ἄλλος ἄλλοσε one one way, one another, Aesch.

div1.head: ἄλλος
div1.sense: alius, another, one besides, ἄλλος μέν . , ἄλλος δέ . , one . , another . , Il.; ἄλλος τις or τὶς ἄλλος, any other, some other; οὐδεὶς ἄλλος no other; εἴ τις ἄλλος, Lat. si quis alius, any one else.
repeated, ἄλλος ἄλλο λέγει one man says one thing, one another, i. e. different men say different things; ἄλλος ἄλλῃ ἐτράπετο Xen.; λείπουσι τὸν λόφον ἄλλοι ἄλλοθεν Xen.;—v. ἀλλαχῆ.
ἄλλος καὶ ἄλλος, one or two; ἄλλο καὶ ἄλλο one thing after another, Xen.

joined with the Art., ὁ ἄλλος, the other; in pl., οἱ ἄλλοι (Ionic ὧλλοι), all the others, the rest; Lat. ceteri; τὰ ἄλλα, contr. τἆλλα or τἄλλα Lat. cetera, reliqua, not alia;— οὕ τε ἄλλοι καὶ . . both all the others and . . , i. e. especially . .
with Numerals, yet, still, πέμπτος ποταμὸς ἄλλος yet a fifth river, Hdt.: with a Sup., ὀϊζυρώτατος ἄλλων most wretched of all besides, Od.
rarely like ἀλλοῖος, of other sort, different, Il.: hence
sometimes like a comp., c. gen., ἄλλα τῶν δικαίων other than just, Xen.; followed by ἤ . . , when a negat. goes before, οὐδὲν ἄλλο, ἤ . . , nothing else than . . , Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἄλλοτε
div1.sense: at another time, at other times, ἄλλοτε . . , ἄλλοτε . . , at one time . . , at another . . , Hom.; so, ἄλλως ἄλλοτε at one time one way, at another another, Aesch.; ἄλλοτʼ ἄλληι, ἄλλοθι, ἄλλοσε, etc.

div1.head: ἀλλοτριοεπίσκοπος
div1.sense: a busy-body in other menʼs matters, NTest.

div1.head: ἀλλοτριολογέω
div1.sense: to speak of things foreign to the matter, Strab.

div1.head: ἀλλοτριοπραγμοσύνη
div1.sense: a meddling with other peopleʼs business, Plat.

div1.head: ἀλλότριος
div1.sense: opp. to ἴδιος, of or belonging to another, Lat. alienus, Hom., etc.; ἀλλ. γυνή another manʼs wife, Aesch.; γναθμοῖσι γελοίων ἀλλοτρίοισιν, of the suitors, laughed with a face unlike oneʼs own, of a forced, unnatural laugh, Od. (Horaceʼs malis ridere alienis is different); ἀλλ. ὄμμασιν by the help of anotherʼs eyes, Soph.; ἀλλοτριωτάτοις τοῖς σώμασιν χρῆσθαι to deal with oneʼs body as if it absolutely belonged to another, Thuc.
opp. to οἰκεῖος, foreign, strange, Lat. peregrinus, Hom.; often with the notion of hostile, Il.
adv., ἀλλοτρίως ἔχειν or διακεῖσθαι πρός τινα to be unfavourably disposed towards one, Lys.: comp. -ιώτερον less favourably, Dem.

div1.head: ἀλλοτριότης
div1.sense: alienation, estrangement, opp. to οἰκειότης, Plat., etc.

div1.head: ἀλλοτριόχρως
div1.sense: changing colour, Anth.

div1.head: ἀλλοτριόω
div1.sense: c. gen. pers. to estrange from, τῶν σωμάτων τὴν πόλιν Thuc.
c. dat. pers. to make hostile to another, τὴν χώραν τοῖς πολεμίοις Xen.:—Pass. to be made an enemy, τινι Thuc.
in Pass. of things, to be alienated, fall into other hands, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀλλοτρίωσις
div1.sense: estrangement, τῆς ξυμμαχίας οὐχ ὁμοία ἡ ἀλλ. its estrangement, its loss, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀλλοφρονέω
div1.sense: to think of other things, to give no heed, Od.; of one in a swoon, to be senseless, Il., Theocr.: to be seized with frenzy, Hdt.
to be of another mind, have other views, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀλλόφυλος
div1.sense: of another tribe, foreign, Lat. alienigena, Aesch., Thuc.; πόλεμος ἀλλ. war with foreigners, Plut.

div1.head: ἀλλόχροος
div1.sense: changed in colour, Eur.

div1.head: ἀλλόχρως
div1.sense: looking strange or foreign, Eur.

div1.head: ἄλλυδις
div1.sense: elsewhither, ἄλλυδις ἄλλος one hither, another thither, Hom.; ἄλλυδις ἄλλῃ changes now one way, now another, Il.

div1.head: ἄλλως
div1.sense: in another way or manner, otherwise, Hom., etc.: in Attic, ἄλλως πως in some other way; ἄλλως οὐδαμῶς in no other wise; καὶ ἄλλως and besides; ἀρίστου καὶ ἄλλως φρονιμωτάτου Plat.
ἄλλως τε καί . . , both otherwise and so, . . , i. e. especially, Attic, etc.
otherwise, differently, ἄλλως εἶπαι to say otherwise, i. e. to deny, Hdt.
in far other manner, i. e. better, Hom., etc.
otherwise than should be, i. e. without aim or purpose, without reason, Od., Hdt., etc.:—also fruitlessly, in vain, Il.

div1.head: ἅλμα
div1.sense: a spring, leap, bound, Od.; ἅλμα πέτρας a leap or fall from the rock, Eur.; κυνῆς ἅλμα the leap of the lot from the helmet, Soph.

div1.head: ἅλμη
div1.sense: sea-water, brine, Od., etc.: spray that has dried on the skin, Od.: a salt incrustation on soil, Hdt.
the brine, i. e. the sea, Pind., Aesch.

div1.head: ἁλμυρός
div1.sense: salt, briny, Od.
of taste, salt, brackish, Thuc., Xen.
metaph. bitter, distasteful, Lat. amarus, Plat., etc.; ἁλμυρὰ κλαίειν to weep bitterly, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀλοάω
div1.sense: to thresh, thresh out, Plat.
to thresh, cudgel, beat, Il., Ar.

div1.head: ἄλοβος
div1.sense: with a lobe wanting, of victimsʼ livers, Xen.

div1.head: ἀλογέω
div1.sense: to pay no regard to a thing, Lat. rationem non habere rei, c. dat., Il.; c. gen. to be disregardful of, Hdt.
to be out of oneʼs senses, Luc.

div1.head: ἀλογία
div1.sense: want of respect or regard, ἀλογίην εἶχον τοῦ χρηστηρίου took no heed of it, Hdt.; so, ἐν ἀλογίῃ ἔχειν or ποιεῖσθαί τι Hdt.
in Attic want of reason, unreasonable conduct, absurdity, Thuc., Plat.

div1.head: ἀλογιστία
div1.sense: thoughtlessness, rashness, Polyb., Plut., etc.

div1.head: ἀλόγιστος
div1.sense: unreasoning, inconsiderate, thoughtless, heedless, Thuc., etc.: τὸ ἀλόγιστον unreason, Thuc.:—adv. -τως, Thuc., Plat., etc.
not to be reckoned, Soph.: not to be taken into account, vile, Eur.

div1.head: ἄλογος
div1.sense: without λόγος, i. e.,
without speech, speechless, infans, Plat.:—adv. ἀλόγως, Soph.
unutterable, Lat. infandus, Plat.
without reason, irrational, Plat., etc.: τὰ ἄλογα brutes, animals, Plat., Xen.; (in modern Greek ἄλογον is a horse).
not reckoned upon, unexpected, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀλοητός
div1.sense: a threshing, Xen.

div1.head: ἁλόθεν
div1.sense: from the sea, ἐξ ἁλόθεν (showing that it is an old gen.) Il.

div1.head: ἀλοίδορος
div1.sense: not reviling or railing, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀλοιητήρ
div1.sense: a thresher, grinder, ἀλ. ὀδόντες the grinders, Anth.

div1.head: ἀλοιφή
div1.sense: anything used for anointing, hogʼs-lard, grease, unguent, Hom.
laying on of unguents or paint, ἀλ. μύρων Plat.

div1.head: ἀλοκίζω
div1.sense: to trace furrows in waxen tablets, to write, draw (cf. Lat. ex-arare), Ar.

div1.head: ἄλοξ
div1.sense: a furrow: v. αὖλαξ.

div1.head: Ἁλοσύδνη
div1.sense: Sea-born, a name of Amphitrite, Od.

div1.head: ἁλότριψ
div1.sense: a pestle to pound salt, Anth.

div1.head: ἁλουργής
div1.sense: wrought in the sea, sea-purple, i. e. genuine purple, Plat.; ἁλουργῆ purple cloths, Aesch.

div1.head: ἁλουργίς
div1.sense: a purple robe, Ar.: as adj., ἐσθὴς ἁλουργίς Luc.

div1.head: ἀλουσία
div1.sense: a being unwashen, want of the bath, Hdt., Eur.

div1.head: ἄλουτος
div1.sense: unwashen, not using the bath, Hdt., Eur., etc.

div1.head: ἄλοφος
div1.sense: without crest, Il.

div1.head: ἄλοχος
div1.sense: a bedfellow, spouse, wife, Hom., Trag.

div1.head: ἄλπνιστος
div1.sense: sweetest, loveliest, Pind.

div1.head: ἅλσις
div1.sense: a leaping, Arist.

div1.head: ἄλσος
div1.sense: a glade or grove, Lat. saltus, Hom.; grove, Od., Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἅλς
div1.sense: as neut., a lump of salt, Hdt.: generally, salt, oft. in pl., Hom., etc.; ἁλὸς μέταλλον a salt-mine, Hdt., Od., etc.
as fem. sg., the sea, Hom.

div1.head: ἀλσώδης
div1.sense: like a grove, Eur.

div1.head: ἁλτικός
div1.sense: good at leaping, Xen.; ἁλτ. ὄρχησις, of the Salii, Plut.

div1.head: ἁλυκίς
div1.sense: a salt spring, Strab.

div1.head: ἀλυκτάζω
div1.sense: to be in distress, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀλυκτοπέδαι
div1.sense: galling bonds, Hes.; in sg., Anth.

div1.head: ἄλυξις
div1.sense: an escape, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀλύπητος
div1.sense: not pained or grieved, Soph.
act. not causing pain, Soph.

div1.head: ἄλυπος
div1.sense: without pain, Soph., etc.; c. gen., ἄλ. γήρως without the pains of age, Soph.; τὸ ἄλυπον ἀλυπία, Plat.—adv., ἀλύπως ζῆν to live free from pain, Soph.
act. not paining, causing no pain, Soph.

div1.head: ἄλυρος
div1.sense: without the lyre, ὕμνοι ἄλυροι, i. e. wild dirges accompanied by the flute, not the lyre, (cf. ἀφόρμικτος), Eur., etc.

div1.head: ἅλυσις
div1.sense: a chain, Hdt., Eur.

div1.head: ἀλυσιτελής
div1.sense: unprofitable, Xen. adv. ἀλυσιτελῶς, Xen.

div1.head: ἀλυσκάζω
div1.sense: to shun, shirk, avoid, Hom.

div1.head: ἀλύσκω
div1.sense: to flee from, shun, avoid, forsake, c. acc., Hom., etc.: rarely c. gen. to flee from, Soph.:— absol. to escape, Hom.

div1.head: ἄλυς
div1.sense: listlessness, ennui, Plut.

div1.head: ἀλύσσω
div1.sense: to be uneasy, be in distress, Il.

div1.head: ἄλυτος
div1.sense: not to be loosed, indissoluble, Hom., etc.:—continuous, ceaseless, κύκλος Pind.

div1.head: ἀλύω
div1.etym: υ short in Hom., ῡ once in Od. and in Trag.
div1.sense: to wander in mind .
from grief, to be ill at ease, be distraught, Il.: to be beside oneself, Hom., Soph.
from perplexity, to be at a loss, not know what to do, ἀλύει δʼ ἐπὶ παντί Soph.; ἀλ. λύπαι, ἐν πόνοις, Soph.
from joy or exultation, to be beside oneself, Od., Aesch.
to wander or roam about, Luc., Babr.

div1.head: ἀλφάνω
div1.sense: to bring in, yield, earn, Hom.:—metaph., φθόνον ἀλφάνειν to incur envy, Eur.

div1.head: ἀλφεσίβοιος
div1.sense: bringing in oxen, παρθένοι ἀλφεσίβοιαι maidens whose parents receive many oxen as presents from their suitors, i. e. much-courted, Il.

div1.head: ἀλφηστής
div1.sense: working for oneʼs daily bread, laborious, enterprising, Od.; esp. of trading, seafaring people, Od.

div1.head: ἀλφιταμοιβός
div1.sense: a dealer in barley-meal, Ar.

div1.head: ἄλφιτον
div1.sense: peeled or pearl-barley; sg. only in phrase ἀλφίτου ἀκτή, barley-meal, Lat. polenta, Hom.: in pl. ἄλφιτα, barley-groats, barley-meal, opp. to ἄλευρα, Hom., Attic
metaph. oneʼs daily bread, Ar.; πατρῶια ἄλφ. oneʼs patrimony, Ar.

div1.head: ἀλφιτοποιία
div1.sense: a making of barley-meal, Xen.

div1.head: ἀλφιτοσιτέω
div1.sense: to eat barley-bread, Xen.

div1.head: ἀλφός
div1.etym: From same Root comes Lat. albus, and also ἄλφιτον, because of the whiteness of meal.
div1.sense: whiteness: white leprosy, Hes., Plat., etc.

div1.head: Ἁλωάς
div1.sense: goddess of the threshing-floor, Theocr.

div1.head: ἁλωεινός
div1.sense: of or for the threshing-floor, Anth.

div1.head: ἀλωή
div1.sense: a threshing-floor, ἱερὰς κατʼ ἀλωάς Il.; μεγάλην κατʼ ἀλωήν, ἐϋκτιμένην κατʼ ἀλ. Il.
a garden, orchard, vineyard, v. γουνός.

div1.head: ἁλωίτης
div1.sense: a thresher, husbandman, Anth.

div1.head: ἅλων
div1.etym: found in the obl. cases, Arist.

div1.head: ἀλωπέκειος
div1.sense: of a fox: ἀλωπεκέη, Attic -κῆ (sub. δορά), a fox-skin, Hdt., Plut.

div1.head: ἀλωπεκίας
div1.sense: branded with a fox, Luc.

div1.head: ἀλωπεκιδεύς
div1.sense: a young fox, Ar.

div1.head: ἀλωπεκίζω
div1.sense: to play the fox, Ar.

div1.head: ἀλωπέκιον
div1.sense: a little fox, Ar.

div1.head: ἀλωπεκίς
div1.sense: = κυναλώπηξ, Xen.
a foxskin cap, Xen.

div1.head: ἀλώπηξ
div1.sense: a fox, Solon, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἁλώσιμος
div1.sense: easy to take, win, or conquer, Hdt., Thuc., etc.
of the mind, easy to apprehend, Soph.
(ἅλωσις) of or for capture, παιὰν ἁλ. a song of triumph on taking a city, Aesch.; βάξις ἁλ. tidings of the capture, Aesch.

div1.head: ἅλωσις
div1.sense: a taking, capture, conquest, destruction, Pind., Aesch., etc.; δαΐων ἅλ. conquest by the enemy, Aesch.: means of conquest, Soph.: ἁλῶναι ἰσχυρὰν ἅλωσιν to be taken without power to escape, Plut.
as law-term, conviction, Plat.

div1.head: ἅλως
div1.sense: a threshing-floor, Xen., etc.:—then, from its round shape,
the disk of the sun or moon, or of a shield, Aesch., etc.

div1.head: ἁλωτός
div1.sense: to be taken or conquered, Thuc.
attainable, Soph.

div1.head: ἀλώφητος
div1.sense: unremitting, Plut.

div1.head: Ἀμαζονικός
div1.sense: of or like the Amazons, Plut.

div1.head: Ἀμαζών
div1.etym: Commonly derived from a_privat, μαζός, from the fable that they got rid of the right breast, that it might not interfere with the use of the bow.
div1.sense: mostly in pl. Ἀμάζονες, αἱ, the Amazons, a warlike race of women in Scythia, Il., Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἀμαθαίνω
div1.sense: to be untaught, stupid, Plat.

div1.head: ἀμαθής
div1.sense: unlearned, ignorant, stupid, boorish (v. ἀμαθία), Hdt., etc.; ἀμαθὴς τὴν ἐκείνων ἀμαθίαν stupid with their stupidity, Plat.; ἀμαθέστερον τῶν νόμων ὑπεροψίας παιδεύεσθαι to be educated with too little learning to despise the laws, Thuc.:—adv., ἀμαθῶς ἁμαρτεῖν to err through ignorance, Eur.
c. gen. rei, without knowledge of a thing, Eur.; περί τινος, πρός τι Plat.
not heard of, unknown, ἀμ. ἔρρει Eur.:—adv., ἀμαθῶς χωρεῖν of events, to take an unforeseen course, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀμαθία
div1.sense: ignorance, Soph., etc.; ἀμ.τινός ignorant of a thing, Xen.; περί τι Xen.

div1.head: ἄμαθος
div1.sense: sandy soil, opp. to sea-sand (ψάμαθος), Il.; in pl. the links or dunes by the sea, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἀμαθύνω
div1.sense: to level with the sand, utterly destroy, Il., Aesch.
to spread smooth, level, κόνιν h. Hom.

div1.head: ἀμαιμάκετος
div1.sense: irresistible, Hom., Soph.
strong, stubborn, of a mast, Od.

div1.head: ἀμαλδύνω
div1.sense: to soften: then to destroy, efface, Il.: to use up, squander, χρήματα Theocr.:— Pass., ὥς κεν τεῖχος ἀμαλδύνηται Il.; ἀμαλδυνθήσομαι Ar.
metaph. to conceal, disguise, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἀμάλθακτος
div1.sense: not to be softened, Anth.

div1.head: ἄμαλλα
div1.sense: cut corn, a sheaf, Soph., Plut.

div1.head: ἀμαλλοδετήρ
div1.sense: a binder of sheaves, Il.

div1.head: ἀμαλός
div1.sense: soft, weak, feeble, Hom., Eur.

div1.head: ἁμάμαξυς
div1.sense: a vine trained on two poles, Sapph., etc.

div1.head: ἄμαξα
div1.sense: a wagon, wain, opp. to the war-chariot (ἅρμα), Lat. plaustrum, Hom.
c. gen. a wagon-load of, πετρῶν, σίτου Xen.
the carriage of the plough, Lat. currus, Hes.:—Charlesʼ wain in the heavens, the Great Bear (ἄρκτος), Hom.
= ἁμαξιτός, Anth.

div1.head: ἁμαξεύς
div1.sense: for a wagon: βοῦς ἁ. a draught ox, Plut.

div1.head: ἁμαξεύω
div1.sense: to traverse with a wagon: Pass. to be traversed by wagon-roads, of a country, Hdt.
metaph., ἁμαξεύειν βίοτον to drag on a weary life, Anth.
intr. to be a wagoner, Plut., Anth.

div1.head: ἁμαξήρης
div1.sense: of or on a carriage, Aesch.; ἁμ. τρίβος a high-road, Eur.

div1.head: ἁμαξιαῖος
div1.sense: large enough to load a wagon, λίθος Xen., etc.

div1.head: ἁμαξίς
div1.sense: a little wagon, Lat. plostellum, Hdt., Ar.

div1.head: ἁμαξίτης
div1.sense: of or for a wagon, Anth.

div1.head: ἁμαξιτός
div1.sense: traversed by wagons, ἁμ. ὁδός a carriage-road, high-road, Pind., Xen.; and without ὁδός, as Subst., Il.

div1.head: ἁμάξοικος
div1.sense: dwelling in a wagon, Strab.

div1.head: ἁμαξοπηγός
div1.sense: a cartwright, Plut.

div1.head: ἁμαξοπληθής
div1.sense: large enough to fill a wagon, like ἁμαξιαῖος, Eur.

div1.head: ἁμαξουργός
div1.sense: = ἁμαξοπηγός
ἐξ ἁμαξουργοῦ λέγειν to talk cartwrightsʼ slang, Ar.

div1.head: ἅμα
div1.sense: at once, at the same time, Hom., etc.
prep. c. dat. at the same time with, together with, ἅμʼ ἠοῖ at dawn, Il.; ἅμα ἕῳ, ἅμα ἕῳ γιγνομένῃ Thuc.

div1.head: ἀμάρακον
div1.sense: Lat. amaracum, amaracus, Anth.

div1.head: ἀμαράντινος
div1.sense: of amaranth:— metaph. unfading, imperishable, NTest.

div1.head: ἀμάραντος
div1.sense: unfading, undecaying, NTest.
as Subst. amaranth, an unfading flower, Diosc.

div1.head: ἀμάρα
div1.sense: a trench, conduit, channel, for watering meadows, Il., Theocr.

div1.head: ἁμαρτάνω
div1.sense: to miss, miss the mark, c. gen., ἑκὼν ἡμάρτανε φωτός he missed the man on purpose, Il.; ἁμ. τῆς ὁδοῦ to miss the road, Ar.; τοῦ σκοποῦ Antipho.

generally, to fail of doing, fail of oneʼs purpose, to miss oneʼs point, fail, go wrong, Od., etc.; c. gen., νοήματος ἤμβροτεν failed in hitting upon the thought, Od., etc.; ἁμ. τοῦ χρησμοῦ to mistake it, Hdt.
to fail of having, i. e. to be deprived of, lose, c. gen., ἁμαρτήσεσθαι ὀπωπῆς that I should lose my sight, Od.; ἁμ. πιστῆς ἀλόχου Eur.

to fail, do wrong, err, sin, Hom., etc.; c. dat. modi, γνώμῃ ἁμ. to err in judgment, Hdt.; or ἐν λόγοις Hdt., Plat.; with a neut. adj., τόδε γʼ ἤμβροτον I erred in this, Od.; in Prose, ἁμ. περί τι ἁμ. περί τι to do wrong in a matter, Plat., etc.
Pass., ἁμαρτάνεταί τι a sin is committed, Thuc.:—impers., ἁμαρτάνεται περί τι Plat.

div1.head: ἁμάρτημα
div1.sense: a failure, fault, sin, Soph., Plat.
a bodily defect, malady, Plat.

div1.head: ἁμαρτῆ
div1.sense: together, at once, Hom.

div1.head: ἁμαρτητικός
div1.sense: prone to error, Arist.

div1.head: ἁμαρτία
div1.sense: a failure, fault, sin, Aesch., etc.; ἁμ. τινός a fault committed by one, Aesch.; ἁμ. δόξης fault of judgment, Thuc.
generally, guilt, sin, Plat., Arist., NTest.

div1.head: ἁμαρτίνοος
div1.sense: erring in mind, distraught, Hes., etc.

div1.head: ἁμαρτοεπής
div1.sense: erring in words, speaking at random, Il.

div1.head: ἀμαρτύρητος
div1.sense: needing no witness, Eur.

div1.head: ἀμάρτυρος
div1.sense: without witness, unattested, Thuc., etc.:—adv. -ρως, Dem.

div1.head: ἁμαρτωλός
div1.sense: sinful:— as Subst. a sinner, NTest.

div1.head: ἀμαρυγή
div1.sense: a sparkling, glancing, of the eye, Hhymn.; of horsesʼ feet, Ar.

div1.head: ἀμάρυγμα
div1.sense: a sparkle, twinkle, changing colour and light, Anth.; quivering, of the lip, Theocr. From

div1.head: ἀμαρύσσω
div1.sense: to sparkle, glance, of the eye, Hes.:—Mid. of light, colour, Anth.

div1.head: ἁματροχάω
div1.sense: to run together, in Epic part. ἁματροχόων, Od.

div1.head: ἁματροχιά
div1.sense: a jostling or clashing of wheels, ἁματροχιὰς ἀλεείνων Il.

div1.head: ἀμαυρόβιος
div1.sense: living in darkness, Ar.

div1.head: ἀμαυρός
div1.sense: dimly seen, dim, faint, baffling sight, εἴδωλον ἀμ. a shadowy spectre, Od.
having no light, darksome, νύξ Luc.:—blind, sightless, Soph.; so, ἀμαυρῶι κώλωι with blind foot, said of a blind man, Soph.
metaph.,
dim, obscure, uncertain, κληδών Aesch.; ἐλπίς Plut.
obscure, unknown, Hes., Soph., Eur.
gloomy, troubled, φρήν Aesch.
act. enfeebling, νοῦσος Anth.

div1.head: ἀμαυρόω
div1.sense: to make dim, faint, or obscure, Xen.; metaph. to impair, Eur., etc.:—Pass. to become dim, suffer eclipse, of the sun, Hdt.; to disappear, Hes.

div1.head: ἀμαύρωμα
div1.sense: obscuration, Plut.

div1.head: ἀμαχεί
div1.sense: without resistance, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀμαχητί
div1.sense: without battle, Il., Hdt.

div1.head: ἀμάχητος
div1.sense: not to be fought with, unconquerable, Soph.
not having fought, not having been in battle, Xen.

div1.head: ἄμαχος
div1.sense: without battle:
of a person, with whom no one fights, unconquered, unconquerable, invincible, Hdt., etc.; of places, impregnable, Hdt.; of things, irresistible, Pind., Aesch.
act. not having fought, taking no part in the battle, Xen.
disinclined to fight, peaceful, Aesch.: not contentious, NTest.

div1.head: ἀμάω
div1.etym: From Root !μα, with a_euphon; cf. Lat. MET-O, to mow.
div1.sense: to reap corn, absol., Il., Hes.; metaph., ἤμησαν καλῶς they reaped abundantly, Aesch.:—so c. acc. to reap, λήϊον Od.; σῖτον Hdt.
generally, to cut reeds, etc., Il., Theocr.

div1.head: ἀμάω
div1.sense: in Mid. to gather together, collect, as reapers gather in corn, ἀμησάμενοι γάλα having collected milk:—so in Act., ἀμήσας κόνιν, having scraped together earth over a corpse, Anth.

div1.head: ἀμβλήδην
div1.sense: with sudden bursts, ἀμβλ. γοόωσα Il.

div1.head: ἀμβλίσκω
div1.sense: to cause to miscarry, Soph., Plat.
of the woman, to miscarry, Plut.

div1.head: ἀμβλύνω
div1.sense: to blunt, take the edge off a sharp instrument, and metaph. to make dull, ὄμματος αὐγήν Anth.:—Pass. to become dull, lose its edge or force, Aesch., Thuc.

div1.head: ἀμβλύς
div1.sense: blunt, dulled, with the edge taken off, of a sharp instrument, Plat., etc.:—metaph. dull, dim, of sight, ἀμβλὺ ὁρᾶν, βλέπειν Plat.; of the feelings, ἀμβλυτέραι τῆι ὀργῆι with anger less keen, Thuc.; ἀμβλύτερον ποιεῖν τι less vigorous, Thuc.
in Aesch. Eum. of Orestes, having lost the edge of guilt: but of persons, generally, dull, spiritless, having lost the keenness of oneʼs feelings, Thuc.
act. darkening, of a cloud, Anth. Hence

div1.head: ἀμβλύτης
div1.sense: bluntness: metaph. dullness, Plut.

div1.head: ἀμβλυωπέω
div1.sense: to be dim-sighted, Xen.

div1.head: ἀμβλυωπία
div1.sense: dim-sightedness, Plat.

div1.head: ἀμβλυώσσω
div1.sense: to be dim-sighted, Plat., etc.; ἀμβλ. πρὸς τὸ φῶς to be blind to it, Luc.

div1.head: ἀμβλωπός
div1.sense: bedimmed, dark, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀμβολάδην
div1.sense: bubbling up, Il.: metaph. by jets, capriciously, Anth.
like a prelude, Hhymn., Pind.

div1.head: ἀμβολάς
div1.sense: thrown up, of earth, Xen.

div1.head: ἀμβολιεργός
div1.sense: putting off a work, dilatory, Hes., Plut.

div1.head: ἀμβροσία
div1.sense: ambrosia (i.e. immortality), the food of the gods, Hom., etc.

div1.head: ἀμβρόσιος
div1.sense: immortal, Hhymn.:—in Hom. night and sleep are called ambrosial, divine, as gifts of the gods; so of everything belonging to the gods, as their hair, robes, sandals, the fodder and the mangers of their horses.

div1.head: ἀμβροτόπωλος
div1.sense: with coursers of immortal strain , Eur.

div1.head: ἄμβροτος
div1.etym: a_privat, βροτός with μ inserted; like lengthd. form ἀμβρόσιος.
div1.sense: immortal, divine, Hom., Aesch.
νὺξ ἄμβροτος, like ἀμβροσίη νύξ, Od.;— then of all things belonging to the gods, Hom.

div1.head: ἀμέγαρτος
div1.sense: unenviable:
melancholy, direful, Hom., Eur.
of persons, unhappy, miserable, Od.

div1.head: ἀμεθύστινος
div1.sense: of amethyst, Luc.

div1.head: ἀμέθυστος
div1.sense: not drunken, Plut.
as Subst., ἀμέθυστος, ἡ, amethyst, the precious stone, supposed to be a remedy against drunkenness, NTest.

div1.head: ἀμείβω
div1.etym: From Root !μειβ, or !μευ, with α prefixed, cf. ἀμεύομαι Lat. MOV-eo.
div1.sense: Act. to change, exchange, ἔντεʼ ἄμειβεν Il.; ἀμ. τί τινος, as γόνυ γουνὸς ἀμείβων changing one knee for the other, i. e. walking slowly, Il.:—and so, either
to give in exchange, τεύχεʼ ἄμειβε χρύσεα χαλκείων exchanged golden armour for brasen, Il.; or
to take in exchange, πόσιν ἀντὶ σᾶς ἀμεῖψαι ψυχᾶς to redeem him at the price of thine own life, Eur.
of place, to change it, and so to pass, cross, Aesch., Eur.: —then, either to pass out of a place, leave it, or to pass into, enter it, Hdt., Attic
simply, to change, alter, χρῶτα oneʼs colour, Aesch.
Causal, to make others change, τεύχεʼ ἄμειβον Il.: to pass on, hand on from one to another, Eur.
like Mid. I. 3, to repay, return, ἀμ. χάριν Aesch.
intr. in part., ἀμείβοντες, οἱ, interchangers, i. e. the rafters that meet and cross each other, Il.; ἐν ἀμείβοντι ἀμοιβαδίς, Pind.
ἀμείβει καινὸν ἐκ καινῶν one new thing comes on after others, Eur.
Mid. to change one with another, ἀμειβόμενοι by turns, alternately, Hom.: to come in turn, Eur.
often of dialogue, to answer one another, Od.; often in part. ἀμειβόμενος, answering, in answer, Hom.; c. acc., ἀμ. τινα μύθωι, μύθοις, ἐπέεσσι Hom.; even, ταῦτα τοὺς φίλους ἠμείψατο Hdt.
to repay, requite, δώροισιν ἀμ. τινα Od.; χρηστοῖσι Hdt.; also c. acc. et dat. rei, ἀμ. εὐεργεσίας χάρισιν Xen.
to get in exchange, λώιους φρένας τῶν νῦν παρουσῶν Soph.
like Act. to change a place, to pass either out of or into, Hom., etc.

div1.head: ἀμείλικτος
div1.sense: unsoftened, cruel, Hom., Hes.

div1.head: ἀμείλιχος
div1.sense: implacable, relentless, Il.
of things, unmitigated, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀμείνων
div1.sense: better, abler, stronger, braver, Hom., etc.; v. ἀγαθός.
of things, better, fitter, Hom.
ἄμεινόν ἐστι ʼtis better, c. inf., ἐπεὶ πείθεσθαι ἄμεινον Il., etc.; with negat., οὐ γὰρ ἄμεινον ʼtwere better not, Hdt.
τὰ ἀμείνω φρονέειν to choose the better part, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀμείρω
div1.sense: to bereave of a thing, c. gen., Pind.

div1.head: ἄμειψις
div1.sense: exchange, interchange, Plut.
change, succession, Plut.

div1.head: ἀμέλγω
div1.etym: From Root !μελγ, with α prefixed, comes also ἀμολγεύς; cf. Lat. mulg_eo.
div1.sense: to milk sheep and goats; βόας Theocr.: —Mid., in metaph. sense, ἀμέλγεσθαι τοὺς ξένους to milk them dry, Ar.
to draw milk from the animals, ἀμ. γάλα Hdt.; Pass., ὄϊες ἀμελγόμεναι γάλα having milk drawn from them, milch-ewes, Il.
metaph. to squeeze out like milk, to press out, ἐκ βοτρύων ξανθὸν ἄμελξε γάνος Anth.
to drink, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀμέλεια
div1.sense: indifference, negligence, Thuc., etc; τινος towards a person, περί τινος about a thing, Plat.

div1.head: ἀμέλει
div1.sense: imperat. of ἀμελέω, never mind, Ar., Xen.; aor1 ἀμέλησον Luc.
as adv. by all means, of course, Ar., Plat., etc.

div1.head: ἀμελετησία
div1.sense: want of practice, Plat.

div1.head: ἀμελέτητος
div1.sense: unpractised, Plat., etc.

div1.head: ἀμελέω
div1.sense: to have no care for, be neglectful of, c. gen., Hom., Hdt., etc.
absol. to be careless, heedless, negligent, Hes., etc.; τὸ μἀμελεῖν (crasis for μὴ ἀμελεῖν) carefulness, Aesch.
c. acc. et part. to overlook, and so to let, allow, suffer, παῖδας θνήσκοντας ἀμελεῖ he lets them die, Eur.:—Xen. has gen. in same sense.
c. inf. to neglect to do, Hdt., Plat.
Pass. to be slighted, overlooked, Soph., etc.; οἱ ἠμελημένοι ἄνθρωποι Thuc.:—adv. ἠμελημένως, carelessly, Xen.

div1.head: ἀμελής
div1.sense: careless, heedless, negligent, Ar., Xen., etc.:—adv. ἀμελῶς, carelessly, Thuc.; comp. ἀμελέστερον, Thuc.
c. gen. careless of a thing, Plat., etc.; περί τινα Isocr.:—adv., ἀμελῶς ἔχειν to be careless, πρός τι πρός τι Xen.
pass. uncared for, unheeded, Xen.

div1.head: ἀμελητέος
div1.sense: one must neglect, τινός Isocr.
ἀμελητέος, α, ον, to be neglected, Luc.

div1.head: ἀμέλητος
div1.sense: not to be cared for, Theogn.

div1.head: ἀμέλλητος
div1.sense: not to be put off, Luc.

div1.head: ἄμεμπτος
div1.sense: not to be blamed, blameless, Eur., Dem.; ἄμεμπτος χρόνου in regard of time, Aesch.; ἀμεμφής Aesch.
of things, perfect in its kind, Xen.; ἄμ. ἐκείνηι without blame to her, Plut.: comp. ἀμεμπτότερος, less blameworthy, Plut.:—adv. -τως, so as to merit no blame, right well, Soph., Xen.
act. not blaming, content, ἀμεμφής Plut., ἄμεμπτόν τινα ποιεῖσθαι Xen.:—so adv., ἀμέμπτως δέχεσθαί τινα without censure, Plut.

div1.head: ἀμεμφία
div1.sense: freedom from blame, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: ἀμενηνός
div1.sense: powerless, fleeting, feeble, of ghosts, Od., etc.; of dreams, Od.; of one wounded, Il.
of mortal men generally, Hhymn., Ar.

div1.head: ἀμενηνόω
div1.sense: to deaden the force of a thing, Il.

div1.head: ἀμέργω
div1.sense: to pluck or pull, Lat. decerpo, Sapph., Eur.:—Mid. to pluck for oneself, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀμέρδω
div1.sense: to deprive of, bereave of, a thing, c. gen., Hes., Od.:—Pass. to be bereft of a thing, αἰῶνος, δαιτός Hom.

c. acc. pers. only, to bereave of his rights, to rob, Il.; ὄσσε δʼ ἄμερδεν αὐγή the glare bereft the eyes of power, blinded them, Il.; ἔντεα καπνὸς ἀμέρδει the smoke robs the arms of lustre, tarnishes them, Od.

div1.head: ἀμερής
div1.sense: without parts, indivisible, Plat.

div1.head: ἀμέριμνος
div1.sense: free from care, unconcerned, Anth.
pass. uncared for, unheeded, Soph.
driving away care, Anth.

div1.head: ἀμετακίνητος
div1.sense: immovable: adv. ἀμετακινήτως, Arist.

div1.head: ἀμεταμέλητος
div1.sense: not to be repented of, Plat.
of persons, unrepentant, Arist.

div1.head: ἀμετανόητος
div1.sense: not to be repented of, Luc.
act. unrepentant, NTest.

div1.head: ἀμετάστατος
div1.sense: not to be transposed, unchangeable, unchanging, Plat.
not to be got rid of or put away, Plat.

div1.head: ἀμεταστρεπτί
div1.sense: adv. ἀμεταστρεπτί_ , or ἀμεταστρεπτεί, without turning, straight forward, ἰέναι, φεύγειν Plat.

div1.head: ἀμετάστρεπτος
div1.sense: without turning about.

div1.head: ἀμετάστροφος
div1.sense: unalterable, Plat., Plut.

div1.head: ἀμέτοχος
div1.sense: having no share of a thing, c. gen., Thuc.

div1.head: ἀμέτρητος
div1.sense: unmeasured, immeasurable, immense, Od., etc.
unnumbered, countless, Eur.

div1.head: ἀμετρία
div1.sense: excess, disproportion, Plat., etc.

div1.head: ἀμετρόβιος
div1.sense: of immensely long life, Anth.

div1.head: ἀμετροεπής
div1.sense: unmeasured in words, Il.

div1.head: ἀμετροπότης
div1.sense: drinking to excess, Anth.

div1.head: ἄμετρος
div1.sense: without measure, immense, excessive, boundless, Plat.:—adv. ἀμέτρως, Plat.; neut. pl. ἄμετρα as adv., Babr.
immoderate, in moral sense, Plat.:—adv. ἀμέτρως, Xen., etc.

div1.head: ἀμεύομαι
div1.sense: to conquer, Pind.

div1.head: ἀμευσίπορος
div1.sense: with interchanging paths, Pind.

div1.head: ἀμήνιτος
div1.sense: not angry or wrathful, Hdt.; χειμὼν οὐκ ἀμήνιτος θεοῖς sent not but by the special wrath of heaven, Aesch.:—adv. -τως, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀμήν
div1.etym: for ἁμῆι, dat. fem. of ἁμός τὶς
div1.sense: Hebr. adv. verily, of a truth, so be it, NTest.:— τὸ ἀμήν, certainty, NTest.

div1.head: ἄμη
div1.sense: a shovel or mattock, Ar., Xen.

div1.head: ἁμῆ
div1.sense: in a certain way: ἁμη-γέ-πη ἁμη-γέ-πηι or other, Plat.

div1.head: ἄμης
div1.sense: a kind of milk-cake, Ar.

div1.head: ἀμητήρ
div1.sense: a reaper, Il.

div1.head: ἄμητος
div1.sense: a reaping, harvesting, Il. (metaph. of slaughter).
harvest, harvest time, Hes., Hdt.
the crop or harvest reaped, Lat. seges, Anth.

div1.head: ἀμήτωρ
div1.sense: without mother, motherless, Hdt., Eur.
unmotherly, μήτηρ ἀμήτωρ Soph.

div1.head: ἀμηχανέω
div1.sense: to be at a loss for, or in want of a thing, c. gen., Hdt.; περί τινος about a thing, Eur.; ὅπα τράπωμαι which way to turn, Aesch.
absol., ἀμηχανῶν βιοτεύω I live without the necessaries of life, Xen.

div1.head: ἀμηχανία
div1.sense: want of means, helplessness, impotence, Od., etc.; ὑπʼ ἀμηχανίας Ar.
of things, hardship, trouble, Hes.

div1.head: ἀμήχανος
div1.sense: without means or resource, at a loss, τινος about one, Od.; ἀμ. εἴς τι awkward at a thing, Eur.:—adv., ἀμηχάνως ἔχειν ἀμηχανεῖν, Aesch., Eur.
c. inf. at a loss how to do, unable to do, Soph., Dem., etc.
in pass. sense,

impracticable, difficult, c. inf., ἀμήχανός ἐσσι πιθέσθαι Il.; ὁδὸς ἀμ. εἰσελθεῖν a road hard to enter on, Xen.; ἀμήχανόν ἐστι, c. inf. ʼtis impossible, Hdt., etc.:—absol., ἀμήχανα impossibilities, Aesch., etc.
against whom nothing can be done, irresistible, of gods, Il.:—of things, ἀμήχανα ἔργα mischief without resource or remedy, Aesch., Hes., Trag.; of dreams, inexplicable, Od.

extraordinary, immense, Plat.; ἀμήχανον εὐδαιμονίας an extraordinary amount of happiness, Il.:—often c. acc., ἀμήχανος τὸ μέγεθος, τὸ κάλλος, τὸ πλῆθος, i. e. inconceivable in point of size, etc., Plat., Xen.:—Plat. often adds the relatives οἷος, ὅσος, and ὡς, as, ἀμήχανον ὅσον χρόνον an inconceivable length of time, ἀμηχάνως ὡς εὖ extraordinarily well.

div1.head: ἀμίαντος
div1.sense: undefiled, Theogn.; Aesch. calls the sea simply ἡ ἀμίαντος.

div1.head: ἀμιγής
div1.sense: unmixed, pure, Arist.

div1.head: ἀμιθρέω
div1.etym: by Epic metath. for ἀριθμέω, Theocr.

div1.head: ἄμικτος
div1.sense: unmingled, that will not mingle or blend, Aesch.
unmixed, pure, Plat.

of persons, not mingling with others (cf. μιγῆναι to have intercourse), unsociable, of Centaurs and Cyclopes, Soph., Eur.:— ἀμ. τινι having no intercourse with others, Eur.; so of laws and customs, ἄμ. νόμιμα τοῖς ἄλλοις Thuc.
of places, inhospitable, Eur.

div1.head: ἁμιλλάομαι
div1.sense: to compete, vie, contend with another, Lat. aemulari, c. dat. pers., Hdt., etc.; πρός τινα Eur.; c. dat. rei, to contend in or with a thing, Hdt.; περί τινος about a thing, Luc.
in pass. sense, τὸ πεζὸν πρὸς ἀλλήλους ἁμιλληθέν being matched one against another, Thuc.
of a single person, to strive, struggle, ἐπί τι to a point, Xen.; πρός τι to obtain a thing, Plat.

div1.head: ἅμιλλα
div1.sense: a contest for superiority, a conflict, Hdt., etc.

c. gen. rei, ἰσχύος ἅμ. a trial of strength, Pind.; ποδοῖν, λόγων ἅμ. Eur.; ἀρετῆς Plat.; c. gen. objecti, ἅμ. λέκτρων a contest for marriage, Eur.; so with an adj., ἅμ. φιλόπλουτος, πολύτεκνος a striving after wealth or children, Eur.

div1.head: ἁμίλλημα
div1.sense: a conflict, v. ἄλεκτρος.

div1.head: ἁμιλλητήρ
div1.sense: a competitor in the race, v. τρόχος B.

div1.head: ἀμιμητόβιοι
div1.sense: inimitable in oneʼs life, Plut.

div1.head: ἀμίμητος
div1.sense: inimitable, Anth.; τινί in a thing, Plut.:—adv. -τως, Anth.

div1.head: ἀμιξία
div1.sense: of persons, want of intercourse, ἀλλήλων with one another, Thuc.; πρός τινα Luc.; ἀμιξίη χρημάτων want of money dealings, Hdt.

div1.head: ἅμιππος
div1.sense: keeping up with horses, i. e. fleet as a horse, Soph.
ἅμιπποι, οἱ, infantry mixed with cavalry, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: ἀμισθί
div1.sense: Eur., Dem., χρημάτων ἀμ. without reward of money, Plut.

div1.head: ἄμισθος
div1.sense: without hire or pay, unhired, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀμίσθωτος
div1.sense: bringing in no rent, Dem.

div1.head: ἀμίς
div1.sense: a chamber-pot, Ar.

div1.head: ἀμιτροχίτωνες
div1.sense: epith. of Lycian, wearing no girdle (μίτρα) with their coat of mail (χιτών), Il.

div1.head: ἀμιχθαλόεις
div1.sense: epith. of Lemnos, inaccessible, inhospitable, Il.

div1.head: ἅμμα
div1.sense: anything tied or made to tie, and so,
a knot, Hdt.
a noose, halter, Eur.
a band, Eur.; ἅ. παρθενίας the maiden girdle, Anth.
in pl. the wrestlerʼs arms or hug, Plut.

div1.head: ἀμμέσον
div1.sense: poet. for ἀνὰ μέσον.

div1.head: ἀμμορία
div1.sense: what is not oneʼs fate, bad fortune, Od.

div1.head: ἄμμορος
div1.sense: without share of a thing, c. gen., Il., Soph.:—free from, without, ὠδίνων Anth.
absol. unhappy, Il.

div1.head: ἄμμος
div1.sense: sand (v. ἄμαθος), Plat., etc.
sandy ground, a race-course, Xen.

div1.head: ἀμμότροφος
div1.sense: growing in sand, Anth.

div1.head: Ἀμμωνίς
div1.sense: Ἀ. ἕδρα the seat of Ammon, i. e. Libya, Eur.

div1.head: Ἄμμων
div1.sense: the Libyan, Zeus-Ammon, Hdt., Pind., etc.

div1.head: ἀμνάς
div1.sense: a lamb, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀμνεῖος
div1.sense: of a lamb, ἀμν. χλαῖνα a lambskin cloak, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀμνημόνευτος
div1.sense: unmentioned, unheeded, Eur.

div1.head: ἀμνημονέω
div1.sense: to be unmindful, absol., Aesch., Eur.
c. gen. to make no mention of, not speak of, Eur., etc.; so, ἀμν. τι περί τινος Thuc.

div1.head: ἀμνημοσύνη
div1.sense: forgetfulness, Eur.

div1.head: ἀμνήμων
div1.sense: unmindful, forgetful, Soph., Plat.; τινός of a thing, Aesch., etc.
pass. forgotten, not mentioned, Eur.

div1.head: ἀμνηστέω
div1.sense: pass. to be forgotten, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀμνηστία
div1.sense: forgetfulness of wrong: an amnesty, Plut.

div1.head: ἄμνηστος
div1.sense: unremembered, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀμνίον
div1.sense: a bowl in which the blood of victims was caught, Od.

div1.head: ἀμνίς
div1.sense: a ewe-lamb, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀμνοκῶν
div1.sense: sheep-minded, i. e. a simpleton, Ar.

div1.head: ἀμνός
div1.sense: a lamb, Soph., Ar.; ἄμνοι τοὺς τρόπους, lambs in temper, Ar.:—for the oblique cases, ἀρνός, ἀρνί, ἄρνα are used; v. ἀρνός.

div1.head: ἀμογητί
div1.sense: without toil or effort, Il.

div1.head: ἀμόγητος
div1.sense: unwearied, untiring, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἀμοθεί
div1.sense: without quarrel, Lacon. word in Thuc.

div1.head: ἁμόθεν
div1.sense: from some place or other, from what source soever, Od.; ἁμόθεν γέ ποθεν Plat.

div1.head: ἀμοιβαδίς
div1.sense: by turns, alternately, ἀμ. ἄλλοθεν ἄλλος one after another, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀμοιβαῖος
div1.sense: giving like for like, retributive, Pind., Anth.:—adv. -ως, in requital, Luc.
interchanged, alternate, Hdt.; ἀμοιβαῖα, alternating verses, sung by two persons one in answer to the other, Plat.; ἀμοιβαίη ἀοιδή Theocr.

div1.head: ἀμοιβάς
div1.sense: for a change of raiment, Od.

div1.head: ἀμοιβηδίς
div1.sense: alternately, in succession, Hom.

div1.head: ἀμοιβή
div1.sense: a requital, recompense, compensation, return, payment, Od.; ἑκατόμβης for the hecatomb, Od.
an answer, Hdt.
change, exchange, of money, Plut.
alternation, κακῶν Eur.

div1.head: ἀμοιβός
div1.sense: one who exchanges, ἀμοιβοί soldiers that relieve others, Il.
as adj. in return or in exchange for a thing, c. gen., Soph.

div1.head: ἀμοιρέω
div1.sense: to have no share in a thing, c. gen., Plut.

div1.head: ἄμοιρος
div1.sense: without share in a thing, c. gen., Aesch., etc.
absol. = ἄμμορος, unfortunate, Eur.

div1.head: ἀμολγαῖος
div1.sense: of milk, made with milk, or (from ἀμολγός an old word for ἀκμή), of the best flour, Hes.

div1.head: ἀμολγεύς
div1.sense: a milk-pail, Lat. mulctra, Theocr., Anth.

div1.head: ἀμόλγιον
div1.sense: a milk-pail, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀμολγός
div1.sense: a word of uncertain sense:—Hom. always joins νυκτὸς ἀμολγῶι, in the hours before daybreak, or the hours after sunset, i. e. generally, at night-time, Il. (The supposition that ἀμολγός meant milking-time (from ἀμέλγω) will not suit the sense. It is said that ἀμολγός was an old word for ἀκμή, so that νυκτὸς ἀμ. means the dead of night.)

div1.head: ἄμομφος
div1.sense: blameless, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀμόργινος
div1.sense: made of Amorgian flax, Ar.

div1.head: ἀμοργίς
div1.sense: fine flax from the isle of Amorgos, Ar.

div1.head: ἄμορος
div1.sense: = ἄμοιρος c. gen., Eur.
absol., unlucky, wretched, Soph.

div1.head: ἀμορφία
div1.sense: unshapeliness, unsightliness, Eur.

div1.head: ἄμορφος
div1.sense: misshapen, unsightly, Hdt., Eur.: —Sup. ἀμορφέστατος (as if from ἀμορφής), Hdt.; but regul. form -ότερος, -ότατος, Xen., Plut.

div1.head: ἁμός
div1.sense: = ἡμέτερος, our, ours, Hom., etc.
Attic = ἐμός, when a long penult. is required.

div1.head: ἁμός2
div1.sense: an old word equiv. to εἷς or τις, only found in the adv. forms ἁμοῦ, ἁμῆ, ἁμοῖ, ἁμῶς, ἁμόθεν.
as, when, Theocr.

div1.head: ἄμοτος
div1.sense: raging, savage, Theocr.
in Hom. as adv. ἄμοτον, insatiably, ἄμ. μεμαώς, striving incessantly; ἄμ. κλαίω I weep continually; τανύοντο they struggled restlessly forwards.

div1.head: ἁμοῦ
div1.sense: ἀμοῦγέ που, somewhere or other, Lys.: cf. ἀμόθεν, ἀμῆ, ἀμοῖ.

div1.head: ἀμουσία
div1.sense: want of refinement, rudeness, grossness, Eur., Plat.
want of harmony, Eur.

div1.head: ἄμουσος
div1.sense: without the Muses, without taste, unrefined, inelegant, rude, gross, Eur., Ar.:—adv. ἀμούσως Plat.
unmusical, Eur.; ἀμουσόταται ᾠδαί Eur.

div1.head: ἀμοχθεί
div1.sense: without effort.

div1.head: ἁμόχθησα
div1.sense: crasis for ἃ ἐμόχθησα.

div1.head: ἄμοχθος
div1.sense: free from toil and trouble, Soph.:— shrinking from toil, Pind.
not tired, Xen.

div1.head: ἄμπαλος
div1.sense: as ἄμ-παλος, poet. for ἀνάπαλος, Pind.
as ἄμπ-αλος, ον, Doric for ἀμφίαλος, Theocr.

div1.head: ἄμ
div1.sense: poet. for ἀνά, before a word beginning with the labials e. g. ἂμ βωμοῖσι, ἂμ μέσον, ἂμ πεδίον ἂμ φυτά.

div1.head: ἀμπέλινος
div1.sense: of the vine, Hdt.
of persons, given to wine, Anth.
