div1.head: ἀμπελίς
div1.sense: a vine-plant, Ar.
the bird ἀμπελίων, Ar.

div1.head: ἀμπελόεις
div1.sense: rich in vines, Il., etc.

div1.head: ἄμπελος
div1.etym: Perh.from ἀμπί (Aeolic for ἀμφί) , ἕλιξ, from its clasping tendrils.
div1.sense: a vine, Lat. vitis, Od., etc.

div1.head: ἀμπελουργέω
div1.sense: to dress vines, Theophr., Luc.

div1.head: ἀμπελουργός
div1.sense: a vine-dresser, Ar., etc.

div1.head: ἀμπελοφύτωρ
div1.sense: a vine-planter, Anth.

div1.head: ἀμπελών
div1.sense: a vineyard, Aeschin., etc.

div1.head: ἀμπεχόνη
div1.sense: a fine robe: generally, clothing, clothes, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: ἀμπέχω
div1.sense: to surround, cover, Lat. cingere, c. acc., Od., Soph., etc.:—absol., σκότος ἀμπίσχων surrounding darkness, Eur.
to embrace, Eur.
to put round, Lat. circumdare, esp. to put on another, c. dupl. acc., Ar., etc.
Mid. to put round oneself, to wear, χλαίνας οὐκ ἀμπισχοῦνται Ar.; ἀμπισχόμενος with your cloak round you, Ar.

div1.head: ἀμπλακεῖν
div1.etym: pres. in use is ἀμπλακίσκῶ ἁμαρτάνω
div1.sense: c. gen. to come short of, Pind., Soph.
to lose, be bereft of, παιδός Soph.; ἀλόχου Eur.
absol. to sin, err, do wrong, Eur., etc.; ὡς τάδʼ ἤμπλακον when I committed these sins, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀμπλάκημα
div1.sense: an error, fault, offence, Aesch., etc.:—also, metri grat., ἀπλάκημα, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀμπυκάζω
div1.sense: to bind the hair with a band, Anth.

div1.head: ἀμπυκτήρ
div1.sense: a horseʼs head-band, Aesch.

div1.head: ἄμπυξ
div1.sense: a womanʼs head-band, snood, Il., etc.
anything circular, a wheel, Soph.

div1.head: ἄμπωτις
div1.sense: a being sucked back, the ebb-tide, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἀμυγδάλινος
div1.sense: of almonds, Xen.

div1.head: ἀμύγδαλος
div1.sense: an almond-tree, Luc.

div1.head: ἄμυγμα
div1.sense: a scratching, tearing, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: ἄμυδις
div1.sense: of Time, together, at the same time, Od.
of Place, together, all together, Il.

div1.head: ἀμυδρός
div1.sense: indistinct, dim, obscure:
ἀμ. γράμματα scarce legible letters, Thuc.
ἀμ. πρὸς ἀλήθειαν faint in comparison with truth, Thuc.; ἀμ. ἐλπίς Plut.

div1.head: ἀμύητος
div1.sense: uninitiated, Plat., etc.
in Plat. Gorg. as if from μύω, οὐ δυνάμενος μύειν, unable to keep close, leaky.

div1.head: ἀμύθητος
div1.sense: unspeakable, unspeakably many or great, Dem.

div1.head: ἀμύκητος
div1.sense: where no herds low, of places, Anth.

div1.head: Ἀμύκλαθεν
div1.sense: from Amyclae, Pind.

div1.head: Ἀμυκλαϊάζω
div1.sense: to speak in the Amyclean (i. e. Laconian) dialect, Theocr.

div1.head: Ἀμυκλαῖον
div1.sense: the temple of Amyclaean Apollo, Thuc.

div1.head: Ἀμύκλαι
div1.sense: a Lacon. city, famous for the worship of Apollo, Il., etc.
a sort of shoes, made at Amyclae, Theocr.

div1.head: ἄμυλος
div1.sense: not ground at the mill, i. e. ground by hand:— as Subst. a cake of fine meal, Ar., etc.

div1.head: ἀμύμων
div1.sense: blameless, noble, excellent, used by Hom. as an honorary epithet, like our honourable, excellency, not implying virtue; never used of gods.
of things, Hom.

div1.head: ἀμυνάθω
div1.etym: the forms assigned to this verb belong to an aor2, ἠμύναθον, hence the irregular infinitive and imperative (cf. ἐργαθεῖν, σχέθω): the inf. therefore is ἀμῡναθεῖν not ἀμῡνάθειν, while the imperative is ἀμῡναθοῦ, not ἀμῡνάθου.
div1.sense: to defend, assist, c. dat., Eur., Ar.:—Mid. to ward off from oneself, repel, ψόγον Aesch.: to take vengeance on, τινα.

div1.head: Ἀμυνίας
div1.sense: personal name.
as appellat., ἦν ἀμυνίας was on its guard, Ar.

div1.head: ἀμυντέον
div1.sense: one must assist, c. dat. pers., Xen.; so pl. ἀμυντέα, Soph.

div1.head: ἀμυντήριον
div1.sense: a means of defence, Plat., etc.

div1.head: ἀμυντήριος
div1.sense: defensive, Plat., etc.

div1.head: ἀμύντωρ
div1.sense: a defender, helper, Hom.
an avenger, πατρός Eur.

div1.head: ἀμύνω
div1.etym: From Root !μυν, with α prefixed, cf. Lat. munio, moenia.
div1.sense: to keep off, ward off, Hom.:

c. acc. of the person or thing to be kept off, c. dat. of pers. for or from whom the danger is kept off, Δαναοῖσιν λοιγὸν ἀμύνειν to ward off ruin from the Danai, Il.:— the dat. is often omitted, λοιγὸν ἀμύνει Il.
c. dat. pers. to defend, assist, aid, succour, Hom., etc.
c. gen. from whom danger is kept off, Τρῶας ἄμυνε νεῶν he kept the Trojans off from the ships, Il., etc.
absol. to repel assaults, to aid, Il.; τὰ ἀμύνοντα means of defence, Hdt.
rarely c. acc., like Mid. ΙΙ, to requite, repay, Soph.
Mid. to ward off from oneself, defend oneself against:
c. acc., Il.
c. gen. of that from which danger is warded off, to fight for or in defence of, Il.: so, ἀμύνεσθαι περὶ πάτρης Il.; ὑπέρ τινος Xen.
absol. to defend oneself, Il.
ἀμύνεσθαί τινα also to avenge oneself on an enemy, to requite, repay, punish, Soph., Thuc., etc.; also, ἀμύνεσθαί τινά τινος or ὑπέρ τινος to punish for a thing, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀμύσσω
div1.etym: from √μυκ, with α prefixed, cf. Lat. mucro.
div1.sense: to scratch, tear, wound, lacerate, mangle, Il., Hdt.; also to prick, sting, Luc., scratch with both hands.
metaph., θυμὸν ἀμ. to tear the heart, Il., Aesch.; φρὴν ἀμύσσεται Aesch.

div1.head: ἀμυστίζω
div1.sense: to drink deep, perf. ἠμύστικα Eur.

div1.head: ἀμυστί
div1.sense: without closing the mouth, i. e. at one draught, Luc.

div1.head: ἄμυστις
div1.sense: a long draught, Anacr., Eur., etc.
deep drinking, tippling, Eur.
a large cup, used by the Thracians, Ar.

div1.head: ἀμυχή
div1.sense: a scratch, skin-wound, Dem.; in sign of sorrow, ἀμυχὰς κοπτομένων ἀφεῖλεν Plut.

div1.head: ἀμφαγαπάζω
div1.sense: to embrace warmly, treat kindly, greet warmly, Od., etc.; so in Mid., Il.

div1.head: ἀμφαγείρομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to gather round, θεαὶ δέ μιν ἀμφαγέροντο (aor2) Il.: hence pres. ἀμφαγέρομαι, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀμφάδιος
div1.sense: public, γάμος Od.
acc. fem. ἀμφαδίην as adv., = ἀμφαδόν, Il.

div1.head: ἀμφαδόν
div1.sense: publicly, openly, without disguise, Hom.

div1.head: ἀμφαδός
div1.sense: discovered, known, Od.

div1.head: ἀμφαΐσσομαι
div1.sense: to rush on from all sides, ἀμφὶ δέ τʼ ἀΐσσονται Il.; ἀμφὶ δὲ χαῖται ὤμοις ἀΐσσοντο floated around his shoulders, Il.

div1.head: ἀμφαραβέω
div1.sense: to rattle or ring around, Il.

div1.head: ἀμφασίη
div1.sense: speechlessness, Hom.

div1.head: ἀμφαϋτέω
div1.sense: to ring around, Il.

div1.head: ἀμφαφάω
div1.sense: to touch or feel all round, to handle, Hom.; so in Mid., Od.
μαλακώτερος ἀμφαφάασθαι easier to deal with, manage, Il.

div1.head: ἀμφελικτός
div1.sense: coiled round, Eur.

div1.head: ἀμφελίσσω
div1.sense: to wrap or twine round, χέρας Eur.:—Mid., Pind.

div1.head: ἀμφερέφω
div1.sense: to cover up, Anth.

div1.head: ἀμφέρχομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to come round one, surround, Od.

div1.head: ἀμφήκης
div1.sense: two-edged, Il., Aesch.
metaph., ἀμφ. γλῶττα a tongue that will cut both ways, i. e. maintain either right or wrong, Ar.; of an oracle, ambiguous, Luc.

div1.head: ἀμφηρεφής
div1.sense: covered on both sides, close-covered, epith. of Apolloʼs quiver, Il.

div1.head: ἀμφήρης
div1.sense: fitted on both sides, well-fitted, ἀμφῆρες δόρυ, of the double rudder used in Greek ships (v. πηδάλιον), Eur.

div1.head: ἀμφηρικός
div1.sense: rowed on both sides, worked by sculls, of a boat, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀμφήριστος
div1.sense: contested on both sides, ἀμφήριστον ἔθηκεν, i. e. made it a "drawn" race, Il.

div1.head: ἀμφιάζω
div1.sense: to clothe, τινά Plut.: metaph. of a grave, ὀστέα ἠμφίασεν Anth.

div1.head: ἀμφίαλος
div1.sense: sea-girt, of islands, Od., Soph.
of Corinth, between two seas, Horaceʼs bimaris, Xen.

div1.head: Ἀμφιάραος
div1.sense: Amphiaraus, the Theban seer, Aesch., etc.

div1.head: ἀμφίασμα
div1.sense: a garment, Ctes., Luc.

div1.head: ἀμφιάχω
div1.sense: of a bird, to fly shrieking about, in irreg. part. perf. ἀμφιαχυῖα, Il.

div1.head: ἀμφιβαίνω
div1.sense: to go about or around, Il.
to bestride, Od.:—esp. to bestride a fallen friend, so as to protect him, Il.; hence of tutelary deities, to protect, Il.
to encompass, wrap round, c. acc., νεφέλη σκόπελον ἀμφιβέβηκε Od.: also c. dat., νέφος ἀμφιβέβηκε νηυσίν Il.:—metaph., σε πόνος φρένας ἀμφιβέβηκεν Od., etc.

div1.head: ἀμφιβάλλω
div1.sense: to throw or put round: of clothes, to put them on a person, Lat. circumdare, c. dupl. acc. pers. et rei, ἀμφὶ δέ χλαῖναν βάλεν Od.; also c. dat. pers., ἀμφὶ δέ μοι ῥάκος βάλον Il.:—Mid. to put round oneself, put round one, put on, Od.
ἀμφιβαλὼν θάλαμον having thrown a chamber over him, Od.; ζυγὸν Ἑλλάδι ἀμφ. Aesch.:—Mid., λευκὴν ἀμφιβάλλομαι τρίχα I put on, get white hair, Soph.
for the Mid. the Act. is sometimes used, κρατερὸν μένος ἀμφιβαλόντες ἑαυτοῖς Il.
to throw the arms round, to embrace, c. dat. pers., Od.
also, c. acc. pers. to embrace, Eur.

div1.head: ἀμφίβασις
div1.sense: a going round, encompassing, ἀμφίβασιν Τρώων τοὺς ἀμφιβαίνοντας Τρῶας, Il.

div1.head: ἀμφίβιος
div1.sense: living a double life, i. e. both on land and in water, amphibious, Batr., Anth.

div1.head: ἀμφίβλημα
div1.sense: something thrown round:
an enclosure, Eur.
a garment, cloak, Eur.

div1.head: ἀμφίβληστρον
div1.sense: anything thrown round:
a casting-net, Hes., Hdt.:—metaph. of the garment thrown like a net over Agamemnon, Aesch.
a fetter, bond, Aesch.
of walls, encompassment of city-walls, Eur.

div1.head: ἀμφιβόητος
div1.sense: noised abroad, Anth.

div1.head: ἀμφιβολία
div1.sense: the state of being attacked on both sides, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀμφίβολος
div1.sense: put round, encompassing, Eur.
attacked on both or all sides, Aesch.; ἀμφ. εἶναι to be between two fires, Thuc.
act. hitting at both ends, double-pointed, Anth.
doubtful, ambiguous, Plat., Xen., etc.; τἀγαθὰ ἐς ἀμφίβολον ἔθεντο accounted their good fortune as doubtful, Thuc.; ἐν ἀμφιβόλωι in doubt, Luc.:—adv., οὐκ ἀμφιβόλως Aesch.

div1.head: ἀμφίβουλος
div1.sense: half-minded to do a thing, c. inf., Aesch.

div1.head: ἀμφίβροτος
div1.sense: covering the whole man, of a large shield, Il.

div1.head: ἀμφίβροχος
div1.sense: thoroughly soaked, Anth.

div1.head: ἀμφιβώμιος
div1.sense: round the altar, Eur.

div1.head: ἀμφιγηθέω
div1.sense: to rejoice around or exceedingly, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἀμφιγνοέω
div1.sense: to be doubtful about a thing, not know or understand, c. acc., Plat.; ἐπί τινος, περί τινος Plat., etc.; ἠμφεγνόουν ὅ τι ἐποίουν they knew not what they were about, Xen.:—Pass., ἀμφιγνοηθείς being unknown, Plat.

div1.head: ἀμφιγόητος
div1.sense: bewailed all round, Anth.

div1.head: ἀμφιγυήεις
div1.sense: of Hephaestus, he that halts in both feet, the lame one, Il.

div1.head: ἀμφίγυος
div1.etym: The termin. -γυος, as in ὑπόγυος, is of uncertain sense.
div1.sense: pointed at each end, double-pointed, Hom.; in Soph., of persons, armed at all points, practised combatants.

div1.head: ἀμφιδαίω
div1.sense: used in intr. perf. and plup. to burn or blaze around, Il.

div1.head: ἀμφιδάκνω
div1.sense: to bite all round: to grip close, Anth.

div1.head: ἀμφιδάκρυτος
div1.sense: all-tearful, Eur.

div1.head: ἀμφίδασυς
div1.sense: fringed all round, of the Aegis, Il.

div1.head: ἀμφιδέα
div1.sense: pl. ἀμφιδέαι, things bound round, bracelets or anklets, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀμφιδέξιος
div1.sense: with two right hands, very dextrous, Lat. ambidexter, Arist.
like ἀμφήκης, two-edged, Eur.
metaph. double-meaning, ambiguous, Lat. anceps, χρηστήριον Hdt.
= ἀμφότερος, ἀμφ. ἀκμαῖς with both hands, Soph.; ἀμφ. πλευρόν each side, Soph.

div1.head: ἀμφιδέρκομαι
div1.sense: to look round about one, Anth.

div1.head: ἀμφίδετος
div1.sense: bound or set all round, Anth.

div1.head: ἀμφιδήριτος
div1.sense: disputed, νίκη Thuc.

div1.head: ἀμφιδιαίνω
div1.sense: to moisten all around, Anth.

div1.head: ἀμφιδινέομαι
div1.sense: to be put round, fitted closely round, Hom.

div1.head: ἀμφιδοκεύω
div1.sense: to lie in wait for, τινά Bion.

div1.head: ἀμφιδονέω
div1.sense: to agitate violently, Theocr., Anth.

div1.head: ἀμφιδοξέω
div1.sense: to be doubtful:— Pass. to be matter for doubt, Plut.

div1.head: ἀμφίδοξος
div1.sense: with doubtful mind or of double sense, doubtful, Polyb., etc.

div1.head: ἀμφίδορος
div1.sense: quite flayed, Anth.

div1.head: ἀμφίδοχμος
div1.sense: as large as can be grasped, λίθος Xen.; cf. χειροπληθής.

div1.head: ἀμφίδρομος
div1.sense: running round, encompassing, inclosing, Soph.

div1.head: ἀμφιδρυφής
div1.sense: having torn both cheeks, in grief, Il.

div1.head: ἀμφίδρυφος
div1.sense: torn on both sides, Il.

div1.head: ἀμφίδυμος
div1.etym: The term. -δυμος recurs in δίδυμος, τρίδυμος.
div1.sense: two-fold, double, λιμὴν ἀμφ. Od.

div1.head: ἀμφιδύω
div1.sense: to put on another:—Mid. to put on oneself, Soph.

div1.head: ἀμφιέλισσα
div1.sense: of ships, rowed on both sides; or, rather, swaying to and fro, rolling.

div1.head: ἀμφιέννυμι
div1.sense: to put round or on, like Lat. circumdare, Il.: but mostly, c. dupl. acc. pers. et rei, ἐμὲ χλαῖναν ἀμφιέσασα Od.:— Pass., ἠμφιεσμένος τι clothed in, wearing, Ar., etc.
c. dat. rei, ἀμφ. τινά τινι to clothe one in or with a thing, Plat.
Mid. to put round one, put on oneself, Hom.

div1.head: ἀμφιέπω
div1.etym: Forms such as ἀμφίεπον or ἄμφεπον could be interpreted as either imperfect or as second aorist.
div1.sense: to go about, be all round, encompass, Hom.
like διέπω, to be busy about, look after, Hom.:—to do honour or reverence to, Pind.
to tend, Pind.; to guard, protect, Soph., Eur.
ἀμφ. κῆδος to court an alliance, Lat. ambire, Eur.
absol. in partic. with good heed, heedfully, carefully, Hom.
in Mid. to follow and crowd round, Il.

div1.head: ἀμφίεσμα
div1.sense: a garment: in pl. clothes, Plat.

div1.head: ἀμφιζάνω
div1.sense: to sit on, settle upon, c. dat., Il.

div1.head: ἀμφίζευκτος
div1.sense: joined from both sides, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀμφιθάλασσος
div1.sense: with sea on both sides, sea-girt, Pind., Xen.

div1.head: ἀμφιθαλής
div1.sense: blooming on both sides, of children who have both parents alive, Il.
all abounding, of the gods, Aesch., Ar.:—metaph. abounding in, c. dat., Aesch.

div1.head: ἀμφιθάλλω
div1.sense: to be in full bloom, Anth.

div1.head: ἀμφιθάλπω
div1.sense: to warm on both sides, or thoroughly, Eur.

div1.head: ἀμφιθέατρον
div1.sense: a double theatre, amphitheatre.

div1.head: ἀμφίθετος
div1.sense: of a cup, either that will stand on both ends, or, with handles on both sides, Il.

div1.head: ἀμφιθέω
div1.sense: to run round about, c. acc., Od.

div1.head: ἀμφίθηκτος
div1.sense: sharpened on both sides, two-edged, Soph.

div1.head: ἀμφίθρεπτος
div1.sense: clotted round a wound, Soph.

div1.head: ἀμφίθυρος
div1.sense: with double entrance, Soph.
as Subst., ἀμφίθυρον, τό, a hall, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀμφικαλύπτω
div1.sense: c. acc. to cover all round, enwrap, enfold, of garments, Il.; of a coffin, Il.; ἀμφ. ἵππον to receive within the walls, Od.; of death, sleep, Od.
ἀμφ. τί τινι to put a thing round any one as a cover or shelter, ἀμφ. σάκος τινί, νέφος τινί Od.
after Hom., ἀμφ. τινά τινι to surround one with a thing, Batr.:—Pass., ἀμφεκαλύφθη κρᾶτα he had his head covered, Eur.

div1.head: ἀμφικεάζω
div1.sense: to cleave asunder, Od.

div1.head: ἀμφίκειμαι
div1.sense: Pass. to lie round, ἐπʼ ἀλλήλοισιν ἀμφικείμενοι locked in each otherʼs arms, Soph.; ἐπʼ ὀλέθρωι ἀμφικεῖσθαι φόνον that one murder lies close upon another, Soph.

div1.head: ἀμφικείρω
div1.sense: to shear all round, Anth.

div1.head: ἀμφικίων
div1.sense: with pillars all round, Soph.

div1.head: ἀμφίκλαστος
div1.sense: broken all round, Anth.

div1.head: ἀμφίκλυστος
div1.sense: washed on both sides by the waves, Soph.

div1.head: ἀμφικομέω
div1.sense: to tend on all sides or carefully, Anth.

div1.head: ἀμφίκομος
div1.sense: with hair all round, Anth.
thick-leafed, Il.

div1.head: ἀμφίκρανος
div1.sense: two headed, Eur.
surrounding the head, Anth.

div1.head: ἀμφικρέμαμαι
div1.sense: to hang round, Pind.

div1.head: ἀμφικρεμής
div1.sense: hanging round or over, Anth.

div1.head: ἀμφίκρημνος
div1.sense: with cliffs all round, Eur.

div1.head: ἀμφικρύπτω
div1.sense: to cover or hide on every side, τοῖον νέφος ἀμφί σε κρύπτει Eur.

div1.head: ἀμφικτίονες
div1.sense: they that dwell round, next neighbours, Hdt., Pind.

div1.head: Ἀμφικτύονες
div1.etym: The word was orig. the same as ἀμφικτίονες.
div1.sense: the Amphictyons, a Council composed of deputies chosen by the States of Greece, the Amphictyonic League, which met at Delphi and Anthela, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: Ἀμφικτυονία
div1.sense: the Amphictyonic League, Dem.

div1.head: Ἀμφικτυονικός
div1.sense: Amphictyonic, of the Amphictyons, Dem.

div1.head: Ἀμφικτυονίς
div1.sense: fem. of Ἀμφικτυονικός; Ἀμφ. (sc. πόλις), a state in the Amphictyonic League, Aeschin.
a name of Demeter at Anthela, a meeting-place of the Amphictyonic Council, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀμφικυκλόομαι
div1.sense: to encircle, surround, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀμφικυλίνδω
div1.sense: to roll around, to be pierced by a sword, Pind.

div1.head: ἀμφικύπελλος
div1.sense: in Hom. ἀμφικύπελλον δέπας, a double cup, i. e. one that forms a cup both at top and bottom, Il., etc.

div1.head: ἀμφίλαλος
div1.sense: of double speech (Greek and Thracian), Ar.

div1.head: ἀμφιλαφής
div1.sense: taking in on all sides, widespreading, of large trees, Hdt.
generally, abundant, excessive, enormous, Hdt., etc.; γόος ἀμφ. a universal wail, Aesch.:—adv. -φῶς, copiously, Plut.
of size, bulky, huge, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀμφιλαχαίνω
div1.sense: to dig round, c. acc., Od.

div1.head: ἀμφιλέγω
div1.sense: to dispute about, τι Xen.; ἀμφ. μή . . , to dispute, question that a thing is, Xen.

div1.head: ἀμφίλεκτος
div1.sense: discussed on all hands, doubtful, Aesch.: so adv. -τως, Aesch.
act. disputatious, Eur.; ἀμφ. εἶναί τινι to quarrel for a thing, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀμφιλογέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to dispute, περί τινος Plut.

div1.head: ἀμφιλογία
div1.sense: dispute, debate, Hes., Plut.

div1.head: ἀμφίλογος
div1.sense: disputed, disputable, Xen.; τὰ ἀμφίλογα disputed points, Thuc.; ἀμφίλογον γίγνεταί τι πρός τινα a dispute on a point takes place with some one, Xen.; neut. pl. ἀμφίλογα as adv., Eur.
act. disputatious, contentious, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: ἀμφίλοφος
div1.sense: encompassing the neck, Soph.

div1.head: ἀμφιλύκη
div1.sense: associated with ἡ νύξ, the morning-twilight, gray of morning, Il.

div1.head: ἀμφιμάομαι
div1.sense: to wipe all round, assumed as pres. of an Epic aor1 ἀμφιμάσασθε, Od.

div1.head: ἀμφιμάσχαλος
div1.sense: round both arms, two-sleeved, Ar.

div1.head: ἀμφιμάχητος
div1.sense: fought for, Anth.

div1.head: ἀμφιμάχομαι
div1.sense: Dep., only in pres. and imperf., to fight round:
c. acc. to besiege, Il.
c. gen. to fight for, Il.

div1.head: ἀμφιμέλας
div1.sense: black all round: φρένες ἀμφιμέλαιναι, prob. referring to the φρένες or midriff being wrapped in darkness, dark-seated.

div1.head: ἀμφιμερίζομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be completely parted, Anth.

div1.head: ἀμφιμήτορες
div1.sense: brothers or sisters by different mothers, Eur.

div1.head: ἀμφιμυκάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to bellow around: metaph., δάπεδον ἀμφιμέμῡκε (perf. 2) the floor echoed all round, Od.

div1.head: ἀμφινεικής
div1.sense: contested on all sides, eagerly wooed, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: ἀμφινέμομαι
div1.sense: Mid., of cattle, to feed around: then, of men, to dwell round, c. acc. loci, Il.

div1.head: ἀμφινεύω
div1.sense: to nod this way and that way, Anth.

div1.head: ἀμφινοέω
div1.sense: to think both ways, be in doubt, Soph.

div1.head: ἀμφιξέω
div1.sense: to smooth all round with an axe or plane, Od.

div1.head: ἀμφίξοος
div1.sense: polishing all round, Anth.

div1.head: ἀμφίπαλτος
div1.sense: tossed about, re-echoing, Anth.

div1.head: ἀμφιπατάσσω
div1.sense: to strike on both sides, Anth.

div1.head: ἀμφί
div1.sense: prep. with gen., dat., and acc.—Radic. sense, on both sides (cf. ἄμφω, Lat. ambo), whereas περί properly means all round.
c. gen.:
Causal, about, for, for the sake of a thing, ἀμφὶ γυναικός Aesch.
about, i. e. concerning or of a thing, ἀμφὶ φιλότητος ἀείδειν to sing about or of love, Od.
of Place, about, around, ἀμφὶ τῆς πόλιος Hdt.
C. DAT.:

of Place, on both sides of, about, ἀμφὶ ὤμοις, στήθεσσι Hom.; likewise, ἀμφὶ περὶ στήθεσσι Od.:—then, just like περί, all round, κρέα ἀμφὶ ὀβελοῖς ἔπειραν they fixed the meat round, i. e. upon, the spits, Hom.
generally, about, near, at, ἀμφὶ πύληισι Il.
about, regarding, ἔρις ἀμφὶ μουσικῆι Hdt.; for the sake of, for, ἀμφʼ Ἑλένηι μάχεσθαι Il., etc.
like Lat. prae, ἀμφὶ τάρβει, ἀμφὶ φόβωι, prae pavore, for very fear, Aesch., Eur.
C. ACC.:
of Place, about, around, mostly with a sense of motion, ἀμφί μιν φᾶρος βάλον Il.
about, near, ἀμφὶ ῥέεθρα somewhere by the banks, ib.
of persons who are about one, οἱ ἀμφὶ Πρίαμον Priam and his train, Il.; οἱ ἀμφὶ hέρξεα his army, Hdt.; in Attic, οἱ ἀμφὶ Πρωταγόραν the school of Protagoras or Protagoras himself, Plat.
κλαίειν ἀμφί τινα to weep about or for one, Il.
εἶναι, διατρίβειν ἀμφί τι to be engaged about it, Xen.
as a loose definition of Time, about, Pind.; ἀμφὶ Πλειάδων δύσιν Aesch.:—so of Number, Lat. circiter, ἀμφὶ τὰς δώδεκα μυριάδας about 120, 000, Xen.
WITHOUT CASE, as adv., on both sides, about, around.
= ἀμφίς A. ΙΙ, apart, Hhymn.
IN COMPOS.:
about, on both sides, as ἀμφίστομος, δίστομος.
all round, on all sides, as ἀμφιλαμβάνω, ἀμφιλαφής.
Causal, for, for the sake of, as ἀμφιμάχομαι.

div1.head: ἀμφίπεδος
div1.sense: surrounded by a plain, Pind.

div1.head: ἀμφιπέλομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to float around, of music, Od.

div1.head: ἀμφιπένομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to be busied about, take charge of, c. acc., Hom.; τὸν κύνες ἀμφεπένοντο the dogs made a meal of him, Il.

div1.head: ἀμφιπεριπλέγδην
div1.sense: twined round, Anth.

div1.head: ἀμφιπεριστέφομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be put round as a crown, Od.

div1.head: ἀμφιπεριστρωφάω
div1.sense: to keep turning about all ways, Il.

div1.head: ἀμφιπεριτρύζω
div1.sense: to chirp or twitter round about, Anth.

div1.head: ἀμφιπεριφθινύθω
div1.sense: to decay all round, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἀμφιπιάζω
div1.sense: to squeeze all round, hug closely, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀμφιπίπτω
div1.sense: to fall around, i. e. to embrace, c. acc., Od.; c. dat., ἀμφιπίπτων στόμασιν embracing so as to kiss, Soph.

div1.head: ἀμφίπλεκτος
div1.sense: intertwined, Soph.; cf. κλῖμαξ.

div1.head: ἀμφίπληκτος
div1.sense: beaten on both sides.
act. dashing on both sides, Soph.

div1.head: ἀμφιπλήξ
div1.sense: striking with both sides, double-edged, Soph.

div1.head: ἀμφιπολεύω
div1.sense: to be busied about, take care of, c. acc., Od., Hdt.; absol., δοῦναί τινά τινι ἀμφιπολεύειν to give one over to another, to take care of, Od.

div1.head: ἀμφιπολέω
div1.sense: c. acc.
to attend constantly, to attend on, watch, guard, Pind.
to tend, treat gently, Lat. fovere, Pind.
c. dat. to minister to, θεαῖς Soph.
c. gen. rei, to be ministers of, Pind.

div1.head: ἀμφίπολις
div1.sense: encompassing a city, of a city taken by blockade, Aesch.
as fem. Subst. a city between two seas or rivers, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀμφίπολος
div1.sense: busied about, busy, epith. of Κύπρις, Soph.:—as fem. Subst. a handmaid, Od.:— sometimes joined with another Subst., ἀμφ. ταμίη, ἀμφ. γραῦς the housekeeper, the old woman in waiting, Hom.
as masc. an attendant, follower, Pind.: —also a priest, Plut.
in pass. sense, as adj. much-frequented, Pind.

div1.head: ἀμφιπονέομαι
div1.sense: to attend to a thing, c. acc., Il.

div1.head: ἀμφιποτάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to fly round and round, Il.

div1.head: ἀμφιπρόσωπος
div1.sense: double-faced, Plut.

div1.head: ἀμφιπτυχή
div1.sense: a folding round, embrace, Eur.

div1.head: ἀμφίπυλος
div1.sense: with two entrances, Eur.

div1.head: ἀμφίπυρος
div1.sense: with fire at each end, of the thunder-bolt, Eur.; of Artemis as bearing a torch in either hand, Soph.
with fire all round, Soph.

div1.head: ἀμφίρυτος
div1.sense: flowed around, sea-girt, of islands, Od., Hes., Soph. etc.

div1.head: ἀμφισαλεύομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to toss about, as on the sea, Anth.

div1.head: ἀμφίσβαινα
div1.sense: a kind of serpent, that can go either forwards or backwards, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀμφισβητέω
div1.sense: literally, to stand apart, and so to disagree with an argument, c. dat., Hdt.:—c. dat. pers. to dispute or argue with, τινι Plat.
absol. to dispute, wrangle, argue, Plat., etc.:— οἱ ἀμφισβητοῦντες the opponents, in a lawsuit, Dem.
c. gen. rei, to dispute for or about a thing, Dem.; also περί τινος Plat.:— to lay claim to the property of a deceased person, τοῦ κλήρου Dem.
c. acc. rei, to dispute a point, Plat.
c. acc. et inf. to argue that, Plat.
Pass. to be the subject of dispute, Plat.; or impers., ἀμφισβητεῖται περί τι or περί τινος Plat.; ἀμφισβητεῖται μὴ εἶναί τι it is disputed, Plat. Hence

div1.head: ἀμφισβήτημα
div1.sense: a point in dispute, Plat., etc.

div1.head: ἀμφισβητήσιμος
div1.sense: disputed, disputable, Plat., etc.; χώρα ἀμφ. debatable ground, Xen.; οὐκέτʼ ἐν ἀμφισβητησίμωι no longer in doubt, Dem.

div1.head: ἀμφισβήτησις
div1.sense: a dispute, controversy, debate, ἀμφ. γίγνεται (or ἐστι) περί τινος Plat.; ἀμφισβήτησιν ἔχει it admits of question, Arist.

div1.head: ἀμφισβήτητος
div1.sense: debatable, γῆ Thuc.

div1.head: ἀμφίς
div1.sense: as adv.
on or at both sides, Il.; with both hands at once, Il.
generally, around, round about, Il.

apart, asunder, γαῖαν καὶ οὐρανὸν ἀμφὶς ἔχειν to keep heaven and earth asunder, Od.; ἀμφὶς ἀγῆναι to snap in twain, Il.; ἀμφὶς φράζεσθαι or ἀμφὶς φρονεῖν to think separately, i. e. to be divided, take opposite parts, Il.
as prep., like ἀμφί,
c. gen. around, ἅρματος ἀμφίς all round his chariot, Il.
apart from, ἀμφίς τινος ἧσθαι Il.; ἀμφὶς ὁδοῦ out of the road, Il.
c. acc. about, around, always following its case, Il.

div1.head: ἀμφιστέλλομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to fold round oneself, c. acc., Theocr.

div1.head: ἀμφιστεφανόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to stand all round like a crown, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἀμφίστημι
div1.sense: to place round; only used in Pass. ἀμφίσταμαι, with intr. aor2 act. ἀμφέστην, Epic 3rd pl. ἀμφέσταν; syncop. 3rd pl. perf. ἀμφεστᾶσι (for ἀμφεστήκασι):— to stand around, Hom.; c. dat., Soph.

div1.head: ἀμφίστομος
div1.sense: with double mouth, of a tunnel, Hdt.; λαβαὶ ἀμφίστομοι handles on both sides of the bowl, Soph.

div1.head: ἀμφιστρατάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to beleaguer, besiege, Epic pl. impf. ἀμφεστρατόωντο πόλιν Il.

div1.head: ἀμφιστρεφής
div1.sense: turning all ways, of a dragonʼs heads, Il.

div1.head: ἀμφιστρόγγυλος
div1.sense: quite round, Luc.

div1.head: ἀμφιτανύω
div1.sense: to stretch all round, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἀμφιτειχής
div1.sense: encompassing the walls, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀμφιτέμνω
div1.sense: to cut off on all sides, intercept, Il.

div1.head: ἀμφιτίθημι
div1.etym: the other forms of this are under τίθημι
div1.sense: to put round, Lat. circumdo, ἀμφὶ δέ οἱ κυνέην ἔθηκε (in tmesi), Hom.; κόσμον ἀμφ. χροΐ Eur.; also, στέφανον ἀμφὶ κρᾶτα Eur.:—Mid. to put round oneself, Od.:—Pass. to be put on, Il.
to cover with a thing, κάρα πέπλοις Eur.

div1.head: ἀμφιτινάσσω
div1.sense: to swing round, Anth.

div1.head: ἀμφιτιττυβίζω
div1.sense: to twitter or chirp around, Ar.

div1.head: ἀμφιτόμος
div1.sense: cutting with both sides, two-edged, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: ἀμφίτορνος
div1.sense: well-rounded, Eur.

div1.head: ἀμφιτρέμω
div1.sense: to tremble round one, in tmesi, Il.

div1.head: ἀμφιτρέχω
div1.sense: to run round, surround, Pind.

div1.head: ἀμφιτρής
div1.sense: pierced from end to end, ἀμφιτρής sc. πέτρα, i. e. a cave with double entrance, Eur.; with a neut. noun, ἀμφιτρὴς αὔλιον Soph.

div1.head: ἀμφίτρητος
div1.sense: pierced through, Anth.

div1.head: ἀμφιτρομέω
div1.sense: to tremble for, c. gen., Od.

div1.head: ἀμφιφαείνω
div1.sense: to beam around, c. acc., Hhymn.

div1.head: ἀμφίφαλος
div1.sense: with double crest (v. φάλος), Il.

div1.head: ἀμφιφανής
div1.sense: visible all round, known to all, Eur.

div1.head: ἀμφιφοβέομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to tremble all round, ἀμφεφόβηθεν (Epic for -ήθησαν, 3rd pl. aor1) Il.

div1.head: ἀμφιφορεύς
div1.sense: a large jar with two handles, Lat. amphora, Hom.; cf. ἀμφορεύς.

div1.head: ἀμφιφράζομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to consider on all sides, consider well, Il.

div1.head: ἀμφιχάσκω
div1.sense: to gape round, gape for, c. acc., Il.; of a child, ἀμφ. μαστόν Aesch.; of an army surrounding a city, Soph.

div1.head: ἀμφιχέω
div1.sense: to pour around, to pour or spread over, Od.
Pass. to be poured or shed around, Il.; c. acc., Hom.
of persons, to embrace, c. acc., Od.

div1.head: ἀμφιχορεύω
div1.sense: to dance around, Eur., Anth.

div1.head: ἀμφιχρίομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to anoint oneself all over, Od.

div1.head: ἀμφίχρυσος
div1.sense: gilded all over, Eur.

div1.head: ἀμφίχυτος
div1.sense: poured around; thrown up around, of an earthen wall, Il.

div1.head: ἀμφίχωλος
div1.sense: lame in both feet, Anth.

div1.head: ἄμφοδον
div1.sense: a road round houses, a street, NTest.

div1.head: ἀμφορεύς
div1.sense: an amphora, jar, urn, Hdt., etc.
a liquid measure, = μετρητής 1 amphorae, or nearly 9 gallons, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀμφορίσκος
div1.sense: Dim. of ἀμφορεύς, Dem.

div1.head: ἀμφοτέρῃ
div1.sense: in both ways, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀμφοτερόπλοος
div1.sense: sailing both ways:— τὸ ἀμφοτερόπλουν (sc. δάνειον), money lent on bottomry, when the lender bore the risk both of the outward and homeward voyage, Dem.

div1.head: ἀμφότερος
div1.sense: each or both of two, Lat. uterque, Hdt., Aesch., etc.
neut. ἀμφότερον as adv., ἀμφότερον βασιλεύς τʼ ἀγαθός κρατερός τʼ αἰχμητής both good king and stout warrior, Il.; so in neut. pl., ἀμφότερα μένειν πέμπειν τε Aesch.

κατʼ ἀμφότερα on both sides, utrinque, Hdt.; ἐπʼ ἀμφότερα, both ways, in utramque partem, Hdt.; ἀπʼ ἀμφοτέρων from both sides, ex utraque parte, Hdt.; ἀμφοτέραις, Epic -ηισι (sc. χερσί), Od.; ἐπʼ ἀμφοτέρων βεβᾱκώς (sc. ποδῶν) Theocr.

div1.head: ἀμφοτέρωθεν
div1.sense: from or on both sides, utrinque, Il., Hdt., etc.
at both ends, Od.

div1.head: ἀμφοτέρωθι
div1.sense: on both sides, Xen.

div1.head: ἀμφοτέρωσε
div1.sense: to both sides, Il.

div1.head: ἀμφοτέρως
div1.sense: in both ways, Plat.

div1.head: ἀμφουδίς
div1.sense: adv., seems to mean off or from the ground, Od.

div1.head: ἀμφώβολος
div1.sense: a javelin or spit with double point, Eur.

div1.head: ἄμφω
div1.sense: Lat. ambo, both, Hom., etc.

div1.head: ἄμφωτος
div1.sense: two-eared, two handled, Od.

div1.head: ἀμώμητος
div1.sense: unblamed, blameless, Il., etc.:—adv. -τως, Hdt.

div1.head: ἄμωμος
div1.sense: without blame, blameless, Hdt., Aesch.

div1.head: ἁμῶς
div1.etym: from obsol. ἁμός τὶς, only in compd. ἀμωσ-γέ-πως
div1.sense: in some way or other, Ar., Plat.

div1.head: ἄν
div1.sense: conditional Particle. In Attic, it is not joined with pres. or perf. ind., nor with imperat. of any tense. Three uses of ἄν must be distinguished in practice:
in combination with Conjunctions and Relatives.
in Apodosis.
in Iterative sentences.
in combinations with Conjunctions and Relatives:

such words are regularly foll. by the subj., viz. ἐάν (= εἰ ἄν) ἤν, ἄν , ἐπήν; ὃς ἄν quicunque, πρὶν ἄν, etc.; ἐπειδάν, ὅταν, ὁπόταν: the protasis generally has a fut. in apodosis, εἰ δέ κεν ὣς ἔρξηις, γνώσηι if perchance thou do thus, thou shalt know, Il.
in Epic sometimes with Opt., ὥς κε δοίη ὧι κʼ ἐθέλοι that he might give her to whomsoever he might please, Od.: in such cases κε or ἄν does not affect the Verb.
in Epic, sometimes with εἰ and Ind., οἵ κέ με τιμήσουσι Il.
in late Greek, ἐάν, etc., take Ind., ἐὰν οἴδαμεν NTest.
combined IN APODOSIS with the Verb, denoting that the assertion is dependent on some condition; ἦλθεν he came, ἦλθεν ἄν he would have come; ἔλθοι may he come, ἔλθοι ἄν he would come:
with Ind.:

with imperf. and aor., the protasis implies non-fulfilment of a condition, and the apod. expresses what would be or would have been the case if the condition were or had been fulfilled. The imperf. with ἄν refers to continued action in present or past time, the aor. generally to action in past time; οὐκ ἂν νήσων ἐκράτει, εἰ μὴ ναυτικὸν εἶχεν he would not have been master of islands if he had not had a fleet, Thuc.; εἰ ταύτην ἔσχε τὴν γνώμην, οὐδὲν ἂν ἔπραξεν if he had come to this opinion, he would have accomplished nothing, Dem.:—the protasis is often understood, οὐ γὰρ ἦν ὅ τι ἂν ἐποιεῖτε for there was nothing which you could have done (i. e. if you had tried), Dem.:—hence the Ind. with ἄν represents a potential mood; ἦλθε τοῦτο τοὔνειδος τάχʼ ἄν this reproach might perhaps have come, Soph.
in Epic, with fut. ind., so as to modify the simple fut.; καί κέ τις ὧδʼ ἐρέει and some one will perchance speak thus, Il.
with Subj., in Epic, much like fut. ind., εἰ δέ κε μὴ δώηισιν, ἐγὼ δέ κεν αὐτὸς ἕλωμαι, i. e. I will take her myself, Il.
with Opt.:

after protasis in opt. with εἰ or some relative word, εἴ μοί τι πίθοιο, τό κεν πολὺ κέρδιον εἴη if he should obey me, it would be much better, Il.; sometimes with ind. in protasis, καί νύ κεν ἔνθʼ ἀπόλοιτο, εἰ μὴ νόησε he would have perished, had she not perceived, Dem.:—sometimes the tense in protasis is pres. or fut., and the opt. with ἄν in apodosis= fut., φρούριον εἰ ποιήσονται, βλάπτοιεν ἄν if they shall build a fort, they might perhaps damage, Thuc.

the protasis is often understood: τὸν δʼ οὔ κε δύʼ ἀνέρε ὀχλίσσειαν two men could not heave the stone (i. e. if they should try), Il.:—hence the opt. with ἄν becomes a potential mood, βουλοίμην ἄν I should like, Lat. velim (but ἐβουλόμην ἄν I should wish, if it were of any avail, vellem).
the opt. with ἄν comes to have the force of a mild command or entreaty, χωροῖς ἂν εἴσω you may go in, Soph.; κλύοις ἂν ἤδη hear me now, Soph.

with inf. and part.:—the pres. inf. or part. represents imperf. ind., φησὶν αὐτοὺς ἐλευθέρους ἂν εἶναι, εἰ τοῦτο ἔπραξαν he says they would (now) be free, if they had done this, Dem.; ἀδυνάτων ἂν ὄντων ὑμῶν ἐπιβοηθεῖν when you would have been unable to assist, Thuc.;—or represents pres. opt., φησὶν αὐτοὺς ἐλευθέρους ἂν εἶναι, εἰ τοῦτο πράξειαν he says they would (hereafter) be free, if they should do this, Xen.;—the aor. inf. or part. represents aor. ind. or opt., οὐκ ἂν ἡγεῖσθʼ αὐτὸν κἂν ἐπιδραμεῖν; do you not think he would even have run thither? Dem.; οὐδʼ ἂν κρατῆσαι αὐτοὺς τῆς γῆς ἡγοῦμαι I think they would not even be masters of the land, Thuc.; οὔτε ὄντα οὔτε ἂν γενόμενα, i. e. things which are not and never could happen, Thuc.:—so the perf. (or plup.) inf. or partic., πάντα ταῦθʼ ὑπὸ τῶν βαρβάρων ἂν ἑαλωκέναι φήσειεν ἄν he would say that all these would have been destroyed by the barbarians, Dem.

with imperf. and aor. ind. in the ITERATIVE construction, to express a condition fulfilled whenever an opportunity offered; εἶτα πῦρ ἂν οὐ παρῆν then there would be no fire at hand, i. e. there never was, Soph.; διηρώτων ἂν αὐτοὺς τί λέγοιεν Plat.
GENERAL REMARKS:
Position of ἄν.

ἄν may be separated from its inf. by such verbs as οἴομαι, δοκέω, so that ἄν has the appearance of belonging to the pres. ind., καὶ νῦν ἡδέως ἄν μοι δοκῶ κοινωνῆσαι I think that I should, Xen.:—in the peculiar case of οὐκ οἶδʼ ἂν εἰ, ἄν belongs not to οἶδα but to the Verb which follows, οὐκ οἶδʼ ἂν εἰ πείσαιμι οὐκ οἶδα εἰ πείσαιμι ἄν, Eur.
ἄν never begins a sentence.
Repetition of ἄν:— in apodosis ἄν may be repeated with the same verb, ὥστʼ ἄν, εἰ σθένος λάβοιμι, δηλώσαιμʼ ἄν Soph.
div1.head: ἄν
div1.etym: = ἐάν, ἤν, often in Plat., etc.; cf. κἄν.

div1.head: ἀναβάδην
div1.sense: going up, mounting: — in Ar., aloft, upstairs.

div1.head: ἀναβαίνω
div1.sense: to go up, mount, to go up to, c. acc. loci, Hom.; φάτις ἀνθρώπους ἀναβαίνει a report goes up among men, Od.; with a prep., ἀν. ἐς δίφρον Il.; ἀν. ἐπὶ οὔρεα Hdt.:—c. dat. to trample on, Il.:— c. acc. cogn., ἀν. στόλον to go up on an expedition, Pind.
Special usages:
to mount a ship, go on board, embark, Hom.; ἐς Τροίην ἀν. to embark for Troy, Od., etc.
to mount on horseback, ἀν. ἐφʼ ἵππον, ἐφʼ ἵππου Xen.; absol., ἀναβεβηκώς mounted, Xen.
of land-journeys, to go up from the coast into Central Asia, Hdt., Xen.; cf. ἀνάβασις 1. 2.
of rivers, to rise, Hdt.; ἀν. ἐς τὰς ἀρούρας to overflow the fields, Hdt.
in Attic, ἀν. ἐπὶ τὸ βῆμα, ἀν. ἐπὶ τὸ βῆμα, alone, to mount the tribune, Dem.; ἀν. ἐπὶ ἀν. ἐπὶ πλῆθος, τὸ δικαστήριον to come before the people, before the court, Plat.
of things and events, to come to an end, turn out, like ἀποβαίνω, ἐκβαίνω, Hdt., etc.
to come to, pass over to, εἴς τινα Hdt.
aor1 ἀνέβησα is used as aor. to ἀναβιβάζω in causal sense, to make to go up, esp. to put on shipboard, Il., Pind.; so mid. ἀνεβήσετο Od.

div1.head: ἀναβακχεύω
div1.sense: to rouse to Bacchic frenzy, Eur.; cf. ἀναβακχιόω.
intr. to break into Bacchic frenzy, Eur.

div1.head: ἀναβάλλω
div1.sense: to throw or toss up, Thuc., Xen.
to put back, put off, Od.; ἀν. τινα to put him off with excuses, Dem.:—Pass. to be adjourned, Thuc.
to run a risk, ἐγώ σφε θάψω κἀνὰ κίνδυνον βαλῶ, καὶ ἀναβαλῶ, Aesch.
Mid. to strike up, begin to play or sing (cf. ἀναβολή ΙΙ), Od., Ar.
to put off, delay, Il., Ar., etc.
to throw back or refer a thing to another, Luc.
to throw oneʼs cloak back, throw it over the shoulder, Ar., Plat.; ἀναβεβλημένος with oneʼs cloak thrown up or back, Dem.; cf. ἀναβολή 1. 2.

div1.head: ἀναβαπτίζω
div1.sense: to dip repeatedly, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνάβασις
div1.sense: a going up, mounting on horseback, Xen.:— πᾶσα ἄμβασις πάντες ἀναβάται, all the horsemen, Soph.
an expedition up from the coast into Central Asia, as that of the younger Cyrus, Xen.
a way up, ascent of a tower or mountain, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: ἀναβαστάζω
div1.sense: to raise or lift up, carry, Luc.

div1.head: ἀναβάτης
div1.sense: one mounted, of Pentheus in the tree, Eur.: a horseman, rider, Xen.

div1.head: ἀναβατικός
div1.sense: skilled in mounting, ἐπὶ τοὺς ἵππους Xen.

div1.head: ἀναβατός
div1.sense: to be mounted or scaled, easy to be scaled, Hom.

div1.head: ἀναβέβρυχα
div1.etym: perf. with no pres. ἀνα-βρύζω in use
div1.sense: ἀναβέβρυχεν ὕδωρ the water gushed or bubbled up, Il.

div1.head: ἀναβιβάζω
div1.sense: to make go up, cause to mount, ἐπὶ πύργον Hdt., Xen.
Special usages:
ἀν. τινα ἐφʼ ἵππον to mount one on horseback, Xen.; ἐπʼ ἅρμα Hdt.
ἀν. ναῦν to draw a ship up on land, Xen.
Mid., ἀναβιβάζεσθαί τινας ἐπὶ τὰς ναῦς to have them put on board ship, Thuc.; absol., ἀναβιβασάμενοι Thuc.
at Athens, to bring up to the bar as a witness, Plat., etc.: Mid., of a culprit, to bring up his wife and children to raise compassion, Plat.
Pass., ἀναβιβάζεσθαι εἰς τιμήν to ascend to honour, Plut.
ἀν. τοὺς φθόγγους, to moderate them, Plut.

div1.head: ἀναβιβαστέος
div1.sense: one must cause to mount, Plat.

div1.head: ἀναβιόω
div1.sense: to come to life again, return to life, Ar., Plat.

div1.head: ἀναβίωσις
div1.sense: a reviving, Plut.

div1.head: ἀναβιώσκομαι
div1.sense: as Pass. = ἀναβιόω, Plat.
as Dep., Causal of ἀναβιόω, to bring back to life, Plat.; aor1 ἀνεβιωσάμην Plat.

div1.head: ἀναβλαστάνω
div1.sense: to shoot up, grow up again, of Plants, Plat.; of a city, Hdt.; of misfortunes, to spring up, be rank, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀναβλέπω
div1.sense: to look up, Ar., Plat., etc.; ἀν. πρός τινα to look him in the face, Xen.
to look up at, c. acc., Eur.; also c. dat., Eur.
c. acc. cogn., ἀν. φλόγα to cast up a glance of fire, Eur.
to recover oneʼs sight, Hdt., Plat.; πάλιν ἀν. Ar.

div1.head: ἀνάβλεψις
div1.sense: a looking up, Arist.
recovery of sight, NTest.

div1.head: ἀνάβλησις
div1.sense: a putting off, delay, Il.

div1.head: ἀναβλύζω
div1.sense: to spout up, c. acc., Anth.
intr. to gush forth, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀναβλώσκω
div1.sense: to go through, c. acc., Eur.

div1.head: ἀναβόαμα
div1.sense: a loud cry, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀναβοάω
div1.etym: The form ἀναβοάσω is aor1, not future.
div1.sense: to shout aloud, utter a loud cry, Hdt., Eur.; of a war-cry, Xen.; c. inf. to call out that . . , Xen.
c. acc. rei, to cry out something, Eur.; also to wail aloud over a misfortune, Aesch., Eur.
c. acc. pers. to call on, Eur.

div1.head: ἀναβολεύς
div1.sense: a groom who helps one to mount, Plut.

div1.head: ἀναβολή
div1.sense: of the thing,
that which is thrown up, a mound, Xen.
that which is thrown back over the shoulder, a mantle, cloak, Plat.:—also the fashion of wearing it, Luc.; cf. ἀναβάλλω B. ΙΙΙ.
as an action,
a prelude on the lyre, Pind.; a dithyrambic ode, Ar.; v. ἀναβάλλω B. I.
a putting off, delaying, Hdt., Thuc.; οὐκ ἐς ἀμβολάς without delay, Eur.; V. ἀναβάλλω B. II.
intr. a bursting forth, Arist.

div1.head: ἀναβράσσω
div1.sense: to boil well, seethe, c. acc., Ar.; absol., ἀναβράττετʼ, ἐξοπτᾶτε Ar.

div1.head: ἀνάβραστος
div1.sense: boiled, Ar.

div1.head: ἀναβρυάζω
div1.sense: to neigh aloud, of horses, Ar.

div1.head: ἀναβρυχάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to roar aloud, Plat.

div1.head: ἀναγγέλλω
div1.sense: to carry back tidings of, report, Aesch., Eur.; τῶι Βρασίδαι τὴν ξυνθήκην Thuc.:—Pass., c. part., ἀνηγγέλθη τεθνεώς was reported dead, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνάγγελος
div1.sense: from which no messenger returns, Anth.

div1.head: ἀναγελάω
div1.sense: to laugh loud, ἀναγελάσας Xen.

div1.head: ἀναγεννάω
div1.sense: to beget anew, regenerate, NTest.

div1.head: ἀναγεύω
div1.sense: to give one a taste, c. acc. pers., Ar.

div1.head: ἀναγιγνώσκω
div1.sense: Epic usage, esp. in aor2 ἀν-έγνων, to know well, know certainly, Hom., Hdt.
to know again, recognise: to acknowledge, own, Lat. agnoscere, Hom., Hdt.

Attic usage, fut. ἀναγνώσομαι: aor2 ἀνέγνων: perf. ἀνέγνωκα:— Pass., fut. -γνωσθήσομαι: aor1 ἀνεγνώσθην: perf. ἀνέγνωσμαι, etc.:—of written characters, to know them again, and so to read, Ar., etc.; ἀναγνώσεται (sc. ὁ γραμματεύς) , ἀνάγνωθι, Dem.:— οἱ ἀναγιγνώσκοντες students, Plut.

Ionic usage, aor1 ἀνέγνωσα, to persuade or induce one to do a thing, c. acc. et inf., Hdt.: the inf. is sometimes omitted, ὡς ἀνέγνωσε when he had persuaded him, Hdt.;—the pres. is once so used, ἀναγιγνώσκεις στρατεύεσθαι βασιλέα Hdt.:—so in aor1 pass. ἀνεγνώσθην, to be persuaded to do a thing, c. inf., Hdt.

div1.head: ἀναγκάζω
div1.sense: to force, compel, mostly c. acc. pers. et inf., ἀν. τινὰ ποιεῖσθαι τι, λέγειν, etc., Hdt., etc.:—so Pass., ἠναγκάζοντο ἀμύνεσθαι Hdt.;—without the inf., ἀναγκάζεσθαί τι to be forced to do a thing, Plat., etc.:—also, ἀναγκάζειν τινὰ ἔς τι Thuc.
c. acc. pers. only, to constrain by argument, Plat.: Pass., ἠναγκάσθην I was constrained, tortured, Soph.; ἠναγκασμένος, ἀναγκασθείς under compulsion, Thuc.
c. acc. rei only, to carry through by force, Eur.
c. acc. rei et inf. to prove that a thing is necessarily so and so, Plat.

div1.head: ἀναγκαῖον
div1.sense: a place of constraint, a prison, Xen.:—others read Ἀνακεῖον.

div1.head: ἀναγκαῖος
div1.sense: with or by force:

act. constraining, applying force, Il.; ἦμαρ ἀν. the day of constraint, i. e. slavery, Ib.;so, ἀναγκαία τύχη the lot of slavery, or a violent death, Soph.; τῶι τῆς ἀρχῆς ἀναγκαίωι by the compulsory nature of our rule, Thuc.; ἐξ ἀναγκαίου under compulsion, Thuc.
of arguments, forcible, cogent, Thuc.
pass. constrained, forced, πολεμισταὶ ἀν. soldiers perforce, whether they will or no, Od.
necessary, ἀναγκαῖόν ἐστι, like ἀνάγκη ἐστί, c. inf., it is necessary to do a thing, Hdt., etc.; but, ἔνιαι τῶν ἀποκρίσεων ἀναγκαῖαι ποιεῖσθαι necessarily requiring to be made, Plat.
τὰ ἀναγκαῖα necessary things, needs, as food, sleep, Plat., Xen.; τὰ ἐκ θεοῦ ἀν. the appointed order of things, laws of nature, Xen.

absolutely necessary, indispensable, barely sufficient; ἀν. τροφή ἡ καθʼ ἡμέραν, Thuc.; τὸ ἀναγκαιότατον ὕψος the least height that was absolutely necessary, Thuc.; ἡ ἀναγκαιοτάτη πόλις the least that could be called a city, Plat.
of persons, connected by necessary ties, i. e. related by blood, Plat., etc.:— οἱ ἀναγκαῖοι, Lat. necessarii, kinsfolk, Xen., etc.
adv. -ως, necessarily, of necessity, perforce, ἀναγκαίως ἔχει it must be so, Hdt.; ἀν. φέρειν to bear as best one can, opp. to ἀνδρείως, Thuc.
ἀν. λέγειν only so far as is necessary, Plat.

div1.head: ἀναγκαστέος
div1.sense: to be compelled, Plat.
neut. ἀναγκαστέον one must compel, Plat.

div1.head: ἀναγκαστός
div1.sense: forced, constrained, Hdt.; ἀν. στρατεύειν pressed into the service, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀνάγκη
div1.sense: force, constraint, necessity, Hom., etc.; ἀνάγκηι perforce, of necessity, or in act. sense, forcibly, by force, Hom.; so, ὑπʼ ἀνάγκης, ἐξ ἀνάγκης, διʼ ἀνάγκης, πρὸς ἀνάγκην, κατʼ ἀνάγκην, Attic:— ἀνάγκη ἐστί, c. inf., it is matter of necessity to do a thing, Hom., etc.; c. dat. pers., ἀν. μοι σχεθεῖν Aesch.:—in Trag., πολλή γʼ ἀνάγκη, πολλή στʼ ἀνάγκη or πολλή μʼ ἀνάγκη, with which an inf. must be supplied.
actual force, violence, torture, Hdt., etc.; metaph., δολοποιὸς ἀν., i. e. the stratagem of Nessus, Soph.
bodily pain, anguish, distress, κατʼ ἀνάγκην ἕρπειν painfully, Soph.; ὑπʼ ἀνάγκης βοᾶν Soph.
like Lat. necessitudo, the tie of blood, relationship, kindred, Lys., etc.

div1.head: ἀναγνάμπτω
div1.sense: to bend back: Pass., αἰχμὴ ἀνεγνάμφθη the spear-point was bent back, Il.
to undo, loose, δεσμόν Od.

div1.head: ἄναγνος
div1.sense: impure, unclean, unholy, defiled, Aesch., etc.

div1.head: ἀναγνώρισις
div1.sense: recognition, Plat.; in a tragedy, recognition, Arist.

div1.head: ἀνάγνωσις
div1.sense: recognition, Hdt.
reading, Plat.

div1.head: ἀνάγνωσμα
div1.sense: a passage read aloud, a lecture, Luc.

div1.head: ἀναγνώστης
div1.sense: a reader, a slave trained to read, Plut.

div1.head: ἀναγνωστικός
div1.sense: suitable for reading, opp. to ἀγωνιστικός, Arist.

div1.head: ἀναγόρευσις
div1.sense: a public proclamation, Decret. ap. Dem.

div1.head: ἀναγορεύω
div1.etym: fut. and aor. are mostly supplied by ἀν-ερῶ, ἀν-εῖπον.
div1.sense: to proclaim publicly, Aeschin.:—Pass. to be proclaimed, ἀναγορευέσθω νικηφόρος Plat.

div1.head: ἀναγραπτέος
div1.sense: one must register, εὐεργέτην ἀν. τινά Luc.

div1.head: ἀνάγραπτος
div1.sense: inscribed, registered, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀναγραφεύς
div1.sense: a registrar, Lysias.

div1.head: ἀναγραφή
div1.sense: a registering, of treaties and the like, Arist.
a register, Plat.

div1.head: ἀναγράφω
div1.sense: to engrave and set up, of treaties, laws, etc., to inscribe, register, ἀν. τι ἐν στήληι or ἐς στήλην, Thuc., Dem.
of persons, to register his name, Isocr.:—Pass., ἀναγραφῆναι πατρόθεν to be registered with his fatherʼs name, Hdt.; ἀναγράφεσθαι εὐεργέτης to be registered as a benefactor, Hdt.
to describe mathematically, Plat. (in Mid.).
to entitle, Plut.

div1.head: ἀναγρύζω
div1.sense: to keep muttering, Ar.

div1.head: ἀναγυμνόω
div1.sense: to strip naked, unveil, Plut.

div1.head: ἀναγωγή
div1.sense: a leading up, esp. taking a ship into the high sea, a putting to sea, Thuc., etc.
a bringing back: restitution by law, Plat.

div1.head: ἀνάγωγος
div1.sense: ill-trained, of horses, ill-broken, unmanageable, Xen., etc.

div1.head: ἀναγώνιστος
div1.sense: without conflict, Thuc.: never having contended for a prize, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνάγω
div1.sense: to lead up from a lower place to a higher, Theogn., etc.
to lead up to the high sea, to carry by sea, Hom., etc.; ἀν. ναῦν to put a ship to sea, Hdt.; absol. in the same sense, Hdt.; —this is more common in Mid.
to take up from the coast into the interior, Od., Hdt.; esp. from Asia Minor into Central Asia, Xen.
to bring up from the dead, Hes., Aesch.
ἀν. χορόν to conduct the choir, Hes., Eur., etc.; also, ἀν. ὁρτήν to celebrate a festival, Hdt.
to lift up, raise, κάρα, τὸ ὄμμα Soph., etc.
ἀν. παιᾶνα to lift up the paean, Soph.
in various senses, ἀν. αἷμα to bring up blood, Plut.; ἀν. ποταμόν to bring a river up [over its banks], Luc.; ἀν. φάλαγγα, like ἀναπτύσσειν, Plut.; to bring up a prisoner for examination, Xen., etc.
to bring back, Hom., etc.
to refer a matter to another, Dem.
to rebuild, Plut.
to reckon or calculate, Plut.
intr. (sub. ἑαυτόν) to draw back, withdraw, retreat, Xen.; ἐπὶ πόδα ἀν. to retreat facing the enemy.
to reduce in amount, contract, Dem.
Mid. and Pass. to put out to sea, set sail, Il., etc.; ἀναχθῆναι Hdt.; ἀναχθείς Aesch.
metaph. to make ready, prepare oneself, ὡς ἐρωτήσων Plat.

div1.head: ἀναδαίω
div1.sense: to light up, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀναδασμός
div1.sense: re-distribution or partition of land, among colonists, Hdt., Plat., etc.

div1.head: ἀνάδαστος
div1.sense: divided anew, re-distributed, ἀν. γῆν ποιεῖν (cf. ἀναδασμός) Plat.
ἀν. ποιεῖν τι to rescind, Luc.

div1.head: ἀναδατέομαι
div1.sense: to divide anew, redistribute, Thuc.:—Pass. ἀναδαίομαι, to be distributed, Orac. ap. Hdt.

div1.head: ἀνάδειγμα
div1.sense: a mouthpiece used by public criers, Anth.

div1.head: ἀναδείκνυμι
div1.sense: to lift up and shew, πύλας ἀναδεικνύναι to display by opening the gates, i. e. throw wide the gates, Soph.; (so in Pass., μυστοδόκος δόμος ἀναδείκνυται Ar.); ἀναδέξαι ἀσπίδα to hold up a shield as signal, Hdt.; ἀνέδεξε σημήϊον τοῖς ἄλλοις ἀνάγεσθαι made signal for them to put to sea, Hdt.
to consecrate, Anth.

div1.head: ἀνάδειξις
div1.sense: a proclamation of an election, an appointment, Lat. designatio, Plut.
(from Pass.) a manifestation, NTest.

div1.head: ἀνάδελφος
div1.sense: without brother or sister, Eur.

div1.head: ἀναδέρκομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to look up, Il.

div1.head: ἀναδέρω
div1.sense: to strip the skin off: metaph. to lay bare, τι Luc.:—so in Mid., ἀναδέρεσθον Ar.

div1.head: ἀνάδεσις
div1.sense: a binding on, στεφάνων Plut.
a binding up, τῆς κόμης Luc.

div1.head: ἀναδέσμη
div1.sense: a band for the hair, a head-band, Il., Eur.:—so,

div1.head: ἀνάδετος
div1.sense: binding up the hair, Eur.

div1.head: ἀναδεύω
div1.sense: to moisten: metaph. to imbue, Plut.

div1.head: ἀναδέχομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to take up, catch, receive, Il.
to take upon oneself, submit to, ὀϊζύν Od.; ἀν. τι ἐφʼ ἑαυτόν Dem.
to undertake, promise to do, c. fut. inf., Hdt., Xen.:—so, ἀν. τοὺς δανειστάς to undertake to satisfy them, Plut.:— to be surety to one, τινι Thuc.

div1.head: ἀναδέω
div1.sense: to bind or tie up, Pind.: Mid., ἀναδέεσθαι τὰς κεφαλάς to bind their heads, Hdt.; κρώβυλον ἀναδεῖσθαι τῶν τριχῶν to bind oneʼs hair into a knot, Thuc.
c. acc. pers. to crown, Pind., Thuc.; εὐαγγέλια ἀναδεῖν τινα to crown him for good tidings, Ar.:—metaph. in Pass., τροφῆι ἀναδοῦνται are well furnished with food, Plat.
ἀναδῆσαι τὴν πατρίην ἔς τινα to attach oneʼs family to a founder, trace it back, Hdt.
Mid., of a ship, ἀναδούμενος ἕλκειν to take in tow, Thuc.
metaph. in Pass., ἀναδεδέσθαι ἔκ τινος or εἴς τι to be dependent upon, Plut.

div1.head: ἀναδιδάσκω
div1.sense: to teach otherwise or better, Lat. dedocere, Hdt.:—Pass. to be better instructed, change oneʼs mind, Hdt.
to shew clearly, Thuc.: to expound, interpret, λόγια ἀν. τινά to expound them to one, Ar.

div1.head: ἀναδίδωμι
div1.sense: to hold up and give, Pind., Xen.
to give forth, send up, yield, καρπόν Hdt., etc.: of a river, to yield, ἀναδιδόναι ἄσφαλτον Hdt.
intr., of springs and fire, to burst forth, Hdt.
to deal round, spread, Plut.
intr. to retrograde, Arist.

div1.head: ἀνάδικος
div1.sense: tried over again, Andoc., Plat.

div1.head: ἀναδιπλόω
div1.sense: Pass. to be made double, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνάδοσις
div1.sense: a distribution: digestion, Polyb.: metaph. of knowledge, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνάδοτος
div1.sense: to be given up, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀναδοχή
div1.sense: a taking up, undertaking, πόνων Soph.

div1.head: ἀναδύνω
div1.sense: to come to the top of water, Batr.
to come up, rise from the sea, c. gen., Hom.; so c. acc., ἀνεδύσατο κῦμα θαλάσσης Il.
to draw back, retire, Hom.: to shrink back, hesitate, Ar.:—of springs, to fail, Plut.
c. acc. to draw back from, shun, πόλεμον Il.

div1.head: ἀνάδυσις
div1.sense: a drawing back, retreat, Plat.: a holding back from service, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνάεδνος
div1.sense: without bridal gifts, Il.

div1.head: ἀναείρω
div1.etym: only in pres. and imperf.; ἀναερτάω is a lengthd. form of ἀν-αείρω, Anth.
div1.sense: to lift up, of a wrestler, Il.; to carry off, τάλαντα Il.

div1.head: ἀνάελπτος
div1.sense: unlooked for, Hes.

div1.head: ἀναζάω
div1.sense: to return to life, be alive again, NTest.

div1.head: ἀναζεύγνυμι
div1.sense: to yoke again, ἀναζευγνύναι τὸν στρατόν to move off the army, Hdt.; ἀν. τὸ στρατόπεδον to break up the camp, Hdt.; ἀν. τὰς νῆας to move Them back, Hdt.
absol. to break up, shift oneʼs quarters, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: ἀνάζευξις
div1.sense: a marching off, return home, Plut.

div1.head: ἀναζέω
div1.sense: to boil up or bubble up, Soph.
ἀναζ. εὐλάς to swarm with worms, a kind of disease, Plut.; also, εὐλαὶ ἀναζέουσιν Plut.

div1.head: ἀναζητέω
div1.sense: to examine into, investigate, τὰ ὑπὸ γῆς Plat.: Pass., Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἀναζωγρέω
div1.sense: to recall to life, Anth.

div1.head: ἀναζώννυμι
div1.sense: to gird up:— Mid., ἀν. τὰς ὀσφύας to gird up oneʼs loins, NTest.

div1.head: ἀναζωπυρέω
div1.sense: to rekindle, Eur.:—Pass. to gain fresh life and courage, Plat., Xen.; so, intr. in Act., Plut.

div1.head: ἀναθάλλω
div1.sense: to shoot up again: so in fut. mid., ἀναθαλήσεται Anth.

div1.head: ἀναθαρσέω
div1.sense: to regain courage, Ar., Thuc.; τινι at a thing, Thuc.; πρός τι Plut.

div1.head: ἀναθαρσύνω
div1.sense: to fill with fresh courage, Xen.
intr. = ἀναθαρσέω, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνάθεμα
div1.sense: † ἀνάθημα, Theocr., Anth.
esp anything devoted to evil, an accursed thing, NTest.
a curse, NTest.

div1.head: ἀναθεματίζω
div1.sense: to devote, ἀναθέματι ἀν. ἑαυτούς to bind themselves by a curse, NTest.
intr. to swear, NTest.

div1.head: ἀναθερμαίνω
div1.sense: to warm up, heat again, Anth.

div1.head: ἀναθετέος
div1.sense: one must attribute, τί τινι Plat.

div1.head: ἀναθηλέω
div1.sense: to sprout afresh, Il.

div1.head: ἀνάθημα
div1.sense: a votive offering set up in a temple, Hdt., Soph., etc.
a delight, ornament, Od.

div1.head: ἀναθλίβω
div1.sense: to press hard, Anth.

div1.head: ἄναθλος
div1.sense: without contest, not warlike, Luc.

div1.head: ἀναθορυβέω
div1.sense: to cry out loudly, shout in applause, Plat., Xen.
c. acc. to applaud, Plat.

div1.head: ἀνάθρεμμα
div1.sense: a nursling, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀναθρέω
div1.sense: to look up at, observe closely, Eur., Plat.:—Pass., τὰ ἔργα ἐκ τῶν λόγων ἀναθρούμενα their deeds compared with their words, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀναθρῴσκω
div1.sense: to spring up, bound up, rebound, Il., Hdt., etc.; ἀναθρώσκει ἐπὶ τὸν ἵππον springs upon it, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀναθυμιάω
div1.sense: to make to rise in vapour:— Pass. to rise in vapour, Arist., Luc.

div1.head: ἀναίδεια
div1.sense: shamelessness, impudence, effrontery, Hom., Plat., etc.

div1.head: ἀναιδεύομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to behave impudently, Ar.

div1.head: ἀναιδής
div1.sense: shameless, Hom., Soph.
c. gen., ἀναιδέα δηϊοτῆτος insatiate of strife, Il.
of things, λᾶας ἀναιδής the reckless stone, of Sisyphus, Od.; ἔργʼ ἀναιδῆ Soph.: —τὸ ἀναιδές, contr. τἀνειδές, ἀναίδεια, Eur.; ἐπὶ τὸ ἀναιδέστερον τραπέσθαι Hdt.
adv. -δῶς, Soph., etc.

div1.head: ἀναιθύσσω
div1.sense: to stir up, rouse, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: ἀναίθω
div1.sense: to light up, set on fire, Eur.: to inflame to love, Mosch.
intr. to blaze up, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀναίμακτος
div1.sense: unstained with blood, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: ἀναίματος
div1.sense: drained of blood, Aesch.

div1.head: ἄναιμος
div1.sense: without blood, bloodless, Plat., etc.

div1.head: ἀναίμων
div1.sense: without blood, bloodless, of the gods, Il.

div1.head: ἀναιμωτί
div1.sense: adv., without shedding blood, Il.

div1.head: ἀναίνομαι
div1.sense: Dep. c. acc. to reject with contempt, turn oneʼs back on, spurn, Hom.: also simply to refuse, decline, Od., Xen.
to renounce, disown, Aesch., Eur.
c. inf. to refuse, decline to do, Il.; and with pleon. negat., ἀναίνετο μηδὲν ἑλέσθαι he said no, he had received nothing, Il.
absol. to refuse, deny, Hom.

div1.head: ἀναίρεσις
div1.sense: a taking up of dead bodies for burial, Eur., Thuc.:—so, in a sea-fight, ναυαγίων ἀν. Thuc.
destruction, Xen., Dem.: abrogation of laws, Plut.

div1.head: ἀναιρέω
div1.sense: to take up, raise, Lat. tollere.
to take up and carry off, bear away, Il., Hdt.
to take up bodies for burial, Ar., Xen.; this is more common in Mid.
to make away with, to destroy, kill, Hom., Hdt., etc.
of things, to abolish, annul, Xen., etc.
to destroy an argument, confute, Plat.
to appoint, order, of an oracle, c. inf., ἀνεῖλε παραδοῦναι Thuc.; also c. acc. et inf., ἀνεῖλε μιν βασιλέα εἶναι Hdt.
absol. to answer, give a response, Hdt., Attic
Mid. to take up for oneself, take up; and then to gain, win, get, achieve, Hom., etc.; ποινήν τινος ἀν. to exact penalty from one, Hdt.
to take up and carry off, snatch away, Od.
to take up dead bodies for burial, Hdt., Thuc., etc.
to take up in oneʼs arms, Il.: hence, to take up new-born children, own them, Lat. tollere, suscipere, Plut.
to conceive in the womb, like συλλαμβάνω, Hdt.
to take upon oneself, undertake, πόνους Hdt.; πόλεμόν τινι war against one, Hdt.; ἀν. δημόσιον ἔργον to undertake, contract for the execution of a work, Plat.
to accept as oneʼs own, γνώμην Hdt.; ἀν. φιλοψυχίην to entertain a love for life, Hdt.
to take back to oneself, cancel, Dem.

div1.head: ἀναίρω
div1.sense: to lift up: in Mid., Eur.; in Pass., ἀναρθείς carried up, Anth.

div1.head: ἀναισθησία
div1.sense: want of feeling or perception; insensibility to pleasure or pain, Arist.

div1.head: ἀναισθητέω
div1.sense: to want perception, Dem.

div1.head: ἀναίσθητος
div1.sense: insensate, unfeeling, Xen., etc.:— adv., ἀναισθήτως ἔχειν to be indifferent, Isocr.
senseless, wanting tact, stupid, Thuc., Dem.: —τὸ ἀναίσθητον insensibility, Thuc.
pass. unfelt, θάνατος Thuc.

div1.head: ἀναισιμόω
div1.sense: to use up, use, consume, Hdt.:—Pass., ἀναισιμοῦσθαι ἔς τι to be used for a purpose, or spent upon a thing, Hdt.; ποῦ ταῦτα ἀναισιμοῦται; where (i. e. how) have these been disposed of? Hdt.

div1.head: ἀναισίμωμα
div1.sense: consumption, expenditure, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀναΐσσω
div1.sense: to start up, rise quickly, Il.; of thought, Il.; of a spring, to gush forth, Il.
c. acc. to leap up into, ἅρμα Il.

div1.head: ἀναισχυντέω
div1.sense: to be shameless, behave impudently, Thuc.; πρός τινα Xen.

div1.head: ἀναισχυντία
div1.sense: shamelessness, Ar., Plat.

div1.head: ἀναίσχυντος
div1.sense: shameless, impudent, Eur., Ar., etc.: —τὸ ἀναίσχυντον, ἀναισχυντία, Eur.:—adv. -τως, Plat.
of things, abominable, Eur.

div1.head: ἀναίτιος
div1.sense: of persons, not being the cause of a thing, guiltless, Hom., etc.
c. gen. rei, guiltless of a thing, Hdt., Aesch., etc.: —οὐκ ἀναίτιόν ἐστι, c. inf. it is blamable to do, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνακαγχάζω
div1.sense: to burst out laughing, Plat.

div1.head: ἀνακαθαίρω
div1.sense: to clear completely:— Pass., of the air, to become quite clear, Plut.
Mid. to clear or sweep away, Plat.

div1.head: ἀνακάθημαι
div1.sense: Pass. to sit upright, Luc.

div1.head: ἀνακαθίζω
div1.sense: to set up: Mid. to sit up, Plat.
intr. to sit up, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνακαινόω
div1.sense: to renew, restore:— Pass. to be renewed, Anth., NTest.

div1.head: ἀνακαίνωσις
div1.sense: renewal, NTest.

div1.head: ἀνακαίω
div1.sense: to light up, Od., Hdt., etc.:—Mid. to light oneself a fire, Hdt.
Pass., metaph. to fire up, with anger, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀνακαλέω
div1.sense: to call up the dead, Aesch.; so in Mid., Eur.
to call again and again:
to invoke, appeal to, θεούς Hdt., etc.;—so in Mid., Soph., Eur.
to summon, cite, Hdt.:—Mid. to call to oneself, send for, summon, Eur., Thuc.
to call by a name, ἀν. κακούς Eur.; Δαναούς Thuc.:—Pass., Ἀργεῖος ἀνακαλούμενος Soph.
to call on, so as to encourage, Thuc.; Mid., ἀνακαλεῖσθαι τὰς κύνας to cheer on the hounds, Xen.
to call back, recall, mostly in Mid., Aesch.; esp. from exile, Plat.; ἀνακαλεῖσθαι τῆι σάλπιγγι to sound a retreat, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνακαλυπτήρια
div1.sense: presents made by the bridegroom, when the bride first took off her veil, Lys.

div1.head: ἀνακαλύπτω
div1.sense: to uncover, ἀν. λόγους to use open speech, Eur.:—Mid. to unveil oneself, unveil, Xen.: —Pass., of a veil, to be uplifted, NTest.

div1.head: ἀνακάμπτω
div1.sense: to bend back: mostly intr. to bend oneʼs steps back, return, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀνάκανθος
div1.sense: without spine, of certain fish, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀνακάπτω
div1.sense: to gulp down, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀνάκειμαι
div1.etym: for rest of morphology see article on κεῖμαι
div1.sense: to be laid up as a votive offering, to be devoted or dedicated, Hdt., etc.
to be set up as a statue, Dem., Theocr.
to be ascribed or offered, τινι Plut.

to be referred to a person, depend on his will, Hdt.; πάντων ἀνακειμένων τοῖς Ἀθηναίοις ἐς τὰς ναῦς since they had their whole fortunes dependant on their ships, Thuc.; ἐπὶ σοὶ τάδε πάντʼ ἀνάκειται Ar.; σοὶ ἀνακείμεσθα Eur.

div1.head: Ἀνάκειον
div1.sense: the temple of the Dioscuri, Andoc., etc.; cf. ἀναγκαῖον.

div1.head: ἀνακέλαδος
div1.sense: a loud shout or din, Eur.

div1.head: ἀνακεράννυμι
div1.sense: to mix up or again, κρητῆρα Od.; οἶνον Ar.:—Pass., aor1 ἀν-εκεράσθην Plat.; ἀν-εκράθην [ᾱ] Plut.

div1.head: Ἄνακες
div1.sense: the Dioscuri, Castor and Pollux, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνακεφαλαιόομαι
div1.sense: to sum up the argument:— Pass. to be summed up, NTest.

div1.head: ἀνακηκίω
div1.sense: to spout up, gush forth, ἀνακήκιεν αἷμα Il.

div1.head: ἀνακηρύσσω
div1.sense: to proclaim by voice of herald, publish abroad, Soph., Xen.
c. acc. pers. to proclaim as conqueror, Ar.:—Pass., aor1 inf. ἀνακηρυχθῆναι Hdt.
to put up to auction, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀνακινδυνεύω
div1.sense: to run into danger again, to run a fresh risk, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀνακινέω
div1.sense: to sway or swing to and fro, Hdt.
to stir up, awaken, νόσον Soph.; πόλεμον Plut.

div1.head: ἀνακίνησις
div1.sense: a swinging to and fro: metaph., excitement, emotion, Soph.

div1.head: ἀνακίρναμαι
div1.sense: Dep. to mix well: metaph., φιλίας ἀνακίρνασθαι to join in closest friendship, Eur.

div1.head: ἀνακλάζω
div1.sense: to cry aloud, scream out, Eur.; of a dog, to bark, bay, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνακλαίω
div1.etym: Note also that there is another verb ἀνακλάω
div1.sense: to weep aloud, burst into tears, Hdt.
c. acc. to weep for, Hdt.; so in Mid., Soph.

div1.head: ἀνακλάω
div1.etym: Note also that there is another verb ἀνακλάω
div1.sense: to bend back, δέρην Eur.
to break short off, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀνάκλησις
div1.sense: a calling on, invocation, θεῶν Thuc.
a recalling: retreat, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνακλητικός
div1.sense: fit for exhorting, Plut.
fit for recalling, τὸ ἀνακλητικὸν σαλπίζειν to sound a retreat, Anth.

div1.head: ἀνακλίνω
div1.sense: to lean one thing upon another, [τόξον ποτὶ γαίηι ἀγκλίνας having laid it on the ground, Il.:—Pass. to lean back, to lie on oneʼs back, recline, Lat. resupinari, Od.
to push back a trap-door, to open it, Hom., Hdt. Hence

div1.head: ἀνάκλιτος
div1.sense: leaning back: ἀν. θρόνος a seat with a back, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνακλώθω
div1.sense: of the Fates, to undo the thread of oneʼs life, to change oneʼs destiny, Luc.

div1.head: ἀνακογχυλιάζω
div1.sense: to open and counterfeit a seal, Ar.

div1.head: ἀνακοινόω
div1.sense: to communicate a thing to another, τί τινι Plat.
c. dat. pers. to communicate with, take counsel with, ἀν. τοῖς θεοῖς περί τινος Xen.
Mid., with perf. pass. ἀνακεκοίνωμαι, properly, to communicate what is oneʼs own to another, ἀνακοινοῦται τῶι Ἴστρωι τὸ ὕδωρ mingles its water with the Ister, Hdt.
much like Act., either ἀνακοινοῦσθαί τί τινι to impart a thing to one; or ἀν. τινι to consult one, Xen.: absol. to hold communication, Ar.

div1.head: ἀνακοιρανέω
div1.sense: to rule or command ina place, Anth.

div1.head: ἀνακομιδή
div1.sense: a carrying away again, recovery, τῶν πλοίων Decret. ap. Dem.

div1.head: ἀνακομίζω
div1.sense: to carry up, Xen.:—Pass. to be carried up stream, or up the country, Hdt.
to bring back, recover, Xen.: —Mid. (with perf. pass.) to take back with one, Hdt.:— Pass. to be brought back, and of persons, to return, Hdt., Thuc.
Mid. also, to bring to pass, Pind.:— to bring back upon oneself, Eur.

div1.head: ἀνακοντίζω
div1.sense: intr., to dart or shoot up, Il., Hdt.

div1.head: ἀνακοπή
div1.sense: a beating back: the recoil of the waves, and the water left after flood-tide, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνακόπτω
div1.sense: to drive back, Od.
to beat back an assailant, Thuc.
to stop:— Pass. to be stopped, stop short, τινός from a thing, Luc.

div1.head: ἀνακουφίζω
div1.sense: to lift up, Eur.; of a ship, ἀν. κάρα Soph.:—Pass. to be lifted up or lightened, aor1 ἀνεκουφίσθην Eur.: to rise in spirits, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνακούφισις
div1.sense: relief from a thing, c. gen., Soph.

div1.head: ἀνακράζω
div1.sense: to cry out, lift up the voice, Od., Attic

div1.head: ἀνάκρασις
div1.sense: a mixing with others, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνακρέκομαι
div1.sense: Mid., to tune up, Anth.

div1.head: ἀνακρεμάννυμι
div1.sense: to hang up on a thing, c. dat., Od.; ἐς . . or πρός. . . Hdt.:—Pass. to be hung up, Hdt.
to make dependent, Plat.

div1.head: ἀνακρίνω
div1.sense: to examine closely, to question, interrogate, τινά Thuc., Plat.
to inquire into a fact, Antipho:—Mid., Pind.
used at Athens in technical sense:
to examine magistrates, as to their qualification, Dem.
of the magistrates, to examine persons concerned in a suit, so as to prepare the matter for trial, Dem.
Mid., ἀνακρίνεσθαι πρὸς ἑαυτούς to dispute one with another, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀνάκρισις
div1.sense: examination of parties concerned in a suit, a preparation of the matter for trial, Xen.; μηδʼ εἰς ἄγκρισιν ἐλθεῖν, i. e. not even to begin proceedings, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀνακροτέω
div1.sense: to lift up and strike together, τὼ χεῖρε Ar.; τὰς χεῖρας Aeschin.: absol. to applaud vehemently, Ar.

div1.head: ἀνάκρουσις
div1.sense: a pushing back: of a ship, backing water, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀνακρουστέος
div1.sense: one must check, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνακρούω
div1.sense: to push back, stop short, check, ἵππον χαλινῶι Xen.
Mid., ἀνακρούεσθαι πρύμνην to put oneʼs ship astern, by backing water, Ar.; so ἀνακρούεσθαι alone, Thuc.; also, ἐπὶ πρύμνην ἀν., Hdt.:—metaph. to put back, Plat.
in Music, to strike up, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀνακτάομαι
div1.sense: Dep., to regain for oneself, get back again, recover, Hdt., Aesch.
c. acc. pers. to win a person over, gain his favour or friendship, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: ἀνακτορία
div1.sense: management of horses, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἀνακτόριος
div1.sense: belonging to a lord or king, royal, Od.

div1.head: ἀνάκτορον
div1.sense: a palace; of gods, a temple, Hdt., Eur.

div1.head: ἀνακυκάω
div1.sense: to stir up and mix, mix up, Ar.

div1.head: ἀνακυκλέω
div1.sense: to turn round again, Eur.: metaph. to revolve in oneʼs mind, Luc.

div1.head: ἀνακυκλόω
div1.sense: Pass., to revolve, Anth.

div1.head: ἀνακυμβαλιάζω
div1.sense: to fall rattling over, of chariots, Il.

div1.head: ἀνακύπτω
div1.sense: to lift up the head, Hdt.; ἀνακεκυφώς with the head high, of a horse, Xen.
to come up out of the water, pop up, Ar., Plat.: metaph. to emerge, Plat.

div1.head: ἀνακωκύω
div1.sense: to wail aloud, Aesch.; ἀνακωκύει φθόγγον utters a loud wail, Soph.

div1.head: ἀνακῶς
div1.sense: carefully, ἀνακῶς ἔχειν τινός to look well to a thing, give good heed to it, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: ἀναλάζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. only in pres., to take again, Mosch.

div1.head: ἀναλαλάζω
div1.sense: to raise a war-cry, cry aloud, Eur., Xen.

div1.head: ἀναλαμβάνω
div1.sense: to take up, take into oneʼs hands, Hdt.: to take on board ship, Hdt., Thuc.: generally, to take with one, Thuc.
to take up, for the purpose of examining or considering, Plat.
to take upon oneself, assume, τὴν προξενίαν Thuc., etc.
Mid. to take upon oneself, undertake, engage in, κίνδυνον, μάχην Hdt.
to learn by rote, Plut.
to get back, regain, recover, τὴν ἀρχήν Hdt., Xen.
to retrieve, make good, τὴν αἰτίην Hdt.; ἁμαρτίαν Soph.
to restore, repair, Hdt.; ἀν. ἑαυτόν to regain strength, revive, Thuc.
to take up again, resume, τὸν λόγον Hdt., Plat.: to recollect, Plut.
to pull short up, to check a horse, Xen.: ἀν. τὰς κύνας to call them back, Xen.
to gain quite over, win over, Ar.

div1.head: ἀναλάμπω
div1.sense: to flame up, take fire, Xen.
metaph. to break out anew, as war, Plut.
to come to oneself again, revive, Plut.

div1.head: ἀναλγησία
div1.sense: want of feeling, insensibility, Dem.

div1.head: ἀναλγής
div1.sense: painless, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνάλγητος
div1.sense: without pain, and so:
of persons, insensible to pain, Arist.
unfeeling, hard-hearted, ruthless, Soph.; ἀναλγητότερος εἶναι to feel less grieved, Thuc.: c. gen., ἀν. εἶναί τινος to be insensible to, Plut.:—adv. -τως, unfeelingly, Soph.
of things, not painful, Soph.
cruel, πάθος Eur.

div1.head: ἀναλδής
div1.sense: not thriving, feeble, Ar.

div1.head: ἀναλέγω
div1.sense: to pick up, gather up, ὀστέα Il.:—Mid. to pick up for oneself, Hdt.; ἀν. πνεῦμα to collect oneʼs breath, Anth.
to reckon up, τὸν χρόνον Plut.: —Pass., ἀναλεγόμενον being recounted, Xen.

div1.head: ἀναλείχω
div1.sense: to lick up, τὸ αἷμα Hdt.

div1.head: ἀνάληψις
div1.sense: a taking up of a child, to acknowledge it, Luc.
pass. a being taken up, the Ascension, NTest.
a taking back, a means of regaining, Plut.
a making good, making amends for a fault, Thuc.: a refreshing, Luc.

div1.head: ἀναλθής
div1.sense: powerless to heal, Bion.

div1.head: ἀνάλιος
div1.sense: Doric for ἀν-ήλιος.

div1.head: ἀνάλιπος
div1.sense: Doric for ἀν-ήλιπος.

div1.head: ἀναλίσκω
div1.etym: The quantity of the 2nd syllable and the active form make it doubtful whether this verb is a compound of ἀνά, ἁλίσκομαι.
div1.sense: to use up, to spend, lavish or squander money, Thuc.; εἴς τι upon a thing, Plat., etc.; πρός τι Dem.; ὑπέρ τινος Dem.:—Pass., τἀνηλωμένα the monies expended, Dem.
metaph., ἀνάλωσας λόγον hast wasted words, Soph.; ἀν. σώματα πολέμωι Thuc.
of persons, to kill, destroy, Trag.:—Mid. to kill oneself, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀνάλκεια
div1.sense: want of strength, feebleness, Epic dat. pl. ἀναλκείησι Il.; sg. ἀναλκίη with ῑ] Theogn.

div1.head: ἄναλκις
div1.sense: without strength, impotent, feeble, of unwarlike persons, Hom., Aesch., etc.

div1.head: ἀνάλλομαι
div1.sense: Dep. , to leap or spring up, Ar., Xen.

div1.head: ἄναλμος
div1.sense: not salted, Xen.

div1.head: ἀναλογία
div1.sense: proportion, Plat., etc.

div1.head: ἀναλογίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep., to reckon up, sum up, Plat., Xen.
to calculate, consider, τι Thuc.
foll. by a Conj., ἀναλ. ὡς, ὅτι, to recollect that, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: ἀναλογισμός
div1.sense: reconsideration, Thuc.:— a course or line of reasoning, Xen.
κατὰ τὸν ἀναλογισμόν according to proportionate calculation, ap. Dem.

div1.head: ἀνάλογος
div1.sense: proportionate, Plat.: neut. as adv. in proportion, analogously, Arist.

div1.head: ἄναλτος
div1.sense: not to be filled, insatiate, Od.

div1.head: ἀνάλυσις
div1.sense: a loosing, releasing, κακῶν from evils, Soph.
(from Pass.) retirement, departure, death, NTest.

div1.head: ἀναλυτήρ
div1.sense: a deliverer, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀναλύω
div1.sense: to unloose, undo, of Penelopeʼs web, Od.
to unloose, set free, release, ἐκ δεσμῶν Od.
after Hom., ἀν. ὀφθαλμόν, φωνάν, i. e. to restore to a dead man the use of his eyes and voice, Pind.
to analyse, Arist.
to put an end to a thing, Xen.:— to abolish, cancel, Dem.:—Mid. to cancel faults, Xen., Dem.
intr. to loose a ship from its moorings, weigh anchor, depart, Polyb.: —metaph., of death, NTest.
to return, NTest.

div1.head: ἀνάλωμα
div1.sense: expenditure, cost, in pl. expenses, Thuc., etc.

div1.head: ἀνάλωσις
div1.sense: outlay, expenditure, Theogn., Thuc.

div1.head: ἀναλωτής
div1.sense: a spender, waster, Plat.

div1.head: ἀναλωτικός
div1.sense: expensive, Plat.

div1.head: ἀνάλωτος
div1.sense: not to be taken, invincible, impregnable, Hdt.: also, not taken, still holding out, Thuc.
of persons, ἀν. ὑπὸ χρημάτων incorruptible, Xen.

div1.head: ἀναμαιμάω
div1.sense: to rage through, c. acc., Il.

div1.head: ἀναμανθάνω
div1.sense: to inquire closely, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀναμάξευτος
div1.sense: impassable for wagons, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀναμάρτητος
div1.sense: without missing, unfailing, unerring, Xen.

in moral sense, without fault, blameless, Plat., etc.; ἀν. πρός τινα or τινι having done no wrong to a person, Hdt.; ἀν τινός guiltless of a thing, Hdt.; τὸ ἀναμάρτητον innocence, Xen.:—adv. ἀν-αμαρτήτως, without fail, unerringly, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀναμασάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to chew over again, ruminate, Ar

div1.head: ἀναμάσσω
div1.sense: to wipe off, ἔργον ὃ σῆι κεφαλῆι ἀναμάξεις a deed which thou wilt wipe off on thine own head (as if it were a stain), Od.; so, ταῦτα ἐμῆι κεφαλῆι ἀναμάξας Hdt.:—Mid., ἀναμάττεσθαι τῶι προσώπωι τοῦ αἵματος to have [some of] the blood wiped on oneʼs face, Plut.

div1.head: ἀναμάχομαι
div1.sense: Dep., to renew the fight, retrieve a defeat, Hdt., Thuc.; ἀν. τὸν λόγον to fight the argument over again, Plat.

div1.head: ἀνάμβατος
div1.sense: of a horse, that one cannot mount, Xen.

div1.head: ἀναμέλπω
div1.sense: to begin to sing, ἀοιδάν Theocr.

div1.head: ἀναμένω
div1.sense: to wait for, await, c. acc., Od., Hdt., etc.:—c. acc. et inf., ἀν. τινὰ ποιεῖν to await oneʼs doing, Hdt.; ἀν. τι γίνεσθαι a thing happening, Hdt.:—absol to wait, stay, Soph., etc.
to await, endure, τί Xen.
to put off, delay, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνάμεσος
div1.sense: in the midland or interior, Lat. mediterraneus, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀνάμεστος
div1.sense: filled full, τινός of a thing, Dem.

div1.head: ἀναμεστόω
div1.sense: to fill up, fill full, Ar., in Pass.

div1.head: ἀναμετρέω
div1.sense: to re-measure the road one came by, retrace oneʼs steps to a place, ὄφρα ἀναμετρήσαιμι Χάρυβδιν Od.
to recapitulate, Eur., in Mid.
to measure over again, to measure carefully, take the measure of, τι Hdt.; ἀν. ἑαυτόν Ar.:—Mid., ἀνεμετρησάμην φρένας τὰς σάς took the measure of thy mind, Eur.
ἀναμετρεῖσθαι δάκρυ εἴς τινα to measure out (i. e. pay) to him the tribute of a tear, Eur.

div1.head: ἀναμέτρησις
div1.sense: a measurement, τινος πρός τι of one thing by another, Plut.

div1.head: ἀναμηρυκάομαι
div1.sense: to chew the cud, Luc.

div1.head: ἀνάμιγα
div1.sense: promiscuously, Soph., Anth.

div1.head: ἀναμείγνυμι
div1.sense: to mix up, mix together, Od., Hdt., etc.:—Pass. to be mixed with others, Hdt., Attic: to have intercourse, Plut.
ἀναμίσγω, poet. and Ionic for ἀναμίγνυμι, only in pres. and imperf.
to mix one thing with another, τί τινι Od.: —Pass. to have intercourse, τινι Hdt.

div1.head: ἀναμιμνήσκω
div1.sense: to remind one of a thing, c. dupl. acc., ταῦτά μʼ ἀνέμνησας Od.; c. gen. rei, ἀν. τινά τινος Eur.:—c. acc. pers. et inf. to remind one to do, Pind.
c. acc. rei, to recall to memory, make mention of, Dem.
in Pass. to remember, τινός Hdt., etc.; more rarely τι Ar., Plat.; περί τι Plat.

div1.head: ἀνάμιξις
div1.sense: intercourse, Plut.

div1.head: ἀναμίξ
div1.sense: adv., promiscuously, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: ἀναμισθαρνέω
div1.sense: to serve again for pay, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνάμνησις
div1.sense: a calling to mind, recollection, Plat., etc.

div1.head: ἀναμνηστός
div1.sense: that which one can recollect, Plat.

div1.head: ἀναμορμύρω
div1.sense: to roar loudly, boil up, πᾶσʼ ἀναμορμύρεσκε (Ionic imperf.) of Charybdis, Od.

div1.head: ἀναμοχλεύω
div1.sense: to raise by a lever, to force open, πύλας Eur.

div1.head: ἀναμπλάκητος
div1.sense: unerring, unfailing, Soph.
of a man, without error or crime, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: ἀναμυχθίζομαι
div1.sense: to moan loudly, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀναμφίβολος
div1.sense: unambiguous: adv. -λως, Luc.

div1.head: ἀναμφίλογος
div1.sense: undisputed, undoubted, Xen. adv. ἀναμφιλόγως, indisputably, Xen.

div1.head: ἀναμφισβήτητος
div1.sense: undisputed, indisputable, Thuc.; ἀν. χώρα a place about which there is no dispute, i. e. well-known, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνανδρία
div1.sense: want of manhood, Eur., Plat., etc.
unmanliness, cowardice, Aesch., etc.

div1.head: ἄνανδρος
div1.sense: = ἄνευ ἀνδρός husbandless, Trag.
= ἄνευ ἀνδρῶν, without men, Trag.
wanting in manhood, unmanly, Hdt., Plat.; τὸ ἄνανδρον ἀνανδρία, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀνάνδρωτος
div1.sense: widowed, εὐναί Soph.

div1.head: ἀνανεάζω
div1.sense: to renew oneʼs youth, Ar.

div1.head: ἀνανέμω
div1.sense: to divide anew: Mid. to count up, Hdt. (in Ionic fut. -νεμέεται).
to rehearse, read, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀνανέομαι
div1.sense: to mount up, ἀννεῖται (Epic for ἀνανεῖται) Od.

div1.head: ἀνανεόομαι
div1.sense: to renew, Thuc., etc.

div1.head: ἀνανεύω
div1.sense: to throw the head back, in token of denial (which we express by shaking the head), Hom., Hdt., etc.
c. acc. rei, to deny, refuse, Il.

div1.head: ἀνανέωσις
div1.sense: a renewal, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀνανήφω
div1.sense: to return to sobriety of mind, NTest.
trans. to make sober again, Luc.

div1.head: ἀνανθής
div1.sense: without bloom, past its bloom, Plat.

div1.head: ἀνανταγώνιστος
div1.sense: without a rival, without a struggle, Thuc.: uncontested, unalloyed, Thuc.:—adv. -τως.
irresistible, Plut.

div1.head: ἄναντα
div1.sense: up-hill, Il.

div1.head: ἀνάντης
div1.sense: up-hill, steep, Hdt., Plat., Xen.; πρὸς τὸ ἄναντες to the highest point, Plat.

div1.head: ἀναντίλεκτος
div1.sense: incontestable, Luc.

div1.head: ἀναξαίνω
div1.sense: to tear open, a wound, Babr.

div1.head: ἀναξηραίνω
div1.sense: to dry up things, of the wind, Il.; to dry up a stream, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀναξία
div1.sense: a command, behest, Pind.

div1.head: ἀνάξιος
div1.sense: of persons,
unworthy, not deemed or held worthy of, c. gen., Hdt.; ἀνάξιον σοῦ too good for thee, Soph.; c. inf., ἀνάξιος δυστυχεῖν undeserving to suffer, Soph.:—adv., ἀναξίως ἑωυτῶν Hdt.
absol. unworthy, worthless, Hdt., Soph.:—adv. -ίως, Soph.
undeserving of evil, Soph., Eur.
of things, undeserved, ἀνάξια παθεῖν Eur., etc.

div1.head: ἀναξιφόρμιγξ
div1.sense: ruled by the lyre, Pind.

div1.head: ἄναξ
div1.sense: a lord, master, being applied to the gods, esp. to Apollo and Zeus, Hom.; to the latter in voc., Ζεῦ ἄνα Il.
among the Homeric heroes Agamemnon is ἄναξ ἀνδρῶν; but ἄναξ is a title given to all men of rank and note, as to Teiresias, Od.; βασιλεὺς ἄναξ lord king, Od.
the master of the house, esp. as denoting the relation of master to slave, Od.
metaph., κώπης, ναῶν ἄνακτες lords of the oar, of ships, Aesch.; ἄν. ὅπλων Eur.

div1.head: ἀναξυρίδες
div1.sense: the trousers worn by eastern nations, Hdt., Xen.; by the Scythians, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀναξύω
div1.sense: to scrape up or off:— Pass., ἀναξυσθείς (aor1 part.) having the surface scraped off, Plut.

div1.head: ἀναπαιδεύω
div1.sense: to educate afresh, Ar.

div1.head: ἀνάπαιστος
div1.sense: struck back, rebounding: as Subst. an anapaest (i. e. a dactyl reversed), an anapaestic verse, Ar.; ἀνάπαιστα, τά, anapaestics, satire, Plut.

div1.head: ἀναπαίω
div1.sense: to strike back.

div1.head: ἀνάπαλιν
div1.sense: back again, Plat., etc.
over again, Plat.
contrariwise, reversely, Plat.

div1.head: ἀναπάλλω
div1.sense: to swing to and fro, ἀμπεπαλὼν ἔγχος, having poised and drawn back the spear before throwing it, Il.: to set in motion, urge on, Eur.; ἀμπάλλειν τὰ κῶλα Ar.:—Pass. to spring up, ὡς ὅτε ἀναπάλλεται ἰχθύς, ὣς πληγεὶς ἀνέπαλτο (3rd sg. Epic aor2) as when a fish springs up, so he smitten sprang up, Il.

div1.head: ἀναπάσσω
div1.sense: to sprinkle upon, τί τινι Pind.

div1.head: ἀνάπαυλα
div1.sense: repose, rest, Soph.; κατʼ ἀναπαύλας διηιρῆσθαι to be divided into reliefs, of workmen, Thuc.
c. gen. rei, rest from a thing, Soph., Thuc., etc.
a resting-place, an inn, Lat. deversorium, Eur., Ar.

div1.head: ἀνάπαυμα
div1.sense: a repose, rest, Hes.; μεριμνῶν from cares, Theogn.
a resting-place, Anth.

div1.head: ἀνάπαυσις
div1.sense: repose, rest, Pind., Xen.: relaxation, recreation, Xen.
rest from a thing, c. gen., Thuc.

div1.head: ἀναπαυστήριος
div1.sense: of or for resting, Hdt.
as Subst. ἀναπαυστήριον, τό, a time of rest, Xen.
a place of rest, Luc.

div1.head: ἀναπαύω
div1.sense: to make to cease, to stop or hinder from a thing, c. gen., Il.; ἀν. τινά τινος to give him rest or relief from a thing, Soph., Dem.
c. acc. only, to stop, put an end to, βοήν Soph.:—more commonly, to rest, halt, τὸ στράτευμα, τοὺς ναύτας Xen.
rarely intr. in sense of Mid. to take rest, ἀναπαύοντες Thuc.; ἀνέπαυεν Xen.
