Mid. and Pass. to desist from a thing, ἀπὸ ναυμαχίας Thuc.
absol. to take oneʼs rest, sleep, Lat. pernoctare, Hdt., Eur., etc.; of the dead, Theocr.: —of soldiers, to halt, rest, Xen.
to regain strength, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνά
div1.sense: prep. governing gen., dat., and acc. Radic. sense, up, upon, opp. to κατά.
WITH GEN., ἀνὰ νηός on board ship, Od.
WITH DAT., on, upon, ἀνὰ σκήπτρωι upon the sceptre, Il.; ἀνὰ ὤμωι upon the shoulder, Od.
WITH ACC., the comm. usage, implying motion upwards:
of Place, up to, up along, ἀνὰ τὸν ποταμόν Hdt.; ἀνὰ δῶμα up and down the house, throughout it, Il.; so, ἀνὰ στρατόν, ἄστυ, ὅμιλον Hom.; ἀνὰ στόμα ἔχειν to have continually in the mouth, Hom.
of Time, throughout, ἀνὰ νύκτα Il.; ἀνὰ τὸν πόλεμον Hdt.; ἀνὰ χρόνον in course of time, Hdt.; ἀνὰ πᾶσαν τὴν ἡμέραν Hdt.; but, ἀνὰ πᾶσαν ἡμέραν, distributively, day by day, Hdt.

distributively also with Numerals, ἀνὰ πέντε παρασάγγας τῆς ἡμέρας they marched] at the rate of 5 parasangs a day, Xen.; κλισίας ἀνὰ πεντήκοντα companies at the rate of 50 in each, NTest.; ἔλαβον ἀνὰ δηνάριον a denarius apiece, NTest.
ἀνὰ κράτος up to the full strength, with all might, ἀνὰ κράτος φεύγειν, ἀπομάχεσθαι Xen.; ἀνὰ λόγον in proportion, Plat.
WITHOUT CASE as adv. thereupon, Hom., etc.
all over, μέλανες δʼ ἀνὰ βότρυες ἦσαν all over there were clusters, Il. [E.] IN COMPOS.,
upwards, up, as ἀναβαίνω, ἀνίστημι.
with a sense of increase or completeness, as ἀνακρίνω.
again, as ἀναβλαστάνω, ἀναγινώσκω.
back, backwards, ἀναχωρέω.
ἄνα by anastr. for ἀνάστηθι, up! arise! ἀλλʼ ἄνα Hom.
ἄν apocop. for ἀνέστη, he stood up, Il.

div1.head: ἀνα-
div1.sense: the negat. Prefix (of which α priv. is a shortened form) before vowels, ἀν-αίτιος, ἀν-ώδυνος (but see ἀ-έκων, ἄ-ελπτος, ἄ-εργος): the complete form remains in ἀνά-εδνος, ἀνά-ελπτος.

div1.head: ἀναπείθω
div1.sense: to bring over, convince, Xen.:— Pass., Thuc.
to persuade, move to do a thing, c. acc. pers. et inf., Hdt., Attic; ἀν. τινά τι to persuade one of a thing, Ar.
to seduce, mislead, τινά Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἀναπειράομαι
div1.sense: Dep., to try or attempt again: as a military and naval term, to renew or continue their exercises, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: ἀναπείρω
div1.sense: to pierce through, fix on a spit, Il., Ar.
to impale, ἐπὶ ξύλου τινά Hdt.: Pass., ἀποθανεῖν ἀναπαρείς (aor2 part.) Hdt.

div1.head: ἀναπειστήριος
div1.sense: persuasive, Ar.

div1.head: ἀναπεμπάζομαι
div1.sense: Dep., to count again, count over, Plat.

div1.head: ἀναπέμπω
div1.sense: to send up from below, Aesch.: to send forth, Pind.:—Mid. to send up from oneself, Xen.
to send up, from the coast inland, esp. into Central Asia, Thuc., Xen.
to send back, Pind.

div1.head: ἀναπετάννυμι
div1.sense: to spread out, unfold, unfurl sails, Il.; ἀν. βόστρυχον to let the hair flow loose, Eur.; φάος ἀμπετάσας having shed light abroad, Eur.; ἀν. τὰς πύλας to throw wide the gates, Hdt.:— Pass., ἀναπεπταμένος thrown open, Il.; ἀλώπηξ ἀναπιτναμένη a fox lying on its back, Pind.:—the part. perf. pass. ἀναπεπταμένος, η, ον, is often a mere adj. open, of the sea, Hdt.; of eyes, Xen.; δίαιτα ἀν. life in the open air, Plut.

div1.head: ἀναπέτομαι
div1.sense: to fly up, fly away, Hdt., etc.
metaph. to be on the wing, ἀνεπτόμαν Soph.; ἀνέπταν φόβωι Soph.

div1.head: ἀναπήγνυμι
div1.sense: to transfix, impale, Plut.

div1.head: ἀναπηδάω
div1.sense: to leap up, start up, Il., Hdt., etc.
to leap back, from fear, Ar.; ἀνεπήδησεν ἐπὶ τὴν Ἑστίαν, for protection, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνάπηρος
div1.sense: much maimed, crippled, Plat., etc.

div1.head: ἀναπιδύω
div1.sense: of ground, to send forth water, Plut.

div1.head: ἀναπίμπλημι
div1.sense: to fill up, Lat. explere, Epigr. ap. Luc.
metaph., πότμον ἀναπλήσαντες having filled up the full measure of misery, Il.; so, ἀναπλῆσαι οἶτον, κακά, ἄλγεα, κήδεα Hom., Hdt., etc.
c. gen. rei, to fill full of a thing, Ar., etc.
with a notion of defiling, infecting, ὡς πλείστους ἀναπλῆσαι αἰτιῶν Plat.; so Pass. to be infected with disease, Thuc., Plat.

div1.head: ἀναπίπτω
div1.sense: to fall back, Aesch.
to fall back, give ground, Thuc.: to flag, lose heart, Lat. concidere animo, Dem.
of a plan, to be given up, Dem.
to recline at table, like ἀνάκειμαι, NTest.

div1.head: ἀναπλάσσω
div1.sense: to form anew, remodel, Ar.:—Mid., ἀναπλάσασθαι οἰκίην to rebuild oneʼs house, Hdt.
metaph. to invent, in Mid., Anth.
to plaster up: Pass., κηρὸν ἀναπεπλασμένος having wax plastered, Ar.

div1.head: ἀναπλέκω
div1.sense: to enwreath, Pind.:—Mid. to braid oneʼs hair, Luc.
metaph. of writing verses, Anth.
Pass., ἀναπεπλεγμένοι closely engaged, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνάπλεος
div1.sense: quite full of a thing, c. gen., Hdt., Plat.
infected with or by a thing, c. gen., Plat.

div1.head: ἀναπλέω
div1.sense: to sail up, to go up stream, c. acc., Od.
to put out to sea, Il., Dem.
to sail the same way back again, sail back, Hdt., Xen.:—of fish, to swim back, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀναπληρόω
div1.sense: to fill up a void, Plat.
to make up, supply, Plat.:—Mid., δώματʼ ἀν. to fill their houses full, Eur.
to fill up the numbers of a body, τὴν βουλήν Plut.; ἀν. τὴν συνηγορίαν to fill the place of advocate, Plut.
to pay in full, in Mid., Dem.
Pass. to be restored to its former size, of the sun, after an eclipse, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀναπλήρωσις
div1.sense: a filling up, Arist., Plut.

div1.head: ἀναπληρωτέος
div1.sense: one must fill up, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνάπλοος
div1.sense: a sailing upstream, Hdt.
a putting out to sea, Polyb.

div1.head: ἀναπλόω
div1.sense: to unfold, open, Mosch., Babr.

div1.head: ἀνάπνευμα
div1.sense: a resting-place, Pind.

div1.head: ἀνάπνευσις
div1.sense: recovery of breath, respite from a thing, c. gen., Il.

div1.head: ἀνάπνευστος
div1.sense: without breath, breathless, Hes.

div1.head: ἀναπνέω
div1.etym: besides the common tenses, we have three Homeric forms as if from ἀμπνύω
div1.sense: to breathe again, take breath, Il., etc.: to recover from a thing, c. gen., Il., Soph., etc.; so, ἔκ τινος Hdt.:— absol. to revive, Xen.; and in this sense Hom. uses ἄμπνυτο, ἀμπνύνθη.
to draw breath, breathe, Pind., Plat.
to breathe forth, send forth, καπνόν Pind.

div1.head: ἀναπνοή
div1.sense: recovery of breath, revival, Pind., Plat.; μόχθων ἀμπνοά rest from toils, Pind., Eur.
a drawing breath, respiration, Ar., Plat.; ἀμπνοὰς ἔχειν ἀναπνέειν, to breathe, Soph.; τὴν ἀν. ἀπολαβεῖν τινος to strangle him.
a breathing organ, of the mouth, Luc.; an air-hole, Plut.

div1.head: ἀναποδίζω
div1.sense: to make to step back, call back, cross-examine, Hdt., Aeschin.; ἀν. ἑωυτόν to correct himself, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀνάποινος
div1.sense: without ransom, only in neut. ἀνάποινον as adv., Il.

div1.head: ἀναπολέω
div1.sense: properly to turn up the ground again: hence to go over again, repeat, reconsider, Pind., Soph.

div1.head: ἀναπολίζω
div1.sense: of a field, Pind.

div1.head: ἀναπομπή
div1.sense: a sending up: ἀν. θησαυρῶν a digging up of treasures, Luc.

div1.head: ἀναπόμπιμος
div1.sense: sent back, Luc.

div1.head: ἀναπομπός
div1.sense: one that sends up or back, of Hades, sending up the shade of Darius, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀναπόνιπτος
div1.sense: unwashen, Ar.

div1.head: ἀναπράσσω
div1.sense: to exact, levy money or debts, Ar., Thuc.; ἀν. ὑπόσχεσιν to exact the fulfilment of a promise, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀναπρήθω
div1.sense: to blow forth, to let burst forth, δάκρυʼ ἀναπρήσας with tears bursting forth, Hom.

div1.head: ἀναπτερόω
div1.sense: properly of a bird, to raise its feathers: hence, ἀν. ἐθείρας Eur.
metaph. to set on the wing, excite vehemently, Hdt., Eur., etc.:— Pass. to be in a state of excitement, Aesch., Xen., etc.

div1.head: ἀναπτοέω
div1.sense: to scare exceedingly, Mosch.:—Pass. to be scared, Plut.

div1.head: ἀναπτύσσω
div1.sense: to unfold the rolls on which books were written; and so, to unrol, open for reading, ἀν. βιβλίον Hdt.:— to undo, open, πύλας Eur.; ἀναπτύξας χέρας with arms outspread, Eur.
to unfold, disclose, reveal, Lat. explicare, Trag.

as military term, τὴν φάλαγγα ἀναπτ. to fold back the phalanx, i. e. deepen it by wheeling men from both flanks to rear, French replier, Xen.; but conversely, τὸ κέρας ἀναπτ. to open out the wing, i. e. extend the line by wheeling men from rear to front, French deployer, Xen.

div1.head: ἀναπτυχή
div1.sense: αἰθέρος ἀμπτυχαί, the expanse of heaven, Eur.; ἡλίου ἀναπτυχαί the sunʼs expanse, Eur.

div1.head: ἀναπτύω
div1.sense: to spit up, sputter, Soph.

div1.head: ἀνάπτω
div1.sense: to make fast on or to a thing, ἐξ ἱστοῦ πείρατʼ ἀνῆπτον made fast the rope to the mast, Od.:—Mid., ἐκ τοῦδʼ ἀναψόμεσθα κάλων to him will we make fast our cable, i. e. he shall be our protector, Eur.:—Pass. to fasten oneself on to, cling to a thing, c. gen., Eur.; ἀμφί τινι Eur.; ἀνῆφθαί τι to have a thing fastened on one, Eur.
to hang up in a temple, offer up, ἀγάλματα Od.
metaph. to attach to, μῶμον ἀνάψαι Od.; αἷμα ἀν. τινί a charge of bloodshed, Eur.
to light up, light, λύχνα Hdt.; πῦρ Eur.; also, πυρὶ ἀν. δόμους Eur.:—metaph., νέφος οἰμωγῆς ὡς τάχʼ ἀνάψει Eur.

div1.head: ἀναπυνθάνομαι
div1.sense: to inquire closely into, ascertain, Hdt.; τὸν ποιήσαντα Hdt.
to learn by inquiry, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: ἀνάπυστος
div1.sense: ascertained, notorious, Od., Hdt.

div1.head: ἄναρθρος
div1.sense: without joints, not articulated, Plat., etc.
without strength, nerveless, Soph.
of sound, inarticulate, Plut.

div1.head: ἀναριθμέομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to enumerate, Dem.

div1.head: ἀναρίθμητος
div1.sense: not to be counted, countless, Hdt., Attic: of time, immeasurable, Soph.
unregarded, Eur.

div1.head: ἀνάριθμος
div1.sense: without number, countless, numberless, Sapph., Trag.: c. gen., ἀνάριθμος θρήνων without measure in lamentations, Soph.; μηνῶν ἀνήριθμος without count of months, Soph.; πόλις ἀνάριθμος πολῖται ἀνάριθμοι, Soph.

div1.head: ἄναρκτος
div1.sense: not governed or subject, Thuc.: not submitting to be governed, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀνάρμενος
div1.sense: unequipped, Anth.

div1.head: ἀναρμοστέω
div1.sense: not to fit or suit, τινί or πρός τι Plat.

div1.head: ἀναρμοστία
div1.sense: discord, of musical sounds, Plat.

div1.head: ἀνάρμοστος
div1.sense: unsuitable, incongruous, disproportionate, Hdt., Xen.:—of sound, out of tune, Plat.:—adv. -τως, Hdt.
of persons, impertinent, absurd, Ar.
unfitted, unprepared, πρός τι Thuc.

div1.head: ἀναρπαγή
div1.sense: re-capture, Eur.

div1.head: ἀναρπάζω
div1.sense: to snatch up, Il., Xen.
to snatch away, carry off, Hom., etc.; of slave-dealers, to kidnap, Od.:—Pass., Soph.: in Prose also, to be dragged before a magistrate, carried off to prison, Lat. rapi in jus, Dem.
in good sense, to rescue, Plut.
to take by storm, plunder, Eur.; of persons, ἀναρπασόμενος τοὺς Φωκέας to take them by storm or at once, Hdt.
to carry off, steal, Xen., Dem.

div1.head: ἀναρπαστός
div1.sense: snatched up, carried off, Eur., Plat.
carried up the country, i. e. into Central Asia, Xen.

div1.head: ἀναρρήγνυμι
div1.sense: to break up the ground, Il., Hdt.
to break through a wall, Il., Eur.:—Pass., ἡ ναῦς ἀναρρήγνυται τὴν παρεξειρεσίαν the ship has its bow broken through, Thuc.
to tear open a carcase, of lions, Il.; of Ajax, δίχα ἀνερρήγνυ was cleaving them asunder, Soph.
to make to break forth, utter, like Lat. rumpere voces, Ar., Theocr.; ἀν. πόλιν to make it break out, excite greatly, Plut.:—Pass. to burst forth; metaph. of persons, ἀναρρήγνυσθαι πρὸς ὀργήν Theocr.
intr. to break forth, Soph.

div1.head: ἀνάρρηξις
div1.sense: breakage, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνάρρησις
div1.sense: a proclamation, Dem.; cf. ἀνεῖπον.

div1.head: ἀναρρίπτω
div1.sense: to throw up, ἀν. ἅλα πηδῶι to throw up the sea with the oar, i. e. row with might and main, Od.; also without πηδῶι, οἱ δʼ ἅλα πάντες ἀνέρριψαν Od.

ἀν. κίνδυνον, a phrase from the game of dice, to run the hazard of a thing, run a risk, Hdt., Thuc.; περί or ὑπέρ τινος Plut.;— also without κίνδυνον, ἐς ἅπαν τὸ ὑπάρχον ἀναρρίπτειν to throw for oneʼs all, stake oneʼs all, Thuc.; with a second acc. ἀν. μάχην to hazard a battle, Plut.

div1.head: ἀναρριχάομαι
div1.sense: to clamber up with the hands and feet, scramble up, Ar.

div1.head: ἀναρροιβδέω
div1.sense: to suck down again, of Charybdis, Od.

div1.head: ἀνάρρυσις
div1.sense: rescue: name of the second day of the festival Ἀπατούρια, Ar.

div1.head: ἀναρρώννυμι
div1.sense: to strengthen afresh:— Pass., to regain strength, ἀναρρωσθέντες, Thuc.
intr. in aor1 act. to recover, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνάρσιος
div1.sense: not fitting, incongruous: hence,
of persons, hostile, unpropitious, implacable, Hom., Trag.
of events, untoward, strange, monstrous, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀναρτάω
div1.sense: to hang to or upon, to attach to, make dependent upon, ἐς θεοὺς ἀν. τι to leave it depending upon them, Eur.; ἀν. ἑαυτὸν εἰς δῆμον Dem.
Pass. to be hung up, Plat.
metaph. to hang or depend upon, ἔκ τινος Plat., Dem.:— ἀνηρτῆσθαι εἰς . . to be referred or referable to . . , Plat.; ἀνηρτημένοι ταῖς ὄψεσιν πρός τινα hanging on one with their eyes, Plut.
Mid. to attach to oneself, make dependent upon one, τινά Xen.

div1.head: ἀναρτέομαι
div1.etym: Ionic Verb, only used in perf. pass.
div1.sense: to be ready, prepared to do, c. inf., Hdt.: cf. ἀρτέομαι.

div1.head: ἀνάρτιος
div1.sense: uneven, odd, opp. to ἄρτιος (even), Plat.

div1.head: ἀναρχαΐζω
div1.sense: to make old again, Anth.

div1.head: ἀναρχία
div1.sense: lack of a leader, Hdt.
the state of a people without government, anarchy, Aesch., Thuc., etc.:—at Athens this name was given to the year of the thirty tyrants (B. C. 404), when there was no archon, Xen.

div1.head: ἄναρχος
div1.sense: without head or chief, Il., Eur.: τὸ ἄναρχον ἀναρχία, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀνασαλεύω
div1.sense: to shake up, stir up, Luc.

div1.head: ἀνασειράζω
div1.sense: to draw back with a rein, to hold in check, Anth.
to draw aside from the road, Eur.

div1.head: ἀνασείω
div1.sense: to shake back, swing to and fro, move up and down, Hes.: esp. as a signal, Thuc.
to stir up, NTest.

div1.head: ἀνασεύομαι
div1.sense: Pass., only in syncop. aor2, αἷμα ἀνέσσυτο the blood sprang forth, spouted up, Il.

div1.head: ἀνάσιλλος
div1.sense: bristling hair, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνασκάπτω
div1.sense: to dig up, to dig up ground, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνασκεδάννυμι
div1.sense: to scatter abroad, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνασκευάζω
div1.sense: to pack up the baggage (τὰ σκεύη), Lat. vasa colligere: to carry away, Xen.:—Mid. to break up oneʼs camp, march away, Thuc., Xen.
to disfurnish, dismantle a place, Thuc.: Mid. to dismantle oneʼs house or city, Thuc.
to waste, ravage, destroy, Xen.
Pass. to be bankrupt, break, of bankers, Dem.; metaph., ἀνεσκευάσμεθα we are ruined, Eur.

div1.head: ἀνάσκητος
div1.sense: unpractised, unexercised, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνασκολοπίζω
div1.etym: The middle future form ἀνασκολοπιοῦμαι has a passive meaning.
div1.sense: to fix on a pole or stake, impale, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀνασκοπέω
div1.sense: to look at narrowly, examine well, Ar., Thuc.

div1.head: ἀνασοβέω
div1.sense: to scare and make to start up, to rouse, Plat.:—Pass., ἀνασεσοβημένος τὴν κόμην with hair on end through fright, Luc.

div1.head: ἀνασπαράσσω
div1.sense: to tear up, Eur.

div1.head: ἀνασπαστός
div1.sense: drawn up, Ar.
dragged up the country, of tribes compelled to emigrate into Central Asia, Hdt.
of a door or gate, drawn back, opened, Soph.

div1.head: ἀνασπάω
div1.sense: to draw up, pull up, Solon, Hdt.:—Mid., ἐκ χροὸς ἔγχος ἀνεσπάσατο he drew his spear forth again, Il.
to draw a ship up on land, Hdt., Thuc.
to draw or suck up greedily, αἷμα Aesch.: but, ὕδωρ ἀν. to draw water, Thuc.
to tear up, Hdt., Attic
metaph., ἀνασπᾶν λόγους to draw forth words, to utter violent, offensive words, Soph.
τὰς ὀφρῦς ἀνασπᾶν to draw up the eyebrows, and so put on a grave important air, Ar.; so, τὰ μέτωπα ἀν. Ar.
to draw back, τὴν χεῖρα Ar.
to carry away from home, Luc.

div1.head: ἄνασσα
div1.sense: a queen, lady, mistress, addressed to goddesses, Od., Aesch.; also to a mortal, Od., Trag.
generally, like ἄναξ IV, ἄνασσα ὀργίων Ar.

div1.head: ἀνάσσω
div1.sense: to be lord, master, owner, to rule, in a place, c. dat., Ἄργεϊ, νήσοισι ἀν.; or c. gen. to be lord of, rule over, Τενέδοιο, Ἀργείων Hom.: also, μετʼ ἀθανάτοισι ἀν. to be first among the immortals, Il.:—Mid., τρὶς ἀνάξασθαι γένεα ἀνδρῶν to have been king for three generations, Od.:—Pass. to be ruled, Hom.
in Trag. metaph. of things, κώπης ἀνάσσειν, etc., Eur., cf. ἄναξ IV:—Pass., παρʼ ὅτῳ σκῆπτρον ἀνάσσεται by whom the sceptre is held as lord, Soph.

div1.head: ἀνασταδόν
div1.sense: standing up, upright, Il.

div1.head: ἀνάστασις
div1.sense: act. a raising up of the dead, Aesch.
a making men rise and leave their place, removal, as of suppliants, Thuc.; ἀν. τῆς Ἰωνίας the removal of all the Greeks from Ionia, Hdt.:— an overthrow, destruction, ruin, Aesch., Eur.
a setting up, restoration, τειχῶν Dem.
(ἀνίσταμαι) a standing or rising up, in token of respect, Plat.
a rising and moving off, removal, Thuc.
a rising up, ἐξ ὕπνου Soph.
a rising again, the Resurrection, NTest.

div1.head: ἀναστατήρ
div1.sense: a destroyer, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀνάστατος
div1.sense: made to rise up and depart, driven from oneʼs home, Hdt.
of cities and countries, ruined, laid waste, Hdt., Soph., etc.

div1.head: ἀναστατόω
div1.sense: to unsettle, upset, NTest.

div1.head: ἀνασταυρόω
div1.sense: to impale, Hdt.: — Pass., Thuc.
in the Rom. times, to affix to a cross, crucify, Plut.
to crucify afresh, NTest.

div1.head: ἀναστείβω
div1.sense: strengthd. for στείβω, Anth.

div1.head: ἀναστέλλω
div1.sense: to raise up:— Mid. to gird up oneʼs clothes, Eur., Ar.
to keep back, repulse an attack, Eur., Thuc.:—Pass. to retire, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀναστενάζω
div1.sense: Hdt.; τοιάδʼ ἀνεστέναζες ἐχθοδοπά such hateful words didst thou groan forth, Soph.
c. acc. pers. to groan for, lament, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: ἀναστεναχίζω
div1.sense: to groan aloud, Il.

div1.head: ἀναστενάχω
div1.sense: c. acc. pers. to groan aloud over, bemoan, c. acc., Il.; so in Mid., Il.

div1.head: ἀναστένω
div1.sense: to groan aloud, Aesch.
like ἀναστενάχω, c. acc., Eur.

div1.head: ἀναστέφω
div1.sense: to crown, wreath, κρᾶτα Eur.:—Pass., ἀνέστεμμαι κάρα I have my head wreathed, Eur.

div1.head: ἀναστηρίζω
div1.sense: to set up firmly, Anth.

div1.head: ἀναστολή
div1.sense: a putting back, τῆς κόμης Plut.

div1.head: ἀναστομόω
div1.sense: to furnish with a mouth, ἀν. τάφρον to clear out a trench, Xen.:—Mid., φάρυγος ἀναστόμου τὸ χεῖλος open the lips of your gullet wide, Eur.

div1.head: ἀναστρέφω
div1.sense: to turn upside down, upset, Il., Eur., etc.; ἀν. καρδίαν to upset the stomach, i. e. cause sickness, Thuc.:—Pass., ὄρος ἀνεστραμμένον ἐν τῆι ζητήσει turned up by digging, Hdt.
to turn back, bring back, τινὰ ἐξ Ἅδιου Soph.; ὄμμʼ ἀν. κύκλωι to roll oneʼs eye about, Eur.: to rally soldiers, Xen.
intr. to turn back, return, retire, Hdt., Attic
Pass. to be or dwell in a place, Lat. versari, ἄλλην γαῖαν ἀν. to go to a place and dwell there, Od.; ἀν. ἐν Ἄργει Eur.:— to conduct oneself, ὡς δεσπότης Xen.
to revolve, of the sun, Xen.
of soldiers, to face about, rally, Xen.

div1.head: ἀναστρολόγητος
div1.sense: ignorant of astrology, Strab.

div1.head: ἀναστροφή
div1.sense: a turning upside down, upsetting, Eur.; εἰς ἀναστροφὴν διδόναι ἀναστρέφειν, Eur.
a turning back, return, Soph.: a wheeling about, of soldiers, whether to flee or rally, Xen.; of a ship, Thuc.
(from Pass.) a dwelling in a place, Plut.: a mode of life, conversation, NTest.
the place where one tarries, an abode, haunt, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀναστρωφάω
div1.sense: intr., to keep turning about, Od.

div1.head: ἀνασύρω
div1.sense: mid., to pull up oneʼs clothes, Hdt.; perf. part. ἀνασεσυρμένος obscene, Theophr.

div1.head: ἀνασφάλλω
div1.sense: intr., to rise from a fall or illness, to recover, Babr.

div1.head: ἀνάσχεσις
div1.sense: a taking on oneself, endurance, τῶν δεινῶν Plut.

div1.head: ἀνασχίζω
div1.sense: to rip up, τὴν γαστέρα Hdt.: to rend, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀνασῴζω
div1.sense: to recover what is lost, rescue, Soph.: Mid., ἀνασώζεσθαί τινα φόβου to recover one from fear, Soph.:—Mid. in proper sense, ἀν. τὴν ἀρχήν to recover the government for oneself, Hdt.:—Pass. to return safe, of exiles, Xen.
in Mid. also to preserve in mind, remember, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀναταράσσω
div1.sense: to disturb greatly, rouse to frenzy, confound, Soph., Plat.:—Pass., ἀνατεταραγμένος in disorder, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνατείνω
div1.sense: to stretch up, hold up, χεῖρα ἀν. to lift up the hand in adjuration or in prayer, Pind.; or as token of ascent in voting, Xen.
to stretch forth, τὴν μάχαιραν ἀνατεταμένος with his sword stretched out, Xen.; οὐδὲν ἀνατείνασθαι φοβερόν to hold out no alarming threat, Dem.
to hold up as a prize, Pind.
to lift up, exalt, Pind.
to stretch out, extend, e. g. a line of battle, Xen.; ἀετὸς ἀνατεταμένος a spread eagle, Xen.
intr. to reach up, πέδιλα ἐς γόνυ ἀνατείνοντα Hdt.: to extend out, οὖρος ἀν. ἐς τὴν Οἴτην Hdt.

div1.head: ἀνατειχίζω
div1.sense: to rebuild, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνατειχισμός
div1.sense: a rebuilding of the walls, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνατέλλω
div1.sense: to make to rise up or to grow up, Il.:—Pass., φλὸξ ἀνατελλομένη a flame mounting up, Pind.
to give birth to, bring to light, Pind.: of events, Soph.
intr. to rise, of the sun and moon, Hdt., Soph., etc.
of a river, to take its rise, Hdt.
to grow, of hair, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀνατέμνω
div1.sense: to cut open, Hdt., Luc.

div1.head: ἀνατίθημι
div1.sense: to lay upon (as a burden), Il., Ar.

to refer, attribute, ascribe a thing to a person, Hdt., etc.; οὐ γὰρ ἂν οἱ πυραμίδα ἀνέθεσαν ποιήσασθαι would not have attributed to him the erection of the pyramid, Hdt.; ἐμοὶ ἀναθήσετε will give me the credit of it, Thuc.:—also, ἀν. τινὶ πράγματα to lay them upon him, entrust them to him, Ar., Thuc.
to set up as a votive gift, dedicate, τί τινι Hes., Hdt., etc.; hence the votive gift itself was ἀνάθημα:— Pass., aor1 inf. ἀνατεθῆναι Ar.; but ἀνάκειμαι is more freq. as the Pass.
metaph., ἀν. τι λύραι to commit a song to the lyre, Pind.
to set up and leave in a place, Ar.
to put back, remove, προσθεῖσα κἀναθεῖσα τοῦ γε κατθανεῖν by adding or putting off somewhat of the necessity of death, Soph.
Mid. to put upon for oneself, τὰ σκεύη ἐπὶ τὰ ὑποζύγια Xen.
to impart something of oneʼs own, τί τινι NTest.
to place differently, change about, Orac. ap. Hdt., Plat.
metaph. to retract oneʼs opinion, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνατιμάω
div1.sense: to raise in price, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀνατινάσσω
div1.sense: to shake up and down, brandish, Eur.; of the wind shaking about a sail, Eur.

div1.head: ἀνατί
div1.sense: without harm, with impunity, Trag.

div1.head: ἀνατλῆναι
div1.sense: to bear up against, endure, Od., Attic; φάρμακʼ ἀνέτλη resisted the strength of the magic drink, Od.

div1.head: ἀνατολή
div1.sense: a rising, rise, of the sun, often in pl., Od.; of the stars, Aesch.
the quarter of sunrise, East, Lat. Oriens, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀνατολμάω
div1.sense: to regain courage, Plut.

div1.head: ἄνατος
div1.sense: unharmed, Aesch.; c. gen., κακῶν ἄνατος harmed by no ills, Soph.

div1.head: ἀνατρεπτέος
div1.sense: one must overthrow, Luc.

div1.head: ἀνατρεπτικός
div1.sense: likely to upset a thing, c. gen., Plat.

div1.head: ἀνατρέπω
div1.etym: Note that aor2 middle is used in a passive sense.
div1.sense: to turn up or over, overturn, upset, Archil., etc.:—Pass., ἀνετράπετο ὕπτιος ἔπεσεν, Il.; of ships, Plat., etc.
to overthrow, Lat. evertere, Hdt., Attic
to upset in argument, refute, Ar.:—Pass. to be upset, disheartened, ἀνετράπετο φρένα λύπαι Theocr.
to stir up, awaken, Soph.

div1.head: ἀνατρέφω
div1.sense: to feed up, nurse up, educate, Aesch., Ar., Xen.

div1.head: ἀνατρέχω
div1.sense: to run back, Il.
c. acc. to retrace, Lat. repetere, Pind.
to jump up and run, start up, of men, Hdt., Thuc.
of things, ἐγκέφαλος ἀνέδραμε ἐξ ὠτειλῆς the brains spurted up from the wound, Il.; σμώδιγγες ἀνέδραμον weals started up under the blow, Il.
to run up, shoot up, of plants, Il.; then of cities and peoples, to shoot up, rise quickly, Hdt.
ἀναδέδρομε πέτρη the rock ran sheer up, Od.

div1.head: ἀνάτρησις
div1.sense: a trepanning, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνατρίβω
div1.sense: to rub well, rub clean, κύνας Xen.
Pass. to be worn away, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀνατροπή
div1.sense: an upsetting, overthrow, Aesch., Plat.

div1.head: ἀνατυλίσσω
div1.sense: to unroll, βιβλία Luc.

div1.head: ἀνατυπόω
div1.sense: to impress again, Luc.

div1.head: ἀνατυρβάζω
div1.sense: to stir up, confound, Ar.

div1.head: ἀναύγητος
div1.sense: rayless, sunless, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀναύδητος
div1.sense: not to be spoken, unutterable, ineffable, Lat. infandus, Aesch., Eur.
unspoken, impossible, Soph.
speechless, Soph.

div1.head: ἄναυδος
div1.sense: speechless, silent, Od., Aesch., etc.
preventing speech, silencing, Aesch.
like ἀναύδητος, unutterable, Soph.

div1.head: ἄναυλος
div1.sense: without the flute, i. e. joyless, melancholy, Eur.: neut. pl. ἄναυλα as adv., Babr.
unskilled in flute-playing, Luc.

div1.head: Ἄναυρος
div1.sense: a river in Thessaly, Hes.
as appellat. ἄναυρος, ὁ, a torrent, Mosch.

div1.head: ἄναυς
div1.sense: without ships, νᾶες ἄναες ships that are ships no more, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀναύω
div1.sense: to cry aloud, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀναφαίνω
div1.sense: to make to give light, make to blaze up, ξύλα Od.
to bring to light, shew forth, display, Hom., Attic; ἀν. μελέων νόμους Ar.

to proclaim, declare, βασιλέα ἀν. τινά Pind.; ἀν. πόλιν to proclaim it victor in the games, Pind.:—c. inf., ἀναφανῶ σε τόδε ὀνομάζειν I proclaim that they call thee by this name, i. e. order that thou be so named, Eur.
of things, to appoint, νόμους Ar.
ἀναφάναντες τὴν Κύπρον having opened, come in sight of, Cyprus, NTest.
Pass., with fut. mid. ἀναφανήσομαι or -φανοῦμαι : perf. ἀναπέφαμμαι, or in mid. form -πέφηνα:— to be shewn forth, come to light or into sight, appear plainly, Hom., etc.
to reappear, Hdt.
ἀναφανῆναι μούναρχος to be declared king, Hdt.; ἀναφαίνεσθαι σεσωσμένος to be plainly in safety, Xen.

div1.head: ἀναφαλαντίας
div1.sense: bald in front, Luc.

div1.head: ἀναφανδά
div1.sense: visibly, openly, Od.

div1.head: ἀναφέρω
div1.sense: to bring or carry up, Od., etc.; ἀν. τινὰ εἰς Ὄλυμπον Xen.:— to carry up the country, esp. into Central Asia, Hdt.:—Mid. to carry up to a place of safety, take with one, Xen.
to bring up, pour forth, tears, Aesch.:—Mid., ἀνενείκασθαι, absol. to fetch up a deep-drawn breath, heave a deep sigh, Il., Hdt.:—c. acc. rei, to utter, ἀνενείκατο φωνάν, μῦθον Theocr.
to uphold, take upon one, ἄχθος Aesch.; κινδύνους Thuc.
to offer, contribute, εἰς τὸ κοινόν Dem.:— to offer in sacrifice, NTest.
intr. to lead up, of a road, Xen.
to bring or carry back, Eur., etc.; ἀν. τὰς κώπας to recover the oars, at the end of the stroke, Thuc.
to bring back tidings, report, Hdt., etc.
to bring back from exile, Thuc.
to carry back, trace up oneʼs family to an ancestor, Plat.

to refer a matter to another, Hdt., etc.: to ascribe, Eur., etc.:—without acc., ἀν. εἴς τινα to appeal to another, make reference to him, Hdt., Plat.:—of things, ἀν. εἴς τι to have reference to a thing, Plat.
to bring back, restore, recover, Thuc.:—Pass. to recover oneself, come to oneself, Hdt.:—so also intr. in Act. to come to oneself, recover, Plat., etc.
to return, yield, as revenue, Xen.
to recall a likeness, Plut.

div1.head: ἀναφεύγω
div1.sense: to flee up, Xen.
to escape, Xen.
of a report, to disappear gradually, Plut.

div1.head: ἀναφής
div1.sense: not to be touched, impalpable, Plat.

div1.head: ἀναφθέγγομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to call out aloud, Plut.

div1.head: ἀναφθείρομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be undone, κατὰ τί δεῦρʼ ἀνεφθάρης; by what ill luck came you hither? Ar.

div1.head: ἀναφλεγμαίνω
div1.sense: to inflame and swell up, Plut.

div1.head: ἀναφλέγω
div1.sense: to light up, rekindle, Eur.: metaph., ἀν. ἔρωτα Plut.:—Pass. to be inflamed, excited, Anth.

div1.head: ἀνάφλεξις
div1.sense: a lighting up, Plut.

div1.head: ἀναφλύω
div1.sense: to bubble or boil up, Il.

div1.head: ἀναφοβέω
div1.sense: to frighten away, Ar.

div1.head: ἀνα-φορά
div1.sense: a carrying back, reference, Theophr., Plut.
recourse to another [in difficulty], Dem.
a means of repairing a fault or loss, a means of recovery, Eur., Plut.

div1.head: ἀναφορέω
div1.etym: Frequent. of ἀναφέρω Ι, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: ἀνάφορον
div1.sense: a pole or yoke for carrying things, Ar.

div1.head: ἀναφράζω
div1.sense: Mid. to be ware of a thing, perceive, Od.

div1.head: ἀναφρόδιτος
div1.sense: without the favour of Venus, Plut., Luc.
Lat. invenustus, without charms, Plut.

div1.head: ἀναφρονέω
div1.sense: to come back to oneʼs senses, Xen.

div1.head: ἀναφροντίζω
div1.sense: c. inf., to meditate how to do a thing, Pind.

div1.head: ἀναφυγή
div1.sense: escape from a thing, c. gen., Aesch.
a retreat, Plut.

div1.head: ἀναφύρω
div1.sense: to mix up, confound:— Pass., ἦν πάντα ἀναπεφυρμένα Hdt.
to defile, αἵματι ἀναπεφυρμένος Hdt.

div1.head: ἀναφυσάω
div1.sense: to blow up or forth, eject, of volcanoes, Plat.
metaph. in Pass. to be puffed up, Xen.

div1.head: ἀναφυσιάω
div1.sense: to blow upwards, of a dolphin, Hes.

div1.head: ἀναφύω
div1.sense: to produce again, to let grow, πώγωνα Theocr.
Pass., with aor2 act. ἀν-έφυν, pf. ἀμ-πέφῡκα, to grow up, Hdt., etc.
to grow again, of the hair, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀναφωνέω
div1.sense: to call aloud, declaim, Plut.

div1.head: ἀναφώνημα
div1.sense: a proclamation, Plut.

div1.head: ἀναφώνησις
div1.sense: an outcry, ejaculation, Plut.

div1.head: ἀναχάζω
div1.sense: to make to recoil, force back, only 3rd pl. poet. aor1 ἀνέχασσαν, Pind.
Mid: to draw back, retire, Hom.; ἐπὶ πόδα ἀναχάζεσθαι to retire slowly, of soldiers, Xen. (who also uses Act. in same sense).

div1.head: ἀναχαιτίζω
div1.sense: of a horse, to throw back the mane, rear up, Eur.: metaph. of men, to become restive, Plut.
c. acc. to rear up and throw the rider, Eur.:—metaph. to upset, Eur., Dem.
c. gen., ἀν. τῶν πραγμάτων to shake off the yoke of business, Plut.

div1.head: ἀναχάσκω
div1.etym: only in pres. and imperf., the other tenses being formed from *ἀναχαίνω
div1.sense: to open the mouth, gape wide, Ar., Luc.

div1.head: ἀναχέω
div1.sense: to pour forth.

div1.head: ἀναχνοαίνομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to get the first down (χνόος), Ar.

div1.head: ἀναχορεύω
div1.sense: to begin a choral dance, ἀν. θίασον Eur.
to celebrate in the chorus, Βάκχιον Eur.
οὐκ ἄν με ἀνεχόρευʼ Ἐρινύσι would not scare me away by a band of Furies, Eur.
intr. to dance for joy, Eur.

div1.head: ἀνάχυσις
div1.sense: effusion: metaph. excess, NTest.

div1.head: ἀναχωνεύω
div1.sense: to fuse again, Strab.

div1.head: ἀναχώννυμι
div1.sense: to heap up into a mound, Anth.

div1.head: ἀναχωρέω
div1.sense: to go back, Hom.: esp. to retire or withdraw from battle, Hom., Hdt., Attic
to retire from a place, c. gen., Od.
to come back or revert to the rightful owner, ἐς τὸν παῖδα Hdt.
. to withdraw from the world, Ar., Plat.

div1.head: ἀναχώρησις
div1.sense: a drawing back, retiring, retreating, Hdt., Thuc.
a means or place of retreat, refuge, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀναχωρητέος
div1.sense: one must withdraw, retreat, Plat.

div1.head: ἀναχωρίζω
div1.sense: to make to go back or retire, Xen.

div1.head: ἀναψάω
div1.sense: to wipe up:— Mid. to wipe up for oneself, Plut.

div1.head: ἀναψηφίζω
div1.sense: to put to the vote again, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀναψυχή
div1.sense: a cooling, refreshing: relief, recovery, respite, Plat.: from a thing, c. gen., Eur.

div1.head: ἀναψύχω
div1.sense: to cool, to revive by fresh air, to refresh, Hom., Eur.:—Pass. to be revived, refreshed, Il.
ναῦς ἀν. to let the ships rest and get dry, relieve them, Hdt., Xen.; so, ἀν. τὸν ἱδρῶτα to let it dry off, Plut.
metaph. c. gen., ἀν. πόνων τινα to give him relief from toil, Eur.
intr. in Act. to recover oneself, revive, Anth., Babr.

div1.head: ἁνδάνω
div1.sense: to please, delight, gratify, c. dat. pers., Hom., etc.:—absol., ἑᾱδότα μῦθον a pleasing speech, Hom.
ἁνδάνει, Lat. placet, expressing opinion, οὔ σφι ἥνδανε ταῦτα Hdt.; c. inf., τοῖσι μὲν ἕαδε βοηθέειν it was their pleasure to assist, Hdt.:—impers., ἐπεί νύ τοι εὔαδεν οὕτως (sc. ποιεῖν) Hom.

div1.head: ἄνδηρον
div1.sense: a raised border, flower-bed, Theocr., Anth.:— any raised bank, a dyke, Mosch.

div1.head: ἄνδιχα
div1.sense: asunder, in twain, Il.

div1.head: ἀνδραγαθέω
div1.sense: = ἀνδραγαθίζομαι:— Pass., ἠνδραγαθημένα brave deeds, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνδραγάθημα
div1.sense: a brave deed, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνδραγαθία
div1.sense: bravery, manly virtue, the character of a brave honest man, Hdt., Ar.

div1.head: ἀνδραγαθίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to act bravely, honestly, play the honest man, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀνδράγρια
div1.sense: the spoils of a slain enemy, Il.

div1.head: ἀνδρακάς
div1.sense: man by man, = κατʼ ἄνδρα, Od.

div1.head: ἀνδραποδίζω
div1.etym: the middle future form ἀνδραποδιεῦμαι is used in a passive sense.
div1.sense: to reduce to slavery, enslave, esp. to sell the free men of a conquered place into slavery, Hdt., Thuc., etc.:—Pass. to be sold into slavery, Hdt., Xen., etc.:—the Mid. was also used in act. sense, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀνδραποδισμός
div1.sense: a selling free men into slavery, enslaving, Thuc., etc.

div1.head: ἀνδραποδιστής
div1.sense: a slave-dealer, kidnapper, Ar., Plat.; ἀνδρ. ἑαυτοῦ one who sells his own independence, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνδραποδοκάπηλος
div1.sense: a slave-dealer, Luc.

div1.head: ἀνδράποδον
div1.sense: one taken in war and sold as a slave, a captive, Il., Hdt., Attic
generally, a slave, a slavish low fellow, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: ἀνδραποδώδης
div1.sense: slavish, servile, abject, Plat., Xen. adv. -δῶς, Plat.

div1.head: ἀνδράριον
div1.sense: a manikin, Ar.

div1.head: ἀνδραχθής
div1.sense: loading a man, as much as a man can carry, Od.

div1.head: ἀνδρεῖα
div1.sense: the public meals of the Cretans, also the older name for the Spartan φειδίτια, Alcman, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνδρεία
div1.sense: manliness, manhood, manly spirit, Lat. virtus, Trag., etc.

div1.head: ἀνδρείκελον
div1.sense: an image of a man, Plat.
a flesh-coloured pigment, Plat.

div1.head: ἀνδρείκελος
div1.sense: like a man, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνδρεῖος
div1.sense: of or for a man, Aesch., etc.; for αὐλοὶ ἀνδρεῖοι, v. αὐλός.
manly, masculine, Hdt., Attic; in bad sense, stubborn, Luc.:—neut. τὸ ἀνδρεῖον, by crasis τἀνδρεῖον, ἀνδρεία, Eur., Thuc.
of things, strong, vigorous, Ar.

div1.head: ἀνδρειότης
div1.sense: = ἀνδρεία, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνδρειφόντης
div1.sense: man-slaying, Il.

div1.head: ἀνδρηλατέω
div1.sense: to banish from house and home, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: ἀνδρηλάτης
div1.sense: he that drives one from home, the avenger of blood, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀνδριαντίσκος
div1.sense: a puppet, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνδριαντοποιέω
div1.sense: to make statues, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνδριαντοποιΐα
div1.sense: the sculptorʼs art, statuary, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: ἀνδριαντοποιός
div1.sense: a statue-maker, statuary, sculptor, Pind., Plat.

div1.head: ἀνδριάς
div1.sense: the image of a man, a statue, Hdt., Attic

div1.head: ἀνδρίζω
div1.sense: to make a man of: Pass. or Mid. to come to manhood, behave like a man, play the man, Plat.

div1.head: ἀνδρικός
div1.sense: of or for a man, masculine, manly, Lat. virilis, Plat.; ἀνδρ. ἱδρώς the sweat of manly toil, Ar.:—adv. -κῶς, like a man, comp. -ώτερον, Sup. -ώτατα, Plat.
composed of men, χορός Xen.

div1.head: ἀνδρίον
div1.sense: a manikin, Ar., Theocr.

div1.head: ἀνδριστέος
div1.sense: one must play the man, Plat.

div1.head: ἀνδριστί
div1.sense: like a man, like men, Ar., Theocr.

div1.head: ἀνδροβόρος
div1.sense: man-devouring, Anth.

div1.head: ἀνδρόβουλος
div1.sense: of manly counsel, man-minded, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀνδροβρώς
div1.sense: man-eating, Eur.

div1.head: ἀνδρογόνος
div1.sense: begetting males, Hes.

div1.head: ἀνδρόγυνος
div1.sense: a man-woman, hermaphrodite, Plat.
a womanish man, effeminate person, Hdt.
as adj. common to men and women, Anth.

div1.head: ἀνδροδάϊκτος
div1.sense: man-slaying, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀνδροδάμας
div1.sense: man-taming, Pind.

div1.head: ἀνδροθέα
div1.sense: the man-goddess, i. e. Athena, Anth.

div1.head: ἀνδρόθεν
div1.sense: from a man or men, Anth.

div1.head: ἀνδροθνής
div1.sense: murderous, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀνδροκμής
div1.sense: man-wearying, Aesch.: man-slaying, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀνδρόκμητος
div1.sense: wrought by menʼs hands, Il.

div1.head: ἀνδροκτασία
div1.sense: slaughter of men in battle, Il., Aesch.

div1.head: ἀνδροκτονέω
div1.sense: to slay men, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀνδροκτόνος
div1.sense: man-slaying, murdering, Hdt., Eur.

div1.head: ἀνδρολέτειρα
div1.sense: a murderess, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀνδροληψία
div1.sense: seizure of men guilty of murdering a citizen abroad, Lex. ap. Dem.

div1.head: ἀνδρομάχος
div1.sense: fighting with men, Anth.; fem. ἀνδρομάχη Anth.

div1.head: ἀνδρόμεος
div1.sense: of man or men, human, κρέα Hom.; ψωμοὶ ἀνδρ. goblets of manʼs flesh, Od.

div1.head: ἀνδρομήκης
div1.sense: of a manʼs height, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνδρόπαις
div1.sense: a man-boy, i. e. a youth near manhood, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀνδροπλήθεια
div1.sense: a multitude of men, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀνδρόσινις
div1.sense: hurtful to men, Anth.

div1.head: ἀνδροσφαγεῖον
div1.sense: a slaughter-house of men, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀνδρόσφιγξ
div1.sense: a man-sphinx, sphinx with the bust of a man, not (as usually) of a woman, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀνδρότης
div1.sense: manliness, manhood, courage, = ἀνδρεία: cf. ἁδροτής.

div1.head: ἀνδροτυχής
div1.sense: getting a husband, ἀνδρ. βίοτος wedded life, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀνδροφαγέω
div1.sense: to eat men, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀνδροφάγος
div1.sense: eating men, Od., Hdt.

div1.head: ἀνδρόφθορος
div1.sense: ἀνδρόφθορον αἷμα the blood of a slain man, Soph.

div1.head: ἀνδροφθόρος
div1.sense: man-destroying, murderous, Soph.

div1.head: ἀνδροφονία
div1.sense: slaughter of men, Arist., Plut.

div1.head: ἀνδροφόνος
div1.sense: man-slaying, Il.
of women, murdering husbands, Pind.
as law-term, one convicted of manslaughter, a homicide, Plat., Dem.

div1.head: ἀνδρόω
div1.sense: to rear up into manhood, Anth.: —Pass. to become a man, reach manhood, Hdt., Eur.
in Pass. also of a woman, to be of marriageable age, Eur.

div1.head: ἀνδρώδης
div1.sense: like a man, manly, Isocr. adv., -δῶς, Sup. -δέστατα, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνδρών
div1.sense: the menʼs apartment in a house, the banqueting hall, etc., Hdt., Aesch., etc.; Ionic ἀνδρεών, Hdt.; Epic -ειών, Anth.:—also ἀνδρωνῖτις, ιδος, ἡ Xen.

div1.head: ἀνέβραχε
div1.sense: clashed or rung loudly, of armour, Il.; creaked or grated loudly, of a door, Od.

div1.head: ἀνέγγυος
div1.sense: not accredited, Plat.; of a woman, unwedded, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνεγείρω
div1.sense: to wake up, rouse, ἐξ ὕπνου, ἐκ λεχέων Hom.:—Pass., Eur., Xen.
metaph. to wake up, raise, Pind.
metaph. also to rouse, encourage, Od.
of buildings, to raise, Anth.

div1.head: ἀνεγέρμων
div1.sense: wakeful, Anth.

div1.head: ἀνέγκλητος
div1.sense: not accused, without reproach, void of offence, Xen., etc.:—adv. -τως, Dem.

div1.head: ἀνέδην
div1.sense: let loose, freely, without restraint, Plat., Dem.:— remissly, carelessly, Soph.
without more ado, absolutely, Plat.

div1.head: ἀνεθέλητος
div1.sense: unwished for, unwelcome, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀνειλείθυια
div1.sense: without the aid of Eileithuia, Eur.

div1.head: ἀνειλέω
div1.sense: to roll up together:— Pass. to crowd or throng together, Thuc.
ἀνείλω, Pass. to shrink up or back, Plat.

div1.head: ἀνειμένος
div1.etym: part. perf. pass. of ἀνίημι, used as adj.
div1.sense: let go free, released from labour, of animals dedicated to the gods, Soph.: metaph., ἀν. ἔς τι devoted to a thing, Hdt.
remiss, slack, unconstrained, Thuc.; ἐν τῶι ἀνειμένωι τῆς γνώμης when their minds are unstrung, Thuc.:—adv. ἀνειμένως, at ease, carelessly, without restraint, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: ἄνειμι
div1.etym: εἶμι, ibo, in Attic serving as fut. to ἀνέρχομαι.
div1.sense: to go up, Hom., etc.; ἅμʼ ἠελίωι ἀνιόντι at sun- rise, Il.
to sail up, i. e. out to sea, Od.
to go up inland, esp. into Central Asia, Plat.
to approach, esp. as a suppliant, Il.
to go back, go home, return, Od., Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἀνείμων
div1.sense: without clothing, unclad, Od.

div1.head: ἀνειπεῖν
div1.etym: aor2 with no pres. in use, ἀναγορεύω being used instead.
div1.sense: to say aloud, announce, proclaim, Pind., Xen.: —c. acc. et inf. to make proclamation that . . , Ar., Thuc.:—in the Athen. assemblies, ἀνεῖπεν ὁ κῆρυξ Thuc., etc.:—Pass. to be proclaimed, ἀναρρηθέντος τοῦ στεφάνου when the crown was proclaimed, Dem.
to call upon, invoke, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνείργω
div1.sense: to keep back, restrain, Hom., Xen.

div1.head: ἀνείρω
div1.sense: to fasten on or to, to string, Hdt.; ἀν. στεφάνους to twine or wreathe them, Ar.

div1.head: ἀνείσοδος
div1.sense: without entrance or access, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνεισφορία
div1.sense: exemption from the εἰσφορά, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνείσφορος
div1.sense: exempt from the εἰσφορά, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνέκαθεν
div1.sense: adv. of Place, from above, Hdt., Aesch.
of Time, from the first, by origin, Hdt.; so with Art., τὸ ἀνέκαθεν Hdt.

div1.head: ἀνεκάς
div1.sense: upwards, Lat. sursum, Pind., Attic

div1.head: ἀνέκβατος
div1.sense: without outlet, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀνεκδιήγητος
div1.sense: ineffable, NTest.

div1.head: ἀνέκδοτος
div1.sense: not given in marriage, Dem., etc.

div1.head: ἀνέκδρομος
div1.sense: inevitable, Anth.

div1.head: ἀνεκλάλητος
div1.sense: unspeakable, NTest.

div1.head: ἀνεκπίμπλημι
div1.sense: to fill up or again, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνέκπληκτος
div1.sense: undaunted, intrepid, Plat.:— τὸ ἀνέκπληκτον intrepidity, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνεκτέος
div1.sense: to be borne, Soph.

div1.head: ἀνεκτός
div1.sense: bearable, sufferable, tolerable, mostly with a negat., Il., Attic
without a negat. that can be endured, Od., Thuc.
adv. -τως, Hom.; οὐκ ἀνεκτῶς ἔχει it is not to be borne, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνέλεγκτος
div1.sense: not cross-questioned, safe from being questioned, Thuc.: unconvicted, Thuc.
not refuted, irrefutable, Plat.:—adv. -τως, without refutation, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνελέγχω
div1.sense: to convince or convict utterly, Eur.

div1.head: ἀνελεήμων
div1.sense: merciless, without mercy, NTest.

div1.head: ἀνέλεος
div1.sense: unmerciful, NTest.

div1.head: ἀνελευθερία
div1.sense: illiberality, Plat.

div1.head: ἀνελεύθερος
div1.sense: not fit for a free man, Aesch., Arist.
illiberal, servile, Plat., etc.
in money matters, niggardly, stingy, Ar.
adv. -ρως, meanly, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνέλιγμα
div1.sense: anything rolled up, a ringlet, Anth.

div1.head: ἀνέλιξις
div1.sense: an unfolding, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνελίσσω
div1.sense: to unroll a book written on a roll, i. e. to unfold, read, interpret, Xen.; ἀν. βίον to pass oneʼs whole life, Plut.
to cause to move backward, πόδα Eur.
to cause to revolve:— Pass. to revolve, move glibly, Ar.

div1.head: ἀνέλκω
div1.sense: to draw up, τάλαντα ἀνέλκει holds them up (in weighing), Il.; ἀνελκύσαι ναῦς to haul them up high and dry, Hdt., Thuc.
to drag up, drag into open court or into the witness-box, Ar.:— Mid., ἀνέλκεσθαι τρίχας to tear oneʼs own hair, Il.
to draw a bow, in act to shoot, Hom.:—Mid., ἔγχος ἀνελκόμενος drawing back his spear [out of the corpse], Od.

div1.head: ἄνελπις
div1.sense: without hope, hopeless, Eur.

div1.head: ἀνέλπιστος
div1.sense: unhoped for, unlooked for, Trag., etc.; τὸ ἀνέλπιστον τοῦ βεβαίου the hopelessness of security, Thuc.
act.,
of persons, having no hope, hopeless, Theocr.; c. inf. having no hope or not expecting that . . , Thuc.
of things or conditions, leaving no hope, hopeless, desperate, Soph., Thuc.; τὸ ἀνέλπιστον despair, Thuc.:—comp. -ότερος more desperate, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀνέμβατος
div1.sense: inaccessible, Babr., Plut.
act. not going to or visiting, Anth.

div1.head: ἀνεμέσητος
div1.sense: free from blame, without offence, Plat.

div1.head: ἀνέμητος
div1.sense: not distributed, Dem.
act. having no share, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνεμίζομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be driven with the wind, NTest.

div1.head: ἀνεμόδρομος
div1.sense: running with the wind, Luc.

div1.head: ἀναμολεῖν
div1.sense: to go through, c. acc., Eur.

div1.head: ἀνεμοσκεπής
div1.sense: sheltering from the wind, Il.

div1.head: ἄνεμος
div1.sense: wind, Hom., etc.; ἀνέμου κατιόντος a squall having come on, Thuc.; ἄν. κατὰ βορέαν ἑστηκώς the wind being settled in the north, Thuc.; ἀνέμοις φέρεσθαι παραδοῦναί τι to cast a thing to the winds, Lat. ventis tradere, Eur.:—Hom. and Hes. mention only four winds, Boreas, Eurus, Notus (or Argestes), Zephyrus; Arist. gives twelve, which served as points of the compass.

div1.head: ἀνεμοσφάραγος
div1.sense: echoing to the wind, Pind.

div1.head: ἀνεμοτρεφής
div1.sense: fed by the wind, of a wave, Il.; ἔγχος ἀνεμ. a spear from a tree reared by the wind, i. e. made tough by battling with the wind, Il.

div1.head: ἀνεμόομαι
div1.sense: to expose to the wind:— Pass., of the sea, to be raised by the wind, Anth.

div1.head: ἀνέμπληκτος
div1.sense: intrepid: in adv. -τως, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνεμπόδιστος
div1.sense: unembarrassed, Arist.

div1.head: ἀνεμώκης
div1.sense: swift as the wind, Eur., Ar.

div1.head: ἀνεμώλιος
div1.sense: windy: metaph., ἀνεμώλια βάζειν to talk words of wind, Hom.; οἱ δʼ αὖτʼ ἀνεμώλιοι are like the winds, i. e. good for naught, Il.; τί νυ τόξον ἔχεις ἀνεμώλιον; why bear thy bow in vain? Il.; ἀνεμώλιος empty fool! Anth.

div1.head: ἀνεμώνη
div1.sense: the wind-flower, anemone, Bion.

div1.head: ἀνενδεής
div1.sense: in want of naught, Anth.

div1.head: ἀνένδεκτος
div1.sense: impossible, NTest.

div1.head: ἀνενδοίαστος
div1.sense: indubitable, Luc.

div1.head: ἀνεξάλειπτος
div1.sense: indelible, Isocr., Plut.

div1.head: ἀνεξέλεγκτος
div1.sense: unquestioned, impossible to be questioned or refuted, of statements or arguments, Thuc.; ἀν. ἔχει τὸ ἀνδρεῖον leaves their courage without proof, Thuc.
of persons, not to be convicted, irreproachable, Xen., etc.

div1.head: ἀνεξέργαστος
div1.sense: unfinished, Luc.

div1.head: ἀνεξέταστος
div1.sense: not inquired into or examined, Dem.
uninquiring, Plat.

div1.head: ἀνεξεύρετος
div1.sense: not to be found out, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀνεξίκακος
div1.sense: enduring evil, forbearing, long-suffering, NTest., Luc.

div1.head: ἀνεξιχνίαστος
div1.sense: not to be traced, unsearchable, inscrutable, NTest.

div1.head: ἀνέξοδος
div1.sense: with no outlet, allowing no return, Lat. irremeabilis, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀνέορτος
div1.sense: without festival, c. gen., ἀν. ἱερῶν without share in festal rites, Eur.

div1.head: ἀνεπαίσθητος
div1.sense: unperceived, imperceptible, Plut., Luc.

div1.head: ἀνεπαίσχυντος
div1.sense: having no cause for shame, NTest.

div1.head: ἀνέπαφος
div1.sense: untouched, ἀν. παρέχειν τι rem integram praestare, Dem.

div1.head: ἀνεπαχθής
div1.sense: not burdensome, without offence, Plut., Luc.:—adv. -θῶς, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀνεπιβούλευτος
div1.sense: without plots, τὸ ἀνεπιβούλευτον the absence of intrigue, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀνεπίγραφος
div1.sense: without title or inscription: metaph. without noticeable features, Luc.

div1.head: ἀνεπίδικος
div1.sense: not disputed by legal process, undisputed, Dem.

div1.head: ἀνεπιείκεια
div1.sense: unfairness, unkindness, Dem.

div1.head: ἀνεπιεικής
div1.sense: unreasonable, unfair, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀνεπίκλητος
div1.sense: unaccused, unblamed, Xen.
without preferring any charge:— adv. -τως, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀνεπίληπτος
div1.sense: not open to attack, not censured, blameless, Eur., Thuc.: adv. -τως, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνεπίμικτος
div1.sense: not mixing with others, unsocial, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνεπίξεστος
div1.sense: not polished or finished, Hes.

div1.head: ἀνεπίπλεκτος
div1.sense: without connexion with others, isolated, Strab.

div1.head: ἀνεπίρρεκτος
div1.sense: not dedicated.

div1.head: ἀνεπίσκεπτος
div1.sense: inattentive, inconsiderate: adv. -τως, Hdt.
pass. not examined, unregarded, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνεπιστημοσύνη
div1.sense: want of knowledge, ignorance, unskilfulness, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀνεπιστήμων
div1.sense: not knowing, ignorant, unskilful, Hdt., Thuc.; ναῦς ἀνεπιστήμονες ships with unskilful crews, Thuc.;—c. gen. rei, unskilled in a thing, Plat.; c. inf. not knowing how to do a thing, Xen.
without knowledge, unintelligent: comp. ἀνεπιστημονέστερος less intelligent, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀνεπίτακτος
div1.sense: subject to no control, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀνεπιτήδειος
div1.sense: unserviceable, unfit, Xen., Plat., etc.:— mischievous, prejudicial, hurtful, Hdt., Thuc.
unkind, unfriendly, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: ἀνεπιτήδευτος
div1.sense: made without care or design, simple, artless, Luc.
unpractised, untried, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνεπιτίμητος
div1.sense: not to be censured, τινος for a thing, Dem.

div1.head: ἀνεπίφθονος
div1.sense: without reproach, Soph.; ἀν. ἐστι πᾶσιν ʼtis no reproach to any one, Thuc.; ἀνεπιφθονώτατον least invidious, Dem. adv. -νως so as not to create odium, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀνέραμαι
div1.sense: to love again, love anew, c. gen., Andoc., Xen.

div1.head: ἀνέραστος
div1.sense: not loved, Luc.
act. not loving, Anth.

div1.head: ἀνέργαστος
div1.sense: unwrought, untilled, Luc.

div1.head: ἄνεργος
div1.sense: not done, Eur.

div1.head: ἀνερεθίζω
div1.sense: to stir up, excite, Plut.:—Pass. to be in a state of excitement, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: ἀνερείπομαι
div1.sense: Dep., only used in aor1, to snatch up and carry off, ἀνηρείψαντο Hom.; ἀνερειψαμένη Hes.

div1.head: ἀνερευνάω
div1.sense: to examine closely, investigate, Plat.

div1.head: ἀνερεύνητος
div1.sense: not investigated, Plat.
that cannot be found out, inscrutable, Eur.

div1.head: ἀνείρομαι
div1.sense: c. acc. pers. to enquire of, question, Od., Soph.
c. acc. rei, to ask about, Od., Plat.
c. dupl. acc. to ask a person about a thing, Il., Soph.

div1.head: ἀνέρπω
div1.sense: to creep up or upwards, Ar., Luc.

div1.head: ἀνέρρω
div1.sense: to go quite away: ἄνερρε away with you, Lat. abi in malam rem, Eur.

div1.head: ἀνερυθριάω
div1.sense: to begin to blush, blush up, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνερύω
div1.sense: to draw up, haul up sails, Od.: to haul ships up on land, Hdt.: —Mid. to deliver, Anth.

div1.head: ἀνέρχομαι
div1.sense: to go up, Od., Attic: absol. to mount the tribune, Plut.:— to go up from the coast inland, Od.:— to come up from the nether world, Theogn., Soph.
of trees, to grow up, shoot up, Od.: of the sun, to rise, Aesch.:—metaph., ὄλβος ἀν. Eur.
to go or come back, go or come home again, return, Hom.
to come back to a point, recur, Eur., Plat.
νόμος εἴς σʼ ἀνελθών a law brought home or having relation to you, Eur.

div1.head: ἀνερωτάω
div1.sense: c. acc. pers. to ask or inquire of, question, Od., Plat.
c. acc. rei, to ask about, inquire into, Plat.; so, ἀν. περί τινος Hdt.
c. dupl. acc. to question a person about a thing, ask it of him, Eur., Ar.

div1.head: ἄνεσις
div1.sense: a loosening, relaxing of strings, Plat., etc.
metaph. remission, abatement, κακῶν Hdt.; ἄν. φόρων, τελῶν remission of tribute, taxes, Plut.
relaxation, recreation, Plat., Arist.
a letting loose, indulgence, license, Plat., Arist.

div1.head: ἀνέστιος
div1.sense: without hearth and home, homeless, Il., Ar.

div1.head: ἀνετάζω
div1.sense: to examine closely, NTest.

div1.head: ἀνετέος
div1.sense: one must dismiss, Plat.

div1.head: ἄνετος
div1.sense: relaxed, slack, loose, Luc.

div1.head: ἄνευθε
div1.sense: prep. c. gen., without, Hom.
away from, Il.
adv. far away, distant, Hom.

div1.head: ἀνεύθετος
div1.sense: inconvenient, NTest.

div1.head: ἀνεύθυνος
div1.sense: not having to render an account, irresponsible, Hdt., Thuc.
guiltless, because such a one is not liable to trial, Luc.; c. gen. guiltless of . . , Luc.

div1.head: ἄνευκτος
div1.sense: not wishing, not praying, Anth.

div1.head: ἄνευ
div1.sense: prep. c. gen. without, οὐκ ἄνευ θεῶν, Lat. non sine Diis, not without divine aid, Od.; ἄνευ ἐμέθεν without my knowledge, Il.; ἄνευ πολιτῶν without their consent, Aesch.
away from, far from, ἄνευ δηΐων Il.
in Prose, except, besides, like χωρίς, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνεύρεσις
div1.sense: a discovery, Eur., Plut.

div1.head: ἀνευρίσκω
div1.sense: to find out, make out, discover, Hdt., Attic: —Pass. to be found out or discovered, Thuc.; c. part. to be discovered to be . . , Hdt.

div1.head: ἀνευφημέω
div1.sense: to shout εὐφήμει or εὐφημεῖτε: as this was mainly done on sorrowful occasions, to cry aloud, shriek, Eur., etc.; ἀνευφήμησεν οἰμωγῆι Soph.

div1.head: ἀνέφελος
div1.sense: unclouded, cloudless, Od.: metaph. not to be veiled or concealed, Soph.

div1.head: ἀνεχέγγυος
div1.sense: not giving surety or confidence, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀνέχω
div1.sense: trans. to hold up oneʼs hands in fight, Od.; also in token of defeat, Theocr.:— to lift up the hands in prayer, Il., etc.
ἀν. φλόγα to hold up a torch at weddings, Eur.; hence ἄνεχε, πάρεχε (sc. τὸ φῶς), i. e. make ready, go on, Eur.; also, ἀν. φῶς σωτήριον to hold up a signal fire, Thuc.
to lift up, exalt, τινά Pind.
metaph. to uphold, maintain, Od., Thuc.; ἀνέχων λέκτρα remaining constant to the bed, Eur.; so, ἀν. κισσόν Soph.
to put forth, πτόρθους Eur.
to hold back, Il.; ἀν. Σικελίαν μὴ ὑπό τινα εἶναι to keep it from being subject, Thuc.
intr. to rise up, rise, emerge from water, Od., Hdt.:—esp. in form ἀνίσχω, of the sun, Hdt., Xen.
of events, to arise, happen, Hdt.
to appear, shew oneself, Soph.
to project, Il.; of a headland, to jut out, Hdt., Thuc.
to hold on, keep doing, c. part., Thuc.; στέρξας ἀνέχει is constant in his love, Soph.; c. acc. et inf. to aver constantly that . . , Soph.
to hold up, cease, Theogn.:—generally, to wait, delay, Thuc.
c. gen. to cease from suffering, get rest from pain, Soph.
Mid. to hold up what is oneʼs own, ἔγχος, χεῖρας Il.; hence ἀνασχόμενος absol. (sub. ἔγχος etc.), Il.
to hold oneself up, bear up, hold out, Il.; aor2 imperat. ἀνάσχεο, Epic ἄνσχεο, be of good courage, Il.:—in part., ἀνεχόμενοι with patience, Hdt.
c. acc. to bear up against, Il., Hdt., Attic:— so, c. gen., Od., Plat.
the dependent clause is added in part., οὔ σε ἀνέξομαι ἄλγεʼ ἔχοντα I will not suffer thee to have . . , Il., etc.; οὐ σῖγʼ ἀνέχει (sc. ὤν); Soph.
c. inf. to suffer, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀνεψιαδοῦς
div1.sense: a first-cousinʼs son, or second cousin, Dem.

div1.head: ἀνεψιός
div1.etym: From a_euphon or a_copul, and !νεπ, whence also Lat. nepos, neptis.
div1.sense: a first-cousin, cousin, Il., Hdt., Attic
a nephew, Hdt.
div1.etym: When the ult. is long, Hom. lengthens also the penult., ἀνεψῑοῦ κταμένοιο.

div1.head: ἄνεω
div1.sense: without a sound, in silence, in Od. certainly an Adv.; in other places it may be nom. pl. ἄνεωι, from ἄνεως ἄν-αυος

div1.head: ἀνηβάω
div1.sense: to grow young again, Theogn., Eur., etc.

div1.head: ἀνηβητήριος
div1.sense: returning as in youth, Eur.

div1.head: ἄνηβος
div1.sense: not yet come to manʼs estate, beardless, Plat., Theocr.

div1.head: ἀνηγεμόνευτος
div1.sense: without leader, Luc.

div1.head: ἀνηγέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to tell as in a narrative, relate, recount, Pind., Hdt.
intr. to advance, Pind.

div1.head: ἀνήδυντος
div1.sense: not sweetened or seasoned, Arist.: unpleasant, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνήθινος
div1.sense: made of anise or dill, Theocr.

div1.head: ἄνηθον
div1.sense: anise, dill, Ar., Theocr.; Ionic ἄννησον or ἄνησον Hdt.; Aeolic ἄννητον, or ἄνητον, Sapph..

div1.head: ἀνήκεστος
div1.sense: not to be healed, incurable, irreparable, fatal, Il., Hdt., Attic; ἀνήκεστα ποιεῖν τινα to do one irreparable injuries, Xen.; ἀνήκεστα πάσχειν Thuc.
of persons, implacable, Xen.
act. damaging beyond remedy, deadly, Soph.:—adv., ἀνηκέστως διατιθέναι to treat with barbarous cruelty, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀνήκοος
div1.sense: without hearing, of the dead, Mosch.
c. gen. not hearing a thing, never having heard it, ignorant of it, Xen., etc.:—absol., σκαιὸς καὶ ἀν. ignorant, Dem.

div1.head: ἀνηκουστέω
div1.sense: to be unwilling to hear, to disobey, c. gen., Il., Aesch., Thuc.; c. dat., Hdt.; absol., Hdt.

div1.head: ἀνήκουστος
div1.sense: unheard of, Lat. inauditus, ἤκουσʼ ἀνήκουστα Soph.
act. not willing to hear: τὸ ἀνήκουστον disobedience, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνήκω
div1.sense: to have come up to a point, reach up to, of persons, αἱμασιὴν ἀνήκουσαν ἀνδρὶ ἐς τὸν ὀμφαλόν a wall reaching up to a manʼs middle, Hdt.; ἀν. ἐς τὰ μέγιστα to reach up to the highest point, Hdt.

of things, τοῦτο ἐς οὐδὲν ἀν. amounts to nothing, Hdt.; αἱ πολλαὶ ζημίαι ἐς τὸν θάνατον ἀν. have gone as far as death, Thuc.; ἀν. ἔς σε ἔχειν it has come to you to have, has become yours to have, Hdt.
to appertain, be fit or proper, NTest.; τὸ ἀνῆκον what is fit and proper, NTest.

div1.head: ἀνηλεής
div1.sense: without pity, unmerciful:— adv. -εῶς, Andoc.

div1.head: ἀνήλιος
div1.sense: without sun, sunless, Trag.

div1.head: ἀνήλιπος
div1.sense: unshod, barefoot, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀνήμελκτος
div1.sense: unmilked, Od.

div1.head: ἀνήμερος
div1.sense: not tame, wild, savage, of persons and countries, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀνήνεμος
div1.sense: without wind, ἀνήνεμος χειμώνων without the blast of storms, Soph.

div1.head: ἀνήνοθε
div1.etym: Formed as if from *ἀνέθω (ἀνά) to rise up; cf. ἐνήνοθε.
div1.sense: αἷμα ἀνήνοθεν ἐξ ὠτειλῆς blood gushed forth from the wound, Il.; κνίση ἀνήνοθεν the savour mounted up, Od.

div1.head: ἀνήνυστος
div1.sense: ineffectual, Od.

div1.head: ἀνήνυτος
div1.sense: = ἀνήνυστος, Soph., Plat.
endless, Plat.

div1.head: ἀνήνωρ
div1.sense: unmanly, Od., Hes.

div1.head: ἀνηπύω
div1.sense: to cry aloud, roar, Mosch.

div1.head: ἄνη
div1.sense: fulfilment, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀνήροτος
div1.sense: unploughed, untilled, Od., Aesch.

div1.head: ἀνήρ
div1.sense: a man, Lat. vir (not homo):
a man, opp. to a woman, Hom., etc.
a man, opp. to a god, πατὴρ ἀνδρῶν τε θεῶν τε Hom.
a man, opp. to a youth, a man in the prime of life, Hom., etc.; εἰς ἄνδρας ἐγγράφεσθαι to be enrolled among the men, Dem.
a man emphatically, a man indeed, ἀνέρες ἔστε, φίλοι Il.; πολλοὶ μὲν ἄνθρωποι, ὀλίγοι δὲ ἄνδρες many human beings, but few men, Hdt.
a man, opp. to his wife, a husband, Hom., etc.; αἰγῶν ἄνερ, Virgilʼs vir gregis, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀνήφαιστος
div1.sense: without real fire, πῦρ ἀνήφαιστον, i. e. the fire of discord, Eur.

div1.head: ἀνθαιρέομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:— to choose one person or thing instead of another, τινά (or τί) τινος Eur.; to prefer, choose rather, Eur.
to dispute, lay claim to, τι Eur.

div1.head: ἀνθαλίσκομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be captured in turn, ἁλόντες αὖθις ἀνθαλοῖεν ἄν Aesch.

div1.head: ἀνθαμιλλάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to vie one with another, to race one another, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνθάμιλλος
div1.sense: vying with, rivalling, Eur.

div1.head: ἀνθάπτομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to lay hold of in turn, c. gen., Hdt., Eur.
simply to lay hold of, grapple with, engage in, c. gen., Hdt., Thuc.: generally, to reach, attain, τερμόνων Eur.
to lay hold of, attack, πλευμόνων, φρενῶν, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: ἄνθειον
div1.sense: a flower, blossom, Ar.

div1.head: ἀνθεκτέος
div1.sense: one must cleave to, c. gen., Plat.; so in pl. ἀνθεκτέα, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀνθέλκω
div1.sense: to draw or pull against, Thuc.; ἀνθ. ἀλλήλαις to pull against one another, Plat.

div1.head: ἀνθέμιον
div1.sense: ἀνθέμιον ἐστιγμένος tattooed with flowers, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνθεμόεις
div1.sense: flowery, of meadows, Il.
of works in metal, bright, burnished, or wrought with flowers, Hom.; of tapestry, flowered, Anth.

div1.head: ἄνθεμον
div1.sense: ἄνθεμα χρυσοῦ, i. e. the costliest gold, Pind.

div1.head: ἀνθεμόρρυτος
div1.sense: flowing from flowers, of honey, Eur.

div1.head: ἀνθεμουργός
div1.sense: working in flowers, of bees, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀνθεμώδης
div1.sense: flowery, blooming, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: ἀνθερεών
div1.sense: the chin or part on which the beard grew, Lat. mentum, Il.

div1.head: ἀνθέριξ
div1.sense: the beard of an ear of corn, the ear itself, Lat. spica, Il.
= the stalk of asphodel, Hdt., Theocr.

div1.head: Ἀνθεστήρια
div1.sense: the feast of flowers, i.e. the three daysʼ festival of Dionysus at Athens, in the month Anthesterion.

div1.head: Ἀνθεστηριών
div1.sense: the month Anthesterion, eighth of the Attic year, answering to the end of February and the beginning of March.

div1.head: ἀνθεστιάω
div1.sense: to entertain in return or mutually, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνθεσφόρος
div1.sense: bearing flowers, flowering, Eur.

div1.head: ἀνθέω
div1.sense: to blossom, bloom, of the youthful beard, Od.; of flowers and plants, Hes., etc.
metaph.,
to be bright with colour, ἀνθεῖν φοινικίσι Xen.
to be in bloom, Pind.; ἐν ὥραι, ἐφʼ ὥραι ἀνθεῖν to be in the bloom of youth, Plat.
to flourish in wealth and prosperity, Hes., Hdt., Attic; c. dat., ἀνθ. ἀνδράσι to abound in men, Hdt.
to be at the height or pitch, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: ἄνθη
div1.sense: full bloom, Plat.

div1.head: ἀνθηρός
div1.sense: flowering, blooming, Ar.
metaph. blooming, fresh, Eur., Xen.
ἀνθηρὸν μένος rage bursting into flower, i. e. at its height, Soph.
bright-coloured, bright, Eur.; τὸ ἀνθ. brightness, Luc.

div1.head: ἀνθησσάομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to give way in turn, τινί Thuc.

div1.head: ἀνθίζω
div1.sense: to strew or deck with flowers, Eur.
to dye with bright colour: Pass., Hdt.; metaph., ἠνθισμένος dyed, disguised, Soph.

div1.head: ἄνθινος
div1.sense: like flowers, blooming, fresh, ἄνθινον εἶδαρ, of the lotus, Od.
bright-coloured, Lat. floridus, of womenʼs dress, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνθιππασία
div1.sense: a sham-fight of horse, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνθιππεύω
div1.sense: to ride against, ἀλλήλοις Xen.

div1.head: ἀνθίστημι
div1.sense: to set against, Ar., Thuc.: to set up in opposition, Thuc.
to match with, compare, Plut.

Pass., with intr. aor2 act. ἀντέστην, perf. ἀνθέστηκα, Attic contr. part. ἀνθεστώς: fut. mid. ἀντιστήσομαι, aor1 ἀντεστησάμην and pass. ἀντεστάθην α:— to stand against, esp. in battle, to withstand, oppose, τινι Il., Hdt., Attic; also, πρός τινα Thuc., etc.: rarely c. gen., φρενῶν ἀνθίσταται (al. ἀνθάπτεται) Aesch.
absol. to make a stand, Il., Hdt.

div1.head: ἀνθοβολέω
div1.sense: to bestrew with flowers, Anth.:— Pass. to have flowers showered upon one, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνθόβολος
div1.sense: garlanded with flowers, Anth.

div1.head: ἀνθοδίαιτος
div1.sense: living on flowers, Anth.

div1.head: ἀνθοδόκος
div1.sense: holding flowers, Mosch.

div1.head: ἀνθοκομέω
div1.sense: to produce flowers, Anth.

div1.head: ἀνθοκόμος
div1.sense: decked with flowers, flowery, Anth.

div1.head: ἀνθοκρατέω
div1.sense: to govern flowers, Luc.

div1.head: ἀνθόκροκος
div1.sense: worked with flowers or brightcoloured, Eur.

div1.head: ἀνθολκή
div1.sense: a pulling in the contrary direction, resistance, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνθολογία
div1.sense: a flower-gathering, Luc.: Ἀνθολογίαι were collections of small Greek poems and epigrams by several authors, which the editor made up into a posy or nosegay.

div1.head: ἀνθολόγος
div1.sense: flower-gathering, Anth.; c. gen. culling the flower of . . , Anth.

div1.head: ἀνθομολογέομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to make a mutual agreement, πρός τινα Dem.
to confess freely and openly, Plut.
to return thanks, NTest.

div1.head: ἀνθοπλίζω
div1.sense: to arm against: Pass. to be arrayed against, τινί Eur.:—Mid. to arm oneself, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνθορμέω
div1.sense: to lie at anchor opposite to, τινί Thuc.; πρός τινα Thuc.

div1.head: ἀνθοσμίας
div1.sense: redolent of flowers, of wine, οἶνος ἀνθ. with a fine "bouquet", Ar.; so ἀνθοσμίας alone, Xen., Luc.

div1.head: ἄνθος
div1.etym: note that ἀνθέων shows up even in Attic.
div1.sense: a blossom, flower, Hom., etc.
generally, anything thrown out upon the surface, froth, scum.

metaph. the bloom or flower of life, ἥβης ἄνθος Il.; ὥρας ἄνθος Xen.; χροιᾶς ἄνθος the bloom of complexion, Aesch.:—also, the flower of an army and the like, Aesch., Thuc.; τὸ σὸν ἄνθος thy pride or honour, Aesch.
the height or highest pitch of anything, bad as well as good, ἔρωτος Aesch.; μανίας Soph.
brightness, brilliancy, Theogn.; in pl. bright colours, Plat.; ἁλὸς ἄνθεα, i.e. purple, Anth.

div1.head: ἀνθοσύνη
div1.sense: bloom, luxuriant growth, Anth.

div1.head: ἀνθοφορέω
div1.sense: to bear flowers, Anth.

div1.head: ἀνθοφόρος
div1.sense: bearing flowers, flowery, Ar., Anth.

div1.head: ἀνθοφυής
div1.sense: party-coloured, Anth.

div1.head: ἀνθρακιά
div1.sense: a heap of charcoal, hot embers, Il.; ἀνθρακιᾶς ἄπο hot from the embers, Eur.
black sooty ashes, Anth.

div1.head: ἀνθρακίας
div1.sense: a man black as a collier, Luc.

div1.head: ἀνθρακίζω
div1.sense: to make charcoal of, to roast or toast, Ar.

div1.head: ἀνθρακόω
div1.sense: Pass. ἀνθρακόομαι, to be burnt to cinders, Aesch.

div1.head: ἄνθραξ
div1.sense: charcoal, coal, Ar., Thuc.

div1.head: ἀνθρήνη
div1.sense: a hornet, wasp, Ar.

div1.head: ἀνθρήνιον
div1.sense: a waspʼs nest, Ar.

div1.head: ἀνθρωπάρεσκος
div1.sense: a man-pleaser, NTest.

div1.head: ἀνθρωπάριον
div1.sense: Dim. of ἄνθρωπος, a manikin, Ar.

div1.head: ἀνθρωπέη
div1.sense: a manʼs skin, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀνθρώπειος
div1.sense: of or belonging to man, human, Hdt., etc.; ἀνθρώπεια πήματα such as man is subject to, Aesch.; ἀνθρωπήϊα πρήγματα human affairs, manʼs estate, Hdt.; τὸ ἀνθρώπειον either mankind or human nature, Thuc.
human, of which man is capable, Hdt., Plat.
human, as opp. to mythical, Hdt.
adv. -ως, humanly, in all human probability, Thuc.; ἀνθρ. φράζειν to speak as befits a man, Ar.

div1.head: ἀνθρωπεύομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to be or act as a human being, Arist.

div1.head: ἀνθρωπίζω
div1.sense: to be or act like a man, Luc.

div1.head: ἀνθρωπικός
div1.sense: of or for a man, human, Plat. adv. -κῶς, Luc.

div1.head: ἀνθρώπινος
div1.sense: of, from or belonging to man, human, Hdt., etc.; ἅπαν τὸ ἀνθρώπινον all mankind, Hdt.; τὸ ἀνθρ. γένος Plat.; τὰ ἀνθρ. πράγματα or τἀνθρώπινα human affairs, manʼs estate, Plat.
human, suited to man, Plat., Arist.
adv., ἀνθρωπίνως ἁμαρτάνειν to commit human, i. e. venial, errors, Thuc.
humanely, gently, Dem.

div1.head: ἀνθρώπιον
div1.sense: Dim. of ἄνθρωπος, a manikin, Lat. homuncio, Eur., Xen.: a paltry fellow, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνθρωποδαίμων
div1.sense: a man-god, i. e. a deified man, Eur.

div1.head: ἀνθρωποειδής
div1.sense: like a man, in human form, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀνθρωποθυσία
div1.sense: a human sacrifice, Strab.

div1.head: ἀνθρωποκτόνος
div1.sense: murdering men, a homicide, Eur.

div1.head: ἀνθρωπόκτονος
div1.sense: furnished by slaughtered men, Eur.

div1.head: ἀνθρωπολόγος
div1.sense: speaking of man, Arist.

div1.head: ἀνθρωποποιΐα
div1.sense: a making of man or men, Luc.

div1.head: ἀνθρωποποιός
div1.sense: making men, Luc.

div1.head: ἄνθρωπος
div1.sense: man, Lat. homo (not vir), opp. to gods, ἀθανάτων τε θεῶν, χαμαὶ ἐρχομένων τʼ ἀνθρώπων Il.
with or without the Art. to denote man generally, Plat., etc.
in pl. mankind, ἀνθρώπων, ἀνδρῶν ἠδὲ γυναικῶν Il.; ὁ ἄριστος ἐν ἀνθρώποις ὄρτυξ the best quail in the world, Plat.; μάλιστα, ἥκιστα ἀνθρώπων most, least of all, Hdt., etc.

with another Subst., to give it a contemptuous sense, ἄνθρ. ὑπογραμματεύς, συκοφάντης, Oratt.; so homo histrio Cic.:—so, ἄνθρωπος or ὁ ἄνθρωπος was used alone, the man, the fellow, Plat.:— also in vocat. it was addressed contemptuously to slaves, ἄνθρωπε or ὦ ʼνθρωπε, sirrah! you sir! Hdt., Plat.
fem. (as homo also is fem.), a woman, Hdt., etc.; with a sense of pity, Dem.

div1.head: ἀνθρωποσφαγέω
div1.sense: to slay men, Eur.

div1.head: ἀνθρωποφαγέω
div1.sense: to eat men or manʼs flesh, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀνθρωποφαγία
div1.sense: an eating of men, Arist.

div1.head: ἀνθρωποφάγος
div1.sense: man eating, Arist.

div1.head: ἀνθρωποφυής
div1.sense: of manʼs nature, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀνθυβρίζω
div1.sense: to abuse one another, abuse in turn, Eur., Plut.

div1.head: ἀνθυπάγω
div1.sense: to bring to trial in turn, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀνθυπατεύω
div1.sense: to be proconsul, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνθυπατικός
div1.sense: proconsular.

div1.head: ἀνθύπατος
div1.sense: a proconsul, Lat. pro consule, Polyb., etc.

div1.head: ἀνθυπείκω
div1.sense: to yield in turn, τινί Plut.

div1.head: ἀνθύπειξις
div1.sense: a mutual yielding, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνθυπηρετέω
div1.sense: to serve in turn, τινί Arist.

div1.head: ἀνθυποκρίνομαι
div1.sense: Mid.
to answer in return, Hdt.
to put on in turn, ὀργήν Luc.

div1.head: ἀνθυπόμνυμαι
div1.sense: Mid. to make a counter-affidavit, Dem.

div1.head: ἀνθυποπτεύω
div1.sense: to suspect mutually:— Pass., ἀνθυποπτεύεται he is met by the suspicion that . . , Thuc.

div1.head: ἀνθυπουργέω
div1.sense: to return a kindness, τινί τι Hdt., Eur.

div1.head: ἀνθυφίσταμαι
div1.sense: to undertake to serve as choragus instead of another, Dem.

div1.head: ἀνιάζω
div1.sense: to grieve, distress, c. acc. pers., Hom.
intr. to be grieved or distressed, feel grief, Hom.; c. dat. at or for a thing, Il.

div1.head: ἀνιάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to cure again, repair, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀνία
div1.etym: In Hom. and Soph. ῑ: in other Poets ι or ῑ.
div1.sense: grief, sorrow, distress, trouble, Od., Hes., etc.
actively, δαιτὸς ἀνίη the bane of our feast, Od.

div1.head: ἁνία
div1.sense: a rein.

div1.head: ἀνιαρός
div1.etym: In Hom and Soph. always ανῑ-, in other Poets ανι-.
div1.sense: grievous, troublesome, annoying, of persons, Od.; ἐχθροῖς ἀνιαροί Ar., of animals, Hdt.:—adv. ἀνιαρῶς Soph.
of things,
painful, grievous, distressing, Theogn., etc.; irreg. comp. ἀνιηρέστερος Od.
pass. grieved, distressed, Xen.:—adv. -ρῶς wretchedly, Od.

div1.head: ἀνίατος
div1.sense: incurable, Plat., etc.
of persons, incorrigible, Plat.; ἀνιάτως ἔχειν to be incurable, Plat.

div1.head: ἀνιάχω
div1.sense: to cry aloud: c. acc. to praise loudly, Anth.

div1.head: ἀνιάω
div1.etym: ῑ in Hom. and Soph., ι or ῑ in other Poets.
div1.sense: Like ἀνιάζω, to grieve, distress, c. acc., Od., etc.; c. dupl. acc., ὁ δρῶν σʼ ἀνιᾶι τὰς φρένας Soph.:—Pass. to be grieved, distressed, Od., etc.; with neut. adj., τοῦτʼ ἀνιῶμαι I am vexed at this, Soph.; aor1 part. as adj., a sorrowful man, Hom.

div1.head: ἀνιδρωτί
div1.sense: without sweat: metaph. without toil, Il.: lazily, slowly, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνίδρωτος
div1.sense: without having sweated or exercised oneself, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνίερος
div1.sense: unholy, unhallowed, Aesch.; ἀνίερος ἀθύτων πελάνων unhallowed because of unoffered sacrifices, Eur.
unconsecrated, Plat.

div1.head: ἀνιερόω
div1.sense: to dedicate, devote, τί τινι Plut.

div1.head: ἀνίημι
div1.etym: For quantities, ἀνι Epic, ἀνῑ- Attic; but Hom. has ἀνῑει, ἀνῑέμενος.
The forms ἀνιεῖς, -εῖ are formed as if they were from ἀνιέω.
The Homeric forms in ἀνεσ- are created as if from ἀν-έζω.
The Ionic form ἀνέωνται is formed as if from ἀν-εόω.
div1.sense: to send up or forth, Hom., etc.; of the earth, to make spring up, Hhymn.; of females, to produce, Soph.:— Pass. to be sent up, produced, Aesch., etc.; to send up from the grave or nether world, Aesch., etc.
to send back, put back, open, Hom., Eur.
to let go, leave, Hom., etc.; c. gen. rei, δεσμῶν ἀνίει loosed them from bonds, Od.: to let go unpunished, Xen.
ἀν. τινί to let loose at one, ἀν. κύνας, Lat. canes immittere, Xen.; hence, ἄφρονα τοῦτον ἀνέντες Il.: c. inf. to set on or urge to do a thing, Hom.
ἀν. τινὰ πρός τι to let go for any purpose, Hdt.; ἀν. τινὰ μανίας to set free from madness, Eur.
to let, allow one to do a thing, c. acc. et inf., Hdt., etc.: —so, ἀν. κόμην to let it hang, loosen, Eur.
Mid., c. acc., κόλπον ἀνιεμένη baring her breast, Il.; αἶγας ἀνιέμενοι flaying goats, Od.

to let go free, leave untilled, of ground dedicated to a god, Thuc.:—Pass. to devote oneself, give oneself up, Hdt.; of animals dedicated to a god, which are let range at large, Hdt.; esp. in perf. pass. part. ἀνειμένος, Soph., etc.
to slacken, relax, let down, unstring, Hdt., Plat.:—then, to remit, neglect, give up, Soph., Thuc., etc.:—Pass. to be treated remissly, Thuc.

so intr. in Act. to slacken, abate, of the wind, Soph., etc.; οὐδὲν ἀνιέναι not to give way at all, Xen.:—c. part. to give up or cease doing, ὕων οὐκ ἀνίει ὁ θεός Hdt.:—c. gen. to cease from a thing, Eur., Thuc.

div1.head: ἀνίκανος
div1.sense: insufficient, incapable, Babr.

div1.head: ἀνικέτευτος
div1.sense: without prayer, not entreating, Eur.

div1.head: ἀνίκητος
div1.sense: unconquered, unconquerable, Hes., etc.

div1.head: ἀνίλεως
div1.sense: unmerciful, NTest.

div1.head: ἀνιμάω
div1.sense: to draw up water, by means of leather straps: generally, to draw out or up, Xen.: also Mid. ἀνιμῶμαι, Luc., etc.
intr. (sub. ἑαυτόν), to mount up, Xen.

div1.head: ἄνιππος
div1.sense: without horse, not serving on horseback, Hdt., Soph.: without a horse to ride on, Ar.
of countries, unsuited for horses, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀνιπτόπους
div1.sense: with unwashen feet, Il.

div1.head: ἄνιπτος
div1.sense: unwashen, Il.
not to be washed out, Aesch.

div1.head: ἄνισος
div1.sense: unequal, uneven, Plat., etc.:—adv., ἀνίσως, unfairly, Dem.

div1.head: ἀνισότης
div1.sense: inequality, Plat., etc.

div1.head: ἀνισόω
div1.sense: to make equal, equalise, Xen.:—Pass. to be made equal, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀνίστημι
div1.sense: Causal in pres., imperf. to make to stand up, raise up, χειρός by his hand. Il.:— to raise from sleep, wake up, Il.: metaph., ἀν. νόσον Soph.:— to raise from the dead, Il., Aesch.; from misery, Soph.
of things, to set up, build, Hdt., etc.; so, ἀν. τινὰ χαλκοῦν to set up a bronze statue of him, Plut.;—aor1 mid., ἀναστήσασθαι πόλιν to build oneself a city, Hdt.
to build up again, restore, Eur., Dem.
to put up for sale, Hdt.
to rouse to action, stir up, Il.:— to rouse to arms, raise troops, Thuc.; ἀν. πόλεμον ἐπί τινα Plut.
to make people rise, break up an assembly, Il., Xen.
to make people rise from their home, make them emigrate, transplant, Od., Hdt., etc.
to make suppliants rise and leave sanctuary, Hdt., Thuc.
of sportsmen, to put up game, spring it, Xen.

Intr. in pres. and imperf. ἀνίσταμαι, -μην, in fut. ἀναστήσομαι, in aor2 ἀνέστην, perf. ἀνέστηκα, Attic plup. ἀνεστήκη; also in aor1 pass. ἀνεστάθην α:— to stand up, rise, to speak, Hom., etc.:— to rise from oneʼs seat as a mark of respect, Lat. assurgere, Il.:— to rise from bed, Il., etc.:— to rise from the dead, Il.:— to rise from an illness, recover, Hdt.
to rise as a champion, Il., Soph.: c. dat. to stand up to fight against, τινι Il.; πᾶσιν ὃς ἀνέστη θεοῖς Aesch.
of buiildings and statues, to be set up, to rise up, rear itself, Eur., Plut., etc.
of a river, to rise, Plut.
to rise to go, set out, go away, Eur., Thuc., etc.
to be compelled to migrate, Thuc.; of a country, to be depopulated, Hdt., Eur.; οὐκέτι ἀνισταμένη no longer subject to migration, Thuc.
of a law-court, to rise, Dem.
of game, to be put up, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνιστορέω
div1.sense: to make inquiry into, ask about, Soph.: c. acc. pers. et rei, to ask a person about a thing, Aesch., Soph.; so, ἀν. τινὰ περί τινος Eur.

div1.head: ἀνιστόρητος
div1.sense: ignorant of history:— adv., ἀνιστορήτως ἔχειν τινός to be uninformed about a thing, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνίσωσις
div1.sense: equalisation, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀνιχνεύω
div1.sense: to trace back, as a hound, Il.: generally, to trace out, Plut.

div1.head: ἀννιβίζω
div1.sense: to side with Hannibal, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνοδηγέω
div1.sense: to guide back, Babr.

div1.head: ἄνοδος
div1.sense: having no road, impassable, Eur., Xen.

div1.head: ἄνοδος2
div1.sense: a way up, as to the Acropolis, Hdt.:— a journey inland, esp. into Central Asia, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: ἀνοδύρομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to set up a wailing, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνοήμων
div1.sense: without understanding, Od.

div1.head: ἀνόητος
div1.sense: not thought on, unheard of, Hhymn.
not within the province of thought, unintelligent, Plat.
act. not understanding, unintelligent, Lat. ineptus, Hdt., Attic; ὠνόητε oh you fool, Ar.; ἀνόητα follies, Ar.:—adv. -τως, Plat., etc.

div1.head: ἄνοια
div1.sense: want of understanding, folly, Hdt., etc.; ὑπʼ ἀνοίας Aesch.; πολλὴ ἄνοιά ἐστι πολεμῆσαι Thuc.

div1.head: ἀνοίγνυμι
div1.sense: to open doors, etc., ἀναοίγεσκον κληῖδα they tried to put back the bolt so as to open the door, Il.; πύλας, θύραν ἀν., Aesch., Ar.
to undo, open, πῶμʼ ἀνέωιγε took off the cover and opened it, Il.; metaph., ἀνοίξαντι κληῖδα φρενῶν Eur.; ἀν. οἶνον to tap it, Theocr.
to lay open, unfold, disclose, Soph.
as nautical term, absol. to get into the open sea, get clear of land, Xen.
Pass. to be open, stand open, of doors, Hdt., Plat.; κόλποι δʼ ἀλλήλων ἀνοιγόμενοι opening one into another, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνοιδέω
div1.sense: to swell up, of a wave, Eur.
metaph. of passion, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀνοικίζω
div1.sense: to remove up the country:— Pass. and Mid. to shift oneʼs dwelling up the country, to migrate inland, Ar.; and of cities, to be built up the country, away from the coast, Thuc.:—generally, to migrate, δεῦρʼ ἀνοικισθείς Ar., Thuc.
to resettle:— Pass. to be re-peopled, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνοικοδομέω
div1.sense: to build up, Hdt.
to wall up, Ar.
to build again, rebuild, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: ἄνοικος
div1.sense: houseless, homeless, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀνοικτέος
div1.sense: one must open, Eur.

div1.head: ἀνοικτίρμων
div1.sense: pitiless, merciless, Soph., Anth.

div1.head: ἀνοίκτιστος
div1.sense: unpitied, unmourned, Anth.

div1.head: ἄνοικτος
div1.sense: pitiless, ruthless, Eur.:—adv. -τως, without pity, without being pitied, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: ἀνοικτός
div1.sense: opened, Babr., Luc.

div1.head: ἀνοιμώζω
div1.sense: to wail aloud, Aesch., Thuc.

div1.head: ἀνοιμωκτί
div1.sense: without need to wail, with impunity, Soph.

div1.head: ἀνοίμωκτος
div1.sense: unlamented, Aesch.

div1.head: ἄνοιξις
div1.sense: an opening, πυλῶν Thuc.

div1.head: ἀνοιστέος
div1.sense: one must report, Soph., Eur.:— one must refer, τι πρός τι Plut.

div1.head: ἄνοιστος
div1.sense: referred, ἔς τινα to some one for decision, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀνοιστρέω
div1.sense: to goad to madness, Eur.

div1.head: ἀνοκωχεύω
div1.sense: to hold back, ἀν. τὰς νέας to keep them at anchor, Hdt.: of a chariot, to hold it in, keep it back, Soph.
ἀν. τὸν τόνον τῶν ὅπλων to keep up the tension of the ropes, keep them taut, Hdt.
intr. to keep back, keep still, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀνοκωχή
div1.etym: formed by redupl. from ἀνοχή (cf. ὄκωχα perf. of ἔχω). The forms ἀνακωχή, ἀνακωχεύω are late and corrupt.
div1.sense: a stay, cessation, κακῶν Thuc.: absol. a cessation of arms, truce, διʼ ἀνοκωχῆς γίγνεσθαί τινι to be at truce with one, Thuc.
a hindrance, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀνολβία
div1.sense: misery, Hes.

div1.head: ἄνολβος
div1.sense: unblest, wretched, luckless, Theogn., Trag.

div1.head: ἀνολκή
div1.sense: a hauling up, λίθων Thuc.

div1.head: ἀνολολύζω
div1.sense: to cry aloud, shout (with joy), Trag.
c. acc. to bewail loudly, Soph.
in a causal sense, to excite by Bacchic cries, Eur.

div1.head: ἀνολοφύρομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to break into loud wailing, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: ἀνομαλίζω
div1.sense: to restore to equality, equalise, 1 perf. pass. inf. ἀνωμαλίσθαι Arist.

div1.head: ἄνομβρος
div1.sense: without rain, of countries, Hdt.; ἄν. ῥοαί streams not fed by showers, Eur.

div1.head: ἀνομέω
div1.sense: to act lawlessly, περί τι Hdt.

div1.head: ἀνομία
div1.sense: lawlessness, Hdt., Eur., etc.

div1.head: ἀνομίλητος
div1.sense: having no communion with others, unsociable, Plat.
c. gen., ἀνομ. παιδείας unacquainted with education, Luc.

div1.head: ἀνόμματος
div1.sense: eyeless, sightless, Soph.

div1.head: ἀνομοιοειδής
div1.sense: of unlike kind, heterogeneous, Arist.

div1.head: ἀνόμοιος
div1.sense: and α, ον, unlike, dissimilar, Pind., Plat.; ἀν. τινι unlike it, Plat.:—adv. -ως, Thuc.; ἀν. ἔχειν to be unlike, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνομοιότης
div1.sense: dissimilarity, Plat.

div1.head: ἀνομοιόω
div1.sense: to make unlike or dissimilar, Plat.: —Pass. to be or become so, Plat.

div1.head: ἀνομολογέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to agree upon a thing, come to an understanding, περί τινος Plat.; πρός τινα with one, Plat.
to sum up oneʼs conclusions, τὰ εἰρημένα Plat.
perf. in pass. sense, ἀνωμολόγημαι πράττειν I am allowed to be doing, Dem.

div1.head: ἀνομολογητέος
div1.sense: one must admit, Plat.

div1.head: ἀνομολογία
div1.sense: disagreement, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνομόλογος
div1.sense: not agreeing .
