div1.head: ἀνομολογούμενος
div1.sense: not agreeing, inconsistent, Plat.

div1.head: ἄνομος
div1.sense: without law, lawless, Hdt., Trag., etc.:— adv. -μως, Eur., etc.; comp. -ώτερον, Plat.
(νόμος II) musical, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀνόνητος
div1.sense: unprofitable, useless, Soph., Eur., etc.; neut. pl. ἀνόνητα as adv. in vain, Eur.
c. gen. making no profit from a thing, Dem.

div1.head: ἄνοος
div1.sense: without understanding, foolish, silly, Il., Soph., etc.:—comp. ἀνούστερος, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀνοπαῖα
div1.sense: either from ἀν-priv., * ὄπτομαι she flew away unseen; or = ἄνω, up into the air; or ἀν’ ὀπαῖα ( = ἀνὰ ὀπήν) up by the smoke-vent, Od.:—others write ἀνόπαια, ἡ, a kind of eagle.

div1.head: ἄνοπλος
div1.sense: without the ὅπλον or large shield, Hdt., Plat.

div1.head: ἀνοράω
div1.sense: to look up, Aesch

div1.head: ἀνόργανος
div1.sense: without instruments, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνορέα
div1.sense: Doric for ἠνορέη.

div1.head: ἀνορθόω
div1.sense: to set up again, restore, rebuild, Hdt., Thuc.
to restore to health or well-being, πόλιν Soph.
to set straight again, set right, correct, τινα Eur.

div1.head: ἄνορμος
div1.sense: without harbour: metaph., ὑμέναιον ἄν. εἰσπλεῖν to sail into a marriage that was no haven for thee, Soph.

div1.head: ἀνόρνυμι
div1.sense: to rouse, stir up, Pind.:—Pass., Epic aor2 ἀνῶρτο, to start up, Hom.

div1.head: ἀνορούω
div1.sense: to start up, leap up, Hom.; of the sun, ἀνόρουσεν οὐρανὸν ἐς went swiftly up the sky, Od.; ἀνορούσαις (Doric part. aor1) Pind.

div1.head: ἀνόροφος
div1.sense: roofless, Eur.

div1.head: ἀνορταλίζω
div1.sense: to clap the wings and crow, like a cockrel, Ar.

div1.head: ἀνορύσσω
div1.sense: to dig up what has been buried, Hdt., Ar.
ἀν. τάφον to dig it up, break open, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀνορχέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to leap up and dance, Eur.

div1.head: ἀνόσιος
div1.sense: unholy, profane, Lat. profanus, of persons and things, Hdt., Attic; ἀνόσιος νέκυς a corpse with all the rites unpaid, Soph.:—adv. -ίως, in unholy wise, Soph.: without funeral rites, Eur.

div1.head: ἀνοσιότης
div1.sense: profaneness, Plat.

div1.head: ἄνοσος
div1.sense: without sickness, healthy, sound, Od., Hdt., Attic
c. gen., ἄνοσος κακῶν untouched by ill, Eur.
of a season, free from sickness, Thuc.
of things, not causing disease, harmless, Eur.

div1.head: ἀνόστεος
div1.sense: boneless, of the polypus, Hes.

div1.head: ἀνόστητος
div1.sense: whence none return, Anth.

div1.head: ἀνόστιμος
div1.sense: not returning, κεῖνον ἀν. ἔθηκεν cut off his return, Od.
not to be retraced, Eur.

div1.head: ἄνοστος
div1.sense: unreturning, without return, Od.; Sup., ἥβη ἀνοστοτάτη never, never to return, Anth.

div1.head: ἀνοτοτύζω
div1.sense: to break out into wailing, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: ἀνούατος
div1.sense: without ear: without handle, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀνούτατος
div1.sense: unwounded by sword, Il.

div1.head: ἀνουτητί
div1.sense: without wound, Il.

div1.head: ἀνοχή
div1.sense: a holding back, stopping, esp. of hostilities: pl., like Lat. induciae, an armistice, truce, Xen.
(ἀνέχομαι) forbearance, NTest.

div1.head: ἀνοχμάζω
div1.sense: to hoist, lift up, Anth.

div1.head: ἀνσχετός
div1.sense: to be borne, sufferable, endurable, Theogn., Soph.; mostly with negat., οὐκ ἀνσχετά insufferable, Od.; πτώματʼ οὐκ ἀνασχετά Aesch.: —οὐκ ἀνασχετόν ἐστι, c. inf., Hdt., Soph.

div1.head: ἀνταγοράζω
div1.sense: to buy with money received in payment for something else, Xen.:—Pass., aor1 part. ἀνταγορασθείς Dem.

div1.head: ἀνταγορεύω
div1.sense: to speak against, reply, Pind.:— to gainsay, contradict, τινί Ar.

div1.head: ἀνταγωνίζομαι
div1.sense: as Dep. to struggle against, prove a match for, τινί Hdt., Thuc.:—generally, to struggle or dispute with, τινί Thuc.:— οἱ ἀνταγωνιζόμενοί τι the parties in a lawsuit, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνταγωνιστέω
div1.sense: to oppose, be a rival, Arist.

div1.head: ἀνταγωνιστής
div1.sense: an opponent, competitor, rival, Xen., etc.; ἀντ. ἔρωτος a rival in love, Eur.

div1.head: ἀνταείρω
div1.sense: Mid., ἀνταείρεσθαι χεῖράς τινι to raise oneʼs hands against one, Hdt.

div1.head: ἄνταθλος
div1.sense: contending against, rivalling, τινος Anth.

div1.head: ἀνταιδέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to respect in return, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνταῖος
div1.sense: set over against, right opposite, ἀνταία πληγή a wound in front, Soph., Eur.
opposed to, hostile, hateful, Eur.; τινι to one, Aesch.; τἀνταῖα θεῶν their hostile purposes, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀνταίρω
div1.sense: to raise against, χεῖράς τινι Anth.; so in Mid., Thuc.
intr. to rise up against, τινί Plat., Dem.; πρός τι or τινα, Dem., etc.
of a cliff, to rise opposite to, πρὸς τὴν Λιβύην Plut.

div1.head: ἀνταιτέω
div1.sense: to demand in return, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντακαῖος
div1.sense: a sort of sturgeon, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀντακούω
div1.sense: to hear in turn, τι ἀντί τινος Soph.: absol. to hear in return, Aesch., Xen.

div1.head: ἀνταλαλάζω
div1.sense: to return a shout, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀντάλλαγμα
div1.sense: that which is given or taken in exchange, φίλου for a friend, Eur.; τῆς ψυχῆς for oneʼs soul, NTest.

div1.head: ἀνταλλακτέος
div1.sense: one must give in exchange, τινός for a thing, Dem.

div1.head: ἀνταλλάσσω
div1.sense: to exchange one thing with another, τί τινι Eur.; τὴν ἀξίωσιν τῶν ὀνομάτων ἀντ. to change the signification of the names, Thuc.

Mid. to take in exchange, τί τινος one thing for another, Eur., Dem.; τι ἀντί τινος Dem.; θάνατον ἀνταλλάξεται shall receive death in exchange, i. e. as a punishment, Eur.:—Pass., ἀντηλλαγμένος τοῦ ἑκατέρων τρόπου having made an interchange of each otherʼs custom, i. e. having each adopted the otherʼs way, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀνταμείβομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to exchange one thing with another, τί τινι Archil.
c. acc. pers. to repay, requite, punish, Archil., Aesch., etc.
to answer again, Hdt.; ἀντ. τι πρός τινα Soph.

div1.head: ἀνταμύνομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to defend oneself against, resist, Thuc.
to requite, τινὰ κακοῖς Soph.

div1.head: ἀνταναβιβάζω
div1.sense: to make go up in turn, Xen.

div1.head: ἀντανάγω
div1.sense: to lead up against, ἀντ. νέας to put ships to sea against, Hdt.; but also, ἀντ. ναυσί with ships, Thuc.;—so, ἀντανάγειν or ἀντανάγεσθαι alone, Thuc., Xen.
to bring up or out instead, Anth.

div1.head: ἀνταναιρέω
div1.sense: to take away from the opposite sides of an account, to cancel, Dem.

div1.head: ἀνταναλίσκω
div1.sense: to destroy in return, Eur.

div1.head: ἀνταναμένω
div1.sense: to wait instead of taking active measures, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀνταναπίμπλημι
div1.sense: to fill up in return, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνταναπλέκω
div1.sense: to plait in rivalry with, τινί Anth.

div1.head: ἀνταναπληρόω
div1.sense: to supply as a substitute or balance, τινὰ πρός τινα Dem.

div1.head: ἄντανδρος
div1.sense: instead of a man, as a substitute, Luc.

div1.head: ἀντάνειμι
div1.sense: to rise so as to balance, τινί Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντανίστημι
div1.sense: to set up against, τί τινι Plut.
Pass., with aor2 act., to rise up against, τινι Soph.

div1.head: ἀντάξιος
div1.sense: worth just as much as, c. gen., Il., Hdt., Attic
absol. worth as much, worth no less, Il.

div1.head: ἀνταξιόω
div1.sense: to demand as equivalent, or in turn, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀνταπαιτέω
div1.sense: to demand in return, Thuc.:— Pass. to be called on for a thing in turn, τι Plut.

div1.head: ἀνταπαμείβομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to obey in turn, τινι Tyrtae.

div1.head: ἀνταπερύκω
div1.sense: to keep off in turn, Anth.

div1.head: ἀνταποδείκνυμι
div1.sense: to prove in return or answer, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνταποδίδωμι
div1.sense: to give back, repay, tender in repayment or requital, Batr., Hdt., Attic:—absol. to make a return, Thuc.
to make correspondent, Plat.
intr. to answer to, correspond with, τοῖς ἑτέροις Plat.
to give back words, answer, τινί Plat.
to deliver in turn, τὸ σύνθημα Xen.
to give back a sound, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνταπόδομα
div1.sense: repayment, requital, NTest.

div1.head: ἀνταπόδοσις
div1.sense: a giving back in turn, Thuc.: a rendering, requiting, repayment, reward, NTest.

div1.head: ἀνταποκρίνομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to answer again, NTest.: to argue against, τινι NTest.

div1.head: ἀνταποκτείνω
div1.sense: to kill in return, Hdt., Attic

div1.head: ἀνταπολαμβάνω
div1.sense: to receive or accept in return, Plat., Dem.

div1.head: ἀνταπόλλυμι
div1.sense: to destroy in return, Eur., Plat.
Pass. and Mid., with perf. 2 act. -απόλωλα, to perish in turn, Eur.; ὑπὲρ ἀνδρὸς ἑκάστου δέκα ἀνταπόλλυσθαι that ten be put to death in revenge for each man, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀνταποτίνω
div1.sense: to requite, repay, Anth.

div1.head: ἀνταποφαίνω
div1.sense: to shew on the other hand, Thuc.

div1.head: ἄντα
div1.sense: over against, face to face, ἄντα μάχεσθαι to fight man to man; ἄντα ἰδεῖν to look before one; θεοῖς ἄντα ἐώικει was like the gods to look at, Hom.; ἄντα τιτύσκεσθαι to aim straight at them, Od.
as prep. with gen., over against, Hom.; ἄντα παρειάων before her cheeks; ἄντʼ ὀφθαλμοῖϊν Od.; ἄντα σέθεν before thee, Od.
in hostile sense, against, Διὸς ἄντα Il.

div1.head: ἀνταρκέω
div1.sense: to hold out against, τινι Thuc.; πρός τι Plut.
absol. to hold out, persist, Ar.

div1.head: ἀντασπάζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to welcome or greet in turn, Xen.; to receive kindly, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνταύγεια
div1.sense: reflexion of light, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνταυγέω
div1.sense: to reflect light, φάσγανον ἀνταυγεῖ φόνον flashes back murder, Eur.

div1.head: ἀνταυδάω
div1.sense: to speak against, answer, τινα Soph.

div1.head: ἀνταΰω
div1.sense: to sound in turn, answer, τινί Pind.

div1.head: ἀνταφίημι
div1.sense: to let go or let fall in turn, Eur.

div1.head: ἀντάω
div1.sense: c. dat. pers. to come opposite to, meet face to face, meet with, Il., Trag.
c. gen., either
gen. pers. to meet in battle, Hom.; or

gen. rei, to take part in, partake in or of, Hom.; ὅπως ἤντησας ὀπωπῆς how thou hast sped in getting sight of him, Od.; so, ἀντ. ξεινίων Hdt.; κακῶν Soph.; so, ἄντασεἘρεχθειδᾶν partook of their blood, Soph.

div1.head: ἀντεγγράφω
div1.sense: to insert one name instead of another, Dem.

div1.head: ἀντεγκαλέω
div1.sense: to accuse in turn, Dem.

div1.head: ἀντεικάζω
div1.sense: to compare in return, τινά τινι Ar.; absol., Plat.

div1.head: ἀντεῖπον
div1.etym: aor2 with no pres, ἀνταγορεύω being used instead, cf. ἀντερῶ
div1.sense: to speak against or in answer, gainsay, c. dat., οὐδὲν ἀντ. τινι Aesch., etc.:—absol. to speak in answer, Thuc., etc.; ἀντ. ἔπος to utter a word of contradiction, Eur.
ἀντ. τινί τι to set one thing against another, Plat.
κακῶς ἀντ. τινά to speak ill of him in turn, Soph.

div1.head: ἀντεισάγω
div1.sense: to introduce instead, substitute, Dem.
to bring into office in turn, Plut.

div1.head: ἀντεκκλέπτω
div1.sense: to steal away in return, Ar.

div1.head: ἀντεκκόπτω
div1.sense: to knock out in return, Dem.

div1.head: ἀντεκπέμπω
div1.sense: to send out in return, Xen.

div1.head: ἀντεκπλέω
div1.sense: to sail out against, τινί Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντεκτείνω
div1.sense: to stretch out in opposition, ἀν. αὑτόν τινι to match oneself with another, Ar.

div1.head: ἀντεκτίθημι
div1.sense: to set forth or state instead, Plut.

div1.head: ἀντεκτρέχω
div1.sense: to sally out against, Xen.

div1.head: ἀντελαύνω
div1.sense: to sail against, Plut.

div1.head: ἀντελπίζω
div1.sense: to hope instead or in turn, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντεμβάλλω
div1.sense: to make an inroad in turn, Xen.: to attack in turn, Plut.

div1.head: ἀντεμβιβάζω
div1.sense: to put on board instead, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντεμπήγνυμαι
div1.sense: Pass. to stick right in, τινί Ar.

div1.head: ἀντεμπίπλημι
div1.sense: to fill in turn, Xen.: to fill in return, by way of compensation, τί τινος Xen.

div1.head: ἀντεμπίπρημι
div1.sense: to set on fire in return, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀντέμφασις
div1.sense: difference of appearance, Strab.

div1.head: ἀντενδίδωμι
div1.sense: to give way in turn, of sawyers, Ar.

div1.head: ἀντεξάγω
div1.sense: to export in turn or instead, Xen.

div1.head: ἀντεξαιτέω
div1.sense: to demand in return, Plut.

div1.head: ἀντεξελαύνω
div1.sense: to drive, ride, sail out against, Plut.

div1.head: ἀντεξέρχομαι
div1.sense: to go out against, Xen.

div1.head: ἀντεξετάζω
div1.sense: to try one by the standard of another, Aeschin.; τι πρός τι Plut.:—Mid. to measure oneself against another, τινί Luc.:— to dispute with him at law, Luc.

div1.head: ἀντεξιππεύω
div1.sense: to ride out against, Plut.

div1.head: ἀντεξόρμησις
div1.sense: a sailing against, Thuc.: a mode of attack, Plut.

div1.head: ἀντεπάγω
div1.sense: to lead against: intr. to advance against, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντεπαινέω
div1.sense: to praise in return, Xen.
Pass., ἀντ. τινί to be extolled in comparison with, Luc.

div1.head: ἀντεπανάγομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to put to sea against, πρός τινα Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντεπαφίημι
div1.sense: to let slip against, τινί Luc.

div1.head: ἀντέπειμι
div1.sense: to rush upon, meet an advancing enemy, c. dat. or absol., Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντεπεξάγω
div1.sense: intr., to go out against, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντεπέξειμι
div1.sense: to march out to meet an enemy, πρός τινα Thuc.; absol., Xen.

div1.head: ἀντεπεξελαύνω
div1.sense: to march out to meet an enemy, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντεπηχέω
div1.sense: to clamour against one, Luc.

div1.head: ἀντεπιβουλεύω
div1.sense: to form counter-designs, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντεπιγράφω
div1.sense: to write something instead, Dem.

div1.head: ἀντεπιδείκνυμι
div1.sense: to exhibit in turn, Xen.; so Mid., Plut.

div1.head: ἀντεπιθυμέω
div1.sense: to desire a thing in rivalry with another, c. gen. rei, Andoc.:—Pass., ἀντεπιθυμεῖσθαι τῆς ξυνουσίας to have oneʼs company desired in turn, Xen.

div1.head: ἀντεπικουρέω
div1.sense: to help in return, τινι Xen.

div1.head: ἀντεπιμελέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to attend or give heed in turn, τινός to one, Xen.

div1.head: ἀντεπιστέλλω
div1.sense: to write an answer, Luc.

div1.head: ἀντεπιστρατεύω
div1.sense: to take the field against, Xen.

div1.head: ἀντεπιτάσσω
div1.sense: to order in turn, τινὶ ποιεῖν τι Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντεπιτειχίζω
div1.sense: In Thuc., dep. with pf pass to build a fort in retaliation, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντεπιτίθημι
div1.sense: to entrust a letter in answer, πρός τινα Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντεπιχειρέω
div1.sense: to attack in turn, τινι Plut.

div1.head: ἀντέραμαι
div1.sense: to rival another in love for a person, τινί τινος Luc.

div1.head: ἀντερανίζω
div1.sense: to contribute in turn; Pass. to be repaid, Anth.

div1.head: ἀντεραστής
div1.sense: a rival in love, τινός for another, Ar.: a rival, Plat.

div1.head: ἀντεράω
div1.sense: to love in return, Aesch.; ἀντερᾶν τινός Luc.
ἀντ. τινί τινος to rival one in love for another, Eur.: absol., τὸ ἀντερᾶν jealous love, Plut.

div1.head: ἀντερείδω
div1.sense: to set firmly against, τί τινι Eur.; ἀντ. ξύλα τῶι πύργωι to set wooden props against it, Xen.; ἀντ. βάσιν to plant it firm, Soph.
intr. to stand firm, resist pressure, Xen.

div1.head: ἀντέρεισις
div1.sense: resistance, Plut.

div1.head: ἀντείρομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to ask in turn, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: ἀντερύομαι
div1.sense: to make equal in weight with, to value equally with, c. gen., Theogn.

div1.head: ἀντερῶ
div1.etym: fut. with no pres. in use.
div1.sense: to speak against, gainsay, Soph.; τι πρός τινα Ar.; c. inf. to refuse, Aesch.:—Pass., οὐδὲν ἀντειρήσεται no denial shall be given, Soph.

div1.head: ἀντέρως
div1.sense: return-love, Plat.

div1.head: ἀντερωτάω
div1.sense: to question in turn, ἐρωτώμενος ἀντερωτᾶν Plat.

div1.head: ἀντευεργετέω
div1.sense: to return a kindness, Xen.

div1.head: ἀντευνοέω
div1.sense: to wish well in return, τινί Xen.

div1.head: ἀντέχω
div1.sense: to hold against, c. acc. et gen., χεῖρα ἀντ. κρατός to hold oneʼs hand against oneʼs head, so as to shade the eyes, Soph.; c. dat., ὄμμασι δʼ ἀντίσχοις τάνδʼ αἴγλαν mayʼst thou keep this sunlight upon his eyes (al. off his eyes), Soph.
to hold out against, withstand, c. dat., Hdt., Thuc.; πρός τινα Thuc.; c. acc. to endure, Anth.
absol. to hold out, stand oneʼs ground, Hdt., Attic: to hold out, endure, last, Hdt., etc.; of the rivers drunk by the Persian army, to hold out, suffice, Hdt.
Mid. to hold before one against something, c. acc. et gen., Od.
c. gen. to hold on by, cling to, Hdt., Attic:—metaph., ἀντ. τῶν ὄχθων to cling to the banks, keep close to them, Hdt.; ἀντ. ἀρετῆς, τοῦ πολέμου Hdt.; τῆς θαλάσσης Thuc.
absol. to hold out, Soph.
c. dupl. gen. pers. et rei, ἀνθέξεταί σου τῶν χρημάτων will lay claim to the property from you, dispute it with you, Ar.

div1.head: ἀντήεις
div1.sense: hostile, Pind.

div1.head: ἀντήλιος
div1.etym: Note that it is not not ἀνθ-ήλιος
div1.sense: opposite the sun, i. e. facing east, Soph.; δαίμονες ἀντήλιοι statues of gods which stood in the sun before the door, Aesch.
like the sun, formed like ἀντίθεος, Eur.

div1.head: ἄντην
div1.sense: against, over against, ἄντην στήσομαι I will confront him, Il.; ὁμοιωθήμεναι ἄντην to match himself against me, Hom.; ἄντην ἔρχεσθαι to go straight forwards, Il.; ἄντην βάλλεσθαι to be struck in front, Il.; ἄντην εἰσιδέειν to look him in the face, Il.; ἄντην λόεσθαι to bathe before all, Od.; θεῶι ἐναλίγκιος ἄντην like a god in presence, Od.

div1.head: ἀντήνωρ
div1.sense: instead of a man, σποδὸς ἀντ. dust for men, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀντηρέτης
div1.sense: properly, one who rows against another: generally an adversary, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀντήρης
div1.sense: set over against, opposite, face to face, Eur.:—c. gen. over against, facing, Eur.; ἀντήρεις στέρνων πληγάς aimed straight at the breast, Soph.:—c. dat., ἀντ. τινί opposite to a thing, Eur.

div1.head: ἀντηρίς
div1.sense: a prop, stay, support, Eur., Xen.; in Thuc., ἀντηρίδες are stay-beams, fixed so as to strengthen the timbers of the bow.

div1.head: ἄντηστις
div1.sense: a meeting, Od.

div1.head: ἀντηχέω
div1.sense: to sound or sing in answer, Eur.
of a musical string, to sound responsively, Plut., Luc.

div1.head: ἀντιάζω
div1.sense: to meet face to face,
c. acc. pers. to encounter, whether as friend or foe, Hdt., Aesch.: absol. to meet, answer, Pind.
to approach as suppliants, to entreat, supplicate, Hdt., Soph.
c. dat. pers. to meet in fight, Pind.

div1.head: ἀντιάνειρα
div1.sense: fem. adj. a match for men, of the Amazons, Il.
στάσις ἀντιάνειρα faction wherein man is set against man, Pind.

div1.head: ἀντιάω
div1.sense: to go for the purpose of meeting:

c. gen. rei, to go in quest of, Hom.; of an arrow, to hit, Il.; of the gods, to come (as it were) to meet an offering, to accept it, or to partake of it, Hom.; then, generally, to partake of, enjoy, obtain, Od., Soph.; so in Mid., Il.
c. gen. pers. to match or measure oneself with, Il., Theogn.
c. dat. pers. to meet with, encounter, Hom.
c. acc. rei, to come to, visit, share, ἐμὸν λέχος ἀντιόωσα Il.

div1.head: ἀντιβαίνω
div1.sense: to go against, withstand, resist, c. dat., Hdt., Aesch.; πλευραῖσιν ἀντιβᾶσα having set her foot against, Eur.; also absol., Hdt., etc.; ἀντιβάς reluctant, Soph.; but, ἀντιβὰς ἐλᾶν to pull stoutly against the oar, going well back, Ar.

div1.head: ἀντιβάλλω
div1.sense: to throw against or in turn, return the shots, Thuc.
to put one against the other, λόγους ἀντ. πρὸς ἀλλήλους to exchange words in conversation, NTest.

div1.head: ἀντίβασις
div1.sense: resistance, Plut.

div1.head: ἀντιβατικός
div1.sense: contrary, opposite, Plut.

div1.head: ἀντιβιάζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to use force against, Anth.

div1.head: ἀντιβίην
div1.sense: against, face to face, Il.

div1.head: ἀντίβιος
div1.sense: opposing force to force, ἀντιβίοις ἐπέεσσι with wrangling words, Hom.:—neut. as adv. = ἀντιβίην, Il.

div1.head: ἀντιβλεπτέος
div1.sense: one must look in the face, Luc.

div1.head: ἀντιβλέπω
div1.sense: to look straight at, look in the face, c. dat. pers., Xen.

div1.head: ἀντίβλεψις
div1.sense: a looking in the face, a look, Xen.

div1.head: ἀντιβοάω
div1.sense: to return a cry, Bion.

div1.head: ἀντιβοηθέω
div1.sense: to help in turn, τινι Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: ἀντιβολέω
div1.sense: to meet by chance, esp. in battle, c. dat. pers. or absol., Hom.
c. dat. rei, to be present at, φόνωι ἀνδρῶν, τάφωι ἀνδρῶν Od.
c. gen. rei, to partake of, have oneʼs share of, μάχης Il.; τάφου Od.
to fall to oneʼs lot, c. gen. pers., γάμος ἀντιβολήσει ἐμέθεν Od.
c. acc. pers. to meet as a suppliant, entreat, supplicate, Ar.; c. acc. et inf., Ar.:—absol. to supplicate, entreat, Ar.

div1.head: ἀντιβολία
div1.sense: entreaty, prayer, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντιβροντάω
div1.sense: to rival in thundering, τινί Luc.

div1.head: ἀντιγέγωνα
div1.sense: to return a cry, Anth.

div1.head: ἀντιγενεηλογέω
div1.sense: Ionic form, to rival in pedigree, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀντιγνωμονέω
div1.sense: to be of a different opinion: ἀντ. τι μὴ οὐκ εἶναι to think that a thing is otherwise, Xen.

div1.head: ἀντίγραμμα
div1.sense: = ἀντίγραφον, Luc.

div1.head: ἀντιγραφεύς
div1.sense: a check-clerk, controller, Aeschin.; ἀντ. τῶν εἰσενεγκόντων one who keeps a check upon their accounts, Dem.

div1.head: ἀντιγραφή
div1.sense: a reply in writing, such as Caesarʼs Anticato in reply to Ciceroʼs Cato, Plut.
as law-term, a plea, indictment, Plat., Dem.

div1.head: ἀντίγραφος
div1.sense: copied, Dem.:—as Subst., ἀντίγραφον, τό, a transcript, copy, counterpart, Dem.

div1.head: ἀντιγράφω
div1.sense: to write against or in answer, write back, Thuc., Plut.
Mid., with perf. pass., as law-term, to put in as a plea, to plead against, Dem.

div1.head: ἀντιδάκνω
div1.sense: to bite in turn, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀντίδειπνος
div1.sense: taking anotherʼs place at dinner, Luc.

div1.head: ἀντιδεξιόομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to salute in return, τινα Xen.

div1.head: ἀντιδέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to entreat in return, Plat.

div1.head: ἀντιδέρκομαι
div1.sense: Dep. = ἀντιβλέπω, c. acc., Eur.

div1.head: ἀντιδέχομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to receive or accept in return, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: ἀντιδημαγωγέω
div1.sense: to rival as a demagogue, Plut.

div1.head: ἀντιδιαβαίνω
div1.sense: to cross over in turn, Xen.

div1.head: ἀντιδιαβάλλω
div1.sense: to attack in return, Arist.

div1.head: ἀντιδιαπλέκω
div1.sense: to retort, Aeschin.

div1.head: ἀντιδιατίθημι
div1.sense: mid., to offer resistance, τοὺς ἀντιδιατιθεμένους opponents, NTest.

div1.head: ἀντιδιδάσκω
div1.sense: to teach in turn or on the other side, Anth.:—of poets, to contend for the prize, Ar.

div1.head: ἀντιδίδωμι
div1.sense: to give in return, repay, τί τινι Hdt., Attic
to give for or instead of, τί τινος Eur.; τι ἀντί τινος Ar.
at Athens, ἀντ. τὴν οὐσίαν to offer to change fortunes with one (cf. ἀντίδοσις), Dem., etc.

div1.head: ἀντιδιέξειμι
div1.sense: to go through in turn, Aeschin.

div1.head: ἀντιδικέω
div1.sense: to dispute, go to law, περί τινος Xen.; οἱ ἀντιδικοῦντες the parties to a suit, Plat.; absol. of the defendant, Ar.; ἀντ. πρός τι or πρός τινα, to urge oneʼs suit against . . , Dem.

div1.head: ἀντίδικος
div1.sense: an opponent in a suit, defendant or plaintiff, Plat., etc.: generally an opponent, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀντίδοξος
div1.sense: of a different opinion or sect, Luc.

div1.head: ἀντίδορος
div1.sense: clothed with something instead of a skin, Anth.

div1.head: ἀντίδοσις
div1.sense: a giving in return, exchange, Arist., Luc.

at Athens, a form by which a citizen charged with a λειτουργία or public charge might call upon any other citizen whom he thought richer than himself either to exchange properties, or to take the charge upon himself, Xen., Dem., etc.

div1.head: ἀντίδοτος
div1.sense: given in lieu of, πυρός Anth.
given as a remedy for, κακῶν Anth.:—as Subst., ἀντίδοτος, ἡ, an antidote, Anth.

div1.head: ἀντιδουλεύω
div1.sense: to serve in place of, τινός Eur.

div1.head: ἀντίδουλος
div1.sense: treated as a slave, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀντίδουπος
div1.sense: re-echoing, Aesch.; ἀντίδουπά τινι Aesch.

div1.head: ἀντιδράω
div1.sense: to act against, retaliate, Soph., Eur.
c. acc. pers. to repay, requite, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: ἀντιδωρέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to present in return, τινά τινι one with a thing, Hdt., Plat., etc.; also, ἀντ. τινί τι to present a thing in turn to one, Eur.

div1.head: ἀντιζητέω
div1.sense: to seek one who is seeking us, Xen.

div1.head: ἀντιζωγρέω
div1.sense: to save alive in turn, Babr.

div1.head: ἀντιθάπτω
div1.sense: to bury opposite: Pass., aor2 ἀντετάφην ᾶ, Anth.

div1.head: ἀντίθεος
div1.sense: equal to the gods, godlike, Hom.

div1.head: ἀντιθεραπεύω
div1.sense: to take care of in return, Xen.

div1.head: ἀντίθεσις
div1.sense: opposition, resistance, Plat., Anth.
antithesis, Isocr.

div1.head: ἀντιθέω
div1.sense: to run against another, compete in a race, Hdt.
to run contrary ways, Anth.

div1.head: ἀντιθήγω
div1.sense: to whet against another, ὀδόντας ἐπί τινα Luc.

div1.head: ἀντίθροος
div1.sense: echoing, Anth.

div1.head: ἀντίθυρος
div1.sense: opposite the door: as neut. Subst., ἀντίθυρον, ου, τό, the part facing the door, the vestibule, Od., Soph.
the side of a room facing the door, Luc.

div1.head: ἀντικάθημαι
div1.etym: perf. of ἀντικαθίζομαι, but used as pres.
div1.sense: to be set over against; of armies or fleets, to lie over against, so as to watch each other, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντικαθίζομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to sit or lie over against, or armies or fleets watching one another, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντικαθίστημι
div1.sense: to lay down or establish instead, substitute, replace, Hdt., Thuc.
to set against, oppose, τινὰ πρός τινα Thuc.; τινά τινι Plat.
to bring back again, restore, Thuc.
Pass., with aor2 and perf. act., and aor1 pass. κατεστάθην [ᾰ], to be put in anotherʼs place, reign in his stead, Hdt., Xen.
to stand against, resist, τινί Xen.; absol., Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντικακουργέω
div1.sense: to damage in turn, τινά Plat.

div1.head: ἀντικαλέω
div1.sense: to invite in turn, Xen.

div1.head: ἀντικαταθνῄσκω
div1.sense: to die or be slain in turn, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀντικαταλείπω
div1.sense: to leave in oneʼs stead, Plat.

div1.head: ἀντικαταλλάσσομαι
div1.sense: Mid., to exchange one thing for another:
to give one thing for another, τί τινος Dem.; τι ἀντί or ὑπέρ τινος Oratt.
to receive one thing in exchange for another, τι ἀντί τινος Isocr.

div1.head: ἀντικατατείνω
div1.sense: to stretch out or set directly in contrast, τι παρά τι Plat.

div1.head: ἀντικατηγορέω
div1.sense: to accuse in turn, recriminate upon, τινός Aeschin.

div1.head: Ἀντικάτων
div1.sense: Anticato, name of a book written by Caesar in reply to the Cato of Cicero, Plut.

div1.head: ἀντίκειμαι
div1.sense: to be set over against, lie opposite, Plat.: adv. part. ἀντικειμένως, by way of opposition, Arist.

div1.head: ἀντικελεύω
div1.sense: to command in turn, Thuc.:— Pass. to be bidden to do a thing in turn, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντίκεντρον
div1.sense: something acting as a goad, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀντικηδεύω
div1.sense: to tend instead of another, τινός Eur.

div1.head: ἀντικηρύσσω
div1.sense: to proclaim in answer, Eur.

div1.head: ἀντικλάζω
div1.sense: to sound against, to be echoed by a thing, Eur.:— ἀντ. ἀλλήλαις μέλος to sing against one another, Eur.

div1.head: ἀντικλαίω
div1.sense: to weep in return, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀντικνήμιον
div1.sense: the part of the leg opposite the κνήμη, the shin, Ar.

div1.head: ἀντικολάζω
div1.sense: Pass. to be punished in return, Luc.

div1.head: ἀντικολακεύω
div1.sense: to flatter in turn, Plut.

div1.head: ἀντικομίζω
div1.sense: to bring back as an answer, Plut.

div1.head: ἀντικομπάζω
div1.sense: to boast in opposition, τινί Plut.

div1.head: ἀντικόπτω
div1.sense: to beat back, resist, oppose, Xen.
impers., ἤν τι ἀντικόψηι if there be any hindrance, Xen.

div1.head: ἀντικορύσσομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to take arms against, τινί Anth.

div1.head: ἀντικρατέω
div1.sense: to hold instead of another, Anth.

div1.head: ἀντίκρουσις
div1.sense: a striking against, hindrance: a repartee, Aeschin.

div1.head: ἀντικρούω
div1.sense: to strike against, to be a hindrance, counteract, τινί Thuc.; πρός τι Plut.; absol., Dem.

div1.head: ἀντικρύ
div1.sense: = ἄντην, over against, right opposite, c. dat., θεοῖς ἀντικρὺ μάχεσθαι Il.; c. gen., Ἕκτορος ἀντικρύ Il.
= ἄντικρυς, straight on, right on, Hom.; followed by a prep., ἀντικρὺ ἀνʼ ὀδόντας, ἀντικρὺ διʼ ὤμου Hom.; ἀντικρὺ κατὰ μέσσον right in the middle, Il.
outright, utterly, ἀντικρὺ δʼ ἀπόφημι Il.

div1.head: ἄντικρυς
div1.sense: straight on, right on, Thuc., etc.
outright, openly, without disguise, Aesch., Thuc., etc.; ἀντ. δουλεία downright slavery, Thuc.; οὐκ ἄντικρυς not at all, Ar.
later, = ἀντῑκρύ, opposite, Arist., Plut.

div1.head: ἀντικτόνος
div1.sense: in requital for murder, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀντικτυπέω
div1.sense: to ring, clash against, τινί Anth.

div1.head: ἀντικύρω
div1.sense: to hit upon, meet, τινί Pind., Soph.

div1.head: ἀντικωμῳδέω
div1.sense: to ridicule in turn, Plut.

div1.head: ἀντιλαβή
div1.sense: a thing to hold by, a handle, Lat. ansa, Thuc.:—metaph., πολλὰς . . ἔχει ἀντιλαβάς gives many handles against one, points of attack, Plat.

div1.head: ἀντιλαγχάνω
div1.sense: as a law-term, ἀντ. δίαιταν to have a new arbitration granted, i. e. to get the old one set aside, Dem.; ἀντ. ἔρημον (sc. τὴν δίκην) to get it set aside by default, Dem.

div1.head: ἀντιλάζομαι
div1.sense: to take hold of, hold by, c. gen., Eur.; to partake in, πόνων Eur.
c. acc. to receive in turn, Eur.

div1.head: ἀντιλακτίζω
div1.sense: to kick against, τινί Ar.

div1.head: ἀντιλαμβάνω
div1.sense: to receive instead of, τί τινος Eur.: to receive in turn or as a return, τι Eur., etc.
Mid., with perf. pass. -είλημμαι, like ἀντέχομαι, c. gen. to lay hold of, Theogn., etc.; χώρας ἀντ. to gain or reach it, Thuc.
to help, take part with, assist, Eur.; c. gen. rei, to help towards a thing, Thuc.; c. gen. pers., NTest.
to lay claim to, τοῦ θρόνου Ar.
to take part, or share in a thing, take in hand, Lat. capessere, τῶν πραγμάτων Xen., etc.
to take hold of for the purpose of finding fault, to reprehend, ἡμῶν Plat.
to take fast hold of, to captivate, ὁ λόγος ἀντιλαμβάνεταί μου Plat.
in Mid. also, to hold against, hold back, ἵππου Xen.

div1.head: ἀντιλάμπω
div1.sense: to kindle a light in turn, Aesch.
intr. to reflect light, shine, Xen.
to shine opposite to or in the face of, ὁ ἥλιος ἀντ. τινί Plut.

div1.head: ἀντιλέγω
div1.etym: the common fut. is ἀντερῶ; the aor. commonly used is ἀντεῖπον
div1.sense: to speak against, gainsay, contradict, τινί Thuc., etc.; τινὶ περί τινος Xen.; ὑπέρ τινος Xen.; πρός τι Ar.:— ἀντ. ὡς . . to declare in opposition or answer that . . , Hdt., etc.; c. inf. to reply that . . , Thuc.; ἀντ. μὴ ποιεῖν to speak against doing, Thuc.
c. acc. rei, to allege in answer, Soph., Thuc.:—Pass. to be disputed, Xen.; of a place, to be counter-claimed, Xen.
absol. to speak one against the other, speak in opposition, Hdt., etc.; οἱ ἀντιλέγοντες Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντιλεκτέος
div1.sense: one must gainsay, Eur.

div1.head: ἀντίλεκτος
div1.sense: disputably, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντιλέων
div1.sense: lion-like, formed like ἀντίθεος, Ar.

div1.head: ἀντίληξις
div1.sense: a motion for a new arbitration, Dem.

div1.head: ἀντιληπτέος
div1.sense: one must take part in a matter, Ar.; τῶν πραγμάτων αὐτοῖς ἀντ. Dem.

div1.head: ἀντίληψις
div1.sense: a receiving in turn or exchange, Thuc.: a counter-claim, Xen.
(from Mid.), a hold, support, defence, succour, Xen.
a claim to a thing, Xen.
an objection, Plat.
(from Pass.) a being seized, a seizure, attack of sickness, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντιλογέω
div1.sense: =ἀντιλέγω to deny, Soph.
= ἀντ. λέγω 3, Ar.

div1.head: ἀντιλογία
div1.sense: contradiction, controversy, disputation, Hdt., Thuc.; in pl. opposing arguments, answering speeches, Ar., Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντιλογίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to count up or calculate on the other hand, Xen.

div1.head: ἀντιλογικός
div1.sense: given to contradiction, contradictory, disputatious, Ar., etc.:— ἡ -κή (sc. τέχνη) the art of contradiction or of arguing from contradictories, Plat.

div1.head: ἀντίλογος
div1.sense: contradictory, reverse, Eur.

div1.head: ἀντιλοιδορέω
div1.sense: to rail at or abuse in turn, NTest.; Mid., c. acc. rei, Luc.

div1.head: ἀντιλυπέω
div1.sense: to vex in return, Plut.

div1.head: ἀντίλυρος
div1.sense: responsive to the lyre, Soph.

div1.head: ἀντίλυτρον
div1.sense: a ransom, NTest.

div1.head: ἀντιμαίνομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to rage or bluster against, τινί Anth.

div1.head: ἀντιμανθάνω
div1.sense: to learn instead, Ar.

div1.head: ἀντιμαρτυρέω
div1.sense: to appear as witness against, to contradict solemnly, τινί Plut.

div1.head: ἀντιμαρτύρομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to protest on the other hand, Luc.

div1.head: ἀντιμάχομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to fight against one, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντιμεθέλκω
div1.sense: to drag different ways, Anth.

div1.head: ἀντιμεθίστημι
div1.sense: to move from one side to the other, to revolutionise, Ar.
Pass., with aor. 2 and perf. act., to pass over to the other side, Luc.

div1.head: ἀντιμειρακιεύομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to behave petulantly in return, πρός τινα Plut.

div1.head: ἀντιμέλλω
div1.sense: to wait and watch against one, aor1 inf. ἀντιμελλῆσαι, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντιμέμφομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to blame in turn, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀντιμερίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to impart in turn, Anth.

div1.head: ἀντιμέτειμι
div1.sense: to compete: οἱ ἀντιμετιόντες competitors, Plut.

div1.head: ἀντιμετρέω
div1.sense: to measure out in turn, to give in compensation, Luc.: Pass. to be measured in turn, NTest.

div1.head: ἀντιμέτωπος
div1.sense: front to front, Xen.

div1.head: ἀντιμηχανάομαι
div1.sense: to contrive against or in opposition, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντιμίμησις
div1.sense: close imitation of a person in a thing, c. dupl. gen., Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντιμισθία
div1.sense: a requital, recompense, NTest.

div1.head: ἀντίμισθος
div1.sense: as a reward, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀντιμοιρεί
div1.sense: by way of compensation, Dem.

div1.head: ἀντίμολπος
div1.sense: sounding instead of, differing in sound from, c. gen., Eur.; ὕπνου ἀντίμολπον ἄκος song, sleepʼs substitute, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀντίμορφος
div1.sense: corresponding to, τινί Luc.

div1.head: ἀντιναυπηγέω
div1.sense: to build ships against, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντινικάω
div1.sense: to conquer in turn, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀντινομία
div1.sense: ambiguity in the law, ἐν ἀντινομίαι γίγνεσθαι to be in a strait between two laws, Plut.

div1.head: ἀντιξοέω
div1.sense: to set oneself against, Pind.

div1.head: ἀντίξοος
div1.sense: opposed, adverse, Hdt.:— τὸ ἀντίξοον opposition, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀντιόομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to resist, oppose, τινί Hdt., Aesch.:— οἱ ἀντιούμενοι οἱ ἐναντίοι, Hdt.:—c. acc., once in Hdt.

div1.head: ἀντίος
div1.sense: set against, and so
in local sense, face to face, opposite, esp. in battle, Hom., etc.; ἀντίος ἦλθε went to meet him, Il.; c. gen., Ἀγαμέμνονος ἀντίος Il.; usually c. dat., Od., Hdt., Attic
opposite, contrary, Aesch., Eur.: οἱ ἀντίοι οἱ ἐναντίοι, Pind., Hdt.: ἐκ τῆς ἀντίης contrariwise, Hdt.
as adv. in neut. ἀντία and ἀντίον, against, straight at, right against, ἀντίον ἷζεν Od., etc.; c. gen., ἀντίʼ ἐμεῖο Il.; so, ἀντία σευ in thy presence, Hdt.; ἀντία τῆς ἵππου opposite it, Hdt.
against, ἀντίον τινος εἰπεῖν Od.; c. dat., ἀντία τοῖς Πέρσηισι Hdt.
τὸν δʼ ἀντίον ηὔδα ἠμείβετο, answered, Od., Attic

div1.head: ἀντιοστατέω
div1.sense: =ἀνθίσταμαι,to be contrary, of a wind, Soph.

div1.head: ἀντιοχεύομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to drive against, Anth.

div1.head: ἀντιπαθής
div1.sense: in return for suffering, Aesch.: felt mutually, Luc.
as Subst., ἀντιπαθές, a remedy for suffering, Plut.

div1.head: ἀντιπαίζω
div1.sense: to play one with another, Xen.

div1.head: ἀντίπαις
div1.sense: like a boy or child, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: ἀντίπαλος
div1.sense: properly wrestling against: then, generally, struggling against, antagonistic, rival, Aesch.; c. dat. rivalling, a match for another, Eur.; c. gen., ὑμεναίων γόος ἀντίπαλος Eur.:—as Subst., ἀντίπαλος, ὁ, an antagonist, rival, adversary, mostly in pl., Hdt., Attic; τὸ ἀντίπαλον the rival party, Thuc.

of things, like ἰσόπαλος, nearly balanced, Thuc.; ἀντ. τριήρης equally large, Thuc.; ἀντ. δέος fear equal on both sides, mutual fear, Thuc.; ἤθεα ἀντίπαλα τῆι πόλει habits corresponding to the constitution, Thuc.:— τὸ ἀντίπαλον τῆς ναυμαχίας the equal balance, undecided state of the action, Thuc.:—adv. -λως, and in neut. pl. ἀντίπαλα, Thuc.
[II.] τὸν ἀμὸν ἀντ. him who fights for me, my champion, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀντιπαραβάλλω
div1.sense: to hold side by side, to compare or contrast, τι πρός τι or παρά τι Plat., etc.

div1.head: ἀντιπαραβολή
div1.sense: close comparison or contrast, Arist.

div1.head: ἀντιπαραγγελία
div1.sense: competition for a public office, Plut.

div1.head: ἀντιπαραγγέλλω
div1.sense: to command in turn or also, Xen.
to compete for a public office, τινί with one, Plut.

div1.head: ἀντιπαράγω
div1.sense: to lead the army against, advance to meet the enemy, Xen.

div1.head: ἀντιπαραθέω
div1.sense: to outflank, Xen.

div1.head: ἀντιπαρακαλέω
div1.sense: to summon in turn or contrariwise, Thuc., etc.

div1.head: ἀντιπαρακελεύομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to exhort in turn or contrariwise, Thuc., etc.

div1.head: ἀντιπαραλυπέω
div1.sense: to annoy in turn, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντιπαραπλέω
div1.sense: to sail along on the other side, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντιπαρασκευάζομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to prepare oneself in turn, arm on both sides, Thuc.; ἀντ. ἀλλήλοις ὡς ἐς μάχην Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντιπαρασκευή
div1.sense: mutual preparation, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντιπαρατάσσομαι
div1.sense: Mid. and Pass. to stand in array against, τινι Thuc.; πρός τι Aeschin.:—absol. to stand in hostile array, Thuc.; ἀπὸ τοῦ ἀντιπαραταχθέντος in hostile array, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντιπαρατείνω
div1.sense: to stretch side by side, so as to compare, τι πρός τι Plat.

div1.head: ἀντιπαρατίθημι
div1.sense: to contrast and compare, τινί τι Plat.

div1.head: ἀντιπάρειμι
div1.sense: to march so as to meet, of armies on opposite sides of a river or the like, Xen.

div1.head: ἀντιπαρεξάγω
div1.sense: to lead on against, Plut.
(sub. στρατόν) to march against, Philipp. ap. Dem.
to march parallel with, τινί Plut.

div1.head: ἀντιπαρέρχομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to pass by on the opposite side, NTest.

div1.head: ἀντιπαρέχω
div1.sense: to supply in turn, Thuc.:—Mid., Xen.; ἀντ. πράγματα to cause trouble in return, Dem.

div1.head: ἀντιπάσχω
div1.sense: to suffer in turn, ἀντιπάσχω χρηστά I receive good for good done, Soph.; ἀντ. ἀντί τινος Thuc.: absol. to suffer for oneʼs acts, Xen.
absol., τὸ ἀντιπεπονθός reciprocity, Arist.

div1.head: ἀντιπαταγέω
div1.sense: to clatter so as to drown other sounds, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντί
div1.sense: c. gen. orig.:— sense over against, opposite.
Usage,
of Place, instead, in the place of, Hom., etc.
as good as, equal to, ἀντὶ πολλῶν λαῶν ἐστίν he is as good as many men, Il.; ἀντὶ κασιγνήτου Od.
at the price of, for, ἀντὶ χρημάτων for money paid, Hdt., etc.
for the sake of, Soph.
to mark comparison, ἓν ἀνθʼ ἑνός one set against the other, compared with it, Plat.: so, after Comparatives, πλέον ἀντὶ σοῦ Soph.; also (esp. after a negative), ἄλλος ἀντʼ ἐμοῦ Aesch.
Position: ἀντί rarely follows its case, and then does not suffer anastrophe.
IN COMPOS.,
over against, opposite, as ἀντίπορος.
in return, as ἀντιβοηθέω.
instead, as ἀντήνωρ.
equal to, like, as ἀντίθεος.
counter, as ἀντίτυπος.

div1.head: ἀντιπέμπω
div1.sense: to send back an answer, Hdt.
to send in repayment, Soph.
to send against, στρατιάν τινι Thuc.
to send in the place of another, στρατηγούς Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντιπενθής
div1.sense: causing grief in turn, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀντιπέραιος
div1.sense: lying over against: ἀντιπέραια the lands just opposite, Il.

div1.head: ἀντιπέρα
div1.sense: the opposite coast, Mosch.

div1.head: ἀντιπέρας
div1.sense: over against, on the other side, c. gen., Thuc.; absol., ἡ ἀντ. Θράικη Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντιπέρηθεν
div1.sense: from the opposite side, c. gen., Anth.

div1.head: ἀντιπεριλαμβάνω
div1.sense: to embrace in turn, Xen.

div1.head: ἀντιπεριπλέω
div1.sense: to sail round on the other side, Strab.

div1.head: ἀντιπεριχωρέω
div1.sense: to move round in turn or in opposition, Plut.

div1.head: ἀντίπετρος
div1.sense: like stone, rocky, Soph.

div1.head: ἀντίπηξ
div1.sense: a kind of cradle for infants, on wheels, Eur.

div1.head: ἀντιπίπτω
div1.sense: to fall against, resist, τινί NTest.

div1.head: ἀντιπλέω
div1.sense: to sail against an enemy, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντιπλήξ
div1.sense: beaten by the opposing waves, Soph.

div1.head: ἀντιπληρόω
div1.sense: to man ships against the enemy, Thuc.
to fill up by new members, Xen.

div1.head: ἀντιπλήσσω
div1.sense: to strike in turn, Arist.

div1.head: ἀντιπνέω
div1.sense: of winds to be contrary, Plut., Luc.

div1.head: ἀντίπνοος
div1.sense: caused by adverse winds, Aesch.: adverse, hostile, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀντιποθέω
div1.sense: to long for in turn, τι Xen.

div1.head: ἀντιποιέω
div1.sense: to do in return, τι Plat.: absol. to retaliate, Xen.
Mid. to exert oneself about a thing, seek after, lay claim to, c. gen., Thuc., Plat., etc.; c. inf., ἀντ. ἐπίστασθαί τι to lay claim to knowing, Plat.
to contend with one for a thing, ἀντ. τινὶ τῆς ἀρχῆς Xen.; τινι περί τινος Xen.

div1.head: ἀντίποινα
div1.sense: requital, retribution, ἀντίποινα τίνειν ἀντιτίνειν, to atone for, c. acc., Aesch.; ἀντίποινά τινος πράσσειν to exact retribution for a thing, Aesch.; ἀντίποινʼ ἐμοῦ παθεῖν to suffer retribution forthe wrong done me, Soph.

div1.head: ἀντιπολεμέω
div1.sense: to urge war against others, Thuc., etc.; c. dat., Xen.

div1.head: ἀντιπολέμιος
div1.sense: warring against, οἱ ἀντιπολέμιοι enemies, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντιπολιορκέω
div1.sense: to besiege in turn, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντίπολις
div1.sense: a rival city, τινι Strab.

div1.head: ἀντιπολιτεύομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to be a political opponent, Arist.; ἀντ. τινι to oppose his policy, Plut.

div1.head: ἀντιπορεῖν
div1.etym: aor2 with no pres. in use
div1.sense: to give instead, Anth.

div1.head: ἀντιπορεύομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to march to meet another, Xen.

div1.head: ἀντιπορθέω
div1.sense: to ravage in return, Eur.

div1.head: ἀντίπορθμος
div1.sense: over the straits, on the opposite side of the straits, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: ἀντίπορος
div1.sense: on the opposite coast, Aesch.; Ἄρτεμιν Χαλκίδος ἀντίπορον, i. e. her temple at Aulis over against Chalcis, Aesch.:—simply, over against, opposite to, τινι Xen.

div1.head: ἀντίπραξις
div1.sense: counteraction, resistance, Plut.

div1.head: ἀντιπράσσω
div1.sense: to act against, seek to counteract, τινί Xen.:— absol. to act in opposition, Hdt., etc.; so in Mid., Xen.

div1.head: ἀντιπρεσβεύομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to send counter-ambassadors, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντιπρόειμι
div1.sense: to come forward against or
to meet, τινί Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντίπροικα
div1.sense: for next to nothing, cheap, Xen.

div1.head: ἀντιπροκαλέομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to retort a legal challenge (πρόκλησις), Dem.

div1.head: ἀντιπροσαγορεύω
div1.sense: to salute in turn, Plut.

div1.head: ἀντιπρόσειμι
div1.sense: to go against, Xen.

div1.head: ἀντιπροσεῖπον
div1.sense: serving as aor2 to ἀντιπροσαγορεύω, Theophr.: aor1 pass. ἀντιπροσερρήθην, Xen.

div1.head: ἀντιπροσκαλέομαι
div1.sense: to summon in turn, Dem.

div1.head: ἀντιπροσφέρω
div1.sense: to bring near in turn, τί τινι Xen.

div1.head: ἀντιπρόσωπος
div1.sense: with the face towards, facing, τινι Xen.: face to face, Xen.

div1.head: ἀντιπροτείνω
div1.sense: to offer in turn, τὴν δεξιάν Xen.

div1.head: ἀντίπρῳρος
div1.sense: with the prow towards, Hdt., Thuc.: prow to prow, Thuc.
like ἀντιπρόσωπος, face to face, Soph.

div1.head: ἀντίπυλος
div1.sense: with gates opposite, ἀλλήληισι Hdt.

div1.head: ἀντίπυργος
div1.sense: like a tower, Eur.

div1.head: ἀντιπυργόω
div1.sense: to build a tower over against, πόλιν τήνδʼ ἀντεπύργωσαν reared up this rival city, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀντιρρέπω
div1.sense: to counterpoise, balance, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀντίρροπος
div1.sense: counterpoising, compensating for, τινός Dem.; λύπης ἀντ. ἄχθος the counterpoising weight of sorrow, Soph.:—adv., ἀντιρρόπως πράττειν τινί so as to balance his power, Xen.

div1.head: ἀντισεμνύνομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to meet pride with pride, Arist.

div1.head: ἀντισηκόω
div1.sense: to counterbalance, compensate for, c. dat., Aesch.; c. gen., Eur.

div1.head: ἀντισκευάζομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to furnish for oneself in turn, Xen.

div1.head: ἀντισήκωσις
div1.sense: equipoise, compensation, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀντισκώπτω
div1.sense: to mock in return, Plut.

div1.head: ἀντισόομαι
div1.sense: Pass to oppose on equal terms, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντίσπαστος
div1.sense: drawn in the contrary direction: spasmodic, convulsive, Soph.

div1.head: ἀντισπάω
div1.sense: to draw the contrary way, hold back, Aesch., Ar.: Pass. to suffer a check, Arist.
to draw to itself, Xen.

div1.head: ἀντίσταθμος
div1.sense: counterpoising: in compensation for, c. gen., Soph.

div1.head: ἀντιστασιάζω
div1.sense: to form a party against, τινί Xen.; οἱ ἀντιστασιάζοντες οἱ ἀντιστασιῶται, Xen.

div1.head: ἀντίστασις
div1.sense: an opposite party, Plat.
a standing against, resistance, Plut.

div1.head: ἀντιστασιώτης
div1.sense: one of the opposite faction or party, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: ἀντιστατέω
div1.sense: to resist, oppose, τινί Plat.; absol., Hdt.

div1.head: ἀντιστάτης
div1.sense: an opponent, adversary, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀντιστοιχέω
div1.sense: to stand opposite in rows or pairs, ἀλλήλοις Xen.: to stand vis-a-vis in a dance, Xen.

div1.head: ἀντίστοιχος
div1.sense: ranged opposite in rows or pairs, Arist.: standing over against, Eur.

div1.head: ἀντιστρατεύομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to make war against, τινι Xen.

div1.head: ἀντιστρατηγέω
div1.sense: to be Propraetor, Plut.

div1.head: ἀντιστράτηγος
div1.sense: the enemyʼs general, Thuc.
the Propraetor or Pro-consul, Polyb.

div1.head: ἀντιστρατοπεδεία
div1.sense: an encamping opposite, Polyb.

div1.head: ἀντιστρατοπεδεύω
div1.sense: to encamp over against, τινί Isocr., Polyb.; mostly in Mid. with perf. pass., Hdt., Attic

div1.head: ἀντιστρέφω
div1.sense: to turn to the opposite side: intr. to wheel about, face about, Xen.

div1.head: ἀντιστροφή
div1.sense: a turning about: the antistrophe or returning of the chorus, answering to a previous στροφή, except that they now moved from left to right instead of from right to left.

div1.head: ἀντίστροφος
div1.sense: turned so as to face one another: correlative, coordinate, counterpart, τινι to a thing, Plat.: also ἀντίστροφός τινος, as if ἀντ. were a Subst., the correlative or counterpart of, Plat.; adv. -φως, coordinately, τινί Plat.

div1.head: ἀντισύγκλητος
div1.sense: a counter-senate, Plut.

div1.head: ἀντισυλλογίζομαι
div1.sense: to answer by syllogism, Arist.

div1.head: ἀντισυναντάω
div1.sense: to meet face to face, Anth.

div1.head: ἀντισφαιρίζω
div1.sense: to play at ball against, οἱ ἀντισφαιρίζοντες the parties in a game at ball, Xen.

div1.head: ἀντίταγμα
div1.sense: an opposing force, Plut.

div1.head: ἀντιταλαντεύω
div1.sense: = ἀντισηκόω, to counterbalance, compensate for, Anth.

div1.head: ἀντίταξις
div1.sense: counter-array, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντιτάσσω
div1.sense: to set opposite to, range in battle against, τινά τινι Hdt., Aesch., etc.; τι πρός τι Aeschin.:—so in Mid., Thuc.
Mid. also to set oneself against, meet face to face, meet in battle, Eur., etc.; τινι Dem.:—Pass. to be drawn out against, τινι Hdt., Xen.; πρός τινα Hdt., Xen.; κατά τινα Xen.

div1.head: ἀντιτείνω
div1.sense: to stretch out in return, to offer in return, to repay, τι ἀντί τινος Eur.
intr. to strive against, counteract, resist, τινί, or absol., Hdt., Attic
of places, to lie over against, τινί Plut.

div1.head: ἀντιτείχισμα
div1.sense: a counter-fortification, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντιτέμνω
div1.sense: to cut against, i. e. to provide a remedy or antidote, Eur.

div1.head: ἀντιτεχνάομαι
div1.sense: Dep to contrive in opposition, counterplan, c. acc., Hdt.

div1.head: ἀντιτέχνησις
div1.sense: counter-manoeuvring, emulation, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντίτεχνος
div1.sense: rivalling in an art or craft, Ar., Plat.; c. dat., Plat.

div1.head: ἀντιτίθημι
div1.sense: to set against, oppose, c. dat., Simon.: to contrast, compare, τί τινι Hdt., Eur.; also τί τινος, Thuc.; τι πρός τι Dem.
ἀντ. τινά τινι to match one against the other in battle, Lat. committere, ἴσους ἴσοισι ἀντιθείς Eur.:—Pass. to be matched one against another, Hdt.
to retort, rejoin, Eur., Thuc.
to deposit in return, Eur., Xen.:— to give in return or as a recompense, τί τινος one thing for another, Eur.

div1.head: ἀντιτιμάω
div1.sense: to honour in return, τινά, Xen.:—f. mid. in pass. sense, Xen.
Mid as law-term, to fix a counter-estimate of damages, c. gen. pretii, Plat.

div1.head: ἀντιτιμωρέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to avenge oneself on, τινα Eur., Thuc.; absol. to take vengeance, Ar.

div1.head: ἀντιτίνω
div1.sense: to pay or suffer punishment for a thing, τι Theogn.; absol., Soph.
Mid. to exact or inflict in turn, τί τινος one thing for another, Aesch., Eur.
to avenge, punish, σὸν φόνον Eur.

div1.head: ἀντιτολμάω
div1.sense: to dare to stand against another, πρός τινα Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντίτολμος
div1.sense: boldly attacking, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀντίτομος
div1.sense: cut as a remedy for an evil: —ἀντίτομον, ου, τό, a remedy, antidote, Hom.; τινος for a thing, Pind.

div1.head: ἀντίτονος
div1.sense: strained against, resisting: as Subst., ἀντίτονα, τά, cords for a ballista, Plut.

div1.head: ἀντιτοξεύω
div1.sense: to shoot arrows in turn, Xen.

div1.head: ἀντιτορέω
div1.sense: to bore right through, c. gen., Il.; c. acc. to break open, Il.

div1.head: ἄντιτος
div1.sense: paid back, requited, avenged: ἄντιτα ἔργα the work of revenge or retribution, Od.; παιδός for her son, Il.

div1.head: ἀντιτρέφω
div1.sense: to maintain in turn, Xen.

div1.head: ἀντιτυγχάνω
div1.sense: to meet with in return, τινός Theogn., Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντίτυπος
div1.sense: repelled by a hard body, τύπος ἀντ. blow and counter-blow, of hammer and anvil, Orac. ap. Hdt.:—of sound, echoed, echoing, στόνος Soph.; κατὰ τὸ ἀντ. by repercussion, of an echo, Luc.
corresponding, as the stamp to the die, ἀντ. τῶν ἀληθινῶν figuring or representing the true, NTest.
act., of a hard body, repellent, rigid, Xen.; of hard ground, ἀντιτύπᾳ ἐπὶ γᾶι πέσε Soph.
metaph. of men, stubborn, obstinate, Xen.
opposed to, τινός Aesch.: adverse, of events, Xen.

div1.head: ἀντιτυπόω
div1.sense: to express as by a figure, Anth.

div1.head: ἀντιτύπτω
div1.sense: to beat in turn, Ar., Plat.

div1.head: ἀντιφερίζω
div1.sense: to set oneself against, measure oneself with, τινί Il., Ar.; παρά τινα Pind.

div1.head: ἀντίφερνος
div1.sense: instead of a dower, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀντιφέρω
div1.sense: to set against, τι ἐπί τινι Anth.:—Dep or Pass. to set oneself against, fight against, Hom.

div1.head: ἀντιφεύγω
div1.sense: to go into exile in turn, Eur.

div1.head: ἀντίφημι
div1.sense: to speak against, to contradict, Plat.

div1.head: ἀντιφθέγγομαι
div1.sense: to return a sound, echo, Pind., Eur.
to speak against, Luc.

div1.head: ἀντίφθογγος
div1.sense: of answering sound, imitative, Anth.

div1.head: ἀντιφιλέω
div1.sense: to love in return, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: ἀντιφίλησις
div1.sense: return of affection, Arist.

div1.head: ἀντιφιλοσοφέω
div1.sense: to hold contrary tenets, Luc.

div1.head: ἀντιφιλοτιμέομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be moved by jealousy against, πρός τι Plut.

div1.head: ἀντιφιλοφρονέομαι
div1.sense: Dep to receive kindly in turn, Plut.

div1.head: ἀντίφονος
div1.sense: in return for slaughter, in revenge for blood, Aesch., Soph.
θάνατοι ἀντ. deaths by mutual slaughter, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀντιφορτίζω
div1.sense: Mostly mid., to take in a return cargo, Dem.
to import in exchange for exports, Xen.: also as Pass., to be received in exchange for the cargo, Xen.

div1.head: ἀντιφράσσω
div1.sense: to barricade, block up, Xen.

div1.head: ἀντιφυλακή
div1.sense: a watching one against another, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντιφύλαξ
div1.sense: one posted to watch another, Luc. Now read ἀντιφυλακάς, see ἀντιφυλακή.

div1.head: ἀντιφυλάσσω
div1.sense: to watch in turn, Plat.:—Mid. to be on oneʼs guard against, τινά Xen.

div1.head: ἀντιφωνέω
div1.sense: to sound in answer, reply, Trag.
c. acc. rei, to utter in reply, Soph.:—c. acc. pers. to reply to, answer, Soph.

div1.head: ἀντίφωνος
div1.sense: sounding in answer, responsive to, c. gen., Eur.

div1.head: ἀντιχαίρω
div1.sense: to rejoice in answer to, τινί Soph.

div1.head: ἀντιχαρίζομαι
div1.sense: to shew kindness in turn, τινί Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: ἀντιχειροτονέω
div1.sense: to vote against doing a thing, ἀντ. μὴ παρέχειν Ar.; absol., Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντιχορηγέω
div1.sense: to be a rival choragus, τινί to another, Dem.

div1.head: ἀντιχόρηγος
div1.sense: a rival choragus, Dem., etc.

div1.head: ἀντιχράω
div1.sense: to be sufficient, like ἀποχράω, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀντίχριστος
div1.sense: Antichrist, NTest.

div1.head: ἀντιψάλλω
div1.sense: to play a lyre in accompaniment to, τινί Ar.

div1.head: ἀντίψαλμος
div1.sense: responsive, harmonious, Eur.

div1.head: ἀντιψηφίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep to vote against, πρός τι Plut.

div1.head: ἀντλέω
div1.sense: to bale out bilge-water, bale the ship, Theogn., Eur.
generally, to draw water, Hdt.
metaph. of toil or suffering, to exhaust, come to the end of, like Lat. exantlare or exhaurire labores, Aesch., Eur.
to squander, Soph.

div1.head: ἄντλημα
div1.sense: a bucket for drawing water, NTest.

div1.head: ἀντλία
div1.sense: the hold of a ship, Soph., Ar.
bilge-water, filth, Ar.

div1.head: ἄντλος
div1.etym: perhaps for ἀνά-τλος, the Root of -τλος being ΤΛΕ, τλάω
div1.sense: the hold of a ship, where the bilgewater settles, Lat. sentina, Od.
the bilge-water in the hold, Eur.; ἄντλον οὐκ ἐδέξατο let in no bilgewater, metaph. for "let no enemy come in, " Aesch.; εἰς ἄντλον ἐμβαίνειν πόδα, metaph. for getting into a difficulty, Eur.

div1.head: ἀντοικτίρω
div1.sense: to pity in return, τινά Eur.

div1.head: ἄντομαι
div1.etym: Dep. only in pres. and impf.
div1.sense: =ἀντάω to meet, in battle, c. dat., Il.:—absol., διπλόος ἤντετο θώρηξ the breastplate doubled (by the belt) met or stopped (the dart), Il.
= ἀντιάζω 1. 2, c. acc. pers. to approach with prayers, entreat, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: ἀντόμνυμι
div1.sense: to swear in turn, c. fut. inf., Xen.

div1.head: ἀντονομάζω
div1.sense: to name instead, call by a new name, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντοφείλω
div1.sense: to owe one a good turn, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀντοφθαλμέω
div1.sense: to meet face to face, to face, τινί Polyb., NTest.

div1.head: ἀντοχέομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to drive or ride against, Mosch.

div1.head: ἀντριάς
div1.sense: *Fem. adj. of a grotto, Anth.

div1.head: ἄντρον
div1.sense: Lat. antrum, a cave, grot, cavern, Od., Trag.

div1.head: ἀντρώδης
div1.sense: full of caves, Xen.

div1.head: ἄντυξ
div1.sense: like ἴτυς, the edge or rim of anything round or curved:
the rim of the round shield, Il.
the rail round the front of the chariot, the chariot-rail, Il.; sometimes double, and therefore ἄντυγες in pl., Il., Soph.
post-Hom.,
in pl. the chariot itself, Soph., Eur.
the frame of the lyre, Eur.
the orbit of a planet, Hhymn.; the disk of the moon, Mosch.

div1.head: ἀντῳδός
div1.sense: singing in answer, responsive, Ar., Anth.

div1.head: ἀντωμοσία
div1.sense: an oath or affidavit made one against the other, i. e. by plaintiff and defendant, Plat., etc.

div1.head: ἀντωνέομαι
div1.sense: Dep to buy instead, Xen.
to bid against, ἀλλήλοις Lys.; ὁ ἀντωνούμενος a rival bidder, Dem.

div1.head: ἀντωπός
div1.sense: with the eyes opposite, facing, fronting, Luc., Anth.

div1.head: ἀντωφελέω
div1.sense: to assist or benefit in turn, τινά Xen.:—Pass. to derive profit in turn, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνύβριστος
div1.sense: not insulted, Plut.
act. not insolent, decorous, Plut.

div1.head: ἄνυδρος
div1.sense: wanting water, waterless, of arid countries, Hdt.:—of a corpse, deprived of funeral lustrations, Eur.

div1.head: ἀνυμέναιος
div1.sense: without the nuptial song, unwedded, Soph., Eur.: neut. pl. as adv., Soph., Eur.

div1.head: ἀνυμνέω
div1.sense: to praise in song, c. acc., Eur.

div1.head: ἀνύμφευτος
div1.sense: unwedded, Soph.; ἀν. γονή birth from an ill-starred marriage, Soph.

div1.head: ἄνυμφος
div1.sense: not bridal, unwedded, Soph.; νύμφη ἄνυμφος a bride that is no bride, unhappy bride, Eur.
without bride or mistress, μέλαθρα Eur.

div1.head: ἀνυπέρβλητος
div1.sense: not to be surpassed or outdone, Xen., etc.:—adv. -τως, Arist.

div1.head: ἀνυπεύθυνος
div1.sense: not liable to give account, irresponsible, Ar., Plat.

div1.head: ἀνυποδησία
div1.sense: a going barefoot, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: ἀνυποδητέω
div1.sense: to go barefoot, Luc.

div1.head: ἀνυπόδητος
div1.sense: unshod, barefoot, Plat.

div1.head: ἀνυπόδικος
div1.sense: not liable to action, Plut.

div1.head: ἀνυπόκριτος
div1.sense: without dissimulation, NTest.

div1.head: ἀνυπονόητος
div1.sense: unsuspected, Dem.

div1.head: ἀνύποπτος
div1.sense: without suspicion, unsuspected, Thuc., Xen.:—adv. -τως, unsuspectedly, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀνυπόστατος
div1.sense: not to be withstood, irresistible, Xen., etc.

div1.head: ἀνυπότακτος
div1.sense: not made subject, τινι NTest.
unruly, refractory, of persons, NTest.

div1.head: ἀνυσιεργός
div1.sense: finishing work, industrious, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀνύσιμος
div1.sense: efficacious, effectual, εἴς τι Xen.: adv. -μως, Sup. -ώτατα, Plat.

div1.head: ἄνυσις
div1.sense: accomplishment, Hom.

div1.head: ἀνυστός
div1.sense: to be accomplished, practicable, Eur.; ὡς ἀνυστόν, like ὡς δυνατόν, σιγῆι ὡς ἀν. as silently as possible, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνυτικός
div1.sense: to be accomplished, practicable, Xen.

div1.head: ἀνυφαίνω
div1.sense: to weave anew, renew, Plat.

div1.head: ἀνυψόω
div1.sense: to raise up, exalt, Anth., in Mid.

div1.head: ἀνύω
div1.sense: to effect, achieve, accomplish, complete, Lat. conficere, c. acc. rei, Hom., etc.; absol., οὐδὲν ἤνυε he did no good, Hdt.; c. acc. et inf. to bring to pass that . . , Soph.:—Mid. to accomplish for oneʼs own advantage, Od., Plat., etc.
to make an end of, destroy, Hom., etc.
to finish a journey, ὅσσον νηῦς ἤνυσεν much as a ship can do, Od.; so, ἀν. θαλάσσης ὕδωρ to make its way over the sea water, Od.

in Attic absol. to make oneʼs way, πρὸς πόλιν Soph.; ἐπὶ ἀκτάν Eur.; also, θάλαμον ἀνύτειν to reach the bridal chamber, Soph.; with inf., ἤνυσε περᾶν succeeded in crossing, Aesch.; and with an adj., εἶναι being omitted, εὐδαίμων ἀνύσει will come to be happy, Soph.
Pass. of Time, to come to an end, Theocr.
in Pass. also of persons, to grow up, Aesch.
to get, procure, φορβάν Soph., etc.
with a partic., οὐκ ἀνύω φθονέουσα I gain nothing by gruding, Il.

to do quickly, make haste, Ar.; then, like φθάνω, ἄνυε πράττων make haste about it, Ar.; ἄνυσον ὑποδησάμενος make haste and get your shoes on, Ar.; also ἀνύσας with an imperat., ἄνοιγʼ, ἄνοιγʼ ἀνύσας make haste and open the door, Ar.; ἀνύσας τρέχε, λέγʼ ἀνύσας Ar., etc.

div1.head: ἄνω
div1.sense: to accomplish, achieve, finish, ὁδόν Od.; οὐδὲν ἦνον Eur.
Pass., of the close ofa period of time, νὺξ ἄνεται night is drawing to a close, Il.; ἔτος ἀνόμενον the waning year, Hdt.:—generally to be finished, Il.; ἤνετο τὸ ἔργον Hdt.

div1.head: ἄνω
div1.sense: implying Motion,
up, upwards, Hom., etc.; ἄνω ἰόντι going up the country, (i.e. inland), Hdt.
implying Rest, up, aloft, on high, Soph., Plat., etc.
on earth, as opp. to the world below, Soph.; οἱ ἄνω the living, opp. to οἱ κάτω the dead, Soph.
in heaven, as opp. to earth, οἱ ἄνω θεοί the gods above, Lat. superi, Soph.
generally of position, ἄνω καθῆσθαι to sit in the upper quarter of the city, i. e. the Pnyx, Dem.; ἡ ἄνω βουλή, i. e. the Areopagus, Plut.
geographically, on the north, northward, Hdt.
inward from the coast, Hdt., Xen.; ὁ ἄνω βασιλεύς the king of Persia, Hdt.
of Time, formerly, of old, Plat., etc.
above, like Lat. supra, in referring to a passage, Plat.
of tones in the voice, Plut.
ἄνω καὶ κάτω, up and down, to and fro, Eur., Ar., etc.
upside down, topsy-turvy, Lat. susque deque, τὰ μὲν ἄνω κάτω θήσω, τὰ δὲ κάτω ἄνω Hdt.; ἄνω τε καὶ κάτω στρέφων Aesch., etc.
as prep. with gen. above, Hdt.
comp. ἀνωτέρω, absol. higher, Aesch.; further, Hdt.
c. gen. above, beyond, Hdt.
Sup. ἀνωτάτω highest, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἀνώγαιον
div1.sense: anything raised from the ground; the upper floor of a house, used as a granary, Xen.; as a dining-room, Lat. coenaculum, NTest.

div1.head: ἄνωγα
div1.etym: The verb ἄνωγα is a perfect form with present sense. The pluperfect is used with imperfect sense.
div1.sense: to command, order, also to advise, desire, urge:— c. acc. pers. et inf., σιωπᾶν λαὸν ἀνώγει bade the people keep silence, Il.; also c. dat. pers., Od.; c. acc. pers., without inf., θυμὸς ἄνωγέ με my spirit bids me, Hom.

div1.head: ἀνώδυνος
div1.sense: free from pain, Soph.
act. allaying pain, Anth.

div1.head: ἄνωθεν
div1.sense: adv. of place from above, from on high, Hdt., Trag., etc.; ὕδατος ἄνωθεν γενομένου, i. e. rain, Thuc.: from the upper country, from inland, Thuc.
= ἄνω, above, on high, Trag.; οἱ ἄν. the living, opp. to οἱ κάτω, Aesch.:—c. gen., Hdt.
of Time, from the beginning, Plat., Dem.:— by descent, Theocr.; τὰ ἄν. first principles, Plat.
over again, anew, NTest.

div1.head: ἀνωθέω
div1.sense: to push up, push off from shore, Od.
Mid. to push back from oneself, to repel, repulse, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀνωϊστί
div1.sense: unlooked for, Od.

div1.head: ἀνώϊστος
div1.sense: unlooked for, unexpected, Il., Mosch.

div1.head: ἀνώλεθρος
div1.sense: indestructible, Plat.; Epic ἀν-όλεθρος having escaped ruin, Il.

div1.head: ἀνωμαλία
div1.sense: unevenness, Plat., etc.
of persons, irregularity, Aeschin.

div1.head: ἀνώμαλος
div1.sense: uneven, irregular, Plat.: τὸ ἀν. unevenness of ground, Thuc.
of fortune, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀνωμοτί
div1.sense: without oath, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀνώμοτος
div1.sense: unsworn, not bound by oath, Eur.; θεῶν ἀνώμοτος without swearing by the gods, Eur.
not sworn to, εἰρήνη Dem.

div1.head: ἀνωνόμαστος
div1.sense: nameless, indescribable, ineffable, Eur., Ar.

div1.head: ἀνώνυμος
div1.sense: without name, nameless, Od., Hdt., etc.
nameless, inglorious, Pind., Eur., Plat.

div1.head: ἀνωρία
div1.sense: untimeliness, ἀν. τοῦ ἔτεος the bad season of the year, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀνωρύομαι
div1.sense: Dep to howl aloud, Anth.

div1.head: ἀνώτατος
div1.sense: Sup. adj. formed from ἄνω, topmost, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀνωτερικός
div1.sense: upper, inland, NTest.

div1.head: ἀνώτερος
div1.sense: higher, Arist.

div1.head: ἀνωφελής
div1.sense: unprofitable, useless, Aesch., Soph., etc.
hurtful, prejudicial, Thuc.; τινι to one, Plat.: adv. -λῶς, Arist.

div1.head: ἀνωφέλητος
div1.sense: unprofitable, useless, Soph.; τινι to one, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀνώχυρος
div1.sense: not fortified, Xen.

div1.head: ἄξενος
div1.sense: inhospitable, of persons, Hes., Plat.; of places, Soph., Eur.:—comp. and Sup. -ώτερος, -ώτατος, Eur.

div1.head: Ἄξεινος
div1.sense: sc. πόντος, the Axine, afterwards called the Euxine (Euxeinus qui nunc Axenus ille fuit Ov.), Pind., Eur.

div1.head: ἄξεστος
div1.sense: unhewn, unwrought, Soph., Anth.

div1.head: ἀξιάγαστος
div1.sense: worth admiring, admirable, Xen.

div1.head: ἀξιάκουστος
div1.sense: worth hearing, Xen.

div1.head: ἀξιακρόατος
div1.sense: worth listening to, Xen.

div1.head: ἀξία
div1.sense: the worth or value of a thing, c. gen., Hdt., Eur.; money-value, price, amount, Hdt.; τῆς ἀξίας τιμᾶσθαι to estimate the penalty at the real amount, Plat.; κατʼ ἀξίαν τῆς οὐσίας Xen.
of persons, worth, reputation, rank, Thuc., etc.

generally, a manʼs due, his deserts, τὴν ἀξίαν λαμβάνειν, τῆς ἀξίας τυγχάνειν to get oneʼs deserts, Hdt., Ar.; κατʼ ἀξίαν according to desert, duly, Eur., Plat.; παρὰ τὴν ἀξίαν, οὐ κατʼ ἀξίαν Thuc., Dem.

div1.head: ἀξιαφήγητος
div1.sense: worth telling, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀξιέπαινος
div1.sense: praiseworthy, Xen.

div1.head: ἀξιέραστος
div1.sense: worthy of love, Xen.

div1.head: ἀξίνη
div1.sense: an axe-head, Il.: battle-axe. Il.: generally, an axe, Xen., NTest.

div1.head: ἀξιοβίωτος
div1.sense: worth living for, Xen.

div1.head: ἀξιοεργός
div1.sense: capable of work, Xen.

div1.head: ἀξιοζήλωτος
div1.sense: enviable, Plut.

div1.head: ἀξιοθαύμαστος
div1.sense: wonder-worthy, Xen.

div1.head: ἀξιοθέατος
div1.sense: well worth seeing, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: ἀξιόθρηνος
div1.sense: worthy of lamentation, Eur.

div1.head: ἀξιοκοινώνητος
div1.sense: worthy of oneʼs society, Plat.

div1.head: ἀξιόκτητος
div1.sense: worth getting, Xen.

div1.head: ἀξιόλογος
div1.sense: worthy of mention, noteworthy, Hdt., Plat., etc.; πόλεμος ἀξιολογώτατος Thuc.:— adv. -γως, Xen.
of persons, of note, important, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀξιομακάριστος
div1.sense: worthy to be deemed happy, Xen.

div1.head: ἀξιόμαχος
div1.sense: a match for another in battle or war, τινι Hdt., Thuc.; πρός τινα Plut.: absol., Hdt., etc.
c. inf. sufficient in strength or number to do a thing, Hdt. adv. -χως, Plut.

div1.head: ἀξιομνημόνευτος
div1.sense: worthy of mention, Plat., Xen.; shapely, beautiful, Manetho.

div1.head: ἀξιόνικος
div1.sense: worthy of victory, Xen.; c. inf., ἀξιονικότερος ἔχειν τοῦτο τὸ κράτος more worthy to hold this power, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀξιοπενθής
div1.sense: lamentable, Eur.

div1.head: ἀξιόπιστος
div1.sense: trustworthy, Plat., Dem.; εἴς τι in a thing, Xen.

div1.head: ἀξιοπρεπής
div1.sense: becoming, goodly, Xen.

div1.head: ἀξιόρατος
div1.sense: worth seeing, Luc.

div1.head: ἀξιόσκεπτος
div1.sense: worth considering, Xen.

div1.head: ἀξιοσπούδαστος
div1.sense: worthy of zealous endeavours, Xen.

div1.head: ἄξιος
div1.etym: ἄγω IV, and so properly weighing as much.
div1.sense: weighing as much, of like value, worth as much as, c. gen., Il., Hdt.; οὐδʼ ἑνὸς ἄξιοί εἰμεν Ἕκτορος we are not worth one Hector, Il.; πάντων ἄξιον ἦμαρ, Lat. instar omnium, Il.; πολλοῦ ἄξιος worth much, Xen.; πλείστου ἄξιον, quantivis pretii, Thuc.; so, παντός, τοῦ παντὸς ἄξιον Plat.; λόγου ἄξιος, ἀξιόλογος, Hdt., etc.:—opp. to these are οὐδενὸς ἄξ. Theogn.; ὀλίγου, σμικροῦ ἄξ. Plat., etc.
c. dat. pers., σοὶ δʼ ἄξιόν ἐστιν ἀμοιβῆς ʼtis worth a return to thee, i. e. will bring thee a return, Od.; πολλοῦ or πλείστου ἄξιον εἶναί τινι Xen., etc.
absol. worthy, goodly, of persons and things, Od., etc.; in Attic it sometimes has an opposite sense, of a proper value, cheap, Ar.
of things, deserved, meet, due, δίκη Soph.; χάρις Xen.
sufficient for, c. gen., Dem.

worthy of, deserving, meet for, c. gen. rei, φυγῆς, γέλωτος Eur.; c. gen. pers., ποιεῖν ἄξια οὔτε ὑμῶν οὔτε πατέρων Thuc.:—c. gen. rei et dat. pers., ἡμῖν δʼ Ἀχιλλεὺς ἄξιος τιμῆς is worthy of honour at our hands, Eur.; πολλῶν ἀγαθῶν ἄξιος ὑμῖν Ar.
c. inf., πεφάσθαι ἄξιος worthy to be killed, Il.; ἄξιός εἰμι πληγὰς λαβεῖν I deserve a flogging, Ar.

ἄξιόν ἐστι ʼtis meet, fit, due, Il., Hdt.; c. dat. pers. et inf., τῆι πόλει ἄξιον ξυλλαβεῖν τὸν ἄνδρα ʼtis meet for the city, is her duty, to arrest the man, Ar.:—the inf. is sometimes omitted, ἄξιον γὰρ Ἑλλάδι ʼtis meet in the eyes of Hellas [so to do], Ar.
adv. ἀξίως, c. gen., worthily of, Hdt.:—absol., Soph.

div1.head: ἀξιοστράτηγος
div1.sense: worthy of being general, Xen.

div1.head: ἀξιοτέκμαρτος
div1.sense: worthy of being brought in evidence, credible, Xen.

div1.head: ἀξιοφίλητος
div1.sense: worth loving, Xen.

div1.head: ἀξιόχρεως
div1.sense: worthy of a thing, and so,
absol., like ἀξιόλογος, note-worthy, considerable, notable, Hdt., Thuc.
serviceable, sufficient, αἰτίη Hdt.; ἀξ. ἐγγυηταί trustworthy, substantial, Plat.
c. inf. able, sufficient to do, Hdt., Eur., etc.
c. gen. rei, worthy, deserving of, Hdt., Dem.

div1.head: ἀξιόω
div1.sense: to think or deem worthy of a thing, whether of reward, Eur., Xen.; or of punishment, Hdt., Plat.:— Pass. to be thought worthy, τινός Hdt., Eur., etc.
c. acc. pers. to esteem, honour, Trag.
c. acc. pers. et inf. to think one worthy to do or be, Eur., etc.:—Pass., Aesch., etc.
to think fit, expect, require, demand that, Lat. postulare, ἀξ. τινα ἐλθεῖν Hdt., etc.
c. inf. only, ἀξ. κομίζεσθαι, τυγχάνειν to think one has a right to receive, expect to receive, Thuc.:—Pass. to be required to do, Dem.

to think fit, expect, consent, resolve, ἀξιῶ θανεῖν Soph.; εἴ τις ἀξιοῖ μαθεῖν if he deigns to learn, Aesch.:—so in Mid., ἀξιοῦσθαι μέλειν to deign to care for, Aesch., etc.; also as a real Mid., οὐκ ἀξιούμενος not deeming himself worthy, Hdt.
to claim, νικᾶν ἠξίουν claimed the victory, Thuc.: absol. to make a claim, Thuc.
to hold an opinion, Dem.; ἐν τῶι τοιῶιδε ἀξιοῦντι in such a state of opinion, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀξίωμα
div1.sense: that of which one is thought worthy, an honour, Eur.; γάμων ἀξ. honour of marriage, Eur.
honour, reputation, Lat. dignitas, Eur., Thuc.
rank, position, Thuc.:—of things, worth, quality, Thuc.
that which is thought fit, a decision, purpose, Soph., Dem.
in Mathematics, a self evident theorem, an axiom, Arist.

div1.head: ἀξίωσις
div1.sense: a thinking worthy, Hdt.
a being thought worthy, reputation, Thuc.
a demand or claim, Thuc.
a thinking fit, an opinion, principle, maxim, Thuc.
ἀξ. τῶν ὀνομάτων the meaning of words, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀξόανος
div1.sense: without carved images, Luc.

div1.head: ἀξόνιος
div1.sense: belonging to the axle, Anth.

div1.head: ἀξυγκρότητος
div1.sense: not welded together by the hammer:— metaph. of rowers, not trained to keep time, Thuc.

div1.head: ἄξυλος
div1.sense: with no timber, timberless, ἄξυλος ὕλη a coppice, brushwood, Il.:—others take it to be a wood from which no timber has been cut, a thick wood.
without wood, Hdt.

div1.head: ἄξων
div1.sense: an axle, Lat. axis, Il., etc.
οἱ ἄξονες, the wooden tablets of Solonʼs laws, made to turn upon an axis, Plut.

div1.head: ἄοζος
div1.etym: Perh. from α copul., ὁδός; cf. ἀκόλουθος.
div1.sense: a servant, attendant, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀοιδή
div1.sense: song, a singing, whether the art of song, Hom.; or the act of singing, song, Il.
the thing sung, a song, Hom., etc.
the subject of song, Od.

div1.head: ἀοιδιάω
div1.sense: to sing, Od.

div1.head: ἀοίδιμος
div1.sense: sung of, famous in song, Hdt.: in bad sense, notorious, infamous, Il.

div1.head: ἀοιδοθέτης
div1.sense: a lyric poet, Anth.

div1.head: ἀοιδομάχος
div1.sense: fighting with verses, Anth.

div1.head: ἀοιδοπόλος
div1.sense: one busied with song, a poet, Anth.

div1.head: ἀοιδός
div1.sense: a singer, minstrel, bard, Lat. vates, Hom., Hdt.; c. gen., χρησμῶν ἀοιδός Eur.; of the cock, Theocr.
as fem. songstress, of the nightingale, Hes.; of the Sphinx, Soph.
an enchanter, Lat. incantator, Soph.
as adj. tuneful, musical, ὄρνις ἀοιδοτάτα Eur.

div1.head: ἀοιδοτόκος
div1.sense: inspiring song, Anth.

div1.head: ἀοίκητος
div1.sense: uninhabited, Hdt.
houseless, Dem.

div1.head: ἄοικος
div1.sense: houseless, homeless, Hes., Soph., etc.
ἄοικος εἰσοίκησις a homeless, i. e. miserable, home, Soph.

div1.head: ἄοινος
div1.sense: without wine, ἄοινοι χοαί, such as were offered to the Erinyes, Aesch.; hence Soph. calls the Erinyes ἄοινοι ;—ἀοίνοις ἐμμανεῖς θυμώμασιν frantic with sober, deliberate rage, Soph.
of men, drinking no wine, sober, Xen.; of a place, having none, Xen.

div1.head: ἄοκνος
div1.sense: without hesitation, untiring, Hes., Soph., Thuc.

div1.head: ἀολλής
div1.sense: all together, in throngs, shoals or crowds, Hom., Soph., etc.

div1.head: ἀολλίζω
div1.sense: to gather together, Il.:—Pass. to come together, assemble, Il
of things, to gather together, heap up, Anth.

div1.head: ἄοπλος
div1.sense: without shields (ὅπλα), without heavy armour, Thuc., etc.: generally, unarmed, Plat.; ἅρμα ἄοπλ. a chariot without scythes, Xen.

div1.head: ἀόρατος
div1.sense: unseen, not to be seen, invisible, Plat., etc.
act. without sight, Luc.

div1.head: ἀοργησία
div1.sense: a defect in the passion of anger, "lack of gall", Arist.

div1.head: ἀόργητος
div1.sense: incapable of anger, Arist.

div1.head: ἀόριστος
div1.sense: without boundaries, Thuc.
undefined, indefinite, Dem., etc.

div1.head: ἄορνος
div1.sense: without birds, Soph.
Ἄορνος, ὁ, lake Avernus, Strab.

div1.head: ἄορ
div1.etym: α in ἄορ; but in trisyll. cases also ᾱ.
div1.sense: a hanger, sword, Hom.: he also uses a masc. acc. pl., ἄορας.

div1.head: ἀορτέω
div1.etym: lengthened form of ἀείρω, only in aor.1 pass. part. ἀορτηθείς
div1.sense: suspended, Anth.

div1.head: ἀορτήρ
div1.sense: a strap to hang anything to, a sword-belt, Hom.: a knapsack-strap, Od.

div1.head: ἀοσσέω
div1.sense: to help, τινί Mosch.

div1.head: ἀοσσητήρ
div1.sense: an assistant, helper, aider, Hom.

div1.head: ἄουτος
div1.sense: unwounded, unhurt, Il.

div1.head: ἀόχλητος
div1.sense: undisturbed, calm, Luc.

div1.head: ἀπαγγελία
div1.sense: a report, as of an ambassador, Dem.
a narrative, recital, Thuc., Plat.

div1.head: ἀπαγγέλλω
div1.sense: of a messenger, to bring tidings, report, announce, τί τινι Il., Hdt., etc.; τι πρός τινα Aesch., etc.; ἀπ. τι οἴκαδε to carry a report home, Plat.:—absol., πάλιν ἀπ. to bring back tidings, report in answer, Od.:—Pass., ἐξ ὧν ἀπηγγέλλετο as he was reported, Dem.; c. part., ἀπηγγέλθη ἐκκεκλεμμένος was reported to have been stolen away, Hdt.
of a speaker or writer, to relate, narrate, Hdt., Attic

div1.head: ἀπαγγελτήρ
div1.sense: a messenger, Anth.

div1.head: ἄπαγε
div1.etym: properly the imperat of ἀπάγω, in intr. sense.
div1.sense: away! begone! hands off! Lat. apage! Eur., Ar.

div1.head: ἀπαγής
div1.sense: not firm or stiff, of Persian caps, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀπαγινέω
div1.sense: esp of paying tribute, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀπαγόρευσις
div1.sense: failure of strength, exhaustion, Plut., Luc.

div1.head: ἀπαγορευτέος
div1.sense: one must give up, Luc.

div1.head: ἀπαγορεύω
div1.sense: to forbid, ἀπ. τινὰ μὴ ποιεῖν τι Hdt., Attic; τινά Xen.
to dissuade, Hdt.

intr. to bid farewell to, c. dat., ἀπαγ. τῶι πολέμωι to give up, renounce war, Plat.; c. part. to give up doing, Xen.:—absol. to give up, fail, sink, Xen.; of things, τὰ ἀπαγορεύοντα worn out and useless, Xen.

div1.head: ἀπαγριόομαι
div1.sense: to become wild or savage, Soph.

div1.head: ἀπαγχονίζω
div1.sense: to strangle, Anth.

div1.head: ἀπάγχω
div1.sense: to strangle, throttle, Od., Ar.; to choke with anger, Ar.:—Mid. and Pass. to hang oneself, to be hanged, Hdt., Attic: to be ready to choke, Ar.

div1.head: ἀπαγωγή
div1.sense: a leading away, Xen.
payment of tribute, Hdt.
as Attic law-term, a process by which a person caught in the act (ἐπʼ αὐτοφώρωι) might be arrested and brought before the Magistrates, Oratt.: — the written complaint laid before the Court, Lys.

div1.head: ἀπάγω
div1.sense: to lead away, carry off, Od., Trag.:— Mid. to take away for or with oneself, Hdt., Trag.:— Pass., ἐς ὀξὺ ἀπηγμένος brought to a point, tapering off, Hdt.
intr. (sub. ἑαυτόν) to retire, withdraw, march away, Hdt., Xen.; cf. ἄπαγε.
to bring back, bring home, Hom., Attic
to return what one owes, render, pay, τὸν φόρον Ar., Thuc.
to arrest and carry off, παρά τινα Hdt.:—esp. as Attic lawterm, to bring before a magistrate and accuse, Dem.:— then, to carry off to prison, Plat., etc.
to lead away from the subject, Plat., etc.

div1.head: ἀπᾴδω
div1.sense: to sing out of tune, be out of tune, Plat.
metaph. to dissent, ἀπʼ ἀλλήλων Plat.
to wander away, ἀπὸ τοῦ ἐρωτήματος Plat.

div1.head: ἀπαείρω
div1.sense: poet. for ἀπαίρω, to depart, Eur.:—Mid. to depart from, c. gen., Il.

div1.head: ἀπαθανατίζω
div1.sense: to aim at immortality, Plat., Arist.

div1.head: ἀπάθεια
div1.sense: want of sensation, insensibility, Arist.

div1.head: ἀπαθής
div1.sense: not suffering or having suffered, without experience of a thing, c. gen., Theogn., Hdt., Attic:—absol., id=Attic
without passion or feeling: — adv., ἀπαθῶς ἔχειν to be without feeling, Plut.

div1.head: ἀπαιγειρόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be changed into a poplar, Strab.

div1.head: ἀπαιδαγώγητος
div1.sense: without teacher or guide, Arist.: uneducated, untaught, τινος in a thing, Arist.

div1.head: ἀπαιδευσία
div1.sense: want of education, Thuc., Plat.
ignorance, boorishness, coarseness, Plat., etc.
c. gen., ἀπαιδευσίαι ὀργῆς from want of control over passion, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀπαίδευτος
div1.sense: uneducated, Eur., Plat.:— c. gen. uninstructed in a thing, Xen.
ignorant, boorish, coarse, Eur., Plat.
adv., ἀπαιδεύτως ἔχειν to be without education, Eur.

div1.head: ἀπαιδία
div1.sense: childlessness, Hdt., Soph.

div1.head: ἀπαιθριάζω
div1.sense: to clear away clouds from the sky, Ar.

div1.head: ἀπαίνυμαι
div1.sense: to take away, withdraw, τί τινος Od.: to pluck off, Mosch.

div1.head: ἀπαιολάω
div1.sense: to perplex, confound, Eur.

div1.head: ἀπαιόλη
div1.sense: cheating, fraud, personified in Ar.

div1.head: ἀπαίρω
div1.sense: to lift off, carry off, take away, to remove from, τί τινος Eur.: absol., Hdt.

to lead away a sea or land force, Hdt.:—intr. (sub. ναῦς, στρατόν, etc.), to sail or march away, depart, Hdt., Attic; c. gen., ἀπαίρειν χθονός to depart from the land, Eur.: c. acc. cogn., ἀπ. πρεσβείαν to set out on an embassy, Dem.

div1.head: ἄπαις
div1.sense: childless, Hdt.; τὰς ἄπαιδας οὐσίας her childless estate, Soph.:—c. gen., ἄπ. ἔρσενος γόνου without male heirs, Hdt.; τέκνων ἄπαιδα Eur.; etc.
Νυκτὸς παῖδες ἄπαιδες children of Night, yet children none, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀπαΐσσω
div1.sense: to spring from aheight, c. gen., Il.
to dart away, Soph.

div1.head: ἀπαισχύνομαι
div1.sense: to refuse through shame, Plat.

div1.head: ἀπαιτέω
div1.sense: to demand back, demand, Hdt.:— ἀπ. τί τινα to demand something of one, Hdt., Attic; ἀπ. ὅπλα τοῦ πατρός Soph.; also, χάριν ἀπ. τινα Plat.
Pass., of things, to be demanded in payment, Hdt.
of persons, to have demanded of one, ἀπαιτεῖσθαι εὐεργεσίαν Xen.

div1.head: ἀπαίτησις
div1.sense: a demanding back, Hdt.; ἀπ. ποιεῖσθαι to make a formal demand, Dem.

div1.head: ἀπαιτίζω
div1.sense: only in pres. part., = ἀπαιτέω, to demand back, χρήματα Od.

div1.head: ἀπαιωρέομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to hang down from above, hang suspended, hover about, Hes.

div1.head: ἀπακριβόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be finished off, highly finished, Plat., Isocr.
as Mid. to finish off, Anth., Luc.

div1.head: ἀπάλαιστρος
div1.sense: not trained in the palaestra, unskilled in wrestling, Anth.: awkward, Cic.

div1.head: ἀπάλαλκε
div1.etym: aor2 with no pres. in use, v. ἄλαλκε
div1.sense: to ward off something from one, τί τινος Hom.; Epic inf. ἀπαλαλκέμεν, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀπάλαμνος
div1.sense: without hands, helpless, good for naught, Il.
impracticable, reckless, lawless, ἔρδειν ἔργʼ ἀπάλαμνα Solon.; ἀπάλαμνόν τι πάσχειν Eur.

div1.head: ἀπάλαμος
div1.sense: like ἀπάλαμνος, helpless, Hes., Pind. [ᾱp - metri grat.]

div1.head: ἀπαλάομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to go astray, wander, Hes.

div1.head: ἀπαλγέω
div1.sense: to feel no more pain at a thing, τι Thuc.; ἀπ. τὸ πένθος to put away sorrow, Plut.

div1.head: ἀπαλείφω
div1.sense: to wipe off, expunge from a register, Dem.; ἀπ. τι to cancel it, Aeschin.

div1.head: ἀπαλέξω
div1.sense: to ward something off from a person, τί τινος Il.
reversely to keep a person from suffering something, τινά τινος Od.
Mid. to defend oneself, ἀπαλέξασθαί τι Soph.

div1.head: ἀπαληθεύω
div1.sense: to speak the whole truth, Xen., in Mid.

div1.head: ἀπαλθαίνομαι
div1.sense: Dep to heal thoroughly, Il.

div1.head: ἀπαλλαγή
div1.sense: deliverance, release, relief from a thing, riddance of it, πόνων, ξυμφορᾶς Aesch., Soph., etc.
absol. a divorce, Eur.
(from Pass.) a going away, a means of getting away, an escape, departure, Hdt.; ἡ ἀπ. ἀλλήλων separation from one another, of combatants, Thuc.
ἀπ. τοῦ βίου departure from life, Xen.; ψυχῆς ἀπὸ σώματος Plat.

div1.head: ἀπαλλακτέος
div1.sense: one must release from, τινά τινος Plut.
(from Pass.) one must withdraw from, get rid of, τινός Plat.

div1.head: ἀπαλλαξείω
div1.sense: to wish to be delivered from or get rid of, τινός Thuc.

div1.head: ἀπαλλάσσω
div1.etym: The middle future ἀπαλλάξομαι has a passive sense.
div1.sense: Act.
to set free, release, deliver a person from a thing, τινά τινος Hdt., Attic
to put away or remove a thing from a person, τί τινος Eur., etc.
