c. acc. only, to put away, remove, dismiss, τι or τινα Eur., Thuc., etc.: to destroy, ἑαυτόν Plut.
intr. to get off, come off, end so and so, οὐκ ὡς ἤθελε Hdt.; κακῶς ἀπ. Plat.; χαίρων Hdt.:—c. gen. to depart from, βίου Eur.
Pass. and Mid. to be set free or released from a thing, get rid of it, c. gen., Hdt., Attic
to get off, καλῶς Eur.; ἀζήμιος Ar.
absol. to be acquitted, Dem.
to remove, depart from, ἐκ χώρης Hdt., etc.; γῆς Eur.
ἀπαλλάσσεσθαι τοῦ βίου to depart from life, Eur.; and without τοῦ βίου, to depart, die, Eur., Thuc., etc.
ἀπ. λέχους to be divorced, Eur.
ἀπ. τοῦ διδασκάλου to leave school, Plat.
ἀπ. ἐκ παίδων to become a man, Aeschin.
πολλὸν ἀπηλλαγμένος τινός far inferior to him, Hdt.

to leave off or cease from τῶν μακρῶν λόγων Soph.; σκωμμάτων Ar.:—absol. to have done, give over, cease, Soph., Plat.:—c. part., εἰπὼν ἀπαλλάγηθι speak and be done with it, Plat.; also in part. with a Verb, οὐκοῦν ἀπαλλαχθεὶς ἄπει; have done and begone, Soph.
to depart from enmity, i. e. to be reconciled, Plat.

div1.head: ἀπαλλοτριόω
div1.sense: to estrange, alienate, Aeschin., Arist.

div1.head: ἀπαλλοτρίωσις
div1.sense: alienation, Arist.

div1.head: ἀπαλοάω
div1.sense: to thresh out, σῖτος ἀπηλοημένος (perf. pass. part.) Dem.:—metaph. to bruise, crush, Il.

div1.head: ἁπαλόθριξ
div1.sense: soft-haired, Eur.

div1.head: ἁπαλός
div1.sense: soft to the touch, tender, of the body, Hom., Soph.; of fresh fruit, Hdt.; of tender meat, Xen.
metaph. soft, gentle, ἁπαλὸν γελάσαι to laugh gently, Od.; ἁπ. δίαιτα soft, delicate, Plat.

div1.head: ἁπαλότης
div1.sense: softness, tenderness, Xen., etc.

div1.head: ἁπαλοτρεφής
div1.sense: well-fed, plump, Il.

div1.head: ἁπαλόφρων
div1.sense: soft-hearted, Anth.

div1.head: ἁπαλόχροος
div1.sense: soft-skinned, Hhymn., Hes., etc.

div1.head: ἁπαλύνω
div1.sense: to soften, Xen.
to make tender, τοὺς πόδας Xen.

div1.head: ἀπαμαλδύνω
div1.sense: to bring to naught, Anth.

div1.head: ἀπαμάω
div1.sense: to cut off, Od., Soph.

div1.head: ἀπαμβλίσκω
div1.sense: to make abortive, Plut.
intr. to miscarry, Plut.

div1.head: ἀπαμβλύνω
div1.sense: to blunt the edge of a sword: metaph., τεθηγμένον τοί μʼ οὐκ ἀπαμβλύνεις λόγωι Aesch.:—Pass. to be blunted, lose its edge, Aesch, Plat.

div1.head: ἀπαμείβομαι
div1.sense: to reply, answer, Hom.

div1.head: ἀπαμείρω
div1.sense: to deprive one of share in a thing:—Pass. to be bereft, τινός of a thing, Hes.

div1.head: ἀπαμελέομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be neglected utterly, perf. part. ἀπημελημένος Hdt., Soph.

div1.head: ἀπαμπλακεῖν
div1.etym: aor2 with no pres. in use
div1.sense: to fail utterly, Soph.

div1.head: ἀπαμύνω
div1.sense: to keep off, ward off, τί τινι something for (i. e. from) another, Il.; τί τινος Luc.: c. acc. to ward off, κακά Hdt.; ἀπ. τὸν βάρβαρον to repulse him, Hdt.
Mid. to keep off from oneself, to drive back, repel, τινά Od., Hdt.
absol. to defend or protect oneself, Hom.

div1.head: ἀπαναίνομαι
div1.sense: to disown, reject, Hom., Aesch.

div1.head: ἀπαναισχυντέω
div1.sense: to have the effrontery to do or say a thing, Plat.
to deny shamelessly, Dem.

div1.head: ἀπαναλίσκω
div1.sense: to use quite up, utterly consume, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀπανδρόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to become manly, come to maturity, Eur., Luc.

div1.head: ἀπάνευθε
div1.sense: afar off, far away, Il.
prep. c. gen. far away from, aloof from, τῶν ἄλλων θεῶν Il.; ἀπ. θεῶν without their knowledge, Il.
out from, issuing from, Il.

div1.head: ἀπανθέω
div1.sense: to leave off blooming, fade, wither, Plat., Luc.

div1.head: ἀπανθίζω
div1.sense: to pluck off flowers, Lat. decerpere: metaph., ματαίαν γλῶσσαν ἀπανθίσαι to cull the flowers of idle talk, i. e. talk at random, Aesch.:—Mid. to gather honey from flowers, to cull the best of, Luc.

div1.head: ἀπανθρακίζω
div1.sense: to broil on the coals, Ar.

div1.head: ἀπανθρακόω
div1.sense: to burn to a cinder, Luc.

div1.head: ἀπάνθρωπος
div1.sense: far from man:
of places, desert, desolate, Aesch.
of men, inhuman, Plut.

div1.head: ἀπανίστημι
div1.sense: to make rise up and depart, send away, τὴν στρατιήν Hdt., Thuc.
Pass., with aor2 and perf. act., and fut. mid., to arise and go away, depart, leave oneʼs country, emigrate, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: ἁπανταχῆ
div1.sense: everywhere, Eur.

div1.head: ἁπανταχόθεν
div1.sense: from all sides, Luc.

div1.head: ἁπανταχόθι
div1.sense: everywhere, Luc.

div1.head: ἁπανταχόσε
div1.sense: to every place, Plut.

div1.head: ἁπανταχοῦ
div1.sense: everywhere, Eur.

div1.head: ἀπαντάω
div1.sense: to move from a place to meet a person; then, generally, to meet, encounter, τινί Hdt., Thuc., etc.:—absol., ὁ ἀεὶ ἀπαντῶν anyone that meets you, any chance person, Plat.:—often with a prep., ἀπ. τινι εἰς τόπον to come or go to a place to meet him, meet him at a place, Hdt.: —without a dat. pers., to present oneself at a place, Xen.
often in hostile sense, to meet in battle, Eur.; ἀπ. Ἀθηναίοις ἐς Τάραντα Thuc.: to oppose in any way, Plat.:—absol. to present oneself in arms, Eur.
as a law term, to meet in open court, Plat., Dem.:— absol. to appear in court, Dem.
ἀπ. εἰς or πρός τι to enter upon a thing, attempt or approach it, Plat., Aeschin.; to have recourse to . . , Dem.
of things, to come upon one, happen to one, Eur., Plat., etc.

div1.head: ἀπάντημα
div1.sense: a meeting, Eur.

div1.head: ἁπάντῃ
div1.sense: everywhere, Hom.

div1.head: ἀπαντικρύ
div1.sense: right opposite, Xen.; c. gen., Dem.

div1.head: ἀπαντίον
div1.sense: right opposite, ἐς τὴν ἀπ. ἀκτήν Hdt.

div1.head: ἀπαντλέω
div1.sense: to draw off water from a shipʼs hold: metaph., ἀπ. ὕβρισμα χθονός Eur.:—c. acc. only, to draw off, Aesch.: to lighten, lessen, πόνους Aesch.; βάρος ψυχῆς Eur.

div1.head: ἀπανύω
div1.sense: to finish entirely, νῆες ἀπήνυσαν (sc. ὁδόν) the ships performed the voyage, Od.

div1.head: ἁπαξάπας
div1.sense: all at once, mostly in pl., Ar.

div1.head: ἁπαξαπλῶς
div1.sense: in general, Luc.

div1.head: ἀπαξιόω
div1.sense: to disclaim as unworthy, disown, τι or τινα Thuc.
ἀπ. τί τινος to deem a thing unworthy of one, Luc.:—Mid. to banish from oneʼs house, Aesch.

div1.head: ἅπαξ
div1.etym: a_copul and root παγ, πήγνυμι, cf. lat. simplex.
div1.sense: once, once only, once for all, like Lat. semel, Od., Hdt., Attic
c. gen., ἅπ. τοῦ ἐνιαυτοῦ once in the year, Hdt.
without any notion of number, after εἴπερ, ἤν, ἐπεί, ὡς, ὅταν, like Lat. ut semel, εἴπερ ἐσπείσω γʼ ἅπαξ if once you have made a treaty, Ar.; ὡς ἅπαξ ἤρξατο once he had begun, Xen.

div1.head: ἄπαππος
div1.sense: with no grandfather: metaph. unfathered by a thing, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀπαράβατος
div1.sense: not passing over to another, not passing away, unchangeable, NTest.

div1.head: ἀπαραίτητος
div1.sense: of persons, not to be moved by prayer, inexorable, Plat., etc.:—adv. -τως, Thuc.
of punishments, not to be averted by prayers, inevitable, unmerciful, Dinarch.

div1.head: ἀπαρακάλυπτος
div1.sense: uncovered: adv. -τως, undisguisedly, Plat.

div1.head: ἀπαράκλητος
div1.sense: unsummoned, volunteering, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀπαράλλακτος
div1.sense: unchanged, unchangeable, Plut.

div1.head: ἀπαραμύθητος
div1.sense: not to be persuaded, inconsolable, ἀθυμία Plut.

div1.head: ἀπαράμυθος
div1.sense: inexorable, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀπαράσκευος
div1.sense: without preparation, unprepared, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: ἀπαράσσω
div1.sense: to strike off, cut off, Il., Hdt.: to sweep off from the deck of a ship, ἀπὸ τῆς νηός Hdt.; ἀπὸ τοῦ καταστρώματος Thuc.

div1.head: ἀπαρέσκω
div1.sense: to be disagreeable to, τινί Thuc.
Mid. to shew displeasure, Il.

div1.head: ἀπαρηγόρητος
div1.sense: inconsolable, Plut.
not to be advised or controlled, Plut.

div1.head: ἀπαρθένευτος
div1.sense: unmaidenly, unfitting a maiden, Eur., in neut. pl. as adv.

div1.head: ἀπάρθενος
div1.sense: no more a maid, Theocr.; νύμφην ἄνυμφον παρθένον τʼ ἀπάρθενον virgin wife and widowʼd maid, " Eur.

div1.head: ἀπαριθμέω
div1.sense: to count over, reckon up, Xen.
to reckon or pay back, repay, Xen.

div1.head: ἀπαρίθμησις
div1.sense: a counting over, recounting, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀπαρκέω
div1.sense: to suffice, be sufficient, Trag.
to be contented, acquiesce, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀπαρνέομαι
div1.sense: to deny utterly, deny, Hdt.; followed by μή and inf., Eur., etc.: ἀπαρνηθῆναί τι to refuse, reject, Thuc.
fut. ἀπαρνηθήσεται in pass. sense, shall be denied or refused, Soph., NTest.

div1.head: ἄπαρνος
div1.sense: denying utterly, ἄπαρνός ἐστι μὴ νοσέειν he denies that he is ill, Hdt.: c. gen., ἄπαρνος οὐδενός denying nothing, Soph.

div1.head: ἀπαρρησίαστος
div1.sense: not speaking freely, Luc.

div1.head: ἀπαρτάω
div1.sense: to hang up from, ἀπ. δέρην to strangle, Eur.:—Pass. to hang loose, Xen.
metaph. to make dependent upon, ἐξ ἑαυτοῦ Luc.
to detach, separate, τί τινος Dem.:—Pass., ἀπηρτημένοι detached, disunited, Luc.
intr. in Act. to remove oneself, go away, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀπαρτίζω
div1.sense: to make even, move regularly, Aesch.
to get ready, complete, Arist.
intr. to be even or exact, Arist.

div1.head: ἀπαρτιλογία
div1.sense: an even number or sum, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀπάρτιον
div1.sense: a sale of goods by auction, Plut.

div1.head: ἀπαρτί
div1.sense: completely, of numbers, exactly, just, Hdt.
of Time, from now, from this time, henceforth, Ar., NTest.
just now, even now, NTest.

div1.head: ἀπαρτισμός
div1.sense: completion, NTest.

div1.head: ἀπαρύω
div1.sense: to draw off, skim off cream, Hdt.: metaph. to draw off the force of a thing, in verb. adj. ἀπαρυστέον, Ar.

div1.head: ἀπαρχή
div1.sense: mostly in pl. ἀπαρχαί, the beginning of a sacrifice, the primal offering (of hairs cut from the forehead), Eur.
the firstlings for sacrifice, first-fruits, Hdt., Attic:—metaph., ἀπαρχὴ τῆς σοφίας Plat.

div1.head: ἀπάρχομαι
div1.sense: Dep.

to make a beginning, esp. in sacrifice, τρίχας ἀπάρχεσθαι to begin the sacrifice with the hair, i. e. by cutting off the hair from the forehead and throwing it into the fire, Il.: to begin the sacrificial rites, Od.
c. gen. to cut off part of a thing, to offer it, to offer part of a thing, Hdt., Eur.
to offer the firstlings or first-fruits, Hdt., Ar.
metaph. to take as the first-fruits, as the choice or best, Theocr.
ἀπάρχω Act., to be the first, be leader, dance, Anth.

div1.head: ἀπασπαίρω
div1.sense: to gasp away life, Eur.

div1.head: ἅπας
div1.sense: quite all, the whole, and in pl. all together, Hom., etc.
with an Adj., ἀργύρεος ἅπας all silver, i.e. of massive silver, Od.; ἅπαν κακόν altogether evil, Ar.
in sing., like πᾶς, everyone, Lat. unusquisque, πᾶν everything, unumquodque, Hdt., Attic

div1.head: ἀπαστία
div1.sense: an abstaining from food, a fast, Ar.

div1.head: ἄπαστος
div1.sense: not having eaten, fasting, Il.: c. gen., ἄπαστος ἐδητύος ἠδὲ ποτῆτος without having tasted meat or drink, Od.

div1.head: ἀπαστράπτω
div1.sense: to flash forth, Luc.

div1.head: ἀπασχολέω
div1.sense: to leave one no leisure, Luc.:—Pass. to be wholly occupied, Luc.

div1.head: ἀπασχολία
div1.sense: detention by business, Strab.

div1.head: ἀπατάω
div1.sense: to cheat, trick, outwit, beguile, Hom., etc.: Pass. to be deceived, Soph.; ἀπατᾶσθαι, ὡς . . , to be deceived into thinking that . . , Plat.

div1.head: ἀπάτερθε
div1.sense: apart, aloof, Il.
prep. c. gen. far away from, ὁμίλου Il.

div1.head: ἀπατεών
div1.sense: a cheat, rogue, quack, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: ἀπατήλιος
div1.sense: guileful, wily, ἀπατήλια εἰδώς skilled in wiles, Od.; ἀπ. βάζειν Od.

div1.head: ἀπάτη
div1.sense: a trick, fraud, deceit, Il.: a stratagem, Thuc.: in pl. wiles, Hom.
guile, fraud, deceit, treachery, Hdt., Attic

div1.head: ἀπατητικός
div1.sense: fraudulent, Xen.

div1.head: ἀπάτητος
div1.sense: untrodden, Anth.

div1.head: ἀπατιμάω
div1.sense: to dishonour greatly, Il.

div1.head: Ἀπατούρια
div1.sense: the Apatouria, a festival at Athens in the month Pyanepsion, at which the grown-up youths (κοῦροι) were enrolled in the φρατρίαι, Oratt.
div1.etym: Prob. from πατρία, = φρατρία, with a_euphon.

div1.head: ἀπάτωρ
div1.sense: without father, fatherless, Soph., Eur.: c. gen., ἀπ. ἐμοῦ not having me for a father, Soph.

div1.head: ἀπαυγάζω
div1.sense: to beam forth, Call. (in Mid.)

div1.head: ἀπαύγασμα
div1.sense: efflux of light, effulgence, NTest.

div1.head: ἀπαυδάω
div1.sense: to forbid, Soph.; ἀπ. μή c. inf. to prohibit from doing a thing, Soph., Eur.
to decline, shun, πόνους Eur.: to deny, renounce, νεῖκος Theocr.
to be wanting towards, fail, φίλοισι Eur.; ἀπ. ὑπὸ λιμοῦ Luc.

div1.head: ἀπαυθαδίζομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to speak or act boldly, speak out, Plat.

div1.head: ἀπαυθημερίζω
div1.sense: to return the same day, Xen.

div1.head: ἀπαυράω
div1.sense: to take away or wrest from, rob of, c. dupl. acc. pers. et rei, ἄμφω θυμὸν ἀπηύρα Il.; τοὺς μὲν τεύχεʼ ἀπηύρα Il.
c. gen. pers., κούρην Ἀχιλῆος ἀπούρας Il.
c. dat. pers., πολέσσιν θυμὸν ἀπηύρα Il.
Mid., ἀπουράμενοι ψυχάς having lost their lives, Hes.
to receive good or ill, to enjoy or suffer, Hes., Eur. Cf. ἐπαυρίσκομαι.

div1.head: ἄπαυστος
div1.sense: unceasing, never-ending, Aesch., Soph.
not to be stopped or assuaged, insatiable, δίψα Thuc.
c. gen. never ceasing from, γόων Eur.

div1.head: ἀπαυτομολέω
div1.sense: to go of oneʼs own accord, desert, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀπαφίσκω
div1.sense: like ἀπατάω, to cheat, beguile, Od.

div1.head: ἀπάχθομαι
div1.sense: For ἀπήχθ- forms see ἀπάγω, ἀπεχθάνομαι. Νot in LSJ, DGE [HD].

div1.head: ἆ
div1.sense: exclamation, like Latin and English ah! ἆ δειλέ, ἆ δειλώ, ἆ δειλοί, Hom.; doubled ἆ ἆ Aesch.

div1.head: ἀπέδιλος
div1.sense: unshod, Aesch.

div1.head: ἄπεδος
div1.sense: even, level, flat, Hdt., Thuc., etc.: —ἄπεδον, ου, τό, a plain, flat surface, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀπεθίζω
div1.sense: to disaccustom, ἀπ. τινὰ μὴ ποιεῖν Aeschin.; part. perf. ἀπειθικώς, Plut.

div1.head: ἀπεῖδον
div1.sense: to look away from other things at a thing, and so simply to look at, ἔς or πρός τι Thuc.

div1.head: ἀπείθεια
div1.sense: disobedience, Xen., NTest.

div1.head: ἀπειθέω
div1.sense: to be disobedient, refuse compliance, Aesch.; c. dat. to disobey, Eur., Plat.

div1.head: ἀπειθής
div1.sense: disobedient, τοῖς νόμοις Plat.; of ships, τοῖς κυβερνήταις ἀπειθεστέραι less obedient to them, Thuc.
act. not persuasive, incredible, Theogn.

div1.head: ἀπεικάζω
div1.sense: to form from a model, to express, copy, of painters, Xen., etc.:—Pass. to become like, resemble, ἀπεικασθεὶς θεῶι in a godʼs likeness, Eur.
to express by a comparison, Plat.:— Pass. to be copied or expressed by likeness, Plat.
to liken, compare with, τί τινι Eur., Plat.
ὡς ἀπεικάσαι as one may guess, to conjecture, Soph.

div1.head: ἀπεικαστέος
div1.sense: one must represent, Xen.

div1.head: ἀπεικονίζω
div1.sense: to represent in a statue, Anth.

div1.head: ἀπειλέω
div1.sense: to force back; mostly in Pass., ἐς ἀπορίην ἀπειλημένος forced into great difficulties, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀπειλέω
div1.sense: to hold out either in the way of promise or threat:
in good sense, to promise, ἠπείλησεν ἄνακτι ῥέξειν ἑκατόμβην Il.; ἠπείλησας εἶναι ἀρίστους didst profess that they were best, Od.
commonly in bad sense, to threaten, Lat. minari, absol. or c. dat. pers., Hom., etc.; c. acc. cogn., ἠπείλησεν μῦθον spake a threatening speech, Il.:—also in Mid., NTest.
c. acc. of the thing threatened, θάνατον ἀπ. τινι Hdt.
dependent clauses added in inf. fut., γέρας ἀφαιρήσεσθαι ἀπειλεῖς Il., etc.; Attic also in inf. aor.:—also ἀπ. ὅτι . . , ὡς . . , Attic
Pass. ἀπειλοῦμαι, of persons, to be terrified by threats, Xen.

div1.head: ἀπειλή
div1.sense: mostly in pl., boastful promises, boasts, Il.
in bad sense, threats, Hom., etc.:—in sg. a threat of punishment, Soph., Thuc.

div1.head: ἀπειλητήριος
div1.sense: of or for threatening, λόγοι Hdt.

div1.head: ἀπειλητήρ
div1.sense: a threatener, boaster, Il.

div1.head: ἄπειμι
div1.sense: to be away or far from, τινος Od., etc.; ἀπό τινος Thuc.: c. dat. to be wanting, φίλοισιν Eur., etc.
absol. to be away or absent, and of things, to be wanting, Soph., etc.; of the dead, Eur.

div1.head: ἄπειμι
div1.sense: to go away, depart, Od., etc.; οὐκ ἄπει; ἄπιθι, be gone, Soph.; ἀπ. πάλιν to return, Xen.; ἄπιτε ἐς ὑμέτερα return to your homes, Hdt.; ἄπιμεν οἴκαδε Ar.; ἐπʼ οἴκου Thuc. —of the Nile, to recede, Hdt.; ἀπ. ἐπί τι to go in quest of a thing, Xen.

div1.head: ἀπεῖπον
div1.etym: for εἶπον orig. had a digamma ϝεῖπον
div1.sense: to speak out, tell out, declare, μῦθον, etc., Hom.; ῥῆσιν Hdt.
to deny, refuse, Il., Plat.
to forbid, ἀπ. τινι μὴ ποιεῖν to forbid one to do, tell him not to do, Hdt., Attic:—Pass., ἀπείρηταί τινι ποιεῖν τι it is forbidden him to do, Hdt.; τὸ ἀπειρημένον a forbidden thing, Hdt.

to renounce, disown, give up, μῆνιν Il.; τὴν συμμαχίην Hdt.; ἀπ. τὴν στρατηγίαν to resign it, Xen.:—Pass., αἱ σπονδαὶ οὐκ ἀπείρηντο had not been renounced, Thuc.:—so in Mid., ἀπείπασθαι ὄψιν to avert a vision (by sacrifice), Hdt.

intr. to give up, to be worn out, fail, sink from exhaustion, Soph., etc.; ἀπεῖπεν φάτις the word failed, was unfulfilled, Aesch.:—c. dat. pers. to fail or be wanting to one, οὐκ ἀπειρηκὼς φίλοις Eur.:—c. dat. rei, ἀπειρηκότων χρήμασι, i. e. when they were bankrupt, Dem.; also, ἀπ. κακοῖς, ἄλγει to give way to, sink under them, Eur.; φέροντες ἀπεροῦσιν they will be tired of paying, Thuc., Plat.

div1.head: Ἀπειραῖος
div1.sense: Apeiraean, Od.; Apeire = limitless-land, an imaginary place.

div1.head: ἀπείραστος
div1.sense: incapable of being tempted by a thing, c. gen., NTest.

div1.head: ἀπείργαθον
div1.sense: to keep away, keep off from, τινά τινος Il.; ῥάκεα ἀποέργαθε οὐλῆς pushed back the rags from the scar, Od.; μή σε τῆσδε γῆς ἀπειργαθῇ Soph.

div1.head: ἀπείργω
div1.sense: to keep away from, debar from, τινά τινος Hom., Attic; τινὰ ἀπό τινος Hdt.
to keep from doing, prevent, hinder, c. acc. et inf., ἀπ. τινὰ ποιεῖν or μὴ ποιεῖν τι Soph., Eur.

c. acc. to keep back, keep off, ward off, Od., Soph., etc.; absol., ἀλλʼ ἀπείργοι θεός heaven forfend! Soph.: νόμος οὐδεὶς ἀπ. no law debars, Thuc.: of the Nile, ἀπεργμένος barred or shut off from its old channel, Hdt.
to part, divide, separate, κληῒς ἀποέργει αὐχένα τε στῆθός τε Il.:—and so to bound, Hdt.
of persons travelling, ἐν ἀριστερῆι ἀπέργων ῥοίτειον keeping Rhoeteium on the left, Hdt.
to shut up, confine, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀπειρέσιος
div1.sense: boundless, immense, countless, Hom., Od.

div1.head: Ἀπείρηθεν
div1.sense: from Apeire, Od.

div1.head: ἀπείρητος
div1.sense: Act., without making trial of a thing, without making an attempt upon, c. gen., Il.
without trial or experience of a thing, Hhymn., Pind. : —absol. inexperienced, Od.
pass. untried, unattempted, Il., Hdt., Dem.

div1.head: ἀπειρία
div1.sense: want of skill, inexperience, Plat.; τινός of or in a thing, Eur.

div1.head: ἀπειρία
div1.sense: infinity, Plat.

div1.head: ἀπειρόδροσος
div1.sense: unused to dew, unbedewed, Eur.

div1.head: ἀπειρόκακος
div1.sense: without experience of evil, unused to evil, Eur. τὸ ἀπ. ignorance of evil, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀπειροκαλία
div1.sense: ignorance of the beautiful, want of taste, Plat.: in pl. vulgarities, Xen.

div1.head: ἀπειρόκαλος
div1.sense: ignorant of the beautiful, without taste, tasteless, vulgar, Plat.: τὸ ἀπ., ἀπειροκαλία, Xen. adv. -λως, Plat.

div1.head: ἀπειρόπλους
div1.sense: ignorant of navigation, Luc.

div1.head: ἄπειρος
div1.sense: without trial or experience of a thing, unused to, unacquainted with, Lat. expers, c. gen., ἄθλων Theogn.; τυράννων Hdt., etc.
absol. inexperienced, ignorant, Pind., Aesch., etc.
adv., ἀπείρως ἔχειν τινός to be ignorant of a thing, Hdt.

div1.head: ἄπειρος2
div1.sense: boundless, infinite, countless, πλῆθος Hdt., Plat.
in Trag., of garments, endless, i. e. without end or outlet, inextricable, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: ἀπειροσύνη
div1.sense: inexperience, Eur.

div1.head: ἀπειρότοκος
div1.sense: not having brought forth, virgin, Anth.

div1.head: ἀπείρων
div1.sense: = ἄπειροs1, without experience, ignorant, Soph.

div1.head: ἀπείρων2
div1.sense: = ἄπειροs2 1, boundless, endless, countless, Hom.
= ἄπειροs2 2, without end, inextricable, δεσμοί Od.

div1.head: ἀπεκδέχομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to expect anxiously, to look for, await, NTest.

div1.head: ἀπεκδύομαι
div1.sense: Act. ἀποδύνω to strip off from, τί τινος Babr.
to strip off oneself, to put off, as in preparing for single combat, NTest.
to strip off for oneself, to despoil, τινα NTest.

div1.head: ἀπέκδυσις
div1.sense: a putting off (like clothes), NTest.

div1.head: ἀπεκλανθάνομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to forget entirely, c. gen., only in imperat. of Epic aor2 ἀπεκλελάθεσθε, Od.

div1.head: ἀπέκ
div1.sense: prep. c. gen. away out of, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἀπέκτητος
div1.sense: uncombed, Anth.

div1.head: ἀπελαύνω
div1.sense: to drive away, expel from a place, τινὰ δόμων, πόλεως, Eur., etc.; ἀπὸ τόπου Xen.: ἀπ. τινά to drive away, banish, expel, Soph., Xen.
ἀπ. στρατιήν to lead away an army, Hdt.: then absol. to march or go away, depart, Hdt.; (sub. ἵππον) to ride away, Xen.
Pass. to be driven away, Hdt., Attic:— to be excluded from a thing, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἀπελεγμός
div1.sense: refutation: disrepute, NTest.

div1.head: ἀπελέγχω
div1.sense: to refute thoroughly, Antipho.

div1.head: ἀπέλεθρος
div1.sense: immeasurable, Hom.: neut. as adv. immeasurably far, Il.

div1.head: ἀπελευθερία
div1.sense: the enfranchisement of a slave, Aeschin.

div1.head: ἀπελευθερικός
div1.sense: in the condition of a freedman, Plut.

div1.head: ἀπελεύθερος
div1.sense: an emancipated slave, a freedman, Lat. libertus, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: ἀπελευθερόω
div1.sense: to emancipate a slave, Plat.

div1.head: ἀπελευθέρωσις
div1.sense: emancipation, Dem.

div1.head: ἀπελλάζω
div1.sense: Laconic for ἐκκλησιάζω, Plut.

div1.head: ἀπελπίζω
div1.sense: to give up in despair, to despair, NTest.; (others to hope to receive from another); to drive to despair, τινά Anth.

div1.head: ἀπεμέω
div1.sense: to spit up, vomit forth, Lat. evomere, Il.

div1.head: ἀπεμπολάω
div1.sense: to sell, Eur.; ἀπ. τί τινος or ἀντί τινος to sell for a thing, Xen., Eur.; ἀπ. τινὰ χθονός to smuggle one out of the country, Eur.:—Pass., ἀπεμπολώμενοι bought and sold, " Ar.

div1.head: ἀπεναντίον
div1.sense: = ἀπέναντι, the opposite shore, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀπέναντι
div1.sense: opposite, against, c. gen., NTest.

div1.head: ἀπεναρίζω
div1.sense: to strip one of arms, despoil one of a thing, c. dupl. acc., Il.

div1.head: ἀπενθής
div1.sense: free from grief, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀπενιαυτέω
div1.sense: to go into banishment for a year, Xen.

div1.head: ἀπεννέπω
div1.sense: to forbid, Aesch.; ἀπ. τι to forbid it, Soph.; c. acc. et inf., ἀπ. τινὰ ποιεῖν or μὴ ποιεῖν τι Eur.:— ἀπ. τινὰ θαλάμων to order him from the chamber, Eur.
to deprecate, τι Aesch.

div1.head: ἀπεξαιρέω
div1.sense: to take out, remove, τί τινος Eur.

div1.head: ἀπεοικώς
div1.sense: unreasonable, Antipho:—adv. ἀπ-εοικότως or -εικότως, unreasonably, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀπέπαντος
div1.sense: not ripened, unripe, Anth.

div1.head: ἀπέπειρος
div1.sense: unripe, untimely.

div1.head: ἄπεπλος
div1.sense: unrobed, clad in the tunic only, Pind.: λευκῶν φαρέων ἄπεπλος not clad in white robes, i. e. in black, Eur.

div1.head: ἀπεραντολόγος
div1.sense: talking without end.

div1.head: ἀπέραντος
div1.sense: boundless, infinite, of space, Pind., Eur., etc.:—of Time, endless, Ar.;—of Number, countless, Plat.; generally of events, ἀπέραντον ἦν there was no end to it, Thuc.
allowing no escape, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀπεργάζομαι
div1.sense: to finish off, turn out complete, Ar., Plat.
of a painter, to fill up with colour, express perfectly, Plat.
to finish a contract, Xen.
c. dupl. acc. to make so and so, ἀγαθὸν ἀπ. τινα Xen.:—so perf. in pass. sense, ἀπειργασμένος τύραννος a finished tyrant, Plat.

div1.head: ἀπεργασία
div1.sense: a finishing off, completing, of painters, Plat.
a making, producing, Plat.
a business, trade, Plat.

div1.head: ἀπεργαστικός
div1.sense: fit for finishing, causing, c. gen., Plat.

div1.head: ἀπέρδω
div1.sense: to bring to an end, finish, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀπερείδω
div1.sense: to rest, fix, settle, τὴν ὄψιν πρός τι Luc.
intr. = Pass. to rest upon, Luc.
mostly as Pass., with fut. and aor1 mid., to support oneself upon, rest upon a thing, c. dat., Xen., etc.; εἴς τι Plat.

div1.head: ἀπερείσιος
div1.sense: ἀπερείσιʼ ἄποιναcountless ransom.

div1.head: ἀπεριλάλητος
div1.sense: not to be out-talked, Ar.

div1.head: ἀπερίληπτος
div1.sense: uncircumscribed, Plut.

div1.head: ἀπεριμέριμνος
div1.sense: free from care:— adv. -νως, unthinkingly, Ar.

div1.head: ἀπερίοπτος
div1.sense: unregarding, reckless of, πάντων Thuc.

div1.head: ἀπερίσκεπτος
div1.sense: inconsiderate, thoughtless, Thuc. adv. -τως; comp. -ότερον, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀπερίτμητος
div1.sense: uncircumcised, NTest.

div1.head: ἀπερίτροπος
div1.sense: not returning or taking heed, Soph.

div1.head: ἀπέρρω
div1.sense: to go away, be gone, Eur.: ἄπερρε away, begone, Lat. abi in malam rem, Ar.

div1.head: ἀπερυθριάω
div1.sense: to put away blushes, to be past blushing, Ar.

div1.head: ἀπερύκω
div1.sense: to keep off or away, c. acc., Hom.; c. acc. et gen. to keep away from, Theogn.; c. acc. et inf. to prevent one from doing, οὔτε σε κωμάζειν ἀπερύκομεν Theogn.; also, ἀπ. τινί τι to keep off from, Hdt.; τι ἀπό τινος Xen.:—Mid., ἀπερύκου (sc. φωνῆς) abstain from speech, Soph.

div1.head: ἀπερύω
div1.sense: to tear off from, ῥινὸν ἀπʼ ὀστεόφιν ἐρύσαι Od.:—Mid., Anth.

div1.head: ἀπέρχομαι
div1.sense: to go away, depart from, c. gen., Hom., Attic; ἀπό or ἐκ τόπου Thuc.
when used with εἰς, departure from one place and arrival at another is implied, ἀπ. ἐς Σάρδις Hdt., etc.
absol. to depart, Hdt., Thuc., etc.: to depart from life, Anth.

div1.head: ἀπερωεύς
div1.sense: a thwarter, Il.

div1.head: ἀπερωέω
div1.sense: to retire or withdraw from, πολέμου Il.

div1.head: ἀπέρωτος
div1.sense: loveless, unloving, ἔρως ἀπέρωτος, like γάμος ἄγαμος, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀπεσθίω
div1.sense: to eat. or gnaw off, Ar., Dem.

div1.head: ἀπεσσούα
div1.sense: he is gone off, Lacon. for ἀπ-εσσύη or ἀπ-εσσύθη, 3rd sg. aor1 pass. of ἀποσεύω, Xen.

div1.head: ἀπεστώ
div1.sense: a being away, absence, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀπέτηλος
div1.sense: leafless, Anth.

div1.head: ἀπευθής
div1.sense: not inquired into, unknown, Od.
act. not inquiring, ignorant, Od.

div1.head: ἀπευθύνω
div1.sense: to make straight again, Plat.; χέρας δεσμοῖς ἀπ. to bind his arms straight, i. e. behind him, Soph.
to guide aright, to direct, govern, Soph.; to correct, chastise, Eur.: c. inf. to direct one to do a thing, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀπευκτός
div1.sense: to be deprecated, abominable, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀπευνάζω
div1.sense: to lull to sleep, Soph.

div1.head: ἀπεύχομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to wish a thing away, wish it may not happen, deprecate, c. acc. rei, Eur., Dem.; c. inf., ἀπ. τι γενέσθαι or μὴ γενέσθαι to pray that it may not happen, Dem.
to reject, despise, τι Aesch.

div1.head: ἄπεφθος
div1.sense: boiled down, ἀπ. χρυσός refined gold, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: ἀπεχθαίρω
div1.sense: to hate utterly, detest, τινά Il.
to make utterly hateful, τι Od.

div1.head: ἀπεχθάνομαι
div1.sense: to be hated, incur hatred, be roused to hatred, Od.; c. dat. pers. to be or become hateful to one, Il., Hdt.; ἀπ. πρός τινα to be hateful in his eyes, Eur.:—c. dat. rei, to be hated for a thing, Plat.
Dep., in causal sense, λόγοι ἀπεχθανόμενοι language that causes hatred, Xen.

div1.head: ἀπέχθεια
div1.sense: felt towards another, πρός τινα Eur., etc.
felt by others towards one, enmity, odium, opp. to χάρις (popularity), and in pl. enmities, Plat., Dem.; διʼ ἀπεχθείας τινὶ ἐλθεῖν to be hated by him, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀπέχθημα
div1.sense: an object of hate, Eur.

div1.head: ἀπεχθής
div1.sense: hateful, hostile, Soph., Theocr., etc.: adv., ἀπεχθῶς ἔχειν τινι to be at enmity with him, Dem.

div1.head: ἀπέχω
div1.sense: to keep off or away from, τινά or τί τινος Il.: absol. to keep off, Eur.
to keep apart, part, κληῖδες ἀπʼ ὤμων αὐχένʼ ἔχουσιν the collar-bones part the neck from the shoulders, Il.
Mid., ἀπὸ χεῖρας ἔχεσθαί τινος (in tmesi) to hold oneʼs hands off or away from, Od.: also, ἀπέχεσθαί τινος to hold oneself off a thing, abstain or desist from it, Hom., Hdt., etc.
c. inf., ἀπέχεσθαι ποιεῖν or μὴ ποιεῖν τι to abstain from doing a thing, Thuc., etc.
intr. in Act. to be away or far from, c. gen. loci, Thuc.; also, ἀπ. ἀπὸ Βαβυλῶνος, etc., Hdt.: absol. to be distant, Xen.
of actions, to be far from, ἀπεῖχον τῆς ἐξευρέσιος were far from the discovery, Hdt.; πλεῖστον ἀπ. τοῦ ποιεῖν to be as far as possible from doing, Xen.
to have or receive in full, τὸν μισθόν NTest., Plut.
impers., ἀπέχει it sufficeth, it is enough, NTest.

div1.head: ἀπηθέω
div1.sense: to strain off, filter, Ar.

div1.head: ἀπηλεγέως
div1.sense: without caring for anything, reckless of consequences, bluntly, μῦθον ἀπηλεγέως ἀποειπεῖν Hom.

div1.head: ἀπηλιαστής
div1.sense: one who keeps away from the Ἡλιαία, i. e. an enemy to law, with a play on ἥλιος, not fond of basking in the sun, Ar.

div1.head: ἀπηλιώτης
div1.sense: the wind that comes from the rising sun, the east wind, Lat. subsolanus, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: ἀπήμαντος
div1.sense: unharmed, unhurt, Od.: ἔστω δʼ ἀπήμαντον be misery far away, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀπημοσύνη
div1.sense: freedom from harm, Theogn.

div1.head: ἀπήμων
div1.sense: unharmed, unhurt, of persons, Hom.; νόστος ἀπ. a safe, prosperous return, Od.: c. gen., ἀπήμων οἰζύος free from distress, Aesch.
act. doing no harm, harmless, and so kindly, propitious, of a fair wind, of sleep, Hom.; c. gen., νεῶν ἀπ. free from harm to them, Eur.

div1.head: ἀπήνη
div1.sense: a four-wheeled wagon, Hom.: any car or chariot, Aesch., Soph.:—metaph., ναΐα ἀπ. a ship, Eur.; τετραβάμων ἀπήνη, of the Trojan horse, Eur.
metaph. also, like ζεῦγος, a pair, e. g. of brothers, Eur.

div1.head: ἀπηνής
div1.etym: Deriv. of -ηνης, as in προσηνής, uncertain.
div1.sense: ungentle, harsh, rough, hard, of persons, Hom.

div1.head: ἀπήορος
div1.sense: hanging on high, high in air.

div1.head: ἄπηρος
div1.sense: unmaimed, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀπηχής
div1.sense: discordant, ill-sounding, Luc.

div1.head: ἀπήωρος
div1.sense: high in air, Od.

div1.head: ἀπιάλλω
div1.sense: Laconic word for ἀποπέμπω, to dispatch, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀπίθανος
div1.sense: not winning belief, incredible, unlikely, improbable, Plat.:—of arguments, not persuasive, unconvincing, Plat.
of persons, not to be trusted, Aeschin.
not having confidence to do a thing, c. inf., Plut.

div1.head: ἀπιθανότης
div1.sense: improbability, Aeschin.

div1.head: ἀπιθέω
div1.sense: οὐκ ἀπίθησει μύθωι he disobeyed not the words, Il.

div1.head: ἀπιθής
div1.sense: disobedient Epic for ἀπειθής, Anth.

div1.head: ἀπίλλω
div1.sense: to bar the way, Lys.

div1.head: ἀπινύσσω
div1.sense: only in pres. to lack understanding, be senseless, Hom.

div1.head: ἄπιον
div1.sense: a pear, Lat. pirum, Plat.

div1.head: ἄπιος
div1.sense: a pear-tree, Lat. pirus, Arist.

div1.head: ἄπιος2
div1.etym: The first sense has short α, the latter ᾱ.
div1.sense: far away, far off, distant, ἐξ ἀπίης γαίης Hom.
Ἄπιος, α, ον, Apian, i. e. Peloponnesian (said to be derived from Ἆπις, a king of Argos), Ἀπία γῆ, Ἀπία χθών, or Ἀπία alone, the Peloponnese, esp. Argolis, Aesch., Soph.; so Ἀπίς, ίδος, ἡ, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀπιπόω
div1.sense: to press the juice from anything, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀπισόω
div1.sense: to make equal, τινά τινι Plut.:—Pass. to be made equal, τινί to a thing, Hdt.

div1.head: Ἆπις
div1.sense: Apis, a bull worshipped in Egypt, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀπιστέω
div1.sense: to be ἄπιστος, and so,
to disbelieve, distrust, mistrust, c. acc., Od., Eur.:—Pass. to be distrusted, Thuc., Xen.
c. dat. pers., Hdt., Attic; ἀπ. τινί τι to disbelieve one in a thing, Hdt.; τινι περί τι Hdt.:—absol. to be distrustful, incredulous, Hdt.
c. inf. to doubt that . . , Soph.; ἀπ. μὴ γενέσθαι τι to doubt that it could be, Thuc.
= ἀπειθέω, to disobey, τινί Hdt., Attic: —absol. to be disobedient, refuse to comply, Soph., Eur.
τὸ σῶμʼ οὐκ ἀπιστήσω χθονί, i. e. I will not hesitate to commit it to the earth, Eur.

div1.head: ἀπιστία
div1.sense: disbelief, distrust, mistrust, Hes., Hdt., etc.; ὑπὸ ἀπιστίης μὴ γενέσθαι τι from disbelief that it had happened, Hdt.; ἀπιστίαν ἔχειν περί τινος to be in doubt, Plat.
of things, ἐς ἀπιστίην ἀπῖχθαι to have become discredited, Hdt.; πολλὰς ἀπιστίας ἔχει it admits of many doubts, Plat.; εἰς ἀπ. καταπίπτειν Plat.
want of faith, faithlessness, unbelief, Soph.: treachery, Xen.

div1.head: ἄπιστος
div1.sense: pass. not to be trusted, and so,
of persons and their acts, not trusty, distrusted, faithless, Il., etc.; θράσος ἄπ. groundless confidence, Thuc.
of reports and the like, incredible, Hdt., Aesch.; τὸ ἐλπίδων ἄπιστον what one cannot believe even in hope, Soph.

act. not believing or trusting, mistrustful, incredulous, suspicious, Od.; ἀπιστότερος less credulous, Hdt.; ἄπιστος πρὸς Φίλιππον distrustful towards him, Dem.; ἄπιστος σαυτῶι not believing what you say yourself, Plat.; τὸ ἀπ. ἀπιστία, Thuc.:—in NTest., unbelieving, an unbeliever,
not obeying, disobeying, c. gen., Aesch.
adv. ἀπίστως,
pass. beyond belief, Thuc.
act. distrustfully, suspiciously, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀπισχυρίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to set oneself to oppose firmly, give a flat denial, πρός τινα Thuc.

div1.head: ἀπίσχω
div1.sense: to keep off, hold off, Od.

div1.head: ἀπιτέος
div1.sense: one must go away, Xen.

div1.head: ἀπλανής
div1.sense: not wandering, steady, fixed, Plat.:—of stars, fixed, opp. to πλανῆται, Plat., Anth.
of a line, straight, Anth.

div1.head: ἀπλάνητος
div1.sense: that cannot go astray, Babr.

div1.head: ἄπλαστος
div1.sense: not moulded, i. e. in its natural state, natural, unaffected, Plut.

div1.head: ἄπλατος
div1.sense: for ἀπέλατος, unapproachable, terrible, Hes., Trag.

div1.head: ἄπλεκτος
div1.sense: unplaited, χαίτη Anth.

div1.head: ἄπλετος
div1.sense: boundless, immense, Hdt., Attic

div1.head: ἄπλευστος
div1.sense: not navigated: τὸ ἄπλ. a part of the sea not yet navigated, Xen.

div1.head: ἄπληκτος
div1.sense: unstricken, of a horse needing no whip or spur, Plat.:— unwounded, Eur.

div1.head: ἀπλήρωτος
div1.sense: insatiable, Luc., Anth.

div1.head: ἀπληστία
div1.sense: insatiate desire, greediness, Plat.; τινός of or for a thing, Eur., Plat.

div1.head: ἄπληστος
div1.sense: not to be filled, insatiate, Soph., etc.
c. gen., ἄπλ. χρημάτων insatiate of money, Hdt., etc.
adv., ἀπλήστως ἔχειν to be insatiate, Plat.; ἀπλ. διακεῖσθαι or ἔχειν πρός τι Xen.

div1.head: ἄπλοια
div1.sense: impossibility of sailing, detention in port, esp. from stress of weather, Aesch., Thuc.; ἴσχον αὐτὸν ἄπλοιαι Hdt.

div1.head: ἁπλοΐζομαι
div1.sense: to deal openly or frankly, πρὸς τοὺς φίλους Xen.

div1.head: ἁπλοΐς
div1.sense: simple, single, of a cloak, Hom.

div1.head: ἀπλόκαμος
div1.sense: with unbraided hair, Anth.

div1.head: Ἁπλοκύων
div1.sense: nickname of a Cynic who wore his coat single instead of double, Plut.

div1.head: ἄπλοος
div1.sense: act., of ships, not sailing, unfit for sea, not sea-worthy, Thuc.:—comp., ἀπλοώτεραι ναῦς less fit for sea, Thuc.
pass., of the sea, not navigable, Dem.

div1.head: ἁπλόος
div1.etym: from ἅμα as Lat. simplex from simul, opp. to διπλόος, duplex, twofold.
div1.sense: single, Soph., Thuc.
simple, natural, plain, sincere, frank, Trag., Plat., etc.: in bad sense, simple, Isocr.
simple, opp. to compound, Plat.; ἁπλῆ δημοκρατία sheer democracy, Plat.
simple, absolutely true, Plat.
adv. ἁπλῶς, v. sub voc.
comp. and Sup. ἁπλούστερος, ἁπλούστατος, Plat.

div1.head: ἁπλότης
div1.sense: singleness: simplicity, frankness, Xen., etc.
liberality, NTest.

div1.head: ἄπλουτος
div1.sense: without riches, Soph., Plut.

div1.head: ἁπλόω
div1.sense: to make single, to unfold, stretch out, Batr., Anth.:—Pass., ἡπλώθη the fish] lay stretched out, Babr.

div1.head: ἀπλυσία
div1.sense: filthiness, filth, Anth.

div1.head: ἄπλυτος
div1.sense: unwashen, unwashed, Ar.

div1.head: ἁπλῶς
div1.sense: Adv. of ἁπλοῦς, Lat. simpliciter
singly, in one way, Plat.
simply, plainly, openly, frankly, Aesch., etc.
simply, absolutely, ἁπλῶς ἀδύνατον Thuc.; οὐδεμία ἁπλῶς none at all, Thuc.; ὅσʼ ἐστιν ἁπλῶς simply all there are, Ar.
in a word, Lat. denique, Eur., Xen.

div1.head: ἀπνευστί
div1.sense: Adv. of ἄπνευστος, ἀπ. ἔχειν to hold oneʼs breath, Plat.; without drawing breath, Dem.

div1.head: ἄπνευστος
div1.sense: breathless, Od.

div1.head: ἄπνοος
div1.sense: without breath, lifeless, Anth.

div1.head: ἀποβάθρα
div1.sense: a ladder for disembarking, a gangway, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: ἀποβαίνω
div1.sense: to step off from a place, to alight or disembark from a ship, Hom., etc.; absol. to disembark, Hdt., Thuc., etc.:— to dismount from a chariot, ἵππων or ἐξ ἵππων Il.
to go away, depart, Il., Attic;—c. gen., ἀπ. πεδίων Eur.; of hopes, to come to naught, Eur.

of events, to issue or result from, τὰ ἔμελλε ἀποβήσεσθαι ἀπὸ τῆς μάχης Hdt.; τὸ ἀποβαῖνον, contr. τἀποβαῖνον, the issue, event, and τὰ ἀποβαίνοντα, τὰ ἀποβάντα the results, Hdt., Thuc.; τὰ ἀποβησόμενα the probable results, Thuc.
to turn out so and so, παρὰ δόξαν Hdt.; τοιόνδε Eur.; ὡς προσεδέχετο Thuc.:—absol. to turn out well, succeed, Thuc.
of persons, to end by being, ἀπ. κοινοί to prove impartial, Thuc.; so, ἐς ἀλαθινὸν ἄνδρʼ ἀπ. Theocr.; ἀπέβη ἐς μουναρχίην things ended in a monarchy, Hdt.
Causal in aor1 ἀπέβησα, to make to dismount, disembark, land, (in which sense ἀποβιβάζω serves as pres.), ἀπ. στρατιήν Hdt.

div1.head: ἀποβάλλω
div1.sense: to throw off, Il.; c. gen. to throw off from, ἀπ. ὀμμάτων ὕπνον Eur.
to throw away, τὴν ἀσπίδα Ar.; τὸν ἄνδρα ἀπ. to reject him, Eur.:—Mid. to cast from one, reject, Theocr.
to lose, τὰ πατρῶια, τὸν στρατόν Hdt.; τὴν οὐσίαν Ar.; πολλοὺς τῶν στρατιωτῶν Thuc.

div1.head: ἀποβάπτω
div1.sense: to dip quite or entirely, ἑωυτόν Hdt.; τι εἴς τι Hdt.

div1.head: ἀπόβασις
div1.sense: a stepping off, disembarking, ἀπὸ τῶν νεῶν Thuc.; ἡ ναυτικὴ ἐπʼ ἄλλους ἀπόβασις landing from ships in the face of an enemy, Thuc.; absol., ποιεῖσθαι ἀπόβασιν to disembark, land, Thuc.
a landing, landing-place, οὐκ ἔχει ἀπόβασιν does not admit of landing, or has no landing-place, Thuc.; pl., Thuc.
a way off, escape, Plut.

div1.head: ἀποβάτης
div1.sense: one who rode several horses leaping from one to the other, Lat. desultor, Plut.

div1.head: ἀποβιάζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to force away:— Pass. to be forced away or back, Xen.
absol. to use force, Xen.

div1.head: ἀποβιβάζω
div1.sense: Causal of ἀποβαίνω, to make to get off, esp. from a ship, to disembark, put on shore, Hdt., Thuc., etc.:—Mid., ἀποβιβάσασθαί τινας to cause them to be put on shore, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀποβλάπτω
div1.sense: to ruin utterly:— Pass., ἀποβλαφθῆναι φίλου to be robbed of a friend, Soph.

div1.head: ἀποβλαστάνω
div1.sense: to shoot forth from, spring from, c. gen., Soph.

div1.head: ἀποβλάστημα
div1.sense: a shoot, scion, Plat.

div1.head: ἀπόβλεπτος
div1.sense: gazed on by all, admired, Eur.

div1.head: ἀποβλέπω
div1.sense: to look away from all other objects at one, to look or gaze steadfastly, ἔς τινα or τι Hdt., Eur.; πρός τινα or τι Hdt., Plat.
to look to, pay attention or regard, ἔς τι Eur., etc.; πρός τι Plat.
to look upon with love or admiration, Lat. observare, suspicere, c. acc., Soph.; with a prep., ἔς or πρός τινα Eur., Xen.

div1.head: ἀποβλητέος
div1.sense: to be thrown away, rejected, Plat.

div1.head: ἀπόβλητος
div1.sense: to be thrown away as worthless, Il.

div1.head: ἀποβλίττω
div1.sense: to cut out the comb from the hive: hence to steal, Ar.

div1.head: ἀποβλύζω
div1.sense: to spirt out, c. gen. partit., ἀπ.οἴνου to spirt out some wine, Il.

div1.head: ἀποβολή
div1.sense: a throwing away, Plat.
a losing, loss, Lat. jactura, Plat.

div1.head: ἀποβολιμαῖος
div1.sense: apt to throw away a thing, c. gen., Ar.

div1.head: ἀποβόσκομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to feed upon, καρπόν Ar.

div1.head: ἀποβουκολέω
div1.sense: to let cattle stray: to lose (as a bad shepherd does his sheep), εἰ τῆι θυγατρὶ τὸν παῖδα ἀποβουκολήσαιμι if I were to lose my daughter her son, Xen.:—Pass. to lose oneʼs way, Luc.

div1.head: ἀποβρίζω
div1.sense: to go off to sleep, go sound asleep, Od.

div1.head: ἀποβροχίζω
div1.sense: to strangle, Anth.

div1.head: ἀποβώμιος
div1.sense: far from an altar, godless, Eur.

div1.head: ἀπόγαιος
div1.sense: from land: ἀπόγειον or ἀπόγαιον, ου, τό, a morning cable, Luc.

div1.head: ἀπογεισόω
div1.sense: to make to jut out like a cornice (γεῖσον) , ὀφρύσι ἀπ. τὰ ὑπὲρ τῶν ὀμμάτων Xen.

div1.head: ἀπογεύω
div1.sense: to give one a taste of a thing, c. gen., Anth.:—Mid. to take a taste of a thing, c. gen., Plat., Xen.

div1.head: ἀπογεφυρόω
div1.sense: to bank off, fence with dykes, τὴν Μέμφιν Hdt.

div1.head: ἀπογηράσκω
div1.sense: to grow old, Theogn.

div1.head: ἀπογίγνομαι
div1.sense: to be away from, have no part in a thing, c. gen., Hdt., Thuc.
absol. to be taken away, opp. to προσγίγνομαι, Thuc.: generally, to be away, absent, Plat., etc.

of death, ἀπ. ἐκ τῶν οἰκιῶν to depart from the house, die out of it, Hdt.; ἀπογενέσθαι alone, to be dead, οἱ ἀπογενόμενοι the dead, Thuc.; ὁ ὕστατον αἰεὶ ἀπ. he who died last, Hdt.; ὁ ἀπογινόμενος one who is dying, Hdt., Thuc.
to be lost, ἀπ. οὐδὲν τοῦ στρατοῦ Thuc.

div1.head: ἀπογιγνώσκω
div1.sense: depart from a judgment, give up a design or intention of doing, ἀπ. τὸ μάχεσθαι Xen.; ἀπ. μὴ βοηθεῖν to resolve not to help, Dem.
c. gen. rei, to despair of a thing, c. gen., Lys.:—absol. to despair, Dem.
c. acc. to give up as hopeless, Dem.:—Pass. to be so given up, Dem.

as law-term, to refuse to receive an accusation, reject, Dem.:— ἀπ. τινος (sc. δίκην vel γραφήν) to reject the charge brought against a man, i. e. acquit him, opp. to καταγιγνώσκειν τινός, Dem.: also, ἀπ. τινά (sc. τῆς δίκης vel γραφῆς) to judge one free from the accusation, to acquit him, Dem.

div1.head: ἀπόγνοια
div1.sense: despair of a thing, c. gen., Thuc.

div1.head: ἀπόγονος
div1.sense: born or descended from, Lat. oriundus, Hdt.: in pl. descendants, Hdt., Thuc.; ἀπόγονοι τεαί thy offspring, Soph.

div1.head: ἀπογραφή
div1.sense: a writing off: a register, list, of lands or property, Plat., etc.: a register of persons liable to taxation, Lat. census, NTest.
as Attic law-term, the copy of a γραφή, a deposition, Oratt.

div1.head: ἀπογράφω
div1.sense: to write off, copy: to enter in a list, register, Hdt., Plat.:—Mid. to have names registered by others, or to register for oneʼs own use, Hdt., Plat.
Mid. also to give in oneʼs name, register, or enlist oneself, Xen.
as Attic law-term,
ἀπογράφειν τινά to enter a personʼs name as accused, give in a copy of the charge against him, to inform against, denounce, Xen.

to give in a list of property alleged to belong to the state, but held by a private person, Oratt.:—also, ἀπέγραψεν ταῦτα ἔχοντα αὐτόν gave a written acknowledgment that he was in possession of this property, Dem.

div1.head: ἀπογυιόω
div1.sense: to deprive one of the use of his limbs, to enfeeble, μή μʼ ἀπογυιώσηις Il.

div1.head: ἀπογυμνάζω
div1.sense: to bring into hard exercise, to ply hard, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀπογυμνόω
div1.sense: to strip quite bare of arms: Pass. to be so stripped, Od.:—Mid. to strip oneself, Xen.

div1.head: ἀποδάκνω
div1.sense: to bite off a piece of a thing, c. gen.:—Pass., μῆλα ἀποδεδηγμένα with pieces bitten out, Luc.
absol. to bite hard, gnaw, Xen.

div1.head: ἀποδακρύω
div1.sense: to weep much for, lament loudly, τινά Plat.
ἀπ. γνώμην is to weep away oneʼs judgment, Ar.

div1.head: ἀποδαρθάνω
div1.sense: to sleep a little, Plut.

div1.head: ἀποδάσμιος
div1.sense: parted from the rest, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀποδασμός
div1.sense: a division, part of a whole, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀποδατέομαι
div1.sense: to portion out to others, to apportion, τί τινι Il.
to part off, separate, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀποδεής
div1.sense: wanting much, not fully manned, Plut.

div1.head: ἀποδειδίσσομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to frighten away, Il.

div1.head: ἀποδείκνυμι
div1.sense: to point away from other objects at one, and so,
to point out, shew forth, exhibit, make known, by deed or word, τί τινι Hdt.; τι Aesch.
to bring forward, shew, produce, Lat. praestare, μαρτύρια τουτέων Hdt.; παῖδας Soph.; ὑγιέα τινὰ ἐόντα ἀπ. to produce him safe and sound, Hdt.
to produce or deliver in accounts, λόγον Hdt., Thuc.
to publish a law, Lat. promulgare, Xen.
to appoint, assign, τέμενος, βωμὸν ἀπ. τινί Hdt.:—Pass., χῶρος ἀποδεδεγμένος an appointed place, Xen.
to shew by argument, prove, demonstrate, Ar., Plat., etc.; ἀπ. τινὰ οὐδὲν λέγοντα to make it evident that he says nothing, Hdt.
to appoint, name, create, ἀπ. τινὰ βασιλέα Hdt., Xen.
to make, render, ἀπ. τινὰ μοχθηρόν to make him a rascal, Ar.; ἀπ. τινὰ κράτιστον Xen.
to represent as, ἀπ. παῖδα Hdt.:—Pass., οὐκ ἐν τοῖσι θεοῖσι ἀποδεδέχαται (Ionic 3rd pl. perf.) have not been considered, admitted among, Xen.
Mid. to shew forth, exhibit something of oneʼs own, ἀποδέξασθαι τὴν γνώμην to deliver oneʼs opinion, Hdt.; μνημόσυνα ἀπ. memorials of oneself, Hdt.:—Pass., ἔργα μέγαλα ἀποδεχθέντα Hdt.
just like Act., ἀποδ. ὅτι . . , to declare that . . , Xen.

div1.head: ἀποδεικτέος
div1.sense: one must prove, Plat.
c. dupl. acc. one must make one so and so, Luc.

div1.head: ἀποδειλίασις
div1.sense: great cowardice, Plut.

div1.head: ἀποδειλιατέος
div1.sense: one must flinch, Plat.

div1.head: ἀποδειλιάω
div1.sense: to play the coward, to flinch from danger or toil, Xen., Plat.

div1.head: ἀπόδειξις
div1.sense: a shewing forth, exhibiting, Eur.
a setting forth, exposition, publication, Hdt., Thuc.
a shewing, proving, proof, Hdt., Attic; pl. proofs, arguments in proof of, τινος Dem.
(from Mid.) ἀπ. ἔργων μεγάλων a display, performance of mighty works, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀποδειπνίδιος
div1.sense: of or from supper, Anth.

div1.head: ἀποδειροτομέω
div1.sense: to slaughter by cutting off the head or cutting the throat, Hom.

div1.head: ἀποδεκατόω
div1.sense: to tithe, pay tithes of, πάντα NTest.; ἀπ. τινά to take tithe of him, NTest.

div1.head: ἀποδεκτέος
div1.sense: one must receive from others, τι Xen.
one must accept, allow, admit, τι Plat.; c. gen. pers. et part., ἀπ. τινὸς λέγοντος Plat.

div1.head: ἀποδεκτήρ
div1.sense: a receiver, Xen.

div1.head: ἀποδέκτης
div1.sense: a receiver, name of a magistrate at Athens who paid the dicasts, Dem.

div1.head: ἀποδεκτός
div1.sense: acceptable, NTest.

div1.head: ἀποδενδρόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be turned into a tree, Luc.

div1.head: ἀπόδερμα
div1.sense: a hide stripped off, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀποδέρω
div1.sense: to flay or skin completely, τὸν βοῦν Hdt.; ἀπ. τὴν κεφαλήν to take off the scalp, Hdt.:—Pass., πρόβατα ἀποδαρέντα Xen.
ἀπ. τὴν δορήν to strip off the skin, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀπόδεσμος
div1.sense: a breastband, girdle, Luc.
a bundle, bunch, Plut.

div1.head: ἀποδέχομαι
div1.sense: to accept from another, to accept, Il., Attic
to accept as a teacher, follow, Xen.
to admit to oneʼs presence, Plat.

to receive favourably, approve, allow, accept, admit, Thuc., etc.; οὐκ ἀπ. not to accept, reject, Hdt.:—the person from whom one accepts in gen., ἀπ. τί τινος Thuc., etc.; but acc. being omitted, gen. pers. becomes dependent on the Verb, with a partic. added, ἀπ. τινὸς λέγοντος to accept [a statement] from him, i. e. to accept his statements, Plat.: —absol. to accept a statement, be satisfied, Dem.
to take a thing in a certain way, with an adv., Xen.; ὑπόπτως ἀπ. τι Thuc.; δυσχερῶς Plat.
to receive back, recover, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: ἀποδέω
div1.sense: to bind fast, Plat.

div1.head: ἀποδέω
div1.sense: to be in want of, lack, τριακοσίων ἀποδέοντα μύρια 1, lacking 300, Thuc.: to fall short of, be inferior to, τινός Luc.

div1.head: ἀποδημέω
div1.sense: to be away from home, be abroad or on oneʼs travels, Hdt., Attic
to go abroad, ἀπ. παρά τινα to visit him, Hdt.; ἀπ. ἐς Αἰγίναν κατά τι to go abroad to Aegina to fetch a thing, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀποδημητής
div1.sense: one who goes abroad, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀποδημητικός
div1.sense: fond of travelling: παράστασις ἀπ. banishment to foreign parts, i. e. ostracism, Arist.

div1.head: ἀποδημία
div1.sense: a being from home, a going or being abroad, Hdt., Attic; περὶ τῆς ἀπ. τῆς ἐκεῖ as to my life in that foreign land, i. e. beyond the grave, Plat.

div1.head: ἀπόδημος
div1.sense: away from oneʼs country, from home, abroad, Pind., Plut.

div1.head: ἀποδιαιτάω
div1.sense: to decide for one in an arbitration, opp. to καταδιαιτάω (to decide against), Dem.

div1.head: ἀποδιατρίβω
div1.sense: to wear quite away, to waste utterly, Aeschin.

div1.head: ἀποδιδράσκω
div1.sense: to run away or off, escape, or flee from, esp. by stealth, Od., Hdt., Attic; of runaway slaves, Xen.; of soldiers, to desert, Xen.
c. acc. to flee, shun, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: ἀποδίδωμι
div1.sense: to give up or back, restore, return, τί τινι Hom., Attic: esp. to render what is due, to pay, as debts, penalties, submission, Il.; ἀπ. τινὶ λώβην to give him back his insult, i. e. make atonement for it, Il.; ἀπ. ἀμοιβήν τινι Theogn., etc.
to return, render, yield, of land, ἐπὶ διηκόσια ἀποδοῦναι (sc. καρπόν) to yield fruit two hundred-fold, Hdt.
c. inf. to suffer or allow a person to do a thing, ἀπ. τισὶ αὐτονομεῖσθαι Thuc., etc.:—so in Pass., ὁ λόγος ἀπεδόθη αὐτοῖς right of speech was allowed them, Aeschin.
to render so and so, ἀπ. τὴν τέρψιν βεβαιοτέραν Isocr.
to deliver over, give up, as a slave, Eur.; ἀπ. ἐπιστολήν to deliver a letter, Thuc.
λόγον ἀπ. to render or give in an account, Lat. rationes referre, Dem.: to give an account of a thing, Eur.
ἀπ. ὅρκον, v. ὅρκος.
intr. to increase, much like ἐπιδίδωμι III, ἢν ἡ χώρη ἐπιδιδῶι ἐς ὕψος καὶ ἀποδιδῶι ἐς αὔξησιν Hdt.;—unless here it means the contrary, if the land increase in height and decrease in productiveness.

Mid. to give away of oneʼs own will, to sell, Hdt., Attic; ἀπ. τι ἐς Ἑλλάδα to take to Greece and sell it there, Hdt.; ἀπ. τοῦ εὑρίσκοντος to sell for what it will fetch, Aeschin.: at Athens, to farm out the public taxes, Dem.

div1.head: ἀποδικεῖν
div1.etym: inf. of ἀπέδικον, aor2 with no pres. in use.
div1.sense: to throw off or away, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: ἀποδικέω
div1.sense: to defend oneself on trial, Xen.

div1.head: ἀποδινέω
div1.sense: to thresh corn (v. δῖνος II), Hdt.

div1.head: ἀποδίομαι
div1.sense: = ἀποδιώκω, only in pres., Il.

div1.head: ἀποδιοπομπέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to avert threatened evils by offerings to Zeus, to conjure away, Plat.

div1.head: ἀποδιορίζω
div1.sense: to mark off by dividing, to separate, NTest.

div1.head: ἀποδιώκω
div1.sense: to chase away, Thuc.; οὐκ ἀποδιώξει σαυτόν; i. e. take yourself off, Ar.

div1.head: ἀποδοκεῖ
div1.sense: it seems good not to do a thing, c. inf., ἀπέδοξέ σφι πράττειν or μὴ πράττειν Hdt., Xen.; sometimes with the inf. omitted, ὥς σφι ἀπέδοξε when they resolved not (to go on), Hdt.

div1.head: ἀποδοκιμάζω
div1.sense: to reject on scrutiny, to reject for want of qualification, Hdt., Attic:—generally, to reject as unworthy or unfit, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: ἀποδοκιμαστέος
div1.sense: one must reject, Xen.
-έος, έα, έον, to be rejected, Arist., Luc.

div1.head: ἀποδοκιμάω
div1.sense: to reject, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀπόδοσις
div1.sense: a giving back, restitution, return, τινος of a thing, Hdt., Attic
payment, τοῦ μισθοῦ Thuc.

div1.head: ἀποδοτέος
div1.sense: one must give back, refer, assign, τί τινι Plat.
one must describe, Plat.

div1.head: ἀποδοχή
div1.sense: a receiving back, having restored to one, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀπόδρασις
div1.sense: a running away, escape, Hdt.: c. gen. escape from, στρατείας Dem.

div1.head: ἀποδρέπω
div1.sense: to pluck off, Pind.; ἀπόδρεπε οἴκαδε βότρυς pluck and take them home, Hes., Anth.

div1.head: ἀποδρύπτω
div1.sense: to tear off the skin, lacerate, Hom.:—Pass., of the skin, to be torn off, Od.

div1.head: ἀποδύρομαι
div1.sense: to lament bitterly, Hdt., Attic

div1.head: ἀποδυτέος
div1.sense: one must strip, τινά Luc.
from Pass., ἀπ. ταῖς γυναιξίν they must strip off their clothes, Plat.

div1.head: ἀποδυτήριον
div1.sense: an undressing room, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: ἀποδύω
div1.sense: to strip off clothes or armour, Il.:—Pass., fut. -δυθήσομαι: aor1 -εδύθην υ: perf. -δέδυμαι.
to strip a person of clothes, ἀπέδυσε τὰς γυναῖκας Hdt., etc.:—Pass. to be stripped of oneʼs clothes, Ar.

Mid., fut. -δύσομαι [ῡ]: aor1 -εδυσάμην; also intr. aor2 act. ἀπέδυν, perf. ἀποδέδῡκα:— to strip off oneself, take off, εἵματα Od.:—absol., ἀποδυσάμενος having stripped, Ar.; ἀποδύντες stripped naked, Thuc.; ἀποδύεσθαι εἴς or πρός τι to strip for gymnastic exercises, Plut.:—metaph., ἀποδύντες ἐπίωμεν let us strip and attack, Ar.
to strip off, βοείην Od.

div1.head: ἀποείκω
div1.sense: to withdraw from the path, c. gen., Il.

div1.head: ἀπόερσε
div1.sense: old Epic aor1 only found in 3 pers. ἀπόερσε, swept away, subj. ἀποέρσηι, opt. ἀποέρσειε, all in Il.

div1.head: ἀποζάω
div1.sense: to live off, ὅσον ἀποζῆν enough to live off, Thuc.
to live poorly, Luc.

div1.head: ἀποζεύγνυμι
div1.sense: Mostly pass.:— to be parted from, γυναικός Eur.; εἰ γάμων ἀπεζύγην if I were free from wedlock, Eur.; ἀπεζύγην πόδας I started on foot, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀπόζω
div1.sense: to smell of something, τινος Ibyc.:— impers., ἀπόζει τῆς Ἀραβίης there comes an odour from Arabia, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀποθάλλω
div1.sense: to lose the bloom, Anth.

div1.head: ἀποθαρρέω
div1.sense: to have full confidence, Xen.

div1.head: ἀποθαυμάζω
div1.sense: to marvel much at a thing, c. acc., Od.:—absol. to wonder much, Hdt., Aesch.

div1.head: ἄποθεν
div1.sense: from afar, Thuc., Xen.
afar off, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: ἀποθεόω
div1.sense: to deify:— Pass., Epic aor1 part. ἀποθειωθείς Anth.

div1.head: ἀποθεραπεία
div1.sense: regular worship, θεῶν Arist.

div1.head: ἀποθερίζω
div1.sense: to cut off, κόμας Eur.

div1.head: ἀπόθεσις
div1.sense: a laying up in store, Plat.
a putting aside, getting rid of a thing, c. gen., NTest.
= ἀποδυτήριον, Luc.

div1.head: ἀπόθεστος
div1.sense: despised, Od.

div1.head: Ἀπόθεται
div1.sense: a place in Lacedaemon, into which misshapen children were thrown, Plut.

div1.head: ἀπόθετος
div1.sense: laid by, stored up, Plut., Luc.
hidden, secret, mysterious, ἔπη Plat.
reserved for occasions, special, Dem.

div1.head: ἀποθέω
div1.sense: to run away, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: ἀποθεώρησις
div1.sense: serious contemplation, Plut.

div1.head: ἀποθέωσις
div1.sense: deification, Strab.

div1.head: ἀποθήκη
div1.sense: any place wherein to lay up a thing, a barn, magazine, storehouse, Thuc.
anything laid by, a store, ἀποθήκην ποιεῖσθαι ἔς τινα to lay up store of favour with him, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀποθηλύνω
div1.sense: to make effeminate, enervate, Plut.

div1.head: ἀποθησαυρίζω
div1.sense: to store, hoard up, Luc.

div1.head: ἀποθλίβω
div1.sense: to press upon, press, squeeze out, Eur.
of a crowd, NTest.

div1.head: ἀπόθλιψις
div1.sense: a squeezing out of oneʼs place, Luc.

div1.head: ἀποθνῄσκω
div1.sense: to die off, die, Hom., Attic:— to be ready to die of laughter, Ar.
serving as Pass. of ἀποκτείνω, to be put to death, to be slain, ὑπό τινος Hdt., Plat.

div1.head: ἀποθρασύνομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to be very bold, dare all things, Dem.

div1.head: ἀποθραύω
div1.sense: to break off, Aesch.:—Pass. to be broken off: metaph., ἀποθραυσθῆναι τῆς εὐκλείας to be broken off from oneʼs fair fame, make shipwreck of it, Ar.

div1.head: ἀποθρηνέω
div1.sense: to lament much, Babr., Plut.

div1.head: ἀποθριάζω
div1.sense: properly, to cut off fig-leaves: to cut off, curtail, Ar.

div1.head: ἀποθρύπτω
div1.sense: to crush in pieces:— metaph. in Pass., ἀποτεθρυμμένος broken, enervated, Plat.

div1.head: ἀποθρῴσκω
div1.sense: to leap off from, νηός Il.; ἀφʼ ἵππου, ἀπὸ νεός Hdt.
to leap up from, rise from, καπνὸν ἀποθρώσκοντα γαίης Od.:—absol. to rise sheer up, of rocks, Hes.

div1.head: ἀποθύμιος
div1.sense: not according to the mind, unpleasant, hateful, ἀποθύμια ἔρδειν τινί to do one a disfavour, Il.; ἀποθύμιόν τι ποιῆσαι Hdt.

div1.head: ἀποθύω
div1.sense: to offer as a votive sacrifice, Xen.

div1.head: ἀποίδησις
div1.sense: abatement of a swelling, Strab.

div1.head: ἀποίητος
div1.sense: not done, undone, Pind.: not to be done, impossible, Plut.

div1.head: ἀποικέω
div1.sense: to go away from home, to settle in a foreign country, emigrate, ἐς Θουρίους Plat.
to dwell afar off, to live or be far away, Eur., Thuc.: Pass., ἡ Κόρινθος ἐξ ἐμοῦ μακρὰν ἀπωικεῖτο Corinth was inhabited far away from me, i. e. I settled far from Corinth, Soph.

div1.head: ἀποικία
div1.sense: a settlement far from home, a colony settlement, Hdt., etc.; εἰς ἀπ. στέλλειν to send away so as to form a settlement, Hdt.; ἀπ. ἐκπέμπειν Thuc.

div1.head: ἀποικίζω
div1.sense: to send away from home, Od., Soph., etc.:—Pass. to be settled in a far land, to emigrate, Plat.
to colonise a place, send a colony to it, c. acc., Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: ἀποικισμός
div1.sense: the settlement of a colony, Arist.

div1.head: ἀποικίς
div1.sense: a colony, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀποικοδομέω
div1.sense: to cut off by building, wall up, barricade, τὰς θύρας, τὰς ὁδούς Thuc.

div1.head: ἄποικος
div1.sense: away from home, ἀπ. πέμπειν τινὰ γῆς to send away from oneʼs country, Soph.
as Subst.,
a settler, colonist, Hdt., Thuc., etc.
ἄποικος (sub. πόλις), a colony, Xen.

div1.head: ἀποικτίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to complain loudly of a thing, c. acc., Hdt.

div1.head: ἀποίμαντος
div1.sense: unfed, untended, Anth.

div1.head: ἀποιμώζω
div1.sense: to bewail loudly, c. acc., Trag.

div1.head: ἄποινα
div1.sense: a ransom or price paid, whether to recover freedom or to save oneʼs life or to redeem the corpse of a friend, Il.; c. gen., ἄποινα κούρης, υἷος ransom for them, Il.
generally, compensation, requital, recompense for a thing, c. gen., Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: ἀποινάω
div1.sense: to demand the fine due from the murderer, Lex ap. Dem.:—Mid. to hold to ransom, Eur.

div1.head: ἀποινόδικος
div1.sense: exacting penalty, Eur.

div1.head: ἀποϊστεύω
div1.sense: to kill with arrows, Anth.

div1.head: ἀποίχομαι
div1.sense: to be gone away, to be far from, c. gen., Il., Attic
absol. to be gone, to have departed, to be absent, Od.: hence, to be gone, to have perished, ἀποίχεται χάρις Eur.: of persons, to be dead and gone, Pind., Ar.

div1.head: ἀποκαθαίρω
div1.sense: to cleanse or clean quite, ἀπ. τὴν χεῖρα εἰς τὰ χειρόμακτρα upon the towels, Xen.
to refine from dross, Strab.: metaph. in Pass., ἀποκεκαθάρθαι τὴν φωνήν to be pure in dialect, Luc.
to clear away, τὰς τραπέζας Ar.:—Mid., ἀποκαθήρασθαί τινος to rid oneself of a thing, Xen.

div1.head: ἀποκάθαρσις
div1.sense: a clearing off, purging, Thuc.
lustration, Plut.

div1.head: ἀποκάθημαι
div1.sense: Pass. to sit apart, ἀτιμώμενοι ἀποκατέαται (Ionic for -κάθηνται) Hdt.

div1.head: ἀποκαθίστημι
div1.sense: to re-establish, restore, reinstate, Xen.

div1.head: ἀποκαίνυμαι
div1.sense: Pass. to surpass or vanquish, c. acc., Od.

div1.head: ἀποκαίριος
div1.sense: unseasonable, Soph.

div1.head: ἀποκαίω
div1.sense: to burn off, of cautery, Xen.: of intense cold (like Virgilʼs frigus adurit), to shrivel up, Xen.:— Pass., ἀπεκαίοντο αἱ ῥῖνες their noses were frozen off, Xen.

div1.head: ἀποκαλέω
div1.sense: to call back, recall, from exile, Hdt., Xen.
to call away or aside, Xen.
to call by a name, esp. by way of disparagement, to stigmatise as, τὸν τοῦ μανέντος ξύναιμον ἀποκαλοῦντες Soph.; σοφιστὴν ἀπ. τινα Xen.

div1.head: ἀποκαλύπτω
div1.sense: to uncover, τὴν κεφαλήν Hdt., etc.
to disclose, reveal, Plat.:—Mid. to reveal oneʼs whole mind, Plut., NTest.:—Pass. to be disclosed, made known, NTest.

div1.head: ἀποκάλυψις
div1.sense: an uncovering, a revelation, NTest.: — the Apocalypse, NTest.

div1.head: ἀποκάμνω
div1.sense: to grow quite weary, fail or flag utterly, Soph., Plat.; c. part., ἀπ. ζητῶν to be quite weary of seeking, Plat.
c. inf. to cease to do, Eur., Plat.
c. acc., ἀπ. πόνον to flinch from toil, Xen.

div1.head: ἀποκάμπτω
div1.sense: intr. to turn off or aside, Xen.

div1.head: ἀπόκαμψις
div1.sense: a turning off the road, Theophr.

div1.head: ἀποκαπύω
div1.sense: to breathe away, ἀπὸ δὲ ψυχὴν ἐκάπυσσεν (Epic aor1 in tmesi) she gasped forth her life, Il.

div1.head: ἀποκαραδοκία
div1.sense: earnest expectation, NTest.

div1.head: ἀποκαρτερέω
div1.sense: to kill oneself by abstinence, Plut.

div1.head: ἀποκαταλλάσσω
div1.sense: to reconcile again, NTest.

div1.head: ἀποκαυλίζω
div1.sense: to break off by the stalk: to break short off, Eur., Thuc.

div1.head: ἀποκαύλισις
div1.sense: a breaking short off, snapping, Luc.

div1.head: ἀπόκειμαι
div1.sense: used as Pass. of ἀποτίθημι, to be laid away, absol. to be laid up in store, Soph., Xen.; πολύς σοι γέλως ἐστὶν ἀποκείμενος you have great store of laughter in reserve, Xen.

div1.head: ἀποκείρω
div1.sense: to clip or cut off hair, mostly in Mid., ἀπεκείρατο χαίτην cut off his hair, Il.; ἀποκείρασθαι τὰς κεφαλάς to have their hair shorn close, Hdt.; and absol., ἀποκείρασθαι to cut off oneʼs hair, Ar.:—Pass., perf. part. ἀποκεκαρμένος with oneʼs hair cut short, Hdt.
metaph. to cheat, τοὺς παχεῖς Luc.
generally, to cut through, sever, Il.
to cut off, slay, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀποκερδαίνω
div1.sense: to have benefit, enjoyment from or of a thing, c. gen., Eur.; absol., Luc.

div1.head: ἀποκερματίζω
div1.sense: to change for small coin: metaph., ἀπ. τὸν βίον to dissipate oneʼs substance, Anth.

div1.head: ἀποκηδεύω
div1.sense: to cease to mourn for, τινά Hdt.

div1.head: ἀποκηδέω
div1.sense: to put away care, be careless, Il.

div1.head: ἀποκήρυκτος
div1.sense: disinherited, Luc.

div1.head: ἀποκήρυξις
div1.sense: public renunciation of a son, disinheriting, Plut., Luc.

div1.head: ἀποκηρύσσω
div1.sense: to sell by auction, Hdt.
to renounce publicly, to disinherit, Plat.
to forbid by proclamation: impers. in perf. pass., ἀποκεκήρυκται μὴ στρατεύειν Xen.

div1.head: ἀποκινδύνευσις
div1.sense: a venturous attempt, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀποκινδυνεύω
div1.sense: to make a bold attempt or venture, try a forlorn hope, πρός τινα against another, Thuc.; c. inf., ἀποκινδυνεύετον σοφόν τι λέγειν Ar.:—Pass., to be put to the uttermost hazard, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀποκινέω
div1.sense: to remove or put away from, c. gen., Hom.

div1.head: ἀπόκινος
div1.sense: a comic dance:— metaph., ἀπόκινον εὑρέ find some way to dance off, Ar.

div1.head: ἀποκλάζω
div1.sense: to ring or shout forth, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀποκλάζω
div1.sense: to bend oneʼs knees.

div1.head: ἀποκλαίω
div1.sense: to weep aloud, Hdt.; c. acc. cogn., ἀπ. στόνον Soph.
ἀπ. τινα or τι to bewail much, mourn deeply for, Aesch., Plat.; so in Mid., ἀποκλαίεσθαι κακά Soph.; τὴν πενίαν Ar.
Mid., also, to cease to wail, Luc.

div1.head: ἀποκλάω
div1.sense: to break off:— Mid., Anth.: —Pass., aor1 part. ἀποκλασθέντα Theocr.

div1.head: ἀπόκλεισις
div1.sense: a shutting up, ἀπόκλ. μου τῶν πυλῶν a shutting the gates against me, Thuc.
a shutting out, ἀποκλήισεις γίγνεσθαι (sc. ἔμελλον) there would be a complete stoppage to their works, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀποκλείω
div1.sense: to shut off from or out of, debar, τινὰ πυλέων Hdt.; δωμάτων Aesch.; ἀπ. τινά to shut him out, Ar.:—Mid., ἀπ. τινα τῆς διαβάσεως to get him debarred from passing, Thuc.
to shut out or exclude from a thing, τινός Hdt., etc.; ἀπό τινος Ar.
to shut up a gate and the like, to bar, close, Hdt.:—Pass. to be closed, Ar.
to shut up one in prison, Soph., Ar., etc.
to shut out, intercept, bar, Hdt., Ar.:—Pass., ἀπ. ὑπὸ τῆς ἵππου Hdt.

div1.head: ἀπόκληρος
div1.sense: without lot or share of a thing, c. gen., Pind.

div1.head: ἀποκληρόω
div1.sense: to choose by lot from a number, Hdt., Thuc.: to choose or elect by lot, Thuc.
to allot, assign by lot, χώραν τινί Plut.

div1.head: ἀποκλίνω
div1.sense: to turn off or aside, τι Od.: to turn back, Hhymn.:—Pass., of the day, to decline, get towards evening, Hdt.
Pass. to be upset, Dem.
intr. in Act. to turn aside or off the road, Xen.; πρὸς τὴν ἠῶ ἀποκλίνοντι as one turns to go Eastward, Hdt.
often in bad sense, to fall away, decline, degenerate, Soph.; ἐπὶ τὸ ῥαιθυμεῖν Dem.:—and without bad sense, to have a leaning, be favourably disposed, πρός τινα Soph.

div1.head: ἀπόκλισις
div1.sense: a turning off, declension, sinking, Plut.

div1.head: ἀποκλύζω
div1.sense: to wash away: metaph. in Mid. to purge, Plat.: to avert by purifications, Ar.

div1.head: ἀποκναίω
div1.sense: to wear one out, worry to death, Plat., etc.:—Pass. to be worn out, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: ἀποκνέω
div1.sense: to shrink from danger, c. acc., Thuc.: —c. inf. to shrink from doing, Thuc., Plat.
absol. to shrink back, hesitate, Thuc., Plat., etc.

div1.head: ἀπόκνησις
div1.sense: a shrinking from, c. gen., Thuc.

div1.head: ἀποκνητέος
div1.sense: verb. adj. of ἀποκνέω, Plat.

div1.head: ἀποκνίζω
div1.sense: to nip off.

div1.head: ἀπόκνισμα
div1.sense: that which is nipt off, a little bit, Ar.

div1.head: ἀποκοιμάομαι
div1.sense: Pass.
to sleep away from home, Plat.
to get a little sleep, Hdt., Ar.

div1.head: ἀποκοιτέω
div1.sense: to sleep away from oneʼs post, Decret. ap. Dem.

div1.head: ἀπόκοιτος
div1.sense: sleeping away from others, c. gen., Aeschin.

div1.head: ἀποκολυμβάω
div1.sense: to dive and swim away, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀποκομιδή
div1.sense: a getting away, getting back, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀποκομίζω
div1.sense: to carry away, escort, Xen.: to carry away captive, Thuc.:—Pass. to take oneself off, get away, Xen.: to return, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀπόκομμα
div1.sense: a splinter, chip, shred, Theocr., Luc.

div1.head: ἀποκομπάζω
div1.sense: of lyre strings, to break with a snap, Anth.

div1.head: ἀποκοπή
div1.sense: a cutting off, Aesch.; ἀπ. χρεῶν, the Rom. tabulae novae, a cancelling of all debts, Plat.
in Gramm. apocope, the cutting off letters from a word.

div1.head: ἀποκόπτω
div1.sense: to cut off, hew off, of menʼs limbs, Il., Hdt.; also, ἀπέκοψε παρήορον he cut loose the tracehorse, Il.:—Pass., ἀποκοπῆναι τὴν χεῖρα to have it cut off, Hdt.
ἀπ. τινὰ ἀπὸ τόπου to beat off from a strong place, Xen.
Mid. to smite the breast in mourning: c. acc. to mourn for, νεκρόν Eur.

div1.head: ἀποκορυφόω
div1.sense: to bring to a point:— metaph., ἀπεκορύφου σφι τάδε gave them this short answer, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀποκοσμέω
div1.sense: to restore order by clearing away, to clear away, Od.

div1.head: ἀποκοτταβίζω
div1.sense: to dash out the last drops of wine, as in playing at the cottabus, Xen.

div1.head: ἀποκουφίζω
div1.sense: to lighten, set free from, relieve, τινὰ κακῶν Eur.

div1.head: ἀποκράδιος
div1.sense: plucked from the fig-tree, Anth.

div1.head: ἀποκραιπαλάω
div1.sense: to sleep off a debauch, Plut.

div1.head: ἀποκρανίζω
div1.sense: to strike off from the head, Anth.

div1.head: ἀποκρατέω
div1.sense: to exceed all others, Lat. superare, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀποκρεμάννυμι
div1.sense: to let hang down, Il.; χορδὰν πλῆκτρον ἀπεκρέμασε the plectrum broke the string so that it hung down, Anth.
to hang up, suspend, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀπόκρημνος
div1.sense: broken sheer off, precipitous, Hdt., Thuc., etc.:—metaph. full of difficulties, Dem.

div1.head: ἀπόκριμα
div1.sense: a judicial sentence, NTest.

div1.head: ἀποκρίνω
div1.sense: to separate, set apart, Plat.:— Pass., ἀποκρινθέντε parted from the throng, of two heroes coming forward as champions, Il.; ἀποκεκρίσθαι εἰς ἓν ὄνομα to be separated and brought under one name, Thuc.
to mark by a distinctive form, distinguish , Hdt.; perf. pass. part. ἀποκεκριμένος distinct, Plat.
to choose out, choose, Hdt., Plat.

Mid. ἀποκρίνομαι, fut. -κρινοῦμαι: perf. -κέκριμαι both in mid. and pass. sense:— to give answer to, reply, Eur., etc.; ἀπ πρός τινα or πρός τι to reply to a questioner or question, Thuc., etc.:—c. acc., ἀποκρίνεσθαι τὸ ἐρωτηθέν to answer the question, Thuc.: so in Pass., τοῦτό μοι ἀποκεκρίσθω let this be my answer, Plat.
to answer charges, defend oneself, Ar.
aor1 pass. ἀπεκρίθη, ἀπεκρίνατο, he answered, first in NTest.

div1.head: ἀπόκρισις
div1.sense: a separating.
(from Mid.) an answer, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: ἀποκριτέος
div1.sense: one must reject, Plat.
one must answer, Plat.

div1.head: ἀπόκροτος
div1.sense: beaten or trodden hard, of ground, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀποκρούω
div1.sense: to beat off from a place, Xen.:—Mid. to beat off from oneself, beat off an attack, Hdt., Thuc.: —Pass. to be beaten off, Thuc., Xen., etc.
Pass., κοτυλίσκιον τὸ χεῖλος ἀποκεκρουμένον a cup with the lip knocked off, Ar.

div1.head: ἀποκρύπτω
div1.sense: to hide from, keep hidden from, c. acc. et gen., θανάτοιο ἀπ. τινα Il.; c. dupl. acc., like Lat. celare aliquem aliquid, to keep back from one, Hdt.; so in Mid., ἀποκρύπτεσθαί τινά τι Xen., etc.
to hide from sight, keep hidden, conceal, Od., Attic:—Mid., ἀποκρύπτεσθαι μὴ ποιεῖν τι to conceal oneʼs doing, Thuc.
to obscure, throw into the shade, Plat.
ἀπ. γῆν to lose from sight, of ships running out to sea, like Virgilʼs Phaeacum abscondimus arces, Plat., Luc.

div1.head: ἀπόκρυφος
div1.sense: hidden, concealed, Eur.; ἐν ἀποκρύφωι in secret, Hdt.
c. gen. concealed from, unknown to one, Xen.
obscure, hard to understand, Xen.

div1.head: ἀποκτείνω
div1.etym: pass. rare, ἀποθνῄσκω being used as pass.
div1.sense: to kill, slay, Hom., Hdt., Attic
of judges, to condemn to death, Plat., Xen., etc.
metaph., like Lat. enecare, to weary to death, Eur.

div1.head: ἀποκτίννυμι
div1.sense: to kill Plat., Xen.

div1.head: ἀποκυέω
div1.sense: to bear young, bring forth, c. acc., Plut., Luc.:—metaph., ἡ ἁμαρτία ἀπ. θάνατον NTest.

div1.head: ἀποκυλίω
div1.sense: to roll away, NTest.:—Pass., Luc.

div1.head: ἀποκωκύω
div1.sense: to mourn loudly over, τινά Aesch.

div1.head: ἀποκώλυσις
div1.sense: a hindrance, Xen.

div1.head: ἀποκωλύω
div1.sense: to hinder or prevent from a thing, τινά τινος Xen.; c. inf., ἀπ. τινὰ ποιεῖν to prevent from doing, forbid to do, μὴ ποιεῖν τι Eur., Xen.
c. acc. only, to keep off, hinder, Orac. ap. Hdt., Thuc.: —absol. to stop the way, Thuc.:—impers., οὐδὲν ἀποκωλύει there is no hindrance, Plat.

div1.head: ἀπολαγχάνω
div1.sense: to obtain a portion of a thing by lot, τῶν κτημάτων τὸ μέρος ἀπ. Hdt.; generally to obtain, Eur.
to fail in drawing lots, Plut.: generally to be left destitute, Eur.

div1.head: ἀπολακτίζω
div1.sense: to kick off or away, shake off, ὕπνον Aesch.
to spurn, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀπολαλέω
div1.sense: to speak out heedlessly, Luc.

div1.head: ἀπολαμβάνω
div1.sense: to take or receive from another, παρά τινος Thuc.:— to receive what is oneʼs due, μισθόν Hdt., Xen.; ἀπ. ὅρκους to accept oaths tendered, Dem.
c. gen. to take of, take part of a thing, Thuc.
to hear or learn, Lat. accipio, Plat.
to take back, get back, regain, recover, τὴν τυραννίδα Hdt.
to have an account rendered one, ἀπ. λόγον Aeschin.
to take apart or aside, ἀπ. τινὰ μοῦνον Hdt.; ἀπολαβὼν σκόπει consider it separately, Plat.
to cut off, intercept, arrest, Hdt.; ἀπ. τείχει to intercept by a wall, Thuc.:—Pass. to be arrested or stopped by contrary winds, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀπολαμπρύνω
div1.sense: to make famous:— Pass. to become so, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀπολάμπω
div1.sense: to shine or beam from a thing, of light, Il.; so in Mid., χάρις ἀπελάμπετο grace beamed from her, Hom.

div1.head: ἀπολάπτω
div1.sense: to lap up like a dog, swallow greedily, Ar.

div1.head: ἀπόλαυσις
div1.sense: enjoyment, fruition, Thuc., Arist.
c. gen. advantage got from a thing, Xen.; ἀπόλαυσιν εἰκοῦς (acc. absol.) as a reward for your resemblance, Eur.

div1.head: ἀπόλαυσμα
div1.sense: enjoyment, Aeschin.

div1.head: ἀπολαυστικός
div1.sense: devoted to enjoyment, Arist.; producing enjoyment, Arist.:—adv., ἀπολαυστικῶς ζῆν to live a life of pleasure, Arist.

div1.head: ἀπολαυστός
div1.sense: enjoyed, enjoyable, Plut.

div1.head: ἀπολαύω
div1.sense: to have enjoyment of a thing, to have the benefit of it, to enjoy, c. gen., Hdt., Attic:—with acc. added, ἀπολαύειν τί τινος to enjoy an advantage from some source, Ar., Thuc.
ironically, to have the benefit of, τῶν Οἰδίπου κακῶν Eur.: —absol. to have a benefit, come finely off, Ar.

div1.head: ἀπολέγω
div1.sense: to pick out from a number, to pick out, choose, Hdt.:—Mid. to pick out for oneself, Hdt., Thuc.; ἀπολελεγμένοι, Attic -ειλεγμένοι, picked men, Hdt., Xen.
div1.head: ἀπολέγω
div1.sense: like ἀπαγορεύω, to decline, refuse: — Mid. to decline something offered to one, renounce, Plut.:—absol. to give in, Plut.

div1.head: ἀπολείβω
div1.sense: to let drop off, to pour a libation, Hes.:—Pass. to drop or run down from, τινός Od.

div1.head: ἀπολείπω
div1.sense: to leave over or behind, of meats not wholly eaten, Od.:—Mid. to leave behind one, after death, Hdt.
to leave hold of, lose, βίον Soph.; also, βίοτος ἀπολείπει τινά Soph.
to leave behind, as in the race, to distance, and generally to surpass, Xen.; v. infr.
to leave quite, forsake, abandon, of places one ought to defend, Il., Hdt., etc.: to leave one in the lurch, Hdt., Ar.
of things, to leave alone, leave undone or unsaid, Hdt., Attic
to leave open, leave a space, Hdt., Xen.
intr. to fail, to be wanting, Od.; of rivers, to fall, sink, Hdt.; of flowers, to begin to wither, Xen.;—also, like ἀπειπεῖν, to fail, flag, lose heart, Hdt., Xen.

to be wanting of or in a thing, c. gen., Thuc.; of measures, ἀπὸ τεσσέρων πήχεων ἀπ. τρεῖς δακτύλους wanting 3 fingers of 4 cubits, Hdt.: c. inf., ὀλίγον ἀπέλιπον ἀπικέσθαι wanted but little of coming, Hdt.
c. part. to leave off doing, Plat.
to depart from, ἐκ τῶν Συρακουσῶν Thuc., Plat.
Pass. to be left behind, stay behind, Thuc., Xen.
to be distanced by, inferior to, τινος Dem.
to be parted from, be absent or far from, c. gen., Hdt.: to be deprived of, τάφου Soph.; φρενῶν Eur.
to be wanting in, fall short of, παιδείας Dem.; ἀπολειφθεὶς ἡμῶν without our cognisance, Dem.; ἀπ. φρενῶν to be bereft of, Eur.

div1.head: ἀπολείχω
div1.sense: to lick clean, NTest.

div1.head: ἀπόλειψις
div1.sense: a forsaking, abandonment, of a thing, Thuc.: desertion of a husband by his wife, Dem.; of their post by soldiers, Xen., etc.
intr. a falling short, deficiency, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀπόλεκτος
div1.sense: chosen out, picked, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: ἀπόλεμος
div1.sense: unwarlike, unfit for war, Il., Eur.
peaceful, Eur.
not to be warred on, invincible, Aesch.
πόλεμος ἀπόλεμος a war that is no war, a hopeless struggle, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: ἀπολέπω
div1.sense: to peel off, flay, Eur., Ar.

div1.head: ἀπολήγω
div1.sense: to leave off, desist from a thing, c. gen., Il., Plat.
c. part. to leave off doing, Hom.:—absol. to cease, desist, Plat.

div1.head: ἀποληρέω
div1.sense: to chatter at random, Dem.

div1.head: ἀπόληψις
div1.sense: an intercepting, cutting off, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀπολιβάζω
div1.sense: to drop off, vanish, Ar.

div1.head: ἀπολιγαίνω
div1.sense: to scream aloud, be obstreperous, Ar.

div1.head: ἀπολιθόω
div1.sense: Mid.-Pass. to become stone, Strab.

div1.head: ἀπολιμπάνω
div1.sense: to leave, Plut., Luc.

div1.head: ἀπολισθάνω
div1.sense: to slip off or away, Thuc.
c. gen. to slip away from, τινός Ar.

div1.head: ἄπολις
div1.sense: one without city, state or country, an outlaw, Hdt., Soph., etc.
πόλις ἄπολις a city that is no city, a ruined city, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀπολιταργίζω
div1.sense: to pack oneself off, Ar.

div1.head: ἀπολίτευτος
div1.sense: taking no part in public matters, living as a private person, Plut.

div1.head: ἀπολιχμάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to lick off, αἷμα Il.

div1.head: ἀπόλλυμι
div1.sense: to destroy utterly, kill, slay, and of things, to destroy, demolish, waste, Hom., Attic; in pregnant sense, γᾶς ἐκ πατρίας ἀπ. to drive me ruined from my fatherland, Eur.; λόγοις ἀπ. τινά Soph.:— to talk or bore one to death, Ar.
to lose utterly, πατέρα, νόστιμον ἦμαρ Hom.

Mid. ἀπόλλυμαι, fut. -ολοῦμαι, Ionic -ολέομαι with part. ἀπολεύμενος: aor2 -ωλόμην: perf. -όλωλα: plup. ἀπολώλειν:— to perish utterly, die, Il.; c. acc. cogn., ἀπ. κακὸν μόρον, αἰπὺν ὄλεθρον Od.; to be undone, Od.; ἀπόλωλας you are done for, lost, ruined, Ar.; as an imprecation, κάκιστʼ ἀπολοίμην Ar.; in fut. part., ὦ κάκιστʼ ἀπολούμενε oh destined to a miserable end! i. e. oh villain, scoundrel! Ar.
to be lost, slip away, vanish, of the water eluding Tantalus, Od.; of sleep, Il.

div1.head: Ἀπολλώνιος
div1.sense: of or belonging to Apollo, Pind.
Ἀπολλώνιον, τό, the temple of Apollo, Thuc.

div1.head: Ἀπόλλων
div1.sense: Apollo, son of Zeus and Latona, brother of Artemis, Hom., etc.: in Hom. men who die suddenly are said to be slain by his ἀγανὰ βέλεα; cf. Ἄρτεμις.

div1.head: ἀπολογέομαι
div1.sense: to speak in defence, defend oneself, περί τινος about a thing, πρός τι or τινα in answer to.., Thuc., Plat.; ἀπ. ὑπέρ τινος to speak in anotherʼs behalf, Hdt.:—absol., Plat.; ὁ ἀπολογούμενος the defendant, Ar.
c. acc. criminis, to defend oneself against a thing, explain, excuse, Thuc., Aeschin.
ἀπ. τι ἔς τι to allege in oneʼs defence against a charge, Thuc., Plat.
ἀπ. δίκην θανάτου to speak against sentence of death being passed on one, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀπολόγημα
div1.sense: a plea alleged in defence, Plut.

div1.head: ἀπολογητέος
div1.sense: one must defend, Plat.

div1.head: ἀπολογία
div1.sense: a speech in defence, defence, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀπολογίζομαι
div1.sense: to reckon up, give in an account, Lat. rationes reddere, Xen.: c. acc. rei, to give in an account of the receipts, Aeschin.
to reckon on a thing, calculate that it will be, c. acc. et inf., Dem.

div1.head: ἀπολογισμός
div1.sense: a giving account, statement, Aeschin.
an account kept, record, Luc.

div1.head: ἀπόλογος
div1.sense: a story, tale, fable, apologue, Plat.

div1.head: ἀπολούω
div1.sense: c. acc. rei, to wash off dirt, Il.: Mid. ἅλμην ὤμοιν ἀπολούεσθαι to wash the brine from off my shoulders, Od.
c. acc. pers. to wash clean, Ar.:— Mid. to wash oneself, Il.
c. acc. pers. et rei, Πάτροκλον λοῦσαι ἄπο βρότον to wash the gore off him, Il.

div1.head: ἀπολοφύρομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to bewail loudly, Xen.
in past tenses, to leave off wailing, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀπολυμαίνομαι
div1.sense: to wash dirt off oneself, cleanse oneself by bathing, Il.

div1.head: ἀπολυμαντήρ
div1.sense: a destroyer: δαιτῶν ἀπολ. one who destroys the pleasure of dinner, a kill-joy, — or, acc. to others, a devourer of feasts, lick-plate, Od.

div1.head: ἀπόλυσις
div1.sense: release, deliverance from a thing, c. gen., Plut.; κατὰ τὴν ἀπόλυσιν τοῦ θανάτου so far as acquittal from a capital charge went, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀπολυτικός
div1.sense: disposed to acquit:— adv., ἀπολυτικῶς ἔχειν τινός to be minded to acquit one, Xen.

div1.head: ἀπολυτρόω
div1.sense: to release on payment of ransom, c. gen. pretii, Philipp. ap. Dem.

div1.head: ἀπολύτρωσις
div1.sense: a ransoming, Plut.: redemption by payment of ransom, NTest.

div1.head: ἀπολύω
div1.sense: to loose from, τί τινος Od.: to undo, Od.
to set free from, release or relieve from, τινὰ τῆς φρουρῆς, τῆς ἐπιμελείας Hdt., Xen.; τι ἀπό τινος Plat.:—Pass. to be set free from, Thuc.
in legal sense, ἄπ. τῆς αἰτίης to acquit of the charge, Hdt., Xen.:—c. inf., ἀπ. τινὰ μὴ φῶρα εἶναι to acquit one of being a thief, Hdt.: then absol. to acquit, Ar.
to let go free on receipt of ransom, hold to ransom, Il.:—Mid. to ransom, redeem, χρυσοῦ by payment of gold, Il.
to discharge or disband an army, Xen.:—generally, to dismiss, Ar.
to divorce a wife, NTest.
Mid. to redeem, v. supr. II.
to do away with charges against one, Lat. diluere, Thuc., Plat.:— absol., ἀπολυόμενος in defence, Hdt.
like Pass. (c. II), to depart, Soph.
Pass. to be released, let off, τῆς στρατηΐης from military service, Hdt.; τῆς ἀρχῆς ἀπολυθῆναι to be freed from their rule, Thuc.:—absol. to be acquitted, discharged, Thuc., Plat.
of combatants, to be separated, part, Thuc.
to depart, Soph.

div1.head: ἀπολωβάω
div1.sense: Pass. -άομαι, to be grievously insulted, Soph.

div1.head: ἀπολωτίζω
div1.sense: to pluck off flowers: generally, to pluck off, cut off, Eur.

div1.head: ἀπομαγδαλία
div1.sense: the crumb or inside of the loaf, on which the Greeks wiped their hands at dinner, and then threw it to the dogs, dogʼs meat, Ar.

div1.head: ἀπομαίνομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to rave, rage to the uttermost, Luc.

div1.head: ἀπόμακτρον
div1.sense: a strickle, Ar.

div1.head: ἀπομαλακίζομαι
