div1.sense: Pass. to show weakness, Plut.

div1.head: ἀπομανθάνω
div1.sense: to unlearn, Lat. dediscere, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: ἀπομαντεύομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to announce as a prophet, τὸ μέλλον ἥξειν Plat.

div1.head: ἀπόμαξις
div1.sense: a wiping off, Plut.

div1.head: ἀπομαραίνω
div1.sense: Pass. to waste or wither away, die away, of a tranquil death, Xen.

div1.head: ἀπομάσσω
div1.sense: to wipe clean, Dem.:— Mid., Ἀχιλλείων ἀπομάττει you wipe your hands on the finest bread, Ar.

to wipe off or level corn with a strickle (ἀπόμακτρον): χοίνικα ἀπ. to give scant measure, as was done in giving slaves their allowance, Luc.; κενεὰν ἀπομάξαι (sc. χοίνικα) to level an empty measure, i. e. to labour in vain, Theocr.
to take an impression: metaph. to take impression, Ar.

div1.head: ἀπομαστιγόω
div1.sense: to scourge severely, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀποματαΐζω
div1.sense: to behave in unseemly fashion, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀπομάχομαι
div1.sense: to fight from the walls, Thuc.; τείχεα ἱκανὰ ἀπομάχεσθαι high enough to fight from, Xen.:—absol. to fight desperately, Thuc.
ἀπ. τι to fight off a thing, decline it, Hdt.; absol., Hdt.
ἀπ. τινά to drive him off in battle, Xen.

div1.head: ἀπόμαχος
div1.sense: past fighting, past service, Xen.

div1.head: ἀπομείρομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to distribute, Hes.
Pass. to be parted from, Hes.

div1.head: ἀπομερίζω
div1.sense: to part or distinguish from a number, Plat.
ἀπ. πρός or ἐπί τι to detach on some service, Polyb.: to impart, Polyb.

div1.head: ἀπομερμηρίζω
div1.sense: to sleep off care, Ar.

div1.head: ἀπομεστόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be filled to the brim, Plat.

div1.head: ἀπομετρέω
div1.sense: to measure out, Luc.:—Mid., Xen.

div1.head: ἀπομηκύνω
div1.sense: to prolong, draw out, λόγον Plat.: absol. to be prolix, Plat.:—Pass. to be extended, Luc.

div1.head: ἀπομηνίω
div1.sense: to be very wroth, to perseverere in wrath, Hom.

div1.head: ἀπομιμέομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to express by imitating or copying, represent faithfully, Xen.

div1.head: ἀπομιμνῄσκομαι
div1.sense: Mid.:— to remember fully, χάριν ἀπ. to recognise, repay a favour, feel gratitude, Il., Thuc.

div1.head: ἀπόμισθος
div1.sense: away from (i. e. without) pay, unpaid, ill-paid, Xen., Dem.
paid off, Dem.

div1.head: ἀπομισθόω
div1.sense: to let out for hire, Thuc.;—c.inf., ἀπ. ποιεῖν τι to contract for the doing of a thing, Lex ap. Dem.

div1.head: ἀπομνημόνευμα
div1.sense: a memorial, Plut.:—in pl. memoirs, Lat. commentarii, as those of Socrates by Xen.

div1.head: ἀπομνημονεύω
div1.sense: to relate from memory, relate, recount, Plat.
to remember, call to mind, Plat.; ὄνομα ἀπεμνημόνευσε τῶι παιδὶ θέσθαι gave his son the name in memory of a thing, Hdt.
ἀπ. τί τινι to bear something in mind against another, Xen.

div1.head: ἀπομνησικακέω
div1.sense: to bear a grudge against, τινί Hdt.

div1.head: ἀπόμνυμι
div1.sense: to take an oath away from a thing, i. e. swear that one will not do it, Od.
to swear one has not done or that it is not so, to deny on oath, Hdt., Attic; with μή added, ἀπ. ἦ μὴν μὴ εἰδέναι Xen.; ἀπ. μηδὲ ὀβολόν (sc. ἔχειν) Xen.
c. acc. to disown on oath: Mid., ἀπωμόσατο τὴν ἀρχήν renounced it, Plut.
to take a solemn oath, ἦ μήν . . Thuc.

div1.head: ἀπομοίρια
div1.sense: a portion, Anth.

div1.head: ἀπομονόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be excluded from a thing, c. gen., Thuc.
to be left alone, Plut.

div1.head: ἀπομόργνυμι
div1.sense: to wipe off or away from, τί τινος Il.:—Mid. to wipe off from oneself, Il.; ἀπομόρξατο δάκρυ wiped away his tears, Od.; absol. in same sense, ἀπομόρξασθαι Ar.; and in Pass., τὴν ὀργὴν ἀπομορχθείς having my anger wiped off, Ar.
to wipe the face clean, Il.:—Mid., ἀπομόρξατο παρειάς she wiped her cheeks, Od.

div1.head: ἀπόμουσος
div1.sense: away from the Muses, unaccomplished, rude, Eur.:—adv., ἀπομούσως unfavourably, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀπομυθέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to dissuade, Il.

div1.head: ἀπομυκάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to bellow loudly, Anth.

div1.head: ἀπομυκτέος
div1.sense: verb. Adj. one must wipe oneʼs nose, Eur. From

div1.head: ἀπομύσσω
div1.sense: to wipe the nose, Anth.:— Mid. to blow oneʼs nose, Ar., Xen.
metaph. to make him sharp, sharpen his wits, Plat.; cf. Horaceʼs vir emunctae naris.

div1.head: ἀποναίω
div1.sense: to remove, to send away, Il.:—Mid. to wend oneʼs way back, ἀπενάσσατο Hom.
aor1 mid. in trans. sense, ἀπενάσσατο παῖδα sent away her child, Eur.; also, ἀπονασθῆναι, to be taken away, depart from a place, c. gen., Eur.

div1.head: ἀποναρκόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to become quite torpid, insensible, Plat.

div1.head: ἀπονεμητέος
div1.sense: verb. Adj. one must assign, Arist. From

div1.head: ἀπονέμω
div1.sense: to portion out, impart, assign, τί τινι Hdt. Attic:—Mid. to assign or take to oneself, Plat.; ἀπονέμεσθαί τι to feed on, Ar.: c. gen. partit. to help oneself to a share of a thing, Plat.

div1.head: ἀπονενοημένως
div1.sense: Adv. part. pf. pss. of ἀπονοέομαι desperately, Xen.

div1.head: ἀπονέομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to go away, depart, Hom.

div1.head: ἀπονεύω
div1.sense: to bend away from other objects towards one, turn towards, πρός τι Plat.

div1.head: ἀπονέω
div1.sense: to unload:— Mid. to throw off a load from, στέρνων ἀπονησαμένη Eur.

div1.head: ἀπονητί
div1.sense: Adv. without fatigue, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀπόνητος
div1.sense: without toil:— adv. Sup. ἀπονητότατα with least trouble, Hdt.
without suffering, Soph.

div1.head: ἀπονήχομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to escape by swimming, to swim away, Luc.

div1.head: ἀπονία
div1.sense: non-exertion, laziness, Xen.: exemption from toil, Plut.

div1.head: ἀπονίζω
div1.sense: wash off, ἀπονίψαντες βρότον ἐξ ὠτειλῶν Od.:—Mid. to wash off from oneself, ἱδρῶ ἀπενίζοντο θαλάσσηι Il.

to wash clean, properly of the hands and feet, ἀπονίζουσα as I was washing his feet, Od.; ὅταν ἀπονίζηι καὶ τὼ πόδʼ ἀλείφηι Ar.:—Mid. to wash oneʼs hands and feet, χεῖράς τε πόδας τε Od.: absol. to wash oneʼs hands, Ar.; perf. pass. ἀπονενίμμεθα Ar.

div1.head: ἀπονίναμαι
div1.sense: to have the use or enjoyment of a thing, c. gen., Hom., Soph.; but the gen. is often omitted, ἦγε μὲν οὐδʼ ἀπόνητο married her but had no joy [of it], Od.; οὐκ ἀπώνητο (sc. τῆς πόλεως) Hdt.

div1.head: ἀπόνιπτρον
div1.sense: water in which the hands have been washed, dirty water, Ar.

div1.head: ἀπονίσσομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to go away, Theogn.: Epic aor1 part. ἀπονισσάμενος, Anth.

div1.head: ἀπονοέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to have lost all sense,
of fear, to be desperate, Xen.; ἄνθρωποι ἀπονενοημένοι desperate men, Lat. perditi, Thuc.
of shame, ἀπονενοημένος an abandoned fellow, Theophr.

div1.head: ἀπόνοια
div1.sense: loss of all sense,
of fear, desperation, εἰς ἀπ. καταστῆσαί τινα to make one desperate, Thuc.
of right perception, madness, Lat. dementia, Dem.

div1.head: ἄπονος
div1.sense: without toil or trouble, untroubled, quiet, Aesch., etc.
of persons, not toiling, lazy, Xen.
adv. -νως, without trouble, Hdt., Xen.
irreg. comp. ἀπονέστερος, Pind., but -ώτερος, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀπονοστέω
div1.sense: to return, come home, ἂψ ἀπονοστήσας, Il.; ἀπ. ὀπίσω Hdt.

div1.head: ἀπονοσφίζω
div1.sense: to put asunder, keep aloof from, τινά τινος h. Hom.
to bereave or rob of, ὅπλων τινά Soph.:—Pass. to be robbed of, ἐδωδήν h. Hom.
c. acc. loci, to flee from, shun, Soph.

div1.head: ἀπονόσφι
div1.sense: far apart or aloof, Hom.
prep. with gen. far away from, Hom.

div1.head: ἀπονυκτερεύω
div1.sense: to pass a night away from, τινός Plut.

div1.head: ἀπονυχίζω
div1.sense: to pare the nails: Pass. to have them pared, Babr.
metaph. to pare down, retrench, τὰ σιτία Ar.
= ὀνυχίζω ΙΙΙ, to try by the nail, ἀκριβῶς ἀπωνυχισμένος, Horaceʼs ad unguem factus, Theophr.

div1.head: ἀπονωτίζω
div1.sense: to make one turn his back and flee, τινά Eur.

div1.head: ἀπόξενος
div1.sense: alien to guests, inhospitable, Soph.:—c. gen. loci, far from a country, Aesch.; πέδου banished from, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀποξενόω
div1.sense: to drive from house and home, banish, Plut.:—Pass., γῆς ἀποξενοῦσθαι Eur.

div1.head: ἀποξένωσις
div1.sense: a living abroad, Plut.

div1.head: ἀποξέω
div1.sense: to shave off, to cut off, ἀπὸ δʼ ἔξεσε χεῖρα Il.
metaph. to strip off, Luc.

div1.head: ἀποξηραίνω
div1.sense: to dry up a river, Hdt.:—Pass. to be dried up, run dry, of rivers, Hdt.
generally to dry completely, τὰς ναῦς Thuc.

div1.head: ἀποξύνω
div1.sense: to bring to a point, make taper, Od.
to make sharp and piercing, τὴν φωνήν Plut.

div1.head: ἀποξυράω
div1.sense: to shave clean, c. dupl. acc., τὸν δοῦλον ἀποξυρήσας τὴν κεφαλήν Hdt.
Mid. to have oneself clean shaved, Plut.

div1.head: ἀπόξυρος
div1.sense: cut sharp off, abrupt, Luc.

div1.head: ἀποξύω
div1.sense: to strip off as it were a skin, Il.

div1.head: ἀποπάλλω
div1.sense: to hurl, Luc.:—Pass. to rebound, Plut.

div1.head: ἀποπαπταίνω
div1.sense: to look about one, as if to flee, Ionic 3rd pl. fut. ἀποπαπτανέουσιν Il.

div1.head: ἀποπατέω
div1.sense: to retire from the way, to go aside to ease oneself, Ar.

div1.head: ἀπόπατος
div1.sense: a place out of the way: a privy, Ar.

div1.head: ἀποπαύω
div1.sense: to stop or hinder from, make to cease from a thing, c. gen., πολέμου Il.; πένθεος Hdt., etc.: c. inf. to hinder from doing, Od.:—Mid. and Pass. to leave off or cease from, c. gen., Hom.; ἐκ καμάτων Soph.: absol. to leave off, Theogn.
c. acc. only, to stop, check, Il., Eur.

div1.head: ἀπό
div1.sense: prep. c. gen. = Lat. ab, from.
OF PLACE:
of Motion, from, away from, Hom., etc.; of warriors fighting from chariots, Hom.
of Position, away from, far from, apart from, ἀπὸ ἧς ἀλόχοιο Il.; ἀπʼ ὀφθαλμῶν far from sight, Il.; ἀπὸ θαλάσσης Thuc., etc.
of the mind, ἀπὸ θυμοῦ away from, i. e. alien from, my heart, Il.; οὐκ ἀπὸ τρόπου not without reason, Plat.; οὐκ ἀπὸ πράγματος Dem.
in partitive sense, αἶσʼ ἀπὸ ληΐδος a part from the booty, a share of it, Od.
OF TIME, from, after, ἀπὸ δείπνου after supper, Il.; ἀπὸ δείπνου γενέσθαι to have done supper, Hdt., etc.; ἀφʼ οὗ (sc. χρόνου), Lat. ex quo, Hdt., etc.
OF ORIGIN, CAUSE, etc.:

of that from which one is born, οὐκ ἀπὸ δρυὸς οὐδʼ ἀπὸ πέτρης not sprung from oak or rock, Od.; τρίτος ἀπὸ Διός third in descent from Zeus, Plat.; οἱ ἀπὸ Σπάρτης the men from Sparta, Hdt.:—metaph. of things, κάλλος ἀπὸ Χαρίτων beauty born of the Graces, such as they give, Od.; γάλα ἀπὸ βοός Aesch.: —of connexion with the leader of a sect, οἱ ἀπὸ Πλάτωνος, Platoʼs disciples; οἱ ἀπὸ τῆς Ἀκαδημίας, ἀπὸ τῆς Στοᾶς, the Academics, the Stoics, Plut., etc.
of the Material from or of which a thing is made, ἀπὸ ξύλου Hdt.; ἀπὸ μέλιτος Theocr.
of the Instrument from or by which a thing is done, ἀπʼ ἀργυρέοιο βιοῖο by [arrow shot from] silver bow, Il.

of the Person from whom an act comes, i. e. by whom it is done, οὐδὲν μέγα ἔργον ἀπʼ αὐτοῦ ἐγένετο Hdt.; ἐπράχθη ἀπʼ αὐτοῦ οὐδέν Thuc.;—so that ἀπό came to be used like ὑπό, but implying a less direct agency.
of the Source from which life or power is sustained, ζῆν ἀπὸ ἰχθύων Hdt.; τρέφειν τὸ ναυτικὸν ἀπὸ τῶν νήσων Xen.

of the Cause, Means, or Occasion from, by, or because of which a thing is done, ἀπὸ δικαιοσύνης by reason of justice, Hdt.; ἀπὸ τῶν αὐτῶν λημμάτων moved by, for the same profits, Dem.:—hence in many adverbial usages, ἀπὸ σπουδῆς in earnest, eagerly, Il.; ἀπὸ τοῦ ἴσου, ἀπὸ τῆς ἴσης, or ἀπʼ ἴσης, equally, Thuc., etc.; ἀπὸ γλώσσης by word of mouth, Hdt.; ἀφʼ ἑαυτοῦ from or of oneself, Thuc.
AS ADVERB, far away, Hom., Hdt.
IN COMPOS.:
from, asunder, as in ἀποτέμνω: away, off, as in ἀποβαίνω.
finishing off, completing, as in ἀπεργάζομαι.
ceasing from, leaving off, as in ἀπαλγέω, ἀπολοφύρομαι.
back again, as in ἀποδίδωμι, ἀπολαμβάνω: also, in full, or what is oneʼs own, as ἀπέχω.
by way of abuse, as in ἀποκαλέω.
almost = a_priv; sometimes with Verbs, as ἀπαυδάω, ἀπαγορεύω; with Adjectives, as ἀποχρήματος, ἀπόσιτος.
ἄπο, by anastrophe for ἀπό, when it follows its Noun, as ὀμμάτων ἄπο Soph.

div1.head: ἀποπειράομαι
div1.sense: to make trial, essay, or proof of a thing or person, c. gen., Hdt., Attic:—so also in Act., ἀποπειρᾶσαι τοῦ Πειραιῶς to make an attempt on the Peiraeeus, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀπόπειρα
div1.sense: a trial, essay, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: ἀποπελεκάω
div1.sense: to hew or trim with an axe, Ar.

div1.head: ἀποπέμπω
div1.sense: to send off or away, to dismiss, Hom., Hdt., etc.:—Mid. to send away from oneself, Hdt.; ἀπ. τὴν γυναῖκα to put away, divorce her, Hdt.: ἀπ. ὕδωρ to get rid of it, Hdt.
to send back, Od.
to dispatch, Hdt., Ar.

div1.head: ἀπόπεμψις
div1.sense: a sending off, dispatching, Hdt.
a divorcing, Dem.

div1.head: ἀποπενθέω
div1.sense: to mourn for, τινά Plut.

div1.head: ἀποπεράω
div1.sense: to carry over, Plut.

div1.head: ἀποπέρδομαι
div1.sense: to break wind, Lat. pedo, Ar.

div1.head: ἀποπέτομαι
div1.sense: to fly off or away, Hom., Ar.

div1.head: ἀποπεφασμένως
div1.etym: From pf. pass. part. of ἀποφαίνω
div1.sense: openly, plainly, Dem.

div1.head: ἀποπήγνυμι
div1.sense: to make to freeze, to freeze, Ar.:—Pass., to be frozen, Xen.: of blood, to curdle, Xen.

div1.head: ἀποπηδάω
div1.sense: to leap off from, ἵππου Plut.
to start off from, turn away from, τινός Xen.
absol. to leap off, start off, Plat.

div1.head: ἀποπίμπλημι
div1.sense: to fill up a number, Hdt.
to satisfy, fulfil, χρησμόν Hdt.
to satisfy, appease, θυμόν, ἐπιθυμίαν Hdt., Plat.

div1.head: ἀποπίνω
div1.sense: to drink up, drink off, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀποπίπτω
div1.sense: to fall off from, ἐκ or ἀπό τινος Od., Hdt.; τινός Hdt.; absol. to fall off, Il.

div1.head: ἀποπιστεύω
div1.sense: to trust fully, rely on, τινί Polyb.

div1.head: ἀποπλάζω
div1.sense: to lead astray from, τινός Apoll.:—Pass., to stray away from, σῆς πατρίδος, Τροίηθεν Od.; ἀπὸ θώρηκος ἀποπλαγχθείς having glanced off from the breastplate, of an arrow, Od.; absol. τρυφάλεια ἀποπλαγχθεῖσα a helm struck off or falling from the head, Od.

div1.head: ἀποπλανάω
div1.sense: to lead astray, Aeschin.; metaph. to seduce, beguile, τινά NTest.

div1.head: ἀποπλανίας
div1.sense: a wanderer, fugitive, Anth.

div1.head: ἀποπλέω
div1.sense: to sail away, sail off, Il., Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἀπόπληκτος
div1.sense: disabled by a stroke,
in mind, struck dumb, astounded, senseless, stupid, Hdt., Dem.
in body, crippled, palsied, Lat. sideratus, Hdt.; ἀπ. τὰς γνάθους struck dumb, Ar.

div1.head: ἀποπληρόω
div1.sense: to fill up, satisfy, Lat. explere, τὰς ἐπιθυμίας Plat.; τοῦτό μοι ἀποπλήρωσον make this complete for me, satisfy me in this, Plat.

div1.head: ἀποπλήρωσις
div1.sense: a filling up, satisfying, Plut.

div1.head: ἀποπλήσσω
div1.sense: to strike to earth, disable in body or mind:— Pass. to lose oneʼs senses, become dizzy or astounded, Soph.

div1.head: ἀποπλίσσομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to trot off, Ar.; v. πλίσσομαι.

div1.head: ἀπόπλοος
div1.sense: a sailing away, Hdt.
a voyage home or back, Xen.

div1.head: ἀποπλύνω
div1.sense: to wash away, Od.

div1.head: ἀποπνέω
div1.sense: to breathe forth fire, etc., Hom.; θυμὸν ἀπ. to give up the ghost, Il.; ἀπ. τὴν δυσμένειαν to get rid of it, Plut.
to blow from a particular quarter, of winds, Hdt.
to smell of a thing, c. gen., Plut.

div1.head: ἀποπνίγω
div1.sense: to choke, throttle, Hdt.; ἀπέπνιγον Ar.; of plants, NTest.: to be choked, suffocated, drowned, Dem.: metaph. to be choked with rage, Dem.

div1.head: ἀποπολεμέω
div1.sense: to fight off from, τοῦ ὄνου from ass-back, Plat.

div1.head: ἀπόπολις
div1.sense: far from the city, banished, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: ἀποπομπή
div1.sense: a sending away: getting rid of an illness, Luc.

div1.head: ἀποπορεύομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to depart, go away, Xen.

div1.head: ἀποπραΰνω
div1.sense: to soften matters down, Plut.

div1.head: ἀποπρίασθαι
div1.sense: to buy off or up, Ar.

div1.head: ἀποπρίω
div1.etym: see also the late form ἀποπρίζω
div1.sense: to saw off, Hdt., Anth.

div1.head: ἀποπροαιρέω
div1.sense: to take away from, σίτου ἀποπροελών having taken some of the bread, Od.

div1.head: ἀπόπροθε
div1.sense: from afar, afar off, far away, Hom.

div1.head: ἀπόπροθι
div1.sense: far away, Hom.

div1.head: ἀποπροΐημι
div1.sense: to send away forward, send on, Od.: to send forth, shoot forth, Od.: to let fall, Od.

div1.head: ἀποπρό
div1.sense: far away, afar off, Il.
prep. c. gen. far away from, Il., Eur.

div1.head: ἀποπροτέμνω
div1.sense: to cut off from, νώτου ἀποπροταμών after he had cut a slice from the chine, Od.

div1.head: ἀποπροφεύγω
div1.sense: to flee away from, Anth.

div1.head: ἄποπτος
div1.sense: out of sight of, far away from, c. gen., Soph.:—absol. out of sight, Soph.; ἐξ ἀπόπτου from a distance, Soph.

div1.head: ἀπόπτυστος
div1.sense: spat out: hence loathed, abominated, Trag.

div1.head: ἀποπτύω
div1.sense: to spit out, Il.; ἀπ. ἄχνην to vomit forth foam, Il.; absol. to spit, Xen.
to abominate, loathe, spurn, Aesch., Eur.: aor1 ἀπέπτυσα, Lat. omen absit, Eur.

div1.head: ἀποπυνθάνομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to inquire or ask of, ἀπ. αὐτοῦ εἰ.. asked of him whether.., Hdt.

div1.head: ἀπορέγχω
div1.sense: to snore to the end, Anth.

div1.head: ἀπορέπω
div1.sense: to slink away, Anth.

div1.head: ἀπόρευτος
div1.sense: not to be travelled, Plut.

div1.head: ἀπορέω
div1.sense: to be without means or resource; and so,

to be at a loss, be in doubt, be puzzled, mostly followed by a relative clause, ἀπ. ὅκως διαβήσεται to be at a loss how he shall cross, Hdt.; ἀπ. ὅ τι χρὴ ποιεῖν Xen.; with an acc. added, ἀπ. τὴν ἔλασιν ὅκως διεκπερᾶι to be at a loss about his march, how he shall cross, Hdt.; and with an acc. only, to be at a loss about it, Hdt.; c. inf. to be at a loss how to do, Ar., Plat.; ἀπ. περί τινος Plat.:—also absol., οὐκ ἀπορήσας without hesitation, Hdt., etc.:—Mid. in same sense, Hdt., Plat.
in Pass., of things, to be left wanting, left unprovided for, Xen.
c. gen. rei, to be at a loss for, in want of, Soph., Thuc., etc.
ἀπ. τινι to be at a loss by reason of, by means of something, Xen.
absol. to be in want, be poor, Plat.

div1.head: ἀπορητικός
div1.sense: inclined to doubt, Plat.

div1.head: ἀπόρθητος
div1.sense: not sacked, unravaged, Il., Hdt., Attic

div1.head: ἀπορθόω
div1.sense: to make straight, guide aright, Soph.

div1.head: ἀπορία
div1.sense: of places, difficulty of passing, Xen.
of things, difficulty, straits, ἐς ἀπορίην ἀπιγμένος, ἀπειλημένος, ἐν ἀπορίηι or ἐν ἀπορίηισι ἔχεσθαι, ἀπορίηισιν ἐνεχέσθαι Hdt.; ἀπ. τοῦ μὴ ἡσυχάζειν impossibility of keeping quiet, Thuc.
of persons, difficulty of dealing with, τινός Hdt.
want of means or resource, embarrassment, difficulty, hesitation, perplexity, Plat., etc.
3 ἀρ. τινός want of a person or thing, Ar., etc.
absol. poverty, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀπόρνυμαι
div1.sense: to start from a place, Λυκίηθεν Il.

div1.head: ἄπορος
div1.sense: without passage, and so:
of places, impassable, pathless, trackless, Xen., etc.

of circumstances, hard to see oneʼs way through, impracticable, very difficult, Hdt., Attic: ἄπορα, τά, straits, difficulties, Hdt., Xen.; so, εἰς ἄπορον ἥκειν, πίπτειν Eur., Ar.; ἐν ἀπόρωι εἶναι at a loss, Thuc.:—comp., ἀπορώτερος more difficult, Ar.
hard to get, scarce, Plat.
of persons, hard to deal with, impracticable, unmanageable, Hdt., Plat.: c. inf., ἄπ. προσμίσγειν, προσφέρεσθαι impossible to have any dealings with, Hdt.: so, absol., ἄνεμος ἄπ. Hdt.
without means or resources, at a loss, helpless, Soph., etc.; ἄπορος ἐπὶ φρόνιμα, ἐπʼ οὐδέν Soph.; of soldiers, οἱ ἀπορώτατοι the most helpless, worst equipt, Thuc.
poor, needy, Lat. inops, Thuc., Plat.
adv. 3 ἀπόρως, ἀπ. ἔχει μοι I am at a loss, Eur.: comp. -ώτερον, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀπορούω
div1.sense: to dart away, Hom.

div1.head: ἀπορρᾳθυμέω
div1.sense: to neglect a thing from faintheartedness or laziness, c. gen., Xen.; absol., Plat.

div1.head: ἀπορραίνω
div1.sense: to spirt out, shed about, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀπορραίω
div1.sense: to bereave one of a thing, c. dupl. acc., Od.

div1.head: ἀπορραντήριον
div1.sense: a vessel for sprinkling with holy water, Eur.

div1.head: ἀπορράπτω
div1.sense: to sew up again, Hdt., Aeschin.

div1.head: ἀπορραψῳδέω
div1.sense: to speak in fragments of Epic poetry, Xen.

div1.head: ἀπορρέζω
div1.sense: to offer some of a thing, c. gen. partit., Theocr.

div1.head: ἀπορρέω
div1.sense: to flow or run off, stream forth, Hdt., Aesch.; ἀπό τινος Hdt.; ἔκ τινος Plat.
to fall off, as fruit, feathers, leaves, etc., Hdt., Attic
to die away, fade from remembrance, Soph.

div1.head: ἀπόρρηγμα
div1.sense: a fragment, Plut.

div1.head: ἀπορρήγνυμι
div1.sense: to break off, snap asunder, Hom., etc.; πνεῦμʼ ἀπορρῆξαι βίου to snap the thread of life, Aesch.; ἀπ. βίον Eur.
Pass., aor.2 to be broken off, severed, Hdt., Thuc.; ἀπό τινος Hdt.
intr. in perf. to be broken, Archil.

div1.head: ἀπόρρησις
div1.sense: a forbidding, prohibition, Plat.
a giving up a point, refusal, Plat.

div1.head: ἀπόρρητος
div1.sense: forbidden, ἀπόρρητον πόλει though it was forbidden to the citizens, Soph.; τὰ ἀπόρρητα prohibited exports, contraband articles, Ar.

not to be spoken, that should not be spoken, Lat. tacendus, ἀπ. ποιεῖσθαι to keep secret, Hdt.; κύριος καὶ ῥητῶν καὶ ἀπορρήτων, of Philip, like dicenda tacenda, Dem.: ἀπόρρητον, ου, τό, a state-secret, Ar.
of sacred things, ineffable, Eur.
unfit to be spoken, abominable, Plat.

div1.head: ἀπορριγέω
div1.sense: to shrink shivering from a thing, shrink from doing it, c. inf., Od.

div1.head: ἀπορρινάω
div1.sense: to file off, Strab.

div1.head: ἀπορρίπτω
div1.sense: to throw away, put away, Il.
to cast forth from oneʼs country, Aesch., Soph.; ἀπερριμμένοι outcasts, Dem.
to disown, renounce, Soph.
to throw aside, set at naught, Aesch.: Pass., ἀπέρριπται ἐς τὸ μηδέν Hdt.
of words, to shoot forth bold, keen words, ἔς τινα at one, Hdt.:— also, ἀπ. ἔπος to let fall a word, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀπορροή
div1.sense: a flowing off, stream, Eur., Xen.
an efflux, emanation, Plat.

div1.head: ἀπορροιβδέω
div1.sense: to shriek forth, βοάς Soph.

div1.head: ἀπορροφέω
div1.sense: to swallow some of a thing, c. gen. partit., Xen.

div1.head: ἀπορρύπτω
div1.sense: to cleanse thoroughly, Luc.: Mid. to cleanse oneself, Plut.

div1.head: ἀπόρρυτος
div1.sense: running, Hes.: ἀπ. σταθμά stables with drains, Xen.

div1.head: ἀπορρώξ
div1.sense: broken off, abrupt, sheer, precipitous, Lat. praeruptus, Od., Xen.
as fem. Subst. a piece broken off, Στυγὸς ἀπορρώξ a branch or off-stream of the Styx, Il.
ἀπ. νέκταρος an efflux, distillation of nectar, Od.

div1.head: ἀπορφανίζω
div1.sense: Pass., to be orphaned or bereaved, Aesch.; ἀπό τινος ἀπ. to be torn away from one, NTest.

div1.head: ἀπόρφυρος
div1.sense: without purple border, Plut.

div1.head: ἀπορχέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to dance a thing away, i. e. lose by dancing, τὸν γάμον Hdt.

div1.head: ἀποσαλεύω
div1.sense: to lie in the open sea, to ride at anchor, Thuc., Dem.

div1.head: ἀποσαφέω
div1.sense: to make clear, Plat.

div1.head: ἀποσβέννυμι
div1.sense: to put out, extinguish, quench, Ar., Plat., etc.
Pass., with fut. mid. aor2 and perf. act. intr., and aor1 pass.— to be extinguished, go out, cease to exist, Eur., Xen.

div1.head: ἀποσείω
div1.sense: to shake off:— Mid. to shake off from oneself, Theogn.; of a horse, to throw his rider, Hdt., Xen.; metaph., ἀποσείεσθαι λύπην Ar.

div1.head: ἀποσεμνύνω
div1.sense: to make august, glorify, Plat.
Pass., with fut. mid., to give oneself airs, Ar.; τι about a thing, Ar.

div1.head: ἀποσεύω
div1.sense: to chase away, Anth.:—Pass., with 3rd sg. Epic aor2 ἀπέσσυτο, aor.1, to dart away, Il.

div1.head: ἀποσημαίνω
div1.sense: to give notice by signs, give notice, περί τινος Hdt.: absol. to give a sign, Plat.
c. acc. to indicate by signs, betoken, Plut.:—Mid. to show by signs or proofs, Hdt.
ἀπ. εἴς τινα to allude to him, Thuc.
Mid. to seal up as confiscated, to confiscate, Xen.: of persons, to proscribe, Xen.

div1.head: ἀποσήπομαι
div1.sense: to lose by mortification, or frost-bite, τοὺς δακτύλους Xen.

div1.head: ἀποσιμόω
div1.sense: to make flat-nosed: Pass., ἀποσεσιμώμεθα τὴν ῥῖνα we have snub noses, Luc.
ἀποσιμοῦν τὰς ναῦς to turn the ships aside, make a sideward movement, so as to avoid the direct shock, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀπόσιτος
div1.sense: abstaining from food, Luc.

div1.head: ἀποσιωπάω
div1.sense: to cease speaking, maintain silence, Isocr., Plut.
trans. to keep secret, Luc.

div1.head: ἀποσιώπησις
div1.sense: a becoming silent, Plut.
a rhetorical figure, when the sentence is broken off, as in Il. 1. 342, Virgil Aen. 1. 135.

div1.head: ἀποσκάπτω
div1.sense: to intercept by trenches, Xen.

div1.head: ἀποσκεδάννυμι
div1.sense: to scatter abroad, disperse, Hom., Soph.:—Pass. to straggle from the ranks, of soldiers, Xen.

div1.head: ἀποσκεπτέος
div1.sense: one must look steadily, Arist.

div1.head: ἀποσκευάζω
div1.sense: to pull off:— Mid. to pack up and carry off, to make away with, Luc.

div1.head: ἀποσκηνέω
div1.sense: to encamp apart from, τινός Xen.

div1.head: ἀπόσκηνος
div1.sense: encamping apart, messing alone, Xen.

div1.head: ἀποσκηνόω
div1.sense: to keep apart from, Plut.
= ἀποσκηνέω, Plut.

div1.head: ἀποσκήπτω
div1.sense: to hurl from above, ἀπ. βέλεα ἔστι to hurl thunderbolts upon, Hdt.
intr. to fall suddenly, like a thunderbolt, ἔς τινα Eur., Aeschin.; ἀπ. ἐς φλαῦρον to come to a sorry ending, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀποσκιάζω
div1.sense: to cast a shadow, Plat.

div1.head: ἀποσκιασμός
div1.sense: the casting a shadow, ἀπ. γνωμόνων measures of time by the shadow on the sun-dial, Plut.

div1.head: ἀποσκίδνημι
div1.sense: mostly mid-pass.,to be dispersed, Il.; of soldiers, ἀπ. ἔς τι to disperse for a purpose, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀποσκλῆναι
div1.sense: to be dried up, to wither, Ar.; so perf. ἀπέσκληκα Luc.; fut. ἀποσκλήσω Anth.

div1.head: ἀποσκοπέω
div1.sense: to look away from other objects at one, to look steadily, πρός τινα or τι Soph., Plat.; εἴς τι Soph.
c. acc. to look to, regard, Eur.; so in Mid., Plut.

div1.head: ἀποσκόπιος
div1.sense: far from the mark, Anth.

div1.head: ἀποσκυθίζω
div1.sense: to strip off the scalp in Scythian fashion: metaph. in Pass. to be shaved bare, κρᾶτʼ ἀπεσκυθισμένη Eur.

trans.i: to carry off as spoil from

div1.head: ἀποσκώπτω
div1.sense: to banter, rally, τινά Plat.; ἀπ. εἴς τινα to jeer at one, Luc.

div1.head: ἀποσμάω
div1.sense: to wipe off dirt, Luc.: Pass. to be wiped clean, Luc.

div1.head: ἀποσμικρύνω
div1.sense: to diminish, Luc.

div1.head: ἀποσμύχομαι
div1.sense: to be consumed by a slow fire, to pine away, Luc.

div1.head: ἀποσοβέω
div1.sense: to scare away, as one does birds or flies, Ar.; metaph., ἀποσοβῆσαι τὸν γέλων Ar.
intr. to be off in a hurry, οὐκ ἀποσοβήσεις; i. e. be off! Ar.

div1.head: ἀποσπάδιος
div1.sense: torn off or away, ἀποσπάδιον, ου, τό, ἀπόσπασμα, Anth.

div1.head: ἀποσπαράσσω
div1.sense: to tear off, Eur.

div1.head: ἀπόσπασμα
div1.sense: that which is torn off, a piece, rag, shred, Plat.

div1.head: ἀποσπάς
div1.sense: a slip torn from a tree, a vine-branch or bunch of grapes, Anth.: and

div1.head: ἀποσπάω
div1.sense: to tear or drag away from, τινός Soph., Plat., etc.; ἀπ. τινα ἀπὸ γυναικός Hdt.; τὸ τέκνον ἐκ χερῶν Eur.; also c. dupl. acc. to tear a thing from one, Soph.:— ἀπ. τινά to tear him away, Hdt.:—Mid. to drag away for oneself, Plut.:—Pass. to be dragged away, detached, separated from, τινός Pind., Eur.; ἐξ ἱροῦ Hdt.; ἀπὸ τῶν ἱερῶν Thuc.
ἀπ. πύλας to tear off the gates, Hdt.
ἀπ. τὸ στρατόπεδον to draw off the army, Xen.; absol., ἀποσπάσας having drawn off, Xen.:—Pass., of troops, to be separated or broken, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀποσπένδω
div1.sense: to pour out wine as a drink offering, Od., Eur.

div1.head: ἀποσπεύδω
div1.sense: to be zealous in preventing a thing, Hdt.; c. acc. et inf., ἀπ. hέρξεα στρατεύεσθαι Hdt.

div1.head: ἀποσποδέω
div1.sense: to wear quite off, ἀπ. τοὺς ὄνυχας to walk oneʼs toes off, Ar.

div1.head: ἀποσταδόν
div1.sense: standing aloof, Hom.

div1.head: ἀποστάζω
div1.sense: to let fall drop by drop, distil, Theocr.
intr. to fall in drops, distil, Soph.

div1.head: ἀποστασία
div1.sense: defection, Plut.

div1.head: ἀποστασίου
div1.sense: ἀποστασίου δίκη an action against a freedman for having forsaken or slighted his προστάτης, Dem.: ἀποστασίου βιβλίον, ου, τό, a writing or bill of divorce, NTest.

div1.head: ἀπόστασις
div1.sense: a standing away from, and so,
a defection, revolt, ἀπό τινος or τινος Hdt., Thuc.; πρός τινα Thuc.
departure from, βίου Eur.
distance, interval, Plat.

div1.head: ἀποστατέος
div1.sense: one must stand off from or give up a thing, c. gen., Thuc., Dem.

div1.head: ἀποστατέω
div1.sense: to stand aloof from, depart from, be far from, c. gen., Aesch., Soph.; ἀπ. φίλων to fall off from oneʼs friends, Ar.
absol. to stand aloof or afar off, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀποστατήρ
div1.sense: one who has power to dissolve an assembly, Lycurg. ap. Plut.

div1.head: ἀποστάτης
div1.sense: a runaway slave: a deserter, rebel, Plut.

div1.head: ἀποστατικός
div1.sense: of or for rebels, Plut.:—adv., ἀποστατικῶς ἔχειν to be ready for revolt, Plut.

div1.head: ἀποσταυρόω
div1.sense: to fence off with a palisade, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀποστεγάζω
div1.sense: to uncover: to take off a roof, NTest.

div1.head: ἀποστέγω
div1.sense: to keep out water: metaph. to keep out or off, ὄχλον πύργος ἀποστέγει Aesch.
to keep in water, confine it, check its outflow, Plat.

div1.head: ἀποστείχω
div1.sense: to go away, to go home, Od., Hdt.; imperat. ἀπόστιχε Il., Hdt.

div1.head: ἀποστέλλω
div1.sense: to send off or away from, γῆς, χθονός Soph., Eur.; ἔξω χθονός Eur.; ἐκ τῆς πόλεως Plat.: absol. to send away, banish, Soph., Eur.:—Pass. to go away, depart, set out, Soph., Eur.
to send off, despatch, on some service, Soph.; of troops and ships, Hdt., Thuc.
intr. to go back, retire, of the sea, Thuc.; of seamen, Dem.

div1.head: ἀποστενόω
div1.sense: to straiten, block up: Pass., 3rd sg. plup. pass. ἀπεστείνωτο Theocr.

div1.head: ἀποστέργω
div1.sense: to love no more, Theocr.:—hence to put away from one, reject, Lat. abominari, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀποστερέω
div1.sense: to rob, despoil, bereave or defraud one of a thing, c. acc. pers. et gen. rei, Hdt., Ar.; also, c. acc. pers. et rei, μή μʼ ἀποστερήσηις ἡδονάν Soph., etc.: absol. to defraud, cheat, Ar.:—Pass. to be robbed or deprived of, c. gen., Ἑλλάδος ἀπεστερημένος Hdt., Attic; also c. acc., ἵππους ἀπεστέρηνται Xen.
ἀπ. ἑαυτόν τινος to detach, withdraw oneself from . . , Soph., Thuc.
c. acc. pers. to deprive, rob, Hdt., Attic;— τὸ σαφές μʼ ἀποστερεῖ certainty fails me, Eur.
c. acc. rei only, to filch away, withhold, Aesch., etc.

div1.head: ἀποστέρησις
div1.sense: deprivation, τῆς ἀκοῆς Thuc.

div1.head: ἀποστερητής
div1.sense: a depriver, robber, Plat.

div1.head: ἀποστερητικός
div1.sense: of or for cheating, γνώμη ἀπ. τόκου a device for cheating one of his interest, Ar.; so fem. ἀποστερητρίς.

div1.head: ἀπόστημα
div1.sense: distance, interval, τοῖς ἀπ. πρὸς τοὺς γονεῖς in point of intervals, in relation to oneʼs parents, Arist.

div1.head: ἀποστηρίζομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to fix firmly, Anth.

div1.head: ἀποστιλβόω
div1.sense: to make to shine, Anth.

div1.head: ἀποστίλβω
div1.sense: to be bright from or with oil, c. gen., ἀπ. ἀλείφατος Od.

div1.head: ἀποστλεγγίζω
div1.sense: to scrape with a strigil:— Mid. to scrape oneself clean, Xen.; perf. pass. part. ἀπεστλεγγισμένοι, scraped clean, fresh from the bath, Ar.

div1.head: ἀποστολεύς
div1.sense: at Athens, a magistrate who had to fit out a squadron for service, Dem., Aeschin.

div1.head: ἀποστολή
div1.sense: a sending off or away, despatching, Eur., Thuc.
(from Pass.) a going away, an expedition, Thuc.
the office of an apostle, apostleship, NTest.

div1.head: ἀπόστολος
div1.sense: a messenger, ambassador, envoy, Hdt.
a sacred messenger, an Apostle, NTest.
= στόλος, a naval squadron or expedition, Dem., etc.

div1.head: ἀποστοματίζω
div1.sense: to dictate by word of mouth, teach by dictation, γράμματα Plat.
to question sharply or to provoke one to speak, NTest.
to recite, repeat by heart, Plut.

div1.head: ἀποστράτηγος
div1.sense: a retired general, Dem.

div1.head: ἀποστρατοπεδεύομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to encamp away from, τινός Xen.; ἀπ. πρόσω to encamp at a distance, Xen.

div1.head: ἀποστρέφω
div1.sense: to turn one back, i. e. either to turn to flight, put to flight, Hom.; or to turn him back from flight, Xen.; πόδας καὶ χεῖρας to twist back the hands and feet so as to bind them, Od.; so τὸν αὐχένα Hdt.:— to turn back, avert oneʼs face, Od., Eur.: to bring back, recall, Xen.
to turn away, to divert the course of a river, Hdt.: to avert a danger, Aesch., Thuc.
intr. (sub. ἑαυτόν, ἵππον, ναῦν, etc.), to turn back, Hdt., Soph.
Pass., ἀπεστράφθαι τοὺς ἐμβόλους, of ships, to have their beaks bent back, Hdt.; ἀποστραφῆναι τὼ πόδε to have oneʼs feet twisted, Ar.
to turn away from, in abhorrence, Lat. aversari, c. acc., Soph., Eur.; absol., ἀπεστραμμένοι λόγοι hostile words, Hdt.
to turn oneself about, turn back, Xen.; to turn and flee, Xen.
ἀποστραφῆναί τινος to fall off from one, desert him, Xen.

div1.head: ἀποστροφή
div1.sense: a turning back, Xen.; ἀποστροφὴν λαμβάνειν to have oneʼs course turned, Plut.
a turning away from, an escape from a thing, c. gen., Aesch., Eur.
a resort, resource, Hdt.:—c. gen. objecti, ὕδατος ἀπ. a resource or means for getting water, Eur.; σωτηρίας ἀπ. Thuc.

div1.head: ἀπόστροφος
div1.sense: turned away, Soph.

div1.head: ἀποστυγέω
div1.sense: to hate violently, abhor, loathe, Hdt., Soph.; c. inf. to be disgusted that.., Hdt.

div1.head: ἀποστυφελίζω
div1.sense: to drive away by force from, τινά τινος Il.

div1.head: ἀποστύφω
div1.sense: to draw up, contract, of astringents, to dull the sense of taste, Anth.

div1.head: ἀποσυκάζω
div1.sense: to squeeze figs, to try whether they are ripe, Ar.

div1.head: ἀποσυλάω
div1.sense: to strip off spoils from a person, to rob or defraud one of a thing, τινά τινος Soph.; τινά τι Eur., Xen.:—Pass., ἀποσυλᾶσθαί τι to be robbed of a thing, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀποσυνάγωγος
div1.sense: put out of the synagogue, NTest.

div1.head: ἀποσυρίζω
div1.sense: to whistle aloud for want of thought, Hhymn.:—Pass. to sound like whistling, Luc.

div1.head: ἀποσύρω
div1.sense: to tear away, Thuc.
to lay bare, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀποσφάζω
div1.sense: to cut the throat of a person, Lat. jugulo, ἀποσφ. τινὰ ἐς ἄγγος, so that the blood runs into a pail, Hdt.: generally, to slay, Ar., Thuc., etc.:—Mid. to cut oneʼs own throat, Xen.

div1.head: ἀποσφακελίζω
div1.sense: to have the limbs frost-bitten, Hdt.
to fall into convulsions, Plut.

div1.head: ἀποσφάλλω
div1.sense: to lead astray, drive away, Od.; ἀπ. τινὰ πόνοιο to baulk them of the fruits of toil, Il.
Pass., aor2 ἀπεσφάλην α, to be baulked or disappointed of a thing, c. gen., Hdt.: to be deprived of, Aesch.: to fail in reaching, Ἰταλίας Plut.: absol. to be missing or lost, Dem.

div1.head: ἀποσφίγγω
div1.sense: to compress, Luc.: Pass., λόγος ἀπεσφιγμένος a close-packed style, Luc.

div1.head: ἀποσφραγίζω
div1.sense: to seal up, Plut.:—so in Mid., Eur.

div1.head: ἀποσχαλίδωμα
div1.sense: a forked piece of wood for propping hunting-nets, Xen.

div1.head: ἀποσχίζω
div1.sense: to split or cleave off, Od., Eur.

to sever or detach from, τινὰ ἀπό τινος Hdt.:—Pass., ἀποσχισθῆναί τινος to be separated from . . ., Hdt.; of a river, to be parted from the main stream, Hdt.; of a tribe, to be detached from its parent stock, Hdt.
metaph., ἀπ. τινὰ τοῦ λόγου to cut him off from his speech, interrupt him in it, Ar.

div1.head: ἀποσχοινίζω
div1.sense: to separate by a cord: generally, to separate, Dem.

div1.head: ἀποσῴζω
div1.sense: to preserve from, heal from or of a thing, τινός Soph.; ἀπ. οἴκαδε to bring safe home, Xen.:—Pass., ἀποσωθῆναι ἐς or ἐπὶ τόπον to get safe to a place, Hdt., Xen.: absol. to get off safe, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀπότακτος
div1.sense: set apart for a special use, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀποτάσσω
div1.sense: to set apart, assign specially, χώραν τινί Plat.:—Pass., ἀπετέτακτο πρὸς τὸ δεξιόν had his appointed post on the right, Xen.
Mid., ἀποτάσσεσθαί τινι to bid farewell to a person or thing, NTest.

div1.head: ἀποταυρόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be like a bull: δέργμα ἀποταυροῦσθαι to cast savage glances at.., Eur.

div1.head: ἀποταφρεύω
div1.sense: to fence off with a ditch, Xen.

div1.head: ἀποτείνω
div1.sense: to stretch out, extend— Pass., Xen.
to lengthen, extend, prolong, of the line of an army, Xen.; of speeches, ἀπ. τὸν λόγον Plat.

div1.head: ἀποτειχίζω
div1.sense: so as to fortify, τὸν Ἰσθμόν Hdt.
so as to blockade, τινάς Ar., Thuc., etc.

div1.head: ἀποτείχισις
div1.sense: the walling off a town, blockading, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀποτείχισμα
div1.sense: a wall built to blockade, lines of blockade, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: ἀποτελευτάω
div1.sense: intr. to end, εἴς τι in a thing, Plat.

div1.head: ἀποτελέω
div1.sense: to bring quite to an end, complete a work, Hdt., Xen., etc.:—Pass., perf. part. ἀποτετελεσμένος, perfect, Xen.
to pay or perform what one is bound to pay or perform, as vows to a god, Hdt., Xen.: generally, to accomplish, perform, Xen.
to render or make of a certain kind, τὴν πόλιν ἀπ. εὐδαίμονα to make the state quite happy, Plat.; and Mid., ἄμεμπτον φίλον ἀποτελέσασθαι to make him without blame towards himself, Xen.

div1.head: ἀποτέμνω
div1.sense: to cut off, sever, Il., Hdt., Attic:—Pass., τὴν γλῶτταν ἀποτμηθείς having his tongue cut out, Aeschin.
to sever, divide, in a geographical sense, Hdt.:—Pass., of troops, to be cut off from the main body, Xen.
Mid. to cut off for oneself, Il.; c. gen. to cut off a bit of a thing, Hdt.
to cut off, so as to appropriate, βοῦς Hhymn., Hdt.; Φοινίκης ἀπ. to have a slice or portion of Phoenicia, Theocr.; ἀπ. τῶν Ἀθηναίων to cut off power from the Athenians, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀπότευξις
div1.sense: a failure, Plut.

div1.head: ἀποτῆλε
div1.sense: far from, c. gen., Anth.

div1.head: ἀποτηλοῦ
div1.sense: far away, Od.

div1.head: ἀποτίθημι
div1.sense: to put away, stow away, Il.
Mid. to put away from oneself, lay aside, of arms and clothes, Il., Hdt.; ἀπ. τὸν νόμον to put aside, i. e. disregard, the law, Thuc.
to avoid, escape, of something odious, Il.
to put by for oneself, stow away, Ar., Xen.
ἀποτίθεσθαι εἰς αὖθις to put off, defer Eur., Xen., etc.

div1.head: ἀποτίλλω
div1.sense: to pluck or pull out, τὰς τρίχας Hdt.; οὐδὲν ἀποτίλας without pulling off any of the fur, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀπότιλμα
div1.sense: a piece plucked off, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀποτιμάω
div1.sense: to put away from honour, to dishonour, slight, Hhymn.
Mid. to fix a price by valuation, διμνέως ἀποτιμησάμενοι having fixed their price at two minae a head, Hdt.
as Attic law term, Act. to borrow money on mortgage; Mid. to lend on mortgage; Pass. of the property, to be mortgaged, Dem.

div1.head: ἀποτίμημα
div1.sense: a mortgage, security, Dem.

div1.head: ἀποτίμησις
div1.sense: a mortgaging, Dem.
the Rom. census, Plut.

div1.head: ἀπότιμος
div1.sense: put away from honour, dishonoured, Hdt., Soph.

div1.head: ἀποτινάσσω
div1.sense: to shake off, Eur.

div1.head: ἀποτίνω
div1.sense: to pay back, repay, return, τί τινι Il.
to pay for a thing, τι Hom., Aesch., etc.: absol. to make atonement, Il.
to pay in full, Hdt., Attic
Mid. ἀποτίνομαι and ἀποτίνυμαι: fut. -τίσομαι:— to get paid one, to exact or require a penalty from a man, ποινήν Il.; δίκην Eur.
c. acc. pers., ἀποτίσασθαί τινα to avenge oneself on another, punish him, Od., Xen.
c. acc. rei, to take vengeance for a thing, punish it, Od.; so, c. gen. rei, Hdt.:—absol. to take vengeance, Theogn.

div1.head: ἀποτιστέος
div1.sense: one must pay, Xen.

div1.head: ἀποτμήγω
div1.sense: Epic for ἀποτέμνω, to cut off from, τινά τινος Il.
to cut off, sever, Il.; κλιτῦς ἀπ. to cut up or plough the hill-sides, Il.

div1.head: ἀποτμητέος
div1.sense: one must cut off, τῆς χώρας a portion of it, Plat.

div1.head: ἄποτμος
div1.sense: unhappy, ill-starred, Hom., Aesch., Eur.: —comp. -ότερος; Sup. -ότατος, Od.

div1.head: ἀποτολμάω
div1.sense: to make a bold venture, τινί upon one, Thuc.: c. inf., Aeschin.: Pass., τὰ ἀποτετολμημένα what has been hazarded, Plat.

div1.head: ἀποτομή
div1.sense: a cutting off, Xen.

div1.head: ἀπότομος
div1.sense: cut off, abrupt, precipitous, Hdt.; ἀπότομον ὤρουσεν εἰς ἀνάγκαν, metaph. from one who comes suddenly to the edge of a cliff, Soph.
metaph. severe, relentless, Eur.

div1.head: ἀποτοξεύω
div1.sense: to shoot off arrows, Luc.
to shoot a person, τινά τινι Luc.

div1.head: ἄποτος
div1.sense: not drinkable, Hdt.
act. never drinking, Hdt., Plat.:— not drinking, without drink, Soph., Xen.

div1.head: ἀποτρέπω
div1.sense: to turn one away from a thing, c. gen., Il.:— to turn away, deter or dissuade from, Thuc.; also, c. inf., ἀπ. τινὰ ποιεῖν τι Aesch., Dem.
c. acc. pers. only, to turn away, turn back, Il.
c. acc. rei, to turn aside, avert, prevent, Hdt., Plat.; cf. ἀποτρόπαιος, ἀπότροπος.
to turn from others against one, τι ἐπί τινι Soph.:—Mid., ἀποτραπόμενος πρός τι turning away from other objects to this one, Plut.
Mid. and Pass. to turn from, to desist from doing a thing, c. part., Il., c. inf., Eur., etc.:—absol. to stop, desist, Thuc.
to turn away, turn a deaf ear, Il.
c. acc. rei, to turn away from, like Lat. aversari, Aesch., Eur.
to turn back, return, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: ἀποτρέχω
div1.sense: to run off or away, Hdt., Attic
to run hard, of one training for a race, Ar.

div1.head: ἀποτρίβω
div1.sense: to wear out, Od.
to rub clean, to rub down a horse, Xen.
to rub off, Theocr.:—Mid. to get rid of, Dem., Aeschin.: to decline, reject, τὴν πεῖραν Plut.

div1.head: ἀποτρόπαιος
div1.sense: averting evil, of Apollo, Lat. averruncus, Ar., etc.
pass. that ought to be averted, ill-omened, Luc.

div1.head: ἀποτροπή
div1.sense: a turning away, averting, κακῶν Aesch., Eur.
a hindering, prevention, Thuc.
(from Mid.) desertion of oneʼs party, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀπότροπος
div1.sense: turned away, banished, Od.
from which one turns away, direful, grim, Aesch., Soph.
act. turning away, averting, a thing, c. gen., Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: ἀπότροφος
div1.sense: reared away from home, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀποτρύχω
div1.sense: = ἀποτρύω, Plut.

div1.head: ἀποτρύω
div1.sense: to rub away, wear out, Soph.:— Mid., γῆν ἀποτρύεσθαι to vex constantly the earth, by working it, Soph.

div1.head: ἀποτρώγω
div1.sense: to bite or nibble off, Ar.
c. gen. to nibble at, τᾶς αὔλακος οὐκ ἀποτρώγεις, i. e. you donʼt get on with your swathe, in reaping, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀποτρωπάω
div1.sense: Frequentat. of ἀποτρέπω, only in pres., Hom.

div1.head: ἀποτυγχάνω
div1.sense: to fail in hitting or gaining, to miss, lose, c. gen., Xen., etc.
Pass., τὰ ἀποτετευγμένα things not come to pass, Luc.
absol. to miss oneʼs object, to be unlucky, fail, Xen.: to miss the truth, err, Xen.:—c. inf. to fail to do, Xen.

div1.head: ἀποτυμπανίζω
div1.sense: to cudgel to death, bastinado, Dem.

div1.head: ἀποτυπόω
div1.sense: Mid. to stamp an impression as on wax, εἴς τι Plat.
Act. ἀπ. σφραγῖδα to impress a seal, Luc.

div1.head: ἀποτύπτω
div1.sense: Mid. to cease to beat oneself, to cease mourning, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀπουρίζω
div1.sense: will mark off, i. e. contract, the boundaries of his fields, Il.: others read ἀπ-ουρήσουσι, ἀπ-αυρήσουσι (from ἀπ-αυράω) will take away.

div1.head: ἄπουρος
div1.sense: far from the boundaries of oneʼs country, c. gen., Soph.

div1.head: ἀπουσία
div1.sense: a being away, absence, Aesch., Eur., etc.

div1.head: ἄπους
div1.sense: without foot or feet, Plat.
without the use of oneʼs feet, halt, lame, Soph.

div1.head: ἀποφαιδρύνω
div1.sense: to cleanse off: Mid., Anth.

div1.head: ἀποφαίνω
div1.sense: to shew forth, display, produce, Hdt., Ar.
to make known, declare, Hdt.: to give evidence of a thing, Hdt.
to shew by reasoning, shew, represent as doing or being, c. part., Hdt.; and with part. omitted, ἀπ. ἑωϋτὸν αἴτιον (sc. ὄντα) Hdt.; so, ἀπ. τινα ἐχθρόν Dem.
c. acc. et inf. to represent that, Plat.; so, ἀπ. ὡς . . , ὅτι . . , Hdt., Thuc.
to give an account of, τὴν οὐσίαν Dem.: to pay in money to the treasury, Dem.
to render or make so and so, Ar.
to appoint to an office, Plat.
Mid. to display something of oneʼs own, Aesch. Plat.: absol. to make a display of oneself, shew off, Xen.
to produce evidence, Hdt.
ἀποφαίνεσθαι γνώμην to declare oneʼs opinion, Hdt., Attic:— absol. to give an opinion, Hdt., Attic. Hence
used like Act., Plat., Xen.

div1.head: ἀπόφανσις
div1.sense: a declaration, statement, Arist.

div1.head: ἀπόφασις
div1.sense: a denial, negation, opp. to κατάφασις, Plat.

div1.head: ἀπόφασις2
div1.sense: a sentence, decision of a court, Dem.
a list, inventory, Dem.

div1.head: ἀποφάσκω
div1.sense: to deny, οὔτε δοκοῦντʼ οὔτʼ ἀποφάσκοντʼ neither in assent nor denial, Soph.

div1.head: ἀποφέρβομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to feed on, τι Eur.

div1.head: ἀποφέρω
div1.sense: to carry off or away, Lat. auferre, Hom., etc.:—Pass. to be carried from oneʼs course, Hdt., Thuc.
to carry or bring back, Il., Attic: Pass., of persons, to return, Hdt., Thuc.
to pay back, return, Hdt.: hence to pay what is due, Hdt.
as Attic law term, to give in an accusation, accounts, etc., Dem., etc.
intr. to be off, ἀπόφερʼ ἐς κόρακας Ar.
Mid. to take away with one, Hdt., etc.: to carry off a prize, Theocr.
to take for oneself, gain, obtain, Eur.
to bring back for oneself, Hdt.; ἀπ. βίον μητρί, i. e. to return to her alive, Eur.

div1.head: ἀποφεύγω
div1.sense: to flee from, escape, c. acc., Hdt., etc.:—absol. to get safe away, escape, Hdt.
as law-term, to escape from, τοὺς διώκοντας Hdt., Attic; also, ἀπ. δίκην Ar., Dem.: —absol. to get clear off, be acquitted, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀποφευκτικός
div1.sense: useful in escaping: τὰ ἀπ. means of acquittal, Xen.

div1.head: ἀπόφευξις
div1.sense: an escaping, means of getting off, ἀπ. δίκης acquittal, Ar.

div1.head: ἀπόφημι
div1.sense: to speak out, declare flatly or plainly, Il.; so in Mid., Il.
to say no, Soph.
c. acc. to refuse, deny, Xen., Plat.

div1.head: ἀποφθέγγομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to speak oneʼs opinion plainly, Luc.:—metaph. to ring, Luc.

div1.head: ἀπόφθεγκτος
div1.sense: = ἄφθεγκτος, Eur.

div1.head: ἀπόφθεγμα
div1.sense: a terse pointed saying, an apophthegm, Xen.

div1.head: ἀποφθεγματικός
div1.sense: dealing in apophthegms, sententious, Plut.

div1.head: ἀποφθείρω
div1.sense: to destroy utterly, ruin, Aesch., Eur.

Pass., with fut. mid., to be lost, perish, Eur., Thuc.: esp. as interrog. used in an imperat. sense, οὐ γῆς τῆσδʼ ἀποφθαρήσεται; i. e. let him begone with a plague to him, Eur.; so, οὐκ εἰς κόρακας ἀποφθερεῖ; Lat. pasce corvos, Ar.

div1.head: ἀποφθινύθω
div1.sense: only in pres. to perish, Il.
trans. to lose, Il.

div1.head: ἀποφθίνω
div1.sense: intr. in pres. to perish utterly, die away, Aesch., Soph.
Causal in fut. -φθιῶ, aor1 -ἔφθισα [ῑ Epic, ι Trag.] to make to perish, waste away, destroy, Hes., Soph.: to lose, βίον Aesch.
Pass., = Act. intr., to perish, die, esp. in Epic aor2 -έφθιτο ι, imperat. -φθίσθω, -φθίμην [ῑ], part. -φθίμενος ι, also in 3rd pl. Epic aor1 ἀπέφθιθεν.

div1.head: ἀποφθορά
div1.sense: utter destruction, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀποφλαυρίζω
div1.sense: to treat slightingly, make no account of, τι Hdt.

div1.head: ἀποφλοιόω
div1.sense: mid., to strip off oneself, Anth.

div1.head: ἀποφοιτάω
div1.sense: to cease to go to school, Plat.

div1.head: ἀπόφονος
div1.sense: unnatural murder, Eur.

div1.head: ἀποφορά
div1.sense: payment of what is due, tax, tribute, Hdt., Attic
also, return for money spent, profit, Xen., etc.

div1.head: ἀποφράγνυμι
div1.sense: to fence off, block up, Thuc.: metaph., Soph.

div1.head: ἀπόφραξις
div1.sense: a blocking up, Xen.
ἀποφράσσω, Plat., Dem. —Mid., ἀποφράξασθαι αὐτούς to bar their passage, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀποφράς
div1.sense: not to be mentioned: ἀποφράδες ἡμέραι, Lat. dies nefasti, days on which no business was done, Plat.

div1.head: ἀποφυγγάνω
div1.sense: = ἀποφεύγω, Dem.

div1.head: ἀποφυγή
div1.sense: an escape or place of refuge, ἀποφυγὰς παρέχειν Thuc.; ἀπ. κακῶν escape from ills, Plat.

div1.head: ἀποφυσάω
div1.sense: to blow away, Ar.
to breathe out life, Luc.

div1.head: ἀποφώλιος
div1.sense: empty, vain, idle, useless, fruitless, Lat. irritus, Od.

div1.head: ἀποχάζομαι
div1.sense: Dep., only in pres., to withdraw from a place, c. gen., Od.

div1.head: ἀποχαλάω
div1.sense: to slack away a rope: metaph., ἀποχάλα τὴν φροντίδα Ar.

div1.head: ἀποχαλινόω
div1.sense: to unbridle, Xen.

div1.head: ἀποχαλκεύω
div1.sense: to forge of copper, Xen.

div1.head: ἀποχαλκίζω
div1.sense: to strip of brass, i. e. money, Anth.

div1.head: ἀποχαρακόω
div1.sense: = ἀποσταυρόω, Plut.

div1.head: ἀποχειροβίωτος
div1.sense: living by the work of oneʼs hands, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: ἀποχειροτονέω
div1.sense: to vote a charge away from one, acquit him, c. gen., Dem.
c. acc., ἀπ. τινα τῆς ἀρχῆς to depose him from the command, Plut.
of things, to vote against, reject, annul, Ar., Dem.
ἀπ. τι μὴ εἶναι to vote that a thing is not, Dem.

div1.head: ἀποχειροτονία
div1.sense: rejection by show of hands, Dem.

div1.head: ἀποχέω
div1.sense: to pour out or off, shed, let fall, Od.:—poet. Mid. ἀποχεύομαι, Eur.

div1.head: ἀποχή
div1.sense: abstinence, Plut.
a receipt, quittance, Anth.

div1.head: ἀποχηρόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be bereft of, τινος Ar.

div1.head: ἀποχραίνω
div1.sense: to soften away the colour, shade off, Plat.

div1.head: ἀποχράω
div1.sense: to suffice, be sufficient, be enough: absol., in persons other than 3rd sg., δύʼ ἀποχρήσουσιν μόνω Ar.; c. inf., ἀποχρέουσι ἑκατὸν νέες χειρώσασθαι are sufficient to subdue, Hdt.
mostly in 3 sing:
to suffice, ποταμὸς οὐκ ἀπέχρησε τῆι στρατιῆι πινόμενος was not enough to supply the army with drink, Hdt.; ταῦτα ἀποχρᾶι μοι Hdt., Attic

impers., c. inf., ἀποχρᾶι μοι ποιεῖν ʼtis sufficient for me to do, Hdt., ; c. part., μέρος ἐχούσηι ἀπόχρη μοι ʼtis sufficient for me to have a part, Aesch.;—and without inf., ἀπόχρη τινι it is enough for him, Dem.
Pass. to be contented with a thing, c. dat., Hdt.
impers., οὐκ ἀπεχρᾶτο Hdt.; ἀπεχρέετο, c. inf., Hdt.
ἀποχράομαι to use to the full, c. dat. rei or absol., Thuc.
to abuse, misuse, Lat. abuti, c. dat., Dem.
c. acc. to use up, destroy, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀποχρήματος
div1.sense: ζημία ἀποχρ. a penalty but not of money, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀποχρώντως
div1.sense: enough, sufficiently, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀποχυρόω
div1.sense: to secure by fortifications: metaph. in perf. pass. part., ἀπωχυρωμένος πρός τι secure against a thing, Plat.

div1.head: ἀποχωλεύω
div1.sense: to make quite lame, Xen.

div1.head: ἀποχωλόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be made quite lame, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀποχώννυμι
div1.sense: to bank up the mouth of a river, Xen.

div1.head: ἀποχωρέω
div1.sense: to go from or away from a place, c. gen., Ar.
absol. to go away, depart, Eur.: to retire, retreat, Thuc., Xen.:— ἀπ. εἴς τι to have recourse to a thing, Dem.
ἀπ. ἐκ . . , to withdraw from a thing, i. e. give it up, Xen.
to pass off from the bowels, Xen.: also, τὰ ἀποχωροῦντα excrements, Xen.

div1.head: ἀποχώρησις
div1.sense: a going off, retreat, Hdt., Thuc.: a place or means of safety, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀποχωρίζω
div1.sense: to part or separate from, τι ἀπό τινος Plat.

div1.head: ἀπόχωσις
div1.sense: the damming up of a river, Plut.

div1.head: ἀποψάω
div1.sense: to wipe off, Eur.:—Mid. to wipe or rub off from oneself, Ar.
c. acc. pers. to wipe clean: — Mid. to wipe oneself, wipe oneʼs nose, Ar.; also, ἀποψ. τὴν χεῖρα εἴς τι Xen.

div1.head: ἀποψεύδομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be quite cheated of a thing, c. gen., Plut.

div1.head: ἀποψηφίζομαι
div1.sense: to vote away from, θάνατον ἀπ. τινός to vote death away from him, refuse to condemn him to death, opp. to καταψηφίζεσθαι, Lycurg.:—hence ἀπ. τινός to vote a charge away from one, i. e. to acquit him, Dem., etc.:—absol. to vote an acquittal, Plat.
to vote the franchise away from one, i. e. to disfranchise by vote, Dem.:— Pass. to be disfranchised, Dem.
c. acc. rei, of judges, ἀπ. γραφήν to vote against receiving the indictment, Aeschin.
ἀπ. μὴ ποιεῖν τι to vote against doing, Xen.

div1.head: ἀποψιλόω
div1.sense: to strip bare, Hdt.
c. gen. to strip bare of a thing, c. gen., Aesch.

div1.head: ἄποψις
div1.sense: an outlook, view, prospect, Hdt.
a lofty spot or tower which commands a view, Plut.

div1.head: ἀποψύχω
div1.sense: to leave off breathing, to faint, swoon, Od., NTest.
c. acc., ἀπέψυξεν βίον breathed out life, Soph.: absol., like ἀποπνέω, Lat. exspiro, to expire, die Thuc.
to cool:— Pass., ἱδρῶ ἀπεψύχοντο χιτώνων they got the sweat dried off their tunics, Il.; ἱδρῶ ἀποψυχθείς Il.; metaph., ἀπεψυγμένοι cold, indifferent, Arist.
impers., ἀποψύχει it grows, cool, the air cools, Plat.

div1.head: ἀππαπαῖ
div1.sense: an exclamation, Ar.

div1.head: ἀπραγία
div1.sense: idleness, want of energy, Plut.

div1.head: ἀπραγμοσύνη
div1.sense: freedom from politics and business (πράγματα), love of a quiet life, love of ease, supineness, Lat. otium, Ar., Xen.; of states that keep clear of foreign politics, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀπράγμων
div1.sense: free from business (πράγματα), keeping clear of politics, a good easy quiet man, opp. to πολυπράγμων (a restless meddlesome man), Ar., Thuc., etc.; πόλις ἄπρ. a country that keeps clear of foreign politics, Thuc.; τὸ ἄπραγμον Lat. otium, Thuc.; τόπος ἀπρ. a place free from law and strife, Ar.
of things, not troublesome or painful, Xen.; so adv. -μόνως, without trouble, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀπρακτέω
div1.sense: to do nothing, Arist.
to gain nothing, παρά τινος Xen.

div1.head: ἄπρακτος
div1.sense: act. doing nothing, ineffectual, unprofitable, Il., Dem.

of persons, without success, unsuccessful, ἄπρηκτος νέεσθαι, Lat. re infecta, Il.; and in Prose, ἄπρ. ἀπιέναι, ἀπελθεῖν, ἀποχωρεῖν Thuc.; ἄπρ. γίγνεσθαι to gain nothing, Thuc.; ἄπρακτον ἀποπέμπειν τινά Thuc.:—adv. -τως, unsuccessfully, Thuc.
pass. against which nothing can be done, impracticable, Od.
not to be done, impossible, Theogn.
not done, left undone, Xen.
c. gen., μαντικῆς ἄπρακτος ὑμῖν unassailed by your divining arts, Soph.

div1.head: ἀπραξία
div1.sense: a not acting, inaction, Eur., Plat.
rest from business, in pl. holidays, Plut.
want of success, Aeschin.

div1.head: ἀπρασία
div1.sense: want of purchasers, no sale, Dem.

div1.head: ἄπρατος
div1.sense: unsold, unsaleable, Dem.

div1.head: ἀπρέπεια
div1.sense: unseemly conduct; indecency, impropriety, Plat.

div1.head: ἀπρεπής
div1.sense: unseemly, unbecoming, indecent, indecorous, Thuc., etc.; τὸ ἀπρεπές ἀπρέπεια, Thuc.:— adv. -πῶς, poet. -πέως,Hhymn., Plat.
of persons, disreputable, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀπρεπίη
div1.sense: poet. for ἀπρέπεια, ugliness, Anth.

div1.head: ἀπρήϋντος
div1.sense: implacable, Anth.

div1.head: ἀπριάτην
div1.sense: without purchase-money or ransom, Hom.

div1.head: ἄπριγδα
div1.sense: = ἀπρίξ, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀπριγδόπληκτος
div1.sense: struck unceasingly, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀπρίξ
div1.sense: with closed teeth, Lat. mordicus: hence fast, tight, ἀπρὶξ συλλαβεῖν Soph.

div1.head: ἀπροαίρετος
div1.sense: without set purpose, not deliberate, of actions, Arist.

div1.head: ἀπροβούλευτος
div1.sense: not planned beforehand, unpremeditated, Arist.
not submitted to the βουλή, Dem.
act. without forethought, Arist.:—adv. -τως, Plat.

div1.head: ἀπρόβουλος
div1.sense: without premeditation:— adv. -λως, recklessly, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀπρόθυμος
div1.sense: not eager or ready, unready, backward, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: ἀπροϊδής
div1.sense: unforeseen, Anth.

div1.head: ἄπροικος
div1.sense: without portion or dowry, ἄπροικον τὴν ἀδελφὴν διδόναι to give her in marriage without dowry, Isae.

div1.head: ἀπρομήθεια
div1.sense: want of forethought, Plat.

div1.head: ἀπρονόητος
div1.sense: unpremeditated, ἀκρασία Arist.
act. improvident, Xen.:—adv. -τως, Xen.

div1.head: ἀπροοιμίαστος
div1.sense: without preface, Luc.

div1.head: ἀπρόοπτος
div1.sense: unforeseen, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀπρόσβατος
div1.sense: unapproachable, Soph.

div1.head: ἀπροσδεής
div1.sense: without want of more, Luc.

div1.head: ἀπροσδιόνυσος
div1.sense: uncongenial to Bacchus: hence, not to the point, out of place, Cic., Luc.

div1.head: ἀπροσδόκητος
div1.sense: unexpected, unlooked for, Aesch., etc.; ἐξ ἀπροσδοκήτου, Lat. necopinato, Hdt.; so adv. -τως, Thuc.
act. not expecting, unaware, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀπροσηγορία
div1.sense: want of intercourse by speech, Arist.

div1.head: ἀπροσήγορος
div1.sense: not to be accosted, savage, Soph.

div1.head: ἀπρόσικτος
div1.sense: not to be attained, Pind.

div1.head: ἀπρόσιτος
div1.sense: unapproachable, Plut.

div1.head: ἀπρόσκεπτος
div1.sense: unforeseen, Xen.
act. improvident, Dem.

div1.head: ἀπρόσκλητος
div1.sense: of a trial in support of which no summons has been issued, Dem.

div1.head: ἀπρόσκοπος
div1.sense: not stumbling, void of offence, Aesch., NTest.
giving no offence, NTest.

div1.head: ἀπρόσμαχος
div1.sense: irresistible, Soph.

div1.head: ἀπρόσμικτος
div1.sense: holding no communion with others, c. dat., Hdt.

div1.head: ἀπρόσοιστος
div1.sense: not to be withstood, irresistible, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀπροσόμιλος
div1.sense: unsociable, Soph.

div1.head: ἀπροσπέλαστος
div1.sense: unapproachable, Strab., Plut.

div1.head: ἀπροστασίου
div1.sense: ἀπροστασίου γραφή, at Athens, an indictment of a μέτοικος for not having chosen a patron from among the citizens, Dem.

div1.head: ἀπρόσφορος
div1.sense: unsuitable, dangerous, Eur.

div1.head: ἀπροσωπόληπτος
div1.sense: not respecting persons. adv. -τως, without respect of persons, NTest.

div1.head: ἀπρόσωπος
div1.sense: without a face, i. e. without beauty of face, Plat.

div1.head: ἀπροτίμαστος
div1.sense: untouched, undefiled, Il.

div1.head: ἀπροφάσιστος
div1.sense: offering no excuse, unhesitating, Thuc., Xen. adv. -τως, without disguise, without evasion, honestly, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀπροφύλακτος
div1.sense: not guarded against, unforeseen, Thuc.

div1.head: ἄπταιστος
div1.sense: not stumbling, ἀπταιστότερος less apt to stumble, Xen.

div1.head: ἄπτερος
div1.sense: without wings, unwinged, in phrase τῆι δʼ ἄπτερος ἔπλετο μῦθος the speech was to her without wings, i. e. did not fly away, sank into her heart, Od.; ἄπτερα πωτήματα wingless flight, Aesch.
unfeathered, of the Harpies, Aesch.; of arrows, Hdt.
of young birds, unfledged, callow, Eur.:—metaph., φάτις ἄπτ. an unfledged, i. e. unconfirmed, report, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀπτήν
div1.sense: unfledged, callow, of young birds, Il.
unwinged, Ar.

div1.head: ἀπτοεπής
div1.sense: undaunted in speech, Il.

div1.head: ἁπτός
div1.sense: subject to the sense of touch, Plat.

div1.head: ἅπτω
div1.etym: v. ἑάφθη for Ionic perf. pass.
div1.sense: to fasten, bind fast, Od., Eur.: Mid. to fasten for oneself, Od., Eur.
to join, χορόν Aesch.; πάλην τινὶ ἅπτειν to fasten a contest in wrestling on one, engage with one, Aesch.
Mid. to fasten oneself to, cling to, hang on by, lay hold of, grasp, touch, c. gen., ἅψασθαι γούνων, as a suppliant, Od.; so, ἅψ. γενείου Od.; ἅπτεσθαι νηῶν Il., etc.:—absol. to reach the mark, Il.

to engage in, take part in, c. gen., βουλευμάτων Soph.; πολέμου Thuc.; ἡμμένος φόνου engaged in . . , Plat.;—but, ἅπτεσθαι τῶν λόγων to lay hold of, dispute the argument of another, Plat.; τούτων ἥψατο touched on these points, Thuc.
to set upon, attack, assail, Hdt., Aesch., etc.
to touch, affect, ἄλγος οὐδὲν ἅπτεται νεκρῶν Aesch., etc.
to grasp with the senses, apprehend, perceive, Soph., Plat.
to come up to, reach, gain, Plat., Xen.
Act., also, to kindle, set on fire, Hdt., Thuc.:— Pass., with fut. mid. to be set on fire, catch fire, Od., Hdt.
ἅπτειν πῦρ to light a fire, Eur.:—Pass., ἄνθρακες ἡμμένοι red-hot embers, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀπτώς
div1.sense: not liable to fall or fail, Plat.

div1.head: ἀπύλωτος
div1.sense: not secured by gates, Xen.

div1.head: ἀπύργωτος
div1.sense: not girt with towers, Od.

div1.head: ἄπυρος
div1.sense: without fire, of pans and tripods, that have not yet been on the fire, fire-new, brand-new, Il.: — without fire, i. e. cold, cheerless, οἶκος Hes.:— ἄπ. χρυσίον unsmelted, Hdt.:— ἄπυρα ἱερά sacrifices in which no fire was used, Pind.; but in Aesch. sacrifices without fire, i. e. that will not burn, or unoffered, neglected:— ἄπ. ἄρδις an arrow-point not forged in fire, i. e. the sting of the gad-fly, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀπύρωτος
div1.sense: not yet exposed to fire, Il.

div1.head: ἄπυστος
div1.sense: not heard of, Od.: ἄπυστα φωνῶν speaking what none can hear, Soph.
act. without hearing or learning a thing, Od.; c. gen., Od.

div1.head: ἀπφῦς
div1.sense: a term of endearment used by children to their father, papa, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀπῳδός
div1.sense: out of tune, Eur., Luc.

div1.head: ἄπωθεν
div1.sense: from afar, Soph., Eur.
c. gen. far from, Eur., Thuc.

div1.head: ἀπωθέω
div1.sense: to thrust away, push back, Il.; to push off, Thuc.: Mid. to push away from oneself, Hom.:—c. gen. to drive away from a place; and in Mid. to drive away from oneself, to expel, banish, Hom., Hdt., etc.
of the wind, to beat from oneʼs course, Od.; so in Mid., Od.
in Mid., also, to reject, decline, refuse to accept, Hdt., Attic; ἀπ. δουλοσύνην to shake off slavery, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀπώλεια
div1.sense: destruction, NTest.

div1.head: ἀπώμαστος
div1.sense: without a lid, Babr.

div1.head: ἀπώμοτος
div1.sense: abjured, declared impossible on oath, βροτοῖσιν οὐδέν ἐστʼ ἀπώμοτον Soph.
of persons, under oath not to do a thing, Soph.

div1.head: ἄπωσις
div1.sense: a driving away, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀπωστέος
div1.sense: one must reject, Eur.

div1.head: ἀπωστός
div1.sense: thrust or driven away from a place, c. gen., Hdt., Soph.
that can be driven away, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀπωτάτω
div1.sense: Sup. adv. of ἄπωθεν, furthest from, τινός Dem.

div1.head: ἀπωτέρω
div1.sense: comp. adv. of ἄπωθεν, further off, Soph., etc. : proverb., ἀπ. ἢ γόνυ κνήμα Theocr.

div1.head: ἀραβέω
div1.sense: to rattle, ring, clash, of armour, Il.; of the teeth, to gnash, Theocr.

div1.head: Ἀραβία
div1.sense: Arabia, Hdt., poet. Ἀρραβία, Theocr.

div1.head: Ἀραβικός
div1.sense: Arabian, Plut.

div1.head: Ἀράβιος
div1.sense: Arabian, Hdt.

div1.head: ἄραβος
div1.sense: a gnashing or chattering of teeth, Il.

div1.head: ἀραγμός
div1.sense: a clashing, clattering, rattling, Aesch.; ἀρ. πετρῶν a crashing shower of stones, Eur.; στέρνων ἀρ. beating of the breast, Lat. planctus, Soph.

div1.head: ἀραῖος
div1.sense: pass. prayed to or entreated, Ζεὺς ἀραῖος, ἱκέσιος, Soph.
prayed against, accursed, laden with a curse or curses, Aesch.; μʼ ἀραῖον ἔλαβες you adjured me under a curse, Soph.
act. cursing, bringing mischief upon a house or person, c. dat., Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: ἀραιός
div1.sense: thin, narrow, slight, slender, Lat. tenuis, Hom.

div1.head: ἀραξίχειρος
div1.sense: beaten with the hand, τύμπανα Anth.

div1.head: ἀράομαι
div1.sense: to pray to a god, c. dat., Il.:—c. acc. to invoke, Od.
c. acc. et inf. to pray that, Il., Hdt., Soph.:—c. inf. only, to pray to be so and so, Od.

to pray something for one, τί τινι; sometimes in good sense, ἀρ. τινι ἀγαθά Hdt.; but usually in bad, to imprecate upon one, ἀρὰς ἀρ. τινι Soph., etc.; without an acc., ἀρᾶσθαί τινι to curse one, Eur.
c. inf. fut. to vow that one will or would, ἠρήσατο ῥέξειν Il.

div1.head: ἆρα
div1.sense: interrog. Particle, in accent and sense a stronger form of ἄρα:
when it stands alone it usually expects a negative answer, like Lat. num? Attic; so ἆρα μή; num vero? Aesch.:—for an affirmative answer, ἆρʼ οὐ; ἆρʼ οὐχί; nonne vero? is used, Soph., etc.
in prose, ἆρα almost always stands first in the sentence.

div1.head: ἄρα
div1.sense: EPIC USAGE:
then, straightway, at once, ὣς φάτο, βῆ δʼ ἄρʼ ὄνειρος Il.: next in order, οἱ δʼ ἄρʼ Ἀθήνας εἶχον Il.

where attention is called to something startling, τὸν τρεῖς μὲν ἐπιρρήσσεσκον τῶν ἄλλων, Ἀχιλεὺς δʼ ἄρʼ ἐπιρρήσεσκε καὶ οἶος three men of the common sort were required to do it, but Achilles, mark ye did it single-handed, Il.

in explanation of a thing going before, εἰ μὴ ὑπερφίαλον ἔπος ἔκβαλε, φῆ ῥʼ ἀέκητι θεῶν φυγέειν had he not let fall an impious word, — for he said . . , Il.:—so, ἄρα makes relat. Pron. more precise, ἐκ δʼ ἔθορε κλῆρος, ὃν ἄρʼ ἤθελον αὐτοί just the one, the very one which . . , Il.

Attic USAGE, much like οὖν, then, therefore:— less strongly, μάτην ἄρʼ ἥκομεν so then we have come in vain, Soph.; εἰκότως ἄρα οὐκ ἐγίγνετο Xen.:— in questions, to express the anxiety of the questioner, as τίς ἄρα ῥύσεται; oh! who is there to save? Aesch.
POSITION: ἄρα never begins a sentence, cf. οὖν, Lat. igitur.

div1.head: ἀρά
div1.etym: ᾱρ- mostly in Epic: in Attic always αρ-.
div1.sense: a prayer, Il., Hdt.
esp. a prayer for evil, a curse, imprecation, mostly in pl., Il., Trag.
the effect of the curse, bane, ruin, ἀρὴν καὶ λοιγὸν ἀμῦναι Il.
Ἀρά personified as the goddess of destruction and revenge, Lat. Dira, Soph.

div1.head: ἀραρίσκω
div1.etym: transitive: aor1 ἦρσα, Epic ἄρσα: aor.2 ἤραρον, Ionic ἄραρον, inf. ἀραρεῖν, part. ἀραρών:— Pass., aor1 ἤρθην, Epic 3rd pl. ἄρθεν.

intransitive: perf. ἄρᾱρα in pres. sense, Ionic ἄρηρα, Epic part. ἀρηρώς, with fem. ἀρηρυῖα and (metri grat.) ἀραρυῖα: Epic plup. ἀρήρειν, ἠρήρειν, with imperf. sense: —of the Pass. we only find Epic aor2 part. ἄρμενος, η, ον.
div1.sense: TRANS.:—
to join, join together, fasten, Il.; ἄγγεσιν ἄρσον ἅπαντα pack up everything in the vessels, Od.
to fit together, construct, τοῖχον ἀραρεῖν λίθοισιν Il.
to prepare, contrive, μνηστῆρσιν θάνατον ἀραρόντες Od.
to fit, equip, furnish with a thing, νῆα ἄρσας ἐρέτηισιν Od.
to please, gratify, favour, Pind., Soph.
to make fitting or pleasing, Il.
INTR.:—
to be joined closely together, to be in close order, close-packed, Hom.
to be fixed, of oaths and faith, Trag.:—absol., ἄραρε ʼtis fixed, Eur.
to fit well or closely, Hom.: to fit or be fitted to a thing, c. dat., Hom.
to be fitted, furnished with a thing, c. dat., Il.; κάλλει ἀραρώς endowed with beauty, Eur.

to be fitting, meet or suitable, agreeable or pleasing, like ἀρέσκω, Od., Hes.:—so in Epic aor2 pass. part. ἄρμενος, η, ον, fitting, fitted or suited to, c.dat., Od.; absol. meet, convenient, Lat. habilis, Il.
prepared, ready, Hes.
agreeable, welcome, ἄρμενα πράξαις εὖ πράξας, Pind.

div1.head: ἀραρότως
div1.sense: compactly, closely, strongly, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: ἀράσσω
div1.sense: to strike hard, smite, (Hom. only has it in the compds. ἀπ-, συν-αράσσω); of horses, ὁπλαῖς ἀρ. χθόνα Pind.; θύρας ἀρ. to knock furiously at the door, Eur.; ἀράσσειν στέρνα, κρᾶτα to beat the breast, the head, in mourning, Lat. plangere, Aesch., Eur.; ἄρασσε μᾶλλον strike harder, Aesch.; ἀρ. ὄψεις, βλέφαρα Soph.
c. dat. modi, ἀράσσειν ὀνείδεσι κακοῖς to throw with reproaches or threats, i. e. fling them wildly about, Soph.
Pass. to be dashed against, πρὸς τὰς πέτρας Hdt.; πέτραις Aesch.

div1.head: ἀρατός
div1.sense: accursed, unblest, Il., Soph.
prayed for: hence Ἄρητος, Ἀρήτη, (with changed accent), as prop. n., the prayed-for, like the Hebrew Samuel, Hom.

div1.head: ἀραχναῖος
div1.sense: of or belonging to a spider, Anth.

div1.head: ἀράχνη
div1.sense: fem. of ἀράχνης, Lat. aranea, Aesch., Anth.
a spiderʼs web, Anth.

div1.head: ἀράχνης
div1.sense: a spider, Lat. araneus, Hes.

div1.head: ἀράχνιον
div1.sense: a spiderʼs web, Lat. aranea, Od., Attic

div1.head: ἀράομαι
div1.sense: to pray, Od.

div1.head: ἀράω
div1.sense: to plough,[was: to damage] ἀράσοντι, Doric for ἀρήσουσι, Inscr.: the following is not in later editions [[perf. pass. part. ἀρημένος, βεβλαμμένος, distressed, afflicted, Hom.]]

div1.head: ἀρβύλη
div1.sense: a strong shoe or half-boot, used by country-people, hunters, travellers, Aesch., Eur., Theocr., Anth.

div1.head: Ἀργαδῆς
div1.sense: name of one of the four old Attic tribes, the workmen, labourers, Eur.

div1.head: ἀργαλέος
div1.sense: painful, troublous, grievous, Lat. gravis, Il., Ar.:— ἀργαλέον ἐστί, c. dat. et inf., ʼtis difficult to do a thing, Hom.; rarely c. acc. et inf., Il.
of persons, troublesome, Theogn., Ar.

div1.head: Ἀργεῖος
div1.sense: of or from Argos, Argive: Ἀργεῖοι in Hom., like Ἀχαιοί, for the Greeks in general: ἡ Ἀργεία (sc. γῆ), Argolis, Thuc.

div1.head: Ἀργειφόντης
div1.sense: slayer of Argus, i. e. Hermes, Hom.

div1.head: ἀργέλοφοι
div1.sense: the feet of a sheep-skin, and so, generally, offal, Ar.

div1.head: ἀργεννός
div1.sense: white, of sheep, Il.; of woollen cloths, Il., Anth.

div1.head: ἀργεστής
div1.sense: of the South wind, clearing, brightening, like Horaceʼs detergens nubila caelo, Il.
ἀργέστης Ζέφυρος (parox.), the North-west wind, Hes.

div1.head: ἀργέω
div1.sense: to lie idle, be unemployed, do nothing, Eur., Xen.; γῆ ἀργοῦσα land lying fallow, Xen.; ἀργεῖ τὸ ἐργαστήριον the shop is out of work, Dem.
Pass. to be left undone, to be fruitless, Xen.

div1.head: ἀργήεις
div1.sense: shining, white, Pind., Aesch.

div1.head: ἀργής
div1.sense: bright, glancing, of vivid lightning, Hom.
shining, white, of fat, Il.; of a robe, Il.

div1.head: ἀργία
div1.sense: idleness, laziness, Eur., Dem.
in good sense, rest, leisure, ἔργων from work, Plat.

div1.head: ἀργικέραυνος
div1.sense: wielder of bright lightning, Il.

div1.head: ἄργιλλα
div1.sense: an underground dwelling, Ephorus ap. Strab.

div1.head: ἄργιλλος
div1.sense: white clay, potterʼs earth, Arist.

div1.head: ἀργιλλώδης
div1.sense: like clay, clayey, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀργινόεις
div1.sense: white, epith. of Rhodian cities, from their chalky hills, Il.

div1.head: ἀργίπους
div1.sense: swift-footed, Il., Soph.

div1.head: ἄργμα
div1.sense: the firstlings at a sacrifice, Od.

div1.head: Ἀργόθεν
div1.sense: from Argos, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: Ἀργολίζω
div1.sense: to take part with the Argives, Xen.

div1.head: Ἀργολικός
div1.sense: of Argolis, a district in Peloponnesus, Plut.

div1.head: Ἀργολίς
div1.sense: sub. γῆ, a district in Peloponnesus, Hdt., etc.
as adj., of Argolis, Argolic, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀργοποιός
div1.sense: making idle, Plut.

div1.head: ἀργός
div1.sense: shining, bright, glistening, Lat. nitidus, Il.: white, Arist. (Hence come ἄργυρος, ἄργῑλος.)
πόδας ἀργοί, as epith. of hounds, swift-footed, because all swift motion causes a kind of glancing or flickering light, Hom.

div1.head: ἀργός2
div1.sense: not working the ground, living without labour, Hdt.; then, generally, inactive, slothful, idle, lazy, Soph., etc.: —c. gen. rei, idle at a thing, free from it, Eur., Plat.; —also, ἀργότεραι ἐς τὸ δρᾶν Thuc.
of land, lying fallow or untilled, Xen.; of money, unemployed, yielding no return, Dem. —Adv. ἀργῶς Xen.
pass. not done, left undone, Lat. infectus, Soph., Eur.; οὐκ ἐν ἀργοῖς not among things neglected, Soph.

div1.head: Ἄργος
div1.sense: name of several Greek cities, of which the Peloponnesian is the best known, called by Hom. Ἀ. Ἀχαιικόν, to distinguish it from Ἀ. Πελασγικόν. The former name comprehends all Argolis; the latter, all Thessaly.

div1.head: ἀργυράγχη
div1.sense: silver-quinsy, which Demosthenes was said to have, when he abstained from speaking on the plea of quinsy, but really (it was alleged) because he was bribed, Plut.

div1.head: ἀργυραμοιβικός
div1.sense: of or for a money-changer, money-changing, Luc.:—adv. -κῶς, Luc.

div1.head: ἀργυραμοιβός
div1.sense: a money-changer, banker, Lat. argentarius, Plat., Theocr., etc.

div1.head: ἀργύρειος
div1.sense: ἀργύρεια μέταλλα silver mines, Thuc.; or τὰ ἀργύρεια alone, Xen.

div1.head: ἀργύρεος
div1.note: ἀργύρεος, α, ον, Att. contr. ἀργυροῦς, ᾶ, οῦν
div1.sense: silver, of silver, Lat. argenteus, Hom., etc.

div1.head: ἀργυρεύω
div1.sense: to dig for silver, Strab.

div1.head: ἀργυρήλατος
div1.sense: of wrought silver, Eur.

div1.head: ἀργυρίδιον
div1.sense: = ἀργύριον, in contemptuous sense, Ar.

div1.head: ἀργυρικός
div1.sense: of, for or in silver, Plut.

div1.head: ἀργύριον
div1.sense: a piece of silver, a silver coin, Ar., etc.
collectively, money, a sum of money, cash, as we also say "silver", Ar., Thuc.
= ἄργυρος, silver, Thuc., Plat.

div1.head: ἀργυρῖτις
div1.sense: silver-ore, Xen.

div1.head: ἀργυρογνώμων
div1.sense: an assayer of silver, Plat.

div1.head: ἀργυροδίνης
div1.sense: silver-eddying, of rivers, Il.

div1.head: ἀργυροειδής
div1.sense: like silver, silvery, Eur.

div1.head: ἀργυρόηλος
div1.sense: silver-studded, Hom.

div1.head: ἀργυροθήκη
div1.sense: a money-chest, Theophr.

div1.head: ἀργυροκόπος
div1.sense: a silver-smith, NTest.

div1.head: ἀργυρολογέω
div1.sense: to levy money, Xen.
c. acc. pers. to levy money upon, lay under contribution, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀργυρολογία
div1.sense: a levying of money, Xen.

div1.head: ἀργυρολόγος
div1.sense: levying money, Ar., Thuc.

div1.head: ἀργυρόπεζα
div1.sense: silver-footed, Homeric epith. of Thetis.

div1.head: ἀργυροποιός
div1.sense: a worker in silver, Anth.

div1.head: ἀργυρόπους
div1.sense: with silver feet, or legs, Xen.

div1.head: ἀργυρόρρυτος
div1.sense: silver-flowing, Eur.

div1.head: ἄργυρος
div1.sense: white metal, i. e. silver, Hom., etc.
silver-money, money, like ἀργύριον, Soph.

div1.head: ἀργυροστερής
div1.sense: robbing of silver, βίος ἀργ. a robberʼs life, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀργυρότοιχος
div1.sense: with silver sides, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀργυρότοξος
div1.sense: with silver bow, Hom.

div1.head: ἀργυροφεγγής
div1.sense: silver-shining, Anth.

div1.head: ἀργυρώδης
div1.sense: rich in silver, Xen.

div1.head: ἀργυρώνητος
div1.sense: bought with silver, Hdt., Aesch.

div1.head: ἀργύφεος
div1.sense: silver-white, Hom.

div1.head: ἄργυφος
div1.sense: = ἀργύφεος, silver-white, Hom.

div1.head: Ἀργῷος
div1.sense: of the Argo, Eur.

div1.head: Ἀργώ
div1.sense: the Argo or swift, the ship in which Jason sailed to Colchis, Od.

div1.head: ἀρδεία
div1.sense: a watering of fields, Strab.

div1.head: ἀρδεύω
div1.sense: to water, Lat. irrigare, Aesch.

div1.head: ἄρδην
div1.sense: lifted up, on high, Soph., Eur.
taken away utterly, wholly, Lat. raptim, Aesch., Eur., etc.

div1.head: ἄρδις
div1.sense: the point of an arrow, Hdt., Aesch.

div1.head: ἀρδμός
div1.sense: a watering-place, Hom.

div1.head: ἄρδω
div1.sense: to water, and so,
of men, to water cattle, Hhymn., Hdt.:—Pass. to drink, ἀρδόμενοι h. Hom.
of rivers, to water land, Lat. irrigare, Hdt., Aesch.:— Pass. to be watered, of countries or crops, Hdt.
metaph. to refresh, cherish, Lat. fovere, Ar., Xen.

div1.head: Ἀρέθουσα
div1.sense: name of several fountains, the earliest known in Ithaca, Od.:—the most famous at Syracuse, Strab.

div1.head: ἀρειά
div1.sense: collective noun, menaces, threats, Il.

div1.head: ἀρειμανής
div1.sense: full of warlike frenzy, Anth.

div1.head: Ἄρειος
div1.sense: devoted to Ares, warlike, martial, Lat. Mavortius, Il., Hdt.

Ἄρειος πάγος, ὁ, the hill of Ares, Mars-hill, over against the west side of the Acropolis at Athens, Ἀρήϊος π Hdt.; also Ἄρεος πάγος (where Ἄρεος is gen. of Ἄρης), Soph., Eur. On it was held the highest judicial court, which took cognisance of murder and other capital crimes, Dem.

div1.head: ἀρείτολμος
div1.sense: warlike, bold, Anth.

div1.head: ἀρείφατος
div1.sense: slain by Ares, i. e. slain in war, Il., Eur.
= Ἄρειος, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀρείων
div1.sense: better, stouter, stronger, braver, more excellent, Hom., Aesch.

div1.head: Ἀρεοπαγίτης
div1.sense: a member of the Areopagus, Aeschin.

div1.head: ἀρέσκεια
div1.sense: the character of an ἄρεσκος, complaisance, obsequiousness, Arist.

div1.head: ἀρέσκευμα
div1.sense: an act of obsequiousness, Plut.

div1.head: ἀρεσκόντως
div1.sense: agreeably, Eur., Plat.

div1.head: ἄρεσκος
div1.sense: pleasing, but mostly in bad sense, obsequious, cringing, Arist., Theophr.

div1.head: ἀρέσκω
div1.sense: to make good, make up, ἂψ ἀρέσαι to make amends, Il.:—Mid., ταῦτα ἀρεσσόμεθα this will we make up among ourselves, Hom.
Mid. to appease, conciliate, αὐτὸν ἀρεσσάσθω ἐπέεσσιν Od.
after Hom., c. dat. pers. to please, satisfy, flatter, Hdt., Attic; ταῦτα ἀρέσκει μοι Hdt.;—so, in Mid., Hdt.
in Attic also c. acc. pers., οὐ γάρ μʼ ἀρέσκει γλῶσσά σου Soph.; τουτί μʼ οὐκ ἀρ. Ar.: hence, in Pass., to be pleased, satisfied with a thing, c. dat. rei, Hdt., Thuc.
ἀρέσκει is used, like Lat. placet, to express the resolution of a public body, ταῦτα ἤρεσέ σφι ποιέειν Hdt.:—so in Mid., Thuc.
part. ἀρέσκων, ουσα, ον, grateful, acceptable, Soph., Thuc.

div1.head: ἀρεστός
div1.sense: acceptable, pleasing, Hdt., Soph. adv., ἑωυτῶι ἀρεστῶς quite to his own satisfaction, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀρετάω
div1.sense: to be fit or proper, to thrive, prosper, Od.

div1.head: ἀρετή
div1.sense: goodness, excellence, of any kind, esp. of manly qualities, manhood, valour, prowess, Hom., Hdt. (like Lat. vir-tus, from vir).
rank, nobility, Theogn., Eur.
in Prose, generally, goodness, excellence in any art, Plat., etc.; of animals or things, Hdt., Attic.
in moral sense, goodness, virtue, Plat., etc.:—also character for virtue, merit, Eur., etc.
ἀρ. εἴς τινα service done him, Thuc.; ἀρ. περί τινα Xen.

div1.head: ἀρηγοσύνη
div1.sense: help, aid, Anth.

div1.head: ἀρηγών
div1.sense: a helper, Il.

div1.head: ἀρήγω
div1.sense: to help, aid, succour, esp. in battle, c. dat., Il., Hdt.
impers., c. inf., like Lat, juvat, it is good or fit, σιγᾶν ἀρήγει Aesch.
c. acc. rei, to ward off, prevent, τι Aesch.; also, ἀρ. τί τινι to ward off from one, Eur.

div1.head: ἀρηΐθοος
div1.sense: swift as Ares, swift in battle, Il.

div1.head: ἀρηϊκτάμενος
div1.sense: slain by Ares or in battle, Il.

div1.head: ἀρηΐφιλος
div1.sense: dear to Ares, favoured of the god of war, Il.

div1.head: ἄρηξις
div1.sense: help, succour, τινος from a person, Aesch., Soph.
c. gen. rei, help against a thing, means of averting it, Soph.

div1.head: Ἄρης
div1.etym: short α in Hom., except in voc. Ἆρες: in Aesch. long or short.
div1.sense: Ares, called by the Latins Mars, son of Zeus and Hera, god of war and slaughter, also of strife and pestilence, Hom., Trag.
in Poets, as appellat., war, battle, discord, slaughter, ξυνάγωμεν Ἄρηα Il; Ἄρης ἐμφύλιος, Ἄ. τιθασός civil war, Aesch.
warlike spirit, Trag.
div1.etym: The Root !αρ, appears also in ἀρετή, the first notion of goodness (virtus) being that of manhood, bravery in war.

div1.head: ἀρητήριον
div1.sense: a place for prayer, Plut.

div1.head: ἀρητήρ
div1.sense: one that prays, a priest, Il.

div1.head: ἀρθμέω
div1.sense: intr. to be united, Il.

div1.head: ἄρθμιος
div1.sense: united, ἡμῖν ἄρθμιοι friends with us, in league with us, Od.; ἄρθμια, τά, peaceful relations, friendship, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀρθμός
div1.sense: a bond, league, friendship, Hom., Aesch.

div1.head: ἄρθρον
div1.sense: a joint, Soph.: esp. the socket of the ankle-joint, Hdt., Soph.:—in pl. joined with some other word, ἄρθρα ποδοῖν the ankles, Hdt.; ἄρθρων ἤλυσις the legs, Eur.; ἄρθρα τῶν κύκλων the eyes, Soph.; ἄρθρα στόματος the mouth, Eur.

div1.head: ἀρθροπέδη
div1.sense: a band for the limbs, fetter, Anth.

div1.head: ἀρθρόω
div1.sense: to fasten by a joint:— of words, ἡ γλῶσσα ἀρθροῖ τὴν φωνήν the tongue produces articulate sounds, Xen.; but, ἀρθροῦν γλώσσην καὶ νόον to nerve the tongue and mind, Theogn.

div1.head: ἀρθρώδης
div1.sense: well-jointed, well-knit, Xen.

div1.head: ἀρίγνωτος
div1.sense: easy to be known, Hom.: well-known, far-famed, Hom.; and in bad sense, infamous, Lat. nimium notus, Od.

div1.head: ἀρίδακρυς
div1.sense: much weeping, very tearful, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀριδείκετος
div1.sense: much shewn, hence like Lat. digito monstratus, Od.; as Sup. c. gen., ἀριδείκετος ἀνδρῶν most renowned of men, Il.

div1.head: ἀρίδηλος
div1.sense: very distinct, far seen, Simon.
quite clear, manifest, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀρίζηλος
div1.sense: conspicuous, very distinct, of a star, Il.; of a voice, Il.; of persons, conspicuous, remarkable, Il.:—adv., ἀριζήλως εἰρημένα a plain tale, Od.

div1.head: ἀριζήλωτος
div1.sense: much to be envied, Ar.

div1.head: ἀριθμέω
div1.sense: to number, count or reckon up, Od., etc.:—Mid., ἠριθμοῦντο they got them counted, Thuc.
to count out, to pay, Xen., Dem.
to reckon, count as, ἐν εὐεργεσίας μέρει Dem.:—Pass. to be reckoned, ἔν τισι Eur.; ἀριθμεῖσθαι τῶν φιλτάτων to be counted as one of oneʼs dearest friends, Eur.

div1.head: ἀρίθμημα
div1.sense: a reckoning, number, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀρίθμησις
div1.sense: a counting, reckoning up, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀριθμητικός
