div1.sense: of or for reckoning, arithmetical, Plat.: ἡ ἀριθμητική (sc. τέχνη) arithmetic, Plat.

div1.head: ἀριθμητός
div1.sense: easily numbered, few in number, Theocr.: οὐκ ἀριθμητός held in no account, nullo numero habitus, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀριθμός
div1.sense: number, Lat. numerus, Od., etc.; ἀριθμόν in number, Hdt., Attic; ἀριθμὸν ἕξ Hdt.; ἐς τὸν ἀρ. τρισχίλια Hdt.; also, ἓν ἀριθμῶι Hdt.; so in Attic
amount, sum, extent, πολὺς ἀρ. χρόνου Aeschin.; ἀρ. ἀργυρίου a sum of money, Xen.
as mark of station, worth, rank, μετʼ ἀνδρῶν ἀριθμῶι among men, Od.; οὐκ ἔχουσιν ἀριθμόν have no account made of them, Eur.; οὐδʼ εἰς ἀριθμὸν ἥκεις λόγων you come not into my account, Eur.
mere number, quantity, opp. to quality, worth, ἀριθμὸς λόγων a mere set of words, Soph.; so of men, οὐκ ἀρ. ἄλλως not a mere lot, Eur.; so ἀριθμός alone, like Hor.ʼs nos numerus sumus, Ar.
a numbering, counting, ἀριθμὸν ποιεῖσθαι τῆς στρατιῆς to hold a muster of the army, Hdt.; παρεῖναι εἰς τὸν ἀρ. Xen.
the science of numbers, numeration, arithmetic, Aesch., Plat.

div1.head: Ἄριοι
div1.sense: the Arians or Aryans, old name of the Medes, Hdt.
Ἄριος, α, ον, as adj. Median, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀρι-
div1.sense: insep. Prefix, like ἐρι-, strengthening the notion conveyed by its compd.: of same Root with Ἄρης, ἀρετή.

div1.head: ἀριπρεπής
div1.sense: very distinguished, stately, Hom.
of things, very bright, splendid, Hom.

div1.head: ἀρίσημος
div1.sense: very notable, Hhymn., Tyrtae.
very plain, visible, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀρίς
div1.sense: a carpenterʼs tool, an auger or drill, Anth.

div1.head: ἀρίσταθλος
div1.sense: victorious in the contest, Anth.

div1.head: ἀρίσταρχος
div1.sense: best-ruling, epith. of Zeus, Simon.

div1.head: ἀριστάφυλος
div1.sense: rich in grapes, Anth.

div1.head: ἀριστάω
div1.sense: to take breakfast or luncheon, Lat. prandere, Ar., Xen.:—perf. pass. impers., ἠρίστηταί τʼ ἐξαρκούντως Ar.

div1.head: ἀριστεία
div1.sense: excellence, prowess, Soph.: Il. 5, in which the prowess of Diomede is described, is called Διομήδους ἀριστεία.

div1.head: ἀριστεῖα
div1.sense: the prize of the best and bravest, the meed of valour, Hdt., Soph., Plat.:—rarely so in sg., Hdt.
in sg. a monument of valour, memorial, Dem.

div1.head: ἀριστερός
div1.sense: left, on the left, Lat. sinister, ἐπʼ ἀριστερά towards, i. e. on, the left, Il.; ἐπʼ ἀριστερὰ χειρός on the left hand, Od.; ἐξ ἀριστερῆς χειρός on the left hand, Hdt.; or simply, ἐξ ἀριστερᾶς Soph.; ἐς ἀριστερήν, ἐν ἀριστερῆι Hdt.
metaph. boding ill, ominous, because to a Greek augur, looking northward, the unlucky signs came from the left, Od.

div1.head: ἀριστεύς
div1.sense: the best man: used by Hom. mostly in Epic pl. ἀριστῆες, the best or noblest, chiefs, princes; so Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἀριστεύω
div1.sense: to be best or bravest, Hom.:— to gain the prize for valour, gain the highest distinction, Hdt.
c. gen., ἀριστεύεσκε Τρώων he was the best of the Trojans, Il.; βουλῆι ἀριστεύεσκεν ἁπάντων Il.; c. inf., ἀριστεύεσκε μάχεσθαι was best at fighting, Il.; ἀρ. τι to be best in a thing, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀριστίζω
div1.sense: to give one breakfast, c. acc. pers., Ar.

div1.head: ἀριστόβουλος
div1.sense: best-advising, Plut.

div1.head: ἀριστογένεθλος
div1.sense: producing the best, Anth.

div1.head: ἀριστογόνος
div1.sense: bearing the best children, Pind.

div1.head: ἀριστοκρατέομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be governed by the best-born, to live under an aristocratical form of government, Ar., Plat.

div1.head: ἀριστοκρατία
div1.sense: the rule of the best, an aristocracy, Thuc., Plat., etc.

div1.head: ἀριστοκρατικός
div1.sense: aristocratical, Plat.

div1.head: ἀριστόμαντις
div1.sense: best of prophets, Soph.

div1.head: ἀριστόμαχος
div1.sense: best at fighting, Pind.

div1.head: ἀριστόνοος
div1.sense: of the best disposition, Anth.

div1.head: ἄριστον
div1.etym: α in Epic, α in Attic
div1.sense: the morning meal, breakfast, taken at sunrise, Hom., Hdt.; ἄριστα, δεῖπνα, δόρπα θʼ αἱρεῖσθαι τρίτον Aesch.:—later, ἄριστον was the mid-day meal, Roman prandium, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀριστοποιέω
div1.sense: to prepare breakfast, τὰ ἀριστοποιούμενα things prepared for breakfast, Xen.:—mostly in Mid. to get oneʼs breakfast, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: ἄριστος
div1.sense: best in its kind, serving as Sup. to ἀγαθός (cf. ἀρείων):

best, noblest, bravest, Il.; βουλῆι, ἔγχεσιν ἄριστος Hom.; εἶδος ἄριστος Il.:—c. inf. ἄριστοι μάχεσθαι Xen.; ἄρ. διαβολὰς ἐνδέκεσθαι readiest to give ear to calumnies, Hdt.; ἄρ. ἀπατᾶσθαι best, i. e. easiest, to cheat, Thuc.
best, most virtuous, Eur.
of animals and things, best, finest, Hom.
neut. pl. as adv. ἄριστα, best, most excellently, Hom., Hdt.

div1.head: ἀριστοτόκος
div1.sense: bearing the best children:— fem. ἀριστοτόκεια, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀριστότοκος2
div1.sense: pass., born of the best parents, Eur.

div1.head: ἀριστόχειρ
div1.sense: won by the stoutest hand, ἀγών Soph.

div1.head: ἀριστώδιν
div1.sense: bearing the best children, Anth.

div1.head: ἀρισφαλής
div1.sense: very slippery or treacherous, Od.

div1.head: ἀριφραδής
div1.sense: easy to be known, very distinct, manifest, Il.: poet. adv. -δέως, plainly, Theocr.
very thoughtful, wise, Soph.

div1.head: ἀρκεόντως
div1.sense: enough, abundantly, ἀρκούντως ἔχει ʼtis enough, Aesch., Thuc.

div1.head: ἄρκεσις
div1.sense: help, aid, service, Soph.

div1.head: ἀρκετός
div1.sense: sufficient, NTest., Anth.

div1.head: ἀρκέω
div1.sense: to ward off, keep off, a thing from a person, τί τινι Il.; ἀρκεῖν τὸ μὴ οὐ θανεῖν to keep off death, Soph.
c. dat. only, to defend, assist, succour, Hom., Soph.
to be strong enough, to be sufficient, to suffice, c. inf., Aesch., Soph.; c. part., ἀρκέσω θνήσκουσα my death will suffice, Soph.; οὐκ ἤρκουν ἰατροὶ θεραπεύοντες Thuc.
c. dat. to suffice, be enough for, satisfy, τινι Hdt., Soph.: to be a match for, πρός τινα Thuc.
absol. to be enough, be strong enough, avail, hold out, Aesch., etc.:—part., ἀρκῶν, οῦσα, οῦν, sufficient, enough, Hdt., Attic
impers., ἀρκεῖ μοι ʼtis enough for me, I am content, c. inf., Soph., etc.:—absol., οὐκέτʼ ἀρκεῖ there is no help, Soph.; ἀρκεῖν δοκεῖ μοι it seems enough, seems good, Soph.
in Pass. to be satisfied with, c. dat. rei, ἔφη οὐκέτι ἀρκέεσθαι τούτοισι Hdt.

div1.head: ἄρκιος
div1.sense: sufficient, sure, certain, νῦν ἄρκιον ἢ ἀπολέσθαι ἠὲ σαωθῆναι one of these is certain, either to perish or be saved, Il.; μισθὸς ἄρκιος a sure reward, Hom.; ἄρκιον εὑρεῖν to have enough, Theocr.; σφίσιν ἄρκιος a match for them, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀρκτέος
div1.sense: one must begin, Soph.
verb. adj. of ἄρχω, one must govern; and in pass sense, one must be ruled, i.e. obey, Soph.

div1.head: ἄρκτος
div1.sense: a bear, Od., etc.
ἄρκτος, ἡ, the constellation Ursa Major, also called ἅμαξα, the Wain, (the star just behind is called Ἀρκτοῦρος the Bearward, or Βοώτης the Wagoner), Hom., etc.
the region of the bear, the North, sg., Hdt., Eur.

div1.head: Ἀρκτοῦρος
div1.sense: arcturus (v. ἄρκτος II), Hes.
the time of his rising, the middle of September, Soph.

div1.head: ἀρκτῷος
div1.sense: northern, Luc.

div1.head: ἄρκυς
div1.sense: pl., nom. and acc ἄρκυες, -υας, Attic contr. ἄρκῡς:— a net, hunterʼs net, Lat. cassis, Aesch.; oft. in pl., Aesch., Eur.:—metaph., ἄρκυες ξίφους the toils, i. e. perils, of the sword, Eur.

div1.head: ἀρκυστασία
div1.sense: a line of nets, Xen.

div1.head: ἀρκύστατος
div1.sense: beset with nets, ἀρκυστάτα μηχανά the hunterʼs toils, Eur.
ἀρκύστατα, τά, a place beset with nets, a snare, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: ἀρκυωρός
div1.sense: a watcher of nets, Xen.

div1.head: ἁρμαλιά
div1.sense: fitting sustenance, allowance, food, Hes., Theocr.

div1.head: ἁρμάμαξα
div1.sense: a covered carriage, borrowed from the Persians, Hdt., Ar.; used by women, Xen.

div1.head: ἅρμα
div1.sense: a chariot, esp. a war-chariot, with two wheels, Hom.; often in pl. for sg., Il., Trag.
chariot and horses, the yoked chariot, Trag.: also the team, the horses, Eur., Ar.

div1.head: ἁρμάτειος
div1.sense: of or belonging to a chariot, Xen.; μέλος ἁρμ. a kind of dirge, Eur.

div1.head: ἁρματεύω
div1.sense: to drive or go in a chariot, Eur.

div1.head: ἁρματηλασία
div1.sense: chariot-driving, Xen.

div1.head: ἁρματηλατέω
div1.sense: to go in a chariot, drive it, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: ἁρματηλάτης
div1.sense: a charioteer, Soph., Xen.

div1.head: ἁρματήλατος
div1.sense: driven round by a wheel, of Ixion, Eur.

div1.head: ἁρματοδρομία
div1.sense: a chariot race, Strab.

div1.head: ἁρματόκτυπος
div1.sense: used to describe ὄτοβος, the rattling din of chariots, Aesch.

div1.head: ἁρματοπηγός
div1.sense: building chariots: ἁρμ. ἀνήρ a wheelwright, chariot-maker, Il.

div1.head: ἁρματοτροφέω
div1.sense: to keep chariot-horses, esp. for racing, Xen.

div1.head: ἁρματοτροφία
div1.sense: a keeping of chariot-horses, Xen.

div1.head: ἁρματοτροχιά
div1.sense: the wheel-track of a chariot, Luc.:—Hom. uses poet. form ἁρματροχιή, Il.

div1.head: ἄρμενα
div1.sense: the tackling or rigging of a ship, Hes., Theocr.
like ὅπλα, any tools, Anth.
div1.etym: Properly neut. of ἄρμενος, v. ἀραρίσκω B. IV.

div1.head: ἁρμόδιος
div1.sense: fitting together, Theogn.
well-fitting, accordant, agreeable, Theogn.:—adv. -ως, Plut.

div1.head: ἁρμόζω
div1.sense: to fit together, join, esp. of joinerʼs work, Od.; so in Mid. to join for oneself, put together, Od.
generally, to fit, adapt, prepare, make ready, Soph.:—Mid. to suit oneself, πρός τινα Luc.

of marriage, ἁρμόζειν τινὶ τὴν θυγατέρα to betroth oneʼs daughter to any one, Hdt.; also, ἁρμ. γάμους Eur.:—Mid. to betroth to oneself, take to wife, τὴν θυγατέρα τινός Hdt.; (so in Mid., NTest.):— Pass., ἡρμόσθαι θυγατέρα τινὸς γυναῖκα to have her betrothed or married to one, Hdt.
to set in order, regulate, govern, Eur.: Pass., Soph.; κονδύλοις ἡρμοττόμην I was ruled or drilled with cuffs, Ar.:—among the Lacedaemonians, to act as harmostes, ἐν ταῖς πόλεσιν Xen.
to arrange according to the laws of harmony, to tune instruments, Plat.:— Pass., ἡρμοσμένος in tune, Plat.
intr. to fit, fit well, of clothes or armour, c. dat. pers., Il.
to fit, suit, be adapted, fit for, τινί Soph.
impers. ἁρμόζει, it is fitting, Lat. decet, c. acc. et inf., Soph.
part., ἁρμόττων, ουσα, ον, fitting, suitable, Plat.; πρός τι Xen.

div1.head: ἁρμοῖ
div1.sense: just, newly, lately, Aesch., Theocr.
div1.etym: In fact, an old dat. of ἁρμός; cf. οἴκοι, πέδοι.

div1.head: ἁρμολογέω
div1.sense: to join, pile together, Anth.

div1.head: ἁρμονία
div1.sense: a fastening to keep ship-planks together, a clamp, Od.
a joining, joint, between a shipʼs planks, τὰς ἁρμ. ἐπάκτωσαν τῆι βύβλωι caulked the joints with byblus, Hdt.
a frame: metaph., δύστροπος γυναικῶν ἁρμ. womenʼs perverse temperament, Eur.
a covenant, agreement, in pl., Il.:— settled government, order, Aesch.
harmony, as a concord of sounds, first as a mythical personage, Harmonia, Music, companion of Hebe, the Graces and the Hours; child of the Muses, Hhymn., Eur.
metaph., harmony, concord, Plat.

div1.head: ἁρμονικός
div1.sense: skilled in music, Plat.:— τὰ ἁρμονικά, music, Plat.

div1.head: ἁρμός
div1.sense: in pl. the fastenings of a door, Eur.; ἁρμὸς χώματος λιθοσπαδής a fissure in the tomb made by tearing away the stones at their joinings, Soph.

div1.head: ἁρμοστής
div1.sense: one who arranges or governs, esp. a harmost or governor of the islands and towns of Asia Minor, sent out by the Lacedaemonians during their supremacy, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: ἁρμόστωρ
div1.sense: a commander, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀρνακίς
div1.sense: a sheepʼs skin, Ar., Plat.

div1.head: ἀρνειός
div1.sense: a young ram or wether, just full grown, Il.; ἀρνειὸς ὄϊς joined, like ἵρηξ κίρκος, Od.

div1.head: ἄρνειος
div1.sense: of a lamb or sheep, κρέα Orac. ap. Hdt.; ἄ. φόνος slaughtered, sheep, Soph.

div1.head: ἀρνεοθοίνης
div1.sense: feasting on lambs, Anth.

div1.head: ἀρνέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. opp. to φημί, to deny, disown, Hom., etc.
opp. to δίδωμι, to decline to give, refuse, Od., etc.
absol to say no, decline, refuse, Il.
dependent clauses are put in inf., with or without μή, to deny that, Hdt., Attic

div1.head: ἀρνευτήρ
div1.sense: a diver, tumbler, Hom.

div1.head: ἀρνεύω
div1.sense: to butt like a ram, to dive, Lycophr.

div1.head: ἀρνήσιμος
div1.sense: to be denied, Soph.

div1.head: ἄρνησις
div1.sense: denial, Aesch., Soph.; foll. by τὸ μή c. inf., Dem.

div1.head: ἀρνίον
div1.sense: a sheep-skin, Luc.

div1.head: ἀρνός
div1.etym: Prob. akin to ἔριον, εἶρος, wool.
div1.sense: a lamb, Lat. agnus, agna, Il.
a sheep, whether ram or ewe, Hom.

div1.head: ἄρνυμαι
div1.etym: used only in pres. and imperf.
div1.sense: to receive for oneself, reap, win, gain, earn, esp. of honour or reward, Hom., Attic:—rarely in bad sense, ἀρνύμενος λώβαν, perh. taking vengeance for my injuries, Eur.

div1.head: ἀρόσιμος
div1.sense: arable, fruitful: metaph. fit for engendering children, Soph., in poet. form ἀρώσιμος.

div1.head: ἄροσις
div1.sense: arable land, corn-land, Lat. arvum, Hom.

div1.head: ἀροτήρ
div1.sense: a plougher, husbandman, Il., Eur.; Σκύθαι ἀροτῆρες, opp. to νομάδες, Hdt.:—adj., βοῦς ἀροτήρ a steer for ploughing, Hes.
metaph. a father, Eur.

div1.head: ἄροτος
div1.sense: a corn-field, Od.
a crop, fruit of the field, Soph.; metaph., τέκνων ἄροτος Eur.
tillage, ploughing, Hes.; ζῆν ἀπʼ ἀρότου to live by husbandry, Hdt.
the season of tillage, seed-time, Hes.: hence a season, year, Soph.

div1.head: ἀροτραῖος
div1.sense: of corn-land, rustic, Anth.

div1.head: ἀροτρεύς
div1.sense: a ploughman, = ἀροτρευτήρ, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀροτρήτης
div1.sense: belonging to the plough, Anth.

div1.head: ἀροτροδίαυλος
div1.sense: a plougher, who goes backwards and forwards like a runner in the δίαυλος, Anth.

div1.head: ἄροτρον
div1.sense: a plough, Lat. aratrum, Hom., etc.

div1.head: ἀροτροπόνος
div1.sense: working with the plough, Anth.

div1.head: ἀροτροφορέω
div1.sense: to draw the plough, Anth.

div1.head: ἀρουραῖος
div1.sense: of or from the country, rural, rustic, μῦς ἀρ. a field- mouse, Hdt.; ὦ παῖ τῆς ἀρουραίας θεοῦ, of Euripides as the reputed son of a herb-seller, Ar.; ἀρ. Οἰνόμαος, of Aeschines who played the part of Oenomaus in the country, Dem.

div1.head: ἄρουρα
div1.sense: tilled or arable land, seed-land, cornland, Lat. arvum, and in pl. corn-lands, fields, Il.: then, generally, land, earth, Il.; πατρὶς ἄρουρα father land, Od.
metaph. of a woman as bearing children, Aesch., Soph.
a measure of land in Egypt, nearly = the Roman jugerum, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀρουροπόνος
div1.sense: working in the field, Anth.

div1.head: ἀρόω
div1.etym: The Root is αροϝ, cf. ἄρουρα, Lat. arvum.
div1.sense: to plough, Lat. arare, οὔτε φυτεύουσιν, οὔτʼ ἀρόωσιν (Epic for ἀροῦσι) Od.: Pass., πόντος ἠρόθη δορί Aesch.
to sow, ἀροῦν εἰς κήπους Plat.
metaph. of the husband, Theogn., Soph.:—Pass., of the child, to be begotten, Theogn.

div1.head: ἁρπάγη
div1.sense: a rake, Lat. harpago, Eur.

div1.head: ἁρπαγή
div1.sense: seizure, rapine, robbery, rape, Solon, Hdt., Attic
the thing seized, booty, prey, Aesch., Eur.; ἁρπαγὴν ποιεῖσθαί τι to make booty of a thing, Thuc.; cf. λεία.
greediness, rapacity, Xen.

div1.head: ἁρπάγιμος
div1.sense: ravished, stolen, Anth.

div1.head: ἁρπαγμός
div1.sense: a seizing, booty, a prize, NTest.

div1.head: ἁρπάζω
div1.sense: to snatch away, carry off, Hom., Hdt., etc.:—absol. to steal, be a thief, Ar.
to seize hastily, snatch up, λᾶαν Il.; δόρυ Aesch.; ἁρπ. τινὰ μέσον to seize him by the waist, Hdt.; c. gen. part., ἁρπ. τινὰ ποδός by the foot, Eur.
to seize, overpower, Aesch.: also to seize a post, Xen.
to plunder, πόλεις Thuc., etc.
div1.etym: From Root αρπ, come also ἅρπη, Ἅρπυιαι, cf. Lat. rapio.

div1.head: ἁρπακτήρ
div1.sense: a robber, Il.

div1.head: ἁρπακτικός
div1.sense: rapacious, Luc.

div1.head: ἁρπακτός
div1.sense: gotten by rapine, stolen, Hes.
to be caught, i. e. to be got by chance, hazardous, Hes.

div1.head: ἁρπαλέος
div1.sense: greedy: adv. ἁρπαλέως, greedily, eagerly, Od., Theogn.
attractive, alluring, Od., Pind.

div1.head: ἁρπαλίζω
div1.sense: to catch up, be eager to receive, τινὰ κωκυτοῖς Aesch.
to exact greedily, Aesch.

div1.head: ἁρπάξανδρος
div1.sense: snatching away men, Aesch.

div1.head: ἅρπαξ
div1.sense: rapacious, Lat. rapax, Ar., Xen.
as Subst.,
ἅρπαξ, rapine, Hes.
ἅρπαξ, a robber, plunderer, Ar.

div1.head: ἅρπασμα
div1.sense: robbery, Plat.

div1.head: ἁρπαστός
div1.sense: carried away, Anth.

div1.head: ἁρπεδόνη
div1.sense: a cord, for binding or for snaring game, Xen.: a bowstring, Anth.

div1.head: ἅρπη
div1.sense: a bird of prey, a kite, Il.
a sickle, = δρέπανον, Hes.

div1.head: Ἅρπυιαι
div1.sense: the snatchers, a personification of whirlwinds or hurricanes, Od. The Harpies, as described by Virgil, belong to later mythology.

div1.head: ἀρραβών
div1.sense: earnest-money, caution-money, deposited by the purchaser and forfeited if the purchase is not completed, Lat. arrhabo, arrha, Isae., NTest.

div1.head: ἄρρατος
div1.sense: firm, hard, solid, Plat.

div1.head: ἄρραφος
div1.sense: without seam, NTest.

div1.head: ἄρρεκτος
div1.sense: undone, poet. ἄρεκτος, Il.

div1.head: ἀρρενικός
div1.sense: male, Luc.

div1.head: ἀρρενόπαις
div1.sense: of male children, Anth.

div1.head: ἀρρενωπία
div1.sense: a manly look manliness, Plat.

div1.head: ἀρρενωπός
div1.sense: masculine-looking, masculine, manly, Plat., Luc.

div1.head: ἄρρηκτος
div1.sense: unbroken, not to be broken, Hom., Hdt., Aesch., etc.: unwearied, Il.

div1.head: ἀρρηνής
div1.sense: fierce, savage, Theocr.

div1.head: ἄρρητος
div1.sense: unspoken, unsaid, Lat. indictus, Od., etc.; οὐκ ἐπʼ ἀρρήτοις λόγοις not without warning spoken, Soph.
not to be spoken, not to be divulged, of sacred mysteries, Hdt., Eur., etc.; διδακτά τε ἄρρητά τʼ, i. e. things profane and sacred, Soph.
unutterable, inexpressible, horrible, Lat. nefandus, Soph., Eur.; ἄρρητʼ ἀρρήτων "deeds without a name, " Soph.
shameful to be spoken, Soph.; ῥητὰ καὶ ἄρρητα, "dicenda tacenda, " Dem.
in Mathem., ἄρρητα, irrational quantities, surds, Plat.

div1.head: ἀρρηφορέω
div1.etym: The meaning of Ἀρρη - is uncertain.
div1.sense: to serve as Ἀρρηφόρος, Ar.

div1.head: ἀρρηφορία
div1.sense: the procession of ἀρρηφόροι Lys.

div1.head: ἀρρηφόρια
div1.sense: the festival arrephoria. Ἀρρηφόρια, τά.

div1.head: ἀρρηφόρος
div1.sense: at Athens
two maidens of noble birth, chosen in their seventh year, who carried the peplos and other holy things of Athena Polias.

div1.head: ἀρρίγητος
div1.sense: not shivering, daring, Anth.

div1.head: ἄρρις
div1.sense: without power of scenting, Xen.

div1.head: ἄρριχος
div1.sense: a wicker basket, Ar., Anth.

div1.head: ἀρρυθμέω
div1.sense: not to be in rhythm with, Plat.

div1.head: ἀρρυθμία
div1.sense: want of rhythm or proportion, Plat.

div1.head: ἄρρυθμος
div1.sense: of sounds, not in rhythm or time, unrhythmical, opp. to εὔρυθμος, Plat.:—metaph. in undue measure, Eur.: ill-proportioned, Xen.

div1.head: ἀρρυτίδωτος
div1.sense: unwrinkled, Anth.

div1.head: ἀρρωδέω
div1.sense: Ionic for ὀρρωδέω

div1.head: ἀρρωδίη
div1.sense: Ionic for ὀρρωδία

div1.head: ἀρρώξ
div1.sense: without cleft or breach, unbroken, γῆ Soph.

div1.head: ἀρρωστέω
div1.sense: to be weak and sickly, Xen., Dem.

div1.head: ἀρρώστημα
div1.sense: an illness, a sickness, Dem.
a moral infirmity, Plut.

div1.head: ἀρρωστία
div1.sense: weakness, sickness, Thuc., etc.; ἀρρ.τοῦ στρατεύειν inability to serve, Thuc.

div1.head: ἄρρωστος
div1.sense: weak, sickly:— adv., ἀρρώστως ἔχειν to be ill, Aeschin.
in moral sense, weak, feeble, τὴν ψυχήν Xen.:— remiss, εἴς τι in a thing, Thuc.
also, v. ἄρδω.

div1.head: ἀρσενοκοίτης
div1.sense: lying with men, NTest.

div1.head: ἄρσην
div1.sense: male, Lat. mas, Il., etc.; ἄρρην, ὁ, or ἄρρεν, the male, Aesch.; οἱ ἄρσενες the male sex, Thuc.
masculine, strong, Eur.: metaph. mighty, κτύπος ἄρσην πόντου Soph.
of the gender of nouns, masculine, ὀνόματα Ar.

div1.head: ἀρσίπους
div1.sense: contr. for ἀερσίπους, raising the foot, active, Hhymn., Anth.

div1.head: ἄρσις
div1.sense: a raising of the foot in walking, Arist.
in Prosody, arsis, opp. to thesis.

div1.head: ἀρτάβη
div1.sense: a Persian measure, artaba, = medimnus 3 choenices, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀρταμέω
div1.sense: to cut in pieces, rend asunder, Eur.

div1.head: ἄρταμος
div1.sense: a butcher, cook, Xen.

div1.head: ἀρτάνη
div1.sense: that by which something is hung up, a rope, noose, halter, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: ἀρτάω
div1.sense: to fasten to or hang one thing upon another, τι ἀπό τινος Thuc.: to fasten in a noose, τὴν δέρην Eur.:—Mid., βρόχους ἀρτωμένη fastening halters to oneʼs neck, Eur.
Pass. to be hung upon, hang upon, ἠρτῆσθαι ἔκ τινος Eur.: hence to depend upon, Lat. pendere ab aliquo, Hdt. Cf. ἀρτέομαι.

div1.head: ἀρτεμής
div1.sense: safe and sound, Hom.

div1.head: ἀρτεμία
div1.sense: soundness, recovery, Anth.

div1.head: Ἀρτεμίσιον
div1.sense: a temple of Artemis, Hdt.

div1.head: Ἄρτεμις
div1.sense: Artemis, the Roman Diana, goddess of the chase, daughter of Zeus and Latona, sister of Apollo: in Hom., women who die suddenly are said to be slain by her ἀγανὰ βέλεα: cf. Ἀπόλλων.

div1.head: ἀρτέμων
div1.sense: prob. a foresail, NTest.

div1.head: ἀρτέομαι
div1.sense: as Pass. to be prepared, get ready, make ready, c. inf., πολεμεῖν ἀρτέοντο, ἀρτέετο ἐς πόλεμον Hdt.; also,
as Mid., c. acc., ναυμαχίην ἀρτέεσθαι to prepare a sea-fight, Hdt.
div1.etym: Akin to ἀρτύω, not to ἀρτάω.

div1.head: ἄρτημα
div1.sense: a hanging ornament, earring, Hdt.; cf. λίθινος.
any hanging weight, Plut.

div1.head: ἀρτηρία
div1.sense: the wind-pipe or trachea, Plat., etc.; πνεύμονος ἀρτηρίαι the vessels of the lungs, Soph.
an artery, only in late writers.

div1.head: ἀρτιάζω
div1.sense: to play at odd and even, Lat. par impar ludere, Ar.
to count, Anth.

div1.head: ἀρτιασμός
div1.sense: the game of odd and even, Arist.

div1.head: ἀρτιβρεχής
div1.sense: just steeped, Anth.

div1.head: ἀρτίγαμος
div1.sense: just married, Anth.

div1.head: ἀρτιγένειος
div1.sense: with beard just sprouting, Anth.

div1.head: ἀρτιγέννητος
div1.sense: just born, Luc.

div1.head: ἀρτιγλυφής
div1.sense: newly carved, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀρτίγονος
div1.sense: just born, Anth.

div1.head: ἀρτιδαής
div1.sense: just taught, Anth.

div1.head: ἀρτίδακρυς
div1.sense: just weeping, ready to weep, Eur.

div1.head: ἀρτίδορος
div1.sense: just stript off or peeled, Anth.

div1.head: ἀρτίδροπος
div1.sense: ready for plucking, of tender age, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀρτιεπής
div1.sense: ready of speech, glib or ready of tongue, Il., Pind.

div1.head: ἀρτιζυγία
div1.sense: a recent union, ἀνδρῶν ἀρτ., i. e. newly-married husbands, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀρτίζω
div1.sense: to get ready, prepare, Anth.: so in Mid., Theocr.

div1.head: ἀρτιθαλής
div1.sense: just budding or blooming, Anth.

div1.head: ἀρτιθανής
div1.sense: just dead, Eur.

div1.head: ἀρτίκολλος
div1.sense: close-glued, clinging close to, ἀρτίκολλος ὥστε τέκτονος χιτών ἀρτίως κολληθεὶς ὡς ὑπὸ τέκτονος, Soph.
metaph. fitting well together, ἀρτ. συμβαίνει turns out exactly right, Aesch.; ἀρτίκολλόν τι μαθεῖν to hear it in the nick of time, opportunely, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀρτιλόχευτος
div1.sense: just born, Anth.

div1.head: ἀρτιμαθής
div1.sense: having just learnt a thing, c. gen., Eur.

div1.head: ἀρτιμελής
div1.sense: sound of limb, Plat.

div1.head: ἄρτιος
div1.sense: complete, perfect of its kind, suitable, exactly fitted; ἄρτια βάζειν to speak to the purpose (cf. ἀρτιεπής), Hom.; ἄρτια ᾔδη thought things agreeable, was of the same mind, Hom.:— meet, right, proper, Solon, Theogn.
c. inf. prepared, ready, to do a thing, Hdt.
of numbers, perfect, i. e. even, opp. to περισσός (odd), Plat., etc.
adv. ἀρτίως, just, now first, like ἄρτι, used by Soph. both of present time with pres. and perf.; and of past with imperf. and aor.

div1.head: ἀρτιπαγής
div1.sense: just put together or made, Theocr., Anth.
freshly coagulated, Anth.

div1.head: ἀρτίπλουτος
div1.sense: newly gotten, χρήματα Eur.

div1.head: ἀρτίπους
div1.sense: sound of foot, Od., Hdt.:—generally, strong or swift of foot, Il.
(ἄρτι, πούς) coming just in time, Soph.

div1.head: ἄρτι
div1.sense: adv. just, exactly,
of the present, just now, even now, with pres. and perf., Theogn., Aesch., etc.
of the past, just now, just, with imperf. and aor., Eur., etc.
in late writers of the future, just now, presently, Luc., etc.

div1.head: ἄρτισις
div1.sense: equipment, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀρτίσκαπτος
div1.sense: just dug, Anth.

div1.head: ἀρτίστομος
div1.sense: speaking in good idiom, or with precision, Plut.

div1.head: ἀρτιτελής
div1.sense: newly initiated, Plat.

div1.head: ἀρτίτοκος
div1.sense: new-born, Anth., Luc.
paroxyt. ἀρτιτόκος, ον, having just given birth, Anth.

div1.head: ἀρτιτρεφής
div1.sense: just nursed, ἀρτιτρεφεῖς βλαχαί the wailings of young children, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀρτίτροπος
div1.sense: just of age, marriageable.

div1.head: ἀρτίφρων
div1.sense: sound of mind, sensible, Od., Eur.: c. gen., γάμων fully conscious of a thing, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀρτιφυής
div1.sense: just born, fresh, Anth.

div1.head: ἀρτιχανής
div1.sense: just opening, Anth.

div1.head: ἀρτίχνους
div1.sense: with the first bloom on, Anth.

div1.head: ἀρτίχριστος
div1.sense: fresh-spread, φάρμακον Soph.

div1.head: ἀρτοκόπος
div1.sense: a baker, Hdt., Xen.
div1.etym: Prob. for ἀρτοπόπος, from πέπτω, cf. Lat. coquus.

div1.head: ἀρτολάγυνος
div1.sense: with bread and bottle in it, πήρα Anth.

div1.head: ἀρτοποιΐα
div1.sense: a baking, Xen.

div1.head: ἀρτοποιός
div1.sense: a bread-maker, baker, Xen.

div1.head: ἀρτοπώλιον
div1.sense: a bakerʼs shop, bakery, Ar.

div1.head: ἀρτόπωλις
div1.sense: a bread-woman, Ar.

div1.head: ἀρτοσιτέω
div1.sense: to eat wheaten bread, Xen.

div1.head: ἄρτος
div1.sense: a cake or loaf of wheat-bread (barley-bread is μᾶζα), mostly in pl., Od.; ἄρτος οὖλος soft bread, Od.

div1.head: ἀρτοφαγέω
div1.sense: to eat bread, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀρτοφάγος
div1.sense: a bread-eater, Batr.

div1.head: ἄρτυμα
div1.sense: seasoning, sauce, spice, Batr.

div1.head: ἀρτύνας
div1.sense: a magistrate at Argos and Epidaurus, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀρτύνω
div1.sense: Ep. form of ἀρτύω to arrange, prepare, devise, λόχον ἀρτύνειν, Lat. insidias struere, Od.; μνηστῆρσιν θάνατον ἀρτ. Od.:—Mid. to prepare for oneself, Od.

div1.head: ἀρτύω
div1.sense: like ἀρτύνω to arrange, devise, prepare, δόλον, ὄλεθρον, γάμον Hom.; so Hdt., Attic

div1.head: ἀρύβαλλος
div1.sense: a bag or purse, Stesich.
a bucket shaped like a purse, i. e. narrow at top, Ar. (Deriv. unknown.)

div1.head: ἀρύσσομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to draw for oneself, Hdt

div1.head: ἀρυστήρ
div1.sense: a cup or ladle, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀρύστιχος
div1.sense: Dim. of ἀρυστήρ, Ar.

div1.head: ἀρύταινα
div1.sense: a small pail, Ar.

div1.head: ἀρυτήσιμος
div1.sense: fit to drink, Anth.

div1.head: ἀρύω
div1.sense: to draw water or any liquor for others, Hes., Xen.:—Mid. to draw water for oneself, ἀρυσσάμενος ποταμῶν ἄπο having drawn water from the rivers, Hes.; ἀρύσασθαι ἀπὸ τοῦ ποταμοῦ Xen.; c. acc., ἀρύσασθαι πῶμα Eur.; c. gen. partit., ἀρύτεσθαι Νείλου ὑδάτων to draw of the waters of the Nile, Ar.; ἐς τὸν κόλπον τρὶς ἀρυσάμενος τοῦ ἡλίου having (as it were) drawn the rays of the sun into his bosom, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀρχάγγελος
div1.sense: an archangel, NTest.

div1.head: ἀρχαϊκός
div1.sense: old-fashioned, antiquated, primitive, ἀρχαϊκὰ φρονεῖν Ar.

div1.head: ἀρχαιόγονος
div1.sense: of ancient race, of old descent, Soph.

div1.head: ἀρχαιολογέω
div1.sense: to discuss antiquities or things out of date, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀρχαιομελισιδωνοφρυνιχήρατος
div1.sense: dear honey-sweet old songs from Phrynichusʼ Phoenissae, Ar.

div1.head: ἀρχαιόπλουτος
div1.sense: rich from olden time, of old hereditary wealth, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: ἀρχαιοπρεπής
div1.sense: distinguished from olden time, time-honoured, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀρχαῖος
div1.sense: from the beginning:
of things, ancient, primeval, olden, Hdt., Attic
like ἀρχαϊκός, old-fashioned, antiquated, primitive, Aesch., Ar.
ancient, former, τὸ ἀρχ. ῥέεθρον Hdt., etc.
of persons, ancient, old, Aesch., Thuc., etc.: οἱ ἀρχαῖοι the Ancients, the old Fathers, Prophets, NTest.
adv. ἀρχαίως, anciently, Dem.; so, τὸ ἀρχαῖον, Ionic contr. τὠρχαῖον Hdt., Attic τἀρχαῖον Aesch.
in olden style, Plat., Aeschin.
as Subst., τὸ ἀρχαῖον, the original sum, the principal, Lat. sors, Ar., Oratt.

div1.head: ἀρχαιοτροπία
div1.sense: old fashions or customs, Plut.

div1.head: ἀρχαιότροπος
div1.sense: old-fashioned, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀρχαιρεσιάζω
div1.sense: to hold the assembly for the election of magistrates, Plut.: to elect, Plut.
to canvass for election, Plut.

div1.head: ἀρχαιρεσία
div1.sense: an election of magistrates, Hdt.; mostly in pl., Xen., etc.

div1.head: ἀρχεῖον
div1.sense: the senate-house, town-hall, residence of the chief magistrates, Lat. curia, Hdt., Xen.
the magistracy, Arist.

div1.head: ἀρχέκακος
div1.sense: beginning mischief, Il.

div1.head: ἀρχέλαος
div1.sense: leading the people, a chief, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀρχέπολις
div1.sense: ruling a city, Pind.

div1.head: ἀρχέτας
div1.sense: a leader, prince, Eur.: as adj., ἀρχ. θρόνος a princely throne, Eur.

div1.head: ἀρχέτυπον
div1.sense: an archetype, pattern, model, Anth.: the figure on a seal, Luc.

div1.head: ἀρχεύω
div1.sense: to command, c. dat., Il.

div1.head: ἀρχέχορος
div1.sense: leading the chorus or dance, Eur.

div1.head: ἀρχηγενής
div1.sense: causing the first beginning of a thing, c. gen., Aesch.

div1.head: ἀρχηγετεύω
div1.sense: to be chief leader, τῶν κάτω Hdt.

div1.head: ἀρχηγετέω
div1.sense: to make a beginning, Soph.

div1.head: ἀρχηγέτης
div1.sense: a first leader, the founder of a city or family, Hdt., etc.
generally, a leader, prince, chief, Aesch., Soph.
a first cause, author, τύχης, γένους Eur.

div1.head: ἀρχηγός
div1.sense: beginning, originating a thing, c. gen., Eur.
as Subst., like ἀρχηγέτης, founder, of a tutelary hero, Soph.
a prince, chief, Aesch., Simon., Thuc.
a first cause, originator, τοῦ πράγματος Xen.

div1.head: ἀρχῆθεν
div1.sense: from the beginning, from of old, from olden time, Hdt.:—with a neg., ἀρχῆθεν μή not at all, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀρχήν
div1.sense: see ἀρχή I.

div1.head: ἀρχή
div1.sense: a beginning, origin, first cause, Hom., etc.:—with Preps. ἐξ ἀρχῆς ἀρχῆθεν, from the beginning, from of old, Od., Attic; ἐξ ἀρχῆς πάλιν anew, afresh, Ar.:—so, ἀπʼ ἀρχῆς Hdt., Trag.:— κατʼ ἀρχάς in the beginning, at first, Hdt.:—absol. in acc. ἀρχήν, to begin with, first, Hdt.; ἀρχὴν οὐ absolutely not, not at all, Lat. omnino non, Hdt., Attic; with numerals, ἀρχὴν ἑπτά in all, Hdt.
the end, corner, of a bandage, rope, sheet, Hdt., Eur., NTest.
the first place or power, sovereignty, dominion, command, Hdt., Attic; c. gen. rei, ἀρχὴ τῶν νεῶν, τῆς θαλάσσης Thuc., etc.
a sovereignty, empire, realm, Hdt., Thuc.
in Prose, a magistracy, office, Hdt., Attic:—also a term of office, τὴν ἐνιαυσίαν ἀρχήν Thuc.:—these offices were commonly obtained in two ways, χειροτονητή by election, κληρωτή by lot, Aeschin.
in pl., αἱ ἀρχαί (as we say) "the authorities, " i. e. the magistrates, Thuc., etc.

div1.head: ἀρχιγραμματεύς
div1.sense: a chief clerk, Plut.

div1.head: ἀρχίδιον
div1.sense: a petty office, petty officer, Ar., Dem.

div1.head: ἀρχιερατικός
div1.sense: of the high-priest, NTest.

div1.head: ἀρχιερεύς
div1.sense: an arch-priest, chief-priest, Hdt.:— at Rome, the Pontifex Maximus, Plut.:—at Jerusalem, the high-priest, NTest.

div1.head: ἀρχιερωσύνη
div1.sense: the high-priesthood, Plut.

div1.head: ἀρχιθάλασσος
div1.sense: ruling the sea, Anth.

div1.head: ἀρχιθεωρέω
div1.sense: to be ἀρχιθέωρος, Dem.

div1.head: ἀρχιθέωρος
div1.sense: the chief of a θεωρία or sacred embassy, Andoc., Arist.

div1.head: ἀρχικός
div1.sense: of or for rule, royal, Aesch., Thuc.
of persons, fit for rule, skilled in government or command, Xen., Plat.: c. gen. having command of, Arist.

div1.head: ἀρχικυβερνήτης
div1.sense: a chief pilot, Plut.

div1.head: ἀρχίμιμος
div1.sense: a chief comedian, Plut.

div1.head: ἀρχιπειρατής
div1.sense: a pirate-chief, Plut.

div1.head: ἀρχίπλανος
div1.sense: a Nomad chieftain, Luc.

div1.head: ἀρχιποίμην
div1.sense: a chief shepherd, NTest.

div1.head: ἀρχισυνάγωγος
div1.sense: the ruler of a synagogue, NTest.

div1.head: ἀρχιτεκτονέω
div1.sense: to be the architect, Plut.
generally, to construct, contrive, Ar.

div1.head: ἀρχιτέκτων
div1.sense: a chief-artificer, master-builder, director of works, architect, engineer, Hdt.
generally, a constructor, author, Eur., Dem.
at Athens, the manager of the state theatre and of the Dionysia, Dem.

div1.head: ἀρχιτελώνης
div1.sense: a chief toll-collector, chief-publican, NTest.

div1.head: ἀρχιτρίκλινος
div1.sense: the president of a banquet (triclinium), NTest.

div1.head: ἀρχιυπασπιστής
div1.sense: chief of the men at arms, Plut.

div1.head: ἀρχοντικός
div1.sense: of an archon, Anth.

div1.head: ἀρχός
div1.sense: a leader, chief, commander, Il.

div1.head: ἀρχῳδός
div1.sense: a precentor, Byz.

div1.head: ἄρχων
div1.sense: a ruler, commander, chief, captain, Hdt., Aesch., etc.
Ἄρχοντες, οἱ, the chief magistrates at Athens, nine in number, the first being ὁ Ἄρχων or Ἄρχων ἐπώνυμος, the second ὁ Βασιλεύς, the third ὁ Πολέμαρχος, the remaining six οἱ Θεσμοθέται.
title of the chief magistrates in other places, as the Ephors at Sparta, Hdt.

div1.head: ἄρχω
div1.etym: pf. pass. ἦργμαι only in mid. sense
div1.sense: in pass. sense:— to be first,
of Time, to begin, make a beginning, both in Act. and Mid.:

c. gen. to make a beginning of, πολέμοιο, μάχης, etc., Hom.; so Hdt. and Attic:—Mid. also in a religious sense, like ἀπάρχεσθαι, ἀρχόμενος μελέων beginning the sacrifice with the limbs, Od.; ἄρχειν σπονδῶν Thuc.
c. gen. also to begin from or with, ἐν σοὶ μὲν λήξω σέο δʼ ἄρξομαι Il.; so, ἄρχεσθαι ἔκ τινος Od.; ἀρξάμενοι ἀπὸ παιδίων even from boyhood, Hdt.
c. gen. rei et dat. pers., ἄρχ. θεοῖς δαιτός to make preparations for a banquet to the gods, Il.; τοῖσι δὲ μύθων ἦρχε Il., etc.
c. acc., ἄρχειν ὁδόν τινι, like Lat. praeire viam alicui, to shew him the way, Od.; absol. (sub. ὁδόν), to lead the way, Hom.; then generally ἄρχειν τι Aesch., Soph.
c. inf. to begin to do a thing, Hom., etc.; c. part. of continued action or condition, ἦρχον χαλεπαίνων Il.; ἄρχ. διδάσκων Xen.
absol., ἄρχε begin! Hom.; ἄρχει ἡ ἐκεχειρία Thuc.; ἅμα ἦρι ἀρχομένωι, θέρους ἀρχομένου Thuc.
of Authority, to lead, rule, govern, only in Act.:
c. gen. to rule, be leader of . . , τινός Hom., Attic
c. dat. to rule over, Hom., Aesch.
absol. to rule, govern, Aesch.: esp. to hold a subordinate office, ὁκοῖον εἴη ἄρχειν μετὰ τὸ βασιλεύειν Hdt.:—at Athens, to be archon, Dem.; cf. ἄρχων.
Pass. to be ruled, governed, Hdt., Attic; οἱ ἀρχόμενοι subjects, Xen.

div1.head: ἀρωγή
div1.sense: help, aid, succour, protection, Ζηνὸς ἀρωγή aid given by Zeus, Il.; ἐπʼ ἀρωγῆι in anyoneʼs favour, Il.; ἀρ. νόσου, help against . . , Plat.
of persons, an aid, succour, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: ἀρωγοναύτης
div1.sense: helper of sailors, Anth.

div1.head: ἀρωγός
div1.sense: aiding, succouring, propitious, serviceable, τινι Aesch.; absol., Aesch., Soph.
c. gen. serviceable towards a thing, Aesch., Soph.; πρός τι Thuc.
as Subst. a helper, aid, esp. in battle, Il.: a defender before a tribunal, advocate, Il.

div1.head: ἄρωμα
div1.sense: any spice or sweet herb, Xen.

div1.head: ἄρωμα
div1.sense: arable land, corn-land, Lat. arvum, Ar.

div1.head: ἄρω
div1.sense: radical form of ἀραρίσκω, whence come ἄρθρον, ἁρμόζω, ἄρτι, ἄρτιος, ἀρτύω, etc.

div1.head: ἀρώσιμος
div1.sense: poet. for ἀρόσιμος

div1.head: ἄρωστος
div1.sense: poet. for ἄρρωστος, Anth.

div1.head: ἄσακτος
div1.sense: not trodden down, Xen.

div1.head: ἀσαλαμίνιος
div1.sense: not having been at Salamis, Ar.

div1.head: ἀσάλευτος
div1.sense: not agitated, tranquil, of the sea:—metaph. of the mind, Eur.

div1.head: ἀσάμινθος
div1.sense: a bathing-tub, Od.

div1.head: ἀσάνδαλος
div1.sense: unsandalled, unshod, Bion.

div1.head: ἄσαντος
div1.sense: not to be soothed, ungentle, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀσάω
div1.sense: to feel loathing or nausea, to be disgusted or vexed at a thing, c. dat., Theogn.; τὴν ψυχὴν ἀσηθῆναι Hdt.; ἀσώμενος ἐν φρεσί Theocr.

div1.head: ἀσαρκής
div1.sense: not fleshly, i. e. spiritual, Anth.

div1.head: ἄσαρκος
div1.sense: without flesh, lean, Xen.

div1.head: ἀσάφεια
div1.sense: indistinctness, obscurity, Plat.

div1.head: ἀσαφής
div1.sense: indistinct to the senses, dim, faint, Thuc.; or to the mind, dim, obscure, Soph., Thuc.; νὺξ ἀσαφεστέρα ἐστίν by night one sees less distinctly, Xen.: —adv. -φῶς, obscurely, ἀσαφῶς ποτέρων ἀρξάντων without knowing which began, Thuc.

div1.head: ἄσβεστος
div1.sense: unquenchable, inextinguishable, of fire, Il.; of laughter, etc., Hom.; ἄσβ. πόρος ὠκεανοῦ oceanʼs ceaseless flow, Aesch.
as Subst., ἄσβεστος (sc. τίτανος), unslaked lime, Plut.

div1.head: ἀσέβεια
div1.sense: ungodliness, impiety, profaneness, Eur., Xen., etc.

div1.head: ἀσεβέω
div1.sense: to be impious, to act profanely, sin against the gods; εἴς τινα or τι Hdt., Eur.; περί τινα or τι Hdt., Xen.
c. acc. pers. to sin against him, Aesch.; hence in Pass., ἠσέβηται οὐδέν no sin has been committed, Andoc.

div1.head: ἀσέβημα
div1.sense: an impious or profane act, Thuc., Dem.

div1.head: ἀσεβής
div1.sense: ungodly, godless, unholy, profane, Soph.: τὸ ἀσεβές ἀσέβεια, Xen.

div1.head: ἀσείρωτος
div1.sense: not drawn by traces (but by the yoke), Eur.

div1.head: ἀσελγαίνω
div1.sense: to behave licentiously, Plat.:—Pass., of acts, τὰ ἠσελγημένα, outrageous acts, Dem.

div1.head: ἀσέλγεια
div1.sense: licentiousness, Plat., Dem.

div1.head: ἀσελγής
div1.sense: licentious, wanton, brutal, Dem.:—adv., ἀσελγῶς πίονες extravagantly fat, Ar.; ἀσ. ζῆν Dem.

div1.head: ἀσέληνος
div1.sense: moonless, νύξ Thuc.

div1.head: ἄσεπτος
div1.sense: unholy, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: ἀσήμαντος
div1.sense: without leader or shepherd, Il.
unsealed, unmarked, Hdt.

div1.head: ἄσημος
div1.sense: without mark or sign, ἄσ. χρυσός uncoined gold, Hdt.; ἄσ. ἀργύριον Thuc.; ἄσ. ὅπλα arms without device, Eur.
of sacrifices or oracles, giving no sign, unintelligible, Hdt., Trag.
leaving no mark, indistinct, Soph.; of sounds, inarticulate, unintelligible, Hdt.; ἄσημα βοῆς ἄσημος βοή, Soph.:—generally, unperceived, unnoticed, Aesch., Soph.
of persons, cities, etc., of no mark, unknown, obscure, Eur.

div1.head: ἄση
div1.sense: nausea, distress, vexation, Hdt., Eur.

div1.head: ἀσθένεια
div1.sense: want of strength, weakness, feebleness, sickliness, Hdt., Thuc., etc.; ἀσθένεια βίου poverty, Hdt.
sickness, a disease, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀσθενέω
div1.sense: to be weak, feeble, sickly, Eur., Thuc., etc.; ἠσθένησε he fell sick, Dem.

div1.head: ἀσθενής
div1.sense: without strength, weak, feeble, weakly, Hdt., etc.; ἀσθενέστερος πόνον ἐνεγκεῖν too weak to bear labour, Dem.:— τὸ ἀσθενὲς ἀσθένεια, Thuc.
of property, weak, poor, Hdt., Eur.; οἱ ἀσθενέστεροι the weaker sort, i. e. the poor, Xen.
insignificant, οὐκ ἀσθενέστατος σοφιστής Hdt.; of streams, petty, small, Hdt.
adv. ἀσθενῶς, feebly, slightly, Plat.: comp. -έστερον or -έστερα Plat., Thuc.

div1.head: ἀσθενόω
div1.sense: to weaken, Xen.

div1.head: ἀσθμαίνω
div1.sense: to breathe hard, gasp for breath, of one out of breath or dying, mostly in pres. part., Il.

div1.head: ἆσθμα
div1.sense: short breath, panting, from toil, Il., Aesch.
generally, a breath, breathing, Mosch.: a blast, Anth.

div1.head: Ἀσιανός
div1.sense: Asiatic, Thuc., etc. also Ἀσιάτης, fem. Ἀσιᾶτις, Ionic Ἀσιήτης Ἀσιῆτις, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: Ἀσία
div1.sense: Asia, Hdt., Attic.

div1.head: Ἀσιάρχης
div1.sense: an Asiarch, the highest religious official under the Romans in the province of Asia, NTest.

div1.head: Ἀσιάς
div1.sense: fem. adj. = Ἀσιανή, Asiatic
(sc. κιθάρα ) the lyre as improved in Lesbos.

div1.head: Ἀσιατογενής
div1.sense: of Asian birth, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀσίδηρος
div1.sense: not of iron, Eur.: not made by iron, Anth.
without sword, unarmed, Eur.

div1.head: ἄσικχος
div1.sense: not nice as to food, Plut.

div1.head: ἀσινής
div1.sense: unhurt, unharmed, of persons, Od., Hdt.: secure, happy of life and fortune, Aesch.
of things, undamaged, Hdt.
act. not harming, Hdt.: harmless, Xen.
protecting from harm, Aesch.
adv. ἀσινῶς, innocently, Sup. -εστατα Xen.

div1.head: Ἄσιος
div1.sense: Asian, Il.

div1.head: ἄσις
div1.sense: slime, mud, such as a river brings down, Il.

div1.head: ἀσιτέω
div1.sense: to abstain from food, fast, Eur., Plat.

div1.head: ἀσιτία
div1.sense: want of food, Hdt., Eur.

div1.head: ἄσιτος
div1.sense: without food, fasting, Od., Attic

div1.head: ἀσκαλαβώτης
div1.sense: the spotted lizard, Lat. stellio, Ar.

div1.head: ἄσκαλος
div1.sense: unhoed, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀσκάντης
div1.sense: a poor bed, pallet, Ar.
a bier, Anth.

div1.head: ἀσκαρδαμυκτί
div1.sense: without winking, with unchanged look, Xen.

div1.head: ἀσκαρδάμυκτος
div1.sense: not blinking or winking, Ar.

div1.head: ἀσκελής
div1.sense: dried up, withered, Od.
neut. ἀσκελές as adv. toughly, obstinately, stubbornly, ἀσκελὲς αἰεί Od.; so, ἀσκελέως αἰεί Il.

div1.head: ἀσκέπαρνος
div1.sense: without the axe, unhewn, Soph.

div1.head: ἄσκεπτος
div1.sense: inconsiderate, unreflecting, Plat.:—adv. -τως, inconsiderately, Thuc., etc.
unconsidered, unobserved, Xen.

div1.head: ἀσκευής
div1.sense: without the implements of his art, Hdt.

div1.head: ἄσκευος
div1.sense: unfurnished, unprepared, Soph.: c. gen. unfurnished with a thing, Soph.

div1.head: ἀσκέω
div1.sense: to work curiously, form by art, fashion, Hom.; ἀσκήσας with skilful art, Hom.
of adornment, to dress out, trick out, decorate, adorn, deck, Hdt.: Pass., πέπλοισι Περσικοῖς ἠσκημένη Aesch.:—Mid., σῶμʼ ἠσκήσατο adorned his own person, Eur.
in Prose, to practise, exercise, train, Lat. exercere, properly of athletic exercise:
of the person trained, Ar.; ἀσκεῖν τὸ σῶμα εἴς or πρός τι for an object or purpose, Xen., etc.
of the thing practised, ἀσκ. τέχνην Hdt.; metaph., ἀσκ. τὴν ἀλήθειαν Hdt.; κακότητα Aesch.; ἀσέβειαν Eur.
c. inf., ἄσκει τοιαύτη μένειν endeavour to remain such, Soph.; ἀσκ. ἀγαθὰ ποιεῖν to make a practice of doing good, Xen.
absol. to practise, go into training, οἱ ἀσκοῦντες those who practise gymnastics, Xen.

div1.head: ἀσκηθής
div1.sense: unhurt, unharmed, unscathed, Hom.

div1.head: ἄσκημα
div1.sense: an exercise, practice, Xen.

div1.head: ἄσκηνος
div1.sense: without tents, Plut.

div1.head: ἄσκησις
div1.sense: exercise, practice, training, Thuc., Xen., etc.; in pl. exercises, Plat.:—c. gen., ἄσκ. τινος practice of or in a thing, Xen.
generally, a mode of life, profession, art, Luc.

div1.head: ἀσκητέος
div1.sense: to be practised, Xen.
ἀσκητέον, one must practise, σοφίαν Plat.

div1.head: ἀσκητής
div1.sense: one who practises any art or trade, ἀσκ. τῶν πολεμικῶν Xen.: esp. an athlete, one trained for the arena, Ar., Plat.

div1.head: ἀσκητός
div1.sense: curiously wrought, Od.: adorned, πέπλωι with a robe, Theocr.
to be acquired by practice, Plat., Xen.
of persons, practised in a thing, c. dat., Plut.

div1.head: ἄσκιος
div1.sense: unshaded, Pind.

div1.head: Ἀσκληπιάδαι
div1.sense: a name for physicians, Theogn., Soph.

div1.head: Ἀσκληπιεῖον
div1.sense: the temple of Asclepius, Luc.

div1.head: Ἀσκληπίειος
div1.sense: of, belonging to Asclepius, Ἀσκληπίεια (sc. ἱερά) his festival, Plat.

div1.head: Ἀσκληπιός
div1.sense: Asclepius, Lat. Aesculapius, a Thessalian prince, famous as a physician, Il.:—later, son of Apollo, tutelary god of medicine.

div1.head: ἄσκοπος
div1.sense: inconsiderate, heedless, Il.: unregardful of a thing, c. gen., Aesch.
pass. unseen, invisible, Soph.
not to be seen, unintelligible, obscure, Aesch., Soph.: inconceivable, incalculable, Soph.

div1.head: ἄσκοπος2
div1.sense: aimless, random, Luc.

div1.head: ἀσκός
div1.sense: a leathern-bag, a wine-skin, Hom.; ἀσκὸς βοός the bag of ox-skin in which Aeolus bottled up the winds, Od.; ἀσκὸς Μαρσυέω a bag made of the skin of Marsyas, Hdt.:— a bladder, Eur.
proverb. usage, ἀσκὸν δείρειν τινά to flay one alive, maltreat wantonly, Ar.; ἀσκὸς δεδάρθαι Solon.

div1.head: ἀσκωλιάζω
div1.sense: to dance as at the Ἀσκώλια, Ar.

div1.head: Ἀσκώλια
div1.sense: the 2nd day of the rural Dionysia, when they danced upon greased wine-skins, "unctos saluere per utres."

div1.head: ἄσκωμα
div1.sense: the leather padding of the hole which served for the row-lock, put there to make the oar move easily, Ar.

div1.head: ᾆσμα
div1.sense: a song, a lyric ode, or lay, Plat.

div1.head: ᾀσματοκάμπτης
div1.sense: twister of song, Ar.

div1.head: ἀσμενίζω
div1.sense: to be well-pleased, Polyb.

div1.head: ἄσμενος
div1.etym: ἥδομαι, the perf. part. of which would be ἡσμένος
div1.sense: well-pleased, glad, always with a Verb, φύγεν ἄσμενος he escaped gladly or he was glad to have escaped, Hom., etc.; ἐμοὶ δέ κεν ἀσμένωι εἴη glad would it make me! Il.; ἀσμένωι δέ σοι νὺξ ἀποκρύψει φάος glad wilt thou be when night shuts out the light, Aesch.: —adv. ἀσμένως, gladly, readily, Aesch., Eur.: Sup. ἀσμεναίτατα, -έστατα, Plat.

div1.head: ἀσοφία
div1.sense: unwisdom, stupidity, Plut., Luc.

div1.head: ἄσοφος
div1.sense: unwise, foolish, silly, Theogn.

div1.head: ἀσπάζομαι
div1.sense: to welcome kindly, bid welcome, greet, Lat. salutare, τινα Hom., etc.; as the common form on meeting, ἀσπάζομαί σε or ἀσπάζομαι alone, Ar.; πρόσωθεν αὐτὴν ἀσπ. I salute her at a respectful distance, i. e. keep away from her, Eur.:— also to take leave of, Eur., Xen.
to embrace, kiss, caress, Ar.; of dogs, Lat. blandiri, Xen.
of things, to follow eagerly, cleave to, Lat. amplector, ἀσπ. τὸν οἶνον Plat.
ἀσπ. ὅτι to be glad that, Ar.

div1.head: ἀσπαίρω
div1.sense: to pant, gasp, struggle convulsively, of the dying, Hom., Hdt.; but, μοῦνος ἤσπαιρε he was the only one who still made a struggle, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀσπάλαθος
div1.sense: aspalathus, a prickly shrub, yielding a fragrant oil, Theogn.; used as an instrument of torture, Plat.

div1.head: ἄσπαρτος
div1.sense: of land, unsown, untilled, Od.
of plants, not sown, growing wild, Od.

div1.head: ἀσπάσιος
div1.sense: welcome, gladly welcomed, Hom.
well-pleased, glad, Hom.:— adv. -ίως, gladly, Hom., Hdt.

div1.head: ἄσπασμα
div1.sense: a greeting, esp. in pl. embraces, Eur.

div1.head: ἀσπασμός
div1.sense: a greeting, embrace, salutation, Theogn., NTest.

div1.head: ἀσπαστός
div1.sense: = ἀσπάσιος, welcome, Od., Hdt. adv. -τῶς, Hdt.

div1.head: ἇς
div1.sense: Aeol. and Dor for ἕως.

div1.head: ἄσπειστος
div1.sense: to be appeased by no libations, implacable, Dem.

div1.head: ἄσπερμος
div1.sense: without seed or posterity, Il.

div1.head: ἀσπερχές
div1.etym: a neut. form used as adv.
div1.sense: hastily, hotly, vehemently, Hom.

div1.head: ἄσπετος
div1.sense: unspeakable, unutterable, unspeakably great, Hom.:—neut. as adv. unspeakably, Il.

div1.head: ἀσπιδαποβλής
div1.sense: one that throws away his shield, a runaway, Ar.

div1.head: ἀσπιδηφόρος
div1.sense: shield-bearing, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: ἀσπιδιώτης
div1.sense: shield-bearing, a warrior, Il.

div1.head: ἀσπιδόδουπος
div1.sense: clattering with shields, Pind.

div1.head: ἀσπιδοπηγεῖον
div1.sense: the workshop of a shieldmaker, Dem.

div1.head: ἀσπιδοῦχος
div1.sense: a shield-bearer, Eur.

div1.head: ἀσπιδοφέρμων
div1.sense: living by the shield, i. e. by war, Eur.

div1.head: ἄσπιλος
div1.sense: without spot, spotless, Anth., NTest.

div1.head: ἀσπίς
div1.sense: a round shield, Lat. clipeus, of bullʼs hide, overlaid with metal plates, with a boss (ὀμφαλός) in the middle, and fringed with tassels (θύσανοι): different from the oblong shield (ὅπλον, Lat. scutum) used by the ὁπλῖται.
in Prose, used for a body of soldiers, ὀκτακισχιλίη ἀσπίς , men-at-arms, Hdt.

military phrases: ἐπʼ ἀσπίδας πέντε καὶ εἴκοσι τάξασθαι to be drawn up 25 deep, Thuc.; so, ἐπʼ ἀσπίδων ὀλίγων τετάχθαι Thuc.; ἐπʼ ἀσπίδα, παρʼ ἀσπίδα (opp. to ἐπὶ δόρυ) on the left, towards or to the left, because the shield was on the left arm, Xen.; παρʼ ἀσπ. στῆναι to stand in battle-array, Eur.
an asp, an Egyptian snake, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀσπιστής
div1.sense: one armed with a shield, a warrior, gen. pl. ἀσπιστάων, Il.:—as adj., ἀσπισταὶ μόχθοι τευχέων, i. e. the shield of Achilles, Eur.

div1.head: ἀσπίστωρ
div1.sense: κλόνοι ἀσπίστορες turmoil of shielded warriors, Aesch.

div1.head: ἄσπλαγχνος
div1.sense: without bowels: metaph. heartless, spiritless, Soph.

div1.head: ἄσπονδος
div1.sense: without drink-offering, of a god, to whom no drink-offering is poured, ἄσπ. θεός i. e. death, Eur.

without a regular truce (which was ratified by σπονδαί), Thuc.; ἀσπόνδους τοὺς νεκροὺς ἀνελέσθαι to take up their dead without leave asked, Thuc.; τὸ ἄσπονδον a keeping out of treaty or covenant with others, neutrality, Thuc.
admitting of no truce, implacable, deadly, Lat. internecinus, of war, Aesch., Dem.

div1.head: ἀσπούδαστος
div1.sense: not to be zealously pursued, not worth pursuing, Eur.

div1.head: ἀσπουδί
div1.sense: without zeal, without a struggle, ignobly, Il.

div1.head: ἀσσάριον
div1.sense: Dim. of Lat. as, a farthing, NTest., Plut.

div1.head: ἆσσον
div1.sense: nearer, very near, Hom.: c. gen., ἆσσον ἐμεῖο nearer to me, Il.; with a double comp., μᾶλλον ἆσσον Soph.:—hence, as a new comp., ἀσσοτέρω, with or without gen., Od.; Sup. ἀσσοτάτω, Anth.; whence adj. ἀσσότατος Anth.

div1.head: Ἀσσυρία
div1.sense: (sc. γῆ) , ἡ Assyria, the country of the Assyrians, Hdt.

div1.head: Ἀσσύριοι
div1.sense: the Assyrians, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀσταθής
div1.sense: unsteady, unstable, Anth.

div1.head: ἀστάθμητος
div1.sense: unsteady, unstable, ἀστέρες Xen.; ὁ δῆμος ἀσταθμητότατον πρᾶγμα Dem.: uncertain of life, Eur.; τὸ ἀστάθμητον uncertainty, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀστακτί
div1.sense: not in drops, i. e. in floods, Soph., Plat.

div1.head: ἄστακτος
div1.sense: not in drops, gushing, Eur.

div1.head: ἀστάλακτος
div1.sense: not dripping, Plut.

div1.head: ἀστάνδης
div1.sense: a courier, Persian word, Plut.

div1.head: ἀστασίαστος
div1.sense: not disturbed by faction, Thuc.: of persons, free from party-spirit, not factious, Plat.

div1.head: ἀστατέω
div1.sense: to be unstable, NTest.

div1.head: ἄστατος
div1.sense: unstable, Plut.

div1.head: ἀσταφιδίτης
div1.sense: of raisins, Anth.

div1.head: ἀσταφίς
div1.sense: as collect. noun, dried grapes, raisins, Lat. uva passa, Hdt.

div1.head: ἄσταχυς
div1.sense: an ear of corn, Il., Hdt.

div1.head: ἀστέγαστος
div1.sense: uncovered: διὰ τὸ ἀστέγαστον from their having no shelter, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀστεΐζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to talk cleverly, Plut.

div1.head: ἀστεῖος
div1.sense: of the town: hence, like Lat. urbanus, town-bred, polite, courteous, opp. to ἄγροικος, Plat.:— refined, elegant, pretty, witty, clever Ar., Plat.:—ironically, ἀστ. κέρδος a pretty piece of luck, Ar.

div1.head: ἀστεμφής
div1.sense: unmoved, unshaken, Il.; ἀστεμφὲς ἔχεσκε τὸ σκῆπτρον he held it stiff, Il.:— adv., ἀστεμφέως ἐχέμεν to hold fast, Od.: also neut. ἀστεμφές, as adv. stiff, stark, Mosch.
of persons, stiff, unflinching, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀστένακτος
div1.sense: without sigh or groan, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: ᾀστέος
div1.sense: one must sing, Ar., Plat.

div1.head: ἄστεπτος
div1.sense: uncrowned, Eur.

div1.head: ἀστεργάνωρ
div1.sense: without love of man, shunning wedlock, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀστεργής
div1.sense: without love, implacable, hateful, Soph.

div1.head: ἀστερόεις
div1.sense: starred, starry, Il.
like a star, glittering, Il.

div1.head: ἀστεροπή
div1.sense: lightning, Il.

div1.head: ἀστεροπητής
div1.sense: the lightener, of Zeus, Il.

div1.head: ἀστερωπός
div1.sense: star-faced, bright-shining, Eur.
starry, Eur.

div1.head: ἀστέφανος
div1.sense: without crown, ungarlanded, Eur.

div1.head: ἀστεφάνωτος
div1.sense: uncrowned, not to be crowned, Plat., etc.

div1.head: ἄστηλος
div1.sense: without tombstone, Anth.

div1.head: ἀστή
div1.sense: fem. of ἀστός, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: ἀστήρικτος
div1.sense: not steady, unstable, Anth., NTest.

div1.head: ἀστήρ
div1.etym: The Root is !ster, α being euphon., cf. Lat. stella, i. e. sterula.
div1.sense: a star, Il., etc.; cf. ἄστρον.
a flame, light, fire, Eur.

div1.head: ἀστιβής
div1.sense: untrodden, Aesch.: desert, pathless, Soph.
not to be trodden, holy, Soph.

div1.head: ἀστικός
div1.sense: of a city or town, opp. to country, Aesch.; τὰ ἀστικὰ Διονύσια (also called τὰ κατʼ ἄστυ), Thuc.
like ἀστεῖος, polite, neat, nice, ἀστικά (as adv.) Theocr.

div1.head: ἄστικτος
div1.sense: not marked with στίγματα, not tattooed, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀστλέγγιστος
div1.sense: not scraped clean, Anth.

div1.head: ἄστολος
div1.sense: unequipped, of Charonʼs boat, used in the same way as γάμος ἄγαμος, Aesch.

div1.head: ἄστομος
div1.sense: without mouth: of horses, hardmouthed, restive, Soph.
of dogs, soft-mouthed, unable to hold with the teeth, Xen.
of metal, soft, incapable of a fine edge, Plut.

div1.head: ἀστονάχητος
div1.sense: without sighs, Anth.

div1.head: ἄστοργος
div1.sense: without natural affection, Aeschin.; ὥστοργος (i. e. ὁ ἄστ.) the heartless one, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀστός
div1.sense: a townsman, citizen, Hom., Attic

div1.head: ἀστοχέω
div1.sense: to miss the mark, to miss, fail, τινος or περί τινος Polyb.; περί τι NTest.

div1.head: ἄστοχος
div1.sense: missing the mark, aiming badly at, τινος Plat., Anth.

div1.head: ἀστράβη
div1.sense: a muleʼs saddle, an easy padded saddle, Dem.

div1.head: ἀστραβής
div1.sense: not twisted, straight, Plat.

div1.head: ἀστραγαλίζω
div1.sense: to play with ἀστράγαλοι, Plat.

div1.head: ἀστραγάλισις
div1.sense: a playing with ἀστράγαλοι, Arist.

div1.head: ἀστράγαλος
div1.sense: one of the neck-vertebrae, Hom.
the ball of the ankle joint, Lat. talus, Hdt., Theocr.

pl. ἀστράγαλοι, dice or agame played with dice, Il., Hdt.:—they were at first made of knuckle-bones, and never had more than four flat sides, whereas the κύβοι had six. They played with four: the best throw (βόλος), when each die came differently, was called Ἀφροδίτη, Lat. jactus Veneris; the worst, when all came alike, κύων, Lat. canis.

div1.head: ἀστραπή
div1.sense: a flash of lightning, lightning, Hdt., Attic; in pl. lightnings, Aesch., Soph.
any bright light, NTest.

div1.head: ἀστραπηφορέω
div1.sense: to carry lightnings, Ar.

div1.head: ἀστραπηφόρος
div1.sense: lightning-bearing, flashing, Eur.

div1.head: ἀστράπτω
div1.sense: to lighten, hurl lightnings, of omens sent by Zeus, Il., Ar.
impers., ἀστράπτει it lightens, ἤστραψε it lightened, Attic
to flash like lightning, Soph., Eur., etc.:—c. acc. cogn., ἐξ ὀμμάτων δʼ ἤστραπτε σέλας (sc. Τυφών) he flashed flame from his eyes, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀστρατεία
div1.sense: exemption from service, Ar.
a shunning of service, which at Athens was a heavy offence, φεύγειν γραφὴν ἀστρατείας to be accused of it, Ar.; ἀστρατείας ἁλῶναι, ὀφλεῖν to be convicted of it, Oratt.

div1.head: ἀστράτευτος
div1.sense: without service, never having seen service, Ar.

div1.head: ἄστρεπτος
div1.sense: = ἄστροφος Theocr.:—adv. -τεί, Anth.
unbending, inflexible, Anth.

div1.head: ἀστρογείτων
div1.sense: near the stars, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀστρόθετος
div1.sense: astronomical, Anth.

div1.head: ἀστρολογία
div1.sense: astronomy, Xen.

div1.head: ἀστρονομέω
div1.sense: to study astronomy, Ar.

div1.head: ἀστρονομία
div1.sense: astronomy, Ar., Plat., etc.

div1.head: ἀστρονομικός
div1.sense: skilled in astronomy, pertaining to astronomy, Plat.

div1.head: ἀστρονόμος
div1.sense: an astronomer, Plat., etc.

div1.head: ἄστρον
div1.sense: mostly in pl. the stars, Hom., Attic; in sg., mostly of Sirius, Xen., etc.; cf. ἀστήρ.

div1.head: ἄστροφος
div1.sense: without turning away, unturning, Lat. irretortus, ὄμματα Aesch.; ἀφέρπειν ἄστρ. to go away without turning back, Soph.

div1.head: ἀστρῷος
div1.sense: starry, Anth.; ἀστρ. ἀνάγκη the law of the stars, Anth.

div1.head: ἀστρωπός
div1.sense: = ἀστερ-ωπός, Eur.

div1.head: ἄστρωτος
div1.sense: without bed or bedding, Plat.: metaph. unsmoothed, rugged, Eur.

div1.head: ἀστυάναξ
div1.sense: lord of the city, epith. of certain gods, Aesch.: in Hom. only as prop. n.

div1.head: ἀστυβοώτης
div1.sense: crying through the city, of a herald, Il.

div1.head: ἀστυγείτων
div1.sense: near or bordering on a city, Hdt., Aesch.
as Subst. a neighbour to the city, a borderer, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: ἄστυδε
div1.sense: into, to, or towards the city, Hom.

div1.head: ἀστυδρομέομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to have the streets filled with fugitives, Aesch.

div1.head: ἄστυλος
div1.sense: without pillar or prop, Anth.

div1.head: ἀστύνικος
div1.sense: (sc. πόλις) Athens, the victorious city, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀστυνομέω
div1.sense: to be ἀστυ-νόμος, Dem.

div1.head: ἀστυνομία
div1.sense: the office of ἀστυνόμος, Arist.

div1.head: ἀστυνομικός
div1.sense: of or for an ἀστυνόμος or his office, Plat.

div1.head: ἀστυνόμος
div1.sense: protecting the city, θεοί Aesch.; ὀργαὶ ἀστ. the feelings of social life, Soph.
as Subst. a magistrate at Athens, who had the care of the police, streets, and public buildings, five for the city and five for Peiraeeus, Plat., etc.

div1.head: ἀστυόχος
div1.sense: protecting the city, Anth.

div1.head: ἄστυ
div1.sense: a city, town, Hom., etc.; Σούσων ἄ. the town of Susa, Aesch.; ἄ. Θήβης Soph.
the Athenians called Athens Ἄστυ, as the Romans called Rome Urbs, mostly without the Art. (as we speak of "being in town, " "going to town"), Ar.

div1.head: ἀστυφέλικτος
div1.sense: unshaken, undisturbed, Xen.

div1.head: ἀστύφελος
div1.sense: not rugged, Theogn., Anth.

div1.head: ἀσυγγνώμων
div1.sense: not pardoning, relentless, Dem.

div1.head: ἀσυγκέραστος
div1.sense: unmixed, Anth.

div1.head: ἀσυγκόμιστος
div1.sense: not gathered in, Xen.

div1.head: ἀσύγκριτος
div1.sense: not to be compared, unlike, Plut.

div1.head: ἀσυκοφάντητος
div1.sense: not plagued by informers, not calumniated, Aeschin., Luc.

div1.head: ἀσυλαῖος
div1.sense: of an asylum, Plut.

div1.head: ἀσύλητος
div1.sense: not inviolate, Eur.

div1.head: ἀσυλία
div1.sense: inviolability, of suppliants, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀσυλλόγιστος
div1.sense: not reasoning justly:— adv., -τως, ἀσυλλογίστως ἔχειν τινός to be unable to reason about a thing, Plut.

div1.head: ἄσυλος
div1.sense: safe from violence, inviolate, of persons seeking protection, Eur.:—c. gen., γάμων ἄσυλος safe from marriage, Eur.
of places, γῆν ἄσυλον παρασχεῖν to make the land a refuge, Eur.

div1.head: ἀσύμβατος
div1.sense: not coming to terms, Thuc.:—adv., -τως ἔχειν to be irreconcilable, Plut.

div1.head: ἀσύμβλητος
div1.sense: not to be guessed, unintelligible, Soph.

div1.head: ἀσύμβολος
div1.sense: not paying oneʼs scot or share (συμβολαί), Lat. immunis, δειπνεῖν ἀσύμβολον Aeschin.

div1.head: ἀσυμμετρία
div1.sense: want of proportion or harmony, Plat.

div1.head: ἀσύμμετρος
div1.sense: having no common measure, τινι with a thing, Plat.; πρός τι Plut.
unsymmetrical, disproportionate, Xen.

div1.head: ἀσυμπαγής
div1.sense: not compact, Luc.

div1.head: ἀσυμπαθής
div1.sense: without sympathy with, τινι Plut.

div1.head: ἀσύμφορος
div1.sense: inconvenient, inexpedient, useless, Hes.: c. dat. inexpedient for, prejudicial to, Eur., Thuc.; also ἔς or πρός τι Thuc.:— adv. -ρως, Xen.

div1.head: ἀσύμφωνος
div1.sense: not agreeing in sound, Plat.:—metaph. discordant, at variance, τινι with another, Plat.; πρός τινα NTest.

div1.head: ἀσύμψηφος
div1.sense: not agreeing with, τινος Plut.

div1.head: ἀσύνδετος
div1.sense: unconnected, Xen.

div1.head: ἀσύνδηλος
div1.sense: not manifest, Plut.

div1.head: ἀσυνεσία
div1.sense: want of understanding, stupidity, Eur., Thuc.

div1.head: ἀσύνετος
div1.sense: void of understanding, stupid, Hdt., Attic; not to be understood, unintelligible, Eur.

div1.head: ἀσυνήθεια
div1.sense: want of experience in a thing, c. gen., Arist.

div1.head: ἀσυνήθης
div1.sense: unaccustomed, inexperienced, unacquainted, with others, Arist.

div1.head: ἀσύνθετος
div1.sense: uncompounded, Plat.
(συντίθεμαι) bound by no covenant, faithless, Dem., NTest.

div1.head: ἀσύνοπτος
div1.sense: not easily perceived, Aeschin.

div1.head: ἀσύντακτος
div1.sense: not ranged together; of soldiers, not in battle-order, Xen.
undisciplined, disorderly, Thuc., Xen.
not combined in society, Xen.
not put on the tax-roll, free from public burdens, Dem.

div1.head: ἀσύντονος
div1.sense: not strained, slack:— adv. -νως, lazily, Sup. -ώτατα, Xen.

div1.head: ἀσυσκεύαστος
div1.sense: not arranged, not ready, Xen.

div1.head: ἀσύστατος
div1.sense: having no cohesion or consistency, Plat.
metaph. incoherent, irregular, Lat. dispar sibi, Ar.; ἀξ. ἄλγος fitful, ever-recurring pain, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀσύφηλος
div1.sense: insolent, degrading, Il.

div1.head: ἀσφάδαστος
div1.sense: without convulsion or struggle, of one dying, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: ἄσφακτος
div1.sense: unslaughtered, Eur.

div1.head: ἀσφάλαξ
div1.sense: a mole, Babr.

div1.head: ἀσφάλεια
div1.sense: security against stumbling or falling, ἀσφ. πρὸς τὸν πηλόν Thuc.: stability, Soph.
assurance from danger, personal safety, security, Hdt., Thuc., etc.; ἀσφ. διδόναι, παρέχειν Xen.
assurance, certainty, ἀσφ. μὴ ἂν ἐλθεῖν αὐτούς certainty that they would not come, Thuc.; ἀσφάλεια λόγου the certainty of an argument, Xen., NTest.

div1.head: ἀσφάλειος
div1.sense: of Poseidon, the securer, Ar.

div1.head: ἀσφαλής
div1.sense: not liable to fall, immoveable, steadfast, firm, θεῶν ἕδος Od., etc.
of friends and the like, unfailing, trusty, Soph., etc.: c. inf., φρονεῖν γὰρ οἱ ταχεῖς οὐκ ἀσφαλεῖς the hasty in council are not safe, Soph.: so of things, sure, certain, Thuc., etc.
assured from danger, safe, secure, Soph., etc.; ἐν ἀσφαλεῖ in safety, Thuc.; τὸ ἀσφαλές ἀσφάλεια, Thuc.; ἀσφαλές ἐστι, c. inf., it is safe to . . , Ar.
ἀσφ. ῥήτωρ a convincing speaker, Ar.

Epic adv. ἀσφαλέως ἔχειν or μένειν to be, remain fast, firm, steady, Hom.; so neut. ἀσφαλές as adv., Hom.; ἀσφ. ἀγορεύει without faltering, Od.; ἔμπεδον ἀσφαλέως without fail for ever, Hom.; still further strengthd., ἔμπεδον ἀσφαλὲς ἀεί Il.
Attic adv. ἀσφαλῶς in all senses of the adj., in safety, with certainty, Soph.:—comp. -έστερον, Hdt., Plat.; Sup. -έστατα, Plat.

div1.head: ἀσφαλίζω
div1.sense: to make safe, secure, NTest.

div1.head: ἄσφαλτος
div1.sense: asphalt, bitumen, forming in lumps, (θρόμβοι) on the surface of the river Is near Babylon and at Ardericca near Susa, Hdt.
div1.etym: Seems to be a foreign word.

div1.head: ἀσφαραγέω
div1.sense: to resound, clang, of armed men, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀσφάραγος
div1.sense: the throat, gullet, Il.

div1.head: ἀσφάραγος2
div1.sense: asparagus, Anth.

div1.head: ἀσφοδέλινος
div1.sense: of asphodel, Luc.

div1.head: ἀσφόδελος
div1.sense: ἀσφόδελος as noun, asphodel, kingʼs-spear, a plant of the lily kind, Hes., Theocr.
oxyt., as adj., ἀσφοδελὸς λειμών the asphodel mead, which the shades of heroes haunted, Od.

div1.head: ἄσφυκτος
div1.sense: without pulse, lifeless, Anth.

div1.head: ἀσχαλάω
div1.sense: to be distressed, grieved, Hom.: to be vexed at a thing, c. gen., Od.

div1.head: ἀσχάλλω
div1.sense: to be vexed at a thing, Aesch., Eur.; τι Eur.

div1.head: ἄσχετος
div1.sense: not to beheld in or checked, irrepressible, ungovernable, Hom.

div1.head: ἀσχημάτιστος
div1.sense: without form or figure, Plat.

div1.head: ἀσχημονέω
div1.sense: to behave unseemly, disgrace oneself, to be put to shame, Eur., Plat.

div1.head: ἀσχημοσύνη
div1.sense: want of form, ungracefulness, Plat.: in moral sense, indecorum, Plat.

div1.head: ἀσχήμων
div1.sense: misshapen, unseemly, shameful, Lat. turpis, Eur.
of persons, ἀσχ. γενέσθαι to be indecorous, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀσχολέω
div1.sense: to engage, occupy, τινά Luc.

div1.head: ἀσχολία
div1.sense: an occupation, business, want of leisure, Thuc.; ἀσχ. ἔχειν φιλοσοφίας πέρι to have no leisure for pursuing it, Plat.; ἀσχ. ἄγειν to be engaged or occupied, Plat.; ἀσχ. παρέχειν τινί to cause one trouble, Plat.

div1.head: ἄσχολος
div1.sense: of persons, without leisure, engaged, occupied, busy, Plat., Dem.; ἄσχ. ἔς τι with no leisure for a thing, Hdt.; ἄσχ. περί τι busy about . ., Plut.:—adv., ἀσχόλως ἔχειν to be busy, Eur.
of actions, allowing no leisure, Eur.

div1.head: ἄσχυ
div1.sense: the inspissated juice of a Scythian tree, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀσώματος
div1.sense: unembodied, incorporeal, Plat.

div1.head: ἀσωτεύω
div1.sense: Mostly dep., to lead a profligate, wasteful life, Arist.

div1.head: ἀσωτία
div1.sense: prodigality, wastefulness, Plat.

div1.head: ἄσωτος
div1.sense: having no hope of safety, abandoned, profligate, Lat. perditus, Soph., Arist.
act., ἄσωτος γένει bringing ruin on the race, fatal to it, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀτακτέω
div1.sense: of a soldier, to be undisciplined, disorderly, Xen., Dem.
generally, to lead a disorderly life, Xen.

div1.head: ἄτακτος
div1.sense: not in battle-order, of troops, Hdt., Thuc., etc.
undisciplined, disorderly, irregular, lawless, Thuc., etc.
adv. -τως, in an irregular, disorderly manner, of troops, Thuc.: comp. ἀτακτότερον, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀταλαίπωρος
div1.sense: without pains or patience, indifferent, careless, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀτάλαντος
div1.sense: equal in weight, equivalent, or equal to, τινι Hom.

div1.head: ἀταλάφρων
div1.sense: tender-minded, of a child, Il.

div1.head: ἀτάλλω
div1.sense: to skip in childish glee, gambol, Il.
. Act. to bring up a child, rear, foster, like ἀτιτάλλω, Soph.:—Pass. to grow up, wax, Hhymn.; the Act. is so used by Hes.

div1.head: ἀταλός
div1.sense: tender, delicate, of young creatures, Hom.; ἀταλὰ φρονέοντες of young, gay spirit, Il.

div1.head: ἀταλόψυχος
div1.sense: soft-hearted, Anth.

div1.head: ἀταξία
div1.sense: want of discipline, disorderliness, properly among soldiers, Hdt., Thuc., etc.
generally disorder, irregularity, Plat., etc.

div1.head: ἀτάομαι
div1.sense: to suffer greatly, be in dire distress, ἀτώμενος Soph., Eur.

div1.head: ἀτάρακτος
div1.sense: not disturbed, without confusion, steady, of soldiers, Xen.

div1.head: ἀταρβής
div1.sense: unfearing, fearless, Il.; ἀτ. τῆς θέας having no fear about the sight, Soph.
causing no fear, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀτάρβητος
div1.sense: fearless, undaunted, Soph.

div1.head: ἀτάρμυκτος
div1.sense: unwincing, unflinching, Pind.

div1.head: ἀτάρ
div1.sense: but, yet, Lat. at, to introduce an objection or correction, Il., Attic; it always begins a sentence or clause, but is placed after the voc., Ἕκτορ, ἀτάρ που ἔφης still thou didst say, Il.:— ἀτάρ sometimes answers to μέν, more emphatic than δέ, Hom., Attic
in Attic to mark a rapid transition to another thought, Aesch., etc.; so ἀτὰρ δή Eur.

div1.head: ἀταρτηρός
div1.sense: mischievous, baneful, Hom.

div1.head: ἀτασθαλία
div1.sense: presumptuous sin, recklessness, arrogance, Hom. always in pl.; in sg., Hes., Hdt.

div1.head: ἀτασθάλλω
div1.sense: acting presumptuously, in arrogance, Od.

div1.head: ἀτάσθαλος
div1.etym: ἄτη, though α does not agree in quantity
div1.sense: presumptuous, reckless, arrogant, Hom., Hdt.

div1.head: ἀταύρωτος
div1.sense: unwedded, virgin, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀταφία
div1.sense: want of burial, Luc.

div1.head: ἄταφος
div1.sense: unburied, Hdt., Attic

div1.head: ἄτεγκτος
div1.sense: not to be wetted: metaph. not to be softened, relentless, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: ἀτειρής
div1.sense: not to be worn away, indestructible, of iron, Hom.: metaph. stubborn, unyielding, Il.

div1.head: ἀτείχιστος
div1.sense: unwalled, unfortified, Thuc.
not walled in, not blockaded, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀτέκμαρτος
div1.sense: not to be guessed, obscure, baffling, Hdt., Thuc.:—adv., ἀτεκμάρτως ἔχειν to be in the dark about a thing, Xen.
of persons, uncertain, inconsistent, Ar.

div1.head: ἀτεκνία
div1.sense: childlessness, Arist.

div1.head: ἄτεκνος
div1.sense: without children, childless, Hes., Trag.
in causal sense, destroying children, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀτεκνόω
div1.sense: to make childless:— Pass. to be deprived of children, Anth.

div1.head: ἀτέλεια
div1.sense: exemption from public burdens (τέλη), Lat. immunitas, granted to those who deserved well of the state, Attic; c. gen., ἀτ. στρατηΐης exemption from service, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀτέλεστος
div1.sense: without end or issue, to no purpose, without effect, unaccomplished, Hom.
uninitiated in mysteries, c. gen., Eur.; absol., Plat.

div1.head: ἀτελεύτητος
div1.sense: not brought to an end or issue, unaccomplished, Il.
of a person, impracticable, Soph.

div1.head: ἀτέλευτος
div1.sense: endless, eternal, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀτελής
div1.sense: without end, i. e.,
not brought to an end or issue, unaccomplished, Od., Xen.:— incomplete, Soph., Thuc., Plat.
act. not bringing to an end, not accomplishing oneʼs purpose, Pind., Plat., etc.
(τέλος iv) at Athens, free from tax or tribute, scot-free, Lat. immunis, absol., or c. gen., ἀτ. τῶν ἄλλων free from all other taxes, Hdt., Attic
of sums, without deduction, nett, clear, ὀβολὸς ἀτ. an obol clear gain, Xen., Dem.
(τέλος v) uninitiated in mysteries, c. gen., Hhymn.

div1.head: ἀτέμβω
div1.sense: to maltreat, to afflict, perplex, Od.: Pass., c. gen., to be bereft or cheated of a thing, Hom.

div1.head: ἀτενής
div1.sense: strained tight, clinging, of ivy, Soph.: metaph.
of menʼs minds and speech, intent, earnest, Hes., Plat.; also stiff, stubborn, inexorable, Aesch., Ar.:—adv. ἀτενῶς earnestly, ἀτ. ἔχειν πρός τι Plut.

div1.head: ἀτενίζω
div1.sense: to look intently, gaze earnestly, εἴς τι Arist.; τινί upon one, NTest.

div1.head: ἅτε
div1.sense: properly acc. pl. neut. of ὅστε, used as Adv., just as, so as, Il., Hdt., Soph.

in causal sense, inasmuch as, seeing that, Lat. quippe, with part., ἅτε ἔχων Hdt., Thuc., etc.; with gen. absol., ἅτε τῶν ὁδῶν φυλασσομένων quippe viae custodirentur, Hdt.; with the part. omitted, δίκτυα δοὺς αὐτῶι, ἅτε θηρευτῆι ὄντι Hdt.

div1.head: ἀτέραμνος
div1.sense: unsoftened: metaph. stubborn, unfeeling, merciless, Od., Aesch.

div1.head: ἀτέρμων
div1.sense: without bounds; ἀτ. πέπλος having no end or issue, inextricable, Aesch.; ἀτέρμονες αὐγαί the countless rays of the mirror, Eur.

div1.head: ἅτερος
div1.sense: Dor for ἕτερος, Ar.
ἅτερος [ᾱ], Attic crasis for ὁ ἕτερος, neut. θἄτερον [ᾱ], gen. θἀτέρου, etc.

div1.head: ἄτερ
div1.sense: without, Hom.; ἄτερ Ζηνός without his will, Il.
aloof or apart from, Il., Trag.

div1.head: ἀτερπής
div1.sense: unpleasing, joyless, melancholy, Hom., Aesch.; ἀτερπέστερον εἰς ἀκρόασιν less attractive to the ear, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀτερψία
div1.sense: unpleasantness, Luc.

div1.head: ἀτευκτέω
div1.sense: to fail in gaining a thing, c. gen., Babr.

div1.head: ἄτευκτος
div1.sense: not gaining.

div1.head: ἀτευχής
div1.sense: unequipped, unarmed, Eur., Anth.

div1.head: ἀτεχνία
div1.sense: want of art or skill, unskilfulness, Plat.

div1.head: ἄτεχνος
div1.sense: without art, ignorant of the rules of art, unskilled, empirical, Plat.

div1.head: ἀτεχνῶς
div1.sense: adv. of ἀτεχνής, simply, i. e. really, absolutely, Lat. plane, omnino, Ar., Plat., etc.; καλὸν ἀτ. simply beautiful, Ar.:—in comparisons, ἀτεχνῶς ὥσπερ just as, Plat.:—with negat., just not, Ar.; ἀτεχνῶς οὐδείς simply no one, Ar.

div1.head: ἀτέχνως
div1.sense: without rules of art, empirically, Xen., Plat.

div1.head: ἀτέω
div1.sense: in part. ἀτέων, fool-hardy, reckless, Il., Hdt.

div1.head: ἄτηκτος
div1.sense: not melted or to be melted, Plat.

div1.head: ἀτημελής
div1.sense: neglected, Plut.
careless:— adv., ἀτημελῶς ἔχειν Plut.

div1.head: ἀτημέλητος
div1.sense: unheeded, uncared for, Xen.
baffled, disappointed, Aesch.
taking no heed, slovenly, Alciphro:—adv., ἀτημελήτως ἔχειν to take no heed of a thing, c. gen., Xen.

div1.head: ἄτη
div1.sense: bewilderment, infatuation, reckless impulse, caused by judicial blindness sent by the gods, Hom.:—hence Ἄτη is personified as the goddess of mischief or reckless conduct, Ἄτη, ἣ πάντας ἀᾶται Il.: the Λιταί come slowly after her, undoing the evil she has worked, Il.
as a consequence,
reckless guilt or sin, as that of Paris, Il.
bane, ruin, Hom., Trag.:—of persons, a bane, pest, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: ἀτηρός
div1.sense: blinded by ἄτη, hurried to ruin, Theogn.
baneful, ruinous, mischievous, Aesch., Soph.: τὸ ἀτηρόν bane, ruin, Aesch.; ἀτηρότατον κακόν Ar.

div1.head: Ἀτθίς
div1.sense: Attic:— as Subst. (sub. γῆ), Attica, Eur.

div1.head: ἀτίετος
div1.sense: unhonoured, Aesch.
act. not honouring or regarding, τινος Eur.

div1.head: ἀτίζω
div1.sense: not to honour, to hold in no honour, θεούς Aesch. : absol. in part., ἀτίζων, unheeding, Il.

div1.head: ἀτιθάσευτος
div1.sense: untamable, wild, Plut.

div1.head: ἀτιμαγελέω
div1.sense: to forsake the herd, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀτιμαγέλης
div1.sense: despising the herd, i.e. straying, feeding alone, Theocr., Anth.

div1.head: ἀτιμάζω
div1.sense: to hold in no honour, to esteem lightly, dishonour, slight, c. acc., Hom., Attic: so in Mid., Soph.:—c. acc. cogn., ἔπη ἀτιμάζεις πόλιν thou speakest words in dishonour of the city, Soph.:—Pass. to suffer dishonour, Hdt., Attic

c. gen. rei, ἀτ. λόγου to treat as unworthy of speech, Aesch.; ἀτ. ὧν ἀτ. τούτων ἅ, Soph.:—also, μή μʼ ἀτιμάσηις τὸ μὴ οὐ θανεῖν deem me not unworthy to die, Aesch.; οὐκ ἀτιμάσω προσειπεῖν will not disdain to . . , Eur.
= ἀτιμόω in legal sense, to deprive of civil rights, Xen.

div1.head: ἀτιμαστέος
div1.sense: to be despised, Plat.

div1.head: ἀτιμαστήρ
div1.sense: a dishonourer, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀτιμάω
div1.sense: to dishonour, treat lightly, Hom.

div1.head: ἀτίμητος
div1.sense: unhonoured, despised, Il.
(τῑμή II) not valued or estimated, δίκη ἀτ. a cause in which the penalty is not assessed in court, but fixed by law beforehand, Dem.

div1.head: ἀτιμία
div1.sense: dishonour, disgrace, Od., Soph., etc.; ἐν ἀτιμίηι τινὰ ἔχειν, ἀτιμίην προστιθέναι τινί Hdt.; ἀτ. τινός dishonour done to one, Eur.
at Athens, the loss of civil rights, Lat. deminutio capitis, Aesch., Oratt.
ἐσθημάτων ἀτ., i. e. ragged garments, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀτιμοπενθής
div1.sense: sorrowing for dishonour incurred, Aesch.

div1.head: ἄτιμος
div1.sense: unhonoured, dishonoured, Il., Trag.; comp. ἀτιμότερος less honourable, Xen.; c. gen. without the honour of . . , not deemed worthy of . . , Aesch.; also, χάρις οὐκ ἄτιμος πόνων no unworthy return for . . , Aesch.

at Athens, deprived of privileges, Lat. capite deminutus, opp. to ἐπίτιμος, Ar., etc.; also c. gen., ἄτ. γερῶν deprived of privileges, Thuc.; ἄτ. τοῦ συμβουλεύειν deprived of the right of advising, Dem.
(τιμή II) without price or value, οἶκον ἄτιμον ἔδεις thou devourest his substance without payment made, Od.
unrevenged, Aesch.
adv. -μως, dishonourably, ignominiously, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: ἀτιμόω
div1.sense: to dishonour, Aesch.:— Pass. to suffer dishonour or indignity, Hdt., Aesch., Eur.
at Athens, to punish with ἀτιμία (2), Lat. aerarium facere, Ar., Oratt.

div1.head: ἀτιμώρητος
div1.sense: unavenged, i. e.,
unpunished, ἀτ. γίγνεσθαι to escape punishment, Hdt., Thuc.:— adv. -τως, with impunity, Plat.
for which no revenge has been taken, ἀτιμώρητον ἐᾶν θάνατον Aeschin.
undefended, unprotected, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀτίμωσις
div1.sense: a dishonouring, dishonour done to, c. gen., τραπέζας, πατρός Aesch.

div1.head: ἀτιτάλλω
div1.sense: redupl. form of ἀτάλλω, to rear up a child, foster, cherish, tend, Hom.; of horses, Pass., χῆνʼ ἀτιταλλομένην ἐνὶ οἴκωι Od.

div1.head: ἀτίτης
div1.sense: unpunished, Aesch.
(τίω) unhonoured, Aesch.

div1.head: ἄτιτος
div1.sense: unhonoured, unavenged, Il.
unpaid, Il. [where ῑ].

div1.head: Ἀτλαγενής
div1.sense: sprung from Atlas, of the Pleiads, Hes.

div1.head: Ἀτλαντικός
div1.sense: of Atlas, Atlantic, τέρμονες Ἀτλ. the pillars of Hercules, Eur.

div1.head: Ἀτλαντίς
div1.sense: θάλασσα ἡ Ἀ. καλουμένη, the Atlantic ocean, Hdt.

div1.head: Ἄτλας
div1.sense: Atlas, one of the elder gods, who bore up the pillars of heaven, Od.:—later, one of the Titans, Hes., Aesch.
in hist. writers, Mount Atlas in Africa, regarded as the pillar of heaven, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀτλητέω
div1.sense: to be unable to bear a thing, to be impatient, Soph.

div1.head: ἄτλητος
div1.sense: not to be borne, insufferable, Il., Orac. ap. Hdt., Soph.
not to be dared, ἄτλητα τλᾶσα Aesch.
act. incapable of bearing a thing, c. gen., Anth.

div1.head: ἀτμενία
div1.sense: slavery, servitude, Anth.

div1.head: ἀτμήν
div1.sense: a slave, servant.

div1.head: ἄτμητος
div1.sense: not cut up, unravaged, Thuc., Plut.: of mines, not yet opened, Xen.
undivided, indivisible, Plat.

div1.head: ἀτμίζω
div1.sense: to smoke, Soph.: of water, to steam, Xen.

div1.head: ἀτμός
div1.sense: steam, vapour, Aesch.

div1.head: ἄτοιχος
div1.sense: unwalled, Eur.

div1.head: ἄτοκος
div1.sense: having never yet brought forth, never having had a child, Hdt., Eur.
not bearing interest, Plat.

div1.head: ἀτόλμητος
div1.sense: not to be endured, insufferable, Pind.: of wicked men, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀτολμία
div1.sense: want of daring, cowardice, backwardness, Thuc., Dem.

div1.head: ἄτολμος
div1.sense: daring nothing, wanting courage, spiritless, cowardly, Ar., Thuc.:—of women, unenterprising, retiring, Aesch.:—c. inf. not having the heart to do a thing, Aesch.

div1.head: ἄτομος
div1.sense: uncut, unmown, Soph.
that cannot be cut, indivisible, Plat.; ἐν ἀτόμωι in a moment, NTest.

div1.head: ἀτονέω
div1.sense: to be relaxed, exhausted, Plut.

div1.head: ἄτονος
div1.sense: not stretched, relaxed, Arist.

div1.head: ἄτοξος
div1.sense: without bow or arrow, Luc.

div1.head: ἀτοπία
div1.sense: a being out of the way, and so:
extraordinary nature of a thing, Thuc.
strangeness, oddness, eccentricity, Ar., Plat.

div1.head: ἄτοπος
div1.sense: out of place, and so,
strange, unwonted, extraordinary, Eur., etc.
strange, odd, eccentric, δοῦλοι τῶν ἀεὶ ἀτόπων slaves to every new paradox, Thuc.; τῶν ἀτοπωτάτων ἂν εἴη Dem.
unnatural, disgusting, foul, πνεῦμα Thuc.
adv. —πως, marvellously or absurdly, Thuc., Plat.

div1.head: ἀτραγῴδητος
div1.sense: not treated tragically, Luc.

div1.head: ἄτρακτος
div1.sense: a spindle, Hdt., Ar., etc.
an arrow, Soph.; cf. ἠλακάτη.

div1.head: ἀτρακτυλίς
div1.sense: a thistle-like plant, used for making spindles, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀτραπός
div1.sense: properly a path with no turnings, generally a path-way, road, Hom., Hdt., Thuc., etc.

div1.head: ἀτράφαξυς
div1.sense: the herb orach.

div1.head: ἀτράχηλος
div1.sense: without neck, Anth.

div1.head: ἀτρέκεια
div1.sense: reality, strict truth, certainty, Hdt.
personified Ἀτρέκεια, severity, Pind.

div1.head: ἀτρεκής
div1.sense: real, genuine, Il.
strict, precise, exact, ἀριθμός Hdt.:— τὸ ἀτρεκές ἀτρέκεια, Hdt.; τὸ ἀτρεκέστερον greater exactness, Hdt.; τὸ ἀτρεκέστατον Hdt.
sure, certain, Eur.
used by Hom. mostly in adv. ἀτρεκέως, with ἀγορεύειν, καταλέξαι, to tell truly, exactly; so also Hdt.
also neut. as adv., δεκὰς ἀτρεκές just ten of them, Od.; so, τὸ ἀτρεκές Theogn.

div1.head: ἀτρέμα
div1.etym: ἀτρέμα used by Poets before a conson., ἀτρέμας before vowels. Il.
div1.sense: without trembling, without motion, Hom.; ἀτρέμας εὕδειν Hom.; ἀτρέμας ἧσο sit still, Il.; ἀτρέμας ἔχειν to keep quiet, Hdt.; ἀτρ. ἅπτεσθαί τινος gently, softly, Eur.; ἀτρ. πορεύεσθαι to go softly, Xen.

div1.head: ἀτρεμέω
div1.sense: not to tremble, to keep still or quiet, Hes.; οὐδαμᾶ κω ἠτρεμήσαμεν, of a restless people, Hdt. From

div1.head: ἀτρεμής
div1.sense: not trembling, unmoved, Plat., Xen. adv. ἀτρεμέως Theogn.

div1.head: ἀτρεμία
div1.sense: a keeping still, ἀτρεμίαν ἔχειν or ἄγειν Xen.

div1.head: ἀτρεμίζω
div1.sense: to keep quiet, Theogn., Hdt.; οὐκ ἀτρ. to be restless, Hdt.

div1.head: ἄτρεπτος
div1.sense: unmoved, immutable, Plut., Luc.

div1.head: ἄτρεστος
div1.sense: not trembling, unfearing, fearless, Lat. intrepidus, Trag.: c. gen., ἄτρ. μάχας fearless of fight, Aesch.; so, ἄτρ. ἐν μάχαις Soph.; ἄτρ. εὕδειν securely, Soph.:—also neut. pl. ἄτρεστα as adv., Eur.

div1.head: ἀτρίακτος
div1.sense: unconquered, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀτριβής
div1.sense: not rubbed: of places, not traversed, pathless, Thuc.: of roads, not worn or used, Xen.: generally, fresh, new, Lat. integer, Xen.

div1.head: ἄτριπτος
