div1.sense: of hands, not worn by work, Od.; of corn, not threshed, Xen.; ἄτρ. ἄκανθαι thorns on which one cannot tread, or untraversed thorns, Theocr.

div1.head: ἄτρομος
div1.sense: intrepid, dauntless, Il.

div1.head: ἀτροπία
div1.sense: inflexibility, Theogn.

div1.head: ἄτροπος
div1.sense: unchangeable, eternal, Theocr.
inflexible, unbending, Anth.:—hence Ἄτροπος, ἡ, name of one of the Μοῖραι or Parcae, Hes.; v. Κλωθώ.

div1.head: ἀτροφέω
div1.sense: to pine away, suffer from atrophy, Plut.

div1.head: ἄτροφος
div1.sense: not fed, ill-fed, Xen.

div1.head: ἀτρύγετος
div1.sense: yielding no harvest, unfruitful, of the sea, Hom.; of the air, Hom.

div1.head: ἀτρύμων
div1.sense: c. gen., ἀτρ. κακῶν not worn out by ills, Aesch.

div1.head: ἄτρυτος
div1.sense: not worn away, untiring, unwearied, Aesch.: indefatigable, Plut.
of things, unabating, Soph., Mosch.; of a road, wearisome, Theocr.

div1.head: Ἀτρυτώνη
div1.sense: the unwearied, a name of Pallas, Hom.
div1.etym: Lengthd. form of ἀτρύτη, as Ἀϊδωνεύς of Ἅιδης.

div1.head: ἄτρωτος
div1.sense: unwounded, Aesch., Soph.
invulnerable, Eur.

div1.head: ἀτταγᾶς
div1.sense: a bird, prob. a kind of partridge; or, as others think, the godwit or redshank, Ar.

div1.head: ἀτταγήν
div1.sense: a bird, prob. a kind of grouse, attagen Ionicus, Hor.

div1.head: ἄττα
div1.sense: a salutation used to elders, father, Hom.

div1.head: ἀτταταῖ
div1.sense: a cry of pain or grief, Trag., Ar.

div1.head: ἀττέλαβος
div1.sense: a kind of locust without wings, Hdt.

div1.head: Ἄττης
div1.sense: Ἄττης Ὑῆς, a form of exorcism, used by the priests of Cybele, Dem.

div1.head: Ἀττικίζω
div1.sense: to side with the Athenians, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: Ἀττικισμός
div1.sense: a siding with Athens, attachment to her, Thuc.

div1.head: Ἀττικιστί
div1.sense: in the Attic dialect, Dem.

div1.head: Ἀττικίων
div1.sense: my little Athenian, Ar.

div1.head: Ἀττικός
div1.sense: Attic, Athenian, Solon, etc.; ἡ Ἀττική (sc. γῆ), Attica, Hdt., etc.; cf. Ἀτθίς.
Adv. -κῶς in Attic style, Dem.

div1.head: Ἀττικωνικός
div1.sense: a comic alteration of Ἀττικός, after the form of Λακονικός, Ar.

div1.head: ἀτύζομαι
div1.sense: Pass. : to be distraught from fear, amazed, bewildered, Hom.; ἀτυζόμενοι πεδίοιο fleeing bewildered oʼer the plain, Il.: also to be distraught with grief, ἀτυζόμενος Soph., Eur.: c. acc., ὄψιν ἀτυχθείς amazed at the sight, Il.
in late Ep. we find the Act. ἀτύζω, with 3 sing. aor. 1 opt. ἀτύξαι, to strike with terror, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀτύμβευτος
div1.sense: without burial, Anth.

div1.head: ἄτυμβος
div1.sense: without a tomb, Luc.

div1.head: ἀτυράννευτος
div1.sense: not ruled by tyrants, Thuc.

div1.head: ἄτυφος
div1.sense: without pride or arrogance, modest, Plat.

div1.head: ἀτυχέω
div1.sense: to be unlucky or unfortunate, fail, miscarry, Hdt., Thuc., etc.
c. gen., to fail of a thing, fail in getting or gaining it, τῆς ἀληθείας Xen.; so, c. part., Thuc.
ἀτ. πρός τινα to fail with another, i. e. to fail in oneʼs request, Xen.:—Pass., τὰ ἀτυχηθέντα mischances, failures, Dem.

div1.head: ἀτύχημα
div1.sense: a misfortune, mishap, Oratt.

div1.head: ἀτυχής
div1.sense: luckless, unfortunate, Dem., etc.

div1.head: ἀτυχία
div1.sense: ill-luck:—a misfortune, miscarriage, mishap, Xen.

div1.head: αὖ
div1.sense: again, anew, afresh, once more, Hom., etc.; after numerals, δεύτερον αὖ, τρίτον αὖ, etc., Hom.
generally, again, i. e. further, moreover, besides, Lat. porro, Od., Attic
in turn, on the other hand, following δέ, Il., Attic.
the pleon. phrases, πάλιν αὖ, αὖ πάλιν, ἔμπαλιν αὖ, αὖθις αὖ, αὖθις αὖ πάλιν, are only Attic, mostly Trag.

div1.head: αὖ
div1.sense: αὖ αὖ, bow wow, of a dog, Ar.

div1.head: αὐαίνω
div1.sense: to dry Od., Hdt., Xen.
to dry or parch up, αὐανῶ βίον I shall waste life away, Soph.: Pass., αὐανθείς withered, Aesch.; so in fut. mid., αὐανοῦμαι I shall wither away, Soph.

div1.head: αὐαλέος
div1.sense: dry, parched, Hes.; of eyes, dry, sleepless, Anth.

div1.head: αὐγάζω
div1.sense: to view in the clearest light, see distinctly, discern, Soph.; so in Mid., Il., Hes.
of the sun, to beam upon, illumine, τινά Eur.

div1.head: αὐγή
div1.sense: the light of the sun, sunlight, and in pl. his rays or beams, Hom.; ὑπʼ αὐγὰς ἠελίοιο, i.e. still alive, Od.; so, αὐγὰς ἐσιδεῖν, λεύσσειν, βλέπειν Theogn., Aesch., Eur.; but, ὑπʼ αὐγὰς λεύσσειν or ἰδεῖν τι to hold up to the light and look at, Eur.; κλύζειν πρὸς αὐγάς to rise surging towards the sun, Aesch.:—metaph., βίου δύντος αὐγαί lifeʼs setting sun, " Aesch.:— αὐγή the dawn, day-break, NTest.
generally, any bright light, as of fire, Hom.; of lightning, Il.; of the eyes, Soph.; hence αὐγαί, like Lat. lumina, the eyes, Eur.
any gleam on the surface of bright objects, sheen, αὐγὴ χαλκείη Il.; αὐγὰ πέπλου Eur.

div1.head: αὐδάζομαι
div1.sense: to cry out, speak, Hdt.: an aor1 act. αὔδαξα occurs in Anth.

div1.head: αὐδάω
div1.sense: c. acc. rei,
to utter sounds, speak, Il., Eur.
c. acc. rei, to speak or say something, Il., Soph.: so as Dep., Soph.:—Pass., ηὐδᾶτο γὰρ ταῦτα so ʼtwas said, Soph.
of oracles, to utter, proclaim, tell of, Soph.; to speak out concerning a thing, Aesch.
c. acc. pers.,
to speak to, address, accost, Hom.: to invoke a god, Eur.
c. acc. et inf. to tell, bid, order one to do, Soph.; αὐδ. τινα μὴ ποιεῖν to forbid one to do, Aesch.; αὐδῶ σιωπᾶν Soph.: so as Dep., Soph.
to call by name, call so and so, Eur.: Pass., αὐδῶμαι παῖς Ἀχιλλέως Soph.; κάκιστʼ αὐδώμενος most ill reported of, Aesch.
like λέγειν, to mean such an one, Eur.

div1.head: αὐδήεις
div1.sense: speaking with human voice, Od.; when θεὸς αὐδήεσσα is applied to Calypso and Circe, it means a goddess who used the speech of mortals, Od.

div1.head: αὐδή
div1.sense: the human voice, speech, opp. to ὀμφή (a divine voice), Il.
the sound or twang of the bowstring, Od.; of a trumpet, Eur.; of the τέττιξ, Hes.
= φήμη, a report, account, Soph., Eur.
an oracle, Eur.

div1.head: αὐερύω
div1.sense: to draw back or backwards, Il.; to draw the bow, Il.: absol., in a sacrifice, to draw the victimʼs head back, so as to cut its throat, Il.
div1.etym: It can hardly be a compd. of αὖ ἐρύω, for αὖ is never elsewh. used in the local sense of back: perh. for ἀνερύω, i. e. ἀνϝερύω.

div1.head: αὐθάδεια
div1.sense: self-will, wilfulness, stubbornness, contumacy, presumption, Aesch., etc.

div1.head: αὐθάδης
div1.sense: self-willed, wilful, dogged, stubborn, contumacious, presumptuous, Hdt., etc.:— metaph. of things, remorseless, unfeeling, Aesch.:— adv. -δως, Ar.; comp. -έστερον, Plat.

div1.head: αὐθαδίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to be self-willed, Plat.

div1.head: αὐθάδισμα
div1.sense: an act of self-will, wilfulness, Aesch.

div1.head: αὐθαδόστομος
div1.sense: self-willed in speech, Ar.

div1.head: αὐθαίμων
div1.sense: of the same blood, a brother, sister, kinsman, Soph.; so αὔθαιμος, ον, Soph.

div1.head: αὐθαίρετος
div1.sense: self-chosen, self-elected, Xen.
by free choice, of oneself, Eur.: independent, Thuc.
of things taken upon oneself, self-incurred, voluntary, Soph., Thuc., etc.

div1.head: αὐθέκαστος
div1.sense: one who calls each thing by its name, Arist.

div1.head: αὐθεντέω
div1.sense: to have full power over, τινός NTest.

div1.head: αὐθέντης
div1.etym: The part -έντης is of uncertain deriv.
div1.sense: one who does anything with his own hand, an actual murderer, Hdt., Eur., etc.:—more loosely, one of a murdererʼs family, Eur.
an absolute master, autocrat, Eur.
as adj., αὐθέντης φόνος, αὐθένται θάνατοι murder by one of the same family, Aesch.

div1.head: αὐθήμερος
div1.sense: made or done on the very day, Aeschin.
adv. αὐθημερόν (oxyt.), on the very day, on the same day, immediately, Aesch., etc.; Ionic αὐτημερόν, Hdt.

div1.head: αὐθιγενής
div1.sense: born on the spot, born in the country, native, Lat. indigena, Hdt.; αὐτ. ποταμοί rivers that rise in the country, Hdt.; ὕδωρ αὐτ. a natural spring, Hdt.:— genuine, sincere, Eur.

div1.head: αὖθι
div1.sense: on the spot, here, there, Hom.; αὖθι ἔχειν to keep him there, as he is, Od.
of Time, forthwith, straightway, Il.

div1.head: αὖθις
div1.sense: a lengthd. form of αὖ:
of place back, back again, Il.; ἂψ αὖτις Il.; this sense rare in Attic
of Time, again, afresh, anew, Hom., Attic; strengthd., ὕστερον αὖτις, ἔτʼ αὖτις, πάλιν αὖτις Il., etc.; βοᾶν αὖθις to cry encore! Xen.
of future Time, again, hereafter, Il., Aesch.
of Sequence, moreover, in turn, on the other hand, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: αὐΐαχος
div1.sense: epith. of the Trojans in Il., either
(a_copul, ἰαχή) loud-shouting, noisy, or,
(from a_privat) noiseless, silent.

div1.head: αὐλακεργάτης
div1.sense: tracing furrows, Anth.

div1.head: αὖλαξ
div1.sense: a furrow made in ploughing, Lat. sulcus, Hom., etc.; αὔλακʼ ἐλαύνειν to draw a furrow, Hes.
metaph. of a wife as the bearer of children, Soph., Eur.
metaph. also, a furrow in the skin, a gash, wound, Aesch., Eur.
= ὄγμος, a swathe, Theocr. (Prob. from same Root as ὁλκός, Lat. sulcus, from ἕλκω.)

div1.head: αὔλειος
div1.sense: of or belonging to the αὐλή or court, ἐπʼ αὐλείηισι θύρηισι at the door of the court, i. e. the outer door, house- door, Od.; so in Hdt. and Attic

div1.head: αὐλέω
div1.sense: to play on the flute, Hdt., Plat., etc.; αὐλ. ἔξοδον to play a finale, Ar.
Pass., of tunes, to be played on the flute, Xen.; but, αὐλεῖται μέλαθρον is filled with music, Eur.
in Pass. also of persons, to be played to, hear music, Xen.

div1.head: αὔλημα
div1.sense: a piece of music for the flute, Ar., Plat.

div1.head: αὐλή
div1.etym: prob. from ἄημι (ἄϝημι) to blow, for the αὐλή was open to the air
div1.sense: in Hom. the court-yard, surrounded with out-buildings, and having the altar of Ζεὺς Ἑρκεῖος in the middle, so that it was at once the meeting-place of the family, and the cattle-yard, Il.: it had two doors, viz. the house-door (cf. αὔλειος), and another leading through the αἴθουσα into the πρόδομος, Od.
the wall of the court-yard, Il.

after Hom., the αὐλή was the court or quadrangle, round which the house itself was built, having a corridor (περιστύλιον), from which were doors leading into the menʼs apartments; opposite the house-door (cf. αὔλειος) was the μέσαυλος or μέταυλος (q.v.), leading into the womenʼs part of the house, Hdt., Attic
generally, any court or hall, Hom., Trag.

div1.head: αὔλησις
div1.sense: flute-playing, Plat.

div1.head: αὐλητής
div1.sense: a flute-player, Lat. tibicen, Theogn., Hdt., etc.

div1.head: αὐλητικός
div1.sense: of or for the flute, Plat.; ἡ -κή (sc. τέχνη) flute-playing, Plat.

div1.head: αὐλητρίς
div1.sense: a flute-girl, Lat. tibicina, Ar., Xen., etc.

div1.head: αὐλιάδες
div1.sense: Αὐλιάδες Νύμφαι Nymphs protecting cattlefolds, Anth.

div1.head: αὐλίζομαι
div1.sense: to lie in the court-yard, of cattle, Od.; to pass the night, lodge, Eur.; of soldiers, to bivouac, Hdt.

div1.head: αὔλιον
div1.sense: a country house, cottage, Hhymn.: a fold, stable, Eur., Xen.
a chamber, cave, grotto, Soph.

div1.head: αὔλιος
div1.sense: of or for farm-yards, rustic, Eur.

div1.head: αὐλίσκος
div1.sense: Dim. of αὐλός, a small reed, pipe, Theogn.

div1.head: αὖλις
div1.sense: a place for passing the night in, a tent, roosting-place, Hom., Eur.

div1.head: αὐλιστρίς
div1.sense: a house-mate, Theocr.

div1.head: αὐλοδόκη
div1.sense: a flute-case, Anth.

div1.head: αὐλοθετέω
div1.sense: to make flutes or pipes, Anth.

div1.head: αὐλοποιϊκή
div1.sense: sc. τέχνη, flute-making, Plat.

div1.head: αὐλοποιός
div1.sense: a flute-maker, Plat.

div1.head: αὐλός
div1.sense: a flute or rather clarionet (for it was played by a mouthpiece, γλωσσίς, Aeschin.), Il., etc.; αὐλοὶ ἀνδρήϊοι and γυναικήϊοι, Lat. tibiae dextrae and sinistrae, bass and treble, Hdt.; sometimes one person played two αὐλοί at once, Theocr.; αὐλὸς Ἐνυαλίου, i. e. a trumpet, Anth.:— ὑπʼ αὐλοῦ to the sound of the flute, Hdt.; so, πρὸς αὐλόν, ὑπὸ τὸν αὐλόν Xen.

any tube or pipe, as the socket of a spear-head, the groove into which the tongue of a buckle fitted, Hom.; the pipe of bellows, Thuc.:— αὐλὸς παχύς, in Od., seems to mean a jet of blood through the tube of the nostril.

div1.head: αὐλών
div1.sense: a hollow way, defile, glen, Hhymn., Hdt., Ar.
a canal, aqueduct, trench, Hdt.
a channel, strait, Aesch.; αὐλῶνες πόντιοι the sea straits, i. e. the Archipelago, Soph.

div1.head: αὐλῶπις
div1.sense: of a helmet, with a tube in front, to hold the λόφος, Il.

div1.head: αὐξάνω
div1.sense: to make large, increase, augment, Hdt., etc. (Hom. only uses ἀέξω).
to increase in power, strengthen, exalt, aggrandise, Hdt., Attic: also to promote to honour, glorify, magnify, Trag., Plat.
Pass. to grow, wax, increase, Hes., Hdt., etc.; αὐξ. ἐς πλῆθος, ἐς ὕψος Hdt.; of a child, to grow up, Hdt.; ηὐξανόμην I grew taller, Ar.; so with an adj., αὐξάνεσθαι μέγας to wax great, Eur. Hence

div1.head: αὔξη
div1.sense: = αὔξησις, Plat.

div1.head: Αὐξησία
div1.sense: the Goddess of growth, Hdt.

div1.head: αὔξησις
div1.sense: growth, increase, Thuc.; of crops, Hdt.

div1.head: αὔξιμος
div1.sense: promoting growth, Xen.

div1.head: αὐξοσέληνον
div1.sense: the waxing moon, Anth.

div1.head: αὐονή
div1.sense: dryness, withering, Aesch.

div1.head: αὖος
div1.sense: dry, of timber, Od.: dried, of fruit, Hdt.: withered, of leaves, Ar.:—neut. as adv., αὖον ἀϋτεῖν or αὔειν to ring dry and harsh, of metal, Il.
dried up, exhausted, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀϋπνία
div1.sense: sleeplessness, Plat.

div1.head: ἄϋπνος
div1.sense: sleepless, wakeful, of persons, Od., Attic: metaph. sleepless, never-resting, πηδάλια Aesch.; κρῆναι Soph.
of sleepless nights, Hom.
ὕπνος ἄϋπνος a sleep that is no sleep, from which one easily awakes, Soph.

div1.head: αὔρα
div1.sense: air in motion, a breeze, esp. a cool breeze, the fresh air of morning, Lat. aura, Od., Hdt., Attic Poets; rare in Prose:—metaph. steam, Ar.
metaph. also, of changeful events, Eur., Ar.; of anything thrilling, Eur.

div1.head: αὔριον
div1.sense: to-morrow, Lat. cras, Hom., etc.; ἐς αὔριον on the morrow or till morning, Hom.
as Subst., the morrow, Il.; in Attic, ἡ αὔριον (sc. ἡμέρα) the morrow, Eur.; ἡ αὔρ. ἡμέρα Xen.; ἡ ἐς αὔρ. ἡμέρα Soph.; ὁ αὔριον χρόνος Eur.

div1.head: αὐσταλέος
div1.sense: sunburnt, squalid, Lat. siccus, Od., Hes.

div1.head: αὐστηρός
div1.sense: making the tongue dry and rough, harsh, rough, bitter, Plat.:—metaph. austere, harsh, Plat., NTest.

div1.head: αὐστηρότης
div1.sense: harshness, roughness, οἴνου Xen.: metaph. austerity, harshness, Plat.

div1.head: αὐτάγγελος
div1.sense: carrying oneʼs own message, bringing news of what oneself has seen, Soph., Thuc.; c. gen. rei, λόγων αὐτ. Soph.

div1.head: αὐτάγρετος
div1.sense: self-chosen, left to oneʼs choice, Od., Hhymn.

div1.head: αὐτάδελφος
div1.sense: related as brother or sister, Aesch., Soph.
as Subst. oneʼs own brother or sister, Soph.

div1.head: αὔτανδρος
div1.sense: together with the men, men and all, Polyb.

div1.head: αὐτανέψιος
div1.sense: an own cousin, cousin-german, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: αὐτάρκεια
div1.sense: sufficiency in oneself, independence, Plat.

div1.head: αὐτάρκης
div1.sense: sufficient in oneself, having enough, independent of others, Hdt., Plat.; νηδὺς αὐτάρκης acting of itself, Aesch.; χώρα αὐτ. a country that supplies itself, independent of imports, Thuc.; αὐτ. πρός τι strong enough for a thing, Thuc., Xen.; c. inf. able of oneself to do a thing, Dem.; αὐτ. βοή a sufficient, vigorous shout, Soph.

div1.head: αὐτεξούσιος
div1.sense: in oneʼs own power; τὸ αὐτεξούσιον free power, Babr.

div1.head: αὐτεπάγγελτος
div1.sense: offering of oneself, of free will, Hdt., Eur., Thuc., etc.

div1.head: αὖτε
div1.etym: αὖ τε — where τε is otiose, as in ὅστε
div1.sense: again, Il.
to mark Sequence, again, furthermore, next, Il., Soph.
on the other hand, on the contrary, following μέν like δέ, Hom., Attic Poets.

div1.head: αὐτεπώνυμος
div1.sense: of the same surname with, τινος Eur.

div1.head: αὐτερέτης
div1.sense: one who rows himself, i. e. rower and soldier at once, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀϋτέω
div1.sense: to cry, shout, Il., Aesch.:—c. acc. cogn., βοὰν ἀϋτῶ Eur.; ἀϋτεῖ δʼ ὀξύ Aesch.
c. acc. pers. to call to, Il., Eur.:—c. acc. pers. et inf., Eur.

div1.head: αὐτήκοος
div1.sense: one who has himself heard, an ear-witness, Thuc., Plat.

div1.head: αὐτῆμαρ
div1.sense: = αὐθημερόν, on the self-same day, Il.

div1.head: ἀϋτή
div1.sense: a cry, shout, esp. battle-shout, war-cry, Hom.: generally a sound, Aesch.

div1.head: αὐτίκα
div1.sense: forthwith, straightway, at once, Hom., etc.; which notion is strengthened in αὐτίκα νῦν, μάλʼ αὐτίκα Od.; c. partic., αὐτίκʼ ἰόντι immediately on his going, Od.; so, αὐτίκα γενόμενος as soon as born, Hdt.; αὐτίκα καὶ μετέπειτα now and hereafter, Od.; so, τὸ αὐτίκα and τὸ μέλλον, Thuc.:—with a Subst., τὴν αὐτίχʼ ἡμέραν Soph.; ὁ αὐτίκα φόβος momentary fear, Thuc.
also in a slightly future sense, presently, Lat. mox, Soph., etc.
for example, to begin with, Ar., Plat., etc.; αὐτίκα δὴ μάλα Dem.

div1.head: ἀϋτμή
div1.sense: breath, Il.; ἀϋτμὴ Ἡφαίστοιο the fiery breath of Hephaestus, Il.; πυρὸς ἀϋτμή Od.; of bellows, Il.; of wind, Od.
odour, scent, fragrance, Hom.

div1.head: αὐτοάνθρωπος
div1.sense: the ideal man, the form of man, Arist.

div1.head: αὐτοβοεί
div1.sense: by a mere shout, at the first shout, αὐτ. ἑλεῖν to take without a blow, Thuc.

div1.head: αὐτόβουλος
div1.sense: self-willing, self-purposing, Aesch.

div1.head: αὐτογέννητος
div1.sense: self-produced: αὐτογέννητα κοιμήματα μητρός a motherʼs intercourse with her own child, Soph.

div1.head: αὐτογνωμονέω
div1.sense: to act of oneʼs own judgment, Xen. From

div1.head: αὐτογνώμων
div1.sense: on oneʼs own judgment, at oneʼs own discretion, Arist.: adv. -όνως, Plut.

div1.head: αὐτόγνωτος
div1.sense: self-determined, self-willed, Soph.

div1.head: αὐτόγυος
div1.sense: of a plough, having the share-beam of one piece with the pole, Hes.

div1.head: αὐτοδαής
div1.sense: self-taught, unpremeditated, Soph.

div1.head: αὐτοδάϊκτος
div1.sense: self-slain or mutually slain, Aesch.

div1.head: αὐτοδάξ
div1.sense: with the very teeth, ὁ αὐτοδὰξ τρόπος your ferocious temper, Ar.

div1.head: αὐτόδεκα
div1.sense: just ten, Thuc.

div1.head: αὐτόδηλος
div1.sense: self-evident, Aesch.

div1.head: αὐτοδίδακτος
div1.sense: self-taught, Od., Aesch.

div1.head: αὐτόδικος
div1.sense: with independent jurisdiction, with oneʼs own law-courts, Thuc.

div1.head: αὐτόδιον
div1.etym: It seems to be lengthd. from αὐτός, as μαψίδιος from μάψ, μινυνθάδιος from μίνυνθα.
div1.sense: straightway, Od.

div1.head: αὐτοέκαστος
div1.sense: το αὐτ. the ideal or form of each object, Arist.

div1.head: αὐτοέντης
div1.sense: a murderer, Soph.

div1.head: αὐτοετεί
div1.sense: in the same year, Theocr.

div1.head: αὐτοετής
div1.sense: in or of the same year: adv. αὐτόετες, in the same year, within the year, Od.

div1.head: Αὐτοθαΐς
div1.sense: Thais herself, Luc.

div1.head: αὐτοθελεί
div1.sense: voluntarily, Anth.

div1.head: αὐτοθελής
div1.sense: of oneʼs own will, Anth.

div1.head: αὐτόθεν
div1.sense: of Place, from the very spot, Lat. illinc, Hom., Attic; αὐτ. ἐξ ἕδρης straight from his seat, without rising, Il.; αὐτ. ἐκ Σαλαμῖνος Hdt., etc.; αὐτόθεν from where thou standest, Soph.; αὐτ. βιοτεύειν to find a living from the place, Thuc.:— οἱ αὐτ. the natives, Thuc.
of Time, on the spot, at once, Lat. illico, Il., Hdt., Attic

div1.head: αὐτόθι
div1.sense: Adv. for αὐτοῦ, on the spot, Il., Hdt., Attic

div1.head: αὐτοκάβδαλος
div1.sense: wrought or done carelessly, slovenly, random, Arist.:—adv. -λως, Arist.

div1.head: αὐτοκασιγνήτη
div1.sense: an own sister, Od., Eur.

div1.head: αὐτοκασίγνητος
div1.sense: an own brother, Il., etc.

div1.head: αὐτοκατάκριτος
div1.sense: self-condemned, NTest.

div1.head: αὐτοκέλευθος
div1.sense: going oneʼs own road, Anth.

div1.head: αὐτοκέλευστος
div1.sense: self-bidden, i. e. unbidden, of oneʼs own accord, Xen., Anth.

div1.head: αὐτοκελής
div1.sense: = αὐτοκέλευστος, Hdt.

div1.head: αὐτόκλαδος
div1.sense: branches and all, Luc.

div1.head: αὐτόκλητος
div1.sense: self-called, i. e. uncalled, unbidden, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: αὐτόκομος
div1.sense: with natural hair, shaggy, Ar.
hair or leaves and all, Luc.

div1.head: αὐτοκρατής
div1.sense: ruling by oneself, absolute, autocratic, Eur., Plat.

div1.head: αὐτοκρατορικός
div1.sense: of or for an autocrat: adv. -κῶς, despotically, Plut.

div1.head: αὐτοκράτωρ
div1.sense: oneʼs own master:
of persons or states, free and independent, Lat. sui juris, Thuc., Xen.
of ambassadors, possessing full powers, plenipotentiary, Ar., Thuc., etc.
of rulers, absolute, arbitrary, despotic, Thuc., etc.
of reasoning, peremptory, Thuc.
c. gen. complete master of, ἑαυτοῦ Thuc.; τῆς ἐπιορκίας αὐτ. at liberty to swear falsely, Dem.

div1.head: αὐτόκτιτος
div1.sense: self-produced, i. e. natural, ἄντρα Aesch.

div1.head: αὐτοκτονέω
div1.sense: to slay one another, Soph.

div1.head: αὐτοκτόνος
div1.sense: self-slaying; Adv. -νως, with oneʼs own hand, Aesch.:—so χεὶρ αὐτ., of Medea, who slew her own children, Eur.
slaying one another, Aesch.; θάνατος αὐτ. death by each otherʼs hand, Aesch.

div1.head: αὐτοκυβερνήτης
div1.sense: one who steers himself, Anth.

div1.head: αὐτόκωπος
div1.sense: together with the hilt, up to the hilt, Aesch.

div1.head: αὐτολήκυθος
div1.sense: one who carries his own oil-flask, a shabby fellow, Dem.

div1.head: αὐτομαθής
div1.sense: having learnt of oneself, self- taught, Anth.

div1.head: αὐτόμαρτυς
div1.sense: oneself the witness, an eyewitness, Aesch.

div1.head: αὐτοματίζω
div1.sense: to act of oneself, act unadvisedly, Xen.

div1.head: αὐτόματος
div1.sense: of persons, acting of oneʼs own will, of oneself, Il., etc.
of things, self-moving, self-acting, spontaneous, of the gates of Olympus, the tripods of Hephaestus, Il.:—of plants, growing of themselves, Hdt.
without apparent cause, accidental, Hdt.; αὐτ. θάνατος a natural death, Dem.
αὐτόματον, ου, τό, mere chance, ἀπὸ τοῦ αὐτομάτου or ἀπὸ ταὐτομάτου, Lat. sponte, by chance, naturally, Hdt., Thuc.
adv. -τως ἀπὸ ταὐτομάτου, Hdt.

div1.head: Αὐτομέδων
div1.sense: self-ruler, name of Achillesʼ charioteer, Il.

div1.head: Αὐτομέλιννα
div1.sense: Melinna herself, Anth.

div1.head: αὐτομολέω
div1.sense: to desert, Hdt., Attic; αὐτ. πρὸς τοὺς Πέρσας Hdt.; ἐς Ἀθήνας ἐκ Περσέων Hdt.

div1.head: αὐτομολία
div1.sense: desertion, Thuc.

div1.head: αὐτόμολος
div1.sense: going of oneself, without bidding: as Subst. a deserter, Hdt., Attic

div1.head: αὐτονομέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to live by oneʼs own laws, be independent, Thuc., Dem.

div1.head: αὐτονομία
div1.sense: freedom to use oneʼs own laws, independence, Thuc., etc.

div1.head: αὐτόνομος
div1.sense: living under oneʼs own laws, independent, Hdt., Attic
generally, of oneʼs own free will, Soph.
of animals, feeding and ranging at will, Anth.

div1.head: αὐτόνοος
div1.sense: self-willed, Aesch.

div1.head: αὐτονυχί
div1.sense: that very night, Il.

div1.head: αὐτόξυλος
div1.sense: of mere wood, Soph.

div1.head: αὐτοπαγής
div1.sense: self-joined, self-built, Anth.

div1.head: αὐτοπάθεια
div1.sense: oneʼs own feeling or experience, Polyb.

div1.head: αὐτοπαθής
div1.sense: speaking from oneʼs own feeling or experience:— adv. -θως, Polyb.

div1.head: αὐτόπαις
div1.sense: an own child, Soph.

div1.head: αὐτοπήμων
div1.sense: for oneʼs own woes, Aesch.

div1.head: αὐτοποιός
div1.sense: self-produced, as the Athenian olive, Soph.

div1.head: αὐτόπολις
div1.sense: free as a state, independent, Thuc.

div1.head: αὐτοπολίτης
div1.sense: citizen of a free state, Xen.

div1.head: αὐτοπόνητος
div1.sense: self-wrought, Anth.

div1.head: αὐτόπους
div1.sense: on oneʼs own feet, Luc.

div1.head: αὐτόπρεμνος
div1.sense: together with the root, root and branch, Soph., Ar.; αὐτ. τι διδόναι to give in absolute possession, Aesch.

div1.head: αὐτοπρόσωπος
div1.sense: in oneʼs own person, without a mask, Luc.

div1.head: αὐτόπτης
div1.sense: seeing oneself, an eyewitness, Hdt.

div1.head: αὐτοπώλης
div1.sense: selling oneʼs own goods or products, Plat.

div1.head: αὐτοπωλικός
div1.sense: = αὐτοπώλης: ἡ -κη (sc. τέχνη), the trade of an αὐτοπώλης, Plat.

div1.head: αὐτόρριζος
div1.sense: roots and all; poet. αὐτόριζος, Babr.
self-rooted, self-founded, Eur.

div1.head: αὐτόρρυτος
div1.sense: self-flowing, flowing unbidden, Anth.

div1.head: αὐτόσε
div1.sense: thither, to the very place, Lat. illuc, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: αὐτοσίδηρος
div1.sense: of sheer iron, with stroke of sword, Eur.

div1.head: αὐτός
div1.sense: self, Lat. ipse:— in the oblique cases simply for the personal Pron., him, her, it:— with the Artic. ὁ αὐτός, ἡ αὐτή, τὸ αὐτό (or ταὐτόν), etc., the very one, the same.
self, myself, thyself, etc., acc. to the person of the Verb., Hom., etc.:

oneself, oneʼs true self, the soul, not the body, Od.; or opp. to others, as king to subjects, parent to children, man to wife, etc., Hom.; hence absol. for the master, τίς οὗτος;—Αὐτός, i. e. Socrates, Ar.; similarly in neut. αὐτὸ δείξει the result will shew, Eur.
of oneself, of oneʼs own accord, Lat. sponte, Hom., Soph.
by oneself, alone, αὐτός περ ἐών although alone, Il.; αὐτοί ἐσμεν we are by ourselves, i. e. among friends, Ar.
in Plat., τὸ δίκαιον αὐτό right in itself, the idea of right, etc.; cf. αὐτοάνθρωπος.
in dat. with Subst., together with, ἀνόρουσεν αὐτῆι σὺν φόρμιγγι he sprang up lyre in hand, Il.; αὐτῆι σὺν πήληκι helmet and all, Il.; and without σύν, αὐτοῖς ἀνδράσι men and all, Hdt., etc.
added to ordinal Numbers, e. g. πέμπτος αὐτός himself the fifth, i.e. himself with four others, Thuc.

in connexion with the person. Pron., ἐγὼ αὐτός, ἐμέθεν αὐτῆς, σὲ αὐτόν, etc., Hom.; in Hdt. and Attic it coalesces with oblique cases of Pron., ἐμαυτοῦ, σε-αυτοῦ, ἑ-αυτοῦ:— it is joined with these reflexive Pronouns to add force, αὐτὸς καθʼ αὑτοῦ, αὐτοὶ ὑφʼ αὑτῶν Aesch., etc.
gen. αὐτοῦ is used with the possessive Pron., πατρὸς κλέος ἠδʼ ἐμὸν αὐτοῦ Il.
αὐτὸς ἑαυτοῦ is also used with comp. and Sup. adj. to express something unusual, αὐτὸς ἑωυτοῦ πολλῶι ὑποδεέστερος Hdt.
he, she, it, for the simple Pron. of 3 person, only in oblique cases, and never at the beginning of a sentence, Hom., Attic: cf. ἑαυτοῦ.

with Article ὁ αὐτός, ἡ αὐτή, τὸ αὐτό, and Attic contr. αὑτός, αὑτή, ταὐτό and ταὐτόν, gen. ταὐτοῦ, dat. ταὐτῶι, pl. neut. ταὐτά: Ionic ὡὐτός, τὠυτό:— the very one, the same, Lat. idem, Hom., Hdt., Attic:—it freq. takes a dat., like ὅμοιος, to denote sameness, τὠυτὸ ἂν ὑμῖν ἐπρήσσομεν we should fare the same as you, Hdt.; also, ὁ αὐτὸς καί, cf. Lat. simul ac, Hdt.
αὐτο- in Compos.:
of itself, i. e. natural, native, not made, as in αὐτόκτιτος.
of mere . . , of nothing but . . , as in αὐτόξυλος.
of oneself, self-, as in αὐτοδίδακτος, αὐτόματος: and so independently, as in αὐτόνομος.
just, exactly, as in αὐτόδεκα.
with reflex. sense of αὑτοῦ and ἀλλήλων, as αὐθέντης, αὐτοκτονέω.
together with, as in αὐτόπρεμνος, αὐτόρριζος.

div1.head: αὐτόσσυτος
div1.sense: self-sped, Aesch.

div1.head: αὐτοσταδίη
div1.sense: a stand-up fight, close fight, ἔν γʼ αὐτοσταδίηι Il.

div1.head: αὐτόστολος
div1.sense: self-sent, going or acting of oneself, Soph., Anth.

div1.head: αὐτόστονος
div1.sense: lamenting by or for oneself, Aesch.

div1.head: αὐτοσφαγής
div1.sense: slain by oneself or by kinsmen, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: αὐτοσχεδιάζω
div1.sense: to act or speak off-hand, Xen.
c. acc. to devise off-hand, extemporise, Thuc., Xen.
in bad sense, to act, speak, or think unadvisedly, try rash experiments, Plat.

div1.head: αὐτοσχεδίασμα
div1.sense: an impromptu, Arist.

div1.head: αὐτοσχεδιαστής
div1.sense: one who acts or speaks offhand: a raw hand, bungler, Lat. tiro, Xen.

div1.head: αὐτοσχέδιος
div1.sense: hand to hand, αὐτοσχεδίηι (sc. μάχηι) in close fight, in the fray, Il.: αὐτοσχεδίην as adv., = αὐτοσχεδόν, Hom.
off-hand, of an improvisatore, Hhymn.

div1.head: αὐτοσχεδόν
div1.sense: near at hand, hand to hand, Lat. cominus, of close fight, Hom.

div1.head: αὐτοτέλεστος
div1.sense: self-accomplished, spontaneous, Anth.

div1.head: αὐτοτελής
div1.sense: ending in itself, complete in itself, supporting oneself, ἱππεῖς Luc.
(τέλος IV) taxing oneself, self-taxed, Thuc.

div1.head: αὐτότοκος
div1.sense: young and all, Aesch.

div1.head: αὐτοτραγικός
div1.sense: arrant tragic, Dem.

div1.head: αὐτοτροπήσας
div1.sense: to turn straightway, Hhymn.

div1.head: αὐτοῦ
div1.sense: properly gen. of αὐτός, at the very place, just here, just there, Lat. illico, Hom., Hdt., Attic; with the place added, αὐτοῦ ἐνὶ Τροίηι Il.; αὐτοῦ τῶιδʼ ἐνὶ χώρωι Od.; αὐτοῦ ταύτηι exactly here, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: αὐτουργέω
div1.sense: to work with oneʼs own hand, Luc.

div1.head: αὐτούργητος
div1.sense: self-wrought, rudely wrought, Anth.

div1.head: αὐτουργία
div1.sense: a working on oneself, i. e. self-murder or the murder of oneʼs own kin, Aesch.
personal labour, opp. to slave-labour, Plut.

div1.head: αὐτουργός
div1.sense: self-working, Soph.

as Subst., one who works his land himself (not by slaves), a husbandman, poor farmer, Eur.; of the Peloponnesians, Thuc.:—metaph., αὐτουργὸς τῆς φιλοσοφίας one that has worked at philosophy by himself, without a teacher, Xen.
pass. self-wrought, simple, native, Anth.

div1.head: αὐτόφι
div1.sense: Epic gen. and dat. sg. and pl. of αὐτός Hom.; ἀπ. αὐτόφιν, παρʼ αὐτόφιν or -φι, from the very spot, Il.; ἐπʼ αὐτόφιν on the spot, Il.

div1.head: αὐτόφλοιος
div1.sense: with the bark on, Theocr.

div1.head: αὐτοφόνος
div1.sense: self-murdering, murdering those of oneʼs own family, Aesch.

div1.head: αὐτοφόντης
div1.sense: a murderer, Eur.

div1.head: αὐτόφορτος
div1.sense: bearing oneʼs own baggage, Aesch.
cargo and all, ναῦς Plut.

div1.head: αὐτοφυής
div1.sense: self-grown, Plat.:— of home growth, Xen.
natural, opp. to artificial, Hes., Thuc.; κορύνα αὐτοφυής rough as it came from the tree, Theocr.
τὸ αὐτοφυές, oneʼs own nature, Plat.

div1.head: αὐτόφυτος
div1.sense: self-caused, ἕλκεα Pind.
natural, αὐτ. ἐργασία, αὐτουργία, i. e. agriculture, Arist.

div1.head: αὐτόφωνος
div1.sense: self-sounding, χρησμὸς αὐτ. an oracle delivered by the god himself, Luc.

div1.head: αὐτόφωρος
div1.sense: self-detected, caught in the act of theft, Soph.; ἐπʼ αὐτοφώρωι λαμβάνειν to catch in the act, Eur., Dem.; ἐπʼ αὐτοφώρωι ἁλῶναι Hdt.: in a more general sense, ἐπʼ αὐτοφώρωι καταλαμβάνειν τινα ἀμαθέστερον ὄντα to detect him point blank of ignorance, Plat.; ἐπʼ αὐτ. εἴλημμαι πλουσιώτατος ὤν Xen.

div1.head: αὐτοχειρία
div1.sense: murder perpetrated by oneʼs own hand, Plat.: dat. αὐτοχειρίαι, Ionic -ίηι, with oneʼs own hand, αὐτ. κτείνειν Hdt., etc.

div1.head: αὐτόχειρ
div1.sense: with oneʼs own hand, Aesch., Soph., etc.: c. gen. the very doer or author of a thing, Soph., Dem.
absol., like αὐθέντης, one who kills himself or one of his kin, Soph.: then, simply, a murderer, homicide, Soph., Dem.; in full, τὸν αὐτ. τοῦ φόνου the perpetrator of . . , Soph.
as adj. murderous, Eur.; πληγέντες αὐτόχειρι μιάσματι of brothers smitten by mutual slaughter, Soph.

div1.head: αὐτόχθονος
div1.sense: country and all, Aesch.

div1.head: αὐτόχθων
div1.sense: sprung from the land itself, Lat. terrigena: αὐτόχθονες, οἱ, like Lat. Indigenae, aborigines, natives, Hdt., Thuc.; of the Athenians, Eur., Ar., etc.
as adj. indigenous, Hdt.

div1.head: αὐτοχόλωτος
div1.sense: angry at oneself, Anth.

div1.head: αὐτοχόωνος
div1.sense: rudely cast, massive, of a lump of iron used as a quoit, Il.

div1.head: αὐτόχρημα
div1.sense: in very deed, really and truly, Ar.
just, exactly, Luc.

div1.head: αὐτοψία
div1.sense: a seeing with oneʼs own eyes, Luc.

div1.head: αὔτως
div1.sense: in this very manner, even so, just so, as it is, γυμνὸν ἐόντα, αὔτως —ὥστε γυναῖκα, unarmed just as I am— like a woman, Il.
in a contemptuous sense, just so, no better, τί σὺ κήδεαι αὔτως ἀνδρῶν; why take you no better care? Il.; νήπιος αὔτως a mere child, Il.; αὔτως ἄχθος ἀρούρης Od.
in reference to the past, still so, just as before, as it was, Hom.; λευκὸν ἔτʼ αὔτως still white as when new, Il.
in vain, without effect, οὐκ αὔτως μυθήσομαι Od.

div1.head: αὐχενίζω
div1.sense: to cut the throat of a person, behead, c. acc., Soph.

div1.head: αὐχένιος
div1.sense: of the neck, Od.

div1.head: αὐχέω
div1.sense: like καυχάομαι, to boast, plume oneself, Hdt., Eur.; τινι or ἐπί τινι on a thing, Eur., Anth.
c. acc. et inf. to boast or declare loudly that, protest that, Hdt., Thuc., Eur.:—c. inf. only, Aesch.; οὐ γάρ ποτʼ ηὔχουν μεθέξειν I never thought that . . , Aesch.

div1.head: αὐχήεις
div1.sense: braggart, proud, Anth.

div1.head: αὔχημα
div1.sense: a thing boasted of, a pride, boast, Soph.: cause for boasting, glory, Soph., Thuc.
boasting, self-confidence, Thuc.

div1.head: αὐχήν
div1.sense: the neck, throat, of men and beasts, Hom., etc.
metaph. any narrow passage, a neck of land, isthmus, Hdt., Xen.
a narrow sea, strait, Hdt., Aesch.; of the point at which the Danube spreads into several branches, Hdt.
a narrow mountain-pass, defile, Hdt.

div1.head: αὔχησις
div1.sense: boasting, exultation, Thuc.

div1.head: αὐχμέω
div1.sense: to be squalid or unwashed, Lat. squaleo, Od., Ar., Plat.

div1.head: αὐχμηρός
div1.sense: dry, dusty, rough, squalid, Eur., Plat.; esp. of hair, Eur.

div1.head: αὐχμός
div1.sense: drought, Hdt., Thuc.
the effects of drought, squalor, Plat.

div1.head: αὐχμώδης
div1.sense: looking dry, squalid, κόμη Eur.: τὸ αὐχμῶδες drought, Hdt.

div1.head: αὔω
div1.etym: Akin to εὕω: hence αὐαίνω, αὐχμός.
div1.sense: to burn, light a fire, get a light, Od.

div1.head: αὔω
div1.etym: The Root is !αϝ, akin to ἄημι: hence ἀϋτή.
div1.sense: to shout out, shout, call aloud, Hom.; αὖε δʼ Ἀθήνη, μακρὸν ἄϋσε, etc., Hom.: —also in Trag.; c. acc. cogn. to utter, στεναγμόν, αὐδάν Eur.
c. acc. pers. to call upon, Hom.
rarely of things, to ring, ἀσπὶς ἄϋσεν Il.; cf. αὖος.

div1.head: ἀφαγνίζω
div1.sense: to purify:— Mid. to purify oneself by offerings, τοῖς θεοῖς to the gods, Eur.

div1.head: ἀφαίρεσις
div1.sense: a taking away, carrying off, Plat.

div1.head: ἀφαιρετέος
div1.sense: one must take away, Plat.
ἀφαιρετέος, έα, έον, to be taken away, Plat.

div1.head: ἀφαιρετός
div1.sense: to be taken away, separable, Plat.

div1.head: ἀφαιρέω
div1.sense: to take from, take away from a person, τί τινι Od., etc.; also τί τινος, Ar., Xen.; and τί τινα Aesch., Soph.:—c. acc. solo, ἀπελὼν τὰ ἄχθεα having taken them off, Hdt.; ὀργὴν ἀφ. to remove it, Eur.; ἀφ. χωρίς separate, set aside, Plat.
Mid., fut. ἀφαιρήσομαι, and later ἀφελοῦμαι: aor2 ἀφειλόμην:— to take away for oneself, take away, in sense and construction much like Act., Hom., etc.
followed by μή c. inf. to prevent, hinder from doing, Soph., Eur.
ἀφαιρεῖσθαί τινα εἰς ἐλευθερίαν, Lat. vindicare in libertatem, to set a man free, Plat., Dem.
Pass., fut. -αιρεθήσομαι: aor1 ἀφηιρέθην: perf. ἀφῄρημαι, Ionic ἀπαραίρημαι:— to be robbed or deprived of a thing, to have it taken from one, τι Hdt., Attic

div1.head: Ἅφαιστος
div1.sense: Hephaestus , Doric for Ἥφαιστος.

div1.head: ἀφάλλομαι
div1.sense: to spring off or from, ἐκ νεώς Aesch.; ἀφήλατο jumped off, Ar.
to rebound, glance off, Anth.

div1.head: ἄφαλος
div1.sense: without the φάλος or boss, in which the plume was fixed, Il.

div1.head: ἀφαμαρτάνω
div1.sense: to miss oneʼs mark, c. gen., Il., Xen.
to be deprived of what one has, Il.

div1.head: ἀφαμαρτοεπής
div1.sense: random-talking, Il.

div1.head: ἀφανδάνω
div1.sense: to displease, not to please, Od., Hdt., Soph.

div1.head: ἀφάνεια
div1.sense: obscurity, ἀξιώματος ἀφ. want of illustrious birth, Thuc.
disappearance, utter destruction, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀφανής
div1.sense: unseen, invisible, viewless, of the nether world, Aesch.: χάσμα ἀφ. a blind pit, Hdt.; ἡ ἀφ. θεός, of Proserpine, Soph.
ἀφ. γίγνεσθαι ἀφανίζεσθαι, to disappear, be missing, Hdt., Eur.:— of soldiers missing after a battle, Thuc.: cf. ἀφανίζω.
unseen, unnoticed, secret, Solon, Thuc.: —c. part., ἀφ. εἰμι ποιῶν τι I do it without being noticed, Xen.
unknown, uncertain, obscure, Hdt., Attic: of future events, τὸ ἀφανές uncertainty, Hdt.:—adv. ἀφανῶς, Thuc.; so ἐκ τοῦ ἀφανοῦς as adv., Thuc.; and neut. pl. ἀφανῆ, Eur.
of persons, unnoticed, obscure, Eur., Thuc.
ἀφανὴς οὐσία personal property, as money, which can be made away with, opp. to φανερά (real), as land, Oratt.

div1.head: ἀφανίζω
div1.sense: to make unseen, hide from sight, Xen., Thuc., etc.

to do away with, remove, ἄχος Soph.; ἀφ. τινὰ πόλεος to carry off one from the city, Eur.; ἀφ. αὑτὸν εἰς τὸν νεών to disappear into the temple, Ar.:—of state criminals, to remove from sight, make away with, Hdt., Xen.: Pass. to be concealed or suppressed, Thuc.
to destroy utterly, rase to the ground, erase writing, Thuc., Dem.: to obliterate traces, Xen.
to obliterate, tarnish oneʼs good name, Thuc., Plat.:—but in good sense, ἀφ. ἀγαθῶι κακόν to wipe out ill deeds by good, Thuc.; δύσκλειαν Thuc.
to disfigure, ἀφ. τὰ πρόσωπα, of hypocritical sadness, NTest.
to make away with property, Aeschin., Dem.
Pass. to become unseen, to disappear, Hdt., Soph.; of persons buried by a sand-storm, Hdt.; or, lost at sea, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: ἀφάνισις
div1.sense: a getting rid of, τῆς δίκης Ar.
(from Pass.) disappearance, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀφανιστέος
div1.sense: to be suppressed, Isocr.

div1.head: ἄφαντος
div1.sense: made invisible, blotted out, forgotten, Il.: hidden, Aesch., Soph.; ἀφ. βῆναι, οἴχεσθαι, ἔρρειν, ἀφανισθῆναι, to disappear, Trag.
in secret, Pind.
obscure, Pind.

div1.head: ἀφάπτω
div1.sense: to fasten from or upon, ἅμματα ἀφ. to tie knots on a string, Hdt.:—Pass. to be hung on, hang on, perf. part. ἀπαμμένος (Ionic for ἀφημμένος), Hdt.; ἀφημμένος ἔκ τινος Theocr.

div1.head: ἀφαρπάζω
div1.sense: to tear off or from, c. gen., Il.; to snatch away, steal from, τί τινος Ar.: c. acc. only, to snatch eagerly, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: ἄφαρ
div1.sense: straightway, forthwith, at once, quickly, presently, Hom., Trag.
thereupon, after that, Hom.
in Theogn. as adj. swift, fleet (cf. ἀφάρτερος).

div1.head: ἀφάρτερος
div1.sense: more fleet, Il.

div1.head: ἀφασία
div1.sense: speechlessness, Eur., Plat.

div1.head: ἀφάσσω
div1.sense: to handle, feel, c. acc., Hdt.

div1.head: ἄφατος
div1.sense: not uttered, nameless, Hes.
untold, unutterable, ineffable, extraordinary, Hdt., Soph.; ἄφατον ὡς thereʼs no saying how, i. e. marvellously, immensely, Ar.

div1.head: ἀφαυρός
div1.sense: feeble, powerless, παιδὸς ἀφαυροῦ Il.; mostly in comp. and Sup., Hom., Hes.:—adv. -ρῶς, Anth.

div1.head: ἀφαύω
div1.sense: to dry up, parch, Ar.

div1.head: ἁφάω
div1.sense: to handle, rub, polish, Il.

div1.head: ἀφεγγής
div1.sense: without light, φῶς ἀφ. a light that is no light (i. e. to the blind), Soph.; νυκτὸς ἀφεγγὲς βλέφαρον, of the moon, as opp. to the sun, Eur.
obscure, dim, faint, Aesch.
metaph., ill-starred, unlucky, Soph.

div1.head: ἀφεδρών
div1.sense: a privy, NTest.

div1.head: ἀφειδέω
div1.sense: to be unsparing or lavish of, ψυχῆς Soph.; ἑαυτοῦ Thuc.:—absol. ἀφειδήσας (sub. ἑαυτοῦ) recklessly, Eur.; but
ἀφειδεῖν πόνου to be careless of it, i. e. neglect, avoid, labour, Soph.

div1.head: ἀφειδής
div1.sense: unsparing or lavish of a thing, c. gen., Aesch.
of actions, done without regard to cost or risk, Thuc.
adv. -δῶς, Ionic -δέως, freely, lavishly Hdt., Dem.:—also sparing no pains, with all zeal, Dem.
unsparingly, without mercy, Hdt.; comp. -έστερον, Sup. -έστατα, Xen.

div1.head: ἀφειδία
div1.sense: profuseness, Plat.
harsh treatment, neglect, NTest.

div1.head: ἀφεκτέος
div1.sense: one must abstain from, τινός Xen.

div1.head: ἀφελής
div1.sense: without a stone, even, smooth, Ar.: metaph. of persons, simple, plain, blunt, Dem., Luc.:—adv. ἀφελῶς, simply, roughly, Theogn.

div1.head: ἀφέλκω
div1.sense: to drag away suppliants, ἐκ τοῦ ἱροῦ Hdt., etc.; to drag or tow ships away, Thuc.:— to draw aside, ἐπί τι Xen.
to draw off liquor, drink up, Aesch.
Mid. to draw off for oneself, Ar.

div1.head: ἀφελότης
div1.sense: simplicity, NTest.

div1.head: ἄφενος
div1.etym: From same Root as Lat. opes.
div1.sense: riches, wealth, plenty, Il., Theogn.

div1.head: ἄφερκτος
div1.sense: shut out from a place, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀφερμηνεύω
div1.sense: to interpret, expound, Plat.

div1.head: ἀφέρπω
div1.sense: to creep off, steal away, retire, Soph.

div1.head: ἄφερτος
div1.sense: insufferable, intolerable, Aesch.

div1.head: ἄφεσις
div1.sense: a letting go, dismissal, Philipp. ap. Dem.:— a quittance or discharge from a bond, Dem.: exemption from service, Plut.: a divorce, Plut.

a letting go (Lat. missio) of horses from the starting-post, and then the starting-post itself, ἰσώσας τἀφέσει τὰ τέρματα having made the winning-post one with the starting-post, i. e. having come back to the starting-post, Soph.

div1.head: ἀφεστήξω
div1.etym: old Attic future formed from ἀφέστηκα fut pf. of ἀφίστημι
div1.sense: I shall be absent, away from, τινός Plat., Xen.

div1.head: ἀφετέος
div1.sense: one must dismiss, Plat.
to be let go, Plat.

div1.head: ἀφετήριος
div1.sense: for letting go or starting for a race: ἀφ. Διόσκουροι whose statues stood at the starting place, Anth.

div1.head: ἄφετος
div1.sense: let loose, at large, ranging at will, of sacred flocks that were free from work, Aesch., Plat.: metaph. of person, dedicated to a god, Eur.: τὸ ἄφετον, freedom from restraint, Luc.

div1.head: ἀφεύω
div1.sense: to singe off, Ar.
to fry, toast, Ar.

div1.head: ἀφέψω
div1.sense: to refine by boiling off the refuse, to boil down, Hdt.:—esp. to boil free of dirt and dross, to refine, χρυσίον Hdt.: to boil young again, Ar.:—Pass., ὕδωρ ἀπεψημένον Hdt.

div1.head: ἀφηγέομαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to lead from a point, and so, generally, to lead the way, go first, οἱ ἀφηγούμενοι the van, Xen.
to tell or relate in full, explain, Hdt.: perf. in pass. sense, τὸ ἀπηγημένον what has been told, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀφήγημα
div1.sense: a tale, narrative, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀφήγησις
div1.sense: a telling, narrating, ἄξιον ἀπηγήσιος worth telling, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀφηγητήρ
div1.sense: a guide, Anth.

div1.head: ἀφηδύνω
div1.sense: to sweeten, Plut., Luc.

div1.head: ἀφήκω
div1.sense: to arrive at, Plat.

div1.head: ἀφῆλιξ
div1.sense: beyond youth, elderly, mostly in comp. ἀπηλικέστερος, Hdt.

div1.head: ἄφημαι
div1.sense: to sit apart.

div1.head: ἁφή
div1.sense: a lighting, kindling, περὶ λύχνων ἁφάς about lamp- lighting time, Hdt.
(ἅπτομαι) a touching, touch, Aesch.: the sense of touch, Plat., etc.

div1.head: ἀφήτωρ
div1.sense: the archer, of Apollo, Il.

div1.head: ἀφθαρσία
div1.sense: incorruption, NTest.

div1.head: ἄφθαρτος
div1.sense: uncorrupted, incorruptible, Arist., etc.

div1.head: ἄφθεγκτος
div1.sense: voiceless, Aesch., Anth.
of places, where none may speak, Soph.
pass. unspeakable, Plat.

div1.head: ἄφθιτος
div1.sense: not liable to perish, imperishable, Hom., Trag.: of persons, immortal, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἄφθογγος
div1.sense: voiceless, speechless, Hdt., Aesch., etc.

div1.head: ἀφθόνητος
div1.sense: unenvied, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀφθονία
div1.sense: freedom from envy or grudging, readiness, Plat.
of things, plenty, abundance, Pind., Plat.

div1.head: ἄφθονος
div1.sense: without envy:
act. free from envy, Hdt., Plat.
ungrudging, bounteous, Lat. benignus, Trag.
pass. not grudged, bounteously given, plentiful, abundant, Hdt., Attic; ἐν ἀφθόνοις βιοτεύειν to live in plenty, Xen.
unenvied, provoking no envy, ὄλβος Aesch.
irreg. comp. -έστερος, Sup. -έστατος, Plat.; but -ώτερος, -ώτατος, Xen.
adv. in abundance, ἀφθ. ἔχειν τινός to have enough of it, Plat.

div1.head: ἀφθορία
div1.sense: incorruption, NTest.

div1.head: ἄφθορος
div1.sense: uncorrupt, of young persons, Anth.

div1.head: ἀφιδρύω
div1.sense: to remove to another settlement: Mid. to cause to be transported, Eur.

div1.head: ἀφιερόω
div1.sense: to purify, hallow: Pass., perf. ταῦτʼ ἀφιερώμεθα I have had these expiatory rites performed, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀφίημι
div1.etym: ι short in Epic, except in augm. tenses: ῑ Attic
div1.sense: to send forth, discharge, Lat. emittere, of missiles, Hom., etc.:—hence to let loose, utter, give vent to words, Hdt., Trag.
to let fall, Il.
to send forth an expedition, dispatch it, Hdt.: Pass., of troops, Hdt.
to give up or hand over to, τινι τί Hdt., Attic:—Pass., ἡ Ἀττικὴ ἀπεῖτο ἤδη Hdt.

to send away, let go, loose, set free, Il., Attic:—c. acc. pers. et gen. rei, to set free from a thing, let off from, Hdt.: in legal sense to release from an engagement, accusation, etc., ἀφ. τινὰ φόνου Dem.
to dissolve, disband, break up an army, Hdt.:— to dismiss the council or law-courts, Ar.
to put away, divorce, Hdt.
to let go as an ἄφετος, consecrate, Xen.
of things, to get rid of, δίψαν Il.; to shed its blossoms, of plants, Od.; to slacken its force, of a dart, Il.
ἀφ. πλοῖον ἐς . . to loose ship for a place, Hdt.
in legal sense, c. dat. pers. et acc. rei, ἀφ. τινὶ αἰτίην to remit him a charge or a fine, Hdt., Dem.
to leave alone, give up, let pass, neglect, Hdt., Attic; foll. by a predicate, ἀφύλακτον ἀφ. to leave unguarded.
c. acc. et inf., ἀφ. τι δημόσιον εἶναι to give up to be public property, Thuc.; ἀφ. τὸ πλοῖον φέρεσθαι to let the boat be carried away, Hdt.
c. acc. pers. et inf. to let, suffer, permit one to do a thing, Hdt., Plat., etc.
seemingly intr. (sub. στρατόν, ναῦς, etc.), to break up, march, sail, etc., Hdt.
Mid. to send forth from oneself, send forth, Attic
δειρῆς ἀφίετο πήχεε she loosed her arms from off my neck.
c. gen. only, τέκνων ἀφοῦ let go hold of the children, Soph., Thuc.

div1.head: ἀφικάνω
div1.sense: to arrive at, to have come to, c. acc., Hom.

div1.head: ἀφικνέομαι
div1.sense: to come to one place from another, to arrive at, reach: c. acc. loci, Hom.; or ἀφ. ἐς . . , ἐπί . . , κατά . . , πρός . . , Hom., Attic (in Prose the prep. is seldom omitted); absol. to arrive, Od.:—Hom. also puts the person reached in acc., μνηστῆρας ἀφ. came up to them, Od.; so, to come up to a throw (of the quoit), Od.:— ἀφ. ἐπὶ or εἰς πάντα to try every means, Soph., Eur.
to come into a certain condition, ἀπ. ἐς πᾶν κακόν or κακοῦ, ἐς ἀπορίην, etc., Hdt., Attic
ἀπ. τινι ἐς λόγους to hold converse with one, Hdt.; so, ἐς ἔριν, ἐς ἔχθεα ἀφ. τινι Hdt.; διὰ μάχης, διʼ ἔχθρας ἀπ. τινί to come to battle, or into enmity with one, Hdt.; διὰ λόγων τινί Eur.
ἐς τόξευμα ἀφ. to come within shot, Xen.

div1.head: ἀφιλάγαθος
div1.sense: not loving the good, NTest.

div1.head: ἀφιλάργυρος
div1.sense: not loving money, NTest.

div1.head: ἀφίλητος
div1.sense: unloved, Soph.

div1.head: ἀφιλόσοφος
div1.sense: unphilosophic, Plat.

div1.head: ἄφιλος
div1.sense: without friends, friendless, Trag.
unfriendly, hateful, Trag.—adv. ἀφίλως in unfriendly manner, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀφιλοστάχυος
div1.sense: without ears of corn, starving, Anth.

div1.head: ἀφιλοτιμία
div1.sense: want of due ambition, Arist.

div1.head: ἀφιλότιμος
div1.sense: without due ambition, Isae., Arist.

div1.head: ἀφιλοχρηματία
div1.sense: contempt for riches, Plut.

div1.head: ἄφιξις
div1.sense: an arrival, Hdt., Dem.
departure, NTest.

div1.head: ἀφιππάζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to ride off or away, Plut.

div1.head: ἀφιππεύω
div1.sense: to ride off, away, or back, Xen.

div1.head: ἀφιππία
div1.sense: awkwardness in riding, Xen.

div1.head: ἄφιππος
div1.sense: unsuited for cavalry, χώρα Xen.
of persons, unused to riding, Plat.

div1.head: ἀφίστημι
div1.sense: Causal in pres. and imperf., in fut. ἀποστήσω, aor1 ἀπέστησα, as also in aor1 mid.:— to put away, remove, c. acc., Aesch., etc.; ἀφ. τινὰ λόγου to hinder from speech, Eur.; ἀφ. τὴν ἐπιβουλήν to frustrate it, Thuc.; ἀφ. τὸν ἄρχοντα to depose him, Xen.; so in aor1 mid., δόρυ πυλῶν ἀπεστήσασθε removed war from your own gates, Eur.
to make to revolt, move to revolt, Hdt., Thuc.
to weigh out, Xen.:—aor1 mid., ἀποστήσασθαι χρεῖος to weigh out or pay the debt in full, Il.; ἀποστήσασθαι τὸν χαλκόν to have the money weighed out to one, Dem.

intr., in Pass., as also in aor2 act. ἀπέστην, imperat. ἀπόστηθι, ἀπόστα, perf. ἀφέστηκα in pres. sense, syncop. pl. ἀφέσταμεν, -στατε, -στᾶσι, inf. ἀφεστάναι, part. ἀφεστώς, -ῶσα, -ός or -ώς: fut. mid. ἀποστήσομαι: aor1 ἀπεστάθην α:— to stand away or aloof from, keep far from, c. gen., Hom., Attic; μακρὰν τόποις καὶ χρόνοις ἀφ. Diod.; ἀφεστάναι φρενῶν to lose oneʼs wits, Soph.; ἀφ. πραγμάτων to withdraw from business, Dem., etc.
in Prose, to revolt from, τινος or ἀπό τινος, Hdt., Attic: absol. to revolt, Hdt.
ἀφ. τινός τινι to give up a thing to another, Dem.; hence, ἀφ. τινι to make way for him, give way to him, Eur.; c. inf. to shrink from doing, Eur.
absol. to stand aloof, Il., Attic

div1.head: ἄφλαστον
div1.sense: Lat. aplustre, the curved stern of a ship with its ornaments, Il., Hdt.

div1.head: ἄφλεκτος
div1.sense: unburnt, unconsumed by fire, πέλανοι Eur.

div1.head: ἄφλοιος
div1.sense: without bark, Epigr. ap. Plut.

div1.head: ἀφλοισμός
div1.sense: of an angry man, spluttering or perh. foaming, Il.

div1.head: ἀφνειός
div1.sense: rich, wealthy, Il.; c. gen., ἀφνειὸς βιότοιο rich in substance, Hom.; c. acc., Hes.; c. dat., Theocr.

div1.head: ἄφνω
div1.sense: unawares, of a sudden, Eur., Thuc.; cf. ἐξ-αίφνης.

div1.head: ἀφόβητος
div1.sense: without fear of, δίκης Soph.: absol. fearless, Anth.

div1.head: ἀφοβία
div1.sense: fearlessness, Plat.

div1.head: ἄφοβος
div1.sense: without fear:
fearless, intrepid, dauntless, Pind., Soph.:—adv. -βως, Xen.
causing no fear, free from fear, Aesch.
ἄφοβοι θῆρες beasts which no one fears, i. e. cattle, Soph.

div1.head: ἀφοβόσπλαγχνος
div1.sense: fearless of heart, Ar.

div1.head: ἄφοδος
div1.sense: a going away, departure, Hdt., Xen.
a going or coming back, return, Xen.

div1.head: ἀφοίβαντος
div1.sense: uncleansed, unclean, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀφομοιόω
div1.sense: to make like, τί τινί Plat.: to compare, τι Plat.:—Pass. to be or become like, τινι Plat.
c. acc. rei only, to pourtray, copy, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: ἀφομοίωμα
div1.sense: a resemblance, copy, Plat.

div1.head: ἀφοπλίζω
div1.sense: to strip of arms, τινά τινος Luc.: to disarm, τινά Anth.:—Mid., ἀφοπλίζεσθαι ἔντεα to put off oneʼs armour, Il.

div1.head: ἀφοράω
div1.sense: to look away from all others at one, to have in full view, to look at, τι or πρός τι Thuc.; also in Mid., Ar.
to view from a place, ἀπὸ δενδρέου Hdt.
to look away, have the back turned, Xen.

div1.head: ἀφόρητος
div1.sense: intolerable, insufferable, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: ἀφορία
div1.sense: a not bearing:
non-production, dearth, καρπῶν Xen.
barrenness, sterility of land: metaph., ἀφ. φρενῶν Xen.

div1.head: ἀφορίζω
div1.sense: to mark off by boundaries, Dem.: —Mid. to mark off for oneself, appropriate, Eur.
to distinguish, determine, define, Plat.
c. acc. pers.,
to banish, Eur.
to set apart, separate, NTest.: then,
to cast out, excommunicate, NTest.
to set apart for some office, to appoint, ordain, NTest.

div1.head: ἀφοριστέος
div1.sense: one must put aside, Arist.

div1.head: ἀφορμάω
div1.sense: to make to start from a place:— Pass. to go forth, start, depart from a place, c. gen., Hom., Attic
intr. in same sense as Pass., Eur., Thuc.: of lightning, to break forth, Soph.; c. acc. cogn., ἀφορμᾶν πεῖραν to begin an enterprise. Soph.

div1.head: ἀφορμή
div1.sense: a starting-point, esp. in war, a base of operations, Thuc.:—also a place of safety, Eur.
generally, a starting-point, the origin, occasion or pretext of a thing, Eur.; ἀφορμὴν παρέχειν, διδόναι to give occasion, Dem.
the means with which one begins a thing, resources, Xen., Dem.; ἀφ. ἔργων means for undertaking works, Xen.
the capital of a banker, Xen., Dem.

div1.head: ἀφόρμικτος
div1.sense: without the lyre, Aesch.

div1.head: ἄφορμος
div1.sense: departing from a place, c. gen., Soph.

div1.head: ἄφορος
div1.sense: not bearing, barren, Hdt., Xen.
causing barrenness, blighting, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀφόρυκτος
div1.sense: unspotted, unstained, Anth.

div1.head: ἀφοσιόω
div1.sense: to purify from guilt or pollution, τὴν πόλιν Plat.
Mid. to purify oneself from sins of negligence, Plat.; ἀφοσιοῦσθαι τῆι θεῶι to make expiatory offerings to the goddess, Hdt.
c. acc. rei, to acquit oneself of an obligation, ἀποσιοῦσθαι τὴν ἐξόρκωσιν to quit oneself of oneʼs oath, Hdt.; ἀπ. λόγιον quitting oneself of the orders of an oracle, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀφοσίωσις
div1.sense: expiation: ἀφοσιώσεως ἕνεκα for formʼs sake, Plut.

div1.head: ἀφραδέω
div1.sense: to be senseless, act thoughtlessly, Hom.

div1.head: ἀφραδής
div1.sense: insensate, reckless, Od.; of the dead, senseless, lifeless, Od. adv. ἀφραδέως, senselessly, recklessly, Il.

div1.head: ἀφραδία
div1.sense: folly, thoughtlessness, mostly in Epic dat. pl., ἀφραδίηισι Hom.; διʼ ἀφραδίας Od.

div1.head: ἀφράδμων
div1.sense: = ἀφραδής, without sense, Hhymn.

div1.head: ἀφραίνω
div1.sense: to be silly, senseless, Hom.

div1.head: ἄφρακτος
div1.sense: unfenced, unfortified, unguarded, Thuc.; c. gen., ἄφρ. φίλων by friends, Soph.; c. dat., ἄφρ. ὅρκοις Eur.
not to be kept in, irrepressible, Aesch.
unguarded, off oneʼs guard, Thuc.

div1.head: ἄφραστος
div1.sense: unutterable, inexpressible, Hhymn., Aesch., Soph.
(φράζομαι) not perceived or thought of, Aesch.; τὸ ἀφραστότατον χωρίον the place least likely to be thought of, Hdt.:—adv. -τως, beyond thought, Soph.

div1.head: ἀφρέω
div1.sense: to befoam, cover with foam, ἵπποι ἄφρεον στήθεα Il.

div1.head: ἀφρηλόγος
div1.sense: gathering froth, skimming, τινός Anth.

div1.head: ἀφρηστής
div1.sense: the foamer, of a dolphin, Anth.

div1.head: ἀφρήτωρ
div1.sense: without brotherhood (φράτρα), i. e. bound by no social tie, Il.

div1.head: ἀφρίζω
div1.sense: to foam, Soph.

div1.head: ἀφριόεις
div1.sense: foamy, Anth.

div1.head: ἀφρογενής
div1.sense: foam-born, of Aphrodite, Hes.: fem. Ἀφρο-γένεια, Mosch.

div1.head: ἀφροδισιάζω
div1.sense: to indulge lust, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: Ἀφροδισιάς
div1.sense: sacred to Aphrodite, name of an island, Hdt.

div1.head: Ἀφροδίσιος
div1.sense: belonging to Aphrodite, Plat.
Ἀφροδίσια, τά, sexual pleasures, Xen.
a festival of Aphrodite, Xen.
Ἀφροδίσιον, ου, τό, the temple of Aphrodite, Xen.

div1.head: Ἀφροδίτη
div1.sense: Aphrodite, Lat. Venus, goddess of love, said to be born from the sea-foam, Hhymn., Hes.
as appellat. love, pleasure, Od.: —Ἀφρ. κακῶν enjoyment, Eur.
attractive beauty, grace, Lat. venustas, Aesch., Luc;. cf. Lat. venus.

div1.head: ἀφρονέω
div1.sense: to be silly, act foolishly, only in part., Il., Anth.

div1.head: ἀφροντιστέω
div1.sense: to have no care of, pay no heed to a thing, c. gen., Xen.

div1.head: ἀφρόντιστος
div1.sense: thoughtless, heedless, taking no care, Lat. securus, Xen., Theocr.:—adv. -τως, inconsiderately, Soph.; ἀφρ. ἔχειν to be heedless, Xen.; also to be senseless, demented, Soph.
pass. unthought of, unexpected, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀφρός
div1.sense: foam, of the sea, Il.: of an angry lion, foam, froth, Il.; ἀπʼ ἀνθρώπων ἀφρόν frothy blood, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀφροσύνη
div1.sense: folly, thoughtlessness, senselessness, in sg. and pl., Hom., Soph., Thuc.

div1.head: ἄφρουρος
div1.sense: unguarded, unwatched, Plat.

div1.head: ἀφροφυής
div1.sense: foam-producing, Anth.

div1.head: ἀφρώδης
div1.sense: foamy, Eur.

div1.head: ἄφρων
div1.sense: without sense, of statues, Xen.:— crazed, frantic, or silly, foolish, Hom., Attic: τὸ ἄφρον ἀφροσύνη, Thuc. adv. ἀφρόνως, senselessly, Soph.

div1.head: ἀφυβρίζω
div1.sense: to give loose to passion, Plut.

div1.head: ἀφυδραίνω
div1.sense: to wash clean from dirt:—Mid., aor1 -υδρηνάμην, to wash oneself clean, bathe, Eur.

div1.head: ἀφύη
div1.sense: a sort of anchovy or sardine, Ar.

div1.head: ἀφυής
div1.sense: without natural talent, witless, dull, Plat.; ἀφυὴς πρός τι naturally unsuited to a thing, Plat., Xen.
simple, unschooled, Soph.

div1.head: ἄφυκτος
div1.sense: not to be shunned, from which none escape, Aesch., Soph.; of an arrow, unerring, Soph., Eur.; of a question, admitting no escape, inevitable, Plat.
act. unable to escape, Ar.

div1.head: ἀφυλακτέω
div1.sense: to be off oneʼs guard, Xen.: c. gen. to be careless about, Xen.

div1.head: ἀφύλακτος
div1.sense: unguarded, unwatched, Hdt., Thuc.
(φυλάσσομαι) unguarded, off oneʼs guard, Thuc.; ἀφύλακτον εὕδειν to sleep securely, Aesch.; ἀφ. τινα λαμβάνειν to catch one off his guard, Xen.; τὸ ἀφ. want of precaution, Thuc.:—adv. -τως, Xen.
not to be guarded against, inevitable, Arist.

div1.head: ἀφυλίζω
div1.sense: to strain off, Anth.

div1.head: ἄφυλλος
div1.sense: leafless, of dry wood, Il.; ἄφ. στόμα words not seconded by the suppliantʼs olivebranch, Eur.
act. stripping off the leaves, blighting, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀφυπνίζω
div1.sense: to wake one from sleep, Eur., Plut.

div1.head: ἀφυπνόω
div1.sense: to wake from sleep, Anth.
to fall asleep, NTest.

div1.head: ἀφυσγετός
div1.sense: the mud and filth which a stream carries with it, rubbish, Il.

div1.head: ἀφύσσω
div1.sense: to draw liquids, esp. from a larger vessel with a smaller, οἶνον ἐν ἀμφιφορεῦσιν ἠφύσαμεν Od.:—Pass., πίθων ἠφύσσετο οἶνος was drawn from the wine-jars, Od.:—metaph., πλοῦτον ἀφύξειν to draw full draughts of wealth, i. e. heap it up, τινί for another, Il.
Mid. to draw for oneself, οἶνον Il.; ῥοάς Eur.:—metaph., φύλλα ἠφυσάμην I heaped me up a bed of leaves, Od.

div1.head: ἀφώνητος
div1.sense: voiceless, speechless, Soph.

div1.head: ἄφωνος
div1.sense: voiceless, speechless, dumb, silent, Theogn., Hdt., Dem.: c. gen., ἄφωνος ἀρᾶς unable to utter a curse, Soph.:—adv. -νως, without speaking, Dem.; neut. pl. as adv., Aesch.
ἄφωνα (sc. γράμματα), consonants, opp. to φωνοῦντα or φωνήεντα (vowels), Eur., Plat.

div1.head: Ἀχαΐα
div1.sense: Achaia in Peloponnese, Thuc.

div1.head: Ἀχαία
div1.sense: name of Demeter in Attica, Hdt.

div1.head: Ἀχαιικός
div1.sense: of or for the Achaians, Achaian, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: Ἀχαιΐς
div1.sense: the Achaian land, with or without γαῖα, Il.
(sub. γυνή) an Achaian woman, Il.

div1.head: ἀχαΐνης
div1.sense: with single points to his horns, a young deer, Babr.

div1.head: Ἀχαιός
div1.sense: Achaian, Lat. Achivus, Hom.:— Ἀχαιοί, οἱ, the Achaians or Greeks generally, Hom.

div1.head: ἀχάλινος
div1.sense: unbridled, Eur., Ar., etc.

div1.head: ἀχαλίνωτος
div1.sense: without bridle, Xen.

div1.head: ἀχάλκεος
div1.sense: penniless, Anth.

div1.head: ἀχάλκευτος
div1.sense: not forged of metal, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀχαλκέω
div1.sense: to be penniless, Anth.

div1.head: ἄχαλκος
div1.sense: without brass, ἄχαλκος ἀσπίδων, i. e. ἄνευ ἀσπίδων χαλκείων, Soph.

div1.head: ἀχάλκωτος
div1.sense: not brasened; without money, Anth.

div1.head: ἀχάνη
div1.sense: a Persian measure, = μέδιμνοι, Ar.

div1.head: ἀχανής
div1.sense: not opening the mouth, Luc.
(a_euphon) yawning, wide, Plut., Anth.

div1.head: ἀχαράκωτος
div1.sense: not palisaded, Plut.

div1.head: ἄχαρις
div1.sense: without grace or charms, graceless, Theogn.
unpleasant, disagreeable, οὐδὲν ἄχαρι παθέειν Hdt.; as euphem. for grievous, ἄχ. συμφορή Hdt.
ungracious, thankless, Hdt.; χάρις ἄχαρις a graceless grace, thankless favour, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: ἀχαριστέω
div1.sense: to be thankless, shew ingratitude, Xen.
= οὐ χαρίζομαι, to discourage, τινί Plat.;

div1.head: ἀχαριστία
div1.sense: thanklessness, ingratitude, Xen., Dem.
ungraciousness, Plat.

div1.head: ἀχάριστος
div1.sense: ungracious, unpleasant, unpleasing, Od.; irreg. comp., δόρπου ἀχαρίστερον (for -ιστότερον) Od.: without grace or charms, Xen.
of persons, ungracious, unfavourable, Theogn.
ungrateful, thankless, Hdt., Attic; τινι Eur.; πρός τινα Xen.
adv. -τως, with an ill-will, Xen.; ἀχαρίστως ἔχει μοι thanks are wanting to me, Xen.

div1.head: ἀχάριτος
div1.sense: = ἀχάριστος or ἄχαρις, Hdt.
ungrateful, thankless, Hdt.; χάρις ἀχ., like χάρις ἄχαρις, Eur.

div1.head: Ἀχαρναί
div1.sense: Acharnae, a demos of Attica, Thuc.

div1.head: Ἀχαρνεύς
div1.sense: an inhabitant of Acharnae, pl. Ἀχαρνεῖς, poet. Ἀχαρνηΐδαι Ar.

div1.head: Ἀχαρνικός
div1.sense: belonging to or of Acharnae, Ar.

div1.head: ἀχείμαντος
div1.sense: not vexed by storms, Alcae.

div1.head: ἀχειροποίητος
div1.sense: not wrought by hands, NTest.

div1.head: ἄχειρ
div1.sense: without hands: τὰ ἄχειρα of the hinder parts of the body, Xen. Also ἄχειρος.

div1.head: ἀχείρωτος
div1.sense: untamed, unconquered, Thuc.
not planted by manʼs hand, Soph.

div1.head: Ἀχελωΐδες
div1.sense: sc. νῆσοι, islands at the mouth of the Achelous, Aesch.

div1.head: Ἀχελῷος
div1.sense: Achelous, name of several rivers; the best known ran through Aetolia and Acarnania, Il., Hes.
any stream, or, generally, water, Eur.

div1.head: ἄχερδος
div1.sense: a wild prickly shrub, a wild pear, Od., Soph.; masc. in Theocr.

div1.head: Ἀχερόντιος
div1.sense: of Acheron, Eur.

div1.head: ἀχερωΐς
div1.sense: the white poplar, said to have been brought by Hercules from the banks of Acheron, Il.

div1.head: Ἀχέρων
div1.sense: Acheron, river of woe (cf. Κωκυτός), one of the rivers of the world below, Od.

div1.head: ἀχεύω
div1.sense: in pres. part. grieving, sorrowing, mourning, Hom.
from the same Root !αχ, came also
aor2 in Causal sense, to grieve, vex, annoy, distress, Hom.: so also, redupl. fut. ἀκαχήσω, Epic aor1 ἀκάχησα, Hom.; and a pres. ἀκαχίζω
pass. to be grieved, distressed, Hom.; c. gen. causae, to grieve for a person, Hom.; rarely c. dat. to grieve at a personʼs death, Od.; the cause of grief also in partic., μή τι θανὼν ἀκαχίζεο Od.
later c. acc. to lament, Soph.

div1.head: ἀχέω
div1.etym: old form for ἰαχέω, Hhymn., Eur.

div1.head: ἀχηνία
div1.sense: need, want, χρημάτων Aesch.; ὀμμάτων ἀχηνίαις in the eyes blank gaze, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀχήν
div1.sense: poor, needy, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀχθεινός
div1.sense: burdensome, oppressive, wearisome, Lat. molestus, of persons, Eur., Xen.:—adv. -νῶς, unwillingly, Xen.

div1.head: ἀχθηδών
div1.sense: a weight, burden, Aesch.
metaph. grievance, distress, vexation, annoyance, Thuc., Plat.; διʼ ἀχθηδόνα for the sake of teasing, Thuc. (From ἄχθος, as ἀλγηδών from ἄλγος.)

div1.head: ἀχθίζω
div1.sense: to load, Babr.

div1.head: ἄχθομαι
div1.sense: to be loaded, νηῦς ἤχθετο Od.

of mental oppression, to be weighed down, vexed, annoyed, grieved, Hom.; τινι at a thing, or with a person, Hdt., etc.; so, ἐπί τινι Xen.; περί τινος Hdt.; ὑπέρ τινος Plat.:—also c. acc., ἄχθομαι ἕλκος Il.;—also c. part., either of subject, as ἄχθομαι ἰδών Soph.; or of object, ἤχθετο δαμναμένους at their being conquered, Il.; but the object is also in gen., οὐδὲν ἤχθετο αὐτῶν πολεμούντων he had no objection to going to war, Xen.

div1.head: ἄχθος
div1.sense: a weight, burden, load, Hom.; ἄχθος ἀρούρης a dead weight on earth, cumberers of the ground, Hom.
a load of grief, grief, trouble, distress, sorrow, Trag.

div1.head: ἀχθοφορέω
div1.sense: to bear burdens, Plut.
to bear as a burden, τι Anth.

div1.head: ἀχθοφόρος
div1.sense: bearing burdens, Hdt.

div1.head: Ἀχίλλειος
div1.sense: of Achilles, Hdt., Eur.
Ἀχιλλείη κριθή Achilles-barley, a fine kind: hence Ἀχίλλειαι (μᾶζαι) cakes of fine barley, Ar.

div1.head: Ἀχιλλεύς
div1.etym: From ἄχος, the grief of the hero being the subject of the Il., cf. Ὀδυσσεύς
div1.sense: Achilles, son of Peleus and Thetis, prince of the Myrmidons.

div1.head: ἀχίτων
div1.sense: without tunic, i. e. wearing the ἱμάτιον only, of Socrates, Xen.

div1.head: ἀχλαινία
div1.sense: want of a cloak or mantle, Eur.

div1.head: ἄχλαινος
div1.sense: without cloak or mantle, Simon.

div1.head: ἄχλοος
div1.sense: without herbage, Eur.

div1.head: ἀχλυόεις
div1.sense: gloomy, Simon. ap. Hdt.

div1.head: ἀχλύς
div1.sense: a mist, Lat. caligo, Od.; a mist over the eyes of one dying, Il.; or of a person deprived of the power of knowing others, Il.—metaph. gloom, trouble, Aesch.

div1.head: ἀχλύω
div1.sense: to be or grow dark, Od.

div1.head: ἄχνη
div1.sense: anything that comes off the surface:
foam, froth, of the sea, Od.; of wine, Eur.; ἄχνη οὐρανία the dew of heaven, Soph.; δακρύων ἄχνη dewy tears, Soph.
of solids, the chaff that flies off in winnowing, in pl., Il.; the down on fruits, Anth.
ἄχνην in acc. as adv., a morsel, the least bit, Ar.

div1.head: ἄχνοος
div1.sense: without down, Anth.

div1.head: ἄχολος
div1.sense: allaying bile or anger, Od.

div1.head: ἀχόρευτος
div1.sense: not attended with the dance, joyless, melancholy, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: ἄχορος
div1.sense: without the dance, of death, Soph.: melancholy, Eur.

div1.head: ἄχος
div1.sense: pain, distress, Hom., Pind., Attic Poets.

div1.head: ἄχραντος
div1.sense: undefiled, immaculate, Plat.

div1.head: ἀχρεῖος
div1.sense: useless, unprofitable, good for nothing, Hes., Soph., etc.
esp. unserviceable, unfit for war, Hdt.; τὸ ἄχρ. τοῦ στρατοῦ the unserviceable part of an army, Hdt., Thuc., etc.

in Hom. neut. ἀχρεῖον as adv., ἀχρεῖον ἰδών giving a helpless look, looking foolish, of Thersites after being beaten, Il.; ἀχρεῖον ἐγέλασσε laughing without cause or meaning, laughed with a forced laugh, Od.; so, ἀχρεῖον κλάζειν to bark without cause, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀχρηματία
div1.sense: want of money, Thuc.

div1.head: ἀχρήματος
div1.sense: without money or means, Hdt., Aesch.

div1.head: ἀχρημοσύνη
div1.sense: want of money, Od., Theogn.

div1.head: ἀχρήμων
div1.sense: without money, poor, needy, Solon, Eur.

div1.head: ἀχρηστία
div1.sense: uselessness, Plat.
the non-usance of a thing, Plat.

div1.head: ἄχρηστος
div1.sense: useless, unprofitable, unserviceable, Hdt., Thuc.: of an oracle, without effect, Eur.:— ἄχρ. ἔς or πρός τι unfit for a thing, Hdt.; ἄχρ. τινι useless to a person, Hdt., Eur.
like ἀχρεῖος, of useless, do-nothing persons, Oratt.
act. making no use of, c. dat., Eur.
(χρηστός) unkind, cruel, Hdt.

div1.head: ἄχρι
div1.sense: adv. to the uttermost, utterly, Il.
after Hom., before Preps., ἄχρι εἰς . . ἄχρι πρὸς . . , Lat. usque ad . . , Xen., Luc.
prep. with gen. even to, as far as:
of Time, until, ἄχρι μάλα κνέφαος until deep in the night, Od.; ἄχρι τῆς ἡμέρας Dem.
of Space, as far as, even to, ἄχρι τῆς ἐσόδου Hdt.
of Degree, ἄχρι τούτου up to this point, Dem.; ἄχρι τοῦ μὴ πεινᾶν Xen.
as Conj., ἄχρι οὗ or ἄχρι alone:
of Time, Lat donec, until, so long as, ἄχρι οὗ ὅδε ὁ λόγος ἐγράφετο Xen.; ἄχρι ἄν with Subj., ἄχρι ἂν σχολάσηι till he should be at leisure, Xen.
of Space, so far as, Xen., Luc.

div1.head: ἀχρώματος
div1.sense: colourless, Plat.

div1.head: ἄχρως
div1.sense: colourless, Plat.

div1.head: ἄχρωστος
div1.sense: untouched, χερῶν ἐμῶν by my hands, Eur.

div1.head: ἀχυρμιά
div1.sense: a heap of chaff, Il., Anth.

div1.head: ἄχυρον
div1.sense: mostly in pl. ἄχυρα, husks, chaff, bran, Hdt.; metaph., ἄχυρα τῶν ἀστῶν Ar.

div1.head: ἀχυρός
div1.sense: a chaff-heap, Ar.; but ἀχυρμός is prob. the true form.

div1.head: ἀχυρότριψ
div1.sense: threshing out the husks, Anth.

div1.head: ἀχώριστος
div1.sense: not parted, not divided, Plat.
(χῶρος) with no place assigned one, Xen.

div1.head: ἄψαυστος
div1.sense: untouched, not to be touched, sacred, Thuc.
act. not touching a thing, c. gen., Soph.

div1.head: ἀψεγής
div1.sense: unblamed, blameless, Soph.

div1.head: ἀψεύδεια
div1.sense: truthfulness, Plat.

div1.head: ἀψευδέω
div1.sense: not to lie, to speak truth, πρός τινα Soph., Plat.

div1.head: ἀψευδής
div1.sense: without lie and deceit, truthful, sincere, trusty, Hes., Hdt., etc.:—adv. -δέως, Attic -δῶς, really and truly, Hdt.

div1.head: ἀψήφιστος
div1.sense: not having voted, Ar.

div1.head: ἁψιδόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be encircled, Anth.

div1.head: ἁψίκορος
div1.sense: satisfied with touching, i. e. fastidious, dainty, Plat.:— τὸ ἁψ. fastidiousness, Plut., Luc.

div1.head: ἁψιμαχέω
div1.sense: to skirmish with an enemy, lead on to fight, Plut.

div1.head: ἁψιμαχία
div1.sense: a skirmishing, Aeschin.

div1.head: ἁψίμαχος
div1.sense: skirmishing.

div1.head: ἀψίνθιον
div1.sense: wormwood, Xen.

div1.head: ἄψινθος
div1.sense: wormwood.

div1.head: ἁψίς
div1.sense: a juncture, loop, mesh, such as form a net, Il.
the felloe or felly of a wheel, the wheel itself, Hes., Hdt., Eur.
any circle or disk, of the sun, Eur.
an arch or vault, Plat., Luc.

div1.head: ἀψόρροος
div1.sense: backflowing, refluent, of Ocean, regarded as a stream encircling the earth and flowing back into itself, Hom.

div1.head: ἄψορρος
div1.sense: going back, backwards, Il., Soph.:—neut. ἄψορρον as adv., backward, back again, Il., Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: ἅψος
div1.sense: a joint, Od.

div1.head: ἀψόφητος
div1.sense: noiseless; c. gen., ἀψ. κωκυμάτων without sound of wailings, Soph.

div1.head: ἄψ
div1.sense: of Place, backwards, back, back again, Hom.
of actions, again, in return, Hom.; so, ἂψ αὖτις, ἂψ πάλιν, yet again, Il.

div1.head: ἄψυκτος
div1.sense: not capable of being cooled, Plat.

div1.head: ἀψυχία
div1.sense: want of life: want of spirit, faint-heartedness, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: ἄψυχος
div1.sense: lifeless, inanimate, Simon., Eur., Plat.
ἄψ. βορά non-animal food, Eur.
spiritless, faint-hearted, Aesch.

div1.head: ἄω
div1.sense: = ἄημι, to blow.
= ἰαύω, to sleep, used only in aor1 ἄεσα, Epic ἄεσσα Od.; also 1st pl. contr. ἄσαμεν, Od.

div1.head: ἄω
div1.sense: to hurt, contr. from ἀάω.

div1.head: ἄω
div1.sense: trans. to satiate, αἵματος ἆσαι Ἀρῆα to give him his fill of blood, Il.
intr. to take oneʼs fill of a thing, c. gen., χροὸς ἄμεναι, χροὸς ἆσαι Ib; so in Mid., ἄσεσθε κλαυθμοῖο, ποτῆτος ἄσασθαι Il.

div1.head: ἀωρία
div1.sense: a wrong time: acc. as adv., ἀωρίαν ἥκειν to have come too late, Ar.; ἀωρίαι at an unseasonable time, so late, Luc.

div1.head: ἀωρί
div1.sense: Adv. of ἄωρος, at an untimely hour, too early, Luc., Anth.; ἀωρὶ τῆς νυκτός at dead of night, Antipho, Theocr.

div1.head: ἀωρόνυκτος
div1.sense: at midnight, Aesch.

div1.head: ἄωρος
div1.sense: untimely, unseasonable, Lat. intempestivus, Aesch., Eur.:—c. gen., γήρως ἀωρότερα things unbecoming old age, Plut.
unripe, ἄωρος πρὸς γάμον Plut.
without youthful freshness, ugly, Xen., Plat.

div1.head: ἄωρος2
div1.sense: pendulous, waving about, of the πλεκτάναι or polypus-like legs of Scylla, Od.

div1.head: ἀωτέω
div1.sense: to sleep well, Hom.

div1.head: ἄωτον
div1.sense: fine wool, flock, οἰὸς ἄωτον, or without οἰός, the sheepʼs finest wool, Hom.; λίνοιο λεπτὸν ἄωτον the delicate flock of flax, i. e. the finest linen, Il.
metaph. the finest, best of its kind, the flower of a thing, ἄωτος ζωᾶς the flower of life, Pind.; Χαρίτων ἄωτος their choisest gift, Pind.
